description: About Us  Dyson is a technology and engineering pioneer and currently operates in the categories of Floorcare, Environmental Control (“Air Multiplier” bladeless fans/heaters/humidifiers/purifiers), Lighting, and Professional (“Airblade” hand dryers). Dyson began 27 years ago with James Dyson and a handful of engineers questioning everyday products, thinking differently and making them better.  Dyson invented the world’s first bagless vacuum with Root Cyclone™ technology, and also the bladeless fans with Air Amplifier™ technology. Currently, Dyson holds 4,550 patents and patents holding, and has a team of over 2,000 engineers and scientists. Dyson also holds a Queen’s Award for Innovation.  Dyson vacuum cleaners are now available in 70 countries worldwide, and on average one machine is sold every 5 seconds. 90% of our machines are sold overseas, this was 30% just 10 years ago. Dyson was recently awarded the Queen’s Award for International Trade, which reflects the company’s growth over the last few years. We are now the world's number one vacuum cleaner manufacturer by value in the UK, US, Western Europe, Japan, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Singapore, and Australia.  “That’s really what Dyson is all about – new thinking to solve everyday problems.” - James Dyson Overview – Dyson Asia  Dyson has set a regional office for Southeast Asia in Singapore. The Singapore office will provide the vision and strategy to Dyson’s business in Southeast Asia, covering key markets such as Singapore, Malaysia, and growth/new markets such as Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines and Vietnam.  Working as part of a dedicated team on the ground in Singapore, this role reports to the Sales Director, SEA.  About The Role  Main Responsibilities – including but not limited to:  Working closely with the Sales Director to develop and implement tailored plans to drive volume and profit growth of our consumer products across our Developing SEA markets; currently Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Work collaboratively with distributor partners to create and implement successful sales and marketing plans.  Communicate product specifications, build demonstration excellence, manage value proposition, sales process, and marketing strategy to Dyson team in distributor businesses and work closely with SEA sales leadership on overall strategy to support the growth and success of this growing region.  Develop and deliver clear execution plans by markets Translate Dyson’s commercial goals into a detailed set of execution plans with distributors which focus on ‘controllable inputs’, getting specific about what both the distributor and Dyson will do. Ensure inputs are consistent with Dyson’s SEA strategy and goals, and check the inputs deliver the commercial plan Deliver and monitor progress vs. plans Manage brand investment budgets, calculating ROIs to reinforce effectiveness of future activities Collaborate with Dyson Marketing and PR teams to ensure delivery of brand building activities on time and in a manner consistent with Dyson standards Share global best practice across SEA markets Build capability of Dyson teams within distributor organisations Drive and monitor distributor's hiring of dedicated Dyson resource within their organisations, based on plans agreed with Dyson Coach and train local Dyson team on Dyson DNA, brand guidelines, our technologies and the ‘Dyson basics’ across retail and demonstration. Prepare, coordinate and deliver a training programme across the region, including train the trainer and Dyson ‘Academies’ Design and drive Dyson Expert monitoring and assessment methodologies to improve conversion Review and react to market share data where available. Maintain knowledge of industry trends, competing or complementary technologies and competitive threats Ongoing sales & forecast management of distributor partners Report sales versus budget and explain performance on a monthly basis Track Distributor performance and measure through sales KPIs (Retail Sales, Sell in, Store expansion) Collaborate with the IBD Supply Chain team and DMSB to ensure effective build plans are in place Ensure accurate rolling forecasts and timely orders are placed by each Distributor About You BA in Business or related discipline or equivalent work experience and a minimum of 7-10 years of related experience. Experience in Thailand and the ability to converse in Thai and fluency in English strongly preferred. Previous sales experience with disruptive technology and vision selling strongly preferred, including proven ability to achieve sales goals Hands-on experience of (trade) customer engagement preferred Strong analytical skills – must be numerate Able to manage complex projects Successful track record of launching new and disruptive technologies Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills Ability to adapt to changing work priorities; and ability to maintain good working relationships while dealing appropriately with sensitive and confidential matters and with a wide variety of personal contacts Proficiency with Microsoft Office software including familiarity with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook required Ability to work independently and travel 30% of the time including occasional weekends for conferences and events Benefits  Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices, and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.  At Dyson, it's about more than our machines. We recognise that our success comes from our inventive people. We believe in including everybody and supporting you on your journey with us.  At Dyson, it's about more than our machines. We recognise that our success comes from our inventive people. We believe in including everybody and supporting you on your journey with us
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Retail

description: About Oddle  Oddle is the leading cloud-based Software-as-a-Service platform that facilitates e-commerce and order management solutions for the F&B industry.  Our journey started in Singapore in 2014 and over the past 7 years, we are proud of what we can offer to help restaurants to manage and grow their sales – not only with technology but also with our data-guided marketing solutions. We connect to food lovers with Oddle Eats, a discovery platform with favourites curated by us because at Oddle, every meal matters. There is more to what we want to achieve.  About the role We are looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our Singapore team as we're bringing Oddle's position in Singapore to the next level. Join us in this high-growth journey and make a meaningful impact in the F&B scene.  As an SDR, you will constantly be collaborating with our Sales team to develop a sales methodology that allows you to create awareness with your prospects, and demonstrate that you are a thought leader in the restaurant territory space, so you can help restaurateurs grow their business by partnering with Oddle.  Who might you be? You are a business-minded individual and will go out of your way to make things happen. You believe in our mission and the excitement that it brings. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth and ever-changing environment, you can easily adapt to any situation and are up to any challenge that arises.  You are authentic and genuine, and have a knack of building great and meaningful business relationships. You want to learn the in & out of the F&B tech industry in Singapore, to leverage on or build your network with the humans of F&B. You care about the impact that you and the company can influence on restaurant partners that entrust their business to us.  What you will do: Research, qualify and build relationships with prospects. Create sales-ready opportunities from inbound and outbound leads targeting F&B businesses Engage with prospects using emailing and cold calling methodologies and/or other creative approaches to uncover their pain points or understand their business needs. Explain Oddle’s value proposition, identify potential opportunities and generate interest Coordinate sales efforts with the local field sales team Gain in-depth knowledge of Oddle products & services, knowledge and technologies in the F&B industry to be the subject matter expert in the restaurant technology space  Who we're looking for: 3-4 years of experience in telesales/prospecting for new leads with a proven track record of success. Experience in F&B / F&B eCommerce industry will be advantageous Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbally, with the ability to negotiate and convince. Bilingual with proficiency in Mandarin to engage with Mandarin speaking clients Strongly disciplined and sound time management skill A self-driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced and highly agile environment An entrepreneurial spirit who is self-started, resourceful, able to drive actions and inspire people around you Possess a great sense of ownership and take pride in your work Good team player and willingness to share knowledge and experiences with team members  If you are driven and looking for tremendous growth opportunities and want to grow with us, we would love to speak with you soon!
industries: Internet and Information Technology and Services

description: We are hiring! FatHopes Energy is a multi-faceted business that was established in 2010 with the primary focus of developing sustainable fats, oils and grease solutions for the primary purpose of advanced biofuel production. Over the years we have managed to cement our position as a robust and reliable supplier of ready to use biofuels as well as biofuels feedstock to the global markets.   We are embarking on an exciting expansion plan that will see us transforming into a regional force in Asia. In line with this we are on a rapid talent pool growth plan. We seek candidates who are driven, eager to learn and are team players. ***************************************************************************************************** The ideal candidate will have experience in all stages of the sales cycle. They should be confident with building new client relationship and maintaining existing ones. They should have evidence of strong skills and possess good negotiation skills.   Job Description: Manage sales pipeline Analyze market and establish competitive advantages Track metrics to ensure targets are hit Working closely with Head of Business Planning and Commercial team to increase acquisitions of F&B outlets for direct collection by FatHopes Energy. Sourcing of new circle of outlets / new accounts for acquisition of used cooking oil. Propose and execute marketing strategies to increase number of outlets for UCO disposal to FatHopes Energy. Expanding database, clientele and key accounts of the company. Strengthen and maintain relationship with Vendors to improve our service based on feedback and long-term account retention. Assist Head of Business Planning and Commercial team to plan and execute all marketing strategies to enhance our social media presence and conversion to outlet acquisition. Crafting Business Proposals and liaising with other departments to align strategies to clients’ requests to execute acquisition process. Any other projects or tasks assigned by Management and Head of Business Planning, as and when required.  Ideal Candidate Minimum Diploma holder and minimum 3 years' experience in sales and marketing. Experience in full sales cycle including deal closing Demonstrated sales success Strong negotiation skills Strong communication and presentation skills

THE OPPORTUNITY  Exciting opportunity to join the sales division of a global biopharmaceutical company that has been in the business for more than 25 years and in the Asia Pacific for over 60 years. Be part of a high-performing Sales team to drive strong results for the business and significant impact on customers Based in Singapore, the regional hub for the Asia Pacific (AP) and named one of the Best Companies to Work for in 2020 by Straits Times Best Employers 2021  Our Sales team support our customers by providing clinical information about products, educational information, clinical training programs and resources. We support healthcare providers and healthcare systems meet the goals of the patients in their communities.  What you will do Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to  Strategic Sales Objectives & Sales Expertise (50%) To achieve strategic objectives as required by the franchise (eg market growth, sales growth, number of new accounts, formulary listings, new product market priming) Demonstrate a high level of sales expertise and relationship management (through product & TA knowledge, selling skills, product presentation skills & managing customers) Be accountable for sales, activities, and compliance within the assigned territory  Territory Management Proactively plan and optimize overall sales results performance through effective territory management Seek Contract opportunities, suggest and negotiate optimum pricing Demonstrate ability to resolve problems in a timely manner, escalate issues early  Marketing Planning, Operations & Key Program Implementation (25%) Active involvement in the annual brand planning process Effective planning & execution of marketing/promotional activities according to plan (eg FGM, L&L, SL engagement program, patient programs, public forums) Ensure timely submission and approval of documentation for planned activities In compliant with internal medical, legal & compliance processes  Account Management (25%) Build and execute account plans for key accounts, through an in-depth understanding of customers (profile/behavior/relationship network/needs, etc)  What you must have To be successful in this role you must have:  A good Degree in Pharmacy/ Biomedical Science/ Arts/ Busines. 3+ years pharmaceutical sales experience in the Pharmaceutical industry Experience in Oncology is an added advantage Strong presentation skills, positive attitude, and strong sales achievement Strong customer focus and proven relationship building skills Good track record in sales, with a history of achieving results Experience in handling projects from end to end  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT  Competitive remuneration Innovative and flexible working environment Opportunity to learn and enjoy a rewarding career that technology companies don’t bring; the satisfaction of saving lives and making an impact!  Who we are…  We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.  What we look for…  In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.  We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.  Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully   Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.
industries: Pharmaceuticals and Biotechnology

description: The ideal candidate is a motivated, organized, and creative individual who welcomes the challenges of acquiring and developing new business through sales efforts. You will build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and close business deals while maintaining an extensive knowledge of current market conditions.   Responsibilities Develop, identify and qualify prospective accounts. Understand prospective accounts and communicate effectively the best ways to utilise our platform based on their marketing needs. Assist in the onboarding of prospective accounts. Continually engage with existing accounts to gain feedback and suggest improvements  Be the advocate of your accounts, ensuring customer success.  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree with at least 5 years of progressive Business Development experience in a fast-paced environment, essentially in Startup, Technology or similar industries Experience in B2B sales and love the sales process, every bit of it Able to drive changes and with continuous improvement mentality A start-up attitude – highly collaborative with an entrepreneurial, roll-up-your sleeves attitude, pragmatic, and able to work independently when required Comfortable with ambiguity - we're a fast-growing business and there's always unchartered territories, which is part of the fun. You should be comfortable with it and understand that not everything is 100% defined all the time. Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Description  The successful candidate will be part of SIA's Sales & Marketing Division.  Key Responsibilities Responsible for the revenue performance of corporate accounts assigned Understand corporate accounts’ travel policies and needs (key routes, travel class, price sensitivity) Prepare account plans and conduct regular reviews with corporate accounts and ensuring their commitment to the agreed targets Propose and execute interventions as needed to drive performance via sales levers (e.g. discount levels, overall net pricing, soft benefits, etc.) File sales reports and sales action plans in Sales Management Tool (SMT) Develop and maintain good relationship with corporate travel managers, procurement personnel and all key influencers within the corporate accounts including regular travelers and their travel arrangers Embark on initiatives to create brand affinity with corporate travelers and their travel arrangers Coordinate performance review, engagement and interventions with Global Account Managers for global corporate accounts Maintain good working relationships with travel management companies (TMCs) Organize corporate engagement events Participate in corporate RFPs and negotiate corporate agreements of existing and/or new corporate accounts Represent SIA in industry events, trade shows, fairs, etc. Meet, present and sign up new accounts based on leads and referrals from TMCs, Corporate Sales Support Desk, etc. Gather market intelligence on competitors' activities in the corporate segment Any other duties as assigned. Requirements A degree in any discipline Prior experience in aviation industry will be an advantage Customer-focused and results-focused Good communication and interpersonal skills

description: Careers that Change Lives  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  SEEKING EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST FOR SALES AND CLINICAL ROLES: This posting is intended to pipeline talent for potential future needs You will have the opportunity to be part of our market leading technology across a broad range of products in medical devices as Sales Representative or Clinical Specialist, Working within a high performing & collaborative team, you will be able to achieve your career aspiration while positively impacting patient lives!  A Day in the Life  SALES REPRESENTATIVE:  Typically, sales professional (individual contributor) with direct sales responsibilities. May direct the work of other entry level sales professionals or manage sales processes and / or accounts involving multiple team members. Majority of time is spent establishing and maintaining customer relationships, developing new customer relationships, implementing sales strategies and meeting sales targets.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and/or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services Conducts market research including customers and competitors’ activities Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing CLINICAL SPECIALIST:  Typically, an individual contributor with responsibility in a professional discipline or specialty. Delivers and/or manages projects assigned and works with other stakeholders to achieve desired results. May act as a mentor to colleagues or may direct the work of other entry level professionals. Majority of time is spent delivering and overseeing the projects – from design to implementation - while and adhering to policies, using specialized knowledge and skills normally acquired through advanced education.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Conducts on-site education and/or consulting Supports field personnel in providing the best possible outcomes and service for Medtronic customers Partners with sales colleagues to develop and execute plans of sales for within one or more business unit(s) Participates in conventions, forums, and meetings to increase product awareness Works closely with Clinical Lead, Clinical Management and Regional Sales team to provide customer case and sales support Identifies and facilitates execution on growth opportunities with Sales and Clinical Support Team Serves as a technical resource to support sales of a specific medical product or solution Minimum Requirements (Sales Representative): Bachelor’s degree in any discipline, preferably in biomedical science/engineering or nursing Years of relevant experience in pharma and/or medical devices between 1 year to 5 years Requires practical knowledge gained through experience of sales techniques and job area typically obtained through education combined with sales experience Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues Minimum Requirements (Clinical Specialist): Bachelor’s degree in any discipline, preferably in biomedical science/engineering or nursing Years of relevant experience in pharma and/or medical devices between 1 year to 5 years Practical knowledge and demonstrated competence within job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Aug 6, 2020 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Job Description of Senior Sales Representative for Johnson and Johnson Surgical Vision (Singapore)  J&J Surgical Vision is inviting highly motivated, tenacious and self-starter talent to join our Singapore Commercial team! In this role, you play an important role in achieving sales and driving share gain within our Singapore private and government Ophthalmology accounts in Cataracts and Refractive segment. This role is rewarded with sales incentives/sales commissions on top of the basic remuneration, so if you are keen, join us now!  What the successful candidate will do: This role has an overall responsibility for driving sales, achieving targets and manages assigned territory while operating within an assigned budget with the below scope: - Be part of the team in determining sales forecasts for business planning to the management through active inputs on market insights and information, sales reports and required documents - Proactively assist in implementing market development and field marketing activities with the clear focus in attaining established sales goals including market share objectives - Performs contract and/or tender management activities - Proactively schedules appointments and make sales presentations to customers - Develops customer and product focused presentation packages to address our customers’ needs - Regular customer engagement to gather information on orders and market conditions, at the same time active follow up with customers to ensure customer satisfaction with our products - Executes promotional activities that are designed to advance sales in specific product lines or areas - Coordinate Professional Development activities to enhance the knowledge of Healthcare professionals - Partner with our marketing team in development of marketing plan, execution of marketing programs and materials and fulfil internal processes to get marketing materials approved for commercial use
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

jobTitle: Key Account Manager, Grab for Business, Singapore
description: Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  As a member of Grab, not only will you bring your skillsets to drive your team forward, but you will also develop your untapped potential and be inspired by some of the most amazing minds in the industry. Our team consists of both young and experienced individuals who are tenacious, motivated and energized by the fact that we exist to make a change - have a societal impact in Southeast Asia.  Grab for Business is the B2B team within Grab that helps to simplify business transportation and related services for companies across Southeast Asia. We actively engage with a wide network of companies across the region and want to ensure that client success is paramount in our organisation.  To this end, we are looking for a strong Key Account Manager in our Grab for Business Singapore team to manage and grow an expanding portfolio of top customers. To perform this role well candidate needs to have strong communication skills, attention to detail, ability to create and follow processes, and a track record of exceeding expectations.  Get to know the Role: Relationship Management: Build strong and long-lasting relationships with our customers through long term planning, handling objections, asking the right questions and understanding their pain points while resolving them. Establish a solid understanding of Grab’s business solutions to service your customers better. Build and maintain healthy cross-functional relationships within the wider Grab organisation for the smooth functioning of the business. Client Success: Assess, clarify and validate customer needs on a regular basis. Work with cross-functional stakeholders to develop solutions that best address consumer needs while simultaneously meeting performance objectives. Enable your team to leverage customer, industry and data-backed insights to achieve excellence and surpass customer expectations. Data Analysis & Insights: With in-depth data analysis of the business (using CRM and other internal tools), drive and develop account specific growth strategies and approaches, solidifying Grab for Business’ position as a market leader. Present account plans based upon data driven insights to establish revenue goals and business plans that advance the accounts’ performance while also working on new initiatives. The must haves: Education: Bachelor’s Degree (minimum) Work Experience: Minimum of 3-6 years of key account management and/or sales experience within a fast-paced and highly competitive B2B, enterprise or corporate environment (direct customer facing role). Proven and successful track record in establishing strong client relationships. A suitable candidate will have an impressive track record in meeting and even exceeding sales targets. Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to effectively network with customers and the overall Grab business. Communication: Strong and effective communicator with good presentation and speaking skills who can verbally and visually articulate their point of view clearly and succinctly. Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) environment. Should have a deep desire to excel and develop a career in business sales & account management. Should have demonstrated integrity and respect in the performance of their duties. Proficiency in customer experience tools (CRM tools, reporting dashboards) Comfortable with data analysis (MS Office, Google Docs / Sheets / Slides)
jobFunction: Business Development, General Business, and Information Technology
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: 10 million wounds treated with 3M™ V.A.C.® Therapy. If it doesn’t say V.A.C.® Therapy, it’s not.  We are looking for a highly motivated individual who will be primarily responsible for achieving business and sales objectives by promoting and selling 3M medical devices and consumables used in the administration of negative pressure wound therapy and other advanced wound care therapies.  Principal Accountabilities/Key Responsibilities  Proactive identification of new users and business opportunities for accelerated product penetration Independent management of own schedule to coordinate regular internal and customer meetings and support activities including regular bedside support in the use of 3M products. Build account intimacy, generate sales leads and leverage various products to meet the customer's needs. Manage all aspects of multiple customer accounts and coordinate input and support from other internal business functions Consistently build strong customer support and a preference for company products. Gain expertise in both 3M and competitor products. Identify and foster opportunities to develop and utilise Key Opinion Leaders. Work with 3M Clinicians to co-lead joint calls with customers to discuss scientific evidence and procedures utilising 3M products. Accountable for customer satisfaction and providing high quality service. Responsible for keeping commitments in a timely manner and resolving issues promptly. Monitors and reports to Sales Manager any marketing information and competitor sales and product strategies. Participates in all trade shows, conferences and other projects as determined by Sales Manager. Conducts all business activities according to applicable rules and regulations and observes all company policy and procedures to ensure meeting ethical standards and compliance obligations.  Position Qualifications, Experience & Skills              Sales experience in medical devices preferred Nursing degree preferred. Post-graduate studies in wound care advantageous. Excellent command of both written and spoken English essential. Self-motivated, willing to learn and to take responsibility, matured. Able to work independently and pro-actively manage their own schedule under time pressure. Excellent presentation and public speaking skills. Proficient in relevant Microsoft Office applications. Results-oriented and self-motivated with a high energy level, initiative, drive and creativity Initially a contract role, convertible to permanent
industries: Medical Devices

description: 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.  Job Description  Account Specialist/Manager  This position is accountable for execution of the sales plan / account plan developed by Division Sales Leader in order to meet set revenue and growth targets for the Oral Care Solutions Division (OCSD).  Role will report to Division Sales Leader, OCSD.  Job Responsibilities  This is a local role, where the Account Specialist/Manager is responsible to drive sales and spec-in to OCSD’s existing customers and develop new businesses.  In this position, the Account Specialist/Manager will work very closely with the Business Team to deliver the following:  Achieve sales goals and year on year growth. Initiates sales process by prospecting, scheduling of appointments, conduct clinical sales presentations, understanding business needs, develop proposals and sales closure. Build customer relationships with the customers and develop these relationships in multiple levels of the organization. Demonstrate a solution-oriented consultation approach to selling Overcome price concerns and other objections by demonstrating value Proactively identify new business opportunities and drive spec-in Constantly provide Voice of Customer/Voice of channel and competitive intelligence Ensures customer satisfaction standards are achieved and maintained Maintain consistent communication and timely follow-up with customers and prospects and be available and responsive to customer’s real-time needs Complete sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner Organize in-services for customers Work with distributors to achieve Sales Targets Other duties may be assigned  Requirements  Bachelor’s Degree or higher educational qualification from an accredited University with minimum 2 -3 years of experience in sales and preferably in a dental / healthcare setting Experience with GPO’s contracts, including negotiation and distribution management is a plus Must be self-motivated; energetic; results-driven and a team player Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills Able to work under time pressure and work independently Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills Demonstrates impeccable sales acumen with passion and drive for success Exhibits clinical and conceptual selling skills in a face-to-face and virtual settings Exemplifies effectiveness in new business development and lead qualification Proficient computer skills including MS Excel, PowerPoint and CRM programs Ability to effectively utilize CRM to maintain and develop assigned territory or account Oversees from preparation to end of dental events/exhibitions and hands-on workshops at all times, including weekends Holds a valid class 3 driving license and possess own car. Actively participating in relevant corporate programs/initiatives, complies with professional and quality standards, complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards.  Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.  Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.  Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.  3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.  Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

description: Want to be on the forefront for Parcel Perform's product for B2B software solutions in e-commerce logistics?    Parcel Perform is looking for an amazing team member to support us on the sales front!   We are a dynamic, fast-growing team that’s excited about e-commerce and logistics, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology. Join us in our journey to drive Parcel Perform’s growth in the e-commerce market.  WE NEED YOU ON OUR TEAM!   All our outstanding solutions and happy customers are looking for a Parcel Perform counterpart that can assist in their onboarding, keeps a close eye on their account and advises them on further potential use cases to expand their feature use on the platform. If have knowledge in the arena of tech SaaS products, B2B sales, and account management experience and are ready to go above and beyond for our clients, this role might be for you.  In short, you will be the key driver for Parcel Perform success in the following ways:  Managing relationships and processes in the onboarding of clients: Onboarding of new customers can involve multiple parties on their and our side. We are looking for a well organised Account Manager that can be a knowledgeable counterpart to guide them through the onboarding process and service them throughout their Parcel Perform journey. Manage portfolio of existing enterprise customers to make them successful: You build strong long-term relationship with all key stakeholders, being the first point of contact for any of their inquiries. You will establish a trusted/strategic adviser relationship with each key customer and drive continued value of Parcel Performs products and services. As part of your role, you will work with customers to establish critical goals, or other key performance indicators and aid the customer in achieving their business goals. Ensuring you are aware of all competitive activities within accounts and work with the customer success team to prevent attrition. Leverage upsell opportunities: You love advising customers on new features and use cases within our platform to drive our upsell opportunity into new features or higher subscriptions and convert existing customers to annual subscriptions.  In summary, you will be a business-critical part of our team, focusing on the customers and making them successful in order to cater to the long-term growth of Parcel Perform. key initial prospecting as much as the first key outreach to ensure a constant lead flow for our business managers to follow up. Your strong organization and writing-skills as well as your high interpersonal competence will ensure our constant customer growth.  ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCES Minimum 3 years of experience in SaaS / IT sales or account management; eCommerce experience a plus Previous experience with SaaS contracts / subscription models a plus Readiness to go the extra mile for our customers around the world. Experience navigating through multiple decision makers and influencers within a large Enterprise environment World-class interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effortlessly make complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple Exceptional fluency and articulation in English (both spoken and written) Highly self motivated and ambitious in achieving goals. Strong team player but still a self-starter Well structured with the ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple projects/deals at the same time High interpersonal skills, ability to identify the needs of our prospects A willingness to keep learning and pushing yourself to higher and higher levels  WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE IN RETURN! The opportunity to work in a fast-growing, super exciting and innovative business that will revolutionize the e-commerce logistics industry. You will be the needle of success on the growth of a global product that will become a key platform behind successful e-commerce logistics worldwide. The ability to continuously learn and develop in an international setting with you being a critical driver behind the success of us achieving our mission. An environment where everybody never stops growing, and focuses on succeeding - we continuously work with you on your strengths and weaknesses across many important dimensions, and look at ways for you to address them and further your development. Your entry ticket into being part of the Parcel Perform journey, where you will work with and alongside people from around the world that share the same passion and dedication.  ABOUT US Parcel Perform is the leading delivery experience platform. It enables modern e-commerce enterprises to create unique end-to-end customer journeys and optimize logistics operations with powerful data integrations, parcel tracking, delivery notifications and logistics performance reports in real-time.   Parcel Perform's scalable SaaS platform executes more than 100M parcel updates daily and integrates with 700+ carriers. The data-first company is pioneering innovative ML / AI use cases in e-commerce logistics including its 'Date of Arrival' prediction engine. Parcel Perform is the partner of choice for top brands, marketplaces and carriers across all major verticals globally.  In August, we successfully secured US$20M in Series A investments led by blue-chip investors such as Cambridge Capital and SoftBank Ventures Asia. Parcel Perform believes in growing our dynamic and diverse team with the best talent to assist our global expansion. We have a myriad of talented individuals who have assisted in helping us achieve profitability. Join us while we grow in technology, talent and teamwork.  For more information, please visit www.parcelperform.com

description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  The Territory Account Manager is responsible for building Commercial and Mid-Enterprise level client relationships across the Singaporean and ASEAN market. Individuals who excel at this job have the ability to prospect, develop, and close business within a timely manner while focusing on the clients’ requirements. The Territory AE’s must have the confidence and ability to negotiate and close agreements with clients and support new customers through our on-boarding process.  This role is a unique opportunity to contribute in a meaningful way to high visibility, high impact projects at a very exciting time for the company. Snowflake is an innovative, high-growth, customer-focused company in a large and growing market. If you are an energetic, self-managed professional with experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities, we’d love to hear from you.  AS A TERRITORY ACCOUNT MANAGER, YOU WILL: Achieve sales quotas for allocated accounts on a quarterly and annual basis by developing a sales strategy in the allocated territory with a target prospect list, and a regional sales plan. Your primary market will be Corporate and mid-Enterprise accounts in Singapore and partner generated opportunities across ASEAN. Develop marketing plans with the marketing team to drive revenue growth. Be the trusted advisor to the customer by understanding their existing and future IT roadmap to drive the Snowflake solution within the marketplace. Prospect qualification and the development of new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue streams both directly and leveraging our partner ecosystem Arrange and conduct initial Executive and CxO discussions and positioning meetings. Sales process management and opportunity closure. Ongoing account management to ensure customer satisfaction and drive additional revenue streams. Be familiar with a solution-based approach to selling, have experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities.  WE ARE LOOK FOR SOMEONE WITH: 2 to 5+ years of full-cycle sales experience selling software or cloud-based applications to the mid-market in Singapore and preferably other ASEAN countries Emphasis on cloud, databases, business intelligence software, data warehousing, SaaS is desired. Experience hitting quota of $750k+ of ARR per year selling both directly and with the channel A track record of success in driving consistent activity, pipeline development and quota achievement. Experience determining customer requirements and presenting appropriate solutions. A pro-active, independent thinker with high energy/positive attitude. Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Sales Specialist - MPGS  Overview  South East Asia is one of the fastest growing divisions for Mastercard, with markets at different stages of development and maturity for digital payments.  The individual will be responsible to manage MPGS customer engagement in collaboration with our country, MPGS product and its functional support teams to optimize existing business & eliminate service delivery impediment for SEA markets. This Sales Specialist will report to the Director, MPGS Sales for Southeast Asia to defend existing business and expand new service revenue growth.  Role  This Position Is Responsible For Working closely with MPGS Sales, Account Managers, MPGS Product, Customer Delivery and MPGS Helpdesk to drive accelerated sales growth Providing data analytic to support sales lead generation and opportunity development Equipping MPGS Sales team with good data analytics / business performance reporting to optimize existing business and customer engagement Working closely with MPGS Product and the Director to develop GTM strategies and business deals for Southeast Asia markets and generating new sales opportunities. Supporting MPGS Sales to win new RFPs  All About You Digitally savvy with strong communication and presentation skills Good knowledge of payments system Customer focus and passionate for service excellent Strong team player with good ownership to carry out responsibilities to the end Preferably possess strong command of ecommerce service suites with the ability to identify opportunities to cross-sell and maximize revenue in each client portfolio. Deep knowledge of MPGS product functionalities would be a key advantage Versatile to pick up new responsibilities with strong project management skill Good grasp of financial modeling and business case development Skilled at management reporting and gathering insights from granular data for better business decision making Comfortable with ambiguous situations and able to carry out works with little instruction Flexibility to travel in Southeast Asia at short notice  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description: About The Role  HubSpot seeks an Account Executive (or Inbound Growth Specialist, as we’d call you around here) to join our Singapore office.  HubSpot Account Executives are responsible for successfully selling the HubSpot value proposition to inbound leads, primarily over the phone. Target clients will consist of small to mid-size companies across India region with no assigned territories or restrictions.  In This Role, You’ll Get To Run a full sales cycle and close new business to consistently exceed quota Become an expert in inbound marketing Inspire prospective customers to adopt HubSpot's suite of products Engage highly qualified inbound leads over the phone at small and mid-sized companies Build relationships with prospects and internal stakeholders to grow new business Work collaboratively with marketing and technology departments to execute sales strategy as the firm introduces enhancements to existing solutions and/or releases new products Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance our company’s values, unique culture, and vision for the future We Are Looking For Sales Professionals With The Following Commitment To Win - You possess a consistent drive to achieve your personal and professional goals. Intellectual Curiosity - You have an innate desire to learn and understand concepts and ask thoughtful questions. Critical thinking - You are able to find and synthesize information, apply logic to problems and quickly analyze to provide a recommendation. Coachability - You are humble, acknowledge your strengths and weaknesses and take feedback well. You are able to self-diagnose and translate that diagnosis into an actionable solution. Strong Communication Skills - You can effectively and concisely communicate with, motivate and inspire prospects You Will Need To Have Experience running a full sales cycle and closing business Terrific consultative sales skills and exceptional closing experience Accurate forecasting and pipeline management Evidence that you are a Top Producer in your current role A sharp focus on your goals and a belief that your daily, weekly and monthly activities will help you achieve them Experience in selling to clients across India Able to articulate confidently the market landscape of the region In exchange for your input you can expect to receive: HubSpot culture is driven by a shared passion for our mission and metrics. It is a culture of amazing, growth-minded people whose values include using good judgment and solving for the customer. Employees who work at HubSpot have HEART: Humble, Empathetic, Adaptable, Remarkable, Transparent. Unlimited Time Off policy and flexible work arrangements Quota relief for those serving National Service lasting longer than 2 weeks Comprehensive Health Care Coverage HubSpot equity and access to Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Comprehensive New Hire Onboarding & Training Program Training (Tuition) Reimbursement Free Books Program Primary Caregiver Leave for a minimum of 16 weeks and Secondary Caregiver Leave for 6 weeks Five Year Sabbatical Annual Fitness Reimbursement We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  About HubSpot  HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.  Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.  By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description  Canopy (https://canopy.cloud/) is a "make sense of your data" financial technology startup. We provide aggregation, visualization, analytics, and reporting services to financial institutions, wealth managers, and high net-worth individuals. We are currently recruiting a BD Manager B2B2C to join us on an exciting journey. The Business Development team at Canopy focuses on identifying new prospects to sell our Wealth Management technology platform. We are looking for a self-motivated and team-focused sales rock star with a strong entrepreneurial spirit who has a positive and pragmatic attitude, combined with the desire to achieve success  Your role: - As a BD Manager, your day will be composed of three main activities: 1. Scouting for new prospects that could use Canopy (ideally from your personal network, cold reach out, partnerships, etc.). Canopy's clientele are Family Offices, Wealthy Families / Individuals, Wealth Managers, External / Independent Asset Managers, Private Bankers, Trustees, Fiduciaries) 2. Engaging in new conversations with firms that could use Canopy, 3. Managing your opportunities and bring them to a close, - You will be selling and promoting a range of WM Tech. Services (reporting SW, Backoffice operations <BPO> such as data aggregation, processing, cleansing) mainly over the phone or face to face, with opportunity to attend conferences and events, - Be part of and actively influence/shape a fast growing Business Development and very international start-up team, - Working in a positive sales environment, recognition and benefits for committed individuals,  Requirements - Singaporean and PR only - 3 – 5 years of trained sales experience (ideally with financial or IT background), - Excellent communication skills and ability to correspond with senior level executives at various types of investment firms (FOs, WMs, EAMs, IAMs, RIAs, PBs, Trustees, Fiduciaries), - Fluent in English (any other European and / or Asian, and / or Middle-Eastern language is an advantage), - Ability to work on your own initiative and manage your personal workload, - Both the ability and the appetite for working in a start-up environment with flat hierarchies, informal and direct collaboration and communication, - You are hungry for success and you strive to build up a great company with the current team, - You love to win, more than you hate to lose :)

The ideal candidate is experienced with business planning globally across various verticals and sales channels to manage pricing, lifecycles, promotional calendars in the technology or consumer electronics industry. We are looking for someone who is resourceful, adaptable, team-oriented and the ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You should have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.  Responsibilities Manage financial analysis, pricing and promotional calendar to ensure that we increase our leadership and market share position Conduct and run competitive benchmarking and product price comparison Work with the Head of Sales & Marketing to ensure regional sales teams are guided in terms of product knowledge, pricing and promotional planning Drive product lifecycle planning for peripherals Responsible for developing and maintaining tools to track, measure and share sales data on Razer and competitive offerings Manage the internal pricing approval system Requirements Degree in Business / Marketing with 5 years of product marketing or business analyst experience with consumer / lifestyle products Proven business planning background with excellent understanding of sales channel management Good analytical and high adaptability skills Excellent interpersonal, communication, and time management skills Possess strong people skills, with the ability to work with the regional Sales & Marketing Teams to bring about increased sales to the market

description: We are recruiting for a Business Development Executive (APAC) based in Singapore.    Our client is a British Talent Marketplace who use technology and datasets to deliver Business Talent on demand from its global network.  This always forward approach drives critical projects with a fast, convenient and precise way for teams to extend bandwidth and expertise, creating the right mix of talent to deliver successful outcomes. Central HR and procurement teams also benefit from insights on external talent usage, skills, experience and costs.    Companies are changing how work gets done, and that change needs a new approach to finding the right people    The APAC sales team is responsible for evangelising the company as a solution to the wider market. The first step in the customer journey aims to position our client as the go-to talent marketplace partner in the business talent category.    For the role you need to be resilient and determined. You will also understand how to assess a prospective customer's needs, cater the outreach to each prospect specifically and field common queries.    Business Development Executive  As a Business Development Executive, you will evangelise and generate revenue for the business in the APAC Region. The role involves identifying which companies will gain most advantage from using the platform and then positioning the solution to become established within the account as their first-choice business talent provider. Once they are on board, you will focus on expanding the user base and overall usage, creating loyal clients who buy in increasing volume and value.    What you will be responsible for:  Use a consultative sales approach throughout to map prospect accounts and their decision- making process, so that you can engage with senior stakeholders including C-suite Consistently achieve/exceed your personal bookings and revenue targets and contribute to overall revenue growth Generating meetings with users within new and existing accounts to identify and generate qualified pipeline and revenue opportunities (minimum of 5 new engagements per week) Collaborate with cross-functional teams, specifically with support from marketing campaigns to evangelise the story to prospects and clients and work with the Delivery team to ensure excellent client service Track and record information on Salesforce and show ownership of data related to your activities   New Account acquisition:  Identify market opportunities within your designated segment and region, sourcing the majority of your own bookings through proactive outreach Manage multi-touch and multi-format outreach programmes Lead meetings with prospects and plan clear next steps to continue engagement Negotiate terms with New Accounts with the view to establish preferred supplier status   Existing Account growth:  Act as point of contact for all requests from your designated existing clients Generate new users within existing accounts through direct outreach and driving referrals into new functions and geographies Increase Existing Account revenue growth with a focus on gaining an increasing share of spend   What you should have:  Proven success in a sales or customer facing role ideally from a marketplace, staffing/recruiting, consulting, or HR technology platform company Track record of achieving and exceeding goals and KPIs Exceptional communications skills including an excellent command of the English language (both verbal and written). Additional language skills are a bonus Strong attention to detail Highly developed complex problem-solving ability with the ability to adapt to the situation Resilience and drive with a will to win and success   This is an opportunity to join a company with a proven business model that has already established clear industry recognition as a leading global marketplace for Business Talent.  Your pace of progression within the company will be determined solely by you - your drive and your own success. Our client offers a highly lucrative reward culture, offering commission for meeting and exceeding targets as well as a competitive basic salary.  Accelerate your personal and professional development by working with and learning from a vibrant and motivated team all on a mission to make a real impact.    EA license No. : R1657232 Agency License No.: 11C4388   Phee Farrer Jones is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: Description  Optimizely is focused on unlocking digital potential and we are the recognized category leader in Digital Experience Platform (DXP) and created the category for A/B Testing and experimentation software. We have incredible customers – isn’t that one of the most important aspects of looking for your next job? Optimizely has over 9,000 brands from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit and Zillow.  Not only are we financially sound and growing but we have unicorn status: Exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and has all strategic options ahead of itself. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.  We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business culture with emphasis on teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!  If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment, apply! We’re just getting started...  What's it like to work here?  "Nowhere else in the tech industry can you find a role that puts you on the frontlines of digital transformation, speaking with the world's most exciting brands to help them build the online experiences of the future. As a bonus, we let loose with fun outings to awesome restaurants and activities." - Henry, Current Account Executive, former SDR  What you'll do: Help us bring the world’s most adopted digital experimentation platform to your assigned markets Become part of our proud front-line as the first touch-point for clients, establishing long-term relationships Collaborate with Account Executives and Marketing to further develop the territories Drive targeted customer engagements with senior marketing executives Educate businesses on the value of testing and personalization through experimentation Become a specialist in SaaS solutions sales Be part of an intercultural environment with inspiring and ambitious colleagues Great support for personal development and mentorship  Qualifications: Sales experience, customer service experience or another type of client-facing experience preferred Knowledge from and insights in tech/SaaS business is preferred You take ownership of everything you do You love making a direct impact You are a keen communicator and love to meet new people You are passionate about technology and online business You are a self-starter with a growth mindset You are solutions-oriented and not afraid to speak up or share an idea You are fluent in verbal and written English  Even if you meet 60% of these qualifications, we encourage you to apply! We are looking to create a diverse and multifaceted team. We embody inclusion, which is reflected in our company values where we embrace diversity and equal opportunities for everyone.  Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market rapidly.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Acquire and Grow ShopeePay’s offline merchant network Cover end to end Merchant Acquisition cycle - from Lead Generation to Outreach, Pitch, Negotiation, Closure and Onboarding Develop and maintain a clear understanding of ShopeePay Create, maintain and manage the working relationship with merchants and collect data/feedback from merchants  Requirements A poly/university/college degree in any major At least 1-2 years of experience in sales Motivated, Resilient, Persistent Have a hunger for success Hardworking A team-player who can work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Excellent communication skills in English Experience/knowledge of the local F&B and/or retail industries will be a plus
industries: Internet

description: Job Description Account management In charge of a set of fashion accounts to groom their performance on Shopee Analyse accounts performance and operation metrics to provide solutions to optimise accounts performance Work with accounts to execute campaign and sales strategies to achieve category and accounts ambitions Work closely with internal teams including marketing, revenue, and operation teams to ensure all execution are completed successfully Engage accounts to participate in Shopee campaigns and work with them to execute and deliver campaign targets Category Management / Project Management Work with category managers to define, implement and execute growth strategy Lead in-team projects to set up improvement processes and execute new initiatives  Requirements Bachelor's degree in any field, coupled with 2 to 5 years of working experience Relevant account management and category management experience Experience in fashion industry and e-commerce industry is preferred Good communication capability and enjoy client facing work Good analytical skills A goal getter and a good team player, and not afraid to take challenges

description: Vibrant environment Opportunities for career growth Attractive Sales Incentives  What would I be doing? Prospecting and acquiring new clients, including payment collection Managing and retaining the relationship with clients throughout the project duration Main point of contact between client and vendor organization Work closely with the Content Strategist team to deliver campaigns on a timely basis  What do I need? The drive to excel and individuals who can love remote working IT Savvy and knowledge of Social Media Platforms, Web Proficiency, and Computer Software NITEC/ Diploma in any field Singaporeans Only  We aim to bring out the best of your potential, breaking away from the traditional corporate or hierarchical structure. If you have the drive to thrive in a fast-paced environment, submit your application now!

Account Specialist/Manager  This position is accountable for execution of the sales plan / account plan developed by Division Sales Leader in order to meet set revenue and growth targets for the Oral Care Solutions Division (OCSD).  Role will report to Division Sales Leader, OCSD.  Job Responsibilities  This is a local role, where the Account Specialist/Manager is responsible to drive sales and spec-in to OCSD’s existing customers and develop new businesses. In this position, the Account Specialist/Manager will work very closely with the Business Team to deliver the following:  1. Achieve sales goals and year on year growth. 2. Initiates sales process by prospecting, scheduling of appointments, conduct clinical sales presentations, understanding business needs, develop proposals and sales closure. 3. Build customer relationships with the customers and develop these relationships in multiple levels of the organization. 4. Demonstrate a solution-oriented consultation approach to selling 5. Overcome price concerns and other objections by demonstrating value 6. Proactively identify new business opportunities and drive spec-in 7. Constantly provide Voice of Customer/Voice of channel and competitive intelligence 8. Ensures customer satisfaction standards are achieved and maintained 9. Maintain consistent communication and timely follow-up with customers and prospects and be available and responsive to customer’s real-time needs 10. Complete sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner 11. Organize in-services for customers 12. Work with distributors to achieve Sales Targets 13. Other duties may be assigned  Requirements: 1. Bachelor’s Degree or higher educational qualification from an accredited University with minimum 2 -3 years of experience in sales and preferably in a dental / healthcare setting 2. Experience with GPO’s contracts, including negotiation and distribution management is a plus 3. Must be self-motivated; energetic; results-driven and a team player 4. Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills 5. Able to work under time pressure and work independently 6. Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills 7. Demonstrates impeccable sales acumen with passion and drive for success 8. Exhibits clinical and conceptual selling skills in a face-to-face and virtual settings 9. Exemplifies effectiveness in new business development and lead qualification 10. Proficient computer skills including MS Excel, PowerPoint and CRM programs 11. Ability to effectively utilize CRM to maintain and develop assigned territory or account 12. Oversees from preparation to end of dental events/exhibitions and hands-on workshops at all times, including weekends 13. Holds a valid class 3 driving license and possess own car. 14. Actively participating in relevant corporate programs/initiatives, complies with professional and quality standards, complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards.
