description: As Business Development Manager Synthetics, you are responsible for growing our client's Synthetics Business in South-East Asia.  Main Responsibilities: - You translate the overall long-term synthetic segment strategies into an annual regional sales plan. - You are the main contact with clients and therefore are first in line to capture clients’ needs. You forward this information internally to play an active role in the product and/or application development and synthetics segment strategies. - You report to the Regional Commercial Director Ropes and work closely with the General Manager Synthetics. In addition, you collaborate with the Innovation, the Customer service and Operations Teams. - Travel is needed; up to 25% of your time you visit customers and prospects in your region.  Requirements:  - University degree in engineering, commercial engineering or business management. - Minimum of five years business development / marketing & sales experience in a B2B context, preferably but not necessarily in the Synthetics Ropes business and/or one of the segments in which we are active (off shore, crane & industrial). - Background in international business management, international customer-supplier relationship, general business law and contracts as well as international trade practices and regulations.

Cyrus is a B2B logistics company that works with medical institutions in Singapore.   We are currently growing our inside sales team and we are looking for a highly motivated and achievement-driven Account Executive to join us. In this role, you will navigate the entire sales cycle from prospecting new business opportunities to closing and onboarding clients.  Responsibilities Creating and driving your own sales pipeline Proactively source new leads and use closed-loop lead management to ensure consistent follow-ups Make high volume of outbound sales calls and emails to prospects daily Understand and keep up to date with industry and competitive landscape knowledge Use specialty expertise and email marketing automation tools to seek out new opportunities to build the pipeline in and drive pursuit Onboarding new prospects to integrate with our logistics   Required Skills & Experience Highly proficient in spoken and written English Proven outbound B2B sales experience over the phone of at least 2 years  You're not shy on the phone and you are able to handle objections and turn them into a yes You have a history of consistently meeting or exceeding sales quotas You're agile and switched on - you're a natural listener and excellent communicator You're flexible, resilient and adaptive You are self-motivated and able to work independently Proactively seek out new leads and opportunities Excellent interpersonal, listening, persuasion and negotiation skills Proficiency in using Excel sheets  You must be able to work from 9am - 6pm GMT+8

Job Description  Procore is looking for a Sales Development Representative to join one of the highest-performing sales teams in the software industry. Our Sales Development team is an essential component of our sales model and has helped fuel our incredible growth for the past several years.  As a Sales Development Representative, you'll develop an understanding of the construction industry and Procore’s product to help improve one of the world’s largest industries. We pride ourselves on setting challenging goals and having fun achieving them together. We value our culture and are looking for optimistic and motivated people to join our team. Are you up for the challenge?  This position will report to the Senior Manager, Sales Development, and is based in Singapore. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.  What you’ll do: Create new business opportunities to fuel Procore’s growth Partner with Account Executives to achieve mutually aligned sales quotas each month Engage construction professionals through phone, email, and other channels to understand their challenges and identify opportunities to solve them Work with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to create opportunities for new business Conduct daily activities, including: Pre-call research and planning Making a high volume of calls per day Nurturing leads by following-up with previous contacts Maintaining Salesforce records What we’re looking for: Bachelor’s degree is preferred or a desire to pursue a career in Sales 1+ years of experience in software sales, specifically SaaS Will to achieve results—the curiosity and perseverance to push harder when the going gets tough Enjoy working in an ambitious collaborative environment—inspire your team to be better while achieving your goals Commitment to lifelong learning and continuous development Self-aware, reflective, and able to digest feedback critically and adapt to overcome challenges Demonstrate our core values of Ownership, Optimism, and Openness. Friendly, enthusiastic and demonstrate empathy and thoughtfulness in your work Construction industry experience, especially with a general contractor or subcontractor is a plus  Additional Information  If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.  About Us  Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.  We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.  We will provide further details during the interview process on the proposed contractual arrangement and relationship you will have with Procore if you are successful in applying for this role.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the IKEA Business Leader, you are to support sales maximisation in your business area by leveraging on existing IKEA product range and tools.  Your assignment Understand and clarify client requirements, coordinate and arrange products to fulfil new and existing customer’s orders Follow through on orders and enquiries through emails and phone calls Work closely with third party associates and all store departments to secure stocks Provide advice to clients on products through essential product knowledge You know the processes and you are responsible for sales documentations and ad hoc assignments. Qualifications You have at least 1 year of experience in high volume business or multiple stakeholder coordination You have strong interest in the home furnishing business and customer service You take lead in ensuring results are delivered, able to work under pressure and able to prioritise and work in an effective manner You have fair commercial acumen, excellent interpersonal skills and able to relate to customers’ needs You are comfortable in developing knowledge and utilising key system tools Able to converse with Chinese-speaking clients You are open to work rotating shifts (including weekends and public holidays) to cover the operation's peak periods. Additional Information  Please apply by 31 October 2021
industries: Consumer Goods, Retail, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Regional Sales Lead, New Business Sales - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Regional Sales Lead, New Business Sales - Singapore  With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have knowledgeable, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.  Additional Role Description  New Business Sales is the high-value and strategic advertiser acquisitions team at Google, excelling in business excellence and operational excellence with an ongoing focus on customer success.  As a Regional Sales Lead, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative business skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. In this role, you'll help your teams and partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You will take an analytical approach to sales management.  You will report directly to the Director of New Business Sales, APAC, and lead the sales team focused on acquiring new advertisers in Southeast Asia.  Responsibilities Grow and develop the acquisitions business to maximize the potential of the entire organization. Drive and execute organizational strategy to grow customer acquisitions for Southeast Asia. Analyze market trends, team performance, and clients' performance to sustain high-growth aspirations and drive continued productivity and performance improvements. Conduct regional business forecasts, pipeline management, demand generation, and strategy development. Manage the sales team members of Sales Managers and Account Executives to exceed business growth goals. Provide strategic thinking and exceptional business skills. Develop strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure a One Google business plan, while also being the external face of Google in many customer-facing events. Communicate effectively with English-speaking stakeholders and clients. Work with cross-functional teams (e.g. marketing, on-boarding, agency) to align and meet regional commitments for the New Business Sales team. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 12 years of sales management experience in technology Experience in people management and team leadership Ability to speak and write in English fluently Preferred Qualifications Experience in sales coaching and mentoring, delivering strategic business goals Strong communication skills with the ability to engage C-Level and provide executive account coverage Possess entrepreneurial and strategic problem solving skills with the ability to initiate and lead a regional virtual strategic cross-functional project in support of mid/long term business goals Strong operational discipline to ensure appropriate focus on the aspects of the business most critical to driving sustained growth
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description:  Get to know the team  You will be part of an exciting sales team that is responsible for acquiring, growing and managing the accounts of key merchants and partners for GrabPay in Singapore.  Day to day activities Manage a portfolio of accounts and gateway partners, responsible for developing and executing an engagement strategy to grow revenue, and drive merchant engagement to achieve set targets Strong engagement at account / partner level to prospect and build a strong pipeline of initiatives, implement, and track performance versus target Be quantitative, analytical, develop initiatives to increase revenues / profitability for your portfolio. Cross sell Grab’s services to merchants / partners Acquire new merchants in identified segments. Plan, manage, and track results of partnership events / initiatives, including post campaign analysis Collaborate and work across functions to deliver on partnership plans The must haves Experienced in sales and/or account management in financial services, technology or FMCG Self-motivated, results oriented, problem solver Confident, able to engage with senior executives Analytical skills, able to develop cogent business plans Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport with clients across all levels High energy, organized, and independent Bachelor degree, min. 8 years of work experience (min. 5 years of relevant sales / AM experience)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: We are currently looking for a Sales Account Executive with the right energy, competitive spirit, and personal drive to be the leading force that fuels our growing client relationships in our Australian & Singapore markets. Working in a defined geographic territory, you will proactively engage with targeted companies, as well as follow up and close on various sources of inbound leads.  The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities by using a consultative approach to selling and use their expertise to identify prospects, build meaningful customer relationships and drive momentum across multiple opportunities by guiding prospective clients on their Spend Management journey.  Key responsibilities:  Create client demos/ presentations, quotes/ proposals, and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) Craft an innovative sales pitch to explain product and service capabilities, and initiate the sales process by scheduling appointments and make initial presentations Represent Volopay in all customer-facing engagements, traveling to customers’ locations as required (post covid) and engaging at all levels of an organization Manage the complete and complex sales cycles often presenting to C-level executives the value and ROI/Business Case of Volopay Utilize Hubspot CRM to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs understanding account requirements Educating prospective customers on the value of products and services to create growth & engagement opportunities Understand customer’s requirements accurately and communicate with the team internally stating needs, problems, use cases, more  Understand the competitive landscape. Identify new opportunities leveraging your own creativity to engage customer prospects for conversions Develop your own vertical/territory plan and a pipeline that will fuel the ongoing growth of your business Strive to continuously improve your sales process and demonstrate a willingness to learn and implement best practices Collaborating with management on sales goals, planning, and forecasting; maintaining short and long-term business development plans.  Qualifications:  Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience’s needs Minimum 2 years of quota-carrying SaaS / b2b software sales experience as an Inside sales representative selling into the SG market to SMEs & mid-market clients. Successful track record managing complex deals from demo presentation to closing and actively engaging. Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. CRM experience preferred. Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment. Strong customer references. Experience managing the sales cycle, closing the deal with the decision-makers with demonstrated skill at negotiating business terms.  If you enjoy solving complex problems, work effectively with cross-functional teams, and thrive in a constantly evolving landscape, then this opportunity will be exciting for you. Additional benefits with this role involve – Constant Learning & Development support towards individual needs, flexibility with timings, and opportunity to uncover emerging trends. We observe multiple industry players and their products, and thus you will be always working on some new challenge.

Hi, I’m Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative (Thai speaking) to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you’re applying, you’ll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio’s, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.   At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will:  Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers  Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors  Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there’s always something new to learn.  You are...  An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You’re looking to work with a team of high performers where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren’t in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don’t throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win.  Valuable experiences and skills you’ll bring to Puppet  Preferred 1 years of work or internship experience in lead generation, sales, business, operations, marketing, or related Proven track record of achieving measurable goals Avid technology evangelist  Bonus, but not required  Sales Development, customer service, or account management experience for a SaaS or B2B solution Language skills (Thai)  Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM Experience with Salesloft. Best practices and applicability Cold-calling experience a plus  We are hiring at various experience levels and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!  *Visa Sponsorship Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.  About Puppet Puppet’s core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn’t stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet’s open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.  As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you’d thrive in, why not say hello?  Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees!  Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.  Please see Puppet's privacy policy here.

description: Lynk is the best place to seek, build and share credible human expertise. We power the new knowledge economy. Our Knowledge-as-a-Service platform unlocks the insights, experience and expertise of experts from around the world, helping people and companies make informed decisions. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, leading investment houses, global family offices, top professional services firms, governments and other organizations. We have been a member of the World Economic Forum since 2019, and we have also formed a Global Alliance with UBS.  We are looking for an experienced people manager to rapidly grow our Southeast Asia Client Solutions team in Singapore. The SEA Regional lead will also be responsible for growing our business across SEA with high focus on Singapore.  What You’ll Do Manage a regional Client Solutions team of 20+ team members across offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, and Vietnam with the aim of providing the best client experience Grow our SEA team as we ramp up hiring for your team in Singapore. Mentor, train and manage new joiners at a rapid pace to meet our increasing client demand Collaborate with multiple departments (sales, marketing, talent acquisition, tech) to ensure the proper execution of the company’s vision and initiatives across SEA Network with our client base in SEA and conduct regular meetings with senior client stakeholders based in Singapore Lead demand generation efforts and collaborate with the marketing team to engage our client base across SEA with thoughtful marketing content Lead productivity growth efforts in the region by closely monitoring data, identifying trends, and deriving solution-focused insights through effective people management and data analysis Work with the product team to be the voice of the customer and proactively lead the adoption of our suite of tech products across our client base in SEA Ensure that team members are actively developing a granular understanding of our clients’ companies/sector coverage in order to build meaningful long-term relationships Experience Required For This Role Minimum 8 years of work experience with 2 or more years of experience in the expert network industry is required for this role Must have experience in a regional leadership role. SEA is preferred Prior experience hiring, training and managing large teams (15+ people) that work across different regional offices is essential An established network among our client base across SEA (consulting firms, investment banks, hedge funds, private equity,venture capital firms) Self starter with experience building business operations in a fast paced environment.. Proven track record in increasing productivity and managing organizational change Results oriented, and driven to meet aggressive targets as the role has considerable topline responsibility Experience in managing cross functional projects and working collaboratively with various departments to achieve company objectives Experience using and deploying CRM Systems (eg. Hubspot) Good communication skills as you will regularly meet and engage clients through in-person and remote meetings Emotional intelligence and a penchant for connecting people Self-disciplined and capable of identifying and completing critical tasks independently and with a sense of urgency A masters degree in business is highly preferred Familiarity with SaaS business models is a plus What We Commit To You Competitive remuneration package in a rapidly-expanding growth stage global company An environment that respects diversity and inclusion Comprehensive medical insurance coverage The opportunity to travel and work around the globe with our international clients and growing number of offices (Hong Kong, Shanghai, Singapore, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Manila, Ho Chi Minh, New York City, Toronto) Notes LYNK employees are prohibited from trading Restricted Securities (defined as any security whose performance is linked to a single company) on any Personal Trading Account. All future new joiners are required to undergo a background check. Lynk is an equal opportunities employer.

description: About Nimbly (hellonimbly.com)  A mobile solution that automates workflows, improving efficiency and generating cost savings by providing data-driven insights from field operations remotely and in real-time. Built by passionate founders and VC-backed, Nimbly enables best-in-class companies like KFC, 7-Eleven, Under Armour, and Cargill to be more agile, deploying digital routines for its front liners to deliver consistency of product quality and customer experience.  Nimbly is looking for a results-driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) and we are OPEN to experience.  Having recently secured Pre-Series A funding Nimbly is currently in a growth mode and is looking for hungry and high performing SDRs to join our growing sales team in Singapore, Jakarta and Bangalore, India and help us raise the bar on quality and gain more market share.   What you will do here?  Partner with the business to identify market potential by qualifying accounts Initiates sales process by scheduling appointments, making sales presentations, and understanding account requirements Conduct research on target markets to identify key players for new accounts Close sales by building rapport with the potential account, explaining product and service capabilities, and preparing contracts Maintain relationships with existing leads by and establish new engagement with prospects   Role Requirements  Minimum 1-2 years experience in any Sales Development Representative, Business Development, B2B Sales, or Inside Sales role Familiar with the F&B/FMCG/Retail/Manufacturing or Agriculture industries is ideal but we are OPEN to other industry experience Excellent presentation and communication skills Prior experience in SaaS/startup industry will be preferred Fluency in English is a must (both verbal and written) Fast learner and target-oriented mindset   Benefits at Nimbly  Competitive net salary and private insurance Remote work with flexible working hours Dynamic and fun working environment
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Industrial Automation

description: Account Executive Job Description  Who are we? Verra Asia is a go-to-market advisory firm based in Singapore, with a focus on helping clients of all sizes scale their operations through sales and marketing best practices. Established in 2018, we have helped clients across many industries implement processes, execute campaigns, and supercharge their growth.  As a fast-growing business, we believe in being purposeful for our clients by empowering our people to do their best work, and to always be the best advocates for the clients we serve.  What is the role? As an Account Executive, you will be involved in managing cross-functional client projects — across strategy, communications, branding, digital marketing, marketing analytics, and creative development. You will also collaborate with Verra Asia’s subject matter experts, as well as our partners, to manage clients’ expectations, derive meaningful insights, and identify opportunities, and communicate this on a regular cadence.  You will be responsible for ensuring that deliverables are aligned to our clients’ objectives while maintaining an open channel of communication to troubleshoot risks and concerns that may arise. As an Account Executive, you are dependable and client-facing, possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills and can demonstrate exceptional time-management and organisational skills.   To be successful as an Account Executive you must understand the importance of accountability, be passionate about building strong advisor relationships, and constantly challenge the status-quo to recommend bespoke solutions.   What will I do? · Act as a key link between Verra Asia and our clients. Including, but not limited to addressing their queries, reporting performance, anticipating issues, and prioritising on-time delivery of projects. · Assist in dissecting our clients’ business objectives and developing plans to achieve them. · Work collaboratively with a team of performance marketers, digital marketers, creative teams, and content developers, to manage punctual delivery of quality work. · Prepare progress reports, project timelines, and periodical reviews with clients. · Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to life to be an effective advocate for our clients  Who are you? · Driven to always deliver your best work. · Excellent interpersonal and communication (written and verbal skills). · Curious, creative, and consultative. · A sense of humour with a knack for whacky ideas. · Strong stakeholder management skills, tactful and effective with differences of opinions. · Influential and collaborative, internally and externally. · Strong project management skills. · High attention to detail, proactive and task-oriented. · Excellent presentation skills. Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel. · Diploma or Degree in Advertising, Marketing, MassComm, Business Administration or related fields preferred. · At least 3 years relevant hands-on experience in an in-house marketing, agency or client-facing role.  Verra Asia’s culture is driven by shared passion and commitment to always providing our clients with quality and timely work. We are a team of growth-minded people who believe that great ideas can come from anywhere (or anyone). We’re looking for someone with high energy, and who is not afraid to fail fast, and learn fast.  A snapshot of Verra Asia:  1. We have lives outside of work.  Family and friends who keep us sane. With hobbies like drawing, photography, gyming, walking our dog and anime to keep us alive and thrilled outside of working hours.  2. We value inputs, and are always willing to try. We're not perfect, but we want great people with big hearts and courage to experiment, succeed and fail.   3. Rules and SOPs? Nope. If you want a structure and rules, we're definitely not for you. We are, however, a place where order brings freedom to create, innovate and thrive.  If you are interested in being part of our team, drop me an e-mail at czaraim@verraasia.com

Job Description:  Get to know the team:  The Singapore Operations team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.  As part of the Singapore Operations team, the GrabFood team looks at connecting Singapore eaters and customers to the vast array of merchants (from the familiar favorites to the up and coming stars) within our sunny island-home of Singapore, through our many delivery-partners.  Get to know the role:  As a Merchant Account Manager, you will be responsible in establishing and managing strong business relationships with existing and potential top 500 relationships to drive growth for GrabFood. You will lead all elements of business identification, strategy, partnerships, account management, and execution strategy.  The day-to-day activities: Working with the Account Management Lead and Head of Merchant on GrabFood business development strategy Drive growth in key accounts as measured by deliveries and GMV End to end deal managing (including working with country BD, transport, operations, marketing, and product ensure the success of the partnership) Develop strong relationships with key partners that fit into our go-to-market strategy Evaluate strategic and partnership opportunities, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses Work across functions to tailor merchant specific needs (e.g. customized reporting, marketing support, integrations) Drive operational excellence by working with the merchants and operations teams The must haves: Bachelor (or above) degree in Business/ Management or equivalent Minimum 4-6 years (for account manager role) or experience in sales, business development, partnerships or equivalent role Experience in F&B industry is a plus Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify and provide comprehensive solutions for varying customer needs Ability to fuse business, strategy, finance and legal concepts to lead complex, multi-faceted deals Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Have a competitive edge and thrive in a team environment Be very organized and communicate well
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About the Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated Corporate Sales Associate to support our Corporate Team and to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel.  The right candidate isn’t afraid of striking up a conversation with someone they just met. You're a master at market research, and aren't afraid to strike up a conversation with someone new. This role is ideal for someone who’s a couple of years into their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.  Key Responsibilities  Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls, emails and SDR set up meetings Research, prospect and engage new small to medium corporate partners in ClassPass markets Continue developing understanding of HR/Benefits world and how ClassPass fits in Manage your own opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Drive through the full sales cycle by making/sending introductory calls and emails, assessing and building the relationship, performing sales presentations and closing the deal. Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways in which you connect and build out your relationships with potential clients and share across the team Attend various industry events and conferences including hosting stands Achieve, and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Collaborate with the Corporate Account Management team to ensure the smooth onboarding of a corporate partner Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics  Skills & Experience  A natural problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals Strong relationship builder; comfortable and confident with a wide range of decision makers (internal and external) A natural negotiator with a passion for results A natural relationship builder with the ability to collaborate Willingness to make multiple sales calls and email contacts per day Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multi-task, prioritise, and manage time effectively Right to work in Singapore  Who we are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What we believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people. ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.
industries: Consumer Services, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Internet

description: JOB PURPOSE    To be the "ambassador" who conveys the Brand's philosophy and values. As such, to be responsible to maximize the sales performance by fostering the relationship with the customers and developing their Brand loyalty, providing a unique experience in our store and guiding the client into our world.    RESPONSIBILITIES    Welcome and serve the customer providing an excellent in-store experience at all times. Maintain and develop client relationships through an individual approach, leveraging also on CRM and digital tools. Be proactively engaged in cross selling with all Departments and maximizes sales opportunity in order to achieve individual sales target and KPIs. Ensure to be up-to-date knowing fashion trends and competitors. Prove Brand and product knowledge. Deal effectively with customer complaints by liaising with the line manager when necessary. Ensure and maintain the shop floor and visual display high standard, complying with Company operational guidelines and stock procedures. Contribute to ensure a high level of security and is attentive to prevent product thefts.    KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS    Passion for human relations and sales  Problem solving, curiosity and interest in luxury/fashion, art and design  Experience of building a long-lasting relationship with clients  Being able to work in team as well as alone  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Passion and knowledge of the managed product category  English language is a must and Mandarin is a plus
industries: Apparel & Fashion and Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Due to growth plans across the entire APJ region, we are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join our thriving Singapore team.  WE ARE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH: 8+ years of field sales experience preferred with an emphasis on data, data analytics, database (SQL & NoSQL), ETL, or business intelligence. Proven ability to independently manage, develop, and close new client relationships. A track record of pro-actively building business in the Enterprise market. Proven success in driving consistent activity, pipeline development and quota achievement. Experience determining customer requirements and presenting appropriate solutions. Pro-active, independent thinking and a high energy/positive attitude. Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. BA/BS preferred.  ABOUT YOU: Enthusiastic, self-motivated, and positive attitude with a passion for building customer relationships and closing new business opportunities. The Account Executive must have the confidence and ability to negotiate and close agreements with Clients and support new customers through our on-boarding process. You are driven to exceed performance objectives. You are excited about being positioned right in the middle of the exploding cloud based economy and to develop and maintain a highly desired knowledge of Snowflake’s solutions. You have an understanding of the Cloud application/computing space along with familiarity with data warehouse or analytic technologies. You are familiar with a solution-based approach to selling, have experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills. You have superb organisation and contact management capabilities. You are driven to achieve your mission and you love bringing the team together to achieve results together.  Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?
industries: Computer Software

description: The Regional Account Manager reports to the company founder and director (ex-eCommerce Architect at Razer and ex-Digital Marketing Manager at Unilever) and plays a key role in driving acquisition and retention of our B2B service offerings in providing customised learning solutions that bridge skills gaps and drive culture change. This is a role for aspiring sales engineers who wish to work close to the tech and adult education industry with clients/partners like GovTech, Maxis and Amazon.  The ideal candidate would be someone who has a few years of Sales, Customer Success, Business Development and/or Account Servicing experience. This is a hands-on role which requires excellent written/spoken communication and problem solving skills. We are looking for someone perceptive and thoughtful who can hold a meaningful conversation and negotiate with a VP level executive   We are a small and fast moving technology-enabled Education startup in Singapore and Malaysia. Only experienced candidates with at least 3 years of relevant experience will be interviewed. Relevant experience includes Enterprise/SMB Sales, CRM, Events and Partnerships.  This role is only open to Singaporeans/PR and Malaysian applicants who have experience working remotely. Professional language competency in Cantonese, Bahasa Melayu or German preferred.   Modest base salary with generous commissions and bonuses.  The account manager will be involved in: Qualify, nurture and manage up to 20 accounts in the APAC region (including Maxis and clients through our partner Amazon Web Services) [30%] Maintain a high volume of business development activity including outbound calls, emails and social selling (e.g. virtual/physical events) with a focus on generating new business within our existing customers & new prospects with our marketing team. [20%] Build strong relationships with customers and prospects through delivery of online and in person sales presentations, illustrating strong product knowledge and solution selling best practices. [15%] Update digital and physical sales kit and monitor our competitive offerings to SMBs and Enterprises. [10%] Strategically prioritise and target key accounts and sectors to close new business, leveraging marketing support team, software automation tools (e.g. Copper CRM) and LinkedIn Sales Navigator. [15%]  In 30 days, you will learn our solution selling process to enterprise and SMEs and craft engagement opportunities for business development.  In 60 days, you will be running through our combined leads of existing contacts and executing an account based management (ABM) strategy while kick starting community events.  In 120 days, you would have created a systemic sales engine and won your first few enterprise clients for CuriousCore and generated extra sales commission for yourself.  Specific Responsibilities: Identify and prioritise key accounts and prospects to build effective sales relationships. Maintain records of contact with Enterprise & SMB clients with their needs and any further actions that may be required. Provide details and negotiate on the terms of sales. Respond effectively to the client's queries and objections, and disseminate information about clients and their buying needs promptly and accurately to relevant people within the organisation. Apply critical, conceptual and systems thinking to assist in the process of designing learning solutions and client interventions for change to happen. Conduct stakeholder interviews and manage customer success with key clients and accounts. Develop proposals in accordance with the organisation's standards and guidelines. Develop and deploy relevant presentation aids, materials and examples to facilitate the target audience's understanding of key concepts and ideas of our unique change management process. Empathise with our clients and prospects organisation challenges and ambitions for change while being a good learning solutions partner. Evaluate the products and services for potential improvements that may lead to growth in sales or market size. Develop client service plans to support customers. Handle client's feedback and provide suitable sales solutions to maintain and enhance relationships with customers. Identify and assess the marketing opportunities and threats to the organisation. Use social selling strategies and software tools to drive greater results and better value for prospects and clients.  Staff Perks (more than $5000 in annual benefits): Free access to our monthly virtual training course on UX design and video learning Free access to LinkedIn Learning and Udemy courses that are beneficial to your duties Work from home at least two days a week $250 WFH budget (one-time) Company sponsored lunch every 2 weeks  AIA Medical Insurance with GP and Specialist cover $500/year Mental Health Subsidy for Therapy, Wellness and Dental services not insured $3000/year learning and self-development subsidy Quarterly Team Day offsite retreat 14-day paid annual leave Discretionary 13th month annual bonus (commissions and individual performance bonus disbursed separately) Work in Somerset, Orchard area in a vibrant co-working space with a fully stocked pantry  What you will learn with us: Business Environment Analysis Business Negotiation  Interpersonal Skills  Business Opportunities Development  Problem Solving  Customer Acquisition Management  Customer Relationship Management  Transdisciplinary Thinking  Cross Border Culture Communication Market Profiling  Market Research and Analysis  Networking  Partnership & Community Management  Product Advisory  Sales Strategy  Sales Target Management  Stakeholder Management  Design & Systems Thinking Social and Solution Selling Learn how to be an effective executive and team player through performance management frameworks like OKRs and Agile principles. We constantly strive to be a high-performing team that puts our people and customers first. -- Please send attach your CV and past writings/proposals/decks  * Note: Please share your favourite book and previous short courses attended in your application.

You will be working very closely with the Sales Director for the following responsibilities:  Generate new business through outbound prospecting, cold calling, leveraging networks, etc Drive the sales process: targeting top prospects, identifying solutions, conducting software demonstrations, negotiating and closing Act as a “solutions expert” consultant by helping prospects with their unique critical business issues and strategic initiatives, and feeding requirements back to the product owner for development Share ideas and new business development strategies Meet and exceed quarterly sales revenue goals (Making it rain!)  Requirements: Highly competitive, strong work ethic and teamwork Experience and / or comfortable with cold calling Demonstrated track record in closing new business (contract sizes between $15-30K), exceeding sales targets and willing to accept aggressive commission pay Willing to adopt a performance-based sales model by tracking critical sales metrics and keeping CRM updated daily (knowledge of Hubspot CRM is a plus) Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to deliver powerful presentations and product demos. Comfortable with technology systems, Internet applications, and the ability to interact with senior level leaders. Ability to pivot and adapt to ever changing market and business needs.  About EngageRocket EngageRocket is one of the top 20 Hottest Startups in Singapore and the fastest-growing Asian employee experience and performance software. A software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, EngageRocket helps leaders and organisations make better people decisions using real-time data. We automate employee feedback and analytics to deliver management insight that improves employee experience and performance.  EngageRocket has doubled its user base and grew its enterprise customer segment by over four times in the past 12 months. Today the cloud-based software company has analyzed over two million employees’ answers across 20 industries and 14 markets, from leading companies such as Starhub, Tokopedia, Mediacorp, Sephora, and Singapore Power.

Lucence is a precision oncology company that invents ultrasensitive blood-testing technology for early cancer detection and treatment selection. Our vision is a world where cancer is overcome by early detection and informed treatment.  Join us in bringing innovative diagnostics to more people by being part of our sales operations as a Sales Support Executive.  Key responsibilities:  Supporting the sales team in their daily sales operations in order to meet company business goals and sales targets.  Managing all sales-related administrative tasks and duties such as handling of customer queries, preparation of sample kits and order forms for customers. Delivering excellent customer support and developing trusted relationships with various key stakeholders.  Supporting the sales team in developing new businesses with existing customers and lead generation for new business opportunities.  Identifying inefficiencies and roadblocks in sales processes and executing improvements for more efficient delivery of sales support.   Tracking the progress of monthly/quarterly sales initiatives for internal reporting. Any other ad hoc duties as necessary (e.g. organization of seminars).   To be a good fit for this role, you would have:  Minimally a Nitec in business administration, science, or a related field.  Prior working experience in sales support and coordination would be advantageous.  Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.  Flexibility to attend to customer support and operational matters beyond usual working hours. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to multitask, while maintaining sharp attention to detail.

About Xccelerate We are a high-growth edtech company, on a mission to accelerate the human race and grow all engines to achieve our vision of solving human capital development challenges across Asia by reinventing life-long learning and education-to-employment+employability solutions.  As we continue to expand our presence globally, our Singapore office is now looking for a Business Development Executive.  About Role Role                  :    Business Development Executive Reporting to  :    Country Manager, SEA Venue              :    Singapore, home-based (until we have confirmed our workspace) with weekly/bi-weekly f2f meeting   Primary Objectives a) Grant submissions b) Lead generation c) Solutioning  a) Grant submissions - Ownership of government funding submissions, starting from SG and eventually rest of SEA - Understand requirements for different available grants, liaison with the needed agencies/vendors, preparing the necessary information, seeing the process to completion - This objective will be a key priority of this role especially in the first months of joining ·        Success means – Xccelerate’s courses attaining accreditation status and qualifying for grants across all available funding programs  b) Lead generation - Create leads for sales team to follow up in SEA across Xccelerate’s product suite - Prepare and deliver collateral for marketing outreach ·        Success means – Consistent lead generation, regular client-marketing updates  c) Solutioning - Work with Sales on client’s requirements and structure proposals - Liaison with Product team and vendors to develop content for clients - Liaison with Engineering to grow our platform offerings (as needed) - Search, qualify and liaison for new trainers and vendors regionally ·        Success means – Producing quality and timely proposals for projects  We Are Looking For Degree in any discipline Must have a flair for writing Understand training and curriculum structure Some digital marketing knowhow will be advantageous Mix of market research and outreach Willing to learn and get hands dirty in all aspects of the business 3-5 years experience preferred Desired traits - (A.B.C.D.E.F.) Adaptable, Bold, Creative, Disciplined, Ernest, Fast   This is one of our first hires in SEA and absolutely integral to our regional success. A challenging and demanding role - definitely fulfilling, ultimately rewarding. If this sounds like you, reach out and Xccelerate with us!

description: Division: Abbott Core Diagnostics  Primary Job Function  To profitably grow APAC ACD business cross country assigned Landmark Accounts through the development of high-level business relationships, strategies and execution of aligned tactics that ultimately closes business and grows Abbott’s market share.  Core Job Responsibilities  Responsible for selling ACD ‘total solutions” to Cross Country APAC Landmark Accounts focused on new business and retention of current customers, so as to generate profitable and sustainable growth that satisfies customers’ expectations. Establishes and builds key stakeholder relationships inside and outside the laboratory and leverages them in driving new profitable sales in the ‘core lab’ and helping to protect current business. Seen as the customer’s Resourceful Advocate and trusted business partner. Leads an internal cross-functional ‘selling team’ (country EAMs, SE, Ambassadors , TSDs, project managers, others) to execute a strategic account plan for each APAC Landmark cross country customer; coordinates ACD activities across entire customer network to maximize profitable growth.  Provides leadership (non-reports) of the Abbott Diagnostics team and coordinates activities when required.Negotiates for resources, plans and executes activities for the long term and sustainable growth of Abbott Diagnostics, aligned with its corporate strategy.  Responsible for overall account management, including uncovering a large complex organization’s strategic long-term plan and translating into a winning solution for ACD; oversees detailed account planning and sales forecasting (monthly and annual); negotiates contracts and all pricing resulting in long-term commitments.Utilizes and models Abbott’s best practice selling, strategic planning and management tools. Has a strategic plan to amplify and protect existing customers through clear value expansion activities including regular Business reviews. Working with customer experience teams, ensures customer satisfaction through a well developed and executed loyalty plan.  Provides organizational leadership, commercial development of teams and individuals through coaching and mentoring.  Supervisory/Management Responsibilities  Leadership of Landmark Cross APAC accounts/opportunity teams. No direct reports  Position Accountability / Scope  Appointed APAC Landmark Cross Country Accounts  Minimum Education A degree in Science, Laboratory Medicine and/or business studies A post-graduate MBA or equivalent will be highly regarded. Minimum Experience/Training Required Significant (>10 Years) successful sales/commercial experience in complex, multilevel, multisite selling environments. Pathology/Diagnostics/Healthcare market highly desirable Minimum Skills Required Ability to liaise with customer executives to achieve objectives. Demonstrated leadership and team management Excellent communication, negotiation, commercial, influencing and strategic planning skills. English at Business Level communication Quality, Safety & Environmental Responsibilities Attend regular departmental meetings with manager/supervisor to build in continuous feedback mechanisms. Meet the requirements of ISO and Class A by complying with all relevant Quality policies and procedures to ensure the Quality objectives of the business are met. Job Description:  Life at Grab:  At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.  The Singapore Operations team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.  As part of the Singapore Operations team, the GrabFood team looks at connecting Singapore eaters and customers to the vast array of merchants (from the familiar favorites to the up and coming stars) within our sunny island-home of Singapore, through our many delivery-partners.  Get to know the role:  As a Merchant Account Manager, you will be responsible in establishing and managing strong business relationships with existing and potential top 500 relationships to drive growth for GrabFood. You will lead all elements of business identification, strategy, partnerships, account management, and execution strategy.  The day-to-day activities: Working with the Account Management Lead and Head of Merchant on GrabFood business development strategy Drive growth in key accounts as measured by deliveries and GMV End to end deal managing (including working with country BD, transport, operations, marketing, and product ensure the success of the partnership) Develop strong relationships with key partners that fit into our go-to-market strategy Evaluate strategic and partnership opportunities, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses Work across functions to tailor merchant specific needs (e.g. customized reporting, marketing support, integrations) Drive operational excellence by working with the merchants and operations teams The must haves: Bachelor (or above) degree in Business/ Management or equivalent Minimum 4-6 years (for account manager role) or experience in sales, business development, partnerships or equivalent role Experience in F&B industry is a plus Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify and provide comprehensive solutions for varying customer needs Ability to fuse business, strategy, finance and legal concepts to lead complex, multi-faceted deals Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Have a competitive edge and thrive in a team environment Be very organized and communicate well We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workpace that enables all Grabbers to perfom at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.  Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

AccelerAsia provides fast growing technology companies from Europe, Israel and the US with a suite of growth services to help them expand their businesses into APAC and ensure long term success in this region. We have offices in Singapore, Bangkok, Jakarta and Melbourne, a team of highly experienced international business builders and a well-established network in the region. Over the past 11 years we have created a unique culture and a very successful business that has helped dozens of companies build their business in these parts of the world.   We are looking for an enthusiastic and driven Sales Development Representative to join our Sales Development Team.   This position focuses on feeding the top of the sales funnel and you will play a key role in finding prospects and qualifying them, before passing them on to Senior Business Development Managers and Business Development Directors. This involves researching companies, identifying the key decision makers and generating leads through cold outreach such as cold calling and social platforms (LinkedIn).   The right candidate has at least 1 to 3 years of SDR experience, is passionate in digital technology, enthusiastic, smart, sales driven, able to focus and eager to learn.  Key Duties: Enthusiastic about enterprise software Ability to grasp the business needs of AccelerAsia’s client(s), be able to think on your feet, and possess the drive to become solution/product experts Outbound prospecting, cold calling to hunt for new leads for AccelerAsia’s client(s) and meeting daily minimum quota/targets Qualify inbound leads from regular marketing campaigns and follow up with leads who have attended events, with the aim of booking meetings Develop and maintain a high-quality lead funnel  Qualify leads using a structured sales methodology Work closely with Senior Business Development Managers and Business Development Directors to support in developing and implementing appropriate prospecting strategies and plans Maintain high level of CRM hygiene by ensuring all customer interactions from LinkedIn messages, calls and emails are updated and recorded in our CRM   Key Skills: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Excellent management of the top of sales funnel Solid commercial acumen; the ability to spot opportunities in the territory  A proactive, service-oriented attitude towards AccelerAsia’s client(s) and prospects Self-starter and autonomous Ideally 1 to 3 years experience software Sales Development  On Offer: Good remuneration package includes performance based variable compensation Medical  Strong Culture driven by AccelerAsia’s values Flexible working hours and uncapped annual leave Opportunities for internal growth within or beyond Sales Development

Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the Shopkeeper of the respective Home Furnishing department, the Sales Associate provides excellent sales service to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction, ensuring the IKEA basic merchandising standards are met to give customers a positive shopping experience.  Your job scope Ensuring high level of customers’ satisfaction by assessing customers’ needs, providing information and assistance when required. Ensuring your department is clean and tidy, with items properly displayed, priced and fully stocked. Actively steering top selling and prioritized products to maximize sales. Qualifications You are customer-service oriented and passionate about driving business You are a problem-solver, independent worker and a strong team player You have strong communication and interpersonal skills You are physically fit to handle physical work and retail hours You have passion for Home furnishing and Life at home details. Additional Information  Please apply by 31 October 2021

description: At Aiven, we turn top Open-Source data technologies into frustration-free cloud services to serve the needs of customers of all sizes. Today, we offer eight fully-managed services - Apache Kafka, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis, InfluxDB and Grafana that work across major cloud providers such as Google, Amazon, Azure, Digital Ocean and more.   Aiven in a nutshell:   We are open-source and cloud experts Our platform delivers bulletproof data ops Global service footprint & support organization Security in our DNA 500+ customers in 50+ countries $150M in VC funding   We are looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join the Aiven Sales team to help develop and qualify out- and inbound opportunities. You will be instrumental in directing leads into the appropriate conversion path while increasing pipeline velocity.   The successful candidate will use creativity and persistence to continuously improve performance as measured by key metrics. They will be familiar with working cross-functionally to promote and sell technical products to sophisticated prospects.    What you'll be doing:   Research, contact, and qualify prospects and MQL Develop and execute messaging strategy to build SQL pipeline Experiment with various outreach methods and sequences Participate in outbound activities including cold calling Document lead interactions and create handoff process Maintain contact with marketing Use results to document SDR best practices  Requirements:  1+ years of experience building, developing, and qualifying sales pipelines CRM and marketing automation experience, Salesforce / Pardot a plus Experience using various methods to establish contact with prospects Demonstrated experience developing effective messaging strategies Fluent in English language, both written and spoken Experience working within cross-functional teams Background in working within tech industry  Benefits:  We are proud of our supportive and pragmatic organizational culture. We are solution-oriented, and at the same time we cultivate an environment of trust and diversity where everyone can strive for excellence.    Besides our people and culture, at Aiven you'll have   A dynamic environment in a rapidly growing, international business Highly experienced colleagues from a variety of backgrounds Flexible working hours, including remote working when needed Ability to choose the devices and tools that make you work the best Mobile phone and subscription Participation in employee stock option plan  You will be part of a highly-skilled, tight-knit and growing team, making your contribution essential to what is becoming a truly unique success story. If you're interested, send us your application and we'll take it from there.   Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes.   Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. description: Careers That Change Lives  As a global leader in medical technology, services and solutions, Medtronic improves the health and lives of millions of people each year. We believe our deep clinical, therapeutic and economic expertise can help address the complex challenges – such as rising costs, aging populations and the burden of chronic disease – faced by families and healthcare systems today. But we can’t do it alone. That’s why we’re committed to partnering in new ways and developing powerful solutions that deliver better patient outcomes.  Founded in 1949 as a medical repair company, we're now among the world's largest medical technology, services and solutions companies, employing more than 85,000 people worldwide, serving physicians, hospitals and patients in more than 160 countries. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.  A Day in the Life  Sales Operation Coordinator Provides administrative support to the sales function such as preparing sales and/or expense forecasts, budgets and quotas; coordinating sales meetings; ensuring all sponsorship (HCP training & 3rd party event) / Donation raised are compliant with the company’s directions Arranging quarterly shift schedule Update data and reports on the spending in excel file Record each case support from spine team for marketing analysis work. Prepares shift allowances, weekend reimbursement claims for quarterly submission to HR Provide accrual for invoice request by finance monthly. Support MedEd request as and when for HCP training, sales rep training, including packing and shipment of instrument sets Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree required 0 years of experience required Nice to Have: Bachelor’s Degree in any disciplines with 3-5 years of experiences working in sales or marketing support function. Positive attitude and agility Knowledge in SAP Good in Microsoft Excel Able to work in fast-paced environment About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 30, 2021 Travel: No

description: Darktrace is rapidly expanding due to unprecedented growth and accelerating revenue. We are looking for ambitious and driven candidates with previous B2B sales experience to join our vibrant, friendly and fast paced Inside Sales team based at our Singapore offices.  You’ll be working in a high growth sector and will be well rewarded for your efforts with uncapped commission. You will be provided with extensive training and support from your mentors and team leader.  Day-to-day you’ll be: Sharing your passion for cyber security whilst making outbound calls and setting appointments Researching and contacting decision makers Providing regular metrics and reports Following up on prospects and booking meetings after events Inviting VIP guests to events  You’ll likely have: A minimum of 1 – 2 years’ previous experience of cold calling outbound sales – showing us your enthusiasm and drive for a career in sales Clear communication skills, able to be compelling with a variety of individuals Resilience and tenacity – you will be able to bounce back and carry on  More about us: Darktrace’s mission is to make the world more secure in the face of targeted threats and evolving, machine-speed attacks. Our award winning technology applies cutting-edge machine learning and mathematics to the field of cyber-security. By augmenting human security teams and autonomously detecting and responding to attacks, Darktrace’s Cyber AI Platform reduces the risks of data theft and technology disruption that organizations face on a daily basis.  Founded in 2013, Darktrace currently has over 1,500 worldwide employees spread across over 40 countries. The technical hub and headquarters are located in Cambridge, UK, with a US headquarters in San Francisco, CA.  This is an excellent opportunity to join a fast-growing company that was recently named one of Fast Company’s 50 ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’.  For more information on our cutting edge products and company please visit our website www.darktrace.com
