description: About Us  Vermillion Lifestyle is a sumptuously curated B2B online marketplace representing the best of Asian design across diversified luxury retail + consumer lifestyle categories. We aim to increase the reach + influence of Asian designers to become globally recognized brands + to solve sourcing headaches for professional buyers + retailers. We are powered by big data, local vendor relationships, passion for heritage, crafts, design, and storytelling; and the joy of discovering + creating new cultural interpretations.  Job Description  We are seeking ambitious and outgoing individuals with a passion for luxury Asian design to join as Business Development Associate / Executive in our growing team. Your mission will be to:  Identify top lifestyle product brand candidates across Asia. Execute business strategy, planning, new brands outreach + onboarding. Write and deliver client presentations. Pitch our platform and services to potential brands and customers; secure contracts and deliver projects including overseeing operational details.  Set up operations in Singapore, under supervision of the General Manager, e.g., working with logistics partners. Uphold exceptional in-house taste level, assortment quality control, partnership management, while helping to drive cost savings + value-add for clients.  This role is an excellent opportunity to make an impact at an early-stage startup, as well as learn by doing across a range of functions.  Responsibilities Candidates may apply to one of two tracks:  1)     Content Marketing/Brand Management Track: support all the editorial content and copywriting on our website, research and reach out to new brands, work closely with our brand partners during onboarding/listing process and manage relationships. Responsibilities Research, pitch to, negotiate with, and onboard new brands throughout the region. Research + connect with new buyers; develop proposals + project-manage special client projects.  Partner closely across all Departments in HQ, including Merchandising, Marketing, Operations, Technology, Finance, Legal and Head of Regions in order to strategize, grow + execute various parts of our daily business. ‘Hunt’ down new consumer / retail trends, designers, brands + products, onboard + gather materials with our brand partners, to ensure all necessary details have been collected Continuously help to process, update and analyse brand and product materials to ensure data is accurately tracked across our internal systems. Work closely with Merchandising, Marketing + Sales teams to review brands portfolio regularly.  Lead cross-Departmental ‘special projects’, that will help us evolve our business strategy + achieve our investors’ target performance metrics.  2)     Corporate Finance/Data Analytics Track: support all the quantitative and analytical aspects of our vibrant startup, including but not limited to fundraising/investor pitching, financial modelling, data analytics & merchandise finance, accounting and payments etc.  Responsibilities Research, pitch to, negotiate with, and onboard new brands throughout the region Research + connect with new buyers; develop proposals + project-manage special client projects Partner closely across all Departments in HQ, including Merchandising, Marketing, Operations, Technology, Finance, Legal and Head of Regions in order to strategize, grow + execute various parts of our daily business. Support fundraising preparations with setting up data room, polishing investor pitch decks, preparing financial models Stay current on luxury and e-commerce industry trends, perform competitive analysis, compile and analyse sales and margin, partner with Merchandising and using financial analysis and identifying key business levers to drive sales and margin growth.  Assist senior management team to review + prepare pricing schedules, corporate budget + forecast + financial statements.  Compile cost benefit analysis to support investment proposals, continuously improve collection + interpretation of management information Lead cross-Departmental ‘special projects’, that will help us evolve our business strategy + achieve our investors’ target performance metrics.  Requirements Min. B.A./B.S. Degrees in Marketing, Computer Science, Finance, Economics or Accounting, Interior Design, Procurement, Graphics, UX, Interior Design, Journalism/ Communication strongly preferred Highly responsible and take ownership of work assigned, willing to take on new challenges Fluency for written + verbal communications in English and one other regional language Strong business savvy + analytical skills, a pro-active, thoughtful, creative problem solver Highly adaptable generalist + proven ability to learn quickly on-the-go, with an entrepreneurial, analytical + agile mindset, eager to roll-up sleeves + execute in-person Cross-disciplinary passion intersecting between arts, design, business + e-commerce Existing curiosity for global market trends, competition, brands, merchandising, pricing, sourcing, production, packaging, logistics across different product categories Willingness to work in a fast-paced, creative, mostly remote working environment Confident + articulate negotiating skills, comfortable with cold-calling, willing to do whatever it will take to ‘make it work’ Proficient in Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, Excel. Media editing software skills is a plus Based in Singapore

AlphaLoan is a FinTech company from Taiwan. We aim to strengthen and deepen the accuracy and utilization rate of AlphaLoan's loan comparison network. We specialize in data-driven online financial services and hold the leading online personal loan comparison website. Now we are ready to provide our well-established loan comparison site to the Singapore market.  Are you looking to be a part of an influential company in the Fintech industry and contribute to the financial comparison revolution? Together, we help each other make the loan process easier. Up for the challenge? Join us today!  THE ROLE  You will support company business growth and strategic KPIs, and report to the Senior BD Manager and the Head of Commercial. Build up relationships with key partners to penetrate developing and maintaining partnerships with Singapore’s largest banks, finance firms, and insurers. You will be in charge of providing insights and analytical reports for the business partners in banks, finance firms, and insurers. You will be a key part of the business strategy and have the opportunity to run the Singapore team in the near future. You will help Singapore consumers to build healthier financial lives and to get the best financial deals.  YOUR TASK  Build and manage relationships with Singapore’s leading financial institutions.  Create client strategy, actionable roadmap, and identify new business growth opportunities through daily interaction with clients and regular business planning. In charge of the whole business development process, including new client prospecting, structure and negotiation of commercial deals, client onboarding and continuous client support, regular business performance review, and up-sale.  Track the sales leads and diligently to get the always up-to-date status and provide regular reports to the management team.  SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS  University graduate with work experience and proven success in creating sustainable business value through business development, sales, or partnership.  Experience working with banks, financial institutions, or experience working in media agency planning is a plus. (Working in Carat Singapore/Performics Singapore/PHD media Singapore/Publicis Groupe Singapore) Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills, self-motivated, independent Mature, self-motivated, and strong interpersonal and communication skills with both internal and external stakeholders. Proficient in written and spoken English.

At a glance The Sales team at Chope is the driving force behind our market growth in the deals and reservations space, and the Inside Sales Representative will have a key involvement in helping to ramp up restaurant acquisition aggressively on our various channels. They report directly to our Head of Sales and will be responsible to facilitate various tasks, from the generation of leads, to the scheduling of meetings and the maintenance of our CRM, which will ultimately lead to increased acquisition rate for our restaurant partners on Chope and ChopeDeals. Here’s a snippet of the main responsibilities:  What you’ll do: Develop sales opportunities by researching and identifying potential accounts. Qualify leads and identify the most suitable solutions to their needs, and deliver qualified leads to the Sales team. Coordinate with the restaurants’ management, marketing and operations team through the phone and/or email to set up meetings for and on behalf of the sales team, making outbound calls and following up on leads. Ensure diligent utilisation, updating and maintenance of Streak, our in-house CRM system. Maintain and expand the company’s database of prospects across the different product lines (e.g. SaaS, ChopeDeals, etc), and across the CRM system and related sales pipelines. Ensure diligent follow-up by passing leads to appropriate team members with calls-to-action, meeting dates, complete profile information, briefing notes, etc. Collaborate with appropriate team members to determine necessary strategic sales approaches. Perform ad-hoc responsibilities pertaining to inbound and outbound lead generation, performance tracking and pipeline management. Where necessary, support B2B marketing efforts such as trade shows, distribution lists, exhibits, and other events.  Skills & experiences required: 2-3 years of direct work experience in a sales or telesales capacity. Able to communicate effectively with a broad range of audiences (internal and external). Success in qualifying opportunities involving multiple key decision makers. Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management. Able to be productive and efficient with minimal or no supervision (because we work fast, and want to grow fast). Able to independently overcome objections of prospective customers. Experience with customer relationship management software. Self motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm. Strong knowledge of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques. Excellent listening skills. Great interpersonal and communication skills.  What you’ll get from Chope Meaningful work - you’ll have ownership over and the ability to make a direct impact on the experience we’re delivering to our customers (You’re not here “just to execute”) Autonomy - you’ll be in an environment that enables you to challenge yourself, challenge team members, learn new skills, and try out new things Collaborative and an open culture that values receiving and giving feedback  A competitive salary Flexible work arrangements that provide you the balance you deserve  What is Chope? The word “Chope” in Singapore means to reserve a seat in a fast food restaurant, sometimes by placing a packet of tissue paper on it. We provide software to restaurants to manage their businesses (https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/join_us), a reservations and food delivery platform (iOS and Android apps and web https://www.chope.co ) for consumers to book restaurants or order delivery that’s also integrated with restaurants and partners like Google and Tripadvisor and a deals platform for consumers to get discounts on their dining. Founded in Singapore in 2011, Chope has offices in 7 cities across Asia. Happy dining!
industries: Internet

description: Job Description  6! The number products in the pipeline over the next coming years. Novartis has its eye on protecting and restoring patients’ vision. We aim to develop life-changing pharmaceuticals and transformative technologies for diseases and conditions from front to back of the eye. Your passion to build, execute business plans to meet the sales goals, develop effective professional business relationships with healthcare professionals will help the world understand what these medicines do, why they matter and how Novartis is striving to reimagine medicine.  As a Sales Associate, you will market our Ophthalmology products to customers by providing relevant scientific information and enabling optimized patient outcomes.  Your responsibilities include, but not limited to: Promotes Novartis portfolio and services by providing the latest, relevant and authorized data, key messages and disease information to the right customer at the right time, to support HCP decision making and optimize patient outcomes in an ethical way. Leverages all available data sources to create, dynamically prioritize and adapt relevant territory and customer engagement plans. Maintains a deep and current knowledge of industry, TA, competitor and buyer dynamics and focuses effort on priority customer opportunities. Leverages advanced customer engagement skills to deliver high quality customer interactions and maximizing customer experience for the benefit of patients. Behave ethically, comply with regulatory requirements and adhere to Novartis values and behaviours   Minimum Requirements  Job Requirements: Degree in Medical Science or other related Science discipline. Minimum 3-4 years of sales working experience in the Pharmaceutical industry. Experience in new product launch activities and hospitals formulary listing is desirable. Good working experience in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint. Proficient and fluent in the English.   Why consider Novartis?  799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?  We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data.  Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.  Imagine what you could do at Novartis!  Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  AMAC  Country  Singapore  Work Location  Singapore  Company/Legal Entity  NOV SINGAPORE  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  Yes

description: Occupation Description:  Läderach is a well-established chocolatier hailing from Glarus, Switzerland. The brand is well established in Switzerland, Germany, Japan, the Middle East and Korea.   The Business Development Executive is responsible and accountable for establishing the brand in Southeast Asia by developing and executing the Läderach brand strategy across all channels including retail boutiques, corporate gifting, and ecommerce.  He / she is a meticulous, energetic, collaborative and people-oriented individual. He / she is a fast and independent learner who is able to effectively multi-task effectively.  Duties & Responsibilities:  Reporting to the Director the Business Development Executive’s key deliverables will include but not limited to the following:  • Identify, develop, and execute new revenue streams for the business within APAC • Plan and carry out direct sales activities to attain new accounts in accordance with agreed sales and business plans • Establish a customer development plan to grow the target accounts (i.e. strategies to leverage existing customers into more Asia Pacific countries) • Perform vertical related administrative support (CRM, monthly report) for regional or global stakeholders • Support internal parties to develop best possible solutions for the customers • Achieve and meet the sales budgets for the defined area for new and/ or existing business  Education & Qualifications:  Min Degree in Sales & Marketing / Business Administration or equivalent  Experience:  Minimum 1-2 years of relevant working experience in sales and marketing Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and presentation skills

description: Job Summary  Monstar Lab is one of the top digital product development company with 26 offices in 15 countries and most importantly with a team of 1200+ beautiful souls.  We build innovative digital products that includes mobile apps, web apps, AR/ VR products for our clients such as UOB, NTUC Income, Gardens by the Bay, Shake Shack, Resort World Sentosa and many stealth start-ups that we can’t talk about publicly.  Our Singapore office is looking for someone who can close a deal with the knowledge of both tech and business. In our business, we have to understand our clients’ requirements deeply and propose business and tech strategy/ solutions as a consultant. Basically, we are co-creating new tech business/ solutions with our clients and you will be working as a consultant/ partner of our client. Sometimes, you will also propose what kind of tech team your client should build.  In this proposal phase, you will be working with project managers, designers and developers to come up with the best strategy/ solutions. After you close the deal, our project manager will manage the project. You will have to offer after sales support to your clients. Job description  ● Increasing revenue and profit through new business sales ● Identifying promising leads and with potential customer to pitch what we can offer in terms of mobile application and website development ● Present Monstar Lab and our service to potential clients ● Understand clients’ requirements and propose the solution with a consultative approach ● Work closely with Project Managers, Designers and Development teams to produce competitive proposals to onboard new clients   Candidate requirements  ● Excellent understanding of complex business processes, identifying trends and opportunities for our technology in that space ● Craft proposals, pitch material and demo for sales knowledge of the application development process and clients’ requirements / Experience in enterprise proposal submission is mandatory ● Proven track record of successfully pitching development projects to new business ● Ideally 4 - 5 years of experience with digital sales ● Project Manage timeline by liaising with our engineers and clients so as to deliver the contracted product and services ● Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/ potential customers to meet their requirements ● Reach out to customer leads through cold calling ● Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction ● Entrepreneurial, self-motivated and driven to meet and exceed goals ● Digital product lover and passionate about tech /start-up industry ● Excellent English verbal and written communication skills ● Expert skills in Microsoft Powerpoint and Excel  ● Mobile app/ web /software development agency experience will be a big advantage ● Developer/ Business analyst/ Project manager experience will be a big advantage ● Consulting firm and digital/ app development agency experience will be an advantage   You will love this role if you are:  • An owner. You own problems in your field and solve them. You shall advocate for our values and culture, both internally and externally. • Willing to jump into projects and situations with ambiguous details in multiple domains, and make sense of the situation. • Striving to improve your knowledge and eager to learn at the best of your ability. • Passionate about tech and familiar with the process of getting from idea to code preferred but not necessary. • Strong in negotiation and adopt a win-win situation for both parties, adept at networking and strong in making real connections happen
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: #TeamSHIELD SHIELD is a mobile-first risk intelligence company that helps world-leading enterprises build trust and safety by stopping fraud and abuse. Trusted across all continents by superapps, top e-commerce platforms, and e-wallets, we protect over 7 billion devices and 700 million user accounts every year. Headquartered in Singapore, we have offices in Germany, the United States, Indonesia, and China. Join our fast-growing team of Agents at the forefront of world-leading fraud and abuse prevention.  RESPONSIBILITIES Following continued growth in recent years and with dedicated sales functions established in EMEA, the Americas and APAC, the Sales Operations Specialist will be responsible for increasing productivity and ensuring smooth running of the sales functions, allowing the global sales team to be more successful in their day-to-day activities.  Develop and execute initiatives designed to optimize sales team efficiency and productivity Take ownership of and manage sales and lead generation frameworks, ensuring that they are adhered to by the team, and drive continual process improvement Gather and analyse a variety of sales data, delivering concise and actionable insights on key performance metrics to senior leadership Leverage the information available on Salesforce for optimum team performance Ensure that Salesforce is accurate and up to date, driving the governance of the Sales Team with regards to timeliness and accuracy of reporting and updates Deliver new and improved Salesforce CRM functionality, driving projects from requirement gathering through to execution Design workflows and playbooks for sales teams Implement enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams Manage close relationships with the global team of AEs and BDRs. Convert marketing initiatives into a healthy sales pipeline and be able to attribute ROI for marketing lead sources  REQUIREMENTS   3+ years of sales operations and/or sales strategy experience in a B2B tech environment Experience managing critical sales processes (e.g. quota setting, forecasting, sales process optimization and sales program implementation)  Experience managing and administering Salesforce CRM including mapping and integration with other platforms would be ideal Demonstrated ability to drive continuous improvement in business processes and deliver results. Has strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems Works well under pressure, with a high degree of adaptability and flexibility in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment Advanced time management skills including ability to handle multiple projects with competing deadlines.  PERKS  In order to ensure that our Agents are in tip-top condition, we’ve got them covered from their physical to mental well-being: A truly flexible working environment  In-house gym and shower facilities Latest games on the PlayStation and VR Dinner and transportation covered if you ever need to work late Team sports, movie screenings, celebrations and more Tech gadgets you need to help you do amazing work  Possibly the best pantry you have ever seen All the merch and more
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Project Management
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Stop settling for the good and go for the great!  About The Role  As a Sales Development Representative for the APAC market you will have a direct impact on getting closer to the vision of digital coaching for everyone. By focusing on customer acquisition within the APAC market you will jointly strengthen the New Business area and make a decisive contribution to the growth of our company.  Tasks And Responsibilities Research of contact persons & decision makers in the company Contacting potential new customers via email, social media and by telephone You act at eye level with all decision-makers and thus ensure the successful start of a long-term partnership Development of long-term customer relationships through strategic planning and trusting cooperation You will create the future of digital coaching with us - Your name will be part of this story!  Check out our short presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_SDR  Your Profile You like to approach people actively and at the same time you are analytical and structured You gained at least 2+ years of experience in a similar role Ambitious goals motivate you, you have a "Competitive Mindset" in a healthy measure Ability to work in a team and strong communication skills Independent working method and entrepreneurial spirit Ambition and willingness to perform, to make the company successful and to make progress for oneself You speak a relevant language for the APAC market at a native level and very good English What we offer Your own personal coach for unlimited sessions that will help you to unlock your potential and regular growth conversations with your supervisor Growth: An opportunity to join a fast growing and agile company The people: You will join an international team of driven and supportive people on a mission Impact: You have a direct impact on people's lives and make a true difference Feel welcome: First class company onboarding week that will get you settled in in no time, both remotely and in-house Experience a strong focus on professional and personal growth across all teams (we are a Coaching company after all!) Working on the forefront of the future of work in an international environment Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub!  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn’s Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‘help organisations to unleash their people’s full potential’ attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‘CoachHubbers’ hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.
industries: Professional Training & Coaching

description: About AVEVA  AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software, driving digital transformation and sustainability. By connecting the power of information and artificial intelligence with human insight, AVEVA enables teams to use their data to unlock new value. We call this Performance Intelligence. AVEVA’s comprehensive portfolio enables more than 20,000 industrial enterprises to engineer smarter, operate better and drive sustainable efficiency. AVEVA supports customers through a trusted ecosystem that includes 5,500 partners and 5,700 certified developers around the world. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, UK, with over 6,500 employees and 90 offices in over 40 countries. Learn more at www.aveva.com.  We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you?  Responsibilities: You will work to develop new opportunities for AVEVA Account Managers. This will involve both working on Inbound leads created via marketing campaigns and leads created via your own research and Outbound prospecting. Within each sub-region you will work closely with local marketing, account management, and technical sales to generate new business and support the closing of business within the region. The role requires the candidate to have basic solution and service knowledge. Additionally, the role requires research, planning and production of simple business presentations for internal and external delivery. Utilize social media, email, and phone communication to deliver qualified leads for Sales Representatives and Account Managers to connect with. Meet and exceed monthly pipeline target. Maintain and develop leads in accordance with the AVEVA Lead Management process and maintain activity within AVEVA’s CRM solution. 1 Hour Service Level Agreement for Inbound Lead follow-up. Support Marketing activities, such as campaigns, events and seminars/webinars where appropriate. Comply with The ONE AVEVA Framework of Processes and Policies and other written and verbal communication from the management. It is expected that some travel to support Sales Representatives to clients, partners, prospects, AVEVA offices etc. will be a normal requirement of successfully executing this role.  Skills & Qualifications: Highly motivated, results-oriented with a positive and determined approach to researching and developing new Sales Qualified Leads. Passionate team player and a self-starter. Tackles routine tasks with energy and commitment. 5-6 years of Telemarketing Experience; previous Software Sales experience not necessary but an added advantage Quick to adopt new skills, motivated for career development, and able to develop an excellent understanding of the value proposition of AVEVA’s solutions. Commercial and analytical skills to identify market trends and opportunities for nominated territory, refining lead development plans to exploit such opportunities. Clear and confident in phone and e-mail prospecting. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong listening skills to logically determine the best solutions for prospect challenges. Understands the prospect’s business, and able to express that understanding accurately to the sales team. Bachelor’s Degree or professional qualification in related sales or marketing positions.  AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplar employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.  Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.  Concerning agencies: AVEVA does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
industries: Computer Software

description: The opportunity  Please note – For this role it is essential that candidates have full right to work in Singapore. We are unable to provide Sponsorship. Although not essential, language proficiency in Bahasa/Vietnamese would be a bonus  An exciting opportunity has arisen working with our APAC Sales Team. We are currently recruiting for a highly motivated, strategic and target driven Business Development Manager to join our Singapore office, and play a key role in our continued growth in APAC. Reporting into our VP of Sales for APAC, this role will be focussing on growing our business in key targeted emerging markets in Southeast Asia, which is a critically important region for us.  The Business Development Manager will be responsible for generating new business across Southeast Asia, and the subscription sales of mining and metals data into targeted enterprises. This will include active follow-ups from client visits, marketing, and event efforts, generating and closing interest for the company’s products and services. As a Business Development Manager, you will need to think strategically on ways to grow our business in miners, traders, manufacturers, producers, government, financiers, and enterprise businesses.  Once appointed, the Business Development Manager will become part of a dynamic, supportive, successful, and truly international team. As you develop your career at CRU, you will gain knowledge on our clients, our best-in-class product portfolio and be a part of a significant growth story. Financially you will be rewarded - our Business Development Managers receive a basic annual salary, country specific benefits, and are eligible to participate in the Company’s commission plan.  Candidates need to have previous solid sales experience, with a strong track record of managing a portfolio and establishing a network. Experience in the price data subscription sales environment for the commodity industry is essential and will be key to the success of this role. You will need to have the ability to partner with colleagues in marketing, management, research & analysis, and sales operations to strengthen your own sales initiatives, internal collaboration will be a contributing factor to the success of this role.  As a global Company we work across multiple time zones, so a degree of flexibility will be needed. The role will also require a level of international and local travel (pandemic travel restrictions dependant), so candidates will need to be comfortable with this  Responsibilities & Accountabilities will include:       Establish and maintain senior level relationships in major functional areas of the customer organization. Utilize the relationships to develop strong revenue growth initiatives for all CRU products as well as retain our existing business within the account. Generate new business through account-based marketing, whitespace analysis, industry networks and relationships New business generation will be a must in this role. The ability to generate and identify potential customers as well as understand the customers workflow to identify a client's needs will be essential Manage renewal sales process for existing customer base, including setting of expectations, changing needs assessments, negotiating contracts and processing of contracts via relevant internal systems Prepare and execute strategic account plan Follow up on all inbound client inquiries, webinars, workshops, events to uncover new and expanding opportunities Maintain consistent and ongoing contact with end-users and decision makers Prospect, present to, and close on new sales opportunities within client base Accurately forecast expected sales and cancellations Provide ongoing product feedback from clients to Line Manager and Product Managers Maintain awareness of, and participate in all relevant training for, new products and capabilities, and market them to account base/prospects Follow and execute a structured solution sales process for revenue growth and prospecting. Able to uncover new revenue opportunities within an account based on the understanding of the works flows and strategies being deployed within the accounts Quickly develop a strong understanding of the unique CRU value proposition Inform and execute a comprehensive sales strategy to ensure they meet/exceed monthly and yearly sales targets Maintain record of client contract and sales pipeline management using Salesforce Quickly penetrate, build presence and pipeline in SEA emerging regions including but not limited to, Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia  About you – What skills and experience are we looking for?  Excellent communication skills with customer and internal organization verbally and written is essential Connect customer values and products/services Interest and work experience in a client facing role in commodities or subscription type service provider Strong negotiation skills Ability to build rapport with customers, and be customer centric at all times Excellent written and verbal communication skills Be comfortable working with clients from different cultures and time zones Ability to work smart, and meet targets within agreed timescales Be comfortable using a CRM system for workload and KPI management Be comfortable working to strict targets Comfortable using Salesforce for recording customer interaction and tasks
industries: Mining & Metals

description: Do you want to kick start an exciting career in Oracle? Apply now and be part of the GBUs!  We are looking for people who are passionate and keen to be a Business Development Consultant for the Construction & Engineering Global Business Unit.  Our Mission – Transforming the world by helping Organizations plan, build & operate critical assets to deliver successful projects and innovate with industry leading project management tools and software.  Be part of a team that help shape digital transformation of the 21st century Construction & Engineering demands where we are involved in over 20 different industries. Check us out at: https://www.oracle.com/industries/construction-engineering/  As a Business Development Consultant, your focus is to generate demand for Construction & Engineering unit through a mix of outbound/inbound prospecting activities for an assigned territory. Acting as the first point of contact for prospects and leads, you will qualify Oracle Construction & Engineering prospects and produce exciting opportunities for the Oracle sales team.  Key Activities / Requirements: Two years relevant sales/business experience preferred. Detail oriented to perform database and record keeping activities. Ability to demonstrate time management, tele-sales skills and knowledge of Oracle products and services (training provided). Ability to work independently, goal-oriented individual with superior communication skills. Ability to complete individual goals as well as work in a team environment. Demonstrated ability to communicate using technical concepts. Desire for a career path in sales. Location based in Singapore, with knowledge of Thai/Vietnamese/Mandarin/Tagalog language is a plus.

jobTitle: Business Development Executive with Intuitive Films
description: Influencing Positive Change through Creative Video Production  What Is The Opportunity?  Intuitive Films is looking for an experienced and energetic Business Development Executive who is driven to influence positive change through creative video production. The right candidate must share our core values and believe in adding value through purposeful work.  PEOPLE  You are a team player who can hold your own confidently. You are good with people and are great at bringing people together, through the good times and the challenging ones.  EXCELLENCE  You are driven to get things done and done right by setting high standards for yourself and the team - continually pushing the envelope while making a positive impact in all that you do.  GROWTH  You are dedicated to growth - both professionally and personally. You are committed to learning and expanding your comfort zone, while being generous in sharing what you know with your team members and helping them grow.  DO MORE WITH LESS  You are resourceful and manage time, energy, budgets and priorities well. You know what it means to leverage on what you have to create more than what might seem possible on first glance. Because you are outcome-focused, you know that everything you do is going into creating something by design.  Skills  If this environment sounds like a place you’d love to grow in and contribute to, here are the specific skills we need from you You must have at least 2 years of experience in a sales or business development role. Experience in a video, communication, media or advertising environment would give you a strong advantage, as with a proven track record of selling to B2B, G2B and G2C stakeholders. Someone who is an energetic, smart, confident and responsible go-getter with the desire and commitment to excel through negotiating win-win outcomes in a sales and marketing role. Someone who is an effective communicator with high professional competency in spoken and written English, plus a genuine sense of empathy, who connects and builds relationships easily with clients and partners from all levels. Someone who keeps abreast of the latest developments in diverse domains and is skilled in developing pitches and conducting consultative presentations with mid and senior level decision-makers. Someone with strong attention to detail and excellent time prioritization skills in balancing multiple tasks and accounts effectively. Someone who is nimble in using technology to achieve goals effectively and efficiently. Someone who is a positive team player with firm commitment towards the delivery of high-quality work and is accountable for our collective success. A recognised bachelor’s degree, with specialisations in mass communications or business as a plus. What Will You Be Taking Charge Of? Achieve revenue targets in a sustainable and value-driven manner, with a focus on generating new revenue streams and expanding our client base. Increase the company’s profitability and growth by researching trends, identifying and capitalizing on market opportunities; conducting competitor analysis; improving marketing initiatives and coordinating new product development. Capitalize on new business opportunities by working closely with the production and creative team to develop pitches and proposals in a responsive, detail-oriented and consultative manner with prospective clients. Interface between clients and our production and creative team to ensure high level of client satisfaction from pre-production to final delivery, with smooth and meticulous handovers of client relationships. Grow client relationships with key accounts by maintaining regular contact; exploring specific needs; and anticipating new opportunities. Contribute to the development and execution of the company’s long term strategic goals. Participate in the continuous development and execution of internal production systems, internal resources, best practices and marketing activities/material. What Can You Look Forward To When You Join Us? A people-focused working environment built upon respect, integrity and accountability. Being part of a team that is committed to personal, professional and organisational growth. An established company with a positive 14-year track record with clients, staff and collaborators. The ability to grow, shape and evolve with the company culture. Diverse clients and range of projects, with a focus on work that delivers positive impact and influences positive change. Continuous learning and training opportunities for both professional and holistic skills, with periodic performance reviews. Competitive pay package including performance bonus, CPF contributions, annual leave, sick leave, childcare leave and medical reimbursement. I'm interested!  Send us an email at hiring@intuitivefilms.com (Subject: ‘Intuitive Business Development Executive - [YOUR NAME]’) with the following: Your CV/resume Your availability Your contact number Your expected salary And tell us a bit more about yourself!  At Intuitive, we value and respect diversity - and we look forward to hearing from you. We will get in touch with shortlisted candidates for an interview within the next few weeks.  Find out more about us at: https://www.intuitivefilms.com We are currently only recruiting those who are already eligible to work in and located in Singapore.

Job Description We are looking for a dynamic, energetic, sales passionate person who would like to work in a team to drive sales in the Cloud adoption arena, primarily the Microsoft and Amazon cloud space. You love to build relationships with clients (preferably have existing ones) and you are familiar with selling tech. If you a passionate to learn about the tech, that is super awesome too!  This role will be to comb existing leads, grow new ones through lead gen activities and to brainstorm strategies internally to build better revenues. The ideal candidate will have experience of sales in the technology industry doing professional services, managed services or SaaS selling. They should be confident with building new client relationships and maintaining existing ones. They should have be value-driven and seeking to WOW customers where they can.  Responsibilities Build key customer relationships and act as their trusted account manager to assist them as best as possible Sell our Microsoft and Amazon cloud solutions, professional services and managed support services. Sell our internal SaaS products Plan quarterly strategies to grow sales database and work with marketing to create leads Negotiate deals with clients to get the best win-win situation Be very customer-focused and do our best to ensure customers’ trust and satisfaction Work with our technical pre-sales team to craft proposals and quotes Work together with the others in the sales team to drive collaborative and teamwork-based selling Learn and grow your skill-set by understanding some technicalities of the solution Work with principals like Microsoft, Amazon, Datto, Veeam, and others within their account managers to build relationships for joint collaborative selling Meet every Monday for a Sales Meeting and work on the sales dashboard Be diligent in our Daily Huddles to align with everyone internally Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and forecasts) Prepare reports on the status of the account Work with the regional sales team to share ideas Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed Participate in brainstorming internally to help increase the product portfolio and ideas to improve Participate in internal activities to boost team building and relationships  Qualifications & Requirements of the Job Bachelor's degree 3+ years in technology sales-related positions Passionate about selling and building customer relationships Previous working experience as a Sales/Account Manager/Business Development Executive in the IT industry selling cloud solutions, SaaS solutions, or other technology software products and services Communicate well, energetic and fun to IT, Management, and Key Executives in the past, in English and Mandarin Experience Selling Microsoft Azure, O365 solutions is preferred but not mandatory Enjoy working in team-based environments Able to juggle multiple accounts, projects at a time and not calculative about time Great if you’ve attended courses on negotiation skills, presentation skills, listening skills in the past, but not mandatory Love meeting customers to mingle and network Able to demonstrate selling success case studies Clear communication and presentation skills Preferably Singapore Citizen, PR or an existing EP holder  Who Are We? Infront Consulting is a regional organization with offices in Malaysia, Singapore and Sri Lanka and is looking to expand the team further. Our vision is to become the best multi-cloud consulting company in the region offering value-based solutions around Cloud & AI implementation and development. We want to Improve the Lives of organizations through the use of Cloud Tech. Internally, we have built a culture that Delivers WOW results, Cares for Everyone Like Family, and an Honest and fully Integrity focused company. We are striving to portray a ‘Crazy is the #norm at Work’ environment within the organization which we are needing of like-minded individuals to join the movement.  We would also require you to take part in an internal Pre-qualification survey by using the link below:  https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=qFuwWliVF0Oms7gS-fhHzXNGEIktjhpIpjxcZuXSNaRUMVdFMkZORE1GM1ZMR0pCMEtPU0g2UE5SWS4u  Looking forward to your application!!

Sales Account Manager  Responsibilities include:  1.     Maintain excellent relationships with existing Accounts and work closely with respective points-of-contact 2.     Develop excellent relationships with new Accounts and work closely with respective points-of-contact 3.     Expand on sales / project business opportunities with existing Accounts 4.     Manage and upkeep Sales Order Forms 5.     Coordinate deliveries with Customer Service team 6.     Initiate quarterly bulk order review and placement of sales orders 7.     Manage projects on day-to-day basis and ensure tasks are implemented on time, on budget and to the required scope and quality 8.     Lead special ad-hoc projects or duties that may be assigned by management from time to time 9.     Manage AR issues 10. Experience in retail industry, store construction, store fixture/fittings procurement 3.     Effective in English and Mandarin as candidate is required to communicate directly with China office staff)

The role will be responsible to drive sales force effectiveness via leading the overall sales execution process of Carlsberg Singapore as well as partnering the Sales Capability Lead to execute capability-building programmes for the Carlsberg Singapore salesforce.  Responsibilities  Sales Execution Excellence To partner the Value Management & Sales Capability, Senior Manager and the Sales team to drive FIT implementation including leading the bi-annual PICoS review, briefing of sales staff, maintenance of outlet census and more To assume the role of an independent auditor for Carlsberg SG by conducting a monthly FIT audit for a defined sample size of on and off-trade outlets To actively manage and drive the sales call’s quality including measurement and corrective actions with the Sales Directors & Managers, including implementation of processes and tools To compute and analyse the monthly audit and sales’ calls results, including proactively reviewing of the findings with the Management team and Sales Directors & Managers to drive corrective actions that can improve overall sales execution To monitor the performance against the agreed sales force KPIs by leveraging on the FIT analytics’ report and independent audits’ findings, then work with the Sales Capability Lead as well as the Sales Directors & Managers to identify opportunities for improvement To support the Sales Capability Lead in maintaining the key reporting platforms that can ease the accessibility for the Sales team to sales and FIT execution information  Sales Force Training & Development To lead the sales force effectiveness’ diagnosis activities that can identify their needs & requirements, after which collaborate with the Sales Capability Lead to implement training programmes that can drive sales excellence To work with the Sales Capability Lead in coordinating and executing all competency and capability-building programmes for the Carlsberg SG sales force To conduct on-the-job training for Carlsberg Way of Selling (i.e Picture of Success and other best practices) for the sales force  Requirements Minimum Degree (Marketing or Business) Minimum 2-3 years of working experience in Sales force Effectiveness, Sales Capability, Sales Operations or equivalent areas Team player with strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills – able to work with and influence stakeholders/colleagues at all levels Proactive, able to work independently, possesses problem solving skills and able to work in a dynamic and challenging environment Strong analytical skills to identify business issues and formulate relevant and actionable recommendations Highly resourceful, creative and open to challenges Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Powerpoint etc), analytics tools (Qilkview, Power BI etc) and salesforce systems (Distributor Management System, Salesforce.com etc) Fluent in English proficiency  Job Details  Workplace Hiap Hoe Building At Zhongshan Park, SG  Job type Permanent  Part time / Full time Full Time  Working Time Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm  We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Food & Beverages

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  What’s the role about?  The Global Account Manager is responsible for generating and developing sales, maintaining strong relationships and a high level of customer satisfaction. To foster and build good customer relationship at all levels for revenue growth and customer retention. To work with Solution Manager & Sales Specialists to propose relevant and cost-effective ICT solutions for corporate customers, covering local, managed and hosting services. To understand and identify corporate customers’ ICT and hosting needs through regular engagement. To identify business opportunities and synergy with customers in areas of cooperation. To identify reciprocal businesses and areas of cooperation whenever there are opportunities. To provide one-stop ICT experience to customers covering related Singtel services. To ensure all support or tasks requested by Global Account Director are done timely and effectively. To ensure that all customers’ pre-sales & post-sales enquiries and works orders, commercial documents, dealings with customers are promptly attended to, documented and kept. To work closely with Singtel Global Offices to engage customers and to deliver services to customers. What do you need to succeed? A degree or higher with at least 5 years of relevant working experience in account management in various industries achieving an excellent sales track record. Experience in telco or ICT account management will be an added advantage. Must be self-driven, energetic, resourceful and creative and possess good leadership. Must be proactive and have a sense of ownership. Able to project strong, positive image of self and company. Able to build good customer relationship at all levels. Able to deliver professional sales presentation, proposals and reports. Able to sell the full range of IT/Telecommunications solutions.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: We’re looking for sales-driven individuals to join us who are excited about the digital transformation being driven by the rise of the social messaging apps and who have made a name for themselves bringing innovative AI-Powered Conversational Customer Experience technology to global leading brands.  Responsibilities · Business development and sales role in our Large SME/ Mid-Market Enterprises team · Providing a world-class prospect and customer experience through every interaction · Become a product expert and learn AiChat’s selling practices · Keep meticulous records of interactions with leads in our CRM (Salesforce) · Help to build scalable demand generation campaigns based on data · Identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in our process  Qualifications · 2+ years of experience in sales, preferably in SaaS · Fluency in English · Commitment to pursuing a career in sales · High level of drive & stamina to succeed in sales · Prior experience cold calling, booking and conducting software demos · Consistent track record of overachieving · Empathic listener and persuasive communicator · Competitive, resilient, and highly motivated · A great attitude and love for teamwork · Bachelor’s degree required · Curious about and understand the value of digital marketing / social media / MarTech  ** Competitive Basic + High Commissions ***

Manage existing accounts to ensure continued growth Deep understanding of customer’s businesses goals and assist in maintenance of account relationships Design, develop, plan and execute strategic program roadmaps for clients that drive optimum value Select the correct products or assist customers in making product selections, based on customers' needs, product specifications and regulations Contact new and existing customers to discuss their needs, and to explain how these needs could be met by specific products and services Generate and develop new business accounts by executing sales and product strategies Requirements 5 years' experience in Account Management role Bilingual in English and Japanese as this candidate will be working closely with Japanese clients and to expand business to regional Possess knowledge of IT infrastructure products and services such as LAN/WAN technology, Data Centre infrastructure etc. customer-oriented, have good understanding of the clients’ needs Excellent written and verbal communication/presentation skills and demonstrate experience communicating technical information.

description: Acquia is redefining the digital strategies of companies all over the world with our open cloud platform. We are passionate and relentlessly committed to helping our clients create digital experiences that are more relevant, personalized, and built for a constantly evolving, always-connected, mobile-first world. Headquartered in the US, we have been named as one of North America’s fastest growing software companies as reported by Deloitte and Inc. Magazine, and have been rated a leader by the analyst community and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future of the web, and we want you to be a part of it!  The Enterprise Account Executive, will be tasked to develop, own and handle closing new business in Asia Pacific. Responsibilities include ensuring that prospective customers have the best possible experience and finding the right mix of Acquia offerings for their needs. The ideal candidate fosters deep relationships with prospective customers, partnering with them to resolve their needs and delivering elite service.  The ideal candidate will have deep experience with solution selling of sophisticated enterprise software with a background around web development, Cloud/SaaS, Web Analytics, Marketing Automation, Web Content Management or Social Software.  Responsibilities Develop and execute a go-to-market strategy for Acquia's offerings in the APJ region. Identify and establish relationships with key corporate C-level representatives through prospecting, marketing leads and expansion of existing contacts within accounts Build and maintain strong sales pipeline and forecast, through discovery calls and meetings Drive the sales process and handle the contract and approval process of new deals, including negotiating on price and getting approvals including contract terms Meet or exceed set Quota targets and Key Performance Indicators for sales based activities Completes required reports on time, maintains accurate forecast Coordinate all information in Salesforce.com Contribute to the development of sales strategy through input of ideas and suggestions to senior management team Build awareness for Drupal and Acquia within large Enterprises and System Integrators Build and foster positive relationships with new and existing Acquia partners Qualifications History of exceeding quota Experience with SaaS technologies. description: General Role The employee contributes to the business of the store and to the quality of service to customers by ensuring a perfectly accurate and reliable management of the store stocks. He/she is constantly a strong support and partner to the sales team. He/she is responsible for the stock accuracy between system-based and physical stocks, for overall organization and tidiness of all storage areas, in strict compliance with Group and local procedures.  Major Responsibilities Process all incoming and outbound product flows, while ensuring perfect synchronization between physical and system-based flows (receiving, transfers and shipments, returns etc.). Manage the daily replenishment of all storage areas on the sales floor (products and packaging) Monitor and close expired reservations and reintegrate them into available stock on a daily basis Stock takes & cycle counts. Contribute to scanning and investigation of discrepancies Implement an optimized organization of storage Ensure an appropriate implementation of storage rules, stock procedures and best practices by all team members Work in constant cooperation with the store team and Corporate team on matters related t the stock  PERFORMANCE INDICATORS Timely completion of product flows (in and out) Stock accuracy: Results of annual stock takes and cycle counts (number of discrepancies, Shrinkage rate) Quality, clearness and cleanliness of stockroom organization: continuous results of 5S checks Quality of relationships with the team  Requirements & Capabilities Minimum 3 years of experience, with previous experience in store environment or in Operations Excellent behavioral and communication skills / leadership, ability to work with sales teams and liaise with corporate Very organized, rigorous and reliable, and able to anticipate, organize and prioritize the activities of a team Service-oriented, proactive to propose improvements and support other team members Proficient with Excel / IT tools Fluent in English

description: Are you someone that always dreamed of joining a global startup company but have not had the opportunity yet?  If you have a global mindset with huge ambitions to change the world, we are looking for you!  We are a close-knit startup team headquartered in Singapore, with offices in China and Philippines as well.  Our vision is to create a global influencer marketplace platform that will change the landscapes of digital commerce. Since the start of our company, our business has already expanded across different continents. We are looking for brilliant and global-minded people that wants to grow together with us.  We give you the possibility to influence, take ownership and be a part of a journey that has only begun!   Job Description  We are looking for an enthusiastic and proactive Account Executive to work with our existing portfolio of clients- to build stronger client relationships, drive revenue through various influencer campaigns and integrate campaigns for our anyStarr platform.   The Account Executive will work closely with the Operations and BD team to execute strategies designed to drive growth, uncover new business potential, increase revenue, provide accurate issue resolution and assure our partners have the best result and support in the market.   You will be the go-to person for all our existing partnership campaigns, working closely with one of the biggest players in digital commerce / gaming industry to execute different campaigns to achieve the desired KPIs.   Job Requirements  •  Minimum 1 to 3 years of solid experience in the tech, e-commerce, internet or gaming industry. •  Knowledge of international experience in Asia and Europe would be an advantage •  Prior sales/account or client management experience is compulsory •  Excellent communication and written skills • Strong attention to detail, time management and organizational skills •  Open to learning and adapting •  Proficiency in other languages a huge plus! •  Proactive and able to manage projects independently

Osome is an international fintech startup with the mission to to help business owners spend less time on routine admin and more time on managing their businesses. We use machine learning (AI) and complex algorithms to automate accounting, tax, company formation, and other tasks.  With Singapore as the headquarter, Osome has expanded to Malaysia, Hong Kong, United Kingdom with a total staff strength of more than 200 employees servicing more than 6000 clients.  Here at Osome, we provide an inclusive and collaborative environment, offering a promising career plan for our employees. You can expect to be rewarded for your contribution. If you are a diligent team player, who is not afraid of challenges, willing to think out of the box and find creative ways to reach the shared goal, think no further!  Responsibilities Responsible closing inbound & outbound leads via emails, chat and calls Responsible for hunting prospects through cold calling Having a hunter mentality and being eager to generate high revenues Occasionally finding new leads independently Showing high conversion rates and exceeding quotas/ KPIs Up-selling and negotiating with prospects Work with marketing on timing of any campaigns Sales presentations/demonstrations to prospective clients Becoming proficient with our platform & CRM tools Being able to sell & follow processes on all sales platforms Manage a large volume of emails and chats with knowledge and efficiency Provide expert answers to questions about services, pricing, and processes to customers Follow company communications guidelines and procedures under minimal supervision Recommend improvements to processes for improved company efficiency Any other ad-hoc responsibilities as required  Requirements Recognised Diploma or Degree in relevant fields, but extensive relevant work experience would make up for lack of qualifications At least 1-3 year of sales experience, with a slight preference in the accounting and corporate services industry Self-motivated and proactive, and able to work meticulously under tight deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills; independent yet able to contribute to a team A willingness to learn, with the ability to use any and all resources to get the job done Proficient in CRM/Sales platforms such as HubSpot or Pipedrive  Benefits Join a hyper fast growing company Experience the most exciting growth phase of a start-up first-hand – we are on an exponential growth path and providing each individual opportunity to change the way we do things Be on the forefront of development when it comes to accounting best practices Work closely with out tech team to help shape the face of corporate services in the future. International environment Flexible working arrangement; working from home Competitive remuneration package Benefits: 18 days annual leave, study leave, cash incentives, medical benefits, etc.  Thank you for your interest in Osome. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: About the company Oddle is the leading cloud-based Software-as-a-Service platform that facilitates e-commerce and order management solutions for the F&B industry.  Our journey started in Singapore in 2014 and over the past 7 years, we are proud of what we can offer to help restaurants to manage and grow their sales – not only with technology but also with our data-guided marketing solutions. We connect to food lovers with Oddle Eats, a discovery platform with favourites curated by us because at Oddle, every meal matters. There is more to what we want to achieve.  About the role  We are looking for an Account Manager to join our Singapore team, our biggest market in the region, as we're bringing Oddle's position in Singapore to the next level. Join us in this high-growth journey and make a meaningful impact in the F&B scene.  As our Account Manager, you will play one of the most integral aspects of Oddle's mission - to become the tech partner of choice for restaurants to grow their sales. Your expertise as Oddle's ambassador will help our restaurants grow their business and strengthen Oddle's relationships with restaurant owners in the F&B community.  Who might you be? You are a business-minded individual who is obsessed with helping others, and will go out of your way to make things happen. You believe in our mission and the excitement that it brings. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth and ever-changing environment, you can easily adapt to any situation and are up to any challenge that arises.  You are authentic and genuine and have a knack for building great and meaningful business relationships. You want to learn the in & out of the F&B tech industry in Singapore, to leverage on or build your network with the humans of F&B. You care about the impact that you and the company can influence on restaurant partners that entrust their business to us.  What you will do: Establish close relationships with merchants to gain an insightful understanding of their business, identify their unique qualities and challenges to develop GMV growth strategies Engage with merchants periodically to analyse and gain insights of their performance, identify gaps or opportunities, optimise their Oddle Shop to grow their sales Market and cross-sell company's new products/services of our new business vertical, as well as improve new product adoption Protect revenue lost by reducing churn, and grow new revenue by getting merchants onboard with our marketing campaigns and/or other company-wide initiatives Assist merchants in day-to-day operational queries Periodically review engagement strategies, keep abreast of internal product offerings and knowledge as well as those of competitors  Who we're looking for: A Degree holder in business or related At least 3-4 years of business development/sales/client account management/customer success experience with a proven track record of success in the role Knowledge or experience in a SaaS / Food Tech / eCommerce industry is an advantage Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, building and maintaining relationships is your forte Strong business acumen, a critical thinker who is able to challenge ideas for the better Sound analytical thinking, a sound ability to decipher data and make data-driven decisions A self-driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced and highly agile environment An entrepreneurial spirit who is self-started, resourceful, able to drive actions and inspire people around you Possess a great sense of ownership and take pride in your work  If you are driven and looking for tremendous growth opportunities and want to grow with us, we would love to speak with you soon! Send us your application and we'll get back to you in a few days.
industries: Internet and Information Technology and Services

description: Donaldson is committed to solving the world’ s most complex filtration challenges. Employing innovation and breakthrough solutions, we are advancing filtration for a cleaner world. We look for the best people to help us succeed, offering opportunities to learn, effect change, and make meaningful contributions at work and in our communities. This is a place where you can make a world of difference.  Follow Us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/donaldson/  Strategic Accounts have been identified as one of the key strategies to grow business, improve market share and maintain/improved profitability sustainably. The purpose of this role is to maintain and expand relationships with strategically important customers (end users) and is responsible for growing our business, improving our market share, ensuring our sustained profitability and achieving assigned strategic account objectives. The role will lead the customers’ account planning cycle and ensure assigned customers’ needs and expectations are met.  Role Responsibilities Plans and manages all sales activities to optimize sales and profits. Retains all profitable existing business through continued efforts to maintain maximum service, quality and on-time delivery. Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts for profitable sales growth (prospect accounts and existing accounts). Formulates and implements effective strategic plans and annual operating plans for assigned customers. Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including support, service and management resources, in order to meet account performance objectives and customers’ expectation. Proactively leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets and critical milestones. Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis (through business reviews). Drive sales by following the Donaldson sales process (Impax). Develops, recommends and implements pricing strategies. Develops and maintains market share information and competitive data to be used in the development of market, product, strategic and annual plans. Meets revenue targets by increasing revenue spend per customer and by identifying, developing and closing new sales opportunities. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business/Marketing/Engineering. More than 3 years of outside sales experience, preferably in strategic account selling. Previous experience in manufacturing sales. Proven track record in managing strategic accounts. Proven account planning and closing skills. Good negotiation, influencing and follow up skills. Technical selling. Excellent sales, negotiation, and team building skills and techniques are required. Consistent achievement of sales goals. Proven ability to manage major programs and major customer penetration and account maintenance is required. Technical sales experience and/or possess strong technical aptitude. Ability to build and maintain long-term customer relationships. Ability to multi-task and prioritize customer needs. Computer literacy and proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software is required. Excellent oral and written communications skills are also required. Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics or related CRM systems. Managing and measuring work. Influencing others. Good business acumen. Managing up and across (Sharing of information with management). Extensive travel required. Conversant in multiple SE Asian languages would be a plus. Come make a World of Difference!  Employment opportunities for positions in the United States may require use of information which is subject to the export control regulations of the United States. Hiring decisions for such positions are required by law to be made in compliance with these regulations. Applicants for employment opportunities in other countries must be able to meet the comparable export control requirements of that country and of the United States.  Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.

SmartMore is a leading vision AI company, focusing on applying computer vision to intelligent manufacturing and ultra-HD video industries. It aims to bring customers a new era of intelligent economics through digitalization and intelligent transformation. With solid experience in the computer vision field for over 20 years, SmartMore has already successfully applied more than 300 international patents and business covered consumer electronics, automobiles, semiconductors, new energy, entertainment, tourism, intelligence transportation and other various industries. SmartMore have also served over 100 market leaders including Carl Zeiss, Airbus, Bosch, Canon, Continental AG, Schaeffler, P&G and Unilever, etc. To know more about us, please visit: https://en.smartmore.com/  Responsibilities: Identify the needs and demands of respective partners to unleash business potential and penetrate the business share within the AI Manufacturing and UHD Video field; Develop new business with existing or new clients, and handle sales related documentations such as presentation, proposals, project specifications, etc.; Strengthen and maintain a good relationship with respective partners and their key contact points to drive and implement the new initiatives; and Provide all levels of support to key partners in order to capture the business opportunities and directly report to sales directors.  Requirements: Degree holder or above; Minimum 2 years' relevant experience in AI, manufacturing or media related industries is highly preferred; Positive attitude and strong desire to deliver exceptional results with great attention to accuracy and details; Strong verbal and written communication skills; Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilities; Passion to learn new technologies and able to identify new AI trend; Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese, knowledge in other Southeast Asia Language is a plus; Candidate with less experience will be considered as Assistant Business Manager; Immediate available is highly preferred.

As a member of the OVH Cloud Sales team, the Inside Sales Representative is in charge of acquiring and growing customers. Based in our APAC Regional Hub, the Inside Sales Representative is a key actor of OVH international presence.  Dynamic, proactive and passionate by Sales and the Cloud Industry, the Inside Sales Representative works in a multi-cultural team which ultimate goal is the client’s satisfaction. You are the first point of contact between OVH and a prospective customer. Your role will be to assist new customers by answering sales requests through calls and emails, both incoming and outgoing. You are responsible for customer satisfaction and for revenue generation within a diverse set of prospects within the mid-market territory.   #Missions Contribute to OVH's growth on the APAC Cloud market by generating business opportunities with prospective and existing clients Work with various lead sources: inbound calls, tickets, contact form enquiries, promotional campaigns, events follow up etc. Help clients identify additional needs Identify and overcome sales hurdles Identify the right OVH product in order to meet customer needs Convert potential prospects into OVH customers Manage a pipeline of business opportunities and add them to our customer system (CRM), Reinforce the OVH.com brand while providing excellent customer service.   #Profile You have a sales mindset and the ability to handle technical conversations You have knowledges on Cloud products (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, Dedicated Servers, VPS...) You are able to work over the phone and to answer electronic tickets generated by customers through email You have excellente communication skills both written and werbal You are customer oriented and technical acumen You are someone rigorous, autonomous, resourceful, organized and proactive With a great sense of service, you want to have a positive impact on your internal and / or external contacts You are open to the world and working in an international context is an important aspect for you You are independent and able to work in a fast-paced environment.  Do you want to join a unique human adventure? Explore new avenues and use your talents and energy to support an ambitious project? You are in the right place. Do not hesitate any longer and join the OVHcloud adventure!

Be part of a fast-growing startup where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, and everyone is valued as an important contributor in the organization.  Sales & Business Development  Working closely with the entire company, you are the Sales’ first point of contact for our clients and prospects. Your mission is to demonstrate to potential clients how Doxa software and platform will be suitable for their business needs. A technical and entrepreneurial mind-set as well as a very strong motivation to seize a challenging opportunity and succeed are necessary to support sales development and be successful in this exciting role.
