Understand in detail technical and commercial characteristics of Doxa software and platform Established existing corporate network with SME and mid-market enterprises in Singapore will be highly advantageous Excellent communication skills in both technical & non-technical ways with all stakeholders Client orientated and very good inter-personal skills Relevant senior sales profiles will be considered as well Must be Singapore citizen or PR If the above fits what you’re looking for, contact Joseph at joseph.seah@doxa-holdings.com.  About Us  Doxa Holdings is a young startup that is developing a best-in-class enterprise platform that connects buyers, suppliers and financiers seamlessly. To learn more about Doxa please visit us at www.doxa-holdings.com.

Developing relationship with marketplace and new channel is also key part to drive client’s sales coverage and growth. Managing brand and channel portfolio to deliver growth to clients. Able to develop account plan Good knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint and ability to quickly adapt to new software and tools Proactive and problem - solving attitude Very strong commercial English as well as client - facing abilities Analytical, data driven mindset High interpersonal skill with problem solving About ACommerce  aCommerce is the leading ecommerce enabler in Southeast Asia, delivering retail solutions for global brands such as L’Oreal, Samsung, and Adidas, etc  Founded in May 2013, aCommerce has over 1,400 staff across offices and fulfillment centres in Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and the Philippines. description: We’re Fever!  Fever is the leading global tech-enabled entertainment discovery platform with a clear mission: to inspire through live entertainment.   Our mobile-first marketplace allows both discovery/inspiration and seamless 2-click booking. Fever has also created a media network where our online communities can look for inspiration and local information (Secret Media Network owner of media outlets like Secret NYC, Secret London or Madrid Secreto among others). Fever and its Secret Media Network inspires over 60 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities.  The preferences expressed by these communities allow us to create new experiences, which we call “Fever Originals”. These are proprietary experiences in which we follow a data-driven content creation strategy, using analytics to understand audiences, develop and optimize new formats. Some successful examples include the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 3 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience” co-produced with Netflix, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party”, all launched in multiple cities across the world.  Fever is a US company with a team of over 750 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in many exciting cities such as New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid, Barcelona, or Sydney, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, and Atresmedia among others.  In order to pursue this objective we are looking for bar-raisers, people that want to work hard, have fun, and make history with us.  ABOUT THE ROLE  Here’s what you’ll be doing:  Create and maintain direct business relationships with the best venues, bars, restaurants and organizers in the city. Meet your sales goals whilst maintaining a high bar of quality Expertly manage contract negotiations with potential and existing clients, ensuring sustainable economics and long lasting value for both parties Evidence strong organizational skills to effectively balance and grow a large base of clients  Collaborate closely with our marketing team to build the Fever brand and promote the partnerships you forge  Keeping up to date with everything cool that’s happening in your city; think of yourself as the expert for new and trending experiences ABOUT YOU  Here’s what you should bring to the table:  At least 5+ years track record of sales success in a fast-paced, quota carrying role Strong desire to bring on new businesses as well as grow and manage an existing book of business Self-starter mentality with an ability to work in a demanding, dynamic start-up environment Demonstrated data-driven approach to business and task prioritization Excellent communication skills both written and verbal along with strong attention to detail Comfort in working with Microsoft Office, Google docs, and a Sales CRM (Sugar CRM is preferred) Knowledge of the city’s entertainment, events, and lifestyle trends Experience in media/ad sales a plus but not required BENEFITS  Here’s what you can expect from us:  Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance. Stock options are possible. Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences Home office friendly Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: We're looking for a Business Development Manager to join our team in Singapore as part of our Sales function. The Business Development Manager is responsible for driving net customer growth. Generating new business in the South East Asia territory. Activity level standard of min 12 customer meetings/week, conversion of self-generated opportunity and qualified leads from Marketing.  Key Responsibilities Developing new business opportunities Selling the entire WGSN suite of solutions to new clients Key responsibilities include lead generation through social selling, cold calling and working closely with the marketing team on campaigns, engaging partners and key prospects, as well managing inbound for designated markets Arranging & attending meetings with prospects, making C-Level presentations including demonstration of the site; drafting proposals and contract documents and consistent networking within the industry Working closely with the regional Account management and Client Success to understand clients' usage of the solution, best practices, customer success stories, drive referral business Working closely with the regional account management and Client Success to understand clients usage of the solution, best practices, customer success stories, and drive referral business Forecasting business accurately on monthly and quarterly outlook Strategic lead in the markets, advise on long term plans for growth and business development beyond core industries Working with Regional Head(s) on long term plans for growth and business development beyond core industries Reporting to the Sales Manager (based in HK)  Your Experience Proven track record of consultative solution selling and understanding of the subscription business Scientific practice of selling, with a superior ability to connect with clients and colleagues alike Previous experience within the information/research industry, marketing/branding agencies, retail, or other service offerings would be a distinct advantage Experience in working/developing SEA market will be a distinct advantage Clear thinking, communication and decision-making process A degree in any discipline is preferable  What We Offer Our benefits package incorporates what we're passionate about - unlocking your future, overall well-being and sustainability - whilst giving you control over your benefits. Annual leave Private medical insurance Great learning and development opportunities  Inclusive Workforce At Ascential, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Ascential people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals. Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For more information on our culture, visit Ascential.com.  About WGSN We offer insights and inspiration from around the globe. We help our customers stay ahead and informed through trend forecasting and data science. We believe inspiration comes from the monumental and the mundane. If you're passionate about fashion and lifestyle this is a great place to be, giving you the opportunity to work with the world's most creative trend experts, designers, editors, account managers, marketers, product developers, customer service experts and much more in a meritocratic, high performance company.  Want More Info? Find out more on what our people say: Ascential YouTube Channel If we inspire you, why not join and inspire us?

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world’s most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified’s machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role  Riskified is growing our Go To Market (GTM) team and looking for its first feet on the ground in our new APAC Office located in Singapore. This is a great opportunity to join an established, well-funded FinTech Company that is experiencing intense high-growth. You will be one of the first employees in Riskified’s Singapore office and play a key role in our APAC expansion strategy.  At Riskified, you’ll be generating leads (through creative and strategic research, networking etc.) and running early sales-cycle stages with enterprise and Fortune 500 companies.  Very successful candidates are able to identify a target’s needs and decision makers and then tailor their outreach accordingly. More than anything, we are seeking bright, driven people to join us and help drive revenue and make a direct impact on Riskified’s growth by becoming establishing members of our local operations in Singapore. If you’re the type of person who likes to figure out where problems exist and then solve them and take on unique challenges, we’d love to learn more about you!  What You'll Be Doing  Establish Riskified’s Presence and Brand in Singapore, and greater APAC, through all of the following: Identify partnership opportunities for Riskified in APAC, and constantly highlight new necessities in the region in order to improve the Company’s presence in APAC Work as part of team with Account Executives and other company resources to win new clients for Riskified Generate quality sales opportunities through proactive, strategic prospecting and networking Manage all sales and market growth opportunities - Create and execute a multi-faceted prospecting plan through research, cold outreach (calling and email), leveraging personal networks and following up on marketing generated leads Manage relationships with our partnerships in APAC to generate qualified leads Research industries and individual companies to find the best targets and establish and develop and nurture relationships with representatives at target companies through a variety of mediums Identify prospects’ key questions and pain-points Work closely with our marketing team to generate quality demand generation Represent Riskified at industry events in Singapore and the greater APAC Qualifications Fluent in English - strong verbal and written communication skills - MUST 3-5 years professional B2B tech sales/ BD experience / management consultancy experience - MUST International work experience - MUST Sales oriented and highly motivated Good analytical & research skills and ability to use both in an effective and relevant way in a sales process Strong interpersonal skills, approachable and able to build relationships with prospects Excellent public speaking skills Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organisation Ability to work in a fast-paced sales environment with minimum supervision Experience in payments and / or eCommerce - an advantage Technical experience - an advantage Consulting background - an advantage Additional local languages - an advantage In The News  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Fortune Magazine: 25 Best Workplaces in New York  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Built In NYC: 100 Best Workplaces  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Riskified is deeply committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

description: Strategic Healthcare Account Manager APAC  Reporting to the Head of the Solutions Centre of Excellence (COE) APAC, this role will direct and support the growth of Solution sales within Strategic Accounts. Working with the Strategic and or Account Manger he or she will use the current strategic account plan and design an engagement strategy to sell solutions and multi-year value based partnership model to these market accounts. This role will act as both a subject market expert for strategic account planning but also have the skills and capabilities to sell Philips’ solutions and deliver on sales growth and tactical account plans. This role will also act as an advocate and coach for the market resources to help build confidence and capability to sell solutions as a key responsibility of the Solutions CoE.  Key Areas Of Responsibilities Work with and support Strategic Account Mangers (SAMs) and Key Account Managers to enhance current strategic account management and sell Philips solutions portfolio within these accounts. Prepares the tactical account plan in line with account strategy in the region and implements the solutions sales strategy. Responsible growing the solutions & LSP funnel within Strategic Accounts as represented un the funnel management tool (SFDC). Accountable for achieving funnel growth and budgeted sales volumes, profit margin and sales forecast at a specified number of customers. Coordinates internal and external resources to obtain objectives involving country manager, solutions CoE, local sales force and marketing support (e.g. Product Sales Specialist, Professional Services, HTS, MarComs and/or Application Specialists). Contributes to the development and implementation of local solutions marketing strategies. Systematically analyzing and reporting of strategic account plan quality (with Sales Excellence), strategic account team development and tactical actions for engagement, sales results, profitability and solutions growth trends Requirements: You will need the following skills -Functional Competencies (Skills & Knowledge)  Skills 15 – 20 years’ experience Strategic Account Management capability + Solutions Selling and/as a Solutions Architect Account Management Needs based selling Effective Customer Dialogue & Negotiation Problem Solving /Lean Knowledge Solutions Portfolio Knowledge Clinical Knowledge Knowledge of Standard Processes & Tools Fit for Future Future focused healthcare needs (site of care, connected, distributed care and AI/ML enabled) Portfolio Knowledge (x-BGs, connected care, analytics, including services and solutions) Healthcare Economics, transition to value and quadruple aim(basic) Specifically, you will; Build customer trust (customer focus, solution thinking, patient in center) Become a trusted advisor (seniority, authority, credibility, maturity) Employ strategic relationship management & networking / C-suite engagement Consultative selling & solution selling Skills and capability to build conceptual / strategic / solutions design Project & program management Propose tailor made sales actions for specific accounts. Be responsible for selling solutions within strategic and key accounts to support district sales plan and gives input for district strategy. Make own sales plan with help of sales management, including sales forecast and activity plan. Implement sales strategy for assigned accounts/area within detailed guidelines: operational and activity planning, implementation of local contracts. Initiate tailor made local actions and conditions within defined directives. develop proposals that have been verified and improved internally through the deal board process before offered to customer. Own sales volume: € 10-20 M; top line and margin improvement. Influence on a Business magnitude of > € 3 M for long term strategic partnerships Why should you join Philips?  Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

description: At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. Because of that we’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and talent. Our culture was purpose-built to be remote first, and we offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. If you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology with a team that makes a difference every day, let’s talk.  About The Role  You will be responsible for driving new business opportunities. You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and innovative at building internal relationships and external partnerships to attack the market with passion!  The right candidate will possess excellent energy and drive and a real desire to build business across a portfolio of accounts. They will have the ability to build effective relationships quickly and to find valuable business within each account immediately that can then be enhanced by leveraging internal resources.  Key Accountabilities Identify and actively hunt new opportunities for CrowdStrike across the Thailand Corporate market Run a sophisticated Value Selling Process from Prospecting to Closure Collaborate with the team, including Sales Engineers (SEs), Marketing and Channel Partners to devise and execute account strategies and plans. Maintain accurate and timely forecast and updates to management team. Provide exceptional and high touch customer service, including escalation and coordination of support issues as needed. Become an insider within the Cyber Security Industry and become an expert of CrowdStrike products and services Stay well educated and informed as to the CrowdStrike competitive landscape and how to sell the value of our solutions and services when compared to the relevant competitors in the Modern Endpoint Protection market space. Be a go-getter that sets his/her sights above and beyond to exceed their established targets and quotas. May require modified work hours to accommodate accounts in other time zones, and minimal, but occasional travel for accounts that require a higher touch to achieve closure. What You’ll Need Proven ability to sell a complex sophisticated product/solution to organizations, covering all levels from C-level Executives down. Challenger mentality. Change the status quo by leading and influencing prospects in a positive way to adopt a better approach to security Hunger and a burning desire to drive success in a hyper growth environment Able to leverage and master available tools and assets to scale up sales results e.g. virtual platforms, selling and prospecting tools, channel partners etc Track record of exceeding expectations in an individually focused, quota carrying role. Strong presentation skills, and customer handling skills. Open minded, focused on constant self-improvement and able to learn new business and technical concepts quickly. Competitive nature, but also a collaborative team player. Persistent – Doesn’t stop at “no”. Believes they can overcome. Coachable - Seeks help; knows how to get help, when to ask for it and what situations call for it. Charismatic - knows how to use it. Sharp/Quick Witted - thinks on their feet. Flexibility to handle a curveball. Creative – Can think outside the box (when appropriate). Motivated - to learn, to succeed, to win, to grow. Aptitude - Able to learn and implement new concepts quickly. Confidence with absence of Ego. Self-Disciplined - Proven to be good at time management, organization, and demonstrate discipline in their process and everyday business. Self-aware – Has a solid understanding of their strengths and weaknesses and what they need to work on. Bilingual in English and Thai is needed to perform this role. Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-friendly culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Paid Parental Leave, including adoption Wellness programs A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Open offices have stocked kitchens, coffee, soda and treats We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives that encourage new ways of solving problems, so we strive to attract and develop talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels seen, heard and empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.  CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

description: About Evie.ai Evie is the future of cognitive collaboration - a world where humans and AI assistants work together naturally to intelligently automate business operations and get things done. We deliver cognitive AI assistants that partner with humans to amplify human intelligence and creativity in order to deliver unprecedented operational efficiency and scale. Evie is built on our next-generation cognitive collaboration platform which handles natural language conversations, reasons autonomously and seamlessly orchestrates workflows.  Why us? You'll be inventing the future of work! Evie is the first of many enterprise AI workers that will transform the way companies operate We’re Stanford & Yahoo alums who have a ton of industry experience and we have awesome investors including folks from AirBnB and Google as well as institutions like SG Innovate and Farsight Capital We’re an engineering-driven company tackling hard (and interesting) technical problems and building foundational technology that will power the Intelligent Enterprise of the future We’re young, growing fast and going global, so you’ll get to experience the energy of a startup in its earliest days    Job Description / Responsibilities Sales Operations Prepare sales proposals, contracts, RFPs Draft Data Security questionnaire responses Manage sandbox environment  Ensure all sales leads/prospects are followed up expediently    General Operations Manage grant applications and claims Manage the ISO 27001 certification and compliance process that includes documentation, execution, management of the internal and external audits.  Handle corporate administration matters and other ad hoc projects Manage the on-boarding, off-boarding process of employees and contractors Manage multiple HR Job boards for recruitment   Job Requirements / Qualifications 1-2 years project management/coordination experience  Strong communication skills (verbal, written and presentation) Able to work fast and independently while being a good team player Highly organised with an eye for detail Able to multitask and meet tight deadlines  Reasonably tech-savvy (fluent with Microsoft Office, working on presentations and reports) University Degree/Diploma equivalent education

Hi, I’m Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you’re applying, you’ll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio’s, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.   At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will:  Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers  Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors  Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there’s always something new to learn.  You are...  An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You’re looking to work with a team of high performers where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren’t in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don’t throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win.  Valuable experiences and skills you’ll bring to Puppet  Preferred 1 years of work or internship experience in lead generation, sales, business, operations, marketing, or related Proven track record of achieving measurable goals Avid technology evangelist  Bonus, but not required  Sales Development, customer service, or account management experience for a SaaS or B2B solution Language skills (Thai)  Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM Experience with Salesloft. Best practices and applicability Cold-calling experience a plus  We are hiring at various experience levels and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!  *Visa Sponsorship Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.  About Puppet Puppet’s core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn’t stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet’s open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.  As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you’d thrive in, why not say hello?  Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees!  Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.  Please see Puppet's privacy policy here.

description: About Us Fundaztic is a peer-to-peer (P2P) financing platform in the country that is licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS).  We are founded and run by veterans of the finance, law, and technology industries, and we aim to create a sustainable environment to democratise financing and investment. We do this by widening funding avenues for promising start-ups as well as micro, small and medium enterprises (SMEs) whilst simultaneously facilitating easy access for investors to support these businesses.  At our core, we are a fintech company. Our systems are designed to outpace the traditional financing institution processes and it is through technology that we strive to ensure that financing and investment opportunities are made available to everyone.  Our team in Fundaztic is dynamic, flexible, and independent - we welcome and value your voice and ideas. It is an exciting time to join us as we set the gears in motion for our expansion plans!  About the Role You will be working as a Business Manager acquiring comprehensive business financing opportunities. You will be part of our larger sales team, and your focus will be on new-businesses, micros, and underserved SMEs.  As a Business Manager, you will: i. Maintain strong and current knowledge of our products and services; ii. Drive the company’s sale portfolio; iii. Grow business relationships with new and existing customers; iv. Act as the communication liaison between customers and our Head of Sales; and v. Conduct basic due diligence on customers and be accountable for all customer proposals, agreements, and documentation.  We are looking for Someone with a good learning attitude and the drive to perform well. Whilst prior experience is preferred, it is not required – convince us that you have what it takes and the motivation to improve!  The following additional qualities would be useful: - Target driven / Goal oriented - Ability to communicate simply and effectively - Strong relationship building skills - Excellent organisational and time management skills - Proactive approach to work - Ability to work independently  If you can see yourself in this position, reach out to us, we’d love to hear from you! Employment Type

You will work closely with our VP Sales to acquire and build successful customer relationships in your region. You will be in charge of building long-term partnerships with key decision makers at large publishing companies. You will be responsible for making Echobox the leading provider in your region by actively selling the product by telephone and in person as well as by becoming the ambassador for our company at the highest levels in your region.  Key Responsibilities Work with our VP Sales to grow the Echobox client base. Be responsible for the entire sales funnel in your region. Drive rapid growth to establish Echobox as the market leader in your region. About Echobox  We are a fast-growing, research-driven company building an artificial intelligence that helps online publishers overcome the challenges they face every day. Using novel machine learning techniques, we are revolutionising the publishing industry and have a track record of building things that others have ruled out as impossible. Leading names from around the world rely on our product every day, including The Guardian, The Singapore Straits Times and The South China Morning Post.  Our team is our best asset. We work with extremely smart and talented individuals, who all enjoy a high degree of responsibility and independence in structuring their work.  Do you think you have what it takes to be part of Echobox? We'd love to hear from you.  Requirements  Academic Qualifications Minimum 2.1 degree from a top tier university. Required Skills And Experience An ability and desire to learn new skills quickly Genuine passion for technology and the publishing industry 1+ years of commercial experience Fluent written and spoken English Preferred Skills Experience with selling tech products or previous experience in a SaaS company Familiarity with the publishing industry An understanding of product management and development Additional relevant language skills

description: Napier’s mission is to become the recognized leader in ‘Intelligent Compliance’ software for all regulated industries. We will achieve this through delivery of a best-in-class financial crime solution. Napier is currently Great Place to Work 2021 certified and has been ranked #4 Best Workplace in Tech (small organisations) 2020.  We are looking for a smart and hard working addition to our APAC sales team. We are growing rapidly and need assistance with Lead generation, lead qualification and sales execution. In addition, there is a large Napier partner network we need assistance to ensure they are successful.   Ideally the candidate will have experience with software sales and the responsibilities of an inside sales or business development resource.   Inside sales representatives work with customers to understand their challenges, create solutions and ensure a smooth sales process. Sales representatives work to find and progress qualified new sales leads. Inside sales reps are friendly, well-spoken and ready to align our solution capabilities with customer requirements.   The Inside Sales position drives net-new business, presales prospecting, targeting and the daily activities associated with Sales. Inside Sales is a position focused on driving and influencing revenue. They drive deals to close and heavily influence deals to accelerate pipeline through the sales cycle. They work with the existing teams to lead all aspects of the sales cycle. They are involved in qualification of opportunities, coordination of all sales team resources, and final negotiation and closing of business.   This role develops and qualifies prospective customers for annual software license service agreements. Including new market penetration, calling on senior-level executives, trade show attendance, webinar and event follow-up, collaborating with teams for pin-pointing top prospects and more.  This position has a significant impact on Napier’s fiscal performance. It requires frequent use of independent judgment and critical decision-making skills on behalf of the company.   What you’ll do  Expanding sales of the Napier solution across the assigned territory  Implementing & executing comprehensive sales strategies  Working with internal resources and business partners to provide solutions to customers’ challenges  Ongoing tracking and communication of account and vertical market opportunities and issues to the team  Creation, updating and execution of sales activity plans  Providing timely and accurate sales forecasts on an ongoing basis  Responsible for building new relationships as well as maintaining and deepening relationships with Customers and prospects.   Account Strategy – Inside Sales resources will help define and implement a strategy to find and develop new accounts which requires a good understanding of the customers’ business and Napier’s potential  Work with direct sales organizations to identify qualification improvements and ensure only qualified leads are passed when applicable  Assist customers in understanding Napier solutions, configuration, environment and how they fit within their current infrastructure and business processes.  Process customers problems and translate their need into business opportunities   What you need to succeed  Prior account development or inside sales experience, preferably within software  History of meeting or exceeding sales targets  Ability to build strong working relationship with the internal ecosystem including: field reps, field marketing and legal  Ability to develop strong relationships with current or potential customers  Ability to work in a fast paced, changing environment and to understand complex business environments and uncover customer issues  Pro-active individual with a “can do” attitude who focuses and commits
industries: Computer Software

description: Do you want to kick start an exciting career in Oracle? Apply now and be part of the GBUs!  We are looking for people who are passionate and keen to be a Business Development Consultant for the Construction & Engineering Global Business Unit.  Our Mission – Transforming the world by helping Organizations plan, build & operate critical assets to deliver successful projects and innovate with industry leading project management tools and software.  Be part of a team that help shape digital transformation of the 21st century Construction & Engineering demands where we are involved in over 20 different industries. Check us out at: https://www.oracle.com/industries/construction-engineering/  As a Business Development Consultant, your focus is to generate demand for Construction & Engineering unit through a mix of outbound/inbound prospecting activities for an assigned territory. Acting as the first point of contact for prospects and leads, you will qualify Oracle Construction & Engineering prospects and produce exciting opportunities for the Oracle sales team.  Key Activities / Requirements: Two years relevant sales/business experience preferred. Detail oriented to perform database and record keeping activities. Ability to demonstrate time management, tele-sales skills and knowledge of Oracle products and services (training provided). Ability to work independently, goal-oriented individual with superior communication skills. Ability to complete individual goals as well as work in a team environment. Demonstrated ability to communicate using technical concepts. Desire for a career path in sales. Location based in Singapore, with knowledge of Bahasa Malaysia/Indonesia language preferred.

description: About MMI Asia MMI Asia is a full subsidiary of one of the world largest and leading exhibition organizers; Messe München GMBH (MMG). MMI Asia established in Singapore in 1992, is now embarking on a significant growth and expansion program, bringing some of MMG’s world leading brands to the ASEAN market. Through a combination of, geo clones, partnerships, joint-ventures, M&A and new greenfield launches, MMI Asia is growing its team in Singapore with exceptional, ambitious and innovative staff to assist the company’s growth strategies.  The Role The Sales Executive / Manager will take responsibility for the relationship building and account management of MMI Asia and MMG’s key clients both in Singapore and across the region. The role ensures that client participation in exhibitions and events overseas are seamless and valuable. The position will also support MMI Asia’s show teams to grow exhibition stand, sponsorship, and digital sales for their respective exhibitions.  Responsibilities For MMG international events: Provide detailed information about all Messe München events to exhibitors, visitors, trade association and media representatives located in Singapore Acquisition of exhibitors and visitors Implement tailored promotions, including the formation of Singapore pavilions Work with international project teams regarding exhibitors’ participation Provide support for application formalities, visa application, stand placement etc. Provide information about grant opportunities through government agencies or associations for exhibitor’s trade fair participation  For MMI Asia regional events: Support the show teams for new business acquisition Exhibition stand, sponsorship and digital sales Source, build and maintain a thorough client database Ensure accurate reporting and pipeline management Establish new and strengthen existing relationships with clients Conduct competitive intelligence  Key Skills and experience ·      2+ years in the international exhibition/event industry ·      Proficiency in English, both written and spoken ·      Commercial flair with the ability to innovate ·      Proactive and ambitious in nature is a must for this position ·      Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and observe tight deadlines ·      Familiar with Microsoft office & Salesforce ·      Self-motivated individual with good team spirit

(Ref No. 31750)  Our client, a notable Japanese multinational company is looking for a Manager - New Business Development, who will be responsible for the formulation and execution of the Healthcare’s new business strategy and mid-term plan, identify new opportunities to unlock business value to their end customers, and business partners and drive business development activities in the Asia Pacific region in liaison with local MDs.  The incumbent will be reporting to the Director of Marketing.  What they are offering Basic Salary up to SGD 7,000 AWS Variable Bonus (Depending on Company & Individual Performance) Annual Leave: 14 Days (Up to 20 days) Transport Allowance (Reimbursement) Company phone will be provided. Position (Manager) Allowance  What will you be working on Formulate and drive mid-to-long term new business strategies focusing on data services and solutions for the Asia Pacific region including but not limited to Remote Patient Monitoring schemes. Develop and manage a mid-term (3-year) and yearly P&L and investment plan in line with the mid-term strategy which is reviewed and steered every year based on in-depth analysis of the market and business environment (PEST, 3C, SWOT, Value Chain Analysis, Competitor Analysis). Monitor and optimize ongoing strategic data services to end customers and data solutions by keeping the pulse of the market and working closely with internal key stakeholders including the core operations team – globally and locally. Plan development pipeline of new data solutions with the buy-in of the relevant stakeholders (product development, technical development, business partners, etc). Commercialize and monetize new services in negotiation with potential technological enablers and business partners, setting up the end-to-end business processes and operational policies and protocols to ensure smooth cross-functional operations (software development, sales, finance, supply chain, marketing, and regulatory). Formulate appropriate performance metrics to track the business performance. Pilot new business ideas and revenue models.  What they are looking for Bachelor's Degree/Master's Degree in Business or a similar field. Minimum 7 years of working experience managing large-scale, business transformation and innovations programs/projects. In-depth understanding of sales and commercial practices and processes. Experience in risk management and driving organization-wide process improvement projects. Preferably a candidate with strong technical/technology/medical background.  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Registration No.: R1984607 (Radzi Barian Arlandito) Recruitment License : 12C5051

description: At EY, you'll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  About The Opportunity  Financial Services Organization (FSO) in Asia Pacific was launched in 2011 and has over 7,900 professionals to-date. Our construct is differentiated within EY focusing on the needs of many of the largest, most well-respected FS clients in banking, capital markets, insurance, wealth and asset management. We operate across four markets: ASEAN, Greater China, Korea and Oceania  The Accounts and BD Operations Specialist plays a vital central point of contact within the Account to support key stakeholders including Client Service Partners (CSP), Business Development Executives (BDE) and the broader account team, to proactively develop, manage and track all activity on some of EY’s most important global Financial Services accounts, working with the broader Markets function (Operations, BMC, Talent and Knowledge) in facilitating communication and global coordination.  Your key responsibilities:  In your role as an Accounts and BD Operations Specialist, you’ll focus on these key aspects: Account management Facilitating account management meetings on a regular basis Be the knowledge steward of the account and disseminate client information to the Account teams regularly Manage the relationship map including working with account teams to identify the key players and develop touch point campaigns to build and strengthen these relationships Coordinate invitations for client relationship events and meetings Oversight and management of offshore resource dedicated to account Sales and Pipeline management Manage the CRM process which includes holding the team accountable to push opportunities through the sales cycle, incorporating EY’s global sales methodology on active opportunities and client meetings, and ensuring all key client relationships are properly managed Data extraction, interpretation and transformation with the goal of highlighting useful information, deriving conclusions and supporting decision-making Support the pursuit process for the smaller to mid-range opportunities Manage and coordinate the Account revenue planning process Liaise with global Account Managers and teams on accounts in other locations Communication and administration Develop, manage and distribute communications (e.g. value scorecards, internal and external communications) Own reporting process for assigned accounts and tracking pipeline Revenue reporting Organize account team meetings Oversight and management of offshore resource dedicated to account Skills and attributes for success: 1 - 3 years of relevant work experience in account management and/or the sales process A Bachelor degree with relevant post graduate/professional qualification is desirable Professional and confident with first rate interpersonal skills and executive presence Project management experience, strong organizational skills and attention to detail Fundamental literacy in financial management will be advantageous Confidence to propose new ideas and ability to influence at all levels Work on own initiative unsupervised and ability to juggle conflicting demands on time and prioritize effectively Excellent written, oral, presentation and facilitation skills Strong Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills English language skills are essential (written and spoken).  What Working At EY Offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer: Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you  About EY  As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.  Join us in building a better working world.  Apply today.  Want to get to know us better?  Visit www.ey.com/SG/careers  Become a fan on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/eycareerssingapore  Connect with us on Linked In: http://bit.ly/EYLinked_Careers  Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/EY_Singapore

jobTitle: Digital Sales Officer - APAC (Flexible location - Singapore, Sydney or Malaysia)
description: Synopsis  It’s an exciting time to work for Etihad Airways; we’ve grown from a national carrier to a global aviation group, transforming the industry through creativity and innovation.    With a diversified portfolio of products and services, we care about delivering outstanding travel experiences and ensuring that Etihad is always a choice well made. We do this by leading with thoughtfulness, seeking excellence in everything we do, promoting greater wellness and sustainability for all, and working together to shape the future of aviation.   If you are an eCommerce/Digital sales expert in the Airline or travel trade, come join us as a Digital Sales Officer for the APAC region. You will add commercial value by developing and executing the digital sales plans and performing towards defined KPIs to meet revenue targets for the region. You will work in the fast-paced environment of e-commerce, and stay on top of trends and new technology.  Accountabilities  Assist the Digital Sales Manager East Region in developing digital sales campaigns for assigned region/market developing and managing activities to drive revenue generation through etihad.com (ey.com) sites. Co-ordinate with Revenue Management fare sanctions for all campaign elements including targeted OandDs/sales and travel dates and terms and conditions. Ensuring ey.com websites for the (country) market (local language and English language) are operational and content is accurate and up-to-date at all times. Prepare all-inclusive fare documents to brief Online Fares team for website fare displays. Identify revenue opportunities to sell Ancillary Products on ey.com based on local market insights. Brief HQ marketing teams on local ey.com campaigns with a focus on database building, email, affiliate marketing, SEO/SEM, Meta-Search, PPC and digital content. Identify partnership opportunities such as Tourism Boards, code share value-adds, loyalty and competition elements. Understand online travel agent business models and key drivers to success within this sales channel.  Co-ordinate with the Digital Transformation teams to provide local insights to ensure ongoing changes, new developments and improvements to EY website, mobile and APP meet local market requirements. CUG's | Co-ordination with sales team for lead in their market, sanction and business case approvals. Lead the co-ordination of content and creative. Monitor sales KPIs and dashboards (based on revenues and targets) to identify areas of improvement, new initiatives and propose corrective actions.  Education & Experience  Minimum Diploma (2 years or more). Minimum of 3 years sales experience within a Digital agency, Online Travel Agency or B2C e-commerce industry Ideally with airline industry background, if not at least with travel industry. Mandarin speaker - must be able to fully converse in Mandarin as a key Account Manager for specific Mandarin speaking accounts Must be a self -starter who can prove an ability to operate in a challenging environment and with multi-cultural teams Solid understanding of technology and systems used such as; GDS, CMS, Omniture, Adobe/Google analytics, Tableau, social media and other tools used to drive a digital/e-commerce channel. High computer literacy with good knowledge of MS Office applications. Excellent creative writing and presentation skills. Knowledgeable in data mining and analysis.
industries: Airlines/Aviation and Leisure, Travel & Tourism

description: The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  Global Strategic Sales  Mission Of The Team  Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ is used by the world’s most iconic brands to optimise their employee (EX), customer (CX), brand (BX) and product experiences (PX).  Our mission is to drive the holistic adoption and standardisation of the Experience Management (XM) platform across the largest and most strategic brands in the world. We are laser focused on standardising the next set of major flagship brands on XM. We take a full portfolio view and work across the different product pillars CX, EX, BX and PX.  Job Description  You will be a key member of a focused global team which reports directly into the Chief Revenue Officer and represents the highest level of strategic sales. We operate against a list of our most strategic accounts that represent the future XM flagship customers and work tightly with regional Enterprise Sales Leaders and local AEs. You will drive the full portfolio of XM and standardisation for the firm, develop multi-year account plans and pursue the deployment of our entire product portfolio, not just single product sales. You will be deep in sales execution and sales strategy which includes: developing relationships, negotiating global framework agreements, connecting stakeholders to flagship XM firms, engaging with partners in the right place and right time, and championing C-Level events. You will orchestrate the full-suite of Qualtrics supporting resources for the right plays at the right time, across Marketing/ABM, Solution Strategy, XM Scientists, Program Architects, PSPs, Tech Sales, pricing strategy, SAP and direct line sales management.  Success is creating some of the largest customers of Qualtrics and driving mobilisation across the full XM portfolio -- all XM applications and use cases.  Expectations For Success Achieve and exceed ‘new bookings’ revenue targets across a named account list of Qualtrics’ most strategic customers and the full XM portfolio Lead, inspire and create vision for customers and those around you. In other words, be a beacon and shape and demonstrate the art of the possible Develop multi-year success plans and orchestrate ecosystem to win as many XM use cases as possible and develop a sustainable customer relationship Build champions and rally executives around XM and associated business value Create and leverage best practices for selling enterprise-wide executive adoption of XM Navigate and overcome obstacles and challenges in the way of winning. Effectively navigate Qualtrics as a nuanced, fast-growing organisation Build strong relationships with local sales reps, leaders, customers, and other internal orgs supporting your success In sum, this role is focused on creating Qualtrics’s next set of flagship full XM portfolio customers and ELA’s  Qualifications & Requirements 10-15 years of extensive and relevant market experience, selling into front-office as well as back-office functions Demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding quotas and developing global accounts with decentralised, regional budgets, where aligning both the customer as well as internal teams is a key success criteria Motivator and leader with a passion for the Qualtrics mission and for developing new approaches to nuanced challenges - easily move others to action by planning, inspiring, and organising Proven ability to execute and implement change - a scrappy self-starter. Ideally, experience in the space of Customer Experience, Employee Experience and/or related product suites (e.g. Experience Cloud, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, HCM, VoC, BI) Experience interacting with clients in pre-sales capacity, industry capacity and/or consultant (internal or external consultant) Deep understanding of Qualtrics product portfolio and the competitive landscape Has a good balance of risk taking and judgment Is confident and able to operate independently of a large staff Commands the respect of teams that they work alongside Exceptional presentation skills Willingness and ability to travel between 25-60% Preview YouTube video What is Qualtrics? | The world’s first Experience Management Platform  What is Qualtrics? | The world’s first Experience Management Platform  Preview YouTube video Work at Qualtrics!  Work at Qualtrics!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: In this role, you will help drive the company’s commercial growth strategy and initiatives. Your priority will be to drive the top line of our maritime drone delivery business in Singapore. You will ensure revenue goals are achieved, maintain a sales pipeline and use available platforms to track sales performances.  You will actively identify, engage, and build relationships with potential customers in the maritime sector in Singapore. You will listen to them, understand their needs and pain points, and develop solutions around our drone technologies to ensure customer success. Shaping, negotiating, closing and executing commercial contracts should be your forte.  You will play an active role in sharpening the go-to-market strategy for F-drones and contribute to the overall company strategy. This will include, but not limited to, working with our marketing manager to build our brand. You can also innovate new techniques and methods to increase sales and profit margins.  In addition, you will work closely with the CEO to identify and assess business opportunities outside Singapore. You will help analyse global market opportunities, produce market reports, identify potential key customers and develop business proposals for international targets. As our business also interfaces with aviation and port regulations, you will also need to understand relevant regulations and support the CEO’s engagements with them.  Where necessary, you will analyse, identify and initiate strategic alliances around the world, which can accelerate the commercialisation of our drone products and services.  Your profile Bachelors or Diploma in Business, Economics, Engineering, Aerospace or Maritime-related fields At least 2 years’ experience in business development, financial analysis and market research in the maritime sector Strong understanding of the port and maritime industry in Singapore, especially the supply-demand dynamics between ship owners, charterers, managers, port agents and launch operators Strong existing relationships with ship owners, charterers, managers and port agents Expertise in developing business proposals, contract negotiations and execution Ability to understand technical specifications of aerial drones Additional experience in drones, logistics or technology sectors will be appreciated Passionate about drones, marine & offshore and sustainability Effective in a fast-paced, demanding and constantly evolving environment Entrepreneurial and resourceful in closing sales Enthusiastic team player with pioneering spirit Willing to travel, if required Excellent communications skills in English, including written and presentation skills Competency in a third language, such as Mandarin and Spanish, is a plus

Account Executive, Singapore  Darktrace is the world’s first and largest self-learning Cyber AI company, helping thousands of companies around the world solve one of today’s most pressing challenges. As we continue our rapid expansion, we have opportunities to join our global sales team, earn significant commissions, enjoy fast paced development, and be part of one of the world’s most exciting and innovative companies.  We are seeking ambitious and driven individuals to join our highly successful team of Account Executives in Singapore covering the Singapore market.  Is this right for you? As an Account Executive you'll play a key role in driving the sales operation, from prospecting for new business to closing deals, and managing an exciting portfolio of client accounts. You'll work with in-house technical experts to present Darktrace’s unique AI solution to information security experts. This role is suited to candidates who are seeking a target-driven sales environment, and have the ability to manage accounts high levels of autonomy. You'll be looking for a meritocratic environment with strong opportunities for development and progression. You'll also have: A degree from a leading university, achieving at least a 2.1 or B equivalent Confidence prospecting your own leads Polished communication skills and ability to build strong and lasting working relationships  About us: Darktrace is a global leader in cyber security AI, delivering world-class technology that protects over businesses, critical services and infrastructure from cyber-threats. Its award-winning technology applies cutting-edge machine learning and mathematics to cyber-security.   The company was the first to develop and commercialise AI for cyber security, and its software engineering team is world renowned.  One of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies, Darktrace listed on the London Stock Exchange in April 2021 and now has a market cap of over £6bn, 1,600+ employees and 5,600+ customers, with offices worldwide.  Darktrace has been named one of TIME Magazine’s ‘100 Most Influential Companies’.  To learn more about us and our leading technology, visit www.darktrace.com.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: Company Description  PowerAdvocate, a Verisk Analytics business, delivers data and insights that operators in the energy and natural resources industry use to improve business performance. Our core asset is our $6 trillion+ proprietary database and technology platform which we apply to solve some of the world’s most complex cost management challenges for our customers in the power, oil and gas, minerals, and renewable energy sectors.  Job Description  About the Role:  PowerAdvocate is a fast-growing company at the intersection of technology, big data, and the energy and natural resources industry. We are looking for driven, self-starting individuals to support strategy, sales, and marketing efforts in our global business.  Job Responsibilities  As an Associate, you will play a critical role in supporting our customer engagement efforts, go-to-market strategy, and aggressive future company growth goals. Unlike traditional roles at many other data and software companies, you will have the opportunity to work on projects across the customer relationship lifecycle – from strategy creation to lead generation to deal closing – gaining an unparalleled level of autonomy, responsibility, and client exposure.  Responsibilities  While Associates are responsible for a variety of tasks in the service of generating revenue and accelerating growth for PowerAdvocate, some common activities include Interfacing directly with clients via our consultative sales model Performing proprietary market analyses to provide unique data insights to the market Developing messaging to communicate the value of PowerAdvocate’s software and data products to the market, and managing content marketing campaigns Supporting new market entry efforts Qualifications  Who We Are Looking For:  Some Other Things We Are Looking For Include  Our Associates have come from a variety of professional and educational backgrounds, so we are not solely focused on a candidate’s experience. What we are really looking for are individuals who are smart, ambitious, hungry to learn, and who want to work in a collaborative, team-based environment. Degree from a top-tier undergraduate program 0 – 1 year of experience Strong analytical and communication skills – we want people who can tell a story with numbers, and who aren’t afraid of digging into data Preference for a fast-paced entrepreneurial culture Desire to tackle interesting challenges and unique opportunities with limited guidance What Else You Will Get  There are a lot of reasons to work at PowerAdvocate, but nothing is as impactful as the business training and professional opportunities you will receive from our team. From day one, you will get: The opportunity to learn foundational business skills that will help jumpstart a career in technology, energy, entrepreneurship, or sales and marketing Significant professional growth in an environment where personal development is a core tenet of the team’s culture The opportunity to take on an enormous amount of responsibility early on your career Vibrant, start-up culture! Additional Information  At PowerAdvocate, we celebrate differences and are committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our workforce to provide opportunities for our employees, our clients and our business. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer – F/M/D/V  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for this position will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

description: We have a winning culture. But to win, hard skills are not enough. Just like in championship, our leaders need mental strength. We foster our Sales Leader’s mindset through a set of coaching system that we want to develop and empower in our people. These are the leaders who will be the core of our unique company culture.  What you can achieve: - Opportunities to travel overseas for business exposure and conference - Personal growth and development - Confidence over time and achievements  What do we see in you: - Competitiveness Driving yourself to be better than who you were before. To thrive in a 100% performance base environment and refuse to give up even after the buzz beater. - Team player Actively contribute to the team in order to meet desired goals. Respect team's idea and aim to improve the process at hand. - Not Afraid of Failure Always experimenting new ways to improve the process and in the mist of it, overcoming countless failures and still keep on going.  What you have to do: - Conduct face to face presentation to potential customers - Generate high quality sales and market shares - Assist in expansion of company’s operations  DON’T send in your resume if you just want a friendly match. SEND if you’re ready to win!

Job Description:  Get to know the Team  As a Junior Account Manager, you will be responsible for establishing and managing strong business relationships with long-tail merchants (top 500-2500) to increase their engagement with GrabFood. Ads or Marketing services) and business goals to inform cross-sell strategy Work with the Merchant Strategy and Execution team to manage the pipeline of merchants scheduling business reviews Maintain detailed notes on the business review and merchant needs post-review Work with the broader Grab team (Sales, Operations, Marketing) to develop value added services for longtail merchants (ie. Webinars, Conferences, Product enhancements) The Must-Haves Bachelor (or above) degree in Business/ Management or equivalent Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify and provide comprehensive solutions for varying customer needs Ability to pay attention to detail without losing sight of the big picture Strong quantitative skills and ability to present complex concepts in clear, concise, understandable way Have a competitive edge and thrive in a team environment
