description: The ideal candidate will help drive revenue growth by building a strong pipeline of sales leads and helping create the market strategy. You will be responsible for establishing a strong relationship with new prospects as well as maintaining a strong relationship with existing accounts. Your effective communication and interpersonal skills will help you succeed as a Senior Account Executive.    Responsibilities Build a strong pipeline of prospective clients Manage and track client outreach Strategize innovative ways to reach new clients Communicate strategy to relevant team-members  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 3+ years' of relevant experience Organized and able to multi-task Strong verbal and written communication skills

Want to be part of the fastest growing startup that is at the intersection of Retail, Fintech and Data?  Qashier is looking for an amazing Business Development Manager to support our growth!  We are a dynamic and fast growing team that is excited about commerce, retail and payments, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology.  We are looking for passionate individuals that can spearhead the growth of the company through the generation of new leads and acquiring of new merchants. If you have knowledge and/or keen interest in the area of point of sale, payment systems and B2B sales, this role might be for you.  In short, you’ll be driving Qashier’s success in the following ways: Generating new leads and sales opportunities through cold calls and emails, direct sales, referrals – main goal here is to be creative (and daring) in your approach! Recommending the best solution to merchants and closing deals: You’ll act as a trusted adviser with each merchant, working with them to establish their business goals and recommending the best solution to achieve those goals. Assist with onboarding of new merchants: Onboarding of new merchants involve setting up and deploying the Qashier system according to each merchant’s requirements. As the initial point of contact, you’ll be working closely with the Account Management team to onboard new merchants according to their requirements.  What you should bring along Diploma/Degree in any field 2+ years of experience in B2B sales, merchant acquisition and/or POS and payments systems Passionate about technology, fintech and the retail space Strong interpersonal skills and readiness to go the extra mile for our merchants Outgoing with good bilingual oral skills Highly driven and energetic individuals with a strong willingness to learn  Why join Qashier? Be at the forefront of a fast-growing startup in an exciting sector. Qashier’s innovative platform combines the latest developments in Cloud technology, Payments and Data to transform the Retail and F&B industries. You’ll play a crucial role on the growth of a revolutionary product that will become a key platform behind successful retail businesses in the region. Amazing growth and learning opportunities. We are a tight knit team where everyone grows together. We’ll continuously work with you to refine your strengths and strengthen your weaknesses to further your personal and career development. Make a strong impact with your work. You’ll be working directly with hundreds of small businesses across the region where the work that you do will make a direct impact to the success of these businesses. Attractive compensation and uncapped commissions  ABOUT QASHIER Qashier (qashier.com) powers SMEs with a technology platform that combines a smart POS terminal and integrated payment acceptance with a diverse app store of both in-house and third party business applications. By pairing technology with a strong commitment to merchant success, Qashier helps retail and F&B businesses increase revenue, streamline operations, and create loyal customers.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Retail, and Food & Beverages

description: HOW YOU'LL HELP US KEEP CLIMBING (OVERVIEW & KEY RESPONSIBILITIES) At Delta Air Lines, we are focused on building an organization operated by people with an unwavering commitment to superior customer experience to further position Delta as the world's most trusted airline in the eyes of our employees and customers.  As a Customer Experience Specialist, you will join a service and sales focused team in high energy call center environment, focused on listening to, caring for and connecting with customers.  In this position, you will answer calls in an efficient, courteous and accurate manner, while assessing customer needs and offering solutions and additional products. Ideal candidates should demonstrate the desire to make our customer's travel not only superior but memorable.This position is full-time with comprehensive health and wellness benefits, performance incentive programs, and Delta's industry-leading travel privileges.  Successful candidates will form a hiring class scheduled as early as May 2021 in our Singapore Engagement Center. Life at our Singapore Customer Engagement Center: Centrally located at the Singapore Post Center 2 minutes away from Paya Lebar MRT station, surrounded by 3 shopping malls, entertainment, and 24-hour food center 5-7 minutes awayModern break room offering snacks and beverage options and free Wi-FiLocal community engagement activities within Singapore as well as participation with Relay for Life and Day of Hope, Breast Cancer Research Foundation (BCRF), and Family Fun DayDelta employees, spouse/children can take advantage of interline agreements that provide space available travel at a reduced rate on many other airlines from around the world.Discounts available to global attractions, hotels and cruises through Delta Perks! Job Summary:Customer Experience Specialists connect with customers via phone and create an experience where customers know they have been heard and understood and feel valued and important, which is accomplished by:Effective listeningQuickly identifying and owning customer issuesActively search for solutions to problemsMaking quality decisionsInteracting with a globally diverse group of customers and colleaguesSpecialists sell travel related services, including car rental and credit card vendor partner products. Customer Experience Specialists demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills, a professional attitude, excellent dependability, the ability to handle stressful situations, possess strong computer skills, flexibility in a fast-paced environment, and the ability to learn and react quickly. Specialists must understand and adhere to all Delta and U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) compliance requirements.Employees will have future opportunities to progress to specialty teams that respond to customer escalations or resolve complex international ticketing issues.  As Delta continues to offer new ways for our customers to connect with us, Specialists may also have opportunities to assist customers via Twitter, Facebook or other emerging social media platforms. Compensation and Training:The starting pay for this position is SGD$1,983.00 per month, with an increase to SGD$2,045.00 after 6 months, and to SGD$2,138.00 after one year. The position is also eligible for performance-based incentive after 6 months’ probation, shift premium for PM shifts, monthly shared rewards if company meets KPIs and annual pay increases.Successful candidates will participate in a comprehensive classroom and on-the-job training. Classroom training includes instruction, observation, exams and performance measures.After training, we will assign new employees to a shift that may be significantly different than your training shift and will include two consecutive days off likely midweek. New employees will remain on that shift until the employee is eligible to bid on a shift they select. New hires are eligible to bid on a new shift during the first shift bid following completion of new hire training. Employees bid on preferred shifts every 3-4 months.  New hires are often awarded PM shifts with midweek days off until they are able to hold different shifts based on seniority.  Delta is a 24/7 operation, and we will always have customers that need us. Your health and safety: Our values-based culture puts people at the heart of every decision. Since the beginning of the pandemic, protecting Delta people, their families, our customers, candidates and making your health and safety our first priority has been the driving force behind every decision we have made.We adhere to the latest Local Ministry of Health (MOH) Guidelines. Temperature checks/screenings are performed at every Delta facility before entry. In addition, Delta requires wearing a mask while in the office, staying 1 meter apart and practicing good hygiene. WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED (MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS)- O-level educational qualification (Singaporean) with a credit in English or higher/ Diploma or Degree (foreigner).- Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles- Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority- Possess correct legal documentation to live and work in Singapore- Be fluent written and verbally in English- This role requires computer skills and comfort with navigating software applications, email, instant messaging, and internet searches.- Must be able to demonstrate clear, pleasant, and courteous verbal and written communication using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation- Must have a flexible schedule as this position will require you to work weekends, holidays and including night shift WHAT WILL GIVE YOU A COMPETITIVE EDGE (PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS)At least one year of experience working in salesAt least one year of experience providing customer service
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Retail, and Leisure, Travel & Tourism

description: Position : Merchant Success Associate (Key Account) - SHOPLINE SINGAPORE  About SHOPLINE:  SHOPLINE is Asia’s largest smart commerce platform. With our customers in mind, we strive to deliverscalable commerce solutions to merchants of all sizes. We’re a full-featured platform with services including online store opening, O2O solution, retail POS systems, advertising placement, business strategy consultation, marketing, and more to empower merchants to succeed in omnichannel retailing and cross-border commerce.  What You’ll Be Doing:  Reporting to the Head of Merchant Success, you will be responsible for: Building and executing account level strategies to drive GMV growth for your accounts Monitoring and optimizing daily sales for your key accounts through the following: Ensuring product availability by planning stock allocations with key accounts Monitoring and planning traffic driving mechanics to key accounts Identifying content improvements to convert traffic Working with your key accounts to improve on their ability to fulfill orders in a timely fashion. Monitoring and working with key accounts to use promotional tools to convert traffic Planning and delivering revenue growth for your portfolio by: Working with key accounts to grow their assortment on their websites Pitching and selling Ad packages Adoption of Shopline tech (Shopline payments,Shopline Logistics, etc) among your key accounts. Reviewing weekly, monthly and quarterly performance vs. plan with your key merchants Working with cross-functional teams to execute strategic projects,as well as address merchants, concerns with regards to operations, finance or marketing  Who We Are Looking For:  Bachelor’s Degree in related fields Minimum two years of work experience in e-commerce, retail, business development, buying or project management role Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal with demonstrated ability to influence others. Strong analytical skills backed by intermediate knowledge of Excel, ability to use data to understand root causes of performance and make decisions. Action and solution-oriented mindset, comfortable in fast-moving entrepreneurial environment Strong ownership and attention to details Passion about improving both customer and seller experience
jobFunction: Information Technology, Project Management, and Consulting
industries: Internet

As a Sales Support Coordinator, you will be providing support to specific customers, building relationships by providing excellent service to customers, implementing consultative approach with customers and establishing possibilities of upgrading their solutions, handing customer quotations on sales information and negotiation, recording and updating sales information in business systems, providing support in marketing activities when necessary and collect relevant information to be recorded in their business systems. description: We are inviting individuals who share our values of constantly doing things that make sense, willing to face challenges, making necessary sacrifices, and adapting to changes.  The ideal candidate is someone who has a client-centric mindset and is capable of analyzing customer behavior in a dynamic environment. As a Sales Executive, your primary focus will be cultivating strong client relationships. You will bridge the gap between merchants, key business stakeholders, and customers. You are expected to have strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate across departments in enhancing the effectiveness and efficiency of the business operations and sales strategies.  Therefore, a commitment to overcome difficult challenges and the conviction to serve merchants and users are must-have qualities.  Responsibilities: Attending networking activities to research and connect with prospective clients. Maintaining meaningful relationships with existing clients by having genuine interests in minimizing frictions in their day to day business operations. Build customer relationships through strategic conversations to understand organizational business objectives and goals. Conduct comprehensive research for all merchants which are in Singapore that are suitable for our products and services. Find solutions for all the problems that occur during the operation hours of all existing merchants which include physically being at merchants’ business locations as soon as problems appear. Facilitate proper onboarding of merchants by being physically present at the merchant’s site for roughly two weeks to assist on matters relating to taking orders, serving their customers, and guiding merchants on the operation of the app while introducing and explain the app to new and existing users. Analyze feedback from both merchants and their customers to provide solutions on how current approaches can be improved. Provide support for day-to-day operations as required.  Key Qualifications: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills while capable of working under pressure. Exhibits strong communication, relationship management, and customer retention skills. A great team player who can work with internal and external partners with an immense amount of curiosity to learn from the best practices. Ability to manage time, smartly organize work priorities, and multi-task in an efficient and effective manner. Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Good computer literacy and proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.

Main Purpose Of Role  To be responsible for maintaining and developing a single/ group of key accounts in order to exceed company set sales and profit targets across range of ‘Must have’ product lines. Implementing the hyper market business plan Maximising sales Forecasting and planning Range and category development Promotions planning Managing in stock/product lifecycle Better coordination of business activities  Key Responsibilities  Financials In conjunction with Sales Manager, deliver the financial targets (sales and profitability) for designated key accounts. Relationship Management & Business Planning Establish ongoing business relations with major account buyers Formulate and implement effective sales strategy and promotion plans for key accounts: develop, present and execute plan, sales and promotions, negotiation of trading terms and trade spends. Work in conjunction with Marketing department to formulate the trade promotion programs Participate in the formal quarterly business review process with key accounts. Category Management Maximize sales profit through improving shelving and display, implementing promotions and new product launching Ensure the execution of the Hasbro marketing plan with key accounts in a timely manner. Implement key store drivers (range, space, promotion and display), working with store planning teams where applicable. Ensure appropriate approvals in place for planograms, end caps, display stands and feature areas/ special events as negotiated with buyers. Work with marketing team to review catalogue layouts and content before going to print. Participate in regular local Sales and Marketing meetings Forecasting & Inventory Management Generating sales forecast/analysis and market insights reports on product trend development and competitors' activities Working with key account forecast, work with buying teams on stock flow (taking into consideration agreed business plan and Hasbro’s financial goals). Working with Operations team, ensure inventory is available for upcoming events Look at stand-out issues for inventory: discuss possible action plans with key account (e.g. clearance or increase stock weights), communicate issues internally. Requirements  Professional Know-how University or Diploma graduate in relevant discipline Minimum 5 years in Consumer/Retail Sales and/or Key Account Management, where at least 3 years is on distributor management Multi brand sales experience in the local market Work Effectiveness & Adaptability Excellent verbal and written English Clear persuasive communicator (written and verbal) including active listening ability PC literate with good working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint Results oriented, risk tolerant and persistent in fast paced, pressurised environment Good prioritisation and organisational skills Adapts response to circumstances, flexible in handling change and comfortable working independently. Business Understanding Category management / Trade Marketing exposure desirable Customer/ Consumer Focus Develops effective business relationships and manages difficult people effectively to seize opportunities Strong planning skills – focused on execution and the customer Ability to use influencing and negotiating skills to achieve results (both internally and externally) Excellent Presentation skills Problem Analysis & Decision Making Numerate, ability to analyse data and sales information and use it to generate new ideas
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Customer Business Development – Heart of Synagie As part of the Customer Business Development team, you will help deliver retail sales target, optimize customer profits, manage inventory holdings to a mutually agreed target, and develop channel trade plans with customer to ensure timely execution of trade plans of the online boutique/s of the brand/s you manage. Equipped with enthusiasm and skill, you will be primarily responsible to:   1. Develop and build long term strategic relationship with assigned key customer(s) •To be the channel experts for customers so as to advice and develop business to achieve goals Channels refer to offline channels and / or online channels such as Lazada, Shopee, Zalora, etc. •Develop, align and implement channel portfolio strategies, go-to-channel routes and promotional plans to achieve mutually agreed business goals. •Regular meetings and quarterly business review with customer(s) and channels to ensure business progress and alignment towards agreed goals •Submission of trade investments and promotional claims to customer(s) per agreed amount  2. Manage channels' (online & offline) activities for assigned customer(s) •To conduct advance planning and gain alignment on business activities with customers and channels •To execute and review agreed plans on channels’ seller centers and exercise entrepreneurship to drive business targets •To manage all channels' seller centers from trade activities to ensuring strong seller's store ratings •To conduct post activity / promotion analysis so as to improve and enhance forward plans •Pitch and negotiate with channels’ category manager to maximize brand’s exposure and visibility  3. Business Custodian for Synagie •To understand assigned customer(s) P&L and identify areas for growth / improvements •To negotiate trade terms and margins with customer to achieve win-win scenario •To prepare analysis and presentations in preparation for any trade / channel negotiations    Synagie believes you will be an awesome fit for this role if you: 1. Hold a bachelor’s degree in any discipline of study; 2. Are keen to work in the eCommerce industry; 3. Have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong commercial acumen; 4. Are passionate about consumer experience, innovation, health, beauty and fashion; 5. Possess good communication skills and able to work in a fast paced but nurturing environment; 6. Are a team player   Why Choose to join Synagie:   The vision. Synagie wants to be the best. We thrive on innovation. We are competitive, but we compete only with ourselves. The feeling of working on something that will only get bigger and better is unparalleled.  The culture. We have and startup culture and everyone has a voice. We promote an environment of open discussions and we treat each other as a family.  The people. We have such an incredible and diverse mix of people from all walks of life. You will work with the smartest, warmest, and most talented people in this industry. Working with such remarkable professionals makes one beam with pride.  The expertise. The main thrust of Synagie is continuous improvement of talent through mentoring, testing & learning, and training. We make sure you grow where you want to. With us, you will be able to learn so much about products, processes and providing excellent customer experience - all of which may pave future opportunities to manage the company’s business while chartering the next chapter of Synagie’s growth and a lot more!  The E-Commerce. Be in the thick of the E-Commerce action where we work with FMCG and Prestige Beauty brands as well as Channel partners to drive business growth, consumers' penetration and enhance shopping journey.
industries: Internet

description: We are a fast growing gaming technology company looking to expand in new international markets. The ideal candidate is a motivated, organised, and creative individual who welcomes the challenges of acquiring and developing new business through sales efforts. You will build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and close business deals while maintaining an extensive knowledge of current market conditions. The position has huge growth potential and we will build a team around you.  Responsibilities Cultivate strong business relationships with key decision makers Proactively identify new opportunities and deliver innovative solutions to customers Develop market strategies by researching lists of high potential prospects  Qualifications High integrity and motivation to succeed Excellent communicator in both Chinese and English Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business Independent team player and works well under pressure Experience in business development operations or similar roles or gaming industry will be a plus but not a must as we are open to all talents with potentials

About Workato  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why: Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 large company for remote workers  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave  Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Commercial Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible to: Present, promote and sell products/services using well-formed arguments to existing and prospective customers; provide product demonstration to prospects Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs; proactively help customers to assess Workato throughout the decision process Regularly evaluate market potential, track sales and status reports; analyze market to formulate plans to win and grow new and existing businesses by working with Marketing, Customer Success and Product Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales potential; create detailed prospecting lists using various methods to identify and win new enterprise customers Establish and maintain positive business and customer relationships. Increase visibility of Workato across all departments within customer accounts Schedules customer onboarding calls; transitions the customer to Customer Success; expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Work effectively in teams to maximize revenue potential and ensure customer success Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service experience to Workato's customers Meet and exceed sales targets and outcomes within schedule Identify and leverage trends within industry of expertise/focus Continuously improve through feedback  Requirements  Qualifications and Experience At least 1 - 2 years of Commercial Software Sales experience in a technology space. Needs to be based in Singapore Has prior experience in closing deals in software or technology sales in Asia (Excluding Japan) Technical background or good understanding of technology and industry trends, especially in the app integration space preferred Experience in customer sales, account management or consulting preferred  Skills High level of comfort presenting key client issues, be the customer advocate within Workato Strong critical thinking, analytical skills with an entrepreneurial and proactive mindset Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and manage time, even under high-pressure situations Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About the Job Global Green Connect is a dynamic company offering comprehensive sustainability services. With partners across the globe, we thrive to provide an integrated sustainability network that re-engineers the ecosystem of business. We provide sustainability consulting, market entry advisory, business accelerator program and ESG training. Our subsidiary GGEF (Global Green Economic Forum) is a purpose-driven social enterprise headquartered in Singapore since 2013, it empowers future leaders with innovation, sustainability and leadership through its conference, awards, SDG Open Hack and training programmes.  Job Summary The Business Development Manager for Global Green Connect has to be passionate about sustainability and business. The ideal candidate will be responsible together with the management team to retain existing clients & partners and source new clients & business partners in the regional business community.  To be successful in this role you should have a thorough understanding of sustainability, training business and sponsorship sales. Ultimately, success is driven by understanding the needs of the client and providing them with the right solution.   We will welcome applicants who do not have experience in Sustainability but you should be able to demonstrate a strong interest in the topic.  Responsibilities Responsible for developing new business opportunities and relationships to grow GGC business in the APAC region Understand client needs and identify business opportunities Be the advocate to the customer towards their stakeholders  Collaborate with regional & global partners to find and close new business and implement the customer solution Collaborate with internal stakeholders in sales, marketing and management team to define the go-to-market strategy  Engage with the management team to leverage the existing pool of GGC network to generate leads Develop compelling offers and proposals together with our product experts & consultants Responsible to close commercial agreements with clients & business partners  Represent GGC in client meetings and conference Identify market trends and provide inputs for product & service development  Maintain existing business  Requirements Proven track record of selling event sponsorship, training or sustainability related services of at least 3-4 years of working experience Experience in B2B  Strong communication and interpersonal skills Proven knowledge and execution of successful development strategies Focused and goal-oriented Fluency in English, Mandarin is a plus  Desirable Experienced working in small interdisciplinary teams, ideally within an international and multicultural context  Understanding of the business drivers behind sustainability, ESG, SDGs and TCFD Understanding of start up and/or accelerator programme

On the heels of Asana’s exponential global growth, we are hiring a Channel Partner Manager in Singapore to join our growing APAC Channel Partnerships team. Channel Partnerships, which includes a variety of revenue-driving partnerships, are critical for the company’s success and this is an exciting opportunity to build and grow an important part of the business.  As a quota-carrying Channel Partner Manager you will report to and work closely with our Head of APAC Channel Partnerships, based out of Singapore, to drive and shape our Channel Partnerships program.  You are a relationship builder who enjoys enabling new revenue streams, especially at the most senior levels between regional systems integrators, software solutions providers and key clients and prospects across the region.  You may have experience in channel partner management, channel sales, or direct enterprise sales - but importantly have a passion for building partner relationships and programs.  What You’ll Achieve Identify, recruit, and onboard partners in South Asia with a primary focus on India, but also covering Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and Pakistan. Track and be responsible for metrics in South Asia, primarily revenue, that indicate partner success. You will own a quota. Collaborate with partners to develop a strong GTM plan and manage co-marketing activities such as events, webinars, etc. Maintain and support ongoing partner relationships, including partners’ capabilities to provide post-sales services and grow accounts Support the global Channel Partnerships team in moving strategic partners up the value chain, enabling us to capture more enterprise value About You Thoughtful about the strategy and metrics you set, but also able to hustle and execute on those plans. This role is very hands-on and you enjoy that. Knowledgeable about the B2B SaaS sales motion, and able to ensure that partners can successfully replicate that when selling Asana, especially among regional systems integrators and at the enterprise level. Balanced in developing short-term solutions and celebrating small wins, while iterating and optimizing partner operations and experience for the long-term Experience in closing deals A creative thinker who drives new ideas to build the Asana partnership ecosystem beyond traditional IT channel / distribution models 5+ years in a similar role within an international / B2B SaaS company Experience selling to APAC based organisations via partners, especially in India Fluency in English About Us  Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world, from small businesses to large enterprises, rely on Asana to manage everything from company objectives to digital transformation to product launches and marketing campaigns. For the past 5 years, we've been named a top workplace, including top 10 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces, #1 Fortune Best Workplace in the Bay Area for four years in a row, #8 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, #14 Glassdoor Best Place to Work , and one of Ireland's Best Workplaces . After spending more than a year physically distanced, we are safely and mindfully returning our global teams to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture . With offices all over the world, we are always looking for curious, collaborative, and mission-driven people to help us enable the world’s teams to work together effortlessly.  We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of any educational background, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, and veteran status.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: VC Regional Key Account Manager - APAC
description: Strategic account management  The role is responsible for managing allocated Key Account customers, via the customers head office, achieving Sales, Profitability, Investment and Service Level targets for all allocated Key Customers. The role will create enduring business partnerships, enabling the growth of the APAC dry eye and contact lens solution market, increasing Alcon’s market share and achieving company sales and distribution budgets, and allowing Alcon to compete equitably, in a very competitive market environment.  Key Responsibilities Build strong and enduring business partnerships with Alcon Key Account customers, by creating strategies for business development, guided by market dynamics, channel segmentation and Alcon business plans. Oversees alignment between Alcon markets to primary customer plans and execute appropriately, leading to the identification of new initiatives for implementation whilst negating commercial risks Achievement of Sales/Distribution targets and Investment budgets for nominated key customers. Monitor targets and budgets on an on-going basis to ensure financial objectives are achieved. Strategic thinking and idea generation, driven from the analysis of customer and market data. Develop overall conclusions regarding accounts, markets, and competitive business results, using complex data from multiple sources. The findings are used to identify opportunities and forecast results. Proactively identify competitive activity, which may have major, long-term impact on sales goals/strategies. Provide recommendations and cost effective plans of action. In collaboration with the Market Key Account Managers, develop initiatives to provide competitive point of difference using knowledge of industry trends and competitive environment Document issues and proposals in a succinct and persuasive manner. Present to groups representing multiple points of view, and formulate and execute a collaborative strategy. Create and implement “Joint Business Plans”, encompassing promotional investment, sales planning, distribution, service plans and delivery of the brand sales/strategies. In collaboration with the Regional Pricing Manager and Area Marketing Director and other stakeholders, develop customer negotiation strategies and framework, and drive alignment across customers, operating to minimise exposure and maximise return. Education  Bachelor of Science, Commerce or Marketing  Experience Minimum 3-5 years of Key Account Experience in ASIA Preferably 1-3 years of relevant Key Account Customer experience Minimum 3 years of sales experience in a pharmaceutical environment Minimum >1 year of marketing experience in the pharmaceutical industry Market research knowledge Strong organisation, communication and presentation skills Computer literacy in Microsoft office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel) Proven analytical and problem solving skills Ability to multi-task, while maintaining good attention to detail
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Marketing and Advertising, and Retail

Active participation to RFQ, collaborate with both Products & Pricing team for timely submission. Meet and exceed GP & Volume growth in line with Sales targets / KPIs. Focus on strong client engagement through high level of services and trusted relationship to drive sustainable business growth and profitability. jobTitle: Business Development Manager (International Customers and Strategic RTM Transformation)
description: Location: Singapore, Singapore  Summary  This position will be responsible for developing and implementing strategy for the long-term business with international customers in APAC, based on our 3 key pillars of growth. Position as a strategic partner Collaborate bigger and better Provide exclusive offering The role requires to assess and implement RTM transformation base on APAC model, achieving market financial goals which includes but is not limited to: revenue in terms of net sales, gross profit, category/market share (where applicable) and operating income by developing and executing sales and trade marketing plans, working closely with Marketing, Finance and Supply Chain and ensuring effective coverage of sales territories and execution of agreed marketing strategies.  Where applicable, this role is responsible for achieving channel and customer profitability as well as market share goals vis a vis identified customers or channels. The delivery of the Net sales and gross profit are the key deliverable of the role. Within the function – the role delivers on controlling of sales expenses and controllable portions of the SG&A line. The role also coordinates and delivers on achieving the optimal supply chain platform for his or her market/s.  The role entails developing and implementing an effective and coordinated trade marketing and sales plan in support of organizational and regional/ business unit strategies and other globally or regionally driven efforts. The role is also a customer facing role representing the corporation with recognized customers and/or relevant organizations, partners, and suppliers within the markets  The role is ultimately responsible for the development and training of key distributor personnel for markets under his or her business unit. He or she must be abreast of current trade trends, market conditions and marketing, finance, supply chain and sales enablers through continued education and training.  The business development manager role is expected to leverage and grow partnerships with key customers for the markets under the business unit. He or she is the main liaison with the Marketing, Finance and Supply Chain regional or sub-regional support teams.  Major Duties/Responsibilities  MARKET STRATEGIES Defines and grows the business through effective customer marketing and sales business plans, Channel, category, and key customer strategies at trade level. Clearly establishes: “where to win” and “how to win” trade, customer, category, and shopper programs that deliver the outcomes required with clear marketing, sales and financial deliverables. The role leads customer marketing, field sales, and Supply Chain in delivering profitable growth for key customers. Leads the articulation of geographic, channel, customer, and category priorities and what it will take to deliver against the strategies – he or she is the key communicator of this at all forums. Communicates and consistently monitors progress of the execution of the strategy with internal and external stakeholders. Develops and executes joint business plans with identified key customers within markets. In all called out areas below, the role will comply with or develop the right measurables at all levels to ensure delivery and visibility of progress (or the lack of it) in achieving business goals. SALES AND CUSTOMER/TRADE MARKETING EXECUTION Owns and manages the total trade spend budget for the Countries/ Customers. Plans full year trade spend in line with yearly activity plan, monitors actuals vs budget on a monthly basis, and adjusts year to go plan as needed in order to meet business objectives within agreed budget. Delivers the agreed market strategies in-store or channels. The role articulates and delivers to his or her marketing partners ideas, positions and insights that will deliver the right positioning, price, product, promotion and place for markets under the business unit. The role is a key participant in the development of marketing plans and strategies and owns the delivery of marketing ambitions in channels, customers and categories. Oversees the delivery of the sales and customer/trade marketing goals through the distributor by creating well defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The KPIs reflect and show sales and customer/trade strategies being executed as planned across the market. KPIs includes but is not limited to: gross invoice sales, in-country sales, speed to shelf, distributor and trade inventory, meeting retail driver standards, proper execution of in store activation strategies (perfect strore blueprint execution, point of materials management, store dressing at category/segment level), channel strategy and plans (Effectively translating marketing plans into store format plans, identifying correct assortment, creating tailor made promotions), category strategy and plans (cross category promotion, cross merchandising initiatives, building consistent platform of projects dedicated to key retailers) . The role owns the delivery of the sales and trade/customer marketing KPIs. Delivers adequate and relevant sales training directly or through others for his or her direct distributor sales team. It is expected that the role manages sales operational support systems internally in the areas of customer/trade marketing, consumer promotions, merchandising, sales analysis and sales administration. Externally, the role is the main driver of the distributor relationship – the main driver of joint business performance. FINANCE, SUPPLY CHAIN Co- owns and co- leads the execution of a healthy P&L for the market which includes but is not limited to: total business, brands, channel and customer P&Ls as well as sales to expense and controllable SG&A lines. He or she articulates the right and relevant financial deliverables with respect to channels, customers and/or shoppers for the market which reflect the investment in the marketing strategies. He or she also owns the execution of the appropriate levels of control and audit processes within the sales organization and with the distributor partners. It is his or her responsibility to coordinate both reporting and funding requirements with key internal and external partners with the region or sub-region. He or she has a full understanding of distributor financials and drives and influences the directions taken by distributors toward financial expectations of the Hershey Company. The role requires that he or she co-plans and executes an optimal supply chain (in-bound) for the markets in conjunction and partnership with internal stakeholders. He or she is responsible for ensuring the delivery of the right stock, at the right time at the right price (out bound within the market). He or she co-owns the product freshness at the market and trade level with internal supply chain partners. He is or she constantly seeks for ideas and arrangements that allow the company to improve on Supply Chain KPIs such as fill rates and product quality. Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities: Deep knowledge and exposure to sales and customer/trade marketing Financially savvy and able to own and manage total trade spend budget. Proficient in MS Office based applications Excellent oral and written communication skills; strong interpersonal and presentation skills A high level of understanding of finance and Supply Chain (logistics) of the business Minimum Education And Experience Requirements He or she must know and understand current trade trends, market conditions and sales enablers through continued education and training. Minimum of 8 years solid work experience in customer/trade marketing (in store activations, channel and category strategy and plans, shopper insights) and sales (key account management, distributor management) Demonstrated ability in key functional tasks and a clear progression or expansion in terms of areas of responsibility or increase in business size and complexity. The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veterans
industries: Consumer Goods

description: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Department  Account Executives, Channel Account Managers, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, Customer Success, and Sales Operations - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.  Based in Singapore, you will drive sales into large enterprise/strategic accounts across ASEAN (primarily Singapore) for Cloudflare’s solutions. Large enterprise accounts include, but are not limited to, MNC’s, G2000/CAC 40 companies, hyper-growth companies, and other organisations that have substantial requirements for Cloudflare solutions. Your strategic selling activities will include "hunter" type activities to proactively penetrate target named large accounts, detailed account planning, focused relationship building and leading effective sales campaigns to successful closure.  The ideal candidate will possess both a major account sales background in technology solutions, primarily software based, that enables them to drive engagement with senior level decision makers within Cloudflare’s target customers. Industry experience selling into Finance, Retail, Manufacturing and other Enterprise verticals along with Service Provider is desired in this role.  As a Strategic Account Executive, you'll be responsible for developing and executing against a Sales strategy/plan for Strategic accounts, as well as driving large account sales into ASEAN markets (primarily Singapore) to achieve revenue targets. Therefore, you must have a strong network of contacts with decision makers in large enterprise accounts across the region, and have experience selling complex solutions to these accounts. You will have an intuitive understanding and experience with the key business and technical needs of these and large accounts and will create and deliver compelling value propositions to them for Cloudflare solutions.  Additional Responsibilities Will Include Manage contract negotiations Maintain a robust sales pipeline Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts < 50% travel Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Bachelor's degree required Fluent in both English and Korean Relevant direct experience, track record, and relationships within largest corporate enterprise accounts in the ASEAN (primarily Singapore) market 10-20+ years of direct B2B selling experience, 5-10+ years selling to large enterprise/strategic accounts Direct experience selling network security and/or CDN solutions and services preferred Prior experience being part of an early sales team helping drive traction in the ASEAN market for a US-based SaaS company highly preferred Experience managing longer, complex sales cycles Basic understanding of computer networking and “how the internet works” Aptitude for learning technical concepts/terms (Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus) Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills Self-motivated; entrepreneurial spirit Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Computer & Network Security

description: Job Title - Business Development Manager Job Code – TWSJD 05 Job Location - Woodlands, Singapore  About The Company: Twilight is a niche technology company specializing in providing Mobile, Web, Cloud, AI & next generation software development solutions. Being incorporated in Singapore with offshore development center in Pondicherry, India, we provide quality IT outsourcing services.  We work closely with global MNC’s, Enterprises, SME’s and emerging Startups fully empowering their digital transformation. Twilight has more than 200+ engineers catering the technology requirements of clients globally.  About the Role: Twilight Softwares is actively looking for energetic Business Development professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit, passion for sales and a proven track record of success, who take a hands-on approach to building business opportunities.  Requirements: • Degree / Diploma in computer Science or Information Technology / Marketing with minimum 5 + years in IT Sales, Marketing & Business Development functions. • Candidates with IT / Software / SaaS Business Development experience & Recruitment / Staffing Business Development experience would be preferred. • A strong passion for sales in IT Industry and able to drive the sales process from prospecting closing the deal. • Proactive and self -motivated, focused and goal oriented. should be able to work under minimum supervision. • A good hunting mentality and resilience towards rejection.   Roles & Responsibilities: • Responsible for all Business Development & Pre-sales activities in the SEA Region and global markets. • Work on all phases of the end-to-end sales cycle including pre-sales presentations, client persuasions, conducting negotiations, and contracting terms with clients. • Business Research to identify potential clients/ lead generation, and take all the required actions to convert the lead • Derive & define sales strategies / plans and work closely with the Management team to maximize the revenue of the organization • Use emails, phone calls, social media, and other channels to reach out to analytics decision-makers and generate interest • Evolve strategic thinking to introduce new/innovative approaches in acquisition of new clients. • Prepare high quality business proposals, elevator pitches and presentations whenever required to boost the sales cycle. • Experience and Knowledge on web / mobile app developments would be preferable as this role would involve engaging with clients of different level through technical solutions.

products portfolio As part of an active product portfolio management process, the incumbent will measure the existing products from a volume, profitability and strategic perspective, and will make recommendations on the development of new business channels and products or terminate existing ones To work closely with the V1 function in the markets in order to identify business opportunities To exploit those business opportunities by developing and delivering new services and products To promote and share best practices within the region, to create transparency across the markets To keep close contact with various HQ departments to manage the NPP process and different proposals with the relevant decision-making bodies and committees within the BMW Group To reinforce the collaboration with C3 across the region To potentially support the Head of cooperation markets on localizing the strategy within the markets Business Development To support the development of new business concepts and ideas together with the markets to enhance customer satisfaction and profitability To align with SF3 V1 on market development opportunities in SF3 markets To develop business concepts with clear vision on final outcome To support the markets in developing material including business cases To support the markets in developing the legal framework with the involvement of AJ, compliance and local and Management To support the achievement of BMW Group brands vehicle sales as well as SF3 profit targets To initiate, steer and support the launch of new products and services in the SF3 region To to: RV based products Corporate sales products and services Integrated offers and mobility services Online sales and digitalisation To help prepare and run tenders with regard to provider selection of products and services To help create material for management to decide on implementation of products and services To help develop the contractual framework of the new products together with AJ, the countries To make proposals to the markets and the Regional Manager on development of new product and service offerings and termination of existing ones based on market requirements and the above periodical review To create a transparent overview of existing products and services in the markets and share best practices between markets Others To serve as a regional contact point in sales and marketing topics across all business lines in both HQ and markets To manage special projects and initiatives Education Background / Professional Knowledge And Experience Minimum Bachelor’s Degree Minimum 3 years of working experience in Business Development and/or S&M Good knowledge of International Financial Services business Special Knowledge / Technical Skills Inter-cultural skills Excellent social competencies Excellent assertion, negotiation and influencing skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Stress-resistance Strong drive to succeed in achieving set objectives Excellent work organization and structure Good MS Office knowledge (PowerPoint, Word, Excel)

description: You will report to the Business Development Director and it will be your primary function to build and lead a sales team to sell products within the chosen division whilst maximizing the company’s sales opportunities for all products within your portfolio. You will also be directly responsible for the company’s revenue within your assigned region. The ideal candidate must be ambitious and career-driven as this is an ideal opportunity for an experienced Sales Manager to develop their career within a fast-paced and rapidly growing application development company that places a strong emphasis on professional development. Here is the basic role and responsibilities; Have full responsibility for overall performance in one of the assigned countries (Vietnam, Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Abu Dhabi, or Malta) regarding sales Build and manage a team of sales professionals Implement both short-term and long-term market development strategy Identify business expansion opportunities, analyze market potential, and target new business of the highest value Establish sales objectives and project expected sales volume and profit within the managed territory Maintain sales volume and adjust selling activities in line with the market situation Build effective networks across business areas

Job Purpose  Implement sales and marketing activities to positively influence key retail accounts and independent lab partners in promoting and selling Transitions lenses. In addition, manage new product introduction in the region and capturing and analyzing market intelligence.  The regionally accountability encompasses all of Asia (excluding Australia/NZ), Turkey, Russia.  This Includes Yet Is Not Limited To Develop close working partnership with key accounts (retail, buying groups and other groups) to improve engagement levels, in store visibility and recommendation of store staff of Transitions lenses; Develop close working partnership with defined labs (lenscaster partners and independent labs) to improve engagement levels, product range held and go to market strategies for Transitions lenses; Deliver educational programs to lab teams, key account teams and eye care professionals [ECP] to expand Transitions knowledge; Partnering with lenscaster teams for development of joint activities for key accounts and labs as required; Capturing, record and analysing market information; Implementing, monitoring and analysing trade promotional programs. Key Responsibilities of the Role Key account and ECP partnership Manage the relationship of defined key accounts labs to enable high engagement on the Transitions brands at head office and individual store level; Develop business plans for key accounts with opportunity, investment, ROI completed, pre, during and post programs, this may include partnership with lab(s) as applicable; Ensure all key accounts are kept up to date with information and activities of Transitions and explore opportunities for collaboration; Identify and creates sales opportunities for Transitions products; Plan, develop and execute market wide promotions, merchandising tools, marketing programs to support the growth of labs Transitions product range; Provide training and education and support with corporate and store staff to increase Transitions penetration. Develops and manages trade promotional programs; Active role in special Transitions events such as new product launches, trade shows, and new communications programs; Actively supports ATL and BTL programs to ensure partners high engagement around the investment. Lab Partnership Under the direction of the General Manager AMERA (and alignment with regional Lenscaster Manager); Manage the relationship of independent labs to enable high engagement on the Transitions brands and products at state, rep and customer service levels; Ensure all independent labs are kept up to date with information and activities of Transitions and explore opportunities for collaboration; Identify and creates sales opportunities for Transitions products; Plan, develop and execute market wide promotions, merchandising tools, marketing programs to support the growth of labs Transitions product range; Provide training and education and support with local sales and customer service teams to increase Transitions penetration. ECP partnership and market intelligence Ensure all targeted accounts (plus those requested through lenscaster & lab partners) have up to date demonstration tools including training on how to use, plus up to date POS materials place in prominent positions in store; Ensures the use & updates of the Transitions customers database; Analyze industry market trends (including competition) and work with management to develop appropriate marketing strategies, tactical programs and see through implementation of such programs; Creates and builds the image of Transitions as an industry leader. The incumbent will be responsible for maintaining the integrity of the brand and the trademark in all communications. Education Implements and/or develops education modules with insight from global teams to ensure understanding of performance and positioning of Transitions family of brands, recommendation processes and overcoming objections; Provide and lead dedicated training sessions, webinars and online education for all key stakeholders on Transitions technology. Education, Experience And Requirements Graduate in Degree / MBA in Business, Sales or any related course. Minimum of 8 years of relevant sales experience with sustained high performance. Results driven and exercise a high degree of ownership and initiative Previous experience with optical and/or retail is an advantage. Must have excellent strategic business planning skills with ability to do detailed analysis of opportunity, investment and ROI is necessary. Strong interpersonal and written communication skills. Excellent presentation skills. Must be able to effectively and professionally represent the Transitions® lenses image to customers and suppliers, and demonstrate the ability to act independently. Ability to influence and drive change within the organization. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Be financially astute, aware of budgets while attaining excellent margin results against plan. Able to travel up to 50% of the time. Highly competent in Excel, PowerPoint and CRM systems. Ability to plan ahead, handles multiple projects, set priorities and drive results. Demonstrate creativity and innovative thinking. Fluency in English language is essential Transversal Responsibilities  All employees have a responsibility to contribute to the Group’s sustainability and in doing so ensure that we can continue to fulfil our mission.All business decisions and actions must serve and be in line with the Group’s sustainability goals and mission.An employee must abide by the legal compliance policy in the performing of his/her duties.

description: About FastCo  FastCo launched FastJobs, Southeast Asia’s fastest-growing online jobs portal that focuses on the recruitment of the Blue Collar Workforce in April 2015. The platform has transformed the way people are connected to jobs, with over 3.8 million mobile application downloads across Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines.   In line with FastCo’s vision “To provide everyone with equal access to job opportunities”, the Company recently launched FastGiG, a flexible workforce platform to match qualified casual workers to employers.  Position: Business Development Executive  We are looking for energetic, proactive, and sales-driven individuals to join our team as Business Development Executive. You will be working in the HR recruitment industry and be responsible for proposing FastGiG's products and services to solve employer needs.   Responsibilities  Promote FastGiG's products and services to potential customers Identify and actively seek out sales opportunities  Achieve monthly revenue targets Work closely with customers to build long term relationships Manage the whole sales process from prospecting, pitching, negotiating, etc. Work with customers and internal teams to ensure that the customers’ needs are met  Requirements  Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in sales with a track record of consistently achieving targets Able to work independently & is self-motivated Proactive and sales-driven with a good customer service mindset Team player and works well in a collaborative environment Fluent in English Strong communication and presentation skills Relish the challenge of working in a fast pace startup Knowledge in HR recruitment industry will be an added advantage

About Us  Build the Smarter Way to Shop!  ShopBack , the #1 rewards and discovery platform in Asia-Pacific, enables shoppers across the region to shop "The Smarter Way”. It is a one-stop rewards and discovery platform for users to earn cashback, while delivering performance-based marketing to merchants. First launched in Singapore in 2014, ShopBack has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand, Taiwan, Australia, and more recently, Vietnam and Korea. In Singapore, the company has also extended its service offering with ShopBack GO, an app-based rewards platform for in-store shopping, dining, and entertainment. We are a passionate team that wants to drive innovation and build a product that we love and are all proud of!  ShopBack partners with over 5,000 merchants including Taobao, Expedia, Shopee, ZALORA to reward its users with cashback across a wide range of categories including general merchandise, travel bookings, fashion, health and beauty, groceries, and food delivery. To date, US$200m in cashback has been awarded to our over 30 million users.  We have global ambitions and are up against international incumbents in a rapidly emerging field! We are expanding our existing team and are looking for passionate talent across APAC to be part of this exciting journey. If you are inspired to take up new challenges and leave a mark on the e-commerce landscape, then come and be part of our growing ShopBack Family!  Responsibilities Evaluate, negotiate, and acquire key merchant partners that would support the company’s business plan and goals. Conduct market and potential clients’ research for our target category and establish a long-term positive relationship with merchant partners. Develop ideas for merchant campaigns, managing campaigns process and execution. Research and explore new business and market opportunities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to decide go-to-market strategy and execution plans to reach company goals.  Requirements At least 3 years of experience in sales and business development Having eCommerce background in Marketplaces, Fashion and Travel would be a strong advantage Proven experience in sales/business development/account management Exhibit strong awareness of consumer trends in e-commerce with an ability to ideate and execute campaigns to drive growth for the business Solution selling: Account growth. Always be looking for new ways to develop, grow and broaden the relationship with the clients. Able to think out of the box in conceptualising ideas for merchant acquisition and management – creativity and logical thinking would be key! Self-motivated and driven to excel and deliver. Must be comfortable with C-level negotiations and have relationships with top decision makers.
industries: Internet

description: MariaDB is making a big impact on the world. Whether you’re checking your bank account, buying a coffee, shopping online, making a phone call, listening to music, taking out a loan, or ordering takeout – MariaDB is the backbone of applications used every day. Companies small and large, including 75% of the Fortune 500 run MariaDB, touching the lives of billions of people. With massive reach through Linux distributions, enterprise deployments, and public clouds, MariaDB is uniquely positioned as the leading database for modern application development.  The Opportunity Business Development Representatives play a key role in our growth by producing qualified sales opportunities.  MariaDB has a consistent track record of promoting BDRs, and we are looking for candidates who are excited about advancing their sales careers by revolutionizing the way data is stored and accessed.   Responsibilities Follow up with, qualify, and develop inbound leads via phone, email, and social media Set up sales discovery calls with prospective clients and MariaDB Account Executives Respond to website instant message chats and our sales phone line Develop Asia-Pacific territory with outbound (“cold”) prospecting Promote MariaDB via social media Collaborate with our marketing team on campaigns, messaging, and prospect feedback Record and manage daily work in tools such as Salesforce and Salesloft  Qualifications Must-haves are: A relentless work ethic: you’re a hustler and committed to aggressively prospecting. A great attitude: you’re positive, coachable, adaptive to change, and a great teammate. You take full ownership of your quota and monthly performance. You can brush off the feeling of rejection that happens in sales. Organization and quality: you are process-oriented and take pride in the quality of your work. Your emails and presentations are polished. Your verbal communication is concise and precise.  Preferred are: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Ability to read/write Korean, Mandarin, or Japanese - this may provide more opportunity for territories you cover Previous sales experience with a technology company  Location Singapore  What’s in it for you? Impact the world of technology by pushing the boundaries of technology and business models, working at MariaDB. Be part of a game-changing organization that encourages outside-the-box thinking, empowerment, and is truly shaping the future of the software industry. You’ll be collaborating with high-caliber colleagues around the world, offering unparalleled learning and growth opportunities. We provide a very competitive compensation package, 25 days paid annual leave (plus holidays), stock options, a massive degree of flexibility and freedom, and more.  +++++  MariaDB does not sponsor work visas or relocation.  MariaDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  MariaDB is an equal opportunities employer.
industries: Computer Software

description: ABOUT AUTO GERMANY  Auto Germany was established in January, 2012 to operate and manage the sole exclusive dealership for Opel passenger and commercial vehicles in Singapore. With the launch of its modern 3S facilities at Alpine Centre, Auto Germany embarked on a 5 year plan to energize the Opel brand and make it one of the top 5 European brand in Singapore.  In 2016, the European Car of the Year was awarded to Opel Astra. And by 2017, The Opel brand was acknowledged by local journalists as the 2nd fastest growing brand by unit sales. By end of 2017, Opel sales had increased by more than 300%. Today, the Opel brand has firmly established itself as a top performer in the mainstream continental market segment, consistently achieving top 3 positioning amongst its competitors.  Auto Germany continues to be a major player in the complex and competitive automotive market in Singapore. Forging forward and embarking on the journey toward electrification, Auto Germany continues to win industry trust and partnerships from Banks/Financial Investors, Insurance Corporations, and Government Regulatory bodies and most importantly it’s ever expanding consumer base.  SALES EXECUTIVE, OPEL SINGAPORE  RESPONSIBILITIES  • Drive sales of Opel vehicles by conducting focused customer presentation and effective test-drive experience to highlight the product features, functions, and benefits of the Opel vehicle. • Provide professional and high-quality customer service in accordance with Opel standards to improve customer satisfaction and promote brand loyalty. • To follow up on all leads provided diligently and effectively to maximize conversion to physical showroom walk-in and test drive. • To be an Opel brand ambassador for our products which also includes being involved in production of media content for communication purposes. • To attend all needed training sessions internal/external and to actively participate in training to ensure maximum learning.  REQUIREMENTS  • Have a passion for cars and the automotive industry. • To be a highly self-motivated individual with ability to find solutions effectively. • Team player. • Right aptitude and has excellent communication skills. • Possesses selling and negotiation techniques. • Experience in handling and managing customers needs and expectations. • High customer and service orientation. • Able to work in rostered shift including weekends. • Must possess a valid Class 3 driving license minimum.

About us MAGES Institute (www.mages.edu.sg) was set up in 2010 is a leading Private Educational Institution providing tertiary level education in Game Design and Development, Game Art, Motion Design, Animation AR/VR, Data Science, Web Development.  It is rated as the “Top 50 institutions” in the world by Rookies in 2020. Located at Orchard Road, MAGES offers Diploma, Advance Diploma, Professional Certificates and govt. subsidised programs. MAGES offers subsidised skills upgrading programs for professionals in the above verticals and is very popular among the youth.  Roles We are looking for an Assistant Business Development Manager (Corporate Sales) whose main role will be to offer subsidised programs in Technology, Design and Art to local SME who are eligible for up to 90% grant. Selected candidates will be provided extensive training and marketing collateral to market the program. Required someone who is service, customer-oriented. Someone who has a pleasant personality and has the ability to put a smile on to customer’s face. (Compulsory) Preferred someone with a good understanding of Creative Technology and/or the Education Industry in Singapore. (Optional) Experience in Business to Business Sales is a must.  Package Complete training provided, all new recruits will be trained under a top sales manager. Basic salary of S$3,500 per month plus generous incentives on targets achieved. Overall average monthly takeaway could be around $5,000 per month with incentive.  Responsibilities Recognize and reach out to clients in businesses. Give Presentations and explain the programs. Pitch MAGES Programs. Create and assess a business marketing strategy. Develop competitive pricing strategies. Follow through with the SME Invite clients to the office for presentations.
