Summary: The Account Development Representative (ADR), India is for developing business in India Market and establishing and developing new customers for PEI Genesis, as well as maintaining and enhancing existing customer relationships. Reading, writing, and communicating effectively in English.  The ADR must be able to identify customers with high potential for growth, know how PEI’s product offerings can be used to provide solutions for customers, and be knowledgeable and persuasive in selling those solutions to customers. The ADR will make outgoing calls for the majority of his/her workday and must be organized, disciplined, able to work at a quick pace, able to multi-task and be self-sufficient in carrying out his/her job responsibilities. Ultimately, the ADR must meet published KPI’s, including exceeding the budgeted sales and Gross Profit targets for his/her assigned accounts and/or territory, and convert leads into sales.  Education/Experience/Skills: Diploma or equivalent in any field; or minimum of three years sales experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with knowledge of telesales/telemarketing and customer service best practices, working in an outbound sales environment. The candidate must be able to read, write and communicate effectively in English and Hindi. The candidate should be goal oriented, possess outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with emphasis on excellent telephone etiquette.  Essential Tasks and Responsibilities: Proactively generating. qualifying sales leads opportunities, negotiation and sales close Establish and develop new customers for the company in a defined geographic, market or industry; utilizing cold calling, lead follow-up, lapsed customer activation, sample follow-up, PEI-Genesis literature mailings, etc. Maintain and enhance existing customer relationships to increase the amount of business and the diversity of products that PEI-Genesis sells to these customers by pursuing possibilities and opportunities beyond those initiated by the customer. Meet or exceed outbound call KPIs, and quote follow up requirements. Understand the potential of each account to maintain or grow sales and communicate potential to management. Be responsive to customer calls and inquiries in a timely manner, consistently follow up on all outstanding quotes, and communicate feedback to the management team to assist in closing the business Understand all pertinent government regulations and customer terms and conditions and how they relate to PEI-Genesis’s processes and capabilities. Ensure that all price, delivery, quality and special handling requirements requested by customers are met in a timely and satisfactory manner. Coordinate large bids, quotes, orders and opportunities with your Manager, and appropriate people at PEI Work with available resources not only within PEI, but Manufacturers’ Representatives, Factory Representatives, and other outside sources to assist customers and expand personal knowledge of product capabilities and solutions. Participate in annual budgeting process, providing suggested customer or geographic sales dollar budget, GP dollar budget and GP percent  Expected Outcomes: Discover accounts within our existing data base, with large potential growth. Excellent collaborative communication with internal and external resources on large quotes, bids, and opportunities, will result in more large orders. Ability to communicate PEI-Genesis’ value proposition to capture more business, repeat orders with existing and new accounts. Ensure customer data and segmentation for the geography is maintained to enable accurate analysis of trends and to maximize Marketing campaign outcomes. Delighting customer always, thus building long term customer loyalty Deliver sales growth by exceeding sales, GP and active customer targets  Requirements: Microsoft Office (including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word) Experience using any ERP system (eg ASW, SAP, Oracle) Experience using any Customer relationship management software (eg NetSuite or Salesforce) Must be able to read, write and communicate effectively in English Enjoy learning about prospects and customers to find innovative ways of engaging effectively with them to drive sales Ability to handle rejection, objection, difficult prospects or customers, yet remain driven and positive even in the face of adversity to transform leads into sales Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both over the phone and in writing. Basic math skills for accurate pricing and quotes

description: Meero’s core mission is to empower photographers to focus on what they love: photography! We take care of the rest by relying on tech and AI.  Started in 2016, Meero is on a mission to make life easier for photographers and customers alike by bringing the top-name brands directly to image creators all the while expediting all of the tedious work. From its state-of-the-art image editing technology to our teams positioned around the world, Meero is helping creators do what they do best: create.  Meero is always looking to add fresh new talents in an already amazing team. Have a look if you needed more reasons to become a Meeronaut: https://bit.ly/2UDSXiJ  Check Out This New Position  What You'll Do Based in Singapore, you will develop our global marketplaces business (Deliveroo, Just Eat, Airbnb type of clients). Engage your customer portfolio, lead negotiations and successfully close the deals. Act as a specialist in your region and with your clients. Draft business proposals. Report on your activities (reviews, summary, customer dunning procedure), Being able to precisely forecast your accounts is key. Following a precise sales methodology What You’ll Need You have 2-5- years of professional experience in Business Development, from prospecting to closing. An experience in Real Estate / Hospitality / Food Delivery is a plus. Fluent English speaker- ability to speak other languages is highly advantageous. Good relationship skills. Rigorous, dynamic and autonomous, you are also results-oriented and very comfortable on the phone. Ambition and over achievement is your fuel. Good awareness of the startup / tech / digital ecosystem (e-commerce, B2B / SAAS companies etc). You have a closer mindset. Ability to think out of the box. An entrepreneurial mindset WORK @ MEERO  Dream big and do bigger - Dreaming big is step one, but we don’t stop there. By realizing our ideas at  a global scale, we can transform the industry with new tools, processes, and opportunities.  Make work play - Work should never be boring. Bold ideas and big laughs make everyday exciting, so we never get complacent. We are a family that loves each other, pushes each other, and laughs with each other.  Champion creators - Creatives are the architects of our visual world. We work tirelessly to support their skills and business, so they can feel inspired to create.  Rise faster than you fail - We celebrate resilience in the face of failure. We truly support one other, so we’re free to fall, but quick to get up and try again.  Give a shit - Success doesn’t happen by accident. We work with focus, determination, and pride towards our goals. We care deeply about each other, our clients, creatives, and our impact on the world.

description: At Genesys, a Sales Development Representative is a great way to kick start your tech sales career in a supportive, dynamic and fun sales environment. We have an amazing sales training program to ensure you are set up for success and have a clear sales career pathway for the right candidate who is hungry, motivated and a hard-working self-starter.  The Sales Development team is an essential team in Genesys’ sales and marketing efforts and is responsible for a combination of demand response, demand management and demand creation.  The primary charge of a Sales Development Representative is to fill and manage the top portion of the sales pipelines allowing Account Executives to focus on closing business.  What You Can Bring To Genesys Prospect and generate leads with companies throughout the SEA region. Leverage a modern lead generation tool stack, including LinkedIn, Demandbase and SalesLoft. Collaborate closely with Regional Sales Managers and Corporate Account Executives to establish a territory "plan-of-attack", including target companies, target prospects, and messaging/talk tracks. Conduct proactive research on accounts by using Google, LinkedIn and Salesforce. Set up new meetings to hand off to our Regional Sales Manager and Mid-Market/Enterprise Account Executive teams. Learn, leverage, and help evolve our demand generation process. Qualify opportunities and handle objections. Participate in regular training & informational sessions. Achieve or exceed quarterly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and associated Pipeline Value Conduct high-level conversations and needs-based analysis with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts through tailored lines of questioning Effectively communicate value propositions in line with the specific needs and requirements of the prospect Provide input to marketing including feedback on the quality of leads from marketing programs. You’ve been there and done this… 1+ year B2B sales experience in a prospecting role (Software sales is preferred but not essential) or, New to the workforce and keen to kick-start a career in Sales Strong passion for technology sales and hunger to achieve results Excellent written communication and grammatical skills needed; ability to craft strong sales and prospecting emails Ability to work in a high-energy metric-driven sales team environment Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong verbal communication skills Proficient in Bahasa Indonesia is advantageous Legal requirements to work in Singapore Able to travel internationally occasionally Please note that Genesys will not accept resumes from agencies at this time.  To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Singapore  Covid-19  Safety for our employees and our communities is a key priority for Genesys. We continue to experience rapid growth during the Covid-19 pandemic and are conducting remote hiring and onboarding processes. All hiring and onboarding processes are being conducted remotely at this time. We utilize Zoom video meetings and phone calls during the interview process. We will be working remotely through at least December 31, 2021, in most locations, and we are re-evaluating the opening date of all the Genesys offices on an ongoing basis.  About Genesys  Every year, Genesys® orchestrates more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service℠, our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.  Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

COMPANY OVERVIEW Universal Robina Corporation (URC) is one of the largest branded consumer food and beverage product companies in the Philippines. We’ve built three strong regional brands over the years— Jack 'n Jill for snack foods, C2 Cool and Clean for ready-to-drink tea, and Great Taste for coffee. These brands are becoming popular across the ASEAN region. We also have premium brands from SBA through their snackfoods segment such as Thins, Cheezels, CC’s, Kettle and Natural Chip, Co., and Griffin’s through their high quality sweet biscuits and wide range of healthy wrapped snacks called Nice and Natural. URC's key to success has been attributed to building strong brands, robust product innovation pipeline, and world-class manufacturing and supply chain capabilities.   RESPONSIBILITIES End-to-end processing of daily sales order (for wholesaler/ domestic sales) Retrieve PO and checking order details Preparation of sales order Preparation of outbound document for all sales order Preparation of Pick list for salesman stock withdrawal Posting of goods Generate and issue sales tax invoice End -to-end processing of sales order for truckload and direct delivery (NTUC & CMM) Retrieve PO and checking order details Preparation of sales order Preparation of outbound document for all sales order Preparation of Pick list for salesman stock withdrawal Posting of goods Generate and issue sales tax invoice Preparation of sales order for Third Party Order (Export Order Batam and BV&R) Preparing custom invoice for custom's purposes Preparing Sales order, Purchase order, perform goods receipts, Invoicing o Printing out above documents, scan copies and email to Accounting o Perform MIGO (receipt of stock inventory) & Purchase Order Preparation of BO & goods return document in SAP. Daily matching of Sales/ tax invoice documents against the delivery receipts. End to end processing of FOC documents. Prepare pick list daily report. Preparation of daily sales report and stock on hand inventory report Handle price maintenance in the system: Updating prices, discount/ promotion prices activity period Assist in preparation of sales commission and monthly performance report. Perform MIGO (receipt of stock inventory) & Purchase Order for trade goods – back up support in the absence of Logistic. Back up support of Admin Assistant Adhoc sales admin duties  QUALIFICATIONS Candidate must have at least 2-3 years' work experience in a previous Sales function Must have previous knowledge and exposure in SAP Preferably with previous exposure to Food and Beverage industry Candidate must be a Permanent Resident of Singapore Must be willing to report on site. Office is located in North area of Singapore  COMPANY INFORMATION OUR PROMISE We offer multi-industry and International exposure. URC is the major player in various food, agricultural and industrial sectors with a powerful presence throughout the ASEAN Regions. We advocate a culture of success. URC empowers its people to become holistic individuals and socially responsible leaders. We are committed to promoting learning and development. URC provides exciting experiences for its people to maximize their potentials and hone their talents. We bring the best in our people and offer them a rewarding career.  OUR CORE PURPOSE Delight everyone with good food choices  OUR VALUES Put people first. We care, cultivate trust, and listen without judgement Own it. We take initiative to unlock opportunities. Dare to do. We champion experimentation and incubate new ideas. Move forward fast. We see the big picture and learn along the way.  OUR AMBITION We are a sustainable global enterprise of world class talent. Giving everyone access to high quality planet-friendly products. Enhancing the lives of our employees, customers, consumers, and communities.  Experience your best self with URC and help us in enhancing the lives of our employees, customers, consumers, and communities!

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 milion visitors. It will be lead by an ambitious team consisting of the Store, Commercial, Operations, IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.  In your role as Sales & Service Generalist, you will ensure end to end shopping experience and apply home furnishing knowledge to provide relevant solutions to customers.  Your assignment To know and understand the customers’ shopping behaviour, retail trends & life at home and use this knowledge to provide the relevant solutions for our customers; To ensure that sales and profitability is secured through sales steering and range efficiency to maximise growth; To know the importance and actively work with replenishment proposal- securing the right parameters to ensure product availability ; To ensure that my area of responsibility is in excellent shape as new, fully stocked and that a high level of merchandising basics is always in place; To contribute towards improving the customer experience in the store and maintain a high level of service standard with a “First time right” mindset; To support a customer-friendly and efficient execution of the payments, exchange & returns and click and collect process. Qualifications  Your profile You have the ability to make things happen by championing flexibility, speed and simplicity; You have the ability to align customer needs and expectations with business needs. You have the ability to communicate with various levels of co-workers from different functions; You have the ability to work on agreed working methods independently and reliably You have the ability to find solutions for customer and operational issues. Additional Information  Please apply by 15 September 2021
industries: Consumer Goods, Retail, and Financial Services

Seeking a highly motivated and energetic candidate for the position of Business Development Executive / Manager to join the Eatigo Team. The ability to work in a fast paced environment, under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism is crucial to this role. Reporting directly to the Country Lead, you will be a key strategic member of the Sales Team. This role would extend our reach through exploration of new and untapped business opportunities and relationships.  WHAT YOU’LL DO:  Has the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality is crucial to this role.  Good communication skills and attention to detail are equally important. Ability to identify & contact potential restaurant partners that can benefit from incremental diners during their off-peak hours Present convincing business cases to demonstrate clear value to these potential restaurant partners  Continuously analyse, identify & execute value creation opportunities for existing restaurant partners  Work closely with the senior business development manager & country lead to brainstorm and execute new strategies Continuously analyse individual and team performance and take necessary steps to ensure growth.  Senior members responsible for training and mentoring team to excel in performance  Meet rigorous daily reporting requirements   WHAT YOU’LL NEED:  Experience in sales / account management, and passion for e-commerce and F&B industry. Ability to use data and analytics while building on client conversations. Self-motivated with a strong affinity for problem solving. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Ability to lead and motivate junior members to achieve exceeding results

As part of the Customer Business Development team, you will help deliver retail sales target, optimize customer profits, manage inventory holdings to a mutually agreed target, and develop channel trade plans with customer to ensure timely execution of trade plans of the online boutique/s of the brand/s you manage. Equipped with enthusiasm and skill, you will be primarily responsible to:  Strategic account planning, leveraging our product and service capabilities, driving profitable business growth; Set sales growth targets with clients and ensure end-to-end account profitability and growth of key accounts assigned; Maintain as the main point of communication contact between clients and the various internal departments, in support of client’s specific e-commerce business needs, which includes channel distribution, creative and content creation, marketing support, other IT services related to e-commerce store management or website management; Daily management planning of inventory for both consignment and outright-purchase stocks, maximizing sales, while leveraging on e-marketplace campaigns and brand’s marketing, promotional campaigns, while minimizing stock-out and excess stockholding risk; Regular business reviews with key clients to ensure that key performance indicators are met and strategize to improve KPIs; Regularly present or consult with senior level management on business trends with a view to developing new services or introduction of new products or product categories; and Use knowledge of the market and competitors to identify and promote company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators to potential new clients  Synagie believes that you are a good fit for this role, if you: With at least diploma/bachelor’s degree in any discipline; With at least 2 years of relevant working experience; Keen to work in e-commerce Have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong commercial acumen; Possess good communication skills and able to work in a fast paced but nurturing environment; Hardworking with positive attitude; Are a team player   About Synagie Synagie is an eCommerce company that provides end-to-end commerce enablement solutions to businesses selling online and offline. Our mission is to simplify commerce and make it easier for brands and businesses to sell online. Established in 2014, our clients include some of the world’s leading MNCs in the consumer goods sector and SMEs who are looking to simplify the complex commerce process.  Why Choose to join Synagie:   The vision. Synagie wants to be the best. We thrive on innovation. We are competitive, but we compete only with ourselves. The feeling of working on something that will only get bigger and better is unparalleled.  The culture. We have and startup culture and everyone has a voice. We promote an environment of open discussions and we treat each other as a family.  The people. We have such an incredible and diverse mix of people from all walks of life. You will work with the smartest, warmest, and most talented people in this industry. Working with such remarkable professionals makes one beam with pride.  The expertise. The main thrust of Synagie is continuous improvement of talent through mentoring, testing & learning, and training. We make sure you grow where you want to. With us, you will be able to learn so much about products, processes and providing excellent customer experience - all of which may pave future opportunities to manage the company’s business while chartering the next chapter of Synagie’s growth and a lot more!  The E-Commerce. Be in the thick of the E-Commerce action where we work with FMCG and Prestige Beauty brands as well as Channel partners to drive business growth, consumers' penetration and enhance shopping journey.

description: About Tritium is a Brisbane-based technology company whose mission is to offer energy freedom. We do this as a world-leading electric vehicle charging infrastructure developer that enables the acceptance and growth of e-mobility. Tritium is a fast-growing global company with offices in Brisbane, Los Angeles, Amsterdam and Singapore. In a global environment that is hungry for innovation in the use and storage of energy, Tritium leads the way in the design, manufacture, and distribution of fast-charging infrastructure for electric vehicles.   The Sales Coordinator will be based in Singapore and report to Regional Vice President, APAC and Middle East. The sales coordinator will provide vital support to the front-end sales team. For example, handling critical back-office sales tasks, such as SalesForce administration, order processing, customer complaints and resolution, sales lead management and communication, delivery schedule management for internal and external.  You You are naturally an upbeat, positive person who is eager to learn as well as being customer-focused. Highly organized, with excellent attention to detail, you can work in a fast-paced environment and adhere to strict deadlines. You will also have the following skills and abilities:   The ability to multitask without losing the quality of work A dedicated team player  Ability to work under strict deadlines You thrive in an ever-changing environment. You love to keep busy and are always looking to find a way to help out Ability to work autonomously, within a team but not afraid to communicate your needs Strategic thinker with a solutions mindset  Role We require someone who can come in and make an impact, generate leads, and build up our brand awareness. This role will require a working horse who doesn't mind autonomy and can't wait to get started. You will be responsible but not limited to:  SalesForce – ability to navigate and provide admirative support to front end sales team.  Proposals – prepare proposals for given opportunities  Order processing – ensure sales order from conformity  Customers complain, and resolution – capture customer, complain and coordinate internally for an effective resolution  Sales lead management and communication – lead response and follow up  Delivery schedule management – ensure timely status updates and coordinate on-time delivery to all customers  Strategic presentation – ability to develop PowerPoint presentations   Qualifications & Competencies Degree/Diploma in Business Administration  5-10 years of proven work experience as a sales team administrator, proposals, and/or back-office sales support function Experienced with CRM software and M.S. Office. Ability to develop an executive-level strategic presentation based on market research and database.   Reward This is an incredible opportunity to join a thriving business that is just getting started. It is fast-paced, and Tritium is kicking some major goals within the industry and its sector. Offering competitive salaries and plenty of growth opportunities, joining is a no brainer.  Tritium is an equal opportunity employer. Therefore, we will not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender expression, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Automotive, and Renewables & Environment

description: Job Description  Job Title: Business Development, Associate  Location: Singapore  Business Unit and Sub-BU: Company Formation, Business Development  Department: Business Development  Level and Grade: Associate  Reporting to: Marsli Low  Purpose of Role: Hunt for new clients and expand current client base  Scope:   ·     Able to make calls to meet potential clients to sell offshore companies and related professional services ·      Hunt and source for new clients to add on our clients portfolio ·      Work with professional intermediary firms like lawyers , bankers and CPAs ·      To work collectively together with the team to meet team sales target ·      Arrange for client events and presentations to promote our Group services ·      Travel to SEA for marketing trips ·      Assist clients in the setting up of companies in the different offshore jurisdictions and the provision of ongoing services ·      Any other work related duties assigned to do by supervisors and direct reports   Key Responsibilities: Refer to purpose and scope  Attributes/Technical Skills:      [Include core competencies, and add specific technical skills required for the job; indicate specific language requirement, if applicable.]  Core Competencies: ·     Good interpersonal ,communication and marketing skills ·     Strong organizational and administrative skills ·     Positive Attitude ·     Willing to learn and able to work independently ·     Meticulous attention to fine details ·     Strong sense of responsibility and priority ·     Outgoing , enthusiastic in sales and marketing ·     High professional integrity  Relevant Experience:  1-2 years business development or sales experience will be good but not a must Fresh graduates are welcome to apply   Education and Professional Qualification:  ·  University or Polytechnic Graduates from Business Administration or Accountancy or relevant discipline ·    Entry Level candidates will be considered (On-the-job training will be provided) ·    Proficiency in MS Words and Excel ·    Internet applications e.g. Internet Explorer, Microsoft Outlook and Outlook Express, etc. ·    Good written and oral communication skills in English Language are essential. ·    Able to write and communicate in Mandarin is an added advantage (to deal with Chinese Clients)    Vistra Values  Join us. At Vistra there is a world of opportunities for you and our clients. Help us deliver consistent greatness in every touchpoint – wherever and whenever people meet us. Grow fast, build relationships, and gain exposure; your focus from the get-go will be focusing both locally & internationally. Enjoy winning with equally passionate learners and solving challenges for our global and complex clients. Together, we constantly want to raise the bar – making everyone better.  What could be your unique contribution be?  At Vistra we build our high performing culture on our four values  Commenting to Clients  Working as ONE  Vistra Empowering People  Doing the Right Thing

description: The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   Responsibilities Meet and exceed sales targets Successfully create business from new and existing customer accounts Manage complex negotiations with senior-level executives Build rapport and establish long term relationships with customers  Qualifications Have at least 2 years' quota carrying sales experience Strong written and verbal communication skills

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is currently recruiting for a Business Development Manager for the Joint reconstruction and Sports medicine portfolio. DePuy Synthes provides one of the most comprehensive orthopaedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide.  The individual is responsible for overseeing the capital sales and digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint Reconstruction and Sports Medicine. A key priority of the role is to launch and lead the capital equipment portfolio within Sports medicine, and to equip the sales team with capital-selling capabilities to drive growth. The individual will also lead the digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint reconstruction in the space of hip and knee surgery, and engage both clinical and non-clinical stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of the solutions in partnership with the sales team.  In addition, the role will be heavily involved in strategic business planning, launching new products and devising solutions to meet healthcare needs of the patients. At this level, the role has increased responsibility including, but not limited to, additional skills, multiple lines/products, diverse teams, etc. This job is eligible for sales incentives/sales commission.  Critical to this role’s success will be the individual’s leadership skills and the ability to communicate and work well with all levels of internal and external partners.  Reporting line This position reports to Franchise Manager (Joints, Mitek and Extremities), Johnson and Johnson Singapore.  Job responsibilities Sports Medicine Capital Sales - Launch and lead sports medicine capital equipment portfolio - Understand and analyze market dynamics and competition to develop business opportunities - Develop effective contracts and financing schemes to grow customer base - Participate in national tender negotiations and evaluation placements - Lifecycle management of capital equipment including after-sales support - Training of team to improve capital selling capabilities and case support - Engage external partners including clinicians, procurement bodies and healthcare institutions  Digital Surgery Solutions - Lead strategic marketing and drive growth for portfolio - Collect competitive insights on product portfolio to recommend and develop marketing programs to adjust product positioning - Build and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and non-clinical partners to facilitate buy-in and launch of digital surgery solutions - Manage strategic accounts identified with creative solution-selling and market business development - Establish and improve relationships at CXO level and build long-term strategic alliances with the portfolio of accounts to continue to add value - Subject matter specialist including technical matters - Conduct training for healthcare professionals (HCPs) - Assists sales team with questions and supports customers requiring additional support - Enable and train sales team to ensure uptake of solutions - Hold stretched sales targets for portfolio
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: We are looking for a Sales Associate to join us at our Cartier ION boutique to be a star player to the team and effectively contribute to the success of our brand. If you have a heart for luxury jewellery and passionate about serving people, we welcome you to apply now!  HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?  As an Ambassador of the Maison, you are responsible for creating a unique client experience before, during, and after a sale. You will also proactively develop your client portfolio and meet individual and boutique targets, both quantitative and qualitative. You will cultivate strong client relationships and develop client loyalty. Participate in daily boutique operations as and when required.  HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?  We believe in shared success, and understanding that with your actions you elevate your team and brand.  To Contribute To Team Success You  Have commercial ability and selling skills Maintain excellent communication in English and Mandarin Provide excellent service and client-focused Exercise flexibility and take the initiative to serve at the highest standard  HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?  A great opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that goes the extra mile to uphold outstanding service for our beloved clients This role will also help deepen your knowledge of luxury whilst enhancing your expertise in boutique operations and sales Finally, a plethora of opportunities within Cartier and the Richemont Group to help you develop and take your career to the next level  Your Journey With Us  After being shortlisted, you will first meet the HRBP to get to know YOU and give you a preview of the team dynamics and company culture Subsequently, you will be meeting with the Boutique Manager to dive deeper and assess your fit for this role. He/she will also share potential growth opportunities should you be successful in this position Finally, you will meet with the Commercial Director to find out more about how we operate and an opportunity for you to ask questions about the business and the Maison.
industries: Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: Being an integral member of the Client Services Team, you will be responsible to act as a key point of contact for ad sales team, clients, ad agencies and internal departments on all aspects of contractual commitments from planning to implementation stage and ensure delivery on all obligations.  Responsibilities: Manage incoming calls and sales & support enquiries from our clients pertaining to website maintenance & hosting services Follow and work closely with assigned SOPs to ensure work is delivered properly and promptly to our clients Sending of customer satisfaction form to gather feedbacks and areas for improvement Review clients’ web maintenance/hosting contracts and contact them for renewals when necessary Propose and upsell necessary web functions to clients when necessary Assign each client query/request to the correct personnel for troubleshooting and follow-up Network with the different departments across the company that are involved in customer support, orders and processing Build sustainable relationships and gain trust with existing clients through effective and interactive communication Able to assess and render the necessary support to clients when necessary Render administrative support and work closely with immediate supervisor and team members to ensure smooth work processes at all times Assist with any other ad-hoc duties when necessary Meet assigned individual and team targets, if any. Positive attitude and willingness to learn. Able to work independently in a fast pace environment with minimal supervision.

description: Globalization Partners’ automated, AI-driven global employment platform, designed by our technical teams and powered by our worldwide HR experts, enables our customers to hire, onboard, and manage the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world.  As the leader in the Employer of Record industry, we simplify global business by allowing companies to grow to new countries and test new markets compliantly, without the hassle of setting up branch offices or subsidiaries.  With diverse teams all around the world, our people are the heartbeat of the company and the reason why Globalization Partners is a fun and inclusive place to work. We encourage and support personal growth and career development, trust our team members with the autonomy to do their best work, and believe in recognition for a job well done.  Did we mention you can experience all of this while working remotely? As a remote-first employer, we value your experience and skills more than where you are located. Join our collaborative work environment where you can make a real impact and love the work you’re doing!  About The Position  As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.  What You Will Do  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle, reaching out and follow-up on both incoming and self-generated leads, proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the phone, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners. Your responsibilities include: Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc. Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc. Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive Maintain high quality data in Salesforce What We Are Looking For  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in the role, we look for the following: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business or finance discipline 2-4 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and selling to C-Level Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus, is a plus Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies is a plus International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a startup environment, an advantage Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal, with excellent English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships About Globalization Partners  Hire anyone, anywhere, quickly and easily.  Globalization Partners AI- driven, automated, fully compliant global Employer of Record platform technology is transforming how companies hire talent around the globe. Our industry-leading proprietary technology simplifies onboarding and managing employees anywhere in the world.  With easy-to-use dashboards and a mobile-ready payroll authorization system, our customers can safely and securely access crucial HR documents and authorize and approve global payroll faster than ever.  Globalization Partners: Breaking Down Barriers for Everyone, Everywhere
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Employment Hero is one of Australia's fastest-growing tech companies. Our world-class software is the easiest way for small to medium-sized businesses to manage HR, payroll, employee engagement, and benefits. Having expanded globally in late 2020 we will continue to grow rapidly in 2021 and beyond.  We believe in distributed employment and take a ‘Remote First' approach with our team. We don't mind where in Singapore you're based, if you've got the skills for the role and the passion for our mission then we want to hear from you.  This position, based in Singapore, is a newly created role. Although working remotely, you'll be part of an engaged, high-performing and driven sales team of 50.  This is the perfect opportunity to join an innovative business that challenges the status quo and sets the benchmark for others to follow. You'll be part of an open, team-oriented and results-based culture where your input is encouraged and your success is rewarded. Uncapped Commission structure - OTE of $180k +  Want to know more about this role? Check out our hiring video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=elkXiSlEJjA  Employment Hero celebrates diverse perspectives and experiences, we invite people of all backgrounds and identities to apply for this position.  Responsibilities This role is best suited to an experienced and self motivated Business Development Manager / Account Executive with an engaging personality and strong work ethic. You will be selling to SMEs (businesses with 10 - 120 employees) and speaking to business owners and C-Level Executives. Similar experience in this capacity, especially within a SaaS environment, would be well regarded. Your ability to learn quickly, take initiative and embrace technology will see you succeed. This is a high volume role, so a proven record in managing a large pipeline with a fast paced sales cycle will be highly beneficial. You will utilise warm leads from the marketing team and outbound SDR team to pitch, demo, present, and win new business. Lead generation has a hybrid model with a 70/30 split between your calendar already filled from our energetic SDRs and self-generated opportunities through cold calling, prospecting, networking and developing strategic partnerships.  Requirements 2+ years' experience in a B2B sales role (performing the full sales cycle) SaaS industry experience Experience selling to C-Level Executives and stakeholders within the SMB market Experience managing a high volume of opportunities and a fast sales cycle Proven sales track record Exposure to the Human Resources and/or payroll industry would be advantageous, but is not required Training in sales techniques including Challenger, SPIN, or consultative selling would be an added bonus!  Benefits Uncapped commission (OTE $180k +) Work from home Self, health, wealth and happiness programs Remote-first and flexible working arrangements A generous budget to spend on setting up your home office (if you need a desk, chair, screen? You name it!) We set you up for success with the latest and greatest hardware, tools and tech Virtual yoga classes Weekly virtual happy-hour and social events to get to know your new colleagues Quarterly & yearly team celebrations  Why join Employment Hero? LinkedIn Top 25 Startups 2021, ranked #2 in Australia The Australian Top 100 Innovators List 2021 Raised $140M Series E round led by Insight Partners July 2021 Raised $45M Series D round led by Seek 2021 Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2020, ranked #42 in Australia LinkedIn Top 10 Startups 2020 Raised $22M Series C Round led by Seek July 2019 Raised $8 mill series B round led by Seek and OneVentures Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2019, ranked #20 in Australia GetApp Category Leader Q1 2019 Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2018, ranked #12 in Australia HRD Gold Medalist - Human Capital Management Systems 2018 HRD Gold Medalist - Rewards and Recognition Service Provider 2018 HRD Rewards and Recognition Employer of Choice 2018 LinkedIn Top 25 Startups 2018 EY Entrepreneur of the Year National Finalist 2018 Dynamic Business Top 10 Entrepreneurs, our CEO Ben Thompson ranked #2 BRW Most Innovative Companies 2015 Anthill Smart 100 List 2015 Startup Daily Top 50 Emerging Leaders 2015 HRD Employer of Choice Award 2015 Aon Hewitt Best Employers 2013

description: Company Overview  WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  Join us. Shape your story here.  Supporting Sales (70%) Prepares media schedules, presentations and proposals for the SG & SEA Ad sales team; includes delivery of accurate and complete paperwork for sponsorships, bookings and campaigns Liaise with and ensures submission of all required materials for broadcast and/or digital. Compiles On-Air Transmission reports, Digital Performance reports, post-campaign Reports, CD-compilations, checking of monthly client invoices, as briefed by the Sales team Research (10%) Monitors competitor channels and provides information to the sales teams on competitor activity Administration (20%) Regularly update product information (credentials presentation, media kits, programme grids, distribution, sales policy, Ratecard etc.) to maintain alignment with other global offices and deliver consistent messaging Submit monthly sales forecast, pipeline and sponsorship information in the standard format Job Requirements Educated to degree level or equivalent Min. 2 years of relevant experience of working in agency / media owner required Interested in and possessing some knowledge of Media/News Broadcasting Sales A strong proficiency in the English language will be important for the position Working proficiency in any additional languages an advantage Strong administrative and organization skills Immediate availability is preferred The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Managing of merchants and accounts  Negotiating campaigns to support sales achievements Extremely persistent with potential leads - Have a ever say no attitude Agile and adaptable to goal changes and project implementations   Requirements:- 1 to 2 years of sales experience in a B2B role, has the drive needed for sales and knows how to pitch/sell Able to hustle, has a positive vibe and is self-motivated Willing to learn Adapt well with changes, understands the dynamics in a fast-paced environment Fluent in communication Familiarity with Hubspot will be a bonus

jobTitle: APAC Senior Channel Strategy & Sales Planning Manager
description: Are you a strategic thinker with strong commercial and project management skills? Come join our customer development team and help us better analyse and plan our sales!  Core Responsibilities  Drive the development, review and governance of the APAC Channel strategy Lead the integrated commercial planning (ICP) process for the APAC Market group together with regional marketing, and in close collaboration with other various stakeholders; and drive the follow-up governance process Enable and govern integration of regional commercial directions into local Business unit (BU) plans and Customer business plans (CBP); successfully coordinate the BU ICP and CBP process to guide the local BU CD leads Regularly review our channel performance, working together with MCD and Business Intelligence (BI) to develop key insights for relevant stakeholders and to input into our strategic priorities Assess the needs of the Sales Department and proactively drive system, process, planning improvements including the necessary skill/capability development. This includes working closely with the global Sales Academy team to ensure relevant delivery of sales training to the APAC sales teams.  Play your part in our team succeeding The APAC Market Group is a diverse and rapidly growing within the LEGO Group, covering 6 Business Units and 12+ countries.  This position is very different from other roles due to the opportunity to have a diverse learning experience across different markets within the area of responsibility (APAC) as well as close interaction with Global teams. It offers in depth understanding of the LEGO Customer Value Proposition and our channel strategy, combining both long term strategic direction aligned to global / regional priorities while also considering local market needs to maintain flexibility and agility. This position provides an opportunity to engage with sales management in various areas (e.g. channel development, customer business planning), regional marketing and the global Market Commercial Development (MCD) and regional marketing to define strategic directions, and shape plans, processes, and initiatives to frame the course for the APAC region. This role provides exposure to holistic problem-solving driven by fact-based insights in collaboration with global, regional and local stakeholders and facilitation of decision-making with senior executives.  Do you have what it takes?  At least a Bachelor’s degree, ideally in business or commercial equivalent 8+ years experience in similar roles in FMCG/CPG company (e.g. sales strategy, sales planning roles) Strong strategic thinking, ability to think conceptually (critical to develop regional/global concepts and strategies such as channel strategy) Strong programme / project management skills with the ability to manage coordinate many stakeholders across multiple functions Proven ability to work cross-functional and cross regional (internally and externally). Proven broad stakeholder management, leadership and project management skills, regional role experience is an advantage Very strong communication skills Strong analytical skills with the ability to effectively analyse, draw insights from and present data Practical Sales experience (Key Account management or similar)  Join the global LEGO® family Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued, and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
industries: Consumer Goods

description: Business Development Manager - Remote (Singapore)  App Annie is always looking for extraordinary candidates with Mobile, SaaS, analytics background and we'd love to get to know you! We do not have any current openings for a Business Development Manger in this location, however, in the event that a position opens up, we'd love for you to be the first person to know! Below is what we traditionally look for:  Something About Us...  App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?  As an App Annie Business Development Manager, you are a high-energy, driven individual with knowledge of technology and solid business-to-business sales and account management experience. AA offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be empowered to sell advertising analytics to the world's most innovative brands and publishers. Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious team members committed to our mission and focused on winning, but always doing it right. Bias to action, bias to learning everyday, self-starter, great collaborator, and focused on learning and growing daily.  At AA, integrity and reliability are as important as talent and effort.  You will be responsible for and take pride in…. Drive adoption, engagement, and usage across the Connect product set for all market segment Showcase the value of our App Annie Connect offering to new and existing customers Forecast sales activity and critical achievements in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied and reference-able customers Ability to decipher key product gaps within the current product offering and regularly provide feedback to the product team. Ability to work effectively Cross-functionally as well as globally Exceptional customer relationship skills, and time management Bias towards high activity, (calls, emails, webinars, content, etc) Strong analytical ability to spot data trends, and uncover key customer insights desired. You should recognize yourself in the following… Experience managing complex sales-cycles Previous Sales Methodology training 3-4 years sales experience w/at least 24 months in closing role Strong, demonstrated written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Strong customer references What We Offer… We provide a WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids behind school-zoom, need to leave early to get to your band repetition or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues. Yes, I want this job!

Thank you for your interest in Osome. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: Application Instructions: Interested applicants please apply here: https://grnh.se/b36ae2702us  Workato is the operating system for today’s fast-moving business. As a high growth company with over 6000 customers, Workato is revolutionizing the integration and automation market with investments from the top 3 SaaS companies - Salesforce, Workday, ServiceNow. Recognized as a leader by both Gartner and Forrester, it is the only AI-based platform that enables both business and IT to integrate their apps and automate workflows across their enterprise with robust security and governance. Some of the world’s top brands including Slack, Grab, Box, Visa, Broadcom run on Workato.  We are looking for an exceptional Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will use your influencing and relationship-building skills to provide quality client service to help businesses achieve their integration and automation objectives. You will consult customers to understand their current and potential use cases of Workato and develop customer centric plans to help customers achieve their goals. You will manage the sales process e.g. lead generation, qualification, evaluation, close and account management.  Workato has a positive, diverse, and collaborative culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, smart, hardworking and work to be a little better every day. Workato has also been recognized amongst the “Top 47 Enterprise Startups to Bet Your Career On in 2020” and the “Hottest 13 Productivity Software Startups to Watch in 2020!” by Business Insider.  Responsibilities  Workato is looking for an Account Executive to join our fast growing team in identifying potential client opportunities and generating new business. You will be responsible for responding to inbound inquiries and increasing our outreach via outbound activity. You will strategically approach target companies and sell automation solutions that will help them achieve their business objectives. Although you strive to meet and exceed quota, you act in the best interests of the client. You are confident, tenacious and highly organized. Present, promote and sell products/services using well-formed arguments to existing and prospective customers; provide product demonstration to prospects Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs; proactively help customers to assess Workato throughout the decision process Regularly evaluate market potential, track sales and status reports; analyze market to formulate plans to win and grow new and existing businesses by working with Marketing, Customer Success and Product Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales potential; create detailed prospecting lists using various methods to identify and win new enterprise customers Establish and maintain positive business and customer relationships. Increase visibility of Workato across all departments within customer accounts Schedules customer onboarding calls; transitions the customer to Customer Success; expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Meet and exceed sales targets and outcomes within schedule Work effectively in teams to maximize revenue potential and ensure customer success Continuously improve through feedback Identify and leverage trends within industry of expertise/focus Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service experience to Workato’s customers Requirements  Qualifications and Experience At least 1 - 2 years of industry experience preferred Need to be based in Singapore Experience in customer sales, account management or consulting preferred Experience in Asia-Pacific markets (Singapore, Japan, Hong Kong, Australia, New Zealand) preferred Technical background or good understanding of technology and industry trends, especially in the app integration space preferred Skills High level of comfort presenting key client issues, be the customer advocate within Workato Strong critical thinking, analytical skills with an entrepreneurial and proactive mindset Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and manage time, even under high-pressure situations Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Excellent written and oral communication skills in English Why Workato? Supportive, collaborative, international team environment that supports remote employees (currently all of us!) Long-term prospects for a professional career in a high growth company Flexible Work culture Be part of a community-oriented organization with a history of giving back Best in class technology tools to empower you to do your best work Support for professional development and continuous learning Wellness programs, including fitness challenges and an occasional company day off to recover from Zoom fatigue Company-sponsored team-bonding activities and team celebrations Employee and Customer referral bonuses All full-time permanent employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley’s fastest growing startups Flexible and personalised medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalisation and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...)

description: Trames is looking for a Sales Development Executive with B2B sales experience who is passionate about growing the sales function in a tech start-up environment. You will be responsible for marketing Trames’ products and/or services by leveraging a multi-channel approach that consists of telephone, email, LinkedIn, events and partnership with other service providers and/or associations - to engage new prospects and/or existing SME customers. Your primary focus is to generate discovery meetings with prospects and convert such prospects to customers.  As the startup is relatively young, there will be various opportunities to take on new tasks if there is interest, and contribute significantly all the way from the start. The team is growing rapidly, and you will be part of an extremely dynamic and flat team.   Responsibilities Drive signup and usage of the Trames platform Prospect consistently through a multi-channel approach to engage and convert prospects to customers Manage sales pipeline and track metrics to ensure targets are hit Analyze market and establish competitive advantages Provides routine analytical and administrative support for customers and partners to guide them through their renewal opportunity and process Apply critical thinking to make recommendations in situations not covered by defined work parameters Collaborate well with others, in person and remotely, to achieve team or individual sales objectives Provides routine analytical and administrative support for customers and partners for up-sell and cross-sell opportunities Working closely with product team to ensure high adoption of the solution and collaborate internally to maximise the value of the solution for customers Effective internal and customer communication skills with proven sales record and rapport with customers and partners Generate reports as required  Qualifications Bachelor's degree 2+ years in B2B sales industry Experience in full sales cycle including deal closing with demonstrated sales success is preferred Familiar with MS Office Strong negotiation skills Strong communication and presentation skills Proficient in English and Mandarin  What Does Success Look Like? Driven with a strong desire to succeed and grow your career in sales Target orientated, proactive, open-minded and organised Willing to constantly experiment with different sales structure and processes Ability to manage multiple stakeholders simultaneously  Company Profile Trames is a supply chain digitisation tech solution designed to improve collaboration and visibility between disparate stakeholders across long and complex supply chains. We achieve this through a collaborative workflow management tool, real time track and trace capabilities and advanced analytics.

description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.  Please submit your resume in English.  The International Sales Performance Coach will act as a sales expert and partner with sales representatives to help assess, measure and enhance the performance of sales generating activities in our International locations as needed. In addition, this position is responsible for training, mentoring, and coaching the sales representatives to ensure these teams are stronger and more effective.  Responsibilities Partner with the sales leadership team to identify and analyze opportunities of revenue generation for KnowBe4’s products and/or services in support of its global business goals and monitor the sales representatives’ overall effectiveness throughout the sales process Perform on the job training for sales representatives in his or her assigned territory by drilling the sales process and providing additional training resources and assistance as needed Assist the Training Department with all new and existing Sales Representatives as they are on or finish their training from the University with drills, tests and any other requirements Consult, train, mentor and coach sales representatives in the assigned territory in areas that include revenue generation performance issues and overall sales effectiveness Monitor the statistics for sales representatives in his or her assigned territory to identify any red flags affecting their performance, and recommend techniques that could help improve such performance Evaluate sales team performance to ensure sales representatives adhere to KnowBe4’s established sales policies and procedures Inspect pipelines and accounts for any administrative errors, or mishandling of customer accounts, and recommend techniques that could help improve such performance. Listen in on demonstration phone calls or webinars and identify areas of improvement for each individual sales representative, create coaching plans as needed. Work in coordination with the sales leadership team and Growth to implement and successfully execute training programs developed by the CGO Identify lost sales opportunities and work in coordination with the sales representative to employ sales techniques that can recover the opportunity Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Education or Bachelor’s Degree in Business, or equivalent work experience A minimum of one year of demonstrated experience in managing people A minimum of one year of proven work experience in training, coaching or mentorship A minimum of one year of demonstrated experience in managing people A minimum of one year of outbound B2B sales experience (cold calling experience a plus) Experience with Gmail and Google Docs Experience with MS Office (Word and Excel) Experience with web browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer, etc.) Strong verbal and written communications Excellent time management and organization skills Excellent listening skills Ability to identify the root cause of a lost sales opportunity Ability to identify revenue generating opportunities Strong statistical analysis skills Strong skills in working with people Strong skills in developing plans and drills to help sales reps Strong overall sales knowledge (closing, prospecting, etc) Fluency in English required; additional languages a plus but not required Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.  Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation.  No recruitment agencies, please.

AccelerAsia provides fast growing technology companies from Europe, Israel and the US with a suite of growth services to help them expand their businesses into APAC and ensure long term success in this region. We have offices in Singapore, Bangkok, Jakarta and Melbourne, a team of highly experienced international business builders and a well-established network in the region. Over the past 11 years we have created a unique culture and a very successful business that has helped dozens of companies build their business in these parts of the world. We are looking for an enthusiastic and driven Sales Development Representative to join our Sales Development Team. This position focuses on feeding the top of the sales funnel and you will play a key role in finding prospects and qualifying them, before passing them on to Senior Business Development Managers and Business Development Directors. This involves researching companies, identifying the key decision makers and generating leads through cold outreach such as cold calling and social platforms (LinkedIn). The right candidate has at least 1 to 3 years of SDR experience, is passionate in digital technology, enthusiastic, smart, sales driven, able to focus and eager to learn. Key Duties: Enthusiastic about enterprise software Ability to grasp the business needs of AccelerAsia’s client(s), be able to think on your feet, and possess the drive to become solution/product experts Outbound prospecting, cold calling to hunt for new leads for AccelerAsia’s client(s) and meeting daily minimum quota/targets Qualify inbound leads from regular marketing campaigns and follow up with leads who have attended events, with the aim of booking meetings Develop and maintain a high-quality lead funnel Qualify leads using a structured sales methodology Work closely with Senior Business Development Managers and Business Development Directors to support in developing and implementing appropriate prospecting strategies and plans Maintain high level of CRM hygiene by ensuring all customer interactions from LinkedIn messages, calls and emails are updated and recorded in our CRM Key Skills: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Excellent management of the top of sales funnel Solid commercial acumen; the ability to spot opportunities in the territory A proactive, service-oriented attitude towards AccelerAsia’s client(s) and prospects Self-starter and autonomous Ideally 1 to 3 years experience software Sales Development On Offer: Good remuneration package includes performance based variable compensation Medical Strong Culture driven by AccelerAsia’s values Flexible working hours and uncapped annual leave Opportunities for internal growth within or beyond Sales Development
