To conducts regular and consistent research keeping brand department informed on best practices and the latest trends in market Recommending strategies to Sales Team to position the brand for growth Analysing brands of competitors, consumer trends and buying behaviours in B2B sector Working with Marketing team on designing and supervising content such as press releases, artwork, print and digital media Working with Marketing (Customer team / Internal team) in discussion with appointed advertising agencies to manage the brand’s marketing campaigns Monitoring the performance of a brand through key performance indicators (KPI) Achieving Brand profit targets, timelines and budgets Organising product training, product launches and promotional events Maintaining contact with Brand Principals / key distributors to get critical input on how product implementation can be improved Develop and give Product presentations to prospective clients and Internal Sales team  Key Requirements:  At least a Diploma or bachelor’s degree in any subject Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar/related role (e.g Partnerships, Brand management and/or New Product Development) Strong presentation skills, verbal and written communication skills Proficiency with data analysis, forecasting, and budgeting Experience with CRMs Ability to navigate and problem-solve effectively Team leadership experience & strong interest in cooking/baking is advantageous  Desired Skills and Experience: Press Releases, Digital Media, Budgets, written communication skills, Advertising, Data Analysis, Business Strategy, Procurement, B2B, Team Leadership, Brand Management, Budgeting, Presentation Skills, Product Development, Disposition, Brand Development   Salary Range: $2800 to $4000

Company  Description  LingoAce is a global leading EdTech (education technology) company, headquartered in Singapore, that currently focuses on providing a quality and immersive Chinese language learning experience to students aged 4 to 15 years old. In addition to its headquarters in Singapore, LingoAce also has a presence in Beijing, Wuhan, Chengdu, Silicon Valley, Bangkok and Jakarta and will continue to expand into other parts of the world to meet the growing demand for language learning.  Founded in 2017, LingoAce leverages its experienced teaching team, AI-powered tools, gamification features and research-backed methodology to provide students with the best learning experience and results.  LingoAce has raised several rounds of venture funding from leading global investors, including Sequoia, Tiger Global and Owl Ventures, to support its vision for revolutionizing learning across the world.  Today, LingoAce has a total registered student base of 300,000 students across 80 countries – coming from families of different nationalities including international expats, Chinese immigrants, and local parents. The company has more than 3,000 teachers and 1,250 employees globally.  The Role  At LingoAce, we’re on a trajectory of quick growth, owing to excellent product, customer obsession and great execution. Our course consultants (CCs) are the enablers of these growth by being the product ambassadors who guide our customers: the parents, through an introduction to the product and eventually onboard them as customers.  We are looking for a highly qualified Course Consultant Manager to lead our Course Consultants. Integral to the topline growth of the company, you will recruit, train, and lead all functions within the Course Consultants team, including course consultants, quality assurance and training.  Responsibilities Lead and own the sales & sales ops team that is dedicated to growing the business 360 through delivering an excellent trial and conversion to paid users at scale. Being a strong customer advocate and able to insightfully identify users’ pain points to better attune our product and services to answer to those relevant points. Manage day-to-day operations of your team including escalations from your direct reports, the delivery of high-quality conversation and follow-ups with the parents, and ensuring teams meet the monthly revenue and expense targets. Collaborate effectively and work closely with various stakeholders ranging from marketing, product, curriculum, teacher management & training, product marketing, learning advisors & operations in driving rapid and scalable growth for the company. Spearhead ambitious yet achievable sales planning & forecasting in ensuring business operations achieve the business objective. Empower and advise our respective teams in making the right decision with data support and insights from a varying perspectives using the right data and analysis. Guide team to conduct ad hoc research on Singapore’s external landscape (eg. Competitions) for current products and SEA external landscape in the future. Requirements BA/BS degree with at least 4 years of experience working in either consulting/ strategy/ commercial/ planning role of a fast-paced consulting / banking / high growth company. At least 1 year of team management experience. Strong proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and comfortable with datasets and quantitative analysis. Good communication skills and ability to articulate priorities to cross-functional audiences. Self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset, growth, and action-biased mentality that can operate with ambiguity. Fluent in both English and Chinese to handle Chinese speaking partners. Candidates who possess Ed-tech experience is a plus.
industries: E-Learning

Key Qualifications 2 year++ working experience in an Ecommerce company, Internet start - up, International Brand, FMCG, retailer or consulting Previous experience in trade marketing, brand management, merchandising would be a plus. Able to develop account plan Good knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint and ability to quickly adapt to new software and tools Proactive and problem - solving attitude Very strong commercial English as well as client - facing abilities Analytical, data driven mindset High interpersonal skill with problem solving About ACommerce  aCommerce is the leading ecommerce enabler in Southeast Asia, delivering retail solutions for global brands such as L’Oreal, Samsung, and Adidas, etc  Founded in May 2013, aCommerce has over 1,400 staff across offices and fulfillment centres in Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and the Philippines. All employment decisions at aCommerce are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion or belief, gender, sexuality, age, family or parental status, or any other status that may be protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest, most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Account Executive is a high impact hunter position in which you are responsible for driving new logo acquisition and developing opportunities.  Across all industry verticals, create a territory plan to prioritize time investment across prospects and customers and manage an active pipeline of new logo opportunities. Ultimately, you are accountable for exceeding monthly/quarterly quota, dedicated deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.  The successful Account Executive will exhibit an ability to "evangelize" new and disruptive products plus have strong cross-functional collaboration skills and exhibit success engaging with the various pre/post sales resources required.  This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the Sales Manager.  Responsibilities  Deliver programmatic engagement with existing DocuSign clients to develop and maintain relationships while helping to grow DocuSign’s incremental revenue by uncovering additional use cases and opportunities to position the broader DocuSign agreement cloud.  Through Those Interactions You Will Qualify sales opportunities based on DocuSign’s sales methodology and metrics, to include client fit and success criteria Position DocuSign's value proposition as part of the overall business solution, linking these benefits back to the key business issues of the client Expand the DocuSign solution beyond the functionality introduced during the implementation process and consistently seek new business opportunities by presenting, recommending, and upselling new DocuSign products, services and partner solutions. Process sales orders and facilitate customer onboarding Manage customer needs for engagement with other DocuSign resources, such as professional services, training, product management and marketing Enlist customers to participate and/or speak at DocuSign and partner events Provide accurate, timely reports, and forecasts, as needed, for management Develop and maintain sophisticated knowledge of DocuSign’s products and services Maintain current and accurate account information, as well as leads and follow-ups for assigned clients in CRM database Manage overall customer loyalty, serving as internal advocate and escalation point to clients. Basic Qualifications 2 + years experience in consultative technology sales and account management, preferably within a SaaS model Track record of acquiring new logos and expanding within existing accounts (60:40) Proven track record meeting/exceeding individual sales targets and quotas Preferred Qualifications Services/Consulting delivery experiences a big plus Ability to manage large volume of concurrent client relationships Ability to identify, critique, suggest, and implement intelligent changes to the clients' business optimization processes Ability to anticipate change and adjust priorities accordingly Ability to work as a team, as well as independently. Excellent verbal and written communications skills to be able to interact effectively at all levels of an organization. BS/BA degree Willingness and ability to travel as necessary. About Us  DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

description: At Quantum, we focus on creating innovative technology and solutions to help our customers get the most value from their data. With 40 years of storage know-how, Quantum’s technology, solutions, and services help customers capture, create, and share digital content – and preserve and protect it for decades. Whether it’s unlocking the potential of digital content, powering breakthrough innovations, creating entertainment that enriches lives, or keeping nations secure, Quantum works with customers and partners to make the world a happier, safer, and smarter place.  Quantum Corp. leads the world in helping users collaboratively solve some of the world's hardest computer challenges. Whether its wrangling petabytes of data for cutting edge movie production, managing global content production workflows, exploring new sources of energy, or managing oceans of content and blending collaborative high-speed workflows with cutting-edge object storage, Quantum has the tools and technology to help our customers engineer the solution that works now, preserving their work for decades to come.  You are applying to an exceptional team that contributes to enhancing our position as a proven global expert in data management. Visit us at www.quantum.com   Responsibilities  Responsible for selling company products/systems and services to end-user customers in assigned territory, industry, or accounts, primarily through outbound and inbound telephone sales activities. Acts as part of a sales team, and supports Field Sales staff. May act as sole sales representative for assigned territory, industry, accounts, or products. Represents the company to the customer and the customer to the company in all sales-oriented activities. Focuses on acquiring new customers and retaining and growing an existing installed base of customers. Responsible for closing the sale on systems and products or may generate leads for Field sales staff. Carries team or individual quota. Handle complex leads, qualified and nurture the leads to potential business opportunities Works on inside sales assignments with broadly defined objectives Solves non-routine issues, challenges and problems within field of specialization   Requirements  ·        Degree / Diploma in Business, Marketing or IT related disciplines or equivalent qualification ·        More than 2 years of experience in a sales or marketing related position ·        Familiarity with CRM systems like Salesforce, Zoho CRM, etc. ·        Excellent Excel skills ·        Excellent communication skills ·        Ability to speak Mandarin and/or Cantonese an advantage ·        Ability to work in a high-pressure deadline driven environment  Qualified candidates (Singapore citizen and PR only) are requested to apply via email stating current and/or expected salary to: hr-sg@quantum-southasia.com

Monitoring of upcoming and ongoing projects for tendering. Attend to sales inquiries and build long-term partnership with current clients/ contractors. Follow up closely on projects process and completion to ensure it is within specified time, cost and in line with required quality and relevant regulatory. Coordinate with Technical and Operation departments to develop technical solutions and strategies for client application. Require to interact with all levels to ensure that projects are being carried out and utilising the necessary resources. Requirements Preferable to have Engineering education background (Diploma/ Degree). Knowledge of Japanese dialect is essential. 5 years’ relevant experience in sales, preferable in Construction industry. Willing to travel to various sites. Able to commit long working hours. Working Hours: (Mon to Fri) – 9am to 5.30pm, (Alt Sat) 9am to 12.30pm

description: Company Description  For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.  We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation. Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 10 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator). We are well positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.  Job Description  Sales Development Representative  The Sales Development Representative - Enterprise for ASEAN will play a key role in driving new business opportunities by qualifying, nurturing and setting appointments for our field sales team in support of our rapidly growing business and high growth market.  Responsibilities Prospecting into multiple organizations via cold calling, networking, e-mail, as well as utilizing Internet information sources to build and maintain a lead development pipeline. Penetrate, profile, qualify and schedule well qualified appointments with key decision makers within global 2000 or “targeted” companies. Qualifying inbound inquiries by educating and developing prospects leading to appointment. Meet and exceed daily and weekly call goals as well as deliver a high quantity of well qualified sales opportunities. Consistently meet and exceed opportunity quotas to deliver optimal sales pipeline. Articulate Zscaler’s value proposition to decision-makers across multiple industries to assess buying interest. Learn and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of Zscaler’s technology – and clearly articulate capabilities and advantages to prospective customers to successfully manage and overcome prospect objections. Work closely with sales and sales engineering teams in the development of strategic sales approaches. Research customers, identify decision makers, educate prospects and qualify buying interest and sense of urgency. Extensive use of CRM (preferably salesforce.com) to maintain accurate activity, contact, and account information of all customers and prospects. Desired Skills & Experience (About You) Highly motivated self-starter with a strong attention to detail and a desire to succeed Team player who possesses an ability to adapt and work in a fast paced, goal-oriented high growth sales environment Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent active listening skills Experience in CRM systems (preferably salesforce.com) Have a keen interest in technology and developing a career in sales Experience in outbound focused position; customer-oriented background required (sales, support, customer service) Qualifications  Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree or tertiary qualification Demonstrated success in prospecting into Enterprise companies Proven capabilities and skills in account development, opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call structure/control and pipeline management In return, we will invest in you, and your customers. You will be supported by a world-class team made up of some of the most prominent names in security who turn our customers into advocates and give you the skills you need to build a highly successful career.  Additionally, We Will Make Every Effort To provide you with the best support, learning, and access to expertise in the marketplace. To invest in your personal and professional growth and reward you accordingly with competitive pay, benefits, and equity. And, provide you with an environment that is defined by collaboration. Additional Information  Why Zscaler?  People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.  Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.  Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: BidFX is a FinTech start-up on a mission to disrupt the foreign exchange market, applying innovative technology to tap FX liquidity. Foreign exchange is the largest financial market in the world, with $6.6 trillion traded every day. We are a small but fast-growing company with big, global aspirations. We aim to connect the world of finance. We operate a successful core-trading platform, with direct connectivity to all major banks as well as non-banks, fronted by a sophisticated trading user interface. We seek candidates who wish to help us fulfil our vision and share in our success. We value diversity and offer equal opportunities to all. BidFX is a subsidiary of SGX Group.  Responsibilities Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with BidFX customers Grow revenue through identifying cross-selling opportunities and communicating these to sales Arrange and schedule onsite visits for relationship management and training Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Communicate clearly the progress of initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Forecast and track key account metrics including monitoring customers usage of BidFX Enhance department and organisation’s reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new requests Responsible for keeping current clients satisfied and delivering exceptional client service on a day-to-day basis Responsible for working with the Sales team to onboard and integrate new clients and developing existing client relationships  Requirements Proven client and/or account management experience from the intermediary space including brokerage, technology provider etc. Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of an organisation, including executive and C-level Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail Confident in meeting and liaising at client sites Excellent verbal and written communications skills EFX knowledge an absolute requirement, multi asset knowledge desirable Self-motivated with the ability to thrive in a result driven revenue-based environment Natural relationship builder with integrity and reliability Ability to prioritise competing tasks Critical thinking and problem-solving skills A desire to constantly seek improvement

Digital Marketing Agency) • Passionate, result-oriented and positive • Preferred to have good networks in the media/ advertising field • Presentable, strong in communication and negotiation skills • Good command of both spoken and written English • Singaporean are welcome to apply You will be offer competitive package with bonus scheme along with fantastic professional development and career progression opportunities.

Company Description  MicroStrategy transforms organizations into intelligent enterprises through data-driven innovation. We match smart people to dynamic projects and technologies that truly challenge their talents. Curious and creative in outlook, our success is built on the talent and energy of smart and driven people. MicroStrategy (Nasdaq: MSTR) is a worldwide leader in enterprise analytics and mobility software. A pioneer in the BI and analytics space, MicroStrategy delivers innovative software that empowers people to make better decisions and transform the way they do business. We provide our enterprise customers with world-class software and expert services so they can deploy unique intelligence applications.  Job Description  The Account Executive is Key Account Manager and Territory Owner who will lead the winning strategy to Go-To-Market, identify opportunities, sell and maintain customer relationships within his/her assigned territory.  This position requires strong leadership to develop and drive successful sales strategy and activities via collaborate with internal departments such as Inside Sales, Sales Engineering, Sales Operations, and Customer Success.  Join an elite team of Sales Professionals that sell Business Intelligence software Solution and services to new and existing clients!  Your Focus Develop Territory Business Plan and drive successful execution to achieve revenue target and long term business goal. Lead Account Strategy to achieve revenue target and long-term account plan. Work with sales consultants to discover, identify and meet customer requirements. Identify and qualify business opportunities. Sell MicroStrategy Business Intelligence software Solution and services to new and existing clients . Cover C-suite and present Solution Value Lead Competitive Strategy to win Lead negotiations and overcome objections for deal closure Manage complex sales cycles and multiple engagements simultaneously Prepare accurate sales forecasts and sales cycle reporting Provide project management to ensure the success of the potential or current clients Leverage and enhance partner relationships to drive additional value and revenue Qualifications  Required experience and skills: Bachelor's degree or equivalent business experience At least 8 years of professional selling experience in Software and solution sales In-depth understanding the Singapore and Malaysia market Fluent in English is a prerequisite, Mandarin, Cantonese and Malay are preferred. Experience with selling Analytics or Business Intelligence and Software Application Solution preferred. Additional experience with Cloud, Mobile, Big Data, Hadoop, or Social Media optional but preferred Proven track record of consistently exceeding corporate objectives and quotas Successful experience at new account development (Hunting) and large account management (Farming) Proven prospecting and sales cycle management capability Experience and training in a value-based enterprise sales methodology (Solution Selling, Customer Centric Selling, etc) Ability to track activity in Salesforce High levels of social perceptiveness and customer service Self-driven, motivated, well-structured, results oriented and integrity. Excellent communication, presentation, negotiation and collaboration skills

We drive dermatology with our knowledge, collaboration and curiosity, and we are at the forefront of science in developing new medicines. For us, pioneering together is about constantly improving and extending what’s possible for each other, our company, and our patients.  Objective To achieve sales target and manage the territory as assignment by providing benefits information of company’s products. To help all potential stakeholders to help patients improve/achieve treatment outcomes   Job Responsibilities ·  Monthly visit stakeholders with key messages from company ·  To list company products to hospital formularies, clinics, etc ·  To be a key link to stakeholders on company strategy, patients programs, marketing programs ·  Responsible for sales achievement and development of the assigned territory ·  Responsible to execute and adopt marketing programs to the assigned territory or company events i.e. product presentation, tea conferences, lecturer tour, round table discussion, booth exhibitions, etc · Planning work schedules, weekly and monthly timetables by arranging appointments with key stakeholders, and keeping detailed records of all contacts via Veeva · Regularly attending company meetings, company training programs, technical data presentations and briefings · Keeping up-to-date with the latest clinical data supplied by the company, and interpreting, presenting and discussing this data with doctors during presentations; · Monitoring competitor activity and competitors' products · Any other adhoc duties as assigned by immediate manager  Job Requirement ·   Minimum a Diploma/ Bachelor Degree in any field. ·   1 -2 Year(s) of working experience in pharmaceutical industry will be an advantage ·   Valid Class 3 license and possess own vehicle ·   Self-motivated, proactive and good interpersonal skill ·  A great team player who is also able to work independently

description: Description & Requirements  lululemon athletica is seeking a highly capable leader who is passionate about developing others and connecting with the community as a Key Leader on our team. The key objective of this position is to lead our retail floor and maintain amazing guest experience in stores.  What You Will Do  The role will combine the life-altering potential of wearing stretchy pants to work every day while talking health, fitness and yoga to your guests and community. The key leader plays a key role in ensuring an exceptional level of education on the retail floor by training, coaching, and developing a team of Educators that delivers the lululemon guest experience. Key leaders build capabilities within the store team to drive strategy and achieve results for the business, today and tomorrow. Under the supervision of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager, the position supports in day-to-day leadership and key areas of store operations. Our Key Leader emanates the lululemon culture, is a lover of fitness and sweaty endeavors, and is committed to creating amazing experiences for those around them.  The life of our Key Leader Passionately leads and educates on our product, community and culture on the retail floor and in the community Takes a stand as an advocate for lululemon athletica’s values and guest experience Oversees the execution of certain deliverables on the Manager ‘80/20 Checklist’, as delegated by the Store Manager or Assistant Manager. For example, Inventory, Product or Community Events Present on the retail floor encouraging and energizing staff Represents her/his store at all required meetings, events and conferences, under the direction of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager Acts as a coach to Educators and plays a hands-on roll in their development What are the technical skills necessary to perform this role? Minimum one year’s work experience in retail / sales leadership, or an equivalent role Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, retail or related field (preferred) Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) Detail oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills Ability to multi-task and coordinate ongoing projects, plans and people development Love of brainstorming, problem-solving, being creative and resourceful Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon, community, and people Passion, knowledge and involvement in yoga, and/or athletics Strong sense of personal style and athletically minded Excellent decision making and problem resolution skills Entrepreneurial, proactive and solution-oriented To Apply for this position  If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness, personal development, growth, change, responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.

description: Assist the Business Development Manager in the implementation of business development strategies and to win projects for the company.  Manage relationship with existing and potential clients to develop new opportunities and advance organisation’s business interests  Identify business opportunities and maintain project pipelines.  Coordinate and follow up on tenders  Work closely with the Business Development Manager to strategise forays in new energy (ammonia, LNG and hydrogen etc.), and to evaluate new markets for existing products and services to achieve market expansion and business development goals  Undertake market research (in house or outsource) to keep the management abreast of latest market and industry trends  Assist the Business Development Manager to identify, build, and manage long-term business relationships with clients and strategic partners.  Provide support to Business Development Manager to drive strategic initiatives related to investment opportunities in renewables, other mergers/ acquisitions/ divestitures activities, setting up new ventures, strategic alliances, IP rights licensing etc

Position Overview: Based in Singapore, the Business Development Manager is accountable for B2B sales, budgets and marketing plans in respective RCEP (Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership) countries. He/ she will be accountable for driving sales growth, executing marketing strategies and building brand reputation via various channels that support the achievement of revenue and profit targets.  Responsibilities: Provides day to day leadership and coaching to the RCEP sales & marketing team Develops and manages trading partner relationships Develops channel strategies: identifies and negotiates distribution agreements with new partners Accountable for P&L management of the local sales & marketing team; Builds holistic sales and marketing plans, including justification for budget required. Supports the team in efficient and effective execution of plans. Provides regular reporting across to our international offices (China, USA & Vietnam) Leads long/mid/short-term strategic planning for RCEP business Works with head office team to gain alignment on strategies and plans  Desired Skills and Experience: Minimally Diploma with 10+ years’ experience in business development in the furniture industry; Previous experience in general management and/or a managing director role would be a strong asset Proven experience in building an international brand from the ground up Proven track record of success with furniture market business is highly desired  Desired Capabilities: Strong leadership and strategic planning skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong collaboration skills. Experience working in organizations with a Head Office in another country. Strong communication skills in English & Mandarin (written & oral) Digitally-savvy Strong customer relations and negotiating skills  *Open to only Singaporeans or Permanent Residents.

JOB SUMMARY  As Sales Support Executive, Oleochemicals, the key responsibilities are to provide sales administrative support to facilitate the business and information flow, as well as trade execution for the Oleochemical group. This can be done through the following accountabilities:   Order and Trade Management – Monitor trade flows between various sales offices and manufacturing sites, and provide necessary support and follow up on documentation, and assist with time order entry, analysis and issuance of documents such as purchase/sales contracts etc.  Sales and Administrative Support – Provide necessary administrative assistance and support to the various sales and marketing functions (demand planning, product management, material sourcing etc.), including but not limited to submission of sample requests, meeting preparation, minute-taking, dissemination of market updates.   MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Submission of Purchase Orders to Vendors Input of Sales/Purchase legs into enterprise system (SAP, CXC) Support Demand Planner on Sales Forecasting and Planning efforts, such as Forecast consolidation and compilation Consolidate individual Sales Manager’s Weekly Flashes, Lost Sales, Import/Export Data (where applicable) for use in sales forums Manage submission of Call Reports from SMs post-customer visits Disseminate Market Updates (ICIS/Oleoline/LMC etc.) to the sales team Provide support on Brochures/Print/Marketing Material Liaise with external Market Reporting agencies on Subscription Renewal, where necessary Any other administrative matter pertaining to Sales as required   JOB REQUIREMENTS:  EDUCATION At least a Diploma in Commerce, Business or equivalent.  EXPERIENCE With 1 to 3 years of experience in sales administration or equivalent function Applicants with strong interest and no prior work experience are also encourage to apply  PERSONALITY TRAITS Keen eye for detail and analytical mindset. Interpersonal skills to manage between key stakeholders Works independently and also in a team Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.

description: Looking to gather some experience?  Not sure where to start?  Come and explore the world of sales and marketing with us!  We are expanding and are looking for fun and outgoing individuals to join us. If you live by our philosophy of working hard and playing harder, apply now!  Highlights:  - Fun and young environment - 1 on 1 Coaching & guidance provided - Travelling opportunities to our partner offices in 8 countries (on hold due to COVID-19) - Career Growth and Development - Competitive Salary Package - Opportunities for learning and personal development  Your role will include:  - Being in a team-based environment - Implementing brand awareness - Executing marketing campaigns and strategies  Who we are looking for:  - Team players - Individuals with great learning attitude & are hardworking - Fresh grad/ORD/Interns (min. commitment of 6 months, kindly indicate in your application) - No experience required

The Dir – Business Development will find new and manage existing partnerships as well as coordinate our approach and sales strategy on large business opportunities. This role identifies, pursues, and secures business with new clients to meet or exceed individual and vertical sales goals within a geographical region, country, and/or territory. The Dir – Business Development also establishes and maintains relationships with key customer executives within the industry. Grows the company’s revenue and profitability by expanding client base. Identifies prospective clients through analysis of current marketplace data and a strong understanding of the industry, its challenges and opportunities. Establishes and owns relationships with key contacts at prospective clients, and develops prospects into becoming new clients. Owns client relationship from prospect stage to client stage. Works to maximize net sales, volume, share position and promotes the company to meet strategic business objectives. Builds and uses simple business models to analyze profitability of various business cases and make recommendations to next level management for approval to improve company profitability. Directs a specific annual revenue target based on estimated forecasts for new clients. Develops and maintains prospective clients’ pipeline, forecasts and revenues, and provides regular activity reports to Senior Management and Leadership. Develops effective forecasting models considering the company’s product/service umbrella, existing clients’ experience, current market and business conditions, and gathered prospective client’s intelligence on business challenges and needs to help establish strategies and priorities, and drive decisions. Develops effective responses to Requests for Proposals (RFP) as needed. Organizes and facilitates meetings with targeted prospective clients and internal teams to identify adequate services/offerings to meet prospective clients’ needs. Creates strong and effective internal partnerships with client and product teams to ensure services are properly scoped and priced to meet prospective client needs, and initial projects stay within scope, budget, timeline, quality and other Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Participates in the Strategic Account Planning (SAPs) process; drives the growth required to meet financial goals by developing and executing the annual strategic Account Plans as it pertains to new clients. Participates in, and often leads, the development and delivery of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities. Develops and implements the strategic and tactical plans (e.g., pricing, products, programs) for each major account and drives results directly through the District Sales Managers and Regional Managers. Takes best practices of Major Accounts and works to execute them within the Division’s smaller accounts. Collaborates with management of major accounts to develop sales programs/presentations, and marketing initiatives to be used by the major accounts. Develops sales tools and collateral materials for both internal & external customers. Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished. Mentors, coaches, trains and develops team. Additional duties as assigned. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Development or related field Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred 10+ years progressive sales and business development experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Understand margin calculations, profit and loss. 8+ years in a leadership role (direct or indirect) Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required. FGE is an international energy consultancy group specializing in providing world-class research and analysis of both regular and complex aspects of the oil and gas markets. A vacancy has arisen in the FGE's Singapore office for a junior key account manager to work alongside the existing sales and account management team help to grow and nurture our clients.  We are a team of experienced professionals with a wide range of international clients, mainly oil companies, financial institutions and producer governments. Our consultancy services include the provision of regular research and analysis, interacting with clients and undertaking special studies and reports. The entrepreneurial spirit of FGE’s consultants allows for a dynamic working environment that enables the company to adapt and develop its products in line with changes within the industry. This dynamism also allows the company to provide unrivalled organic growth opportunities to candidates with a proven ability to develop and expand the business.  Working collaboratively with the Accounts and Business Development teams, this individual will take on a primarily account servicing role while working together with Business Development teams to deliver more value to our clients by upsell/cross sell.  Key Responsibilities:  Act the single point of contact for some of our key clients. Build strong relationships across multiple client stakeholders. Understand the client's business model and how FGE's services can work to support them. Growing and nurturing existing client accounts through renewals/upsells/cross-sells. Working to move client relationships from tactical to partnership. Identifying and acting on potential new business opportunities. Gathering product feedback and market insight from client conversations. Working collaboratively with other internal commercial teams.  Skills and Experience Excellent attention to detail. Fluent (written and verbal) in English with excellent interpersonal skills. Experience working with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Confident and clear communication style. Hunger to learn and succeed. Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Singapore. Fresh Graduates welcome. Previous experience of an account management or client servicing or sales role in a B2B business setting is a plus, but not required.   If you are interested in applying for this position, and you meet the above requirements, please submit your application. Unfortunately, due to the high number of applications we receive, we are only able to contact applicants who have been selected for interview. Please note, we are only able to process applications that include a CV. Those without will not be processed.

We offer At Maersk we value the diversity of our talent and will always strive to recruit the best person for the job – we value diversity in all its forms, including but not limited to: gender, age, nationality, race, sexual orientation, disability or religious beliefs. You understand the value the customer brings to Maersk Line and are able to find and implement solutions that are mutually beneficial to the customer and Maersk Line. • Stakeholder management and negotiation skills: You are able to manage both internal and external stakeholder and be persuasive towards achieving the objectives set for the accounts. description: About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain—in real-time, across devices—to improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The Commercial Sales Team  The Commercial Sales Team is responsible for bringing in new logos, renewing accounts, and up-selling into current customers. The team has two different roles, Account Executives who bring in new business, and Relationship Managers responsible for managing existing clients focusing on specific business segments. The APAC Commercial Sales Team is at the forefront of Mixpanel's fast growth around the world.  About The Role  You will be an impact player based out of our Singapore APAC Headquarters who will help build and iterate on Mixpanel's fastest growing market strategy by prospecting and acquiring new customers within our Commercial APAC market. You will collaborate with cross-functional team members to position Mixpanel as the best in class Product Analytics tool in the market, focusing on our highest potential value accounts to increase growth in our business's highest priority segment. This role is for you if you have a growth mindset, a bias towards experimentation, comfort with ambiguity, and rapid iteration.  Responsibilities Prospect and outbound into an account list Build and iterate an outbound and pipeline generation strategy Be an expert on Mixpanel product and industry knowledge to properly pitch and position Mixpanel during discovery calls and product demonstrations Manage complex sales cycles with technical proof of concepts Accurately forecast sales pipeline and exceed annual targets We're Looking For Someone Who Has 5 years experience owning a revenue quota for a SaaS business within the APAC Region with a technical product OR consulting experience with Go To Market, Sales, or Strategy Experience building an account, territory, and/or go to market strategy for a SaaS business within APAC Knowledge sales procurement process and practices A record of success hitting key performance indicators or achieving quota while working with complex customer engagements Bonus Points For Have experience working with a technical SAAS product and collaborating with client Product and Engineering teams Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers’ success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can’t win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Cellebrite is the Global leader in digital intelligence, providing law enforcement, military and intelligence agencies, a wide range of solutions for digital forensics, triage and analytics. With cutting edge technology, Cellebrite provides a one-stop shop for digital intelligence to Law enforcement and to the private sector, across the world. With high-energy and high motivation, here at Cellebrite we are creating a safer world day by day.   Role Description: Sales Operations is a key function in Cellebrite’s winning sales team. As such, the Sales Operations Specialist plays a pivotal role in the sales process, managing the back-office operations from End-to-End for a specified territory. The Sales Operations Specialist is a customer facing role, and as such, requires being Customer, sales and service oriented. As a member of the Center of Excellence, the Sales Operations Specialist is required to provide high quality support to both internal and external customers.  Responsibilities: Manage end to end support of the company’s customers. Build a strong, close relationship with the partners and end users, and be their focal point of contact Be the backbone of the sales team, providing support to Sales Directors and assisting in all Back-Office operations Manage all Opportunity-to-Cash activity. Lead the sales cycle from order to shipment Forecast management and data accuracy both in the CRM system (SalesForce), and in the ERP system (Netsuite). Be the company’s Gate Keeper. Work closely with Finance and the Legal department, and implement the company’s policies and procedures Oversee all processes to make sure we meet SOX compliance   Charged with managing all collection aspects. Build processes to improve collection rates, and customize them to the relevant customer type/ culture Manage company’s renewal sales. In a company of over 60K licenses, maintaining and increasing the renewal rate is an important step within the sales process Know and understand the Sales processes, understanding how to prioritize and differentiate between different assignments in a high- pressure environment  Position requirements: 5-year experience in a similar position in a High-Tech Global company- a must! English fluent speaker- a must! Full knowledge of SalesForce- an advantage Full knowledge of Netsuite- an advantage Knowledge of Microsoft Office – must, particularly advanced knowledge of Excel High energy and high motivation Creative thinking- ability to solve complex problems and think outside the box Attention to details Ability to perform in a multicultural environment Work in a high-pressure environment   Cellebrite: Digital Intelligence for a Safer World Digital data plays an increasingly important role in investigations and operations of all kinds. Making data accessible, collaborative and actionable is what Cellebrite does best. As the global leader in digital intelligence deployed in 150 countries, we provide law enforcement, military, intelligence, and enterprise customers with the most complete, industry-proven range of solutions for digital forensics, triage and analytics.  By enabling access, sharing and analysis of digital data from mobile devices, social media, cloud, computer, cellular operators and other sources, Cellebrite products, solutions, services and training help customers build the strongest cases quickly, even in the most complex situations. As a result, Cellebrite is the preferred one-stop shop for digital intelligence solutions that make a safer world more possible every day.  Founded in 1999, Cellebrite is known worldwide for innovation, commitment to our customers’ missions, and technical expertise. With HQ in Israel the company has more than 750 employees across the globe, with dedicated Sales operations in the United States, Israel, Brazil, United Kingdom, Germany, Singapore and Australia.

Role: Senior Business Development Executive Location: Singapore  Term: Full Time  Start Date: Immediate Reporting to: CEO   Company Profile Commsens is an IoT energy management and optimisation solution provider. We monitor assets and processes – securely monitoring health and performance.   We develop and deploy secure and robust multi-sensor wireless IoT devices to gather real-time data from factories, hospitals, homes and smart city installations.   Our devices and software suite are suited for condition monitoring, diagnostics and automation. We enable, condition monitoring, energy management, predictive maintenance, resource planning, capacity utilisation, process optimisation, performance warnings, decision insights, digital twin visualisation, etc.   Our team has over twenty years of experience in the IoT, AI and cybersecurity space, and we transform domain know-how and expertise into value-driven products for our customers  Summary of Responsibilities Generate new leads and connect through cold calls/emails Build relationships with prospective clients  Maintain consistent contact with existing clients  Manage healthy sales pipeline  Track sales metrics to ensure targets are hit Analyze market and establish competitive advantages  Qualifications Bachelor's degree with 3+ years in sales industry [OR] Diploma degree with 5+ years in the sales industry  Experience in full sales cycle including deal closing Demonstrated sales success  Strong negotiation skills  Strong communication and presentation skills  CRM experience is a must, comfortable with making cold calls/emails Knowledge of Internet of Things (IoT) and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) is preferred but not mandatory (We will provide training on our product/solutions business line)  Detailed day to day activities You will be responsible for providing overall direction, sales strategy, and team management to meet and exceed profitable sales targets for IoT solutions in Singapore and Globally. On a day to day basis, you will be driving the following areas. Develop plans to increase the market share of all assigned product lines through communications with government officials, consulting engineers, engineering firms, industrial and utility companies Develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales revenue to meet and/or exceed assigned targets. Monitor performance metrics and key performance indicators for the team Coordinate sales distribution by establishing quotas and goals with resellers and distributors Establish and ensure effective/clear communication/coordination within the internal teams to maintain a common, corporate message and share best practices Establish sales channels and recommend the development of alternate sales channels Ensure Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system usage and sales processes are being diligently followed in a timely manner Assist with the negotiations of contracts for the purchase Conduct techno-commercial sales presentations Keep company management informed of business conditions that may affect assigned products or markets Stay current with competitive activity and organize sales response to market changes Provide accurate forecasts of projected sales and growth covering weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly numbers Focus on cultivating organic sales opportunities, and targeted messaging, with a goal of generating new leads locally and globally Create linkages between lead-generation marketing, and wider corporate marketing efforts, such as thought leadership, and broader brand-based marketing Actively participate in webinars, trade shows, roadshows, and training activities Ensure that profit margins are maximized for the assigned product/solution lines  Few things we'd like to know from you Have you converted customers from cold calls and cold emails? Have you used CRM software to manage your sales activities? Have you closed sales deals virtually (over Zoom calls or equivalent)?  Apply Now We are looking to onboard suitable candidates immediately. Singaporeans & PR are preferred. For applying email us at aloysius@commsens.ai or call at 92323699. Thanks!

description: Who we are  American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.  Get to know the business  General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.  About the role  What you need to know:  The Business Development Manager (BDM) in Agency involves close collaboration with different business divisions such as financial lines, casualty, marine and personal insurance and the producer who promotes AIG products suites. The main role of a BDM is to drive and meet agency business objectives, and at the same time, help the producers meet their professional goals. Thus, it is important that the BDM understands the company sales process (product, underwriting appetite, compliance, claims, service process) and the external market environment (customer buying trends, competitor's strength and weaknesses). To achieve Agency and team’s production budget Develop and lead strategies and campaign initiatives to drive growth Develop regular sales activities such as joint field work with producers and monthly engagement events with targeted producers Collaborate with producers to identify business opportunities and build accounts pipeline through the producers clientele base Be proficient with sales numbers through daily production tracking and trending Participate in regular and ad-hoc agency events  What we’re looking for: Bachelors’ Degree Preferred Experience in General Insurance industry Possess BCP, PGI, ComGI & Health Insurance certification Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build credibility quickly with new agents High energy and driven to meet sales targets; and Adaptable and able to work independently and under stress  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer  It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.  At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Company Overview  ESET develops software solutions that deliver instant, comprehensive protection against evolving computer security threats. We pioneered and continue to lead the industry in proactive threat detection. ESET NOD32® Antivirus, our flagship product, consistently achieves the highest accolades in all types of comparative testing and is the foundational product that builds out the ESET product line to include ESET Smart Security. Sold in more than 202 countries, ESET has global headquarters in Bratislava, Slovakia, with distribution headquarters for the Americas located in San Diego, California. ESET also has offices in Buenos Aires, Prague, Krakow, Singapore, Australia and Japan and is represented by an extensive global partner network.   General Position Overview Directly reporting to the Sales Director, the position of Consumer Lead, APAC will be in charge of the planning and execution of the consumer segment for business growth. Planning and execution of platform campaigns with ROI and performance tracking Acquiring the key merchants/brand owners to the platform from offline and online sources Close cooperation with ESET HQ and local offices Relationship management and accountability for the performance of channel partners   The successful incumbent should possess:  Bachelor’s degree in business management or equivalent A minimum of 5 years of sales experience in the software industry. Excellent presentation and business communication skills Sales-driven, energetic and full of drive.Excellent presentation and business Fluent in business English (written, oral) Skill in organization and time management. Ability to work independently and achieving a high level of external customer satisfaction. Ability to travel as required.

description: We are a mobility service provider who aims to deliver seamless and new mobility services using advanced technologies that are simple and convenient to use by the commuters. Join our international team  Why settle for boring and average when you can become part of our fast growing global business! Statista is the number one Data Market Research and Statistics Platform on the internet right now. Want to hear more? Keep reading!  Our platform offers reliable data resulting from primary research and credible sources. Within just a few years, Statista managed to establish itself as a leading provider of market and consumer data for clients around the globe. Over 900 visionaries, experts, and doers continuously reinvent Statista, thereby constantly developing successful new products and business models and for that reason – we are hiring. Fluency in English is a must, advantageous to speak other South East Asian languages for development of other markets Extroverted and professional character with an ability to put yourself in your customers' shoes Competitive, aggressive sales nature with a desire to win Desire to be part of a rapidly expanding business Willingness to undertake business trips Keen eye for detail and organization skills   The Team  The Sales Team is one of the largest at Statista. jobTitle: Account Manager, Apps, E-Commerce, Entertainment, Large Customer Sales - Singapore
description: The area: Large Customer Sales (LCS)  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  The role: Account Manager, Apps, E-Commerce, Entertainment, Large Customer Sales - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  As an Account Manager, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions to some of Google's partners. You'll drive and grow new and existing business with Google’s advertisers by discussing and program managing the execution of Joint Business Plans across various Google products and services, regions and stakeholders. In this role, you will build strategic partnerships to help grow businesses. You’ll contribute to and execute on the team’s strategic annual plan.  Responsibilities Manage and develop relationships with our customers, including educating them on digital and Google’s products. Educate the market on Google’s advertising solutions. Contribute strategically to the growth and direction of Google’s products and services. Coordinate a cast of Google teams internally to deliver excellent service and information to help our customers achieve their business goals. Report on business figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical. Analyze data, trends and client performance, develop solid strategic plans, prepare and conduct strategic pitches and consultative presentations. Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities, provide campaign updates and ensure that advertisers are satisfied. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in advertising business and media account management. Preferred Qualifications Online business and account management experience. Experience in advertising, digital marketing, consulting or media specific industry. Knowledge of traditional and digital media and its business landscape. Ability to work with evolving and emerging products. Ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment. Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About EVFY: EVFY - An apt merger of logtech and traditional logistics businesses, with a mission to evfy delivery fleets, contributing towards the goal of the Singapore Green Plan 2030. Evfy is the first company in Singapore to own a 100% electric vehicle fleet, which at the point of writing is one of the largest EV fleet owners on the island. Proprietary logtech and crowdsourcing algorithms to enhance fleet management and operations for all last mile logistic needs. Evfy’s mission is zero carbon emissions and contribution to green logistic initiatives.  Vision - “To be the ‘best-in-class’ sustainable logistics company of the region by electrifying last-mile logistics through a driver-centric approach. We aim to be the thought leader in the green last-mile logistics sector, constantly staying ahead by pioneering sustainable initiatives that provide value for the environment, our drivers and our customers.”  Mission - “To make a social impact with businesses and consumers to adopt sustainable and environment friendly options, now.”  Job Description: • Identify new business opportunities via cold call, email, and other marketing channels • Engage prospects in discussions to discover their needs and propose relevant solutions • Develop and maintain good relationships with existing and new clients • Drive sales numbers through aggressive development of new opportunities, sales pursuits, including revenue, contracts signed, customer satisfaction and profitability • Achieve monthly and annual sales target • Work with the operations team seamlessly to deliver desired results • Prepare and maintain accurate records for presentation in weekly sync  Requirements: • A proven track record in significant/complex consultative services-led sales engagements and negotiations with partners and clients • 2 to 4 years experience in sales and business development is preferred • Knowledge of the logistics and smart mobility sector is a plus • Driven with keen interest to learn new solutions, including performing presentations and demonstrations  Working Environment & Culture: • Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics! • Close-Knit Team • Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities • Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities, Covid Restriction Compliance • Inclusive & Enjoyable Company Culture

By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers. Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employeesDocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The teamOur Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest, most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This positionThe Account Executive is a high impact hunter position in which you are responsible for driving new logo acquisition and developing opportunities.  Across all industry verticals, create a territory plan to prioritize time investment across prospects and customers and manage an active pipeline of new logo opportunities. Ultimately, you are accountable for exceeding monthly/quarterly quota, dedicated deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.  The successful Account Executive will exhibit an ability to "evangelize" new and disruptive products plus have strong cross-functional collaboration skills and exhibit success engaging with the various pre/post sales resources required.  This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the Sales Manager.  Responsibilities  Deliver programmatic engagement with existing DocuSign clients to develop and maintain relationships while helping to grow DocuSign’s incremental revenue by uncovering additional use cases and opportunities to position the broader DocuSign agreement cloud.  Through Those Interactions You Will Qualify sales opportunities based on DocuSign’s sales methodology and metrics, to include client fit and success criteria Position DocuSign's value proposition as part of the overall business solution, linking these benefits back to the key business issues of the client Expand the DocuSign solution beyond the functionality introduced during the implementation process and consistently seek new business opportunities by presenting, recommending, and upselling new DocuSign products, services and partner solutions. Process sales orders and facilitate customer onboarding Manage customer needs for engagement with other DocuSign resources, such as professional services, training, product management and marketing Enlist customers to participate and/or speak at DocuSign and partner events Provide accurate, timely reports, and forecasts, as needed, for management Develop and maintain sophisticated knowledge of DocuSign’s products and services Maintain current and accurate account information, as well as leads and follow-ups for assigned clients in CRM database Manage overall customer loyalty, serving as internal advocate and escalation point to clients. Basic Qualifications 2 + years experience in consultative technology sales and account management, preferably within a SaaS model Track record of acquiring new logos and expanding within existing accounts (60:40) Proven track record meeting/exceeding individual sales targets and quotas Preferred Qualifications Services/Consulting delivery experiences a big plus Ability to manage large volume of concurrent client relationships Ability to identify, critique, suggest, and implement intelligent changes to the clients' business optimization processes Ability to anticipate change and adjust priorities accordingly Ability to work as a team, as well as independently. Excellent verbal and written communications skills to be able to interact effectively at all levels of an organization. BS/BA degree Willingness and ability to travel as necessary. About Us  DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.
