description: One2Ten is looking for a Senior Sales Executive in the experience management solutions space.   One2Ten is an end to end Experience Management solutions provider which combines the power of Customer feedback, Employee feedback and Process feedback to truly understand friction points in an organisation and the impact to Employees and Customers alike.  This is a unique opportunity to join an exciting rapidly growing business which is fast becoming a market leader. You will spend your days developing and executing sales across the region and reporting directly into the MD for APAC. You will guide your clients through a consultative sales approach where you will learn about your prospect’s needs and then dive into the potential solutions fit. Your expertise will be critical in helping articulate the value of our products and building strong long lasting relationships.   The ideal candidate would have the following skills:  Minimum of 5+ years of solutions sales experience with a proven track record in achieving targets.  Network of relationships within the APAC market. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful. Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology and / or have a extremly strong network in one of the following industries: Industrial markets (shipping ideal), Consumer products and retail, Financial services, Public Sector, Healthcare or Education Pro active “Can Do” person - you take full ownership of your responsibilities Experience navigating through multiple decision makers and influencers within Enterprise environments including C-suite executives. Exceptional skills in building and maintaining long term relationships with prospects and customers.

Who are we?  HubSpot is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform for scaling companies. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world use our marketing, sales, and customer success software to grow their businesses. It's our mission to not just help them grow, but to help them grow better.  At HubSpot, we believe that our values live in our hearts, not our hallways. We want to build a company where people feel empowered to do their best work, wherever they are.  What’s the role?  As a Channel Account Manager (CAM), you will be responsible for building a long term successful strategy for HubSpot channel partners. Using strong consultative skills, you will work with partners (agencies, value added resellers, distributors, system integrators...etc) to sell HubSpot software and associated services to their clients. In addition, you will dissect their business goals and develop a better plan for achieving them.  What will I do? Close new business consistently at or above quota level by focusing on partners with the most potential while also building and advancing a channel pipeline Successfully onboard new partners with the goal of driving their first resell within the first 6 months of the partnership Co-sell partner services (e.g agency retainers, integration, migration, architecture mapping...etc) and HubSpot software with partners Provide sales training and deal-level sales coaching to help partner drive resell and advance in partner tiers Develop a long-term successful strategy for the partners in your book of business, focused around sales planning, sales execution, and business development Develop the ability to dissect a partner’s business goals and help them develop a better plan for achieving them Work collaboratively with marketing, sales, services, ops and technology departments to execute sales strategy as the firm introduces enhancements to existing solutions and/or releases new products Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance our company’s values, unique culture, and vision for the future Who are you? Driven and committed to exceeding goals and driving success with partners in the India market. Ability to hold partners accountable and proven track record of exceeding revenue targets. Have extensive experience in onboarding and training partners ranging from agencies, value added resellers, distributors and system integrators. Familiar with co-selling with the direct sales team. A positive outlook and a strong ability to take responsibility for your successes as well as your failures. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Exceptional consultative selling skills and closing skills Accurate forecasting and pipeline management Evidence you are a Top Producer in your current role A sharp focus on your goals and a belief that your daily, weekly and monthly activities will help you achieve them. What are the benefits? Generous remuneration + uncapped commissions! Work From Home options available. You choose Home, Office or Flex! World Class New Hire Training Stock units - so that you can share in HubSpot’s future success An education allowance up to USD$5,000 per annum Unlimited Time Off Policy Private health insurance allowance Free books program Annual fitness reimbursement Five-year sabbatical - Paid 4 week sabbatical with USD$5k bonus! A clear career advancement path, with potential for global mobility opportunities Primary Caregiver Leave of 16 weeks and Secondary Caregiver Leave for 6 weeks HubSpot culture is driven by a shared passion for our mission and metrics. It is a culture of amazing, growth-minded people whose values include using good judgment and solving for the customer. Employees who work at HubSpot have HEART: Humble, Empathetic, Adaptable, Remarkable, Transparent.  We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  About HubSpot  HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.  Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.  By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  The Singapore Commercial team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.  The team is responsible for acquiring, growing and managing the accounts of FMCG partners and key enterprise merchants across GrabFood, GrabMart and GrabPay. Ensuring close partnership with the merchants, we develop plans and strategies to drive their sales and meet their business needs, across the different services in Grab such as Express, Pay, Ads.  Get to know the Role:  As an Enterprise Account Manager (Food), you will be responsible for: Establishing and managing strong business relationships with existing and potential new enterprise merchants to drive growth for GrabFood Leading all elements of account management, including business identification, business development strategy, partner negotiation, day-to-day account management, and execution of key initiatives Drive growth in enterprise accounts as measured by deliveries, GMV and revenue, as well as forming deeper relationships with partners through collaboration in other areas such as GrabPay, GrabAds and GrabExpress The day-to-day activities: Work with the Enterprise Account Management Lead / Head of GrabFood on GrabFood business development strategy. Manage a portfolio of key accounts with a focus on building lasting relationships and increasing profitability/revenue. Evaluate strategic and partnership opportunities, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses. Analyzing data and developing initiatives to increase revenues/profitability for your portfolio. Drive growth for key accounts, measured by deliveries and GMV and ensure that the partner thrives on the platform. Work across functions to tailor account specific needs (e.g. customized reporting, marketing support, integrations, product, etc.) to make sure accounts have the best possible experience on the GrabFood platform. Continuously engage our merchants and listen to their needs, collect and address feedback, and address concerns put forward. Drive operational excellence by working with the merchants and operations teams. Work closely with regional commercial teams to develop joint business plans, strategic initiatives and conduct regular business reviews. The must haves: Bachelor’s degree in Business/ Management or equivalent. Minimum 3-5 years (for account manager role) or experience in sales, business development, partnerships or equivalent role Experienced in handling Key Accounts and Strategic Partnerships Able to manage conversations with C-level positions and senior stakeholders Experience in F&B industry is a plus Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify and provide comprehensive solutions for varying customer needs Ability to fuse business, strategy, finance and legal concepts to lead complex, multi-faceted deals Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Have a competitive edge and thrive in a team environment Comfortable with managing data and able to perform analysis (e.g. to solve business problems) Detail-oriented and organized
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  We are looking for Business Development Services Account Manager to make an impact to our businesses!  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  What you will do: Initiates contact, develops relationship and generates demand for customers in hunting zone, assigned to them by Services Marketing. Educates customers on all SE products and services with special attention on customer pain points. Cross selling of Field Service portfolio – Power, Secure Power & Cooling, Digital Energy, Industry Secures customer satisfaction overseeing all ongoing activities with the customer (orders, delivery etc) Utilizes BFO (Salesforce.com) for sales funnel management, account planning, performance and opportunity detection via Sales Cockpit Provides monthly forecasts, using BFO, and summaries in a timely manner. Participates in the preparation of analysis and reports on field service performance. Provides precise and timely information to Tender team to prepare sales quotations and proposals Monitors margin to be at or above country thresholds. Uses DOA process to escalate opportunities below thresholds Is “feeding” the Field Services Marketing leaders with Offers feedback and needs + IB data Knows where to be to create business opportunities, understand the importance of attending industry events and networking functions to follow assigned accounts needs.  Qualifications  Experience and skills we are looking for: Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent At least 4-5 years of technical sales experience Prior experience as Business Development/Hunter sales with experience in selling electrical distribution solutions Extensive business acumen with strong results orientation Experience in managing P&L will be a plus  Benefits we offer: Global family leave Comprehensive medical coverage for employee and dependents Flexible work arrangement Worldwide Employee Stock Ownership …and more!  We are looking forward to welcoming you in our team!  Schedule: Full-time  Req: 0077UK

description: We are expanding our presence across AMEA (Asia Middle East and Africa) and we are looking to hire for Sales Lead/ Senior Sales Lead in the following regions: Australia, Japan, Hong Kong and Singapore.  Job Description: Responsible for revenue targets on a quarter / annual basis for the assigned portfolio and territory Establish and maintain current and new customer relationships and work closely with internal stakeholders to facilitate a positive customer experience Work closely with Commercial Director and / or distributors to develop and implement selling strategies to win greater market share for assigned portfolio. Engage key customers on through technical discussion, presentations etc to win deals and accelerate revenue growth for the portfolio Provide accurate forecasting of revenue on a monthly / quarterly / annual basis Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from marketing activities and expand current customer base in assigned territory to drive revenue growth Support the marketing team in the planning and implementation of relevant campaigns, promotions and events to drive greater awareness and generate leads for our portfolio  Requirements: Master degree or PhD major in Medicine (preferred), Biology, Biotechnology or equivalent. Minimum 2 years-experience in academic research area. NGS industry experience is a plus. Familiar with Australia, Japan, Hong Kong and Singapore market will be treated as value add. Prior technical support or project management experience is a plus Strong logical thinking and problem-solving skills Good interpersonal and communication skills, ability to work under pressure Attention to detail and ability to multi-task Have local citizenship or working rights is required.

Job Summary:  Responsible for all marketing events and activities for Surgical products assigned under his/her care. Responsible for the planning, developing and implementing effective marketing communication campaigns. Responsible to develop “go to market” plans and downstream marketing to align with sales strategy to enable field execution.  Duties & Responsibilities:  Plan, Develop and Implement appropriate strategy for assigned products in different markets. Conduct PDCA and gap analysis to implement recovery action. Assume revenue and market share responsibility for assigned products. Align global growth strategies and market-specific short- and long-term strategic plans, functional objectives and input from the country business leaders & marketing leaders. Manage/Support distribution network (i.e. communicate and understand the limitations faced by the distributors) to ensure they are representing the brand and business effectively to achieve departmental/division goals. Direct marketing planning, analysis, research, as well as promotion and market development activities for the achievement of short-term and long-term business objectives. Prepare market visualization report for the products assigned in specific markets. Monitor sales (units and revenue) weekly, promptly discussing your analysis findings and agreeing on actions to maintain growth, turnaround negative growth or seek new opportunities. Analyze market trends and sales potential in the ASEAN business landscape while understanding direct and indirect competition; monitor competitive activity in the field and develop strategies and tactics to deal effectively. Assess market needs, follow trends in the business and anticipate future developments. Assist in carrying out these market research activities to identify and develop new sales opportunities within assigned product and market to unlock the potential growth of the distributor and the organization. Evaluate the effectiveness of promotion and advertising programs and make recommendations for improvements. Support the domestic and regional sales team in the preparation and delivery of presentations, evaluations and negotiations with prospective and current customers to achieve growth objectives. Partner with Regulatory Affairs (RA) team and sales team to ensure timely and high quality product submission and registration. Share the best practices with SBCs in the region, ensuring successes are leveraged and failures are minimized. Participate in relevant industry meetings and conferences as agreed with management. Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned by supervisor.  Credentials and Experience:  Bachelor degree, in medical, science or business field. Min. 2 years or more sales or marketing experience in healthcare industry. Demonstrate clearly proven sales or marketing track record with detailed examples. Experience in driving a new service or product concept through an accelerated adoption sequence.

description: What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a team with a no-limits mindset that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company that steers clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment with exceptional training and career development. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.  Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here !  Business Development Executive Role  As an experienced sales professional, you’ll partner with existing Gartner clients, leveraging internal subject matter experts, to address their most critical priorities. Business Development Executives are strategic partners to C-level and senior executives and focus purely on establishing new business relationships with non-client organisations within an assigned prospecting territory. Clients of the large enterprise sales team have $1B+ in annual revenue and include 77% of the Global 500. Your role will also include: Partnering with C-Level executives to develop and implement effective, enterprise-wide strategies Owning the full sales cycle from prospecting through close Having excellent executive presence and the ability to lead and close a complex sales process using Gartner’s value selling proposition Forecasting and account planning on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis What’s in it for you? World-class training through our Sales Academy when you join and on-going training from our L&D team and sales leadership Unlimited advancement potential as a sales professional or progression into people leadership Unmatched resources to support your success Inclusive environment with great balance for personal and family life Generous compensation including uncapped commission, accelerators, bonuses & incentive trips About The Team  Our diverse sales team is one with a track record of continuous learning and overachievement. 46% of our sales associates achieved our annual sales recognition trip, Winner’s Circle, in 2019 and 18% were promoted to new roles. Most people leaders have been promoted internally and have delivered great success as an individual contributor in the past. They’re hands-on and enjoy working through challenging client scenarios alongside their team!  What You Need To Be Successful  We’re a traits-based organization that seeks diverse talent to best meet our clients’ needs. We look for sales professionals with strong executive presence, intrinsic drive, natural curiosity and coachability. The experience level we look for is as follows: 5-8 years of consultative, B2B sales experience Experience prospecting to the C-Suite and senior-level leadership of enterprise businesses Quick learning attributes that enable you to pivot and work through ambiguity Ability to demonstrate strong sales process and strategies Track record of over achievement on goals or quotas Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s or advanced degree is a plus Job Requisition ID:55264  By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.  Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy  For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

Develops knowledge of client needs and requirements and coordinates the firm’s effort to serve client organizations. The job duties associated with this role may be expected to include:  Maintaining and building the business relationship with assigned institutional accounts. Working closely with client’s investment and research personnel. Presenting research services and advising clients on investment opportunities. Providing full account coverage service for small accounts, including trading and execution services, e.g. obtain orders for the purchase and sales of securities.  Knowledge Thorough understanding of sales and trading business. Profound knowledge of the domestic and international capital markets and the firm’s products and services. Understanding the client’s investment behavior and orientation.  Skills and Abilities Customer-oriented mentality. Passionate for the sales job. Effective communicator. Excellent interpersonal skills, integrating tact and diplomacy. Self-confident & energetic. Master degree in relevant majors. MBA from renowned universities are preferred. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as the comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

description: Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest, most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Account Executive is a high impact hunter position in which you are responsible for driving new logo acquisition and developing opportunities.  Across all industry verticals, create a territory plan to prioritize time investment across prospects and customers and manage an active pipeline of new logo opportunities. Ultimately, you are accountable for exceeding monthly/quarterly quota, dedicated deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.  The successful Account Executive will exhibit an ability to "evangelize" new and disruptive products plus have strong cross-functional collaboration skills and exhibit success engaging with the various pre/post sales resources required.  This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the Sales Manager.  Responsibilities  Deliver programmatic engagement with existing DocuSign clients to develop and maintain relationships while helping to grow DocuSign’s incremental revenue by uncovering additional use cases and opportunities to position the broader DocuSign agreement cloud.  Through Those Interactions You Will Qualify sales opportunities based on DocuSign’s sales methodology and metrics, to include client fit and success criteria Position DocuSign's value proposition as part of the overall business solution, linking these benefits back to the key business issues of the client Expand the DocuSign solution beyond the functionality introduced during the implementation process and consistently seek new business opportunities by presenting, recommending, and upselling new DocuSign products, services and partner solutions. Process sales orders and facilitate customer onboarding Manage customer needs for engagement with other DocuSign resources, such as professional services, training, product management and marketing Enlist customers to participate and/or speak at DocuSign and partner events Provide accurate, timely reports, and forecasts, as needed, for management Develop and maintain sophisticated knowledge of DocuSign’s products and services Maintain current and accurate account information, as well as leads and follow-ups for assigned clients in CRM database Manage overall customer loyalty, serving as internal advocate and escalation point to clients. Basic Qualifications 2 + years experience in consultative sales and account management, preferably within a SaaS model Proven track record meeting/exceeding individual sales targets and quotas Strong computer skills, including experience using sales force automation tools (preferably Salesforce.com), Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Preferred Qualifications Services/Consulting delivery experiences a big plus Ability to manage large volume of concurrent client relationships Ability to identify, critique, suggest, and implement intelligent changes to the clients' business optimization processes Ability to anticipate change and adjust priorities accordingly Ability to work as a team, as well as independently. Excellent verbal and written communications skills to be able to interact effectively at all levels of an organization. BS/BA degree Willingness and ability to travel as necessary. About Us  DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

description: As part of our growth strategy, Kardex Far East Pte Ltd is seeking a motivated self-starter to join our New Business Team in the role of Territory Sales Manager for Singapore. Position is home-based and reports to the Director New Business for SE Asia in Kuala Lumpur.  Purpose of the role:  Develop the market for Kardex products and solutions for assigned territories/segments in Singapore. Reach and exceed sales targets in the territory and relevant segment via direct sales. Lead business development for new industry and segment. Initiate and follow up marketing leads, turn them into opportunity and close the sales.  Major task and responsibilities:  Achieve quota in the sales area for bookings and Gross Profit Margin of Sales. Manage prospect acquisition and lead generation, offer making, contract and price negotiations. Develop solution and value proposition for customer. Initiate and participate in business development projects. Recognize market needs and report into the organization. Work with marketing team to implement sales and marketing campaigns. Attend trade shows, conferences and other marketing events. Follow Kardex C2 (Sales) process applying Miller-Heiman Sales Method and use of CRM reporting. Coordinate sales projects. Perform risk assessment Act as overall technical and commercial contact for customers. Ensure compliance with the Kardex policies and regulations.  Your profile:  Education: Tertiary education in related field. Minimum 7-10 years of experience in Capex sales with high exposure to Electronics, Biotechnology, Pharmaceutical and Food & Beverage industries, with good knowledge and understanding in ASRS, Automation, Robotics, AGV, AMR, VLM and/or conveyor systems. Intralogistics business knowledge with systems sales in warehouses 3PL, precision engineering, aerospace will be added advantage. Multi-year experience of high level and complex B2B sales, with solution selling. Commercial background with good technical understanding or vice versa. Formally trained in sales and key account management. Experience in development and negotiation of complex contracts. Good understanding of logistical processes, and software supported working processes. Experienced in using Strategic Selling Framework like Miller Heiman, SPIN selling and CRM, e.g. SalesForce Experienced in solution selling at high level. Creative and solution oriented. Patient, persistent and enduring working style.  Behaviours required to perform this role:  Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently at all levels of the organization. Ability to understand customer needs and see how our products can add benefits and help them being successful. Ability to create business cases together with customers. Ability to stay focused – talk when you should, listen when you should, multitasking ability, be sensitive and particular with how to use time best. Strong negotiation skills. Drive, team oriented, focus on winning. Build rapport and long term relationship with customers. Networking ability at all levels in organisation from board room to warehouse. Create and gain trust in and outside organisation. Be and create reputation of professional and fair behaviour.  This role is only open to Singapore citizens or Permanent Residents only.  Note: With your active application via LinkedIn you agree to the usage of your LinkedIn profile and your personal data during our internal recuriting process.

description: You will be: Come join us and be part of PolicyPal’s business development team to enable consumers to learn about personal finance and planning for their financial freedom. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining partnerships with business partners aligned to the company’s overall objectives and get exposure to shape the overall business strategy. Here at PolicyPal, we strive to provide opportunities for our team to learn, grow and thrive.  Responsibilities Achieving quarterly revenue targets through continuous account management and business development activities. Building up & managing client accounts through a customer contact strategy that includes regular virtual interaction (face to face depending on Covid regulations), creating multiple contact points in each corporate account, and personal relationship building with these contacts Continuously researching and prospecting new business opportunities through effective methods Pitching and presenting the company’s product offerings to new business opportunities and existing clients Completing regular needs analyses, formulating proposals, detailing costing, and negotiating payment terms with organisations. Requirements 1-2 years of business development or sales experience in the insurance or banking industry will be advantageous Ability to perform in a fast-paced and growth-charged environment Track record of consistently meeting and exceeding KPIs Excellent interpersonal, strong presentation and communication skills Comfortable with numbers and ability to use MS Excel Passionate about FinTech and InsurTech Certification in M5,M9,M8,HI,BCP, PGI, CGI would be a plus

description: The Dir – Business Development will find new and manage existing partnerships as well as coordinate our approach and sales strategy on large business opportunities. This role identifies, pursues, and secures business with new clients to meet or exceed individual and vertical sales goals within a geographical region, country, and/or territory. The Dir – Business Development also establishes and maintains relationships with key customer executives within the industry. Grows the company’s revenue and profitability by expanding client base. Identifies prospective clients through analysis of current marketplace data and a strong understanding of the industry, its challenges and opportunities. Establishes and owns relationships with key contacts at prospective clients, and develops prospects into becoming new clients. Owns client relationship from prospect stage to client stage. Works to maximize net sales, volume, share position and promotes the company to meet strategic business objectives. Builds and uses simple business models to analyze profitability of various business cases and make recommendations to next level management for approval to improve company profitability. Directs a specific annual revenue target based on estimated forecasts for new clients. Develops and maintains prospective clients’ pipeline, forecasts and revenues, and provides regular activity reports to Senior Management and Leadership. Develops effective forecasting models considering the company’s product/service umbrella, existing clients’ experience, current market and business conditions, and gathered prospective client’s intelligence on business challenges and needs to help establish strategies and priorities, and drive decisions. Develops effective responses to Requests for Proposals (RFP) as needed. Organizes and facilitates meetings with targeted prospective clients and internal teams to identify adequate services/offerings to meet prospective clients’ needs. Creates strong and effective internal partnerships with client and product teams to ensure services are properly scoped and priced to meet prospective client needs, and initial projects stay within scope, budget, timeline, quality and other Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Participates in the Strategic Account Planning (SAPs) process; drives the growth required to meet financial goals by developing and executing the annual strategic Account Plans as it pertains to new clients. Participates in, and often leads, the development and delivery of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities. Develops and implements the strategic and tactical plans (e.g., pricing, products, programs) for each major account and drives results directly through the District Sales Managers and Regional Managers. Takes best practices of Major Accounts and works to execute them within the Division’s smaller accounts. Collaborates with management of major accounts to develop sales programs/presentations, and marketing initiatives to be used by the major accounts. Develops sales tools and collateral materials for both internal & external customers. Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished. Mentors, coaches, trains and develops team. Additional duties as assigned. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Development or related field Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred 10+ years progressive sales and business development experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Understand margin calculations, profit and loss. 8+ years in a leadership role (direct or indirect) Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required. High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning) Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting

description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  Responsibilities To foster and build good customer relationship at all levels for revenue growth and customer retention. To work with Solution Manager & Sales Specialists to propose relevant and cost-effective ICT solutions for corporate customers, covering local, managed and hosting services. To understand and identify corporate customers’ ICT and hosting needs through regular engagement. To identify business opportunities and synergy with customers in areas of cooperation. To identify reciprocal businesses and areas of cooperation whenever there are opportunities. To provide one-stop ICT experience to customers covering related Singtel services. To ensure all support or tasks requested by Global Account Director are done timely and effectively. To ensure that all customers’ pre-sales & post-sales enquiries and works orders, commercial documents, dealings with customers are promptly attended to, documented and kept. To work closely with Singtel Global Offices to engage customers and to deliver services to customers. The Ideal Candidate Should Possess A degree or higher with at least 5 years of relevant working experience in account management in various industries achieving an excellent sales track record. Experience in telco or ICT account management will be an added advantage. Must be self-driven, energetic, resourceful and creative and possess good leadership. Must be proactive and have a sense of ownership. Able to project strong, positive image of self and company. Able to build good customer relationship at all levels. Able to deliver professional sales presentation, proposals and reports. Able to sell the full range of IT/Telecommunications solutions. High Proficiency in MS Word, Excel & Powerpoint We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

description: About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain—in real-time, across devices—to improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The Team  The APAC Sales Team is responsible for bringing in new logos, renewing accounts, and up-selling to current customers.  About The Role  We are looking for a highly motivated professional with sound business acumen, strong technical aptitude, and natural sales instincts to join our tech-focused sales teams as a Customer Development Representative. Ideal candidates should be eager to advance in our organization by demonstrating their ability to be tenacious self-starters every day. As a Customer Development Representative, you'll help achieve our corporate revenue objectives by providing world-class customer service and sales support. Specifically, you will help our Growth Plan segment grow. This is our high growth self-serve segment where our customers are mostly inbound. Together with another CDR, you will be responsible for handling these requests in the most efficient and streamlined manner.  The Customer Development team is part of the APAC Sales organization and is the first point of contact for the majority of our customers.  The Objectives Of The CDR Team Are To quickly identify if an opportunity is large enough to need an Enterprise Plan if this has not been identified through pre-qualification routing and to hand over to an Account Executive or To support the customer with enough information/demos for them to make a sale fast through our online portal or help them sign up so they can try the product themselves. To support customers who could be on a free or online plan that would be looking to upgrade. Primary  Responsibilities Pick up inbound requests for Demos or Contact from the Sales team. To run a quick Discovery and identify exactly the elements the customer needs to see in our platform to make a quick sale. The average deal value you will be responsible for will be between 5-20K USD ARR. To organize and run one to many demos or one to one demos if necessary. To answer any technical questions or administrative questions they may have. To ensure that all the relevant information is captured on Salesforce and kept up to date. Secondary - availability dependent Mine the data we have on customers who are evaluating our platform on the Free version and identify high potential customers which may need to be targeted for outbound activity. Conduct outbound activities to prospect, educate, and develop these interested customers to get them to buy. Partner with Account Executives to prioritize activities against a strategic target account list Provide feedback to ensure continuous process optimization We're Looking For Someone Who Has Strong Technical knowledge and a high level of comfort with providing technical advice and demoing on the fly. An agile mind and strong active listening skills who can ask the right questions fast to establish what needs to be done to get a sale. Strong and clear communication and presentation skills in order to be comfortable with running sessions which may have relatively large audiences - 10-100 attendees. Corporate sales development experience or equivalent experience (Software sales is a plus) Successful Inside Sales experience (experience hitting quota, scheduling outbound meetings, etc.) Motivation, drive, and a self-starting attitude Creativity and the desire to innovate and build in a growing sales organization Excellent time-management and organizational skills Excellent written/verbal communication skills Experience of Salesforce A 4-year degree or equivalent experience Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers’ success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can’t win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Computer Software

description: Join Affinidi and be part of the future of identity: secure, portable and controlled by the individual.  Affinidi empowers individuals and organisations with ownership and control of their verifiable data, to unlock value across borders and platforms.  Leveraging on the building blocks that Affinidi provides, trusted institutions and entities can issue verifiable credentials to customers, which can in turn be shared with other applications to access services in an open and interoperable ecosystem.  Currently undergoing development are three applications that leverage Affinidi's technology: Safe Travel initiative, a digital medical credentials ecosystem to safely open up international air travel; Trustana, a curated B2B marketplace and trade platform connecting verifiable, international partners for seamless cross-border trade; and Good Worker, an online job matching platform for seasonal workers and employers in India.  Affinidi, along with the applications Trustana and Good Worker, are seeded by Temasek, a global investment company headquartered in Singapore.  We are building a motivated and entrepreneurial team who is passionate about identity, decentralization and technology to make this happen.  What You'll Do To drive new business, accelerate annual sales and revenue targets/growth for the Travel vertical by identifying and assessing current and future growth opportunities as well as innovating to ensure scalable results for overall profitability Work with CxOs and other key customers to identify and create new value in their relationship with Affinidi, developing a deep understanding of their business challenges and providing Affinidi's solutions to address them Demonstrate ability to leverage Affinidi's portfolio of products and services and lead enterprise sales engagements smoothly from end to end across industries within Southeast Asia, India, China and beyond Continuous development and steady stream of opportunities to be converted to successful deals Work as part of a multidisciplinary team, and partnering closely with the product development organisation to ensure effective feedback and validation loops, to inform and refine the travel product roadmap Instill a purposeful, customer-obsessed culture centered on placing Affinidi customers at the forefront of every business decision Promote the adoption of Affinidi's SSI solution through participation in summits, conferences, and forums  You Should Apply If: You are a proven operator and have a successful record of in identifying, cultivating and closing high-value deals with enterprise accounts from Governments/ Travel industries Strong customer centricity and success oriented sales mentality You are entrepreneurial and innovative, with desire and capability to identify opportunities or develop new/alternative propositions for clients Negotiated commercial deals for complex solutions or products, requiring high touch implementations, and are excited by the opportunity to drive the early adoption of a truly transformative technology within the digital identity space Experience working with product development and engineering teams and are able to establish strong and trusted working relationships within a multidisciplinary start-up team Built trusted advisory relationships at the most senior levels, and operate with the highest levels of integrity to engender trust across a spectrum of stakeholders You have a track record of hiring, developing, and mentoring successful teams Proven success exceeding expectations in hitting growth targets and winning, retaining and growing customer relationships, within a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment, ideally at a scaling company You are comfortable with ambiguity, you are creative, adaptable, and comfortable with experimentation Innately curious and solution-oriented, collaboratively finding ways to turn challenges into opportunities, and opportunities into deals Experience with regions including EMEA and the Americas  Bonus points if: You understand developer marketplaces, and how to build open source ecosystems You have worked within the digital identity domain You have worked in an early-stage company and led them through significant growth, and subsequent fundraising rounds You have worked with resellers  Equal Opportunity Statement  Our company embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.  We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Us ❤️ Partipost is building a platform that connects brands with genuine people to launch organic marketing campaigns. We believe in giving the crowd a voice, and that social media advocates have the power to call their followers into action. We are committed to building solutions with our users' needs as a priority.  We are looking for you! 👀 Are you a go-getter that wakes up thinking about how you can change the world? Does disrupting the ad-tech sound right up your alley? Is working with big brands such as Guinness and Singtel something that you are looking for? Search no more! We have a mobile application with a growing user-base and often work with renowned brands. Join us today for an exciting journey ahead!  Role 👨‍💻👩🏽‍💻 Contacting potential clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings Planning and overseeing new marketing initiatives Researching organisations and individuals to find new opportunities Increasing the value of current customers while attracting new ones Finding and developing new markets and improving sales Developing quotes and proposals for clients Developing goals for the development team and business growth and ensuring they are met  Sound Like You? 🙌 Business Development Executive (0-3 years exp) & Business Development Manager (3 years and above) Singaporean or PRs Strong sales/ business development background Advertising/ media sales (preferred but not necessary) Strong command of English both spoken and written Strong interpersonal and communication skills preferred as you will be facing clients directly Excellent negotiation and presentation skills Proactive and able to execute projects independently with little supervision Able to be a great team player  Benefits 🎁 Competitive salary Performance bonus Commuter benefits Remote working within Singapore Central office location, heart of Singapore Awesome open office culture International work environment and flat organisation Great career development opportunities in a growing company   Backed by SPH Ventures, iGlobe Partners, Quest Ventures.  Partipost is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. description: SmartRetail is an exciting and established automated retail solution & interactive marketing platform deployed in Hong Kong, Singapore and Malaysia. We have developed our own proprietary platform, together with artificial intelligence technology to raise the bar of traditional retail solutions to enhance customer experience, drive engagement and improve profitability. Our business aims at disrupting the traditional retail business by creating a powerful IoT platform of smart automated retail machines, that also act as an interactive marketing platform with the use of artificial intelligence and big data.  The Role  The Role  Due to continued expansion, we are now looking for an additional highly talented salesperson to come and help us achieve our growth goals. In return you will be part of a high performing team with a customer centric approach who’s aim is to be ‘best in class’. You will also be part of a wider team of experienced product and digital specialists who give us our market leading edge. We can offer a competitive package with excellent benefits for the right candidate. This role reports to the Senior Manager Strategic Accounts, Singapore.  Key Purpose  To drive growth by achieving and exceeding sales targets and performance objectives by acquiring and retaining customers. To be a brand ambassador for SmartRetail with a consultative and customer focused sales approach.  Ideal Profile  Qualifications Ideally +3 year’s experience of working in a sales-led environment where you have generated significant revenue and sold to senior level stake holders. Keen to constantly develop your sales skills and capabilities. Willing to travel when required. Knowledge of Salesforce or using a CRM preferred. Skills And Competencies Strong sales skills with a proven track record of winning new business. Confidence in presenting to and speaking to groups. Winning people’s trust and putting them at their ease. Sound business acumen. Ability to persuade others using facts and insight. Ideas generation and the flexibility to solve business problems. Ability to thrive under pressure. Confidence in prioritizing and meeting deadlines. Resourceful and highly motivated individual with the ability to work independently, think analytically and remain calm under pressure. Excellent time management, multi-tasking and follow-through skills. What's on Offer? Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance Work alongside & learn from best in class talent Strong opportunities to progress your career

description: We are looking for an Account Manager to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The Account Manager’s role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients and actively seek new sales opportunities.  ROLE/RESPONSIBILITIES - Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters - Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships - Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customers’ needs and objectives - Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors - Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders - Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement - Prepare reports on account status - Collaborate with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within territory - Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed - Support projects organization in Asia (including China mainland), Europe and America - Manage the accounts/ customers P&L throughout the duration of the contract - Report to Events Director  REQUIREMENTS - Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager or relevant role - Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level - Solid experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) and MS Office (particularly MS Excel) - Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs - Proven ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail - Excellent listening and presentation abilities - Strong verbal and written communication skills - Positive attitude - BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Sales or relevant field - 5 years minimum of experience in account management - Love to be a dynamic team player - Bilingual in English & Mandarin & Cantonese to liaise with mandarin speaking partners is a plus

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world’s most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified’s machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  We are a fast-growing and dynamic startup with 650+ team members globally. We value collaboration and innovative thinking. We’re looking for bright, driven, and passionate people to grow with us.  About The Role  Riskified is growing our Business Development team and looking for its first feet on the ground in our new APAC Office located in Singapore. This is a great opportunity to join an established, well-funded FinTech Company that is experiencing intense high-growth. You will be one of the first employees in Riskified’s Singapore office and play a key role in our APAC expansion strategy.  This is not your typical Business Development opportunity. At Riskified, you’ll be generating and nurturing leads with enterprise and Fortune 500 companies through creative and strategic research as well as networking.  Very successful candidates are able to identify a target’s needs and decision makers and then tailor their outreach accordingly. More than anything, we are seeking bright, driven people to join us and help drive revenue and make a direct impact on Riskified’s growth. If you’re the type of person who likes to figure out where problems exist and then solve them and take on unique challenges, we’d love to learn more about you!  What You'll Be Doing  Establish Riskified’s Presence and Brand in Singapore, and greater APAC, through all of the following: Generate quality sales opportunities through proactive, strategic prospecting and networking Manage all sales opportunities - Create and execute a multi-faceted prospecting plan through research, cold outreach (calling and email), leveraging personal networks and following up on marketing generated leads Manage relationships with our partnerships in APAC to generate qualified leads Research industries and individual companies to find the best targets and establish and develop and nurture relationships with representatives at target companies through a variety of mediums Identify prospects’ key questions and pain-points Work closely with our marketing team to generate quality demand gen Represent Riskified at industry events in Singapore and the greater APAC Identify partnership opportunities for Riskified in APAC, and constantly highlight new necessities in the region in order to improve the Company’s presence in APAC Work as part of team with Account Executives and other company resources to win new clients for Riskified Qualifications Fluent in English - strong verbal and written communication skills - MUST 3-5 years professional B2B tech sales/ BD experience / management consultancy experience - MUST International work experience - MUST Sales oriented and highly motivated Good analytical & research skills and ability to use both in an effective and relevant way in a sales process Strong interpersonal skills, approachable and able to build relationships with prospects Excellent public speaking skills Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organisation Ability to work in a fast-paced sales environment with minimum supervision Experience in payments and / or eCommerce - an advantage Technical experience - an advantage Consulting background - an advantage Additional languages - an advantage In The News  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  Fortune Magazine: 25 Best Workplaces in New York  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Built In NYC: 100 Best Workplaces  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Riskified is deeply committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

description: The Role : Key Account Manager Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with customers. Liaise between customers and cross-functional internal teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs. Generate sales among client accounts, including reporting, up selling, and cross selling. Develops long-term relationships with a portfolio of clients, connecting with key business executives, and stakeholders. Makes sure clients receive requested products and services within timelines promised. Forecasts and tracks client account metrics. Manage projects within client relationships, working to carry out client goals while meeting company goals. Identifies opportunities to grow business with existing clients. Responsible for keeping current clients satisfied and delivering exceptional client service on a day-to-day basis. The Candidate Proven track record in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs and comfortable with working KPIs and achieving targets. Exhibiting the ability to build relationships with integrity, reliability, and maturity. 3 - 5 years of account management experience, preferably, with at least 2 years of experience with a tech company (selling enterprise CRM, ERP system, etc.), managing a portfolio of large / enterprise accounts and preferably one with high familiarity of the local market situation and access to broad network. Proficient in English wrapped with a superior communication skill and strong ability to present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level What We Offer A high degree of autonomy and freedom of creativity in a welcoming environment Sabbatical program of 15 days blocked leaves every 3 years of your tenure with us to recharge as we know that working long term in a company might be taxing. We aim to create an entrepreneur out of our team, where we are committed to supporting learning and development aspirations within and outside of our organization A unique environment of a mission-driven digital company present since 2012, always with a start-up mindset - just a bit wiser Our Values Think and Act Like an Owner Deliver Beyond Expectation Be Helpful Embrace and Drive Change Pursue Learning and Growth Be Open, Honest, and Constructive If you are up for the challenge, we hope you will join the team and take part in our journey to be the Most Impactful CRP in the region.

description: ABOUT KOMPACPLUS  Established in 2009, we are the primary supplier and installer of Italy-made KompacPanels – specially engineered interior panels that is built to be supremely durable and waterproof with signature compact thickness of only 6-mm. From on-site measurements to custom orders, we provide a full suite of services to help people achieve various lifestyle needs through innovative and seamless applications as countertops, wall claddings, custom furniture and more.  Driven by the shared aim to provide the ultimate service at every level, our vision is to one day conquer the global arena. To-date, we have also expanded from our headquarters in Singapore to Malaysia over the years, and increasing brand presence in neighbouring regions.  THE OPPORTUNITY Be part of the KompacPlus’ Unbounded experience by working alongside our passionate team of creative explorers to find business opportunities as well as building and nurturing customer relationships.  In order to deliver the ultimate service to our customers, we believe that every day is an opportunity to explore and innovate ways to offer better products and services, and with a growing portfolio of product and service offerings as a testament to our dedication over the years, we are looking for new adventurers to be part of the KompacPlus journey as a new chapter begins.  The ideal candidate is a reliable professional who is experienced in sales and customer service with balanced customer orientation and a results-driven approach. On top of being directly responsible for the preservation and growth of our customer base, your overarching goal is to identify opportunities with prospects and new clients, and building mutually benefiting long-term relationships with them.  MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Stay up-to-date with the company’s offerings and present new products to existing and new customers to gain more business Foster positive long-term relationships with clients by providing follow-up after-sales support Respond to complaints and resolve issues to customer’s satisfaction Maintain regular contact with clients to understand and meet their needs Manage the entire sales cycle from finding clients to securing deals Manage the flow of information from client to the project team for execution Negotiate agreements and keep records of sales and data  DESIRABLE SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES  • Communication and Interpersonal Skills Preferably with good English and Chinese proficiency Have strong listening and conversational adaptability Able to collaborate and work in teams Able to negotiate amicably and effectively  • Management and Organisational Skills Able to assimilate large quantities of information quickly while maintaining attention to detail Able to work under pressure  • Personality and Character Is easy-going and self-motivated Is proactive with willingness to learn Has industry awareness Able to manage challenges and constructive criticism Has good understanding of what makes a good advertisement  UNDERSTAND THE KOMPACPLUS CULTURE  As KompacPlus is built on the joint efforts of our valuable people, it is important for the ideal candidate to resonate with our core values as listed below:  Integrity: KompacPlus is a lifestyle brand for people. While we do our best to manage our own responsibilities and keep our egos in check, it is important for us to be able to trust and depend on each other to do the right thing, before we seek the trust of our customers in our brand.  Humility: No matter what roles we play, it is important for us to treat others the way we want to be treated. How we interact with people within and outside of KompacPlus should always reflect our commitment to provide the ultimate service to others.  Collaboration: In order to nurture a community where our people are not afraid to ask for help or give assistance to others in need, every success is celebrated as a team effort, and every mistake is shared as a learning opportunity to solve and improve on together.  Sustainability: How can a company grow if its people doesn’t? When we are not innovating new products and services to benefit our customers, we recognise the need for work-life balance and provide opportunities for continued self-development.

description: Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda. foodpanda is the leading, on-demand food delivery company in Singapore, bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We are also always looking at ways of enhancing the experience our partners have within the foodpanda space.  Recently, foodpanda has launched a new B2B venture enabling better supply chain management for foodpanda vendors.  We’re all about bringing on the smartest and most innovative folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture. This role will be based in Singapore and will be reporting to the Vendor Services Lead.  Responsibilities: Identify key decision makers (restaurant owners, procurement managers, head chefs, suppliers) in Singapore and build strong relationships with vendors and suppliers Handle end to end process of vendor/supplier on-boarding journey. This includes cold and warm callings/pitching. Educate and train vendors/suppliers on product adoption See through first order placed by new vendors Maintain regular communication & engagement with vendors/suppliers, provide real-time support Observe how vendors/suppliers use our product, engage with them on new feature requests and releases Responsible for gathering feedback and analysis: Share insights in a structured manner that will help improve product, strategy and processes - you are the eyes and ears of what's happening on the grounds Act as a point of contact for the portfolio of vendors and suppliers in answering high severity requests or issue escalations when necessary Conduct Market Research for potential lead identification and sourcing Ensure timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to vendor/suppliers' needs and objectives To liaise with internal departments, collect and consolidate users' requirements Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly targets and initiatives  Requirements: At least 1-3 years relevant working experience in e-commerce, B2B tech sales or account management within the tech industry Possess outstanding communication and interpersonal skills Experience & knowledge of supply chain is highly preferred Ability to analyse and draw inference from data Experience in delivering client-focused solutions Demonstrate ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization   What we offer: Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve Vibrant, dynamic & international workplace Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities Tasty Thursdays Birthday Leave Work Anniversar(ies) Leave Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company

TeleGeography, a telecommunications research and consulting firm, is expanding and looking for a new member of our business development team in Singapore.  The Business Development Assistant has a critically important role at TeleGeography, assisting with a variety of duties, including writing and editing proposals, managing all sales documentation, inputting and tracking all sales activity using Salesforce.com, send informative emails to current end users. Extraordinary attention to detail and excellent organization skills are required in order to be successful in this role. The successful candidate will have great writing and editing skills and will be able to work independently, prioritizing tasks without being micromanaged.  This is a great opportunity for someone looking to launch their career in sales! Our expectation is that as this individual’s experience and knowledge increases, this person will assume more responsibility for inside sales work (e.g. expanding existing client work, closing smaller deals, etc.). Prior experience is not required for this position, but may be helpful. Responsibilities include: -Coordinate and submit RFP responses- Communicate with clients regarding contracts, proposals, etc- Track sales activities in CRMs (SalesForce and Hubspot)- Serve as point of contact for client’s procurement tools and manage the contract process- Send informative emails to current end users- Coordinate and schedule sales calls and teleconferences- Triage incoming leads (via internet and phone)- Write and edit proposals- The successful candidate will possess the following:Ability to build rapport with clients- Excellent attention to detail and organization skills- Business (proposal) writing skills- Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite- Excellent oral and written communication skills- The ability to multi-task and prioritize work is a must- Takes ownership for work, always ensuring standards and deadlines are met and keeping others informed and up-to-date- "Can do" attitude, taking initiative in accomplishing agreed-upon goals- Self-motivated with an eagerness to learn- Have the desire, drive, and creativity to find solutions- Self-driven and results-oriented- Excellent English oral and written communication skills. Fluency in Mandarin or Japanese is preferred.- Experience with Hubspot or Salesforce is a plus, but not required TeleGeography is a boutique firm with a global scope covering a critical, dynamic industry. It offers a collegial, intellectual atmosphere with a bit of quirky charm in an energizing remote-friendly workplace. During non-pandemic times, we have active offices in California, Washington DC, Exeter, and Singapore. If you’re ready to put your skills to work for a team dedicated to authoritative industry analysis, we want to hear from you! Edit job description

description: About Us  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.  In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn’s Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don’t take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  About The Role  You will be reporting to the Sales Manager. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team into 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure they fully utilize their account.  What will you be doing? Hunt new commercial clients that are spending on cards (Commercial Card) OR Hunt new leads for client that are sending funds in different currencies across the globe (FX) Perform prospecting activities such as cold calling and networking Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps Drive referrals by your exceptional work Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook Keep all records in our CRM Report to Sales Manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results We would love to get to know you if you have the following: Bachelor’s degree OR at least 2-3 years of relevant work experience Hunting new opportunities is in your blood Possess a track record of being a top producer in your previous companies Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills via phone (cold calling) and email Experience with a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard/CardUp) is a big plus (Commercial Card) & knowledge of the commercial card market in Singapore (and SEA ideally) OR Experience with a remittance company (WorldFirst/Wise/Instarem/Wallex/SingX) is a big plus (FX) Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization Apply now at: https://boards.greenhouse.io/aspire/jobs/4103513004
