description: About The Company  StaffAny’s mission is to shape and empower the future of work. As the hunters of StaffAny, we stand at the frontline, spearheading and charting the growth of the Company. We provide our users with a remedy that streamline and automate their painful Operations/HR processes. Our users rely on our superpowers to understand their frustrations and we are here to empower them to make time for what they love.  About The Role  StaffAny started humbly from SouthEast Asia and is growing fast. We are looking to bet on our next rockstar who can learn and grow together with us. You will be part of the early team to shape and accelerate the growth of the company and be involved in the entire sales process, from early prospecting and engaging up to closing. If you are a go-getter who naturally puts yourself in the shoes of customers and is fascinated with challenges and growth, we would love to hear from you!  You Are A never-say-die hustler who hungers for growth Looking for challenges and responsibilities The person in your group of friends who facilitates conversations and crack jokes Strong communicator with positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, and strong writing skills Competitive in nature and values teamwork Always excited to exceed your limits and have shown success in meeting monthly targets 1 to 3 years of experience in B2B outbound SDR / Marketing roles (Bonus) Experienced in HR/ Productivity solutions for the F&B/Retail/ blue-collar industry. You Will Find Yourself Being part of the company’s growth momentum and working with the Head of Growth to share ideas and new business development strategies Generate new business opportunities to fuel the sales pipeline Acquire and develop sales opportunities through a combination of channels, including but not limited to calling, referrals, and networking Diligently follow up and set meetings between (prospective) customers and sales executives Build a lasting and genuine relationship with decision-makers to maintain the possibility of future sales Diligently fillup CRM (I.E HubSpot) and collate personal sales stats Meet or exceed SDR Sales Qualified Opportunities volume targets Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts Participate in documenting all processes in the StaffAny SDR handbook and update as needed with the Head of Growth Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts Being accountable for personal results Achieving targets as a team!!! The Offer The opportunity to be part of the team that paints the StaffAny’s story. Be part of a fast-paced growth environment where you learn how to be comfortable uncomfortable. We’re a diverse team and we’re look forward to you bringing your own unique flavor to the SDR role! Work together with a passionate and driven bunch of do-ers in a young and vibrant environment :~)

description: At a glance  If you believe that our clients' success is our success, and would love to come on board a fast-growing startup, then we strongly urge you to join our team!  About the role Our Sales Executive will be the driving force behind our market growth. They report directly to our Sales Manager and will be responsible for offering Chope’s entire range of restaurant yield solutions to restaurant partners. Acquire and develop sales opportunities through a combination of channels, including but not limited to, referrals, networking, cold calls, and face-to-face meetings Diligently follow up and close sales opportunities Build a lasting relationship with restaurant decision makers to maintain the possibility of future sales Consult and recommend our products and services to restaurant decision makers while communicating the value of joining the Chope network Collate press materials to ensure that a restaurant is ready to go live on the various Chope distribution channels Work closely with the Operations and Marketing team to facilitate successful product adoption and partnerships by new clients  Skills & experiences required At least 2 years of experience in B2B sales, particularly products or services Experience in direct selling products or services Able to communicate effectively with a broad range of audiences to sell Chope’s products Able to build positive, lasting relationships with clients Analytical, detail-oriented, and conscientious Great interpersonal and communication skills  What you’ll get from Chope Meaningful work that allows you to fulfill your purpose by doing the biggest job you’ve ever done for a mission you believe in Working for leaders who are open to new ideas and genuinely believe people are the company’s key success factor Flexible work arrangements and parental leave programs that provide you the balance you deserve Substantial employee referral incentives   We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

description: Carousell is a classifieds marketplace that makes selling as easy as taking a photo, buying as simple as chatting. Launched in August 2012, Carousell began in Singapore and is now one of the world's largest and fastest growing marketplaces. We have market presence in eight markets (Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Taiwan, Myanmar, and Vietnam) and three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India.  Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, and Sequoia Capital. The Carousell marketplace has a diverse range of products across a variety of categories, including cars, lifestyle, gadgets and fashion accessories. As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell.  The Merchant Services team at Carousell is responsible for establishing Carousell as the to-go online marketplace platform for all kinds of businesses ranging from retail, ecommerce, business services, home services & many more. The primary objectives of the Merchant Services Team is to acquire new businesses to be on Carousell, promote and educate Carousell advertising tools and ensure a long lasting relationship with Carousell.  We are looking for an experienced Sales Senior Associate to acquire & support businesses, brands, stores etc. to on-board & advertise with Carousell. This individual will drive sales of media and internal products (e.g. Carousell Coins) and manage advertiser accounts to ensure they are successful & using Carousell’s ad product. The scope will include all categories and sectors in Singapore, excluding cars and property sectors.  This role will report to the Sales Lead.  You Will Drive sales of assigned category/territory, acquire & on-board new merchants onto Carousell and achieve individual sales & revenue targets through your efforts. Proficient in prospecting through cold calling, canvassing & cold emails/LinkedIn etc. Able to articulate clearly & confidently the USPs and value proposition of advertising on Carousell and follow-up through the sales process. Experienced in managing sales pipeline and able to accurately forecast weekly sales and implement GTM sales strategies to achieve monthly targets. Build lasting business relationships with advertisers, ensuring they are successful in their business objectives when using Carousell ad products and media. Develop and maintain strong partnerships with clients establishing themselves as trusted consultants at all levels. Advise on client’s digital strategy and educate advertisers on Carousell ad platforms across channels and devices. Optimise accounts to improve performance for the advertiser. Aggressively grow sales and track retention of clients and/or agencies, negotiating additional budgets along with up-selling new Carousell products. Run performance reviews with clients to iterate and improve on Carousell’s effectiveness for clients and get feedback to further strengthen Carousell’s products and services. You Have A general diploma in business administration, marketing or a related field Passionate for sales and able to cold call, canvass, lead generate etc. and clear understanding of sales process and pipeline management At least 2 years of experience in media sales or B2B small business management Proven track record in identifying new opportunities and closing deals with small and large companies with a solution-based approach for clients Strong and in depth understanding of mobile, online business, ad tech, marketplace, e-commerce and/or classifieds Have exceptional communication skills and an ability to build excellent rapport with strategic decisions makers. Experience working in a highly collaborative environment with internal and external stakeholders Project management experience, including multitasking to run, lead or execute multiple time-sensitive projects in parallel Resourceful, driven and a team player Bonus if you are a Carousell user Bonus if you have experience working in a startup environment before or in eCommerce Note: Due to the high volume of applicants. Only shortlisted will be notified.  Agencies: Please do not call or email any employee of Carousell Group outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, to the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property/ownership of Carousell Group and, in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
industries: Internet, Information Technology and Services, and Online Media

description: Are you ready to accelerate your career? Join Cielo as a Business Development Representative! A career at Cielo will give you the opportunity to work with the industry’s smartest people and to take ownership of your success!  Cielo is a brand that reflects our big idea – that talent is rising – and with it our opportunity to rise above. We create careers for ambitious people by moving beyond traditional assumptions of what it means to work in talent acquisition.  The Business Development Representative will generate new business through networking, targeted campaigns, social media, cold calling, and other forms of outreach, utilizing professional networks to develop new partnerships for Cielo. The Business Development Representative will qualify inbound leads and engage Business Development Leaders for prospect meetings and sales opportunities.  This individual will be a key member of Cielo’s regional go-to-market team.  Responsibilities:  Develop expertise in Cielo offerings to effectively engage Cielo prospects in sales conversations Assist Business Development leadership by establishing active communication and engagement with prospects to create new leads and sales opportunities Research prospects online using LinkedIn, Google, Salesforce, and other resources Cold-calling prospects to develop new business leads Utilize additional communication forums (ex. Email, InMail, etc.) to introduce Cielo services Qualify prospects on potential fit for Cielo services Follow-up on inbound leads, serve as first point of contact, and schedule and attend meetings as appropriate Utilize Salesforce CRM to track and organize prospect details, including documenting conversations and interactions to maintain accurate sales database records and capture market intelligence  Qualifications:  Experience  4+ years’ recruitment industry experience Proven track record of driving sales results with a goal-oriented mindset Proven ability to work independently and as part of a broader team Demonstrated ability to understand others’ perspectives and build rapport Demonstrated resilience and initiative when encountering obstacles  Education  Bachelor’s degree in related field (i.e. Business Administration, Communications, Marketing), preferred  Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required  Exceptional interpersonal communication skills Engagement and Influencing skills, with an understanding of recruitment processes Life Sciences, Manufacturing, and/or Technology business sector knowledge and exposure Proactive in increasing own knowledgebase, learning new things, and keeping abreast of latest Cielo offerings Strong organizational skills  About Cielo  Cielo is the world’s leading strategic Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) partner. The industry has verified Cielo’s reputation for executing innovative solutions that provide business impact through numerous awards and recognitions, including its annual leadership position on the HRO Today RPO Baker’s Dozen listing, Peak Matrix Leader placement by Everest Group and Industry Leader designation by NelsonHall.  Cielo is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, or any other status protected by state or local law for an individual who falls within the jurisdiction of such law.

description: Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  The Singapore Commercial team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.  The team is responsible for acquiring, growing and managing the accounts of FMCG partners and key enterprise merchants across GrabFood, GrabMart and GrabPay. Ensuring close partnership with the merchants, we develop plans and strategies to drive their sales and meet their business needs, across the different services in Grab such as Express, Pay, Ads.  Get to know the Role:  As an Enterprise Account Manager (Mart), you will be responsible for: Establishing and managing strong business relationships with existing and potential new enterprise merchants to drive growth for GrabMart Leading all elements of account management, including business identification, business development strategy, partner negotiation, day-to-day account management, and execution of key initiatives Drive growth in enterprise accounts as measured by deliveries, GMV and revenue, as well as forming deeper relationships with partners through collaboration in other areas such as GrabPay, GrabAds and GrabExpress The day-to-day activities: Working with the GrabMart Account Management Lead / Head of GrabMart on business development strategy Manage a portfolio of key accounts with a focus on building lasting relationships and increasing profitability/revenue. Evaluate strategic and partnership opportunities, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses. Analyzing data and developing initiatives to increase revenues/profitability for your portfolio. Drive growth for key accounts, measured by deliveries and GMV and ensure that the partner thrives on the platform. Work across functions to tailor account specific needs (e.g. customized reporting, marketing support, integrations, product, etc.) to make sure accounts have the best possible experience on the GrabMart platform. Continuously engage our merchants and listen to their needs, collect and address feedback, and address concerns put forward. Drive operational excellence by working with the merchants and operations teams. Work closely with regional commercial teams to develop joint business plans, strategic initiatives and conduct regular business reviews. The must haves: Bachelor (or above) degree in Business/ Management or equivalent Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience (including account management, business development, partnerships or equivalent) Experience in managing FMCG, supermarket (e.g. Fresh Produce/Essential Products) or e-commerce categories is a plus Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify and provide comprehensive solutions for varying customer needs Ability to fuse business, strategy, finance and legal concepts to lead complex, multi-faceted deals Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Have a competitive edge and thrive in a team environment Comfortable with managing data and able to perform analysis (e.g. to solve business problems) Detail-oriented and organized
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Overview   This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly respected organisation as we are expanding the sales team to help continue the consistent growth we have experienced over the past 18 months. You will be responsible for building relationships with both new and existing regional clients from our Singapore office.   You will be a dedicated and resourceful team player with the desire to have a positive impact on the people around you.  Your skills and experience will display a mature approach to relationship based sales, and the ability to intelligently sell integrated solutions and services.  This is a varied position that is focused on growing business as well as managing strategic accounts and helping establish our reach in the APAC region.  Your Role This role is focused on developing strong relationships with clients and agencies in the region, selling Rombii’s suite of integrated solutions, which includes digital marketing, programmatic, native, content and demand generation, focused on outcomes.  Initially, you will be focused on the IT sector although in the future we will look at other relevant market segments where we can add value to clients.     Responsibilities Achieve revenue growth and business development objectives across Rombii’s suite of solutions Ensure coverage across both local SG and APAC counterparts within all relevant organisations Accurate reporting of revenue, activity and forecast figures, ensuring all data is accurately reflected in Salesforce Nurture key accounts, cross-selling solutions to consistently optimise revenue Discover and document marketing and sales function stakeholder maps within organisations : Marketing: Digital, Demand, Social, Search, Product, Channel Sales: Head of SDR / Inside Sales, Head of Sales, Sales Director Work with leadership to ensure our data includes relevant organisations and we have coverage of the stakeholders within them Leverage existing relationships to garner introductions to other prospects both internally and externally Build and manage pipeline and activity in line with your KPIs Report meeting pipeline and activities to the leadership team and ensure all systems show this data Actively pursue representation and involvement in industry forums and events to assist in the development of business relationships which may lead to new client acquisition Collaborate with sales teams by bringing innovative campaign ideas and case studies to weekly meetings Ensure that all outbound activity is executed and logged in Outreach Consistently achieve and exceed sales targets  KPIs  Planning A weekly account management plan executed and recorded in Outreach A daily structure focussed on activity and account coverage Proactive account discovery and opportunity creation  Activity Consistent outbound client engagement across phone, email and social All activity reported in Outreach through intelligent use of sequences and task management Following the Rombii outbound engagement model and ensuring delivery is accurate All client communication responded to on the same day  Reporting Account coverage - number of contacts engaged, prospects created, accounts attempted, accounts engaged Activity to meeting tracking - conversion metrics Meeting reports - working with the team to ensure all relevant information is recorded and actioned Accurate pipeline management and revenue forecasting to leadership  Required experience Minimum of 5 years experience in digital marketing and/or lead generation Strong contact list of agencies and clients in the IT industry Strong telephone and face to face sales skills Enthusiasm and expertise in working with senior marketing professionals in a consultative manner, listening and responding to their needs Strong organisational and interpersonal skills Comfortable and capable as part of a strong team culture and as a high performing individual

description: Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.  foodpanda is the leading, on-demand food delivery company in Singapore, bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture.  We are looking for a highly driven and motivated Account Management Lead for our shops team in Singapore. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have direct impact on an ever-growing business, this might be the place for you! The ideal candidate will have prior experience in managing teams, and working closely with management in driving business growth.  About This Role  This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Head of Marketplace - Shops.  Job Description  The Account Management Lead will lead a team of Account Managers and Key Account Managers to grow foodpanda’s business by managing the overall shops experience. These tasks include, but are not limited to: Manage the team: scale the team according to the growing portfolio of brands with foodpanda, manage incentive schemes for Account Managers, onboard new joiners, identify growth areas for your direct reportees and provide guidance for them to achieve it Drive business expansion strategies: Explore best opportunities within market segments to penetrate through foodpanda shops. Understanding varying directives and approaches adopted by different business segments currently online on foodpanda shops and exploring the best way in achieving a mutually beneficial business partnership Pursuing Operational Excellence: monitor overall vendor performance metrics and direct your team to ensure their portfolios’ compliance with foodpanda’s operational standards, so we deliver to our customers in the most efficient way possible! Exploration of Non-Commercial Revenue (NCRs): Exploring and creating beneficial deal & promotional packages for vendors on the platform to opt-into. You will be the local owner of post-live sales growth along with the opportunity to be involved in the end-to-end process of bringing deals live, including pitching to restaurants when necessary. Guide and motivate the team to achieve their targets Innovation and Automation: ideate and propose new ways to improve engagement of our key brands with foodpanda Stakeholders Management: coordinate with cross-functional departments to engage support for activities aimed to drive business growth and ensure operational efficiency Requirements Prior proven experience and the passion in building/managing teams in a fast-paced environment is preferred Previous eCommerce, high tech, or retail experience is required A natural flair for building relationships. Outgoing personality, always ready to meet clients and understand their needs! Comfortable with data analysis and business process improvement Strong communication skills, with the ability to communicate with both external (vendors) and internal (regional/global/local) teams across departments What We Offer Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve Vibrant, dynamic & international workplace Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities Tasty Thursdays Birthday Leave Work Anniversar(ies) Leave Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company

Job Descriptions • Manage and Increase business with existing customers by identifying their current and future service requirements • Establish new accounts by potential customers; planning and conducting sales calls • Explore new business opportunities and identify new customer base • Contribute to team effort and be accountable for sales growth objectives • Monitor payment and control collection • Meeting with possible partners to introduce business’s services • Attend to sales enquiries and general sales quotations • Correspond with suppliers and customers to ensure prompt delivery & provide service • Maintain good relationship with distributors and key customers • Identify and develop new sales opportunities and strategy to enhance market penetration  Job Requirements/Qualifications Minimum Diploma in Civil or Mechanical Engineering Preferably with working experience in foundation and piling construction (min 2yrs) Familiar with construction materials and consumable products Experience in working with client at multiple levels Strong written and verbal communication skills Good computer literacy With Class 3 Driving license Preferably to possess own vehicle

Business Development Manager - SAP Partnership  Sales and Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our technology is transforming the way our customers live their lives and do business. Our Sales team is collaborating with customers across the globe to help them leverage our technology to change the way they do business. Our Business Development team is partnering with some of the largest and most innovative companies in the world and in their industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to an individual or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our product and strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line  The position  At DocuSign we are passionate about transforming how companies are doing business today – we enable companies to do business faster, quicker and on any device.  This position will be a resource to drive and accelerate our partnership primarily with SAP. We are looking for an individual who has a proven record of success in building and driving established Partner relationships (for example SAP, Salesforce or other Cloud-Software vendors ) and also with the wider DocuSign partner eco-system. You will have a clear understanding of how to drive Go-To-Market strategies and able execute them in complex and large partner organizations.  This role reports into the Director of Partner Ecosystems, SAP and is designated Flex.  Responsibilities  You will be responsible for developing, prioritizing and executing go-to-market strategies for our key strategic partners in the APAC region. Working closely with our sales, business development, renewal managers, sales engineering and marketing teams, as well as with SAP and other partners to drive DocuSign’s Go-to-Market strategies. Build the go-to-market (GTM) plans for key DocuSign partners (SAP) Establish marketing plan and associated budget for the overall GTM plan for APAC Create demand generation campaigns in key industry sectors to drive revenue with our partners Own the partner pipeline and revenue for your market segment Conduct quarterly business reviews with key partners Present partner updates at monthly executive meetings Communicate regularly across the organization and ensure DocuSign sales teams are informed of new developments and properly enabled Basic Qualifications 12 years+ business development / sales experience Proven experience and success in a Partner / Channel / Alliances role Demonstratable ability to achievekey revenue targets. Strong understanding of cloud requirements in the APAC market Ability to create Go-To-Market plans and extend these to enhance and increase partner revenues Timely responsiveness to sales and renewal manager inquiries Preferred Qualifications Proven experience and success in a Partner / Channel / Alliances role Proven ability to think and work strategically An understanding of SAP’s Ecosystem would be an advantage BUT not necessary Experience with other software vendors like Salesforce, Microsoft Relevant experience in SaaS and other cloud technologies Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Strong communication and presentation skills – both verbal and written. About DocuSign  DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.  DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

description: The Business Development Manager of Sales is responsible for sales efforts within assigned business verticals with the objective of identifying and helping to sign large eCommerce Processors, Marketplaces, Telcos and Retailers. You will develop new regional business relationships by meeting the product and service needs of prospective and current clients. Highly motivated and forward-thinking, the ideal candidate must be a strategic and critical thinker with a proven record of success exceeding sales and business development goals.  Vesta is a SaaS-based, global leader in fraud protection and guaranteed e-commerce payment solutions. We are headquartered in Portland, Oregon with flagship offices in Atlanta, Ireland, Singapore and Mexico City. We are looking for energetic new talent to help us execute on our plans for innovation, growth and expansion, globally.  Core Responsibilities: Plan, and execute go-to-market strategies to support sales efforts within assigned business verticals and regions Work closely with E-Commerce product and sales leadership to develop and execute strategies Coordinate business development efforts with internal teams to develop sales and marketing materials, provide market intelligence and product feedback Proactively develop strong relationships with prospective clients, with the objective of structuring long-term program relationships Coordinate business development / relationship-building efforts with external partners who have been successful at cultivating relationships with target prospects Possess a strong understanding of Vesta products and services, and the ability to articulate these in a compelling manner Provide creative input to develop new features and capabilities for enterprise prospects Utilize CRM tools to manage prospective clients, analyze data and trends, and provide updates to senior leadership on the status and strategic direction of key prospects Treat people with respect; keep commitments; inspire the trust of others; work ethically and with integrity; uphold organizational values; accept responsibility for own actions  Education & Experience Required: Bachelor's degree required; master's degree preferred Minimum of 3-5 years of sales or business development experience with a track record of meeting or exceeding targets This position will require up to travel 50% + annually (post-COVID)  Competencies Required: Experience in executing full sales cycle direction for enterprise, merchant, and ecommerce prospects Successful track-record of Sales or Business Development experience working with large eCommerce clients at E-Commerce, Fintech, or online marketplaces. Demonstrated ability to lead all aspects of the business development sales process for enterprise prospects Ability to assist in the RFP processes, develop value propositions and proposals that resonate with online retailers Passion for large market enterprise and eCommerce business development Demonstrate an ethical approach to business, high integrity, and a commitment to delivering superior results Experience working in a commission-driven compensation model Ability to work effectively in a remote work environment as an individual contributor  About Vesta  Vesta is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company that specializes in managing payments in the "card-not-present" (CNP) arena. We use next-level technologies and cutting-edge data science methodologies to bring unparalleled accuracy to fraud detection. Our zero liability solutions let merchants step fearlessly into the world of online commerce, so they can stop chargebacks—without stopping business.  We are a company reinventing ourselves for the future in an industry that is growing and changing at the same time. We are looking for talented people to join us who resonate with our Vesta Values: trust, partner, empower, passion and courage -- and who love to tackle new challenges every day.  We are also a casual, fun and flexible workplace that also offers highly competitive benefits including a selection of medical, dental and vision care options, paid parental leave, generous paid-time-off and a paid sabbatical program.  Vesta is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, or disability.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact Jobs@trustvesta.com for assistance

description: Confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. Have you ever found a new favourite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? That’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organisations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. Our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organisation. With Confluent, organisations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.  We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energised to roll up their sleeves and help realise Confluent’s enormous potential. Chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. We value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact.  About The Role  TheEnterprise Account Executive will play a key role in driving Confluent’s sales activities in region. This role includes activities developing and executing on the go-to-market strategy for your territory. The ideal candidate needs to have experience selling complex Database, Messaging, Big Data, Open Source and/or SaaS into large corporate and multi national companies.  Responsibilities Focussing on Pakistan, Sri Lanka & Bangladesh locations Build awareness for Kafka and Confluent within large enterprises Aggressively prospect, identify, qualify and develop sales pipeline Close business to exceed monthly, quarterly and annual bookings objectives Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities Build and maintain relationships with new and existing Confluent partners Create and execute go to market plans that are based on viral methods and organic growth  What We're Looking For At least 5+ years of outside sales experience Deep experience selling within the Database, Open Source, Messaging or Big Data space. An ability to articulate and sell the business value of big data and the big impact on businesses of all sizes Experience selling to developers and C levels Significant experience in a Sales and/or Business Development role within a similar start up and high growth organization  Come As You Are  At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact.  Click here to review our California Candidate Privacy Notice , which describes how and when Confluent, Inc., and its group companies, collects, uses, and shares certain personal information of California job applicants and prospective employees.

description: Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.   Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. Our systems are accessible at the touch of a finger via our software platform and app.    We make it easy for anyone to do business anywhere and hold ourselves to high standards of doing business by maintaining our triple bottom line philosophy that emphasizes happy clients, happy employees and happy shareholders. And not to brag, but we’ve won multiple awards for our culture, including being named as one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America by Entrepreneur Magazine   Globalization Partners International Business, Simplified.  ﻿About the position: As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.   Responsibility of the role: The team is responsible for the generation of new revenues for Globalization Partners by meeting corporate sales targets. As a member of this key team, you would be responsible for meeting your individual sales targets and other metrics established by the Sales Manager.  What you will do:  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle including reaching out and following on both incoming and self-generated leads, generating deal proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the wire, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy, high integrity and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on provide an outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners.    Responsibilities:  Understand prospective client requirements and validate their suitability for Globalization Partner’s solution Complete sales and achieve quarterly sales targets Meet activity KPIs set by your sales manager Build and sustain a strong understanding of the Globalization Partner’s solutions using the education materials provided Maintain a strong understand of the competitive environment by engaging in internal training, self education and research Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team colleagues, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc.  Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges  Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution  Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target  Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics  Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc.  Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive  Develop, maintain and engage in business related networking online via LinkedIn, Twitter (etc.) and physically through local networking and industry events Build partnership with sales executives in adjacent solutions to maximise lead opportunities Maintain high quality data in Salesforce   What we are looking for:  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in our culture, we look for the following demonstrated attributes:   Ability and experience in researching prospect industries and providing insight as relates to talent acquisition Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships  Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal  Active listening skills  Attention to detail  Collaborative and support skills to team Presentation & product demonstration experience  Problem solving skills  Information gathering skills  Self-starter with strong time management & organisational skills  Ability to understand and explain complex solutions Successful record in selling solution in a remote environment  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business discipline or equivalent  Minimum of 2 - 5 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and pitching to C-Level  Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus preferred  Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies preferred International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a start-up environment an advantage  Very good English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred

description: Exciting opportunity to join a boutique specialty coffee brand as BD Manager!  Your new company You will be joining an interesting boutique coffee roaster brand with headcount of less than 300 globally. They specialize in an array of coffee roast, capsules, and brewing tools to cater to D2C market, Independent Cafes, Restaurants, and Hotels. With 3 decades of roasting experiences, the company is very relationship-focused and they attribute their success to the people that they worked with, whether it is their employees, Café partners, or their day-to-day customers.  Your new role As the Business Development Manager, you will play as a major contributor to Singapore's revenue by identifying, initiating, and developing new businesses & accounts. You will actively pursue new customer relationships in line with company's current focus and work collaboratively across all areas of business to ensure an exceptional brand experience for the customers.  As the company focuses on Cafes and Restaurants business, you will seek to continue their network within the Horeca channel.  What you'll need to succeed The successful candidate will come with 4 - 6 years of track record in Business Development, Sales, and/or Account Management, with a strong focus in Food & Beverage / Coffee sectors. Ideally, you will possess wide network within the Horeca channel and comes with a strong hunting mindset to grow the business.  What you'll get in return In return, you will have the opportunity to work in a company that centered around its people and development. The company also has a nurturing & family-oriented culture. You will have the opportunity to work alongside a talented & motivated regional team, while having opportunity to develop your career vertically & horizontally.  Base salary range from $5,500 - $6,500/month + sales incentives.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or email me at Richard.Tey@hays.com.sg. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
industries: Consumer Goods, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: Marcura is an established, successful, diverse and energetic company and for the last 20 years we’ve been developing a series of innovative software products and platforms which have been transforming our part of the massive maritime market. Our mission is to streamline the processes of the shipping industry and we do that via digital transformation.  So far, we’ve done a pretty good job with significant growth (we’re now over 700 people, based in multiple countries) and market leading products (see the website for more). But we’re even more ambitions now than ever. With big future growth plans we have vacancies for some new teammates with big talents and expertise.  In order to be passionate about our customers, we need to be passionate about hiring (and keeping) the best talent. That’s hopefully where you come in. If you are talented and passionate about digital transformation, tech, platforms, SaaS, customer service, and excellence we’d be pleased to hear from you.   Marcura is looking for a Senior Sales Manager to develop our activities in Singapore  You will join MarTrust, which is a company under The Marcura Group. MarTrust is an ambitious and dynamic payment services organisation that delivers a unique value proposition to the Maritime industry. In MarTrust, you will join a team of experienced payments specialists, who focus on continuously developing the value proposition and market awareness. While it is an ambitious team, your new colleagues are also up for casual virtual hangouts and brainstorming sessions. You’ll work closely with the Commercial and Product Development Teams, who are passionate about offering the best financial solutions focused solely on the maritime industry.  This is what we really need from you: As a Senior Sales Manager, you promotes MarTrust brand awareness and define a robust sales plan and prospects pipeline to sell and develop MarTrust services such as e-wallet, FOREX, and payment solutions within the Maritime Industry.   Your new day to day will be: Promote MarTrust brand awareness, Payment solutions, FOREX, and E-wallet to prospective customers within the Maritime Industry in Singapore and Asia.  Plan sales and prospecting strategy for the relevant country and define the relevant activities to meet sales targets. Provide regular updates on the progress made to the Management and update our internal software that monitor the sales pipeline cycle. Establish customers' needs, assess the relevant services required and prepare and present the proposal to the customer. Understand the value drivers and negotiate the commercials for the relevant services. Liaise with Business Intelligence Team to develop high quality leads following the processes and Marcura’s core values to drive commercial actions. Closely collaborate with sales and marketing departments within the group to determine the best methods of promoting MarTrust services within the country and region. Comply with all policies and procedures, reasonable and lawful instructions of MarTrust to ensure compliance with the UK FCA and the Relevant Financial entities.  Your background: Holding an MBA or Master degree in Sales or Business Development Banking Education and Experience in Banking or Payment sector Experience in remote working or collaborating virtually Strong sales experience, with Ship Management or maritime industry exposure Experience working for a Payment Provider or a Bank with a network in the shipping industry would be a great advantage.   Here are some of the benefits you get from working with Marcura: - highly competitive salary and various other benefits -remote-first organization which means you can work from home - we organise your home office IT setup and a monthly remote work allowance  - extensive and inclusive onboarding process; you’ll be up and running in no time - flexibility: we support a healthy work-life balance -employment locally, but in a global and ambitious organisation;  our benefits often exceed local benchmarks - modern performance management framework; you are supported monthly to achieve your best possible potential  Here are some of the great things about working at Marcura: - already successful company - growing company, launching new products, always improving and investing - really great, fun people in the team (but you’ll have to take our word for that until you start!) - global mindset, strong values and passionate colleagues from all over the world  - innovative approach to customers, our platforms and services backed by an ambitious organisation - digital work environment that’s constantly developing to drive excellence for our customers and our organisation - modern communication and collaboration tools for our virtual support of customers and each other
industries: Maritime, Banking, and Financial Services

description: Job Brief :   We are looking for an ambitious and energetic Business Development Manager to help us expand our clientele. You will be the front of the company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective sales strategy. The goal is to drive sustainable financial growth through boosting sales and forging strong relationships with clients and Channel Partners.  Responsibilities :  Develop a growth strategy focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction Conduct research to identify new markets and customer needs Arrange business meetings with prospective clients and Channel Partners Promote the company’s products/services addressing or predicting clients’ objectives Prepare sales contracts ensuring adherence to law-established rules and guidelines Keep records of sales, revenue, invoices, etc. Provide trustworthy feedback and after-sales support Build long-term relationships with new and existing customers and Channel Partners Develop entry level staff into valuable salespeople  Requirements:  Proven working experience as a business development manager, sales executive or a relevant role Proven sales track record Experience in customer support is a plus Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) Proficiency in English Market knowledge Communication and negotiation skills Ability to build rapport Time management and planning skills BSc/BA in business administration, sales or relevant field

Be part of something revolutionary We have a vision. Our Digital Brain, o9’s AI-powered platform, is being used by global enterprises to drive their digital transformations. The integrated planning and operational efficiencies we provide are helping businesses do more, be more and mean more to the world at large. Because businesses that plan better, reduce waste, creating value for themselves and the planet.   But we also have a vision for our people. We want the most talented, committed, and driven people to power our transformative approach. In return, we’ll provide a nurturing environment where you can be a part of something special.  About the role As a member of the o9 alliance team, you are responsible for building out our partner network. You are continuously connecting with both our partner contacts and o9 sales on developing account opportunities. You will do this by maintaining a network of partner contacts and making sure we are connected at all key initiatives and events.. You will work closely with the Alliance lead and the rest of the Alliance team as well as business stakeholders such as Sales, Business Development, Presales and others. You will help execute go-to-market (GTM) campaigns and continuously expand and educate our partner network. Key metrics include a number of partner contacts identified and engaged.  A successful candidate will bring a Bachelor’s degree, and 1- 3+ years of project management experience in the areas of Sales/Marketing, Supply Chain, this can be in the form of internships and academic coursework. You will have demonstrated success, or bring strong aptitude in, process mapping, identifying key stakeholders in order to build relationships and execute sales and marketing programs. Experience in end-to-end planning & forecasting, using Salesforce CRM is a plus.  What you will be doing:  Maintain relationships with partner contacts and support the joint governance model Maintain and expand partner contact networks and work closely with internal teams to identify and expand networks.  Represent o9 and evangelize our partners and their sellers on our vision, mission, and propositions Coordinate and help execute go-to-market programs Conduct introductory sessions for all our partner contacts Gain thorough knowledge about the o9 platform and its value.  Visit partners and attend events as appropriate  What you will bring: Bachelor’s degree required One or more years of experience with Sales, Project Management and/or Consulting and/or Supply Chain experience would be a plus You have a true passion for process transformation and end to end planning & forecasting A disciplined and structured approach to mapping out key stakeholders to build relationships  Proficient use of MS Office package, LinkedIn, and Salesforce Excellent spoken and written communication, interpersonal & relationship building skills Ability to work across time zones and travel domestically and internationally when appropriate  What we ask:  Great work ethic and eagerness to learn  Strong initiative – you don’t have to know everything, study the context/problem first, and if you cannot find the solution reach out for help  Proactive (self-motivated, self-directed, ambitious, highly productive)  Low on ego, high on interest to contribute to the benefit of your peers (we are including the customer team here as well)  Flexibility to work with global partners (Europe, India, and the US)  What you get:  A fantastic opportunity to join a Unicorn with an amazing AI platform Extended possibilities to travel  Exposure to the biggest brands in the world  A flat organization with a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics)  Possibility to really make a difference in a scale-up environment
industries: Computer Software, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Information Technology and Services

description: Who We Are  Johnson Controls is the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings. At Johnson Controls, we’ve been making buildings smarter since 1885, and our capabilities, depth of innovation experience, and global reach have been growing ever since. Today, we offer the world’s largest portfolio of building products, technologies, software, and services; we put that portfolio to work to transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play.This is where Johnson Controls comes in, helping drive the outcomes that matter most. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make your buildings smarter.  Sustainability is a top priority for our company. We committed to invest 75 percent of new product development R&D in climate-related innovation to develop sustainable products and services. We take sustainability seriously. Achieving net zero carbon emissions before 2040 is just one of our commitments to making the world a better place.  Please visit and follow Johnson Controls Pacific linkedin for recent exciting activities.  Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/johnson-controls-australia-pty-ltd/  Career The Power Behind Your Mission  OpenBlue OpenBlue: This is How a Space Comes Alive  What You Will Do  The APAC Inside Sales Leader will be a customer champion. Strong belief in serving customers by managing their expectations and delivering what you promise. Responsible for leading overall implementation and development of a world-class Inside Sales team across the region which will increase the volume of qualified pipeline / leads and drive incremental growth from targeted campaigns. An entrepreneur at heart to enjoy the challenge of expanding new territory and executing a land-and-expand strategy. Keep Company leadership apprised of market / industry activity and trends, including new solutions, process improvements and technology which could empower the sales team.  How You Will Do It Lead the APAC Inside Sales program to build and develop world-class Inside Sales teams across APAC markets delivering against growth targets and key metrics on lead and pipeline development. Work with local Inside Sales Teams & Leaders together with in-country / regional leadership to optimize team structure, processes, and enabling tools / programs to maximize performance in targeted growth campaigns leveraging industry best practices. Identify and implement improvements / enhancements working with cross-functional teams across the enterprise. Provide coaching and development opportunities to Inside Sales Team Leaders / Reps in order to maximize both personal performance as well as development of their teams to drive growth. Establish and enhance strong performance management of Inside Sales teams through establishing clear targets and KPIs, leveraging data from multiple sources as well as driving operational cadence / reporting. Prepare and deliver regular updates to senior management as required. Monitor team productivity and motivate team to reach daily goals. Ensure accurate and complete information is captured in CRM system. Prepare cohesive procedures to capture new leads by using tools like install base mining. Establish and manage demand generation procedures and operations prepare or launch campaigns for lead generation. Conduct entire management activities inclusive of coaching, evaluating, training and monitoring performance. Motivate, establish sales quotas and provide education to target accounts as well as markets. Continue to develop new strategies on how to generate sales opportunities to further expand growth. What Are We Looking For Experience of at least 6 – 8 years in related position or organization leading an Inside Sales team, preferably within a multinational organization Experience in Six Sigma and/or similar process improvement & excellence discipline desired. Some experience or knowledge working in an HVAC/BMS/Building Technology field preferred. Ability to work with CRM platforms as well as Excel to analyze & drive performance. Managerial abilities. Multi-tasking ability; ability to be flexible enough to handle numerous tasks. Ability to work efficiently as part of a team. Ability to work with little or no supervision. Excellent presentation skills. Self-motivated and enthusiastic. Must be an excellent communicator, whether orally or on paper. Must possess good organizational leadership skills. Possess excellent decision making skills. Ability to meet up with deadlines. Good interpersonal skills. Ability to pay attention to details. Must possess people skills, and have the ability to be creative. JCI’s Diversity & Inclusion  Our dedication to diversity and inclusion starts with our values. We lead with integrity and purpose, focusing on the future and aligning with our customers’ vision for success. Our High-Performance Culture ensures that we have the best talent that is highly engaged and eager to innovate.  Our D&I mission elevates each employee’s responsibility to contribute to our culture. It’s through these contributions that we’ll drive the mindsets and behaviors we need to power our customers’ missions. You have the power. You have the voice. You have the culture in your hands.  Job  Sales & Marketing  Primary Location  SG-South West-Singapore  Organization  Bldg Technologies & Solutions
industries: Information Technology and Services, Machinery, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Responsibilities: Serves as the primary point of contact for the reseller interface to all Ingram Micro resources Responsible for selling Ingram Micro’s products or services, developing new accounts and/or expanding existing accounts Develops strategic relationships with resellers to identify and leverage the resellers’ business goals, growth strategies and profit drivers to deliver Ingram Micro’s value proposition sales solution strategy Provides leadership and guidance in account planning and engagement Engages resellers in joint planning that integrates Ingram Micro products & services by securing reseller commitment for the development of a comprehensive investment in strategies that advance Ingram Micro’s market position and financial goals Conducts business reviews with assigned accounts to track progress toward revenue and growth goals and owns execution of business plan Maintains and monitors pipeline for assigned accounts, performs analysis and identifies improvement opportunities Supports Ingram Micro vendor's strategies by aligning solutions with our resellers to maximize profitable growth and reseller expansion   Requirements: Bachelor's degree (in a relevant field) or equivalent experience from which comparable knowledge and job skills can be obtained 3 to 5 years’ work experience in sales in IT industry Experience in direct sales & consultative sales is a plus Experience in handling large accounts Ability to perform with little supervision Good problem solving & issue management skills Proven ability to develop business relationships and penetrating and growing business from existing/new accounts Must be highly motivated, have a passion for sales and proven sales success with the ability to drive revenue within accounts Excellent communication and organizational skills required

description: Business Development Executive Role  As an experienced sales professional, you’ll partner with existing Gartner clients, leveraging internal subject matter experts, to address their most critical priorities. Business Development Executives are strategic partners to C-level and senior executives and focus purely on establishing new business relationships with non-client organisations within an assigned prospecting territory. Clients of the large enterprise sales team have $1B+ in annual revenue and include 77% of the Global 500. Your role will also include: Partnering with C-Level executives to develop and implement effective, enterprise-wide strategies Owning the full sales cycle from prospecting through close Having excellent executive presence and the ability to lead and close a complex sales process using Gartner’s value selling proposition Forecasting and account planning on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis What’s in it for you? World-class training through our Sales Academy when you join and on-going training from our L&D team and sales leadership Unlimited advancement potential as a sales professional or progression into people leadership Unmatched resources to support your success Inclusive environment with great balance for personal and family life Generous compensation including uncapped commission, accelerators, bonuses & incentive trips About The Team  Our diverse sales team is one with a track record of continuous learning and overachievement. 46% of our sales associates achieved our annual sales recognition trip, Winner’s Circle, in 2019 and 18% were promoted to new roles. Most people leaders have been promoted internally and have delivered great success as an individual contributor in the past. They’re hands-on and enjoy working through challenging client scenarios alongside their team!  What You Need To Be Successful  We’re a traits-based organization that seeks diverse talent to best meet our clients’ needs. We look for sales professionals with strong executive presence, intrinsic drive, natural curiosity and coachability. The experience level we look for is as follows: 5-8 years of consultative, B2B sales experience Experience prospecting to the C-Suite and senior-level leadership of enterprise businesses Quick learning attributes that enable you to pivot and work through ambiguity Ability to demonstrate strong sales process and strategies Track record of over achievement on goals or quotas Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s or advanced degree is a plus
industries: Legal Services, Management Consulting, and Financial Services

description: Do you have expertise in, and passion for, Pharmaceutical Sales? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the lives of patients in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you!  ABOUT ASTRAZENECA AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.  We are on a journey to bring life-saving medicines to patients. Our role in contributing to decreasing mortality rates globally is clear – shaping the future by spotting a scientifically-led commercial opportunity and acting now to operationalise and scale it.  Our Singapore Marketing Company (SGMC) is responsible for the marketing of our medicines in Singapore. Here you’ll also find colleagues from AstraZeneca’s corporate functions and our Asia and International regions’ sales and marketing teams. As a member of the Singapore Association of Pharmaceutical Industries (SAPI), all of our sales, marketing and communications activities are subject to the SAPI Code of Conduct.  BUSINESS AREA – Singapore Marketing Company, Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism (CVRM) Business Unit Our team proudly leads the way as the fastest growing pharmaceutical. But we’re not done yet – we’re fearless in setting the direction for a new future to keep progressing for our patients. We’re bringing transformative drugs to those that need them the most by combining continuous new launches with unique solutions across the whole patient journey. It’s how we are able to truly make a difference to the quality of lives and answer huge unmet patient needs.  In our ever-evolving and complex markets, it takes entrepreneurial thinking to stay at the forefront. Fusing our diverse minds with local ownership we’re powered with everything we need to shape a new future for AstraZeneca, our markets and our patients.  United by our local sense of belonging, there’s never been a better time to a join a progressing team. Countless opportunities to learn from the best global talent, this is a place for those who want to be challenged and empowered to do the things they never thought possible.  What you’ll do Committed to delivering innovative CVRM solutions, you will exhibit AstraZeneca’s pro-active value propositions to discover new business opportunities and actively influence clinical demands through engagement programmes with long-term relationships with stakeholders.  Essential for the role Valid Class 3/3A driving license University degree  Desirable for the role High grades in university degree in natural sciences Pharmaceutical sales experience in CVRM or Specialty Care Therapeutic Areas Track record of engaging key stakeholders in complex clinical environments, e.g., mid and senior level healthcare professionals, key accounts and the medical community Proven track record in influencing the stakeholder decision-making process and creating value in an ecosystem with multiple influential players / decision makers Proven demonstration of successful working in complex cross functional teams  This position is not eligible for sponsorship of employment visa/work permit in Singapore.  Depending on candidate experience, this position may be filled at the following levels: Medical Representative, Senior Medical Representative or Medical Sales Executive.  Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.  So, what’s next? Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it’s yours. We welcome your application, no later than 5 November 2021.  AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law. AstraZeneca only employs individuals with the right to work in the country/ies where the role is advertised.
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: Position Purpose: Do you want to work for Australia’s leading natural healthcare company? Do you want to work for an organization that gives people a choice to invest in and take control of their health and wellbeing, as well as their career? Blackmores is thrilled to give our consumers the choice to make living well each day a natural way of life.  Marketing Executive is responsible for efficient management, driving and tracking of all marketing and new product development projects, establishing best practice in the process and communication with stakeholders on projects status and issues, ultimately driving growth and profitability for the business. Champion a consumer driven innovation pipeline through research (consumers insight, trend, market environment and regulations) and close partnership with other functions.   Responsibilities Drive Blackmores product portfolio strategy and map growth strategy and NPD initiatives.    Execute market research to deeper understand the usage habits of target consumers, purchase intent etc and make the learning/insights actionable. Support integrated marketing communication plan which includes above the line and below the line. Support activations for owned platforms namely website & FB/ Instagram page. Ensure A&P expenses drive returns, efficiencies and profitability. On selected projects, he/she will be required to provide consults to regional/global, providing cross functional guidance and facilitate in-country team communication. Manage vendors/ agency relationships and ensure effectiveness & efficiency in the allocated budget. In charge of event management inclusive annual PR/Charity events Work closely with Sales Team to roll out marketing & trade campaigns Partner National Sales Manager to drive product segment sales & monthly promos activities in line with agreed internal strategy Joint business planning with retail partners Maintain necessary contact with major marketing suppliers, key retailers, industry associations and government representatives to achieve the objectives of the company Development of active relationships: creative and media buying agencies, promotional agency, sponsorships, events and PRs Ensure all cross functional needs are incorporated in business and strategy action plans  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field Minimum 6 years marketing experience in FMCG industry Working knowledge of business financials Strong project leadership, team work skills Ability to deliver in high pressure situations and with tight deadline

description: Job Description  Panelogue is looking for a Sustainable Materials and Applications Consultant to join the green revolution! Advocate the use of sustainable materials by serving as the main point of contact for designers, specifiers, and decision-makers. Expected to be resourceful and independent, you will develop keen/expert knowledge on the latest sustainable material trends and offerings. Building and maintaining relationships with key clients as a trusted advisor, empowering them with the right information and tools through regular consultations. Engage with creatives and vendors to create and disseminate marketing resources and maintain the brand’s digital presence. Work together with the Co-founders to identify growth opportunities, and trends within the market and discover new ways to promote and use sustainable products. Coordinate with the internal and external logistics partners, installers on fulfilment making sure that the materials are thoroughly used and applied to the spaces. Requirements A year’s work experience as an Account Executive, Sales Executive, or relevant position in the interior design industry Able to communicate effectively, as well as influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization Diploma/Degree in any discipline, but with an interest in Interior Design Fresh Graduates are also welcome to apply

Act as the point of contact and handle customers’ individual needs 5. Resolve conflicts and provide solutions to customers in a timely manner 6. Report on the status of accounts and transactions 7. description: Have you ever stared out at sea and wondered which exotic destinations all these ships you see are coming from and going to? We know, as we are agents in more than 2000 ports around the world.  In Wilhelmsen Ships Agency, we provide our customers with piece of mind while we handle their cargo, their vessels, and their crew. We handle 75,000 port calls per year, which means that every 7 minutes, anywhere around the world, we send a ship safely out to sea again to fulfil its purpose. We match local expertise with strict global standards, making sure we consistently make our customers’ port calls as efficient and safe as possible.  Now more than ever we see that the maritime industry keeps the world going round, and as agents we are the linking pin in the process of transporting goods around the world. Our vision is to shape the maritime industry, and we constantly develop new and improved solutions for our customers, like last mile drone delivery and our online interactive maps showing Covid port restrictions which has reached more than 500,000 users globally.  We now have the opportunity for you to join our global network.  We are looking for a Key Account Manager to develop and lead the sales strategy for the designated customers and collaborate closely with the Ships Agency Managers and other relevant internal resources. If you have a bachelor's degree in Sales and Marketing, with a minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in sales and account management, then this is the role for you.  The Key Account Manager will report to Global Sales Director.  Required Experience And Skills Preferably experience from working in the Maritime Industry. Proven track record when it comes to sales growth. Commercial mind-set. Ambitious and a strong desire for success. Proven communication, negotiation and presentation skills. What You Will Be Doing Drive profitable sales growth by increased customer loyalty. Build the sales pipeline to hit the targets as specified. Be a commercial role model towards rest of Ships Agency division by having extensive customer contact and deal closing focus. Manage and develop the Key Account teams globally and ensure regular team correspondence /sales meetings to secure a results-oriented sales approach and customer strategy implementation. Secure multilevel entry points by using own and other internal resources ensuring wide customer relationships to increase sales. Report on account performance, customer development and take corrective actions. Ensure customer deals generate the most optimal return by proactive contract management. Ensure all customers have approved credit limits in place, and adhere to agreed payment terms and approved credit exposure limits. Ensure accurate and updated information on key accounts and local accounts in WSS SA CRM system including visit reports, opportunities, deals etc. Implement company sales strategy, process, procedures, campaigns and initiatives. We offer a culture and work environment of strong leadership, career development and a job that is both challenging and stimulating.  Sounds interesting? If you can see yourself in this role, please let us know why you are our new Key Account Manager.  Please indicate your current/last and expected salary, notice period and reason for leaving your company.  You Can Apply Via Link  https://wilhelmsen.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Wilhelmsen/job/Singapore/Key-Account-Manager_JOBREQ_1578
