description: Senior Sales Representative, Singapore  Location: Guoco Tower, 1 Wallich Street, Singapore  Job Title: Senior Sales Representative  Manager: Claire Gailey  FactSet provides integrated workflow solutions and market data to Financial Professionals. Headquartered in the US, FactSet’s global revenues exceed $1.45 BB per annum. Please visit our website http://www.factset.com/ for further details.  We are seeking an ambitious, motivated and deal driven Senior Sales Representative to work in our Singapore office. The Singapore office is responsible for FactSet’s business in S.E. Asia. The sales representative will join the new business team and will be responsible for accelerating new business sales across S.E. Asia. The role offers a great opportunity to hunt new logos across all client types both buy-side and sell-side.  The individual will be expected to work independently while working alongside the new business sales team. The ideal candidate will build relationships internally and externally and have high levels of commitment, while displaying strong organisational skills. Ambition, hunger, and a tireless work ethic are a must have for success in this role.  Main Goals and responsibilities include but not limited to: Work with the new business team to execute on sales strategy and achieve both team and individual targets Maintain a prospect list and follow up on leads Build strong relationships with key senior managers and decision makers at each client Identify growth opportunities, lead the sales pursuit, and close deals Conduct sales demos, presentations, and contract negotiations Implement and close trials in decent time frame Participate in RFP/RFI responses Attend industry conferences and seminars to promote FactSet Offer Project Management oversight to consulting team during implementation process Work closely with consulting team to pursue common goals Visit clients/prospects on a regular basis Gain knowledge of competition in the accounts Contribute in setting long term strategy to increase market share  Skills/Requirements: 2-3 years’ experience at a financial solutions provider or similar Prior experience in selling complex solutions to asset managers / buy-side industry would be beneficial Strong and proven communication and interpersonal skills Drive, enthusiasm and a desire to exceed targets Strong sense of initiative and creativity Understanding of buy-side and sell-side workflows CFA would be an advantage Eligible to work in Singapore without required an EP sponsorship
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Job Description We are searching for high-energy Account Executives who can recognize opportunities and turn leads to long-lasting partnerships. With their extensive product knowledge and understanding of industry trends, Account Executives will communicate directly with clients and prospects, understand their individual needs, and recommend products or services that maximize value. Account Executives may also assist in developing sales strategies and establishing quotas. You should be an adaptable (Traditional and Digital Means), knowledgeable multi-tasker with strong computer and communication skills.: Arranging meetings and liaising with clients to understand their requirements Quality control of all work that is submitted to clients Disclosing campaign details to the client and all team members Monitoring all stages of campaigns to guarantee that they run smoothly Writing status reports throughout the duration of the project to keep clients and peers updated Ensuring that the project stays within the allocated budget Prepare Creative Proposal, Quotations and Project Timeline Administration tasks that will help to keep campaigns well-managed and organised Offering creative ideas to the account manager to develop exciting campaigns and encourage clients to understand the importance of creativity throughout projects To align with Marketing Team and do Cold Calls and Outreach during down-time Keeping oneself stimulated in order to achieve maximum productivity Be on the venue/onsite during setup and teardown of the campaign Night work/shifts to oversee productions setup/installations. We get excited when we meet people who possess a drive to do their best work possible and want to be the best they can be. In that respect, it would also help if you have: Excellent oral and written communication skills Be contactable after workhours Keen and Open to work in an Agency Lifestyle Ready to get sweaty and dirty during setup/teardown. First-class organisational skills A pro-active approach to creative projects Experience of working as part of a team A keen eye for detail and an understanding of budget restraints Full awareness of creative processes and techniques – including digital platforms Ability to work under pressure whilst maintaining a cool outlook A personable and professional character that will allow you to build client rapport The confidence to give clients trust in your work

description: Responsibilities:  Responsible for brand building, coordinate with advertising agencies for product launches promotional work, production of in-house promotional materials and publications, preparing press releases, organising promotional activities. Preparation of brand plan-marketing, quarterly promotional strategy-input finalisation and input implementation plan. Brand sales analysis and follow-up for strategy implementation. Ensuring brand profitability. Piloting the innovations and creating new indications and expanding markets. Keep abreast with market trends and new developments utilising information for business improvement. Accountability for Brand's performance & working closely with sales team. Formulating and implementing trade/marketing strategies. Execution of trade and promotional activities. Managing advertising and promotion funds. Providing market analysis information pertaining to competitors, trends and activities. Assist in new product launches. Assess market opportunities and create product concepts. Conduct concept testing. Assist in development, implementation and evaluation of advertising and consumer promotion.

As the world’s leading provider of cloud-based software and technology solutions delivered by managed service providers (MSPs), Datto believes there is no limit to what small and medium businesses can achieve with the right technology.  Collaboration, teamwork, open communication, and transparency are vital to our success. Datto motivates and empowers our employees to grow through professional development, training opportunities, and internal promotions.  The Opportunity  As a key member of the APAC leadership team and in partnership with the VP APAC Sales, you will guide a regional team of partner sales managers to build prospect, partner and distribution pipelines, and increase recurring revenue across Datto’s evolving SEA partner base. Your flare for coaching will strengthen performance, pipelines, forecasts and account plans as well as develop emerging and experienced sales talent, contributing to the continued growth of our SEA business.  Does This Describe You?  You are an entrepreneurial, self-motivated and hands on coach who inspires their team and peers with energy, commitment, and high integrity. You can seamlessly switch between strategic and transactional sales strategy and leverage supporting functions to optimise success. Your core focus will cover Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia and Taiwan.  A Look Inside the Job Build and execute the strategic roadmap for Datto’s GTM expansion across SEA in collaboration with senior leaders both locally and globally As a member of the APAC sales management team, you’ll be responsible for channel sales managers across regional SEA markets Supervise and manage the day-to-day operations and coaching activities of your team to meet monthly revenue goals - metrics, opportunities, account planning, prospecting, forecasting Lead by example and inspire a culture of top performing team players Maintain and grow headcount through proactive recruiting, performance management and training of elite sales talent Identify competency / skill gaps in your team and consistently monitor and improve sales activity through meaningful, metric drive performance planning Collaborate with global sales managers, VPs, marketing and business leaders to optimise process, systems, messaging and alignment strategies Support teams with progressing deal stages, forecasting accuracy, increasing conversion rates, and closing opportunities Manage a monthly forecast of sub-30 day deal cycle opportunities to the senior leadership team and build quarterly and annual revenue plans Run team QBRs to build sales maturity and cultivate an environment of feedback Work with marketing to develop and optimise lead sourced and sales touch points Maintain professional knowledge of Datto’s channel partners and competitive landscape About You You have defined GTM strategies in emerging SEA markets Demonstrated experience leading teams of varying experience levels in a solution sales environment Ability to be adaptive to the rapid change and ambiguity that comes with being in a fast growing, global organisation Ability to take team members on a growth journey and drive a business vision forward with energy and high integrity Natural ability to foster the right behaviours and actions in a transactional and strategic sales environment Effective communication with a variety of stakeholders and partners across multiple departments Proven success as a quota carrying sales representative in a new business or growth sales function A deep rooted understanding of SaaS, recurring revenue sales models Bonus Points Channel and direct sales strategy development Datto - A little more!  Datto offers Unified Continuity, Networking, and Business Management solutions and has created a one-of-a-kind ecosystem of MSP partners. Datto supports our partners 24/7/365. This commitment is a value at the core of every role in every office, always doing the right thing, and putting our customers first.  Benefits  At Datto, we’re committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including: “Datto University” on-boarding program EAP (Employee Assistance Program) LinkedIn Learning Headspace App Employee Resource Groups (Datto Culture, Datto Familia, Datto Pride, Women in Tech) Charity match program Education reimbursement Datto is an equal opportunity employer.  By submitting an application, you acknowledge we will process your data in order to consider you for the position you apply for and for other open positions within our company for which you may be suited. We collect and store your data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Practices.  Please note: Only candidates who are Singapore Citizens or hold perm residency will be considered.  Agencies please note: This recruitment assignment is being managed directly by our internal talent team. We will certainly reach out to our external partners if we require additional talent options. Your respect for this process is appreciated.
industries: Computer Networking, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: The Senior Account Manager will propose and sell services-based technology solutions for Telstra Enterprise customers in Singapore. You will have a positive impact on achieving Telstra’s sales, revenue and NPS targets. You will drive connectivity and Network Application Services (NAS) revenue and sales for our global products within the respective markets and ensure that global product portfolio is represented in your account plan.  Key Responsibilities Identifying and winning NEW high value and strategic enterprise customers to achieve targets and Customer Satisfaction Measures Establish a sales portfolio plan that sets out the strategy to achieve your key performance metrics and build a sustainable pipeline over the next 12-24 months Establish and maintain long term relationships with “C”’ level decision makers to maximize business opportunities Develop and maintain in depth knowledge of the Prospects business and technology environment and drivers, relevant for the application of network IT services Develop and maintain an understanding of the organization’s Network Application Services (NAS) portfolio to effectively develop and present business led propositions to our Prospects Participate actively in sales calls and bid reviews as appropriate and contribute to the rapid growth of sales, demonstrating excellent account and relationship management and ‘closing skills’ to the team Manage internal sales business management responsibilities including sales opportunity forecasting, reporting, account reviews and opportunity management Conduct regular knowledge sharing and coaching with peers, sharing best practices and industry insights to build motivation, and selling skills Work in close cooperation with internal teams and collaborate well with Peers across the International Region Occasional traveling across Asia as required

description: Corsiva Lab is Singapore’s very own creative Website & Mobile Apps Development and Digital Marketing Agency. At our company, our team of 60+ is dedicated to providing strong digital solutions, that upholds our client's unique brand, all while helping them to generate higher sales revenue. Our quality of work has brought us close to 400+ clients till date, including companies like Camel Nuts, Capitaland, NUS, SIM, Far East Organization, Republic Polytechnic, Orchard Central, Loreal, Public Transport Council and many more.  We are looking for an experienced & driven Business Development candidate who has passion in growing businesses.  The ideal candidate should be an individual who is outspoken, hardworking & able to build relationships with new / existing customers. Most importantly, he/she must be convincing and able to leverage on the company’s unique selling points to generate higher revenues. A plus point would be that the candidate has an existing network of clients.  Highlights: Corsiva Lab is a PRE-Approved PSG Grant vendor for E-Commerce Solutions, making it attractive for your potential clients with the 80% - 98% funding available Basic pay + Transport claims + Attractive Commission model Get equipped with useful Digital knowledge from on the job training Driven, young & energetic working environment  Job Scope: - Able to source for new leads actively & promptly handle warm leads to ensure the project is sealed - Preparing detailed & convincing proposals with accurate quotation & timelines based on potential customers’ business requirements - Manage existing client’s relationship to retain revenue and generate higher life time value - Clear briefings on scope of work to internal team members once project is sealed. Active communications with management team on revenue reports  Requirements: - Highly motivated & target driven individuals (Achievable KPIs) - Good analytical, communication & interpersonal skills - Confident & convincing presentation skills - Open minded and willing to take on new challenges to grow the company - Singaporean or PR  *On the job training/guidance will be provided!

1.0        SUMMARY The International Territory Manager position plays a fundamental role in achieving ASU’s sales and business development goals, including customer-acquisition and revenue growth.  The International Territory Manager requires a deep knowledge of sales processes and a familiarity with the aviation night vision industry; from prospecting through negotiation to order closure. Account and relationship management are key components of this position.  The ideal team member should focus heavily on working with and managing international representatives and resellers. The candidate will be comfortable and adept in working with senior level decision-makers as well as end-users. While the notice says Singapore, you need not be located there. We seek the best person throughout the Asian Pacific region.  2.0        FUNCTIONAL ROLE 2.1        Accountable Manager for sales within the Asia territory 2.2        Responsible for business development, revenue generation and account/dealer management within Asia territory 2.3        Responsible for filling the Aircraft Services, Training and Equipment Sales funnels to support each department’s revenue goals 2.4        Provide routine sales forecasts 2.5        Perform other tasks, duties, and functions as assigned  3.0        REQUIREMENTS 3.1        Travel: Minimum 50% travel 3.1.1   Ideal candidate located in Asia 3.2        Education: Bachelors degree in related field or demonstrated relevant business experience 3.3        Experience: 3+ years successful Sales/BD experience within the Asia Night Vision/Aerospace Market 3.4        Language / Communication Skills: Must be able to communicate effectively (reading, writing and speaking) the English language. Must know and understand terminology related to the aviation and night vision industry. Must posses strong writing skills and be able to present ideas clearly. Multi-lingual candidates will be given priority. 3.5        Computer Literacy: Must possess proficiency in Microsoft suite of products including Windows, Outlook and Excel. Proficiency in Salesforce and Microsoft Dynamics preferred.   3.6        Preferred Requirements: 3.6.1   Contract/Proposal/Tender Writing Experience 3.6.2   Business contacts within the Asian market 3.6.3   Experience working with Distributors/Sales Representatives 3.6.4   Asian military sales experience 3.6.5   Pipeline/Funnel and Opportunity Management 3.6.6   ITAR Experience 3.6.7   Program Management 3.6.8   Experience dealing with long sales cycle  4.0        REPORTING RELATIONSHIP 4.1         International Territory Manager reports to Sr. Director of Sales 4.2        Asian distributors and representatives report to the Territory Manager  5.0        LIMITS OF AUTHORITY 5.1        The International Territory Manager has the authority to negotiate and complete sales transactions up to $100,000 value with less than one-year total period of performance. Contracts shall comply with the standard terms and conditions, margin and credit arrangements. 5.2        The International Territory Manager has the authority to manage distributors and sales representatives within the specified territory.  6.0        DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT: 6.1        Qualify potential customers by understanding their needs, rating their interests and determining purchasing potential and timing 6.2        Qualify, outline and communicate customer requirements internally to generate high-value proposals; professionally present proposals to potential clients 6.3        Train dealer organizations in the ASU's value propositions, products and systems 6.4        Consistently work with, advise and support dealer personnel to close and grow their business 6.5        Coordinate and follow through on dealer requests and needs; act as primary liaison for dealers 6.6        Develop market segment and account/dealer strategies 6.7        Research and understand potential customer's organization, key players, needs, opportunities and pain-points 6.8        Participate in industry-specific trade show in Asia 6.9        Integrate with marketing to create plans and campaigns  SALES: 6.10     Manage the entire sales process for each opportunity 6.11     Provide routine sales forecasts; assist in budget creation 6.12     Source and develop new sales opportunities through research, prospecting, lead follow-up, and targeted telephone and email communications 6.13     Assist in margin, expense and profitability management 6.14     Manage accounts and relationships for long-term business development 6.15     Accurately and timely utilize Salesforce CRM tools 6.16     Provide feedback/input into the sales process, marketing opportunities, and product design and quality 6.17     Communicate with leadership throughout ASU on emerging trends, competitor analysis and product inquires. 6.18     Responsible for visits to current and potential clients 6.19     Submit short and long-range sales plans and prepares sales strategies utilizing available marketing programs to reach targets 6.20     Ensure clients receive high-quality customer service    7.0        MEASURES OF PERFORMANCE 7.1        Business Development: Growth and progression of opportunities in the sales funnel, quantifiable through Salesforce  7.2        Sales: Monthly and annual sales revenue quota

We are a major leading steel staircase Manufacturing Company, headquarter based in Tokyo, Japan. Our company owns over 15 manufacturing facilities in both Japan and overseas, including some joint-ventures businesses. We have been speciliased in cutting-edge Steel structural staircases, which fit for commercial building, skyscrapers, residential apartments, stadiums, etc. As we are growing in Singapore, we are seeking a '' Senior Sales Executive'' to expand our business in Singapore. Your goal will be to meet or exceed our annual quota and increase our revenue.   Responsibilities Build pipeline and maintain long-term relationships with prospects in Singapore Identify new business opportunities to generate opportunities, and close deals. Develop annual sales strategy and goals Leverage sales tools and resources to identify new sales leads and nurture prospect relationships Handling projects across in Singapore, follow up on smooth delivery ( & liaise with Factory in JB) and manage and until smooth handover and follow up all the way to AR Good contact with Main contractors, Developers, Architects, Interior/exterior Designers & etc. is an advantage. Other tasks assigned by Managers   Qualifications Diploma/ Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience (Preferably in CIVIL or Mechanical) 3+ years' of sales experience Proven history meeting or exceeding quota and closing sales Japanese speaking is a MUST, in order to liaise with our Headquarter, and Factory in JOHOR, as well as our Other stakeholders Strong business development skills • Strong business acumen ONLY Singaporean or PR may apply

description: Wagawin is a global technology company headquartered in Munich. Our proprietary technology is able to systematically collect unique audience insights during the user’s consumption of mobile ads. Through this we have the advantage of getting to know the users and their preferences.  This unique technology is called LivingAds – a new way of mobile advertisement and data collection. It enables brands and media agencies to personalize their customer journeys to consumers exact needs and leads to improved return in invest.  Your tasks: Be one of the driving forces for business development in the Asia region and bring innovative ideas to the team Develop accounts to their full potential by maintaining and strengthening the relationships with media agency’s and direct client’s stakeholders Provide pre- and post sales support to the Sales Managers and assist in cross- and upselling Generate reports for both internal purposes and clients (post campaign) Understand clients’ objectives and KPIs and optimise towards these for optimum campaign performance Be the contact person for clients f. e. in attending to requests, troubleshooting campaigns or overlooking technical issues Educate our clients and prospects on our product suite and wider programmatic industry Coordinate, supervise and analyze campaigns during the entire campaign lifecycle and make recommendations for the best possible outcomes Support live operational matters and help to handle feature requests and new inventory resources in close collaboration with the Product- and Business Development team and our inhouse consultant Required skills: Proven work experience in an account management or similar role Understanding and willingness to learn about the quickly-changing digital marketplace Experience in managing digital campaigns, preferably within mobile advertising Understanding of Programmatic Buying, including DSPs, DMPs, SSPs, and 3rd party ad-serving systems Excellent knowledge of processing and analyzing data with Excel Outstanding communication skills & ability to manage competing priorities and effectively adapt to change What we offer: Huge growth potential within the organization Professional and personal development Medical insurance An open company culture that encourages proactive employees Flexible working hours on a trust base and a modern office located in the heart of the CBD

I'm looking for Individuals with excellent communication skills coupled with adaptability and willingness to learn who wish to explore a direct sales role with Aviva.  I am currently in the process of building a new team in Aviva’s direct sales force (Affinity Channel) The benefits of being a direct sales force is , you get a fixed monthly pay, CPF contributions by Aviva, corporate leads from our various partners as well as corporate staff benefits What I’m looking for is someone who has the drive and determination to succeed in the insurance industry .

THE OPPORTUNITIES ARE ENDLESS WHEN YOU ARE FEARLESS  Driven by the passion of over 4000 employees, KTM is the largest European motorcycle manufacturer with a revenue of over €1.5 billion. To this end, we consistently pursue a long-term strategy based on the four pillars of brand, globalization, innovation and employees. That’s why we are looking for new, proactive colleagues to work with us and share this journey. No matter who you are, in the end, all that matters to us, is what you can do!  In your role as a Regional Sales & Operations Planner, you are the link between our products and our customers. As a newbie in our Singapore team, you support us from the beginning in regards to our sales operations. Are you a motivated team player, who likes to handle numbers and is extraordinarily analytical? Does your heart beat for motorcycles? - Then you are the right person for the job!  THE TASKS AWAITING YOU Build and maintain effective performance metrics & dashboards for Sales & Operations Planning related to sales, inventory and orders. Manage International Sales Planning forecast aligning with central S&OP, production factory and markets. Analyze market, sales and inventory data to make proficient decisions at the SKU level to meet regional sales volume and revenue targets, decrease lead time, inventory and logistic cost. Liaise with sales team on sales results and short-term forecast tracking and the preparation of regular business review presentations. Liaise with our manufacturing facilities to ensure the supply chain is aligned with manufacturing and sales targets. Drive budgeting, sales planning, and supply plan activities, including the yearly budgeting process, seasonal model year plans and inventory levels comparing actual vs budget. Directly cooperate with other relevant department e.g. Business Intelligence, Finance, Product Management. Collect business intelligence data from available industry reports, public information, field reports, or purchased source and prepare ad hoc market analysis on business opportunities and competitors. Further development and optimization of interdepartmental processes. How You Can Inspire Us BSc/BA in industrial engineering, supply chain, business administration. Minimum with 2 years working experience. Excellent MS Office skills, in particular MS Excel; knowledge of ERP system SAP will be considered as plus. Knowledge and passion for motorcycle products, business actors and markets dynamics are a great advantage. Must have strong analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in English, spoken and written; German language will be considered as a plus. Ability to track multiple processes. Being a competent and proactive personality with a pragmatic and structured way of working. Great attention to details. Knowledge or previous experiences in a similar role within the motorcycle/automotive business are an advantage. What You Can Look Forward To The opportunity to help shape the future of Europe’s most successful motorcycle manufacturer. Unique corporate culture driven by passion and characterized by collegiality and team spirit. Flexible working hours. 15 days annual paid leave (more possible). 60-80k SGD gross yearly salary (salary and job level will depend on candidate seniority and experience). APPLICATION PROCESS  Are you interested in working in a dynamic and motivated team? If so, please email nurlisa.banuh@ktm.com. We look forward to receiving your informative online application (curriculum vitae, cover letter as well as relevant references)!
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Consumer Goods, and Financial Services

description: As Global Business Development Executive, your focus will be on customer acquisition, lead generation, and prospect management, as this role will garner and meet with potential clients. You will be responsible to research business relationships, business partnerships, prospective vendors and distributors and provide information and presentations as needed. You will work to create solutions for their needs and consult internal stakeholders throughout the process.  Ideally you are energetic, well-spoken, and eager to do business and increase revenue.  You’ll Work with various internal teams to create effective solutions; Build solid relationships with customers, vendors and distributors, as well as sales and marketing teams; Manage partnerships and project deliverables' timeline and execution; Develop an in-depth knowledge of our company offerings to in order to identify profitable business opportunities; Develop efficient business strategies with key stakeholders; Develop and maintain long-term relations with existing and future clients; Develop and manage strategic partnerships to grow our business; Attend client meetings, presentations, trade shows, and more; Guide marketing efforts by presenting market research and analysis to our Marketing Team and suggesting strategies to expand market research; Prepare all documentation required for Requests For Proposal (RFP); Research industry emerging trends and recommending new company offerings to satisfy customers’ needs; Continually contribute by sharing your creativity in preparation of product information to better meet our customers needs globally; Present business or marketing opportunities to company executives and management. You’ll have A Bachelor's degree or higher in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, or a related discipline; A minimum of 2 years of experience in the gaming, or computer software industry; with a focus on marketing or operations and at least 1 + year of relevant work experience in content/localization preferably; A proven track record in business development, sales and or marketing; Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; An a desire to challenge the status quo and question current practices; A strong Business Acumen; Meticulous attention to detail: Excellent Analytical and Information Management skills. Excellent Problem Solving Skills; A Proficiency in English and Chinese is a must in order to meet business needs and enable communication with Business Partners, Potential Clients and our offices in China and Hong Kong. Additional fluency in any other language would be an advantage; An ability to work on multiple projects with different deadlines; A passion to learn and be involved; Good Communication skills. Good Time Management Skills; Team Player qualities; A love for playing games.

description: Protegrity, a global leader in data security, protects sensitive data everywhere and future-proofs businesses as data-privacy regulations evolve. Maintaining privacy today across distributed data has become impossibly complicated. With Protegrity, enterprises can secure data wherever it resides, control how it’s protected, and have confidence that data is safe, even if a breach occurs. The Protegrity Data Protection Platform is a modern alternative to traditionally complex data-protection methods that leave gaps in security.  Deep integrations with Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Teradata, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, Cloudera, Databricks, and many other enterprise applications ensure that data remains fully protected in hybrid-cloud, multi-cloud, and on-premises environments without performance penalties. The platform’s fine-grained data protection anonymizes personally identifiable information (PII) that’s used in AI and machine learning models, providing faster access to critical analytics data and dramatically shortening the time to business insights.  Protegrity’s Inside Sales group (Business Development) is growing rapidly and we are looking for a Global Sales Leader to manage transformational growth. You will be responsible for driving interest in the Protegrity Platform targeting decision makers at Enterprises across a variety of industries including Financial Services, Healthcare, Retail and other industry verticals. You will develop and execute on sales strategy and go-to-market plans, enabling your sales team to drive long-term success with their clients.  You are a dynamic, proactive, and passionate about Sales and thrive playing at the intersection of the biggest market trends: Cloud, Security, and Data Privacy. The Business Development Manager works in a multi-cultural team whose ultimate goal is to drive pipeline. You are the first point of contact between PROTEGRITY and a prospective customer via inbound and outbound campaigns and are responsible for revenue generation within a diverse set of Enterprise accounts.  Main Responsibilities Lead Protegrity's prospecting in the APAC market by generating new business opportunities with prospective clients Research target clients, qualify customer’s needs, and handle objections by positioning Protegrity solutions Work with various lead sources: inbound, outbound prospecting, inquiries, promotional campaigns, events follow up etc, Close potential client for initial meetings with Enterprise Sales team and convert potential prospects into sales leads Manage a pipeline of business opportunities and develop, measure, and improve daily, weekly, and monthly KPIs Required Skills/background Sales mindset and ability to determine prospects Situational Pain, Impact, Critical Event, and Decision criteria Impeccable attention to detail; develop multi-channel prospecting sequences (phone, email, targeted marketing, campaigns, etc) Maniacally focused on Prospecting new clients Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to own strategic initiatives to completion; hungry and resourceful Provide monthly metrics Strong preference for candidates with experience working in Cyber Security, Cloud, Data Privacy, Big Data, or AI/Analytics market segments Please Note - Singapore Citizens And Permanent Residents Preferred  We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits with generous vacation and holiday time off. All employees are also provided access to ongoing learning & development.  Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is our priority. We are committed to an environment of acceptance where you are free to bring your full self to work. All qualified applicants and current employees will not be  discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or veteran status.

About The Company  Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports.  Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks.  Crypto.com is headquartered in Hong Kong with a 1,500+ strong team. Find out more by visiting https://crypto.com  About The Role  Are you enthusiastic about gaming/eSports/anime/manga? Do you love closing deals and crushing your targets? Come join one of the most dominant companies in the crypto/fintech industry and play an important part in accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency.  We are looking for an ambitious and passionate BD manager to join our team and help scale up our global pool of NFT contents. As a deal hunter, you will be responsible for bringing digital artists, cartoonists, mangakas, musicians, influencers, gamers, Tiktokers and every relevant content creator interested onboard the Crypto.com NFT marketplace. You will be leveraging your knowledge of sales and customer insights to curate the best content worldwide.  Responsibilities Reach out to relevant creators who have strong presence in multiple social media platforms such as Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc. Research, identify, and reach out to suitable talents using platforms like Behance, Dribbble, Deviantart and other portfolio sites. Understand trends, likes, preferences and needs of customers in different age groups and geographical locations. Establish strategic partnerships with potential gaming or entertainment partners to list their content on Crypto.com NFT marketplace. Ensure a successful and smooth execution of each partnership with the optimal pricing strategy Requirements Has minimum 5 years working experience as a sales/business development role in an e-commerce marketplace, influencer marketing agency, or gaming/entertainment industry Proven ability in business development and strategic partnership to structure creative deals, and drive revenue in the digital world Familiar with platform such as Foundation, Superrare, OpenSea, NiftyGateway, Rarible, Artblocks, Aysnc.art, Maker's Place, Ephimera, Bitski and Zora. Hungry for results. Resourceful. Benefits Attractive compensation package - base salary, commissions & bonuses Working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team

jobTitle: Sales Development Representative, Large Enterprise & Majors
description: Company Description  For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.  We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation. Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 10 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator). We are well positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.  Job Description  Sales Development Representative  The Sales Development Representative, Large Enterprise & Majors will play a key role in driving new business opportunities by qualifying, nurturing and setting appointments for our field sales team in support of our rapidly growing business and high growth market.  Responsibilities Prospecting into multiple organizations via cold calling, networking, e-mail, as well as utilizing Internet information sources to build and maintain a lead development pipeline. Penetrate, profile, qualify and schedule well qualified appointments with key decision makers within global 2000 or “targeted” companies. Qualifying inbound inquiries by educating and developing prospects leading to appointment. Meet and exceed daily and weekly call goals as well as deliver a high quantity of well qualified sales opportunities. Consistently meet and exceed opportunity quotas to deliver optimal sales pipeline. Articulate Zscaler’s value proposition to decision-makers across multiple industries to assess buying interest. Learn and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of Zscaler’s technology – and clearly articulate capabilities and advantages to prospective customers to successfully manage and overcome prospect objections. Work closely with sales and sales engineering teams in the development of strategic sales approaches. Research customers, identify decision makers, educate prospects and qualify buying interest and sense of urgency. Extensive use of CRM (preferably salesforce.com) to maintain accurate activity, contact, and account information of all customers and prospects. Desired Skills & Experience (About You) Highly motivated self-starter with a strong attention to detail and a desire to succeed Team player who possesses an ability to adapt and work in a fast paced, goal-oriented high growth sales environment Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent active listening skills Experience in CRM systems (preferably salesforce.com) Have a keen interest in technology and developing a career in sales Experience in outbound focused position; customer-oriented background required (sales, support, customer service) Qualifications  Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree or tertiary qualification Demonstrated success in prospecting into Large Enterprise or Major accounts Proven capabilities and skills in account development, opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call structure/control and pipeline management In return, we will invest in you, and your customers. You will be supported by a world-class team made up of some of the most prominent names in security who turn our customers into advocates and give you the skills you need to build a highly successful career.  Additionally, We Will Make Every Effort To provide you with the best support, learning, and access to expertise in the marketplace. To invest in your personal and professional growth and reward you accordingly with competitive pay, benefits, and equity. And, provide you with an environment that is defined by collaboration. Additional Information  Why Zscaler?  People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.  Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.  Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones.  Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface – made by innovators for innovators – is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers (b2b) anywhere you can, to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals. Merchant acquisition in various sectors is the key driver in this position.  Responsibilities Adhere to and follow Unlimint’s clients policy, targeted types of merchants and industries, Unlimint ’s requirements for potential and existing merchants; Promote and sell services of Unlimint and its affiliated and related parties (as the case may be); Forward potential merchants to Unlimint ’s onboarding team and other units of Unlimint as the case may be; Assist potential merchants with their onboarding with Unlimint ; Propose potential business deals with potential partners, and if approved by Unlimint , work on conclusion of such deals; Arrange and hold business meetings with potential and existing merchants and partners; Participate in conferences, exhibitions and other events as instructed by Unlimint ; Provide and relay to Unlimint duly, timely and accurately feedback, comments and information. from merchants and partners; Advise and provide information to Unlimint and its affiliates and related parties on business development, including opportunities, strategies, risks etc. Experience and mindset Min. 2 years of B2B sales experience Min. 2 years of direct experience in Payments is a must Excellent command of English and one Asian language Ability to negotiate on C- and Director-Level Competitive, aggressive sales nature with a desire to win Desire to be part of a rapidly expanding business Ability to work in a fast paced environment Willingness to undertake business trips We offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Modern workplace A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

description: Contentsquare is a global SaaS technology company that empowers brands to build better digital experiences for all. Not to brag but… we have been recognized by Gartner as one of the four most innovative e-commerce technologies in the world, and featured in Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups.  Contentsquare has 8 main offices across the world (Paris, NYC, London, Tel Aviv, Munich, Tokyo, Singapore & San Francisco) with 750+ clients globally including many accounts from the global Fortune 100. We’ve been experiencing tremendous growth as our team has grown from :300 to over 850+ employees globally, and raised a $500M Series E funding in May 2021, the biggest total VC funding ever for a French start-up! This announcement garnered more than 350 media placements globally.  We can tell you that this growth is not going to stop here as we are anticipating to hire 1,500+ positions globally within the next few years and are looking for talented people like you - unique, ambitious, and enthusiastic - to join us and help us continue to innovate and improve user experience. YOU keep us going and your creativity drives us to be a better company. Come join the #CSquad family!  We work with 700+ clients globally including Singtel, BMW, IKEA, Suncorp, HSBC, Samsung and Microsoft to empower their teams with behavioural insight.  As an Account Executive based in Singapore, you will join our growing APAC sales team to continue accelerating growth. You will drive new business sales and collaborate with our global teams including our Sales Development Representatives, Solutions Engineers, and Customer Success Managers. Last year, we became the undisputed global leader in experience analytics - are you ready to join us and be part of what's next?  As an Account Executive at Contentsquare, you will: Own the full sales cycle from prospecting to close and drive new business sales Establish and navigate relationships with senior executives and decision-makers Foster new relationships for Contentsquare through your own outbound efforts and with the help of our high performing SDR team Wow prospects with an initial demo of the Contentsquare platform + partner with our sales-savvy Solutions Engineer to win the customer Work with and help grow our partner community in the region Communicate and escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, onboarding, and technical inquiries Collaborate with our global teams across Solutions Engineering, Marketing, Customer Success Managers, Leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product You ideally have: 5+ years as a sales hunter (new logo / new revenue acquisition) with relevant enterprise SaaS experience Industry knowledge of the growing and exciting Marketing Technology space or similar An entrepreneurial spirit, ready to drive growth in across APAC Experience managing a pipeline and closing SaaS contracts The ability to develop senior level relationships quickly and effectively Experience presenting to senior managers and the C-suite at leading enterprise companies The ability to manage multiple opportunities simultaneously at various stages of the buying process Interest in increasing customer satisfaction and deepening customer relationships Why Should You Apply to Contentsquare?  ✅ Our mission is focused on empowering everyone to create better experiences for all in the digital world.  ✅ We invest in our employees through career development & opportunities, social events, philanthropic activities, and competitive benefits.  ✅ You get to collaborate with and learn from smart and creative people around the globe.  ✅ We are in this together #TeamSpirit.  To keep our employees happy and motivated, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we’d like to highlight: Virtual onboarding, Hackathon, and our annual kickoff trip on a global basis! You have the opportunity to interact with our global colleagues. Generous paid time-off policy (every location is different) We offer many benefits in various countries -- ask your recruiter for more information! Competitive parental leave policy (it can vary depending on geographic locations) Fun office culture with a big opportunity to make an impact on our growing global team, culture, including a Culture Crew for every country to organize regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours #Uniqueness is embedded in our DNA as one of our core values, and we welcome everyone to apply to our positions.  Contentsquare is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Your personal data are used by Contentsquare for recruitment purposes only. Read our Job Candidate Privacy Notice to find out more about data protection at Contentsquare and your rights.

jobTitle: Regional Business Manager – Acute Care – East Asia
description: Who We Are Looking For  Talent developers. Growth-oriented managers who recruit and hire top-performing talent and prioritize the development of their team members.  Managers who drive performance. People who implement process improvements and leverage the talent of their team to consistently increase performance and productivity.  This key role manages the sales & marketing teams for the Acute Care business for Stryker East Asia (HK, Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Philippines) This includes overall responsibility for all aspects of Sales & Marketing including but not limited to sales growth, marketing planning, forecasting, strategy and management.  This position is responsible for driving new business and for developing and delivering high standards of customer service, both internally and externally and the development of sales & marketing capability across the business. A key element of this role is to add value to key customer relationships and leverage business opportunities across the range of products.  The role holder takes an overall view of business and manages corporate business responsibilities, strategic direction and ethical and legal standards for the business. All aspects of the role must be in compliance with company policy and procedures and the requirements of quality standards.  Key Areas Of Accountability Plan for and achieve sales, profit, market share and service targets. Manage and develop team to effectively deliver orders, sales, and operating income targets. Proactively monitor market dynamics and anticipate their possible influence on the portfolio, marketing plans and customer base Identify new product and marketing opportunities within the portfolio and make recommendations and lead teams to implement those plans Collaborate with other department to manage inventory, product life cycle and asset management in line with business objectives to drive competitive business advantage for Acute Care. As part of the Medical APAC leadership team, develop effective relationships with other Leaders across East Asia and Stryker Corporate to maximize business opportunities. Develop sales & marketing capabilities including improving business processes, sales & marketing management processes and driving effective programs. Accountable for profit and loss results for the Acute Care East Asia business P&L. Build sales & marketing by proactively recruiting and developing outstanding talent. Market share and growth in alignment with set targets and the Corp strategy Align with corporate policy, legislation, and quality compliance to meet national and international standards. Operate within Stryker delegated authority levels. Comply with, and actively promote, the code of conduct. safe work practices & quality standards. Accurate forecasting and sales planning Collaboration with the Account Management group to drive strategic initiatives and sales Support for systematic and professional product launches and recalls across territories Systematic business improvements across sales process Negotiate major deals and maintain key customer contacts at senior levels. Work with other relevant managers to develop regional sales strategy. Ensure organizational processes maintain an exemplary record of compliance and commitment to relevant quality standards through the use of the local quality management system. Drive a quality culture through individual and team behaviour and through implementation of continuous process improvements compliant with relevant quality standards. Direct Reports (if Any) Business Development Managers and Representatives Commercial and Associate Sales Managers Territory Managers Field Sales Managers Critical Requirements (eg: skills, experience, qualifications):  Knowledge Financial skills, profit and loss and inventory management Product life cycle and, product registration and quality programs and standards Sales & Marketing leadership and staff development strategies and processes Strategic and business planning approaches Skills Business acumen and the ability to profitably run a technically complex business covering sales, marketing and logistics and inventory management capacity Strategic capability to effectively set and drive long term business objectives Leadership, change leadership and people development skills to build and drive sales and marketing capability within the business Negotiation and communication skills to effectively build relationships with surgeons and other key clients, stakeholders and senior members of the community and government. Business process improvement capability and ability to drive and implement systematic improvement and quality results across the business. Experience Previous experience as a business manager in a technology related industry with a demonstrated track record of success in sales & marketing and winning new business Desirable Requirements (eg: skills, experience, qualifications): Experience as a manager with experience leading a large diverse team with accountability for overall business results Tertiary qualifications in a business / commercial or marketing related discipline are desirable. Technical proficiency including product knowledge, knowledge of the medical and hospital industries to build effective relationships and comply with corporate policy and federal and state legislation Other requirements (eg: travel, on-call responsibilities): Domestic and international travel as needed

description: 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.  About The Job  Job Description:  You will be the Brand Lead for a key strategic division that has some of the most established and trusted brands with strong brand equity index. You will continue to lead and exceed BEI and sales growth expectations through well-structured marketing strategies, channel and brand building programs led by consumer insights. You will also be playing a pivotal role in product pricing strategy, new product introductions while managing the advertising and promotional funds, inventory planning and demand forecast accuracy.  Duties & Responsibilities  Reporting to the SEA Marketing Lead, you will be working proactively with cross-functional teams to develop differentiated brand architecture for core brand and its extensions to meet set KPIs.  Your Responsibilities Will Include  Deliver set financial objectives through well management of Division P&L, inventory planning and demand accuracy. Lead in the conceptualization and execution of all nationwide marketing and demand generation campaigns, integrating the use of digital and through-the-line elements to achieve the marketing and sales objectives while ensuring effective ROI. Leverage on consumer and shopper insights in the development of strategies in prioritized market segments, product penetration/adoption and pricing. Execute new product commercialization by developing integrated marketing plan so as to enable successful launches and post-launches. Stay abreast on current market environment and gather trade intelligence in activities, products and pricing executed by competitors and other suppliers. Collaborate closely with internal key stakeholders (Regional Portfolio Lead, Trade Marketing, Key Account Managers, Supply Chain and R&D) so as to ensure seamless execution of all plans and promotions. Know the channel, accounts, category and shopper group intimately and using the knowledge to develop impactful programs.  Qualifications & Requirements  Degree in Marketing or Business-related discipline with 5-6 years in FMCG marketing experience. MNC environment will be an added advantage.  Analytical and highly driven individual with demonstrated strength in both digital engagement and acquisition, developing and executing offline marketing campaigns and brand management. Strong consumer marketing background complemented with sound commercial acumen demonstrated by good experience in managing the P&L. Proven success working in a highly stress and fast-paced environment. Possess a positive and cheerful attitude with strong resilience and commitment in overcoming challenges to achieve required results. Exudes self-confidence and possesses excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills. The ability to be strategic to management and simplifying communications to laymen. A dynamic team player who works well with cross-functional stakeholders but is independent and decisive in executing required tasks.  Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M. description: The Company  If you’re excited about what the future holds you’ve come to the right place!  Mintel is the world’s leading market intelligence agency. With offices around the world we take a global view on what is happening in the space of CPG innovation. We offer our clients a unique perspective on the future of the consumer landscape and a clear roadmap to navigate it with.  We are looking for a smart and energetic Senior Account Manager to join our team in Singapore. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strategic mindset, who will nurture and grow a portfolio of key accounts in a way that will ensure commercial success for the Singapore market  What You Will Be Doing Growing existing account relationships. Across a portfolio of key accounts, you will be using your excellent communication skills, strong follow-up and sharp attention to detail to enhance your existing relationships. Building a pipeline. Leveraging your current client relationships to grow their investment in Mintel products, growing their business and ours. Networking. Identifying new champions and revenue streams by networking throughout assigned accounts and by leveraging contacts throughout the industry. Delivering Creative Business Solutions. Ensuring clients are getting the most out of the data. Proving ROI on a monthly or quarterly basis to aid in retention of business. Negotiating and closing contracts. Delivering industry-leading renewal rates and owning the strategy and pricing of local key accounts, inclusive of growth and service plans. Forecasting. Deliver accurate and up to date forecasts to sales management for you and your team. Lead with insight. Using insight to demonstrate value to our clients, supporting their business decisions and growing Demonstrating Expertise in CPG. Ensuring you are constantly on the pulse of what is happening within the consumer packaged goods and market research industries Who We Are Looking For Client-Obsessed: You live for your clients, know their businesses inside out from strategic objectives to organisational structures. And network at the highest possible levels across your portfolio to ensure there is appropriate executive level engagement. Commercially-minded: You have a proven track record of delivering return on investment and achieving sales targets by easily identifying potential growth opportunities and successfully demonstrating the value Mintel data can provide. Self-Directed: You take initiative to solve problems and uncover opportunities, and you are eager to take ownership and accountability for the success of your team and client portfolio. Data-driven: You understand how to leverage the power of data and forward-looking metrics to drive better performance results for your clients. People Smart: You are able to easily adapt to different personalities and levels within an organization ∙ Committed to personal growth: You are committed to continuous learning and growth, constantly pushing yourself outside of your comfort zone to develop your skill set. Naturally curious: You are naturally inquisitive and great at navigating client conversations, asking second and third level questions to get at the heart of clients’ challenges and goals. Humble: You are humble, yet confident. You willingly admit when you need help, and you know how and when to utilize the resources and people around you. You are also willing to share your own knowledge for the benefit of the team. Creative problem-solver: You are able to identify complex problems based on a broad range of factors. You also are able to develop & implement optimal solutions. You establish key results, you track learnings and you embrace continuous improvement A Collaborator: You are a team player who is focused on the broader good and the success of the organization. In this spirit you are also comfortable providing and receiving feedback, so that we are all able to continuously learn & improve, together.

description: Malwarebytes believes that when people and organizations are free from threats, they are free to thrive. Founded in 2008, CEO Marcin Kleczynski had one mission: to rid the world of malware. Today, Malwarebytes has grown beyond malware remediation to ensuring cyberprotection for every one, providing device protection, privacy, and prevention solutions in the home, on-the-go, at work, or on campus. With threat hunters and innovators across the world, we want great people, like YOU, to join our team!  Who We Need  We are looking for a passionate sales professional with strong ability to create new customer relationships across the SMB and Midmarket security landscape within the Greater Asia region. Candidates must be results-driven, committed and focused on solely creating new business opportunities, be it via direct activities or working closely with channel partners. The ideal candidate will have experience successfully selling security solutions, both directly and via the channel, into many countries in Asia.  What You'll Do Develop strong relationships with prospective customer contacts to gain insight into the business mandates and IT drivers enabling development of a strategy to sell Malwarebytes solutions. Work closely within existing channel partners to support the sale of Malwarebytes solutions. Work both independently and as part of a team to determine the best approach for achieving personal and company goals. Work under general direction toward predetermined short and long term goals. Understands the client supplier ecosystem and build partnerships where appropriate to deliver against objectives: Channel and SI’s. Sell the organization’s products and/or services through a consultative selling approach and maintains good relationships with key individuals within named accounts. Primary sales point-of-contact for the account, representing the organization to the customer and the customer to the organization. Effectively engage and build cooperative relationships with sales resources: SE, Channel, Specialist sales team and executives as required. Actively build networks with contacts and partner companies that can contribute to Malwarebytes success. Identifies and qualifies opportunities, developing and executing the sales process. Maintain a robust sales pipeline. Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption. Responsible for account penetration and balanced sales growth. Responsible for meeting assigned Sales Quota. Meets or exceeds discount/profit margin goals. Provide accurate forecasts and reports on activity and sales performance as and when required by management. Ensure full compliance with all internal processes. Expect moderate travel Skills You'll Need To Have Proven track record of sales experience in hi tech industry (preferably software) developing strategic customer relationships. High levels of achievement against quota and experience selling to the executive level customer, preferably in the high-tech industry. Demonstrates strong sales skills and high level of technical and business acumen in both our industry and industry being sold into. Demonstrates a breadth and depth of knowledge arrived through exposure to complex business situations. Extensive successful demonstrable experience in a field sales role. Strong verbal and written communications skills Direct field experience in working with end user accounts What We Offer Competitive compensation and benefit packages A quickly growing, great work environment that supports growth and development A company with a strong social element and lots of other great stuff

description: Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  GrabAds allows Advertisers, Agencies, and Merchants to engage the Grab Audience via innovative online and offline advertising experiences. Through our unique ecosystem and transacting user base, our clients are able to reach their desired audiences at scale, while driving measurable business outcomes.  We would like You to join our journey to create value for our users, drivers, merchants, and advertising partners, while continuing to make everyday lives better across Southeast Asia.  The regional team is based in Singapore, and the role will require you to work hand in hand with regional sales and country sales teams across Grab’s eight markets.  Get to know the Role:  As part of the GrabAds’ Direct Sales Organization, you will be responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of GrabAds’ sales teams, partnering closely with multiple internal teams across Grab to drive enablement initiatives. This is a strategic role that requires you to drive continuous growth of enablement programs, especially with our Merchant Ads business, to ensure we are meeting the needs of the sales teams through building scalable frameworks, closely partnering with cross-functional teams, and making data-driven decisions. You will work closely with the Sales Enablement Senior Manager to set the vision for scaling new sales hire training, implementing ongoing education, and creatively executing.  This role is ideal for a self-starter who has demonstrated success operating in a fast-growing environment, dealing with ambiguity, and solving problems with limited oversight. Learn more below!  The day-to-day activities: Support building and executing a vision that increases GrabAds’ sales excellence (identifying the learning needs and actively working to increase efficiency, expertise, and impact). Scope and source and/or develop and build educational programs in onboarding, sales methodologies, sales/account management, and product. Manage business stakeholders and leaders in delivering projects to the team to drive business growth. Partner with internal teams such as Strategy, Merchant, Marketing, and Product to build and deliver content, collateral, etc. Support product launches by preparing and enabling the sales team to understand and sell our solutions. Work closely with Sales Enablement Senior Manager to determine KPIs and manage all programs to clear performance goals. Use data to develop a detailed analysis of the areas of improvement of the current enablement infrastructure and make suggestions to build improvement and implementation plans. Maintain a Resource Portal with content, tools & information and ensure that all information is easily & readily accessible at point of need. The must haves: 5+ years Sales Enablement experience in an advertising technology, fast growth and/or media company setting. Past experience working directly with SMBs and multinational brands will be prioritized. Strong understanding of programmatic & auction-time bidding from the publisher side. A proven track record in building and rolling out successful training and development programs at scale. Ability to work cross-functionally with Business leaders, Sales leaders and subject matter experts. Extraordinary communication and presentation skills with the ability to transmit across different level stakeholders. A strong operational & PMO background who is inspired by data to make data-driven decisions. Ability to build, lead, and motivate teams to deliver results. Experience in a fast-paced dynamic environment and can balance setting strategic priorities with high-quality, tactical execution. A high threshold for navigating ambiguity and building effective solutions that scale.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
