description: Overview of Role : As Clear Channel Singapore continues to grow, we are looking for a talented, motivated professional to add to our Team.  The ideal candidate will bring strong organisational, communication and analytical skills and provide support to the Sales and the Digital Service team for business operations matters. A good understanding of business processes and the ability to improve organisational effectiveness within a fast growing and diverse environment will be key to the successful contribution to this role, as well as being able work effectively with a multi-cultural and diverse team.  Key Accountabilities :  Directly support sales people on the daily sales-operations tasks, which includes but is not limited to preparing and raising contracts, logging in sales and production details in our in-house system, raising invoice requests, ensuring inventory is booked timely and accurately, and ensuring production timelines are met. Manage unavoidable late changes to campaigns. Responsible for applying principles of media planning using all audience metrics for campaigns. Responsible for monitoring campaign performance and predicting future audience levels to enable optimal use of inventory Work closely with internal order management team and support our clients across the entire production process, driving all production requests and requirements are in place, and ensure these are completed and delivered according to agreed schedules and quality processes. Provides post campaign evaluations and reporting on campaign activity. Ensure great end-to-end customer service and satisfaction levels. Ensure that clients' requests or questions are attended to in a timely, professional manner, escalating the more advanced queries as necessary. Ensure accurate data entry of bookings, contracts, production, amendments and invoicing details into the in-house system. Work with Campaign Delivery to address any user issues with in-house system. Ensure contractual paperwork is in place and in order, and proper filing to be made regularly. Take on other duties and tasks as and when assigned..  Essential Behaviours/ Skills :  A self-starter Determined and pro-active Energetic and impactful agent of change Highly analytical and strong communicator Make meaningful sense of data; able to translate numbers to tell a good story  Highly adaptable and able to grasp and manage ambiguity Persuasive in conveying complex ideas Strong understanding of media terminology and concepts Sense of commercial acumen Able to operate across a cross-functional environment Convey a sense of gravitas and credibility  Stakeholders :  Internal Chief Executive Officer Chief Commercial Officer  Chief Development Officer Chief Financial Officer Sales Team Sales Optimisation Campaign Delivery Digital Operations Marketing Finance Operations IT  External Advertisers Agencies Production Houses Suppliers Vendors  Requirements : You should possess a recognized Diploma with at least 3 years of similar work experience in either sales support or a customer service role.  A good candidate could be equipped with: Proficient with Word and Excel. Self-starter and steadfast learner. Strong resourcefulness and curiosity coupled with a strong team player mindset and good work ethic. Trustworthy, reliable and proven ability to ensure completion of work. Natural inclination towards action.  If you are excited by joining a fast-paced and growing media company and a team that consistently produces award-winning campaigns, this would be the ideal role for you.  Interested applicants, kindly apply online or send your resume to joy.lum@clearchannel.com.sg

jobTitle: Sales Account Manager, Human Capital Solutions
description: We’re hiring!  Aon is currently recruiting a Sales Account Manager, Human Capital Solutions to join our team in Singapore.  The Business  The Rewards Solutions practice is a leading team of dedicated and passionate analysts and consultants who collaborate with clients to design, enhance and maintain reward strategy and programs. We pride ourselves on developing solutions that attract, retain and motivate the people needed to fuel growth, manage change and reduce risk in a volatile world.  We are part of Aon's Human Capital Solutions offering that encompasses services in Rewards, Talent, Sales Force Effectiveness and Human Capital Advisory to help our clients drive business performance through people.  The Opportunity  Due to growth and expansion across the region we have another exciting role where you will partner with clients and prospects to demonstrate our cutting-edge software and technology platform relating to HR data and analytical products.  Your focus will be to develop new client relationships as well as maintain existing corporate client relationships across APAC and MEA headquartered companies across a variety of industry sectors and sub-sectors (i.e. Technology, E-Commerce, Life Sciences, Media Entertainment and Gaming, Retail, Manufacturing, Financial Services…)  Your role will allow you to work in partnership with our Human Capital Consulting team to ensure we are providing the insights and added value that help our clients achieve their stakeholder goals. Our focus is to identify and understand clients’ needs and match products that can enhance client value.  You will also be critical in helping create and support the sales strategy across Southeast Asia.  Responsibilities Direct sales of cutting-edge software, technology and platform relating to HR data and analytical products, developing new clients and maintaining existing corporate clients across APAC and MEA headquartered companies. Manage relationships with key industry clients across Human Capital Solutions to ensure retention targets are met. Manage any inbound leads from website queries and webinars accordingly, as well as outbound outreach to develop own pipeline of new business. Interact with prospects in the HR function to CxO level across emerging companies to global enterprises, proactively developing and maintaining mutually beneficial productive relationships Focused, active listening with innovation to solve client and prospect objectives/needs with Aon Rewards solutions in a professional manner, always representing Aon Manage annual client renewals including expanding survey participation and other offerings. Exercise discretion and independent judgment with respect to negotiating terms of sales and closing business. Communicate efficiently with internal teams - sales colleagues, subject matter experts, marketing , accounting…etc Understand various broader Aon offerings to listen out for expanded opportunities and coordinate accordingly internally with the relevant subject matter experts. Active and continuous initiative to learn and maintain knowledge of Aon product offering. Requirements Minimum 3-5 years Sales experience in a solution/services selling environment with consistent quota achievement Sense of humor Independent, self-driven and commitment to ongoing learning Professional selling and account management skills, negotiation and closing via phone and online environment Strong organizational and time management skills to establish and meet goals and daily priorities independently Prior use of Salesforce and online meeting presentation tools for selling (WebEx) Outlook efficiency and Excel experience essential Ability to actively listen and act autonomously on a prospect/clients’ questions, goals, and objectives to provide superior service Quick analytical listening to assess what drives client reliance on Aon’s resources Professional verbal and written communication skills Team player required - Internal cooperative sales team environment encourages goal-oriented collaboration among sales team members with focus on both individual and team achievement. An understanding of the Financial Services and Tech sectors an advantage How To Apply  Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.  We Offer You  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience  Every day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.  Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.  2490957

description: About Datadog:  Datadog is the world-class monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. We’re dedicated to creating, developing, and supporting our product and customers, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Built by engineers, for engineers, our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stack. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.  The Team:  Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.  The Opportunity:  Datadog is the monitoring and analytics platform for developers, IT teams and business users in the cloud age. We're scaling our Inside Sales team in Singapore to help IT and Technology leaders recognize Datadog’s impact in their digital transformation and migration to the cloud. This is an opportunity to bring a proven product, loved by thousands of customers, to a multi-billion dollar market.  You Will: Focus 100% on net new logo acquisition Manage the full sales cycle Run and partner with Sales Engineers on demos Use tools such as Sales Navigator and ZoomInfo Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users  You Are: Fluent in English Focused on hunting and closing net new logos A top performer with a history of success Bold on the phones, and creative in your emails Able to strategically map out and break into accounts Motivated, curious, hungry, and driven as a sales person  Bonus Points: Passionate about tech and the cloud space Experience with SaaS/Cloud and Salesforce  Why You Should Apply: Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Generous and competitive benefits Friendly and inclusive workplace culture  Equal Opportunity at Datadog:  Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.  Your Privacy:  Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

description: Be part of something revolutionary  We have a vision. Our Digital Brain, o9’s AI-powered platform, is being used by global enterprises to drive their digital transformations. The integrated planning and operational efficiencies we provide are helping businesses do more, be more and mean more to the world at large. Because businesses that plan better, reduce waste, creating value for themselves and the planet.   But we also have a vision for our people. We want the most talented, committed, and driven people to power our transformative approach. In return, we’ll provide a nurturing environment where you can be a part of something special.    As a member of the o9 alliance team you are responsible for the execution, day-to-day management and continuously connecting with both our partner contacts and o9 sales on developing account opportunities. You will do this by maintaining a network of partner contacts and ensure a seamless cooperation with partners by providing them with the latest collateral, information and ensure we are connected at all key initiatives and events.. You will work closely with the Alliance lead and the rest of the Alliance team as well as business stakeholders such as sales, business development, senior executives, presales and others. You will help execute go-to-market campaigns and continuously expand and educate our partner network. Key metrics include contribution to the sales pipeline, the number of account introductions and maintaining best-in-class sales and marketing assets available for our partner(s).   What you’ll do for us…  Maintain relationships with partner contacts and drive the joint governance model Maintain and expand partner contact networks and work closely with internal teams to identify and expand networks.  Represent o9 and evangelize our partners and their sellers on our vision, mission and propositions Coordinate and manage go-to-market programs Conduct introductory and second level training and demos for our Partners, their Industry/Client Leads and Teams.  Develop joint proposals, project plans and offerings for prospects and partners.  Gain thorough knowledge about the o9 platform and its value.  Visit partners and attend events   What we’ll do for you…  Competitive salary Tech tools: Complementary Mac or PC laptop. Enjoy yourself: Unlimited paid time off. Flexibility: Work from home two days a week. Get up a bit later, skip the commute, and put the time back into your deadlines. Get social: When we work from home, we play from home with fun after-work activities like Friday Socials. If you’re in the office, feel free to join these events in person. Flat organization: With a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics). Support network: Work with a team you can learn from and every day. Diversity: We pride ourselves on our international working environment.    What you’ll have…  Experience: 2+ years of Supply Chain and Operations experience is a MUST. 5+ years of experience with Sales, Project Management, and/or Consulting Firm experience Education: Master’s degree required, EMBA a plus Skills: Proficient use of MS Office package, LinkedIn, and Salesforce Characteristics: You have a true passion for process transformation and end to end planning & forecasting and a strong understanding of supply chain planning concepts  Excellent spoken and written communication, interpersonal & relationship-building skills. Ability to travel domestically and internationally We really value team spirit: Transparency and frequent communication are key. At o9, this is not limited by hierarchy, distance, or function  How the process works  You’ll be contacted by our recruiter, who’ll fill you in on all things o9, give you some background about the role and get to know you. They’ll contact you either via video call or phone call - whatever you prefer. During the interview phase, you will meet with the Hiring Manager for 30 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we’d like to progress your application. Your application has progressed! Meet with a new panel for a final round of interviews for 30 minutes each.  Our recruiter will let you know if you’re a successful candidate. Good luck  More about us…   With its recent Unicorn status, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest growing AI-powered digital transformation companies in the world today. Our high energy environment drives us to grow and aim 10x. It’s this drive that has made us leaders of Gartner’s S&OP Magic Quadrant.  The o9 platform, or “digital brain”, is the premier AI-powered, cloud-based platform behind the digital transformations of major global enterprises. These include Google, Walmart, and Starbucks, among others.  Our headquarters are located in Dallas, and we currently have offices in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Bangalore, Tokyo, Seoul, Paris and London.  o9 is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Chapter Lead Sales - Roche Information Solutions (RIS)
description: Possible Locations Singapore Travel is up to 50% is required  Who We Are At Roche, we are passionate about transforming patients’ lives, and we are bold in both decision and action - we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. Roche is strongly committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to build teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Embracing diversity enables us to create a great place to work and to innovate for patients.   The Opportunity The job will require close virtual connections, as well as travel, to manage teams that will be geographically dispersed over a larger region.  This leader will need to excel at stakeholder management with the regional market development and regional solution delivery teams, as well as the global sales operations, marketing, and customer success hubs.  The sales leader will also need to connect with local and regional sales teams of in-vitro diagnostics and pharmaceutical commercial teams who interact with a similar customer base.   Job Facts This is a newly created role and the successful candidate will have the opportunity to shape the remit of the team as it evolves. Your main responsibilities will include Lead sales teams across larger regions for cloud-software solutions for healthcare. Engage with the global hubs of sales operations, marketing operations, and customer success, along with local and regional market development teams and solution delivery teams. Stakeholder management with the regional commercial teams of in-vitro diagnostics and pharmaceuticals Who You Are We are looking for a motivated and committed leader of sales teams for cloud-software solutions for healthcare and Labs.  Moreover you bring Previous management experience with leading sales teams of cloud-based software solutions for healthcare. Experience with commercial deployment and customer engagement of cloud-based healthcare software solutions. Experience building new teams, and creating environments of accountability and employee engagement Bachelors or Masters in Business, Finance, or Healthcare or equivalent experience will be a plus; Experience with commercially launching cloud-based software solutions in healthcare will be a plus.  Mindset  You will be expected to demonstrate the We@RD dimensions and help evolve the functions culture beliefs and bring We@RocheDiagnostics to life, as part of the TransformD journey. The dimensions are We are passionate about our customers and patients We radically simplify We trust, collaborate & have fun We ALL lead We experiment & learn Are you ready to apply? We want someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a unique opportunity to shape the future of Diagnostics. Locations You can be based in Singapore At the Company's discretion, an exception to the location requirement could be made under extraordinary circumstances.

As the member in our Renewal Team, you will be responsible for timely and seamless processing and renewals of service orders so as to meet clients’ Annual Return and Income Tax filing deadlines.  The successful candidate must have an urgency mentality, good time management, attentive to details and good processing methodology approach in order to meet clients’ Annual Return and Income Tax/GST filing deadlines.  He/She should have supervisory experience, is creative, goal oriented, a go getter, works well under pressure and is able to guide and mentor the team in achieving team goals and customer fulfilment. description: Are you a sales professional driven by the desire to help clients find solutions to real problems?  Do you enjoy staying current with the latest game-changing technologies?  Are you inherently relationship oriented and able to create long term connections?  At Paradox, we believe when you get the people thing right you can build teams that can change the world. We’re a high performance culture with laser focus on building world class products and a team that our clients love. Our flagship product, Olivia, is the AI assistant helping companies around the world reimagine the way they hire: conversations instead of job applications, automatic interview scheduling, and so much more.  We’re looking for a top performer who has a track record of success and want to build a company together as we continue our triple-digit growth and expand our global footprint. Account Executives will engage prospective client companies and introduce Paradox products and solutions to drive meaningful improvements in hiring results. You’ll help us transform the industry of recruiting and hiring by building relationships, serving as a trusted advisor, and introducing our conversational AI software to companies across Singapore.  Excited about introducing next generation recruitment technology in Singapore? We want to hear from you!  As An Account Executive, You Will Leverage your SaaS sales experience to drive new business opportunities Manage the full sales cycle using a consultative, relationship-driven approach Outreach to prospective client companies to introduce Paradox and generate interest in initial business conversations Navigate complex organizational structures and technology stacks for business as you lead discovery conversations, product demos and solution discussions Listen and ask questions to gain deep understanding of clients’ recruiting and hiring challenges Present creative solutions through storytelling and consultation Educate potential clients and their teams on the transformative power of our AI products, building a coalition of Paradox enthusiasts throughout the organization Experience & Skills Required 3+ years in full cycle software sales role selling complex technology solutions Experience in the SaaS industry, highly preferred A consultative, relationship-driven sales philosophy Successful experience in multi-stakeholder environment Selling to or through channel partners. May include channel sales support and channel development duties. Comfortable with an autonomous work environment and a distributed, global workforce Track record of long-term success and upward mobility in previous roles Why You Should Work At Paradox Work side by side with a global team of passionate, purposeful people - Talent is our DNA and we pride ourselves on having the best! Ability to make a big impact on a growing organization and drive your own growth The opportunity to build the next big thing in recruiting technology Internal and external professional development, coaching, and continuous education opportunities

jobTitle: Merchant Acquisition Lead/ Assistant Manager, GrabMart
description: Job Description:  The Singapore Operations team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.  As part of the Singapore Operations team, the GrabMart team looks at connecting Singapore customers to the vast array of merchants (from the familiar favorites to the up and coming stars) within our sunny island-home of Singapore, through our many delivery-partners.  Be part of the dynamic Merchant Acquisition team which is responsible for acquiring and growing GrabMart’s huge and diverse merchant network to bring even more exciting brands, value and options to eaters in Singapore!  Get to know the role:  Oversee the entire process within merchant acquisition and onboarding  The day-to-day activities: Meet, pitch and lead negotiations with assigned/prospected merchant leads to acquire and onboard them unto GrabMart To market and champion GrabMart’s strong value proposition as the leader of choice for merchants Deal with merchants from a diverse range of establishments Build relationships/partnerships with merchants and manage their performance and contribution to building the GrabMart merchant network Handle day-to-day merchant queries (commercial & operational) and ensure a smooth and efficient onboarding and post-onboarding process Be accountable for merchant activity and engagement throughout the merchant’s onboarding journey Keep abreast of market and industry knowledge as well as competitor activity in order to contribute to strategies in meeting market changes and merchants’ requirements Develop and maintain a solid understanding of all products and services Grab offers Work closely with the Account Management Team and other verticals (e.g. GrabPay, GrabAds, GrabRewards) to align and cross-sell, elevating the value GrabMart brings to merchants The must haves: Bachelor’s Degree or higher education in business, economics or relevant fields 4 to 6 years of experience in sales and/or business development with a successful track record Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills to build rapport and win over merchants Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English. Proficiency in Mandarin is an advantage Good creativity, resourcefulness and problem-solving skills Proficient in Microsoft Office (MS. Excel, MS. Word and MS. Powerpoint) Good business acumen, comfortable with numbers and analysing sales data A team player but also able to work independently Self-driven, motivated and entrepreneurial; ability to own outcomes and make things happen Upbeat and passionate about making an impact to the business and stakeholders. Accountable and responsible in discharging duties Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment Retail or e-commerce industry background is an advantage.

description: The Business Development Manager is focused on the development of customer relationships, sales opportunities within new and dormant accounts in General Staffing(GS) business unit of Quess Singapore. GS focuses on partnering with clients for their staffing needs for its non-tech talent in sectors such as Consumer Business, Luxury, Mass Retail, Education, Insurance, BFSI and Govt. Strategically-minded, the Business Development Manager will establish and build a trusting relationship with potential prospects, and develop and close sales opportunities within new accounts (high touch sales).  Responsibilities: Establish relationships with new customers and secure contracts with new customers that achieve assigned sales quotas and targets Prospect for potential customers using various direct methods such as calling and face to face meetings, and indirect methods such as networking Qualify prospects against company criteria for ideal customers and sales Maintain a high level of relevant domain knowledge in order to have meaning conversations with prospect Work with Consultants to address customers specific requirements  Qualifications: At least 5 years experience in driving revenue and key account management, with experience in client and talent acquisition Extensive experience in General Staffing recruitment; Familiar with MOM rules and regulations; Understand and able to interpret Singapore employment and labour laws High level skills in MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and SharePoints and Drives Able to do the job independently; Should be Self-driven and motivated to achieve success Experience in Singapore based staffing organization -Mandatory. Must have experience of Contingent workforce models and also familiar with solutions such as MSP. Those with lesser experience can be considered for Junior positions.

Description  Ekata, a Mastercard company, is the global standard in identity verification, providing businesses worldwide the ability to link any digital transaction to the human behind it. Our Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only of its kind, uses complex machine learning to combine features derived from the billions of transactions within our proprietary network and the data from our graph to deliver industry leading risk assessment solutions.  As we embark on our next phase of growth, we are seeking a Sr. Business Development Representative (BDR) to serve as a founding member and assist in the creation, development, and management of our first team of business development representatives supporting our APAC region. This team will be made up of driven individuals seeking a path to becoming Account Executives or Partner Managers within our company. The Business Development team is one of the first interactions our prospective customers have with Ekata and the BDR program will be a key driver of our ongoing success. If you have proven success overachieving your KPIs and goals as a BDR, a desire to build the team, enact scalable processes, as well as have a knack for inspiring people, this is the role for you!  Objectives For The BDR  Outbound BDRs at Ekata will run highly targeted prospecting campaigns at assigned targeted and named accounts. This dedicated operational team will also proactively call net-new and existing accounts and help these clients understand how Ekata can innovate their identity verification and fraud prevention strategy. Be a founding member of our outbound Business Development team. Help build predictable, scalable, repeatable, and effective outbound prospecting playbooks to drive organizational growth. Fuel pipeline expansion for Ekata Asia Pacific (APAC) by finding qualified opportunities over the phone, email, and social interaction. These three objectives are crucial in scaling the sales organization and providing a predictable revenue and profit stream.  In The Sr. Business Development Representative Role You Will Research targeted accounts and execute outbound playbooks at scale, setting up qualified new business opportunities for our APAC Account Executives. Strategically and creatively map target accounts, finding the best way into the organization while securing executive and project sponsorship. Help create, improve, and oversee usage of standard playbooks and outreach cadences, developing a set of best practices and techniques. Use data to identify and make improvements in process, efficiency, enablement, and productivity. Track and communicate weekly goals to team and leadership to drive consistent performance. Deliver on meetings set and opportunities generated, as well as report on all weekly, monthly, and quarterly KPIs and performance. Proactively identify and launch initiatives to drive new business development growth and operational excellence. Achieve quarterly and annual pipeline and revenue targets. Work with marketing and sales operations to ensure thorough follow-up on leads. Work closely with Sales Managers and Account Executives to ensure proper alignment on opportunity quality, and follow-up on handoffs. Maintain impeccable data quality and Salesforce CRM hygiene. Have a maniacal focus on outcomes and impact. Closely monitor metrics – everything from daily activity, conversion rates to opportunities, hand-off to sales, and close rates – with the aim to increase BDR productivity, contribution to pipeline, and bookings. Our Ideal Sr. Business Development Representative Will Have Proven track record of success – demonstrable experience as an SDR or BDR with phone experience for at least two years with clear goals and KPI achievement for a sales organization. Builder mentality – ability and interest in developing new processes while serving as a founding member of the team. Strategic thinker – able to research and understand the ideal Ekata client profile and become an expert on Ekata’s competitive landscape. Team player – you inspire others around you through your effort and ability to play a team game. At Ekata, Sales is a team sport with collaboration required across many departments. Data-driven – you are driven by numbers and are constantly finding ways to improve productivity, efficiency, and contribution to the business. Natural leader – you have a passion for mentoring and coaching a team to success, inspiring confidence, and leading by example. Results-driven work ethic with measurable results in fast-paced environments. 2+ years in a fast-growing SaaS environment. This is an APAC market-facing role, therefore, proficiency in Mandarin Chinese, Bahasa Indonesia, or Malay are preferred. Experience using Salesforce, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Gong, Chorus, and any other prospecting tools. Strong process and analytical skills to identify inefficiencies and create improvements. This role is based in Singapore and will report to the Head of Business Development.  Unwavering in our pursuit of standardizing global identity data, we are approachable, real people that genuinely care about the success of those we partner with. With a commitment to service, innovation, and ownership, Ekata is a dynamic place to work for folks who want to make an impact on a global scale. We provide learning & development opportunities for each employee and promote work-life flexibility through self-managed time off. Headquartered in downtown Seattle, Ekata is growing internationally with offices in Budapest, Amsterdam, and Singapore.  To learn more about the experience of working at Ekata, visit https//ekata.com/careers/.  Ekata prides itself on celebrating diversity, inclusivity, and being an equal-opportunity employer.

description: About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain—in real-time, across devices—to improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The Commercial Sales Team  The Commercial Sales Team is responsible for bringing in new logos, renewing accounts, and up-selling into current customers. The team has two different roles, Account Executives who bring in new business, and Relationship Managers responsible for managing existing clients focusing on specific business segments. The APAC Commercial Sales Team is at the forefront of Mixpanel's fast growth around the world.  About The Role  You will be an impact player based out of our Singapore APAC Headquarters who will help build and iterate on Mixpanel's fastest growing market strategy by prospecting and acquiring new customers within our Commercial APAC market. You will collaborate with cross-functional team members to position Mixpanel as the best in class Product Analytics tool in the market, focusing on our highest potential value accounts to increase growth in our business's highest priority segment. This role is for you if you have a growth mindset, a bias towards experimentation, comfort with ambiguity, and rapid iteration.  Responsibilities Prospect and outbound into an account list Build and iterate an outbound and pipeline generation strategy Be an expert on Mixpanel product and industry knowledge to properly pitch and position Mixpanel during discovery calls and product demonstrations Manage complex sales cycles with technical proof of concepts Accurately forecast sales pipeline and exceed annual targets We're Looking For Someone Who Has 3 to 5 years experience owning a revenue quota for a SaaS business within the APAC Region with a technical product OR consulting experience with Go To Market, Sales, or Strategy Experience building an account, territory, and/or go to market strategy for a SaaS business within APAC Knowledge sales procurement process and practices A record of success hitting key performance indicators or achieving quota while working with complex customer engagements Bonus Points For Have experience working with a technical SAAS product and collaborating with client Product and Engineering teams Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers’ success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can’t win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.  Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.  Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.  As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.  We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.  Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth.  About The Role  We are looking for a Partner Development Representative to join our Partnerships team and scale business growth. This individual is responsible for sourcing and building partner relationships, educating and training partner sales teams, and implementing sales strategies to meet revenue and profit goals within our emerging partners:  Impact You’ll Own Support channel strategy based on Planet’s definitive target markets. Help the Channel evolve by implementing creative ideas about programs, sales strategies, and incentives to extend to partners to drive growth. Develop business relationships with the emerging partners in your region, such as commercial contracts, sales and technical enablement, deal flow, etc. Responsible for ensuring that your partners are conducting business up to Planet’s company standards. Manage the right coverage and mix of partners within the region (resellers, VARs, solution providers, app dev, integrators). Define partner-specific quantifiable goals and sign new partners as needed. Follow process, criteria, and controls for selection, management and performance of channel partners. Summarize partner pipeline and revenue for the region. Actively manage partner enablement to sell and service our full range of products. Ensure partners, sales and management are working together in the sales process, lead generation, registering opportunities, accurately forecasting revenue and tracking to required revenue goals established by their discount tier. Drive regional sales through partners and execute go-to-market strategies and identify business growth opportunities in the assigned customer base. Participate in sales cadence of Sales Kickoff, Quarter Business Reviews and weekly Forecast calls. What You Bring Minimum 2+ years of sales experience including 1+ years of channel sales Demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets Ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a high-growth, start-up culture Excellent communicator with strong presentation, speaking, and writing skills Excellent market research and prospecting skills The ability to coach partner sales teams on selling Planet products and solutions Excellent organizational and time management skills A strong understanding of home working and the motivation to stay on track What Makes You Stand Out Experience working with geospatial imagery and/or GIS software Degree or equivalent business experience A desire to win and a focus on customer satisfaction Benefits While Working At Planet Comprehensive Health Plan Wellness program and onsite massages in specific offices Flexible Time Off Recognition Programs Commuter Benefits Learning and Tuition Reimbursement Parental Leave Offsites and Happy Hours Volunteering Benefits Some Press About Us  Our CEO, Will Marshall featured on TED and featured in a Planet Blog  “Planet: Bringing Space Back Down to Earth”  Tiny, privately owned satellites are changing how we view the Earth features in NBC News  “Planet And Rocket Lab Create Mission Patch To Honor Women In Aerospace” —Planet Blog  Why We Care So Much About Belonging.  We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.

description: Today, most countries across the world lack access to the internet and with that, the resources to do business, exchange ideas and learn.  Severe bottlenecks at all levels, what we call the Global Internet Distribution Challenge, has led to more than 50% of the world left unconnected entirely OR connected but with extremely poor access to the Internet. The outcome is that large swaths of the global population are hence prevented from accessing life-changing and economy-driving tools and services offered by the Internet.  What if you could really change the future?  We are building a space laser network to deliver the future of Internet Distribution worldwide. This will be the fastest way to bring the rest of the world up on the bandwidth and connectivity curve. Right now, we are using the same technology to provide a rapidly deployable, affordable, low cost and high speed Last Mile Connectivity solution, CENTAURI, which speeds up adoption of 4G and 5G globally, specially dense residential areas during COVID-19 period which require urgent bandwidth upgrades.  Join our team if you want to define the rules of how our civilisation communicates!  GLOBAL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT LEAD  Responsibilities  Plan, Strategize and Expand Business Grow Transcelestial’s business in Southeast Asia (Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand). Define and execute the Go-to-Market strategies to achieve business objectives. Designs, implements, and manages sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes (AOP). Hunt new accounts and expand/diversify product mix in existing accounts. Make presentations, lead negotiations and close deals. Keep and build relationships with customers, partners, channels and distributors. Responsible in managing/coaching in hunting for new customers and opportunity. Regularly plan, execute, review and revise business plan Expand and Manage Sales Team Lead and direct sales team to meet or exceed order booking, sales, profitability and budgetary targets Advise in hiring the right candidates and develop the sales team according to yearly strategy plan Need to help sales team to navigate both internally for management/presales/technical support, as well as externally with customers’ personnel, to maximize success, effectiveness and profitability. Develop Partner Programme Own and assist in developing a Partner Programme which allows us to standardize Terms of Engagement with sales channels and other commercial partners globally. Develop Commercial Kit and PR Commercial Kit development (whitepapers, master slides, training material for other incoming BD/sales team, CRM and metric tracking for BD/sales) Represent Transcelestial at conferences, meetups and other places along with the founders. Develop value propositions and responses to RFPs. Provide routine weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting as required. Active participation in regular management team meetings. Ensure individual’s account plans are well prepared and executed accordingly to meet annual targets. Accountable for the on-time implementation of sales organization quotas and performance objectives. Accountable for accurate and on-time reporting essential for sales organization effectiveness. Achievement of strategic objectives defined by company management. Qualifications Amazing hustler with an ability to instinctively understand customer’s motivation Successful experience in selling directly to tier one mobile network operators. Successful experience in building and managing channels, partners and distributors. Experience in managing similar territory, familiar with Southeast Asia and East Asia culture. Demonstrated a successful track record of at least 3-5 years in identifying key business opportunities and executing a go-to-market strategy within that Degree from an accredited institution; master’s in telecommunications, electrical engineering or/and business administration or equivalent preferred. Minimum 3-5 years of sales or sales management experience in a business-to-business sales environment Experience managing key customer relationships and closing strategic opportunities. Proof of record of winning significant business. Experience in managing a sales teams, monitoring and evaluating the team progress against stated expectations, in addition to aligning and changing individual behaviour with performance expectations. Demonstrate outstanding leadership, communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrate innovative solutioning and able to “think-out of the box”. High level of tenacity, resiliency and achievement orientation. Able to travel up to 50% of time regionally and globally. Preferred Skills And Experience Experience in TMT Sales, Business Development or Strategy within Asia or Globally Experience with any of the following specialized areas - satellite connectivity, enterprise connectivity, leased line connectivity, local loop connectivity Experience with any of the following specialized industries - Telco, ISP, Ports, Financial Networks, Oil & Gas, Government, Media and Entertainment, Gaming, Data Center. Instinct and track record of closing B2B deals Transcelestial is working on creating a better connection for everyone on this planet, and we apply many of the same values in accomplishing that end to supporting all our team members at work, and beyond.  Compensation & Benefits We have flexible work hours Comprehensive and best in industry health plans A monthly book and hobby fund that makes sure our team enjoys their time out of work We try to ensure that a percentage of time at work can be used experimentally to create things needed in space ... for the next 100 years!

description: About Workato  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why: Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 large company for remote workers  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave  Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Enterprise Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be involved in responding to inbound inquiries and increasing our outreach via outbound activity. You will strategically approach target companies and sell automation solutions that will help them achieve their business objectives. Although you strive to meet and exceed quota, you act in the best interests of the client. You are confident, tenacious and highly organized. You will also be responsible to: Own and develop accounts to expand business with enterprise companies in the Asia (Excluding Japan) market Manage the full sales pipeline by assessing sales potential and create prospecting lists via various methods to attract enterprise customers. Develop relationships with existing/potential customers to meet their needs and proactively help customers to assess Workato Working with teams from multiple functions (e.g: Marketing, Customer Success, Product, etc.) to formulate plans to grow new and existing businesses. Build a compelling partner strategy for your key accounts, engage with the channel team and lead the joint sales approach Ability to expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Develop and execute outbound strategies to create opportunities  Requirements  Qualifications and Experience 5+ years of Enterprise Software Sales experience in a technology space. Has prior experience in closing deals in software or technology sales in Asia (Excluding Japan) Needs to be based in Singapore Keen interest in technology and industry trends  Skills Demonstrates understanding of the Workato iPaaS & Automation Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time in high-pressure situations, and work in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Capability to build great relationships with highly technical customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Possess strong critical thinking and analytical skills with an entrepreneurial mindset
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: “Pursue your career with a dynamic company recognized as the most important and most influential in its industry. We offer competitive pay, work-life balance, and career progression opportunity.”    Who We Are - Media OutReach is the Asia Pacific region’s first global newswire company and the only newswire with its own distribution network across 24 countries in this region. Founded in 2009, in Hong Kong, today we have offices in Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, Taiwan, Japan, China, and Vietnam as well as reseller partners in Europe, the USA, UK, and Russia, serving a broad range of clients - public relations, investor relations, and digital contents agencies, local and international multinational, government agencies, SMEs, education institutions, the list goes on.  Our Talents - We are looking for highly motivated candidates who aspire to work in a dynamic and tech-based media industry to join our Singapore sales office. We believe in investing in our people both professionally and personally, and we reward ambition. When you join the Media OutReach family, you will be working with a company that focuses on developing your potential as we want to support you to achieve your personal success. We offer a supportive working environment where our corporate culture is about being authentic and caring for each other. If you relish working in an environment where you are rewarded financially and have colleagues and management who support you, we are the company for you. We look forward to hearing from you. Join us and build your career with us today.  Please visit http://www.media-outreach.com/ for more information about us   Corporate Business Development Manager (5 Day Week, Good Remuneration & Work-Life Balance)  Job Role Introduction As the Corporate Business Development Manager, you are a dynamic person who is thrilled by the opportunity to introduce our fantastic service to the public relations, marketing communications, and digital sectors. Our service appeals to diverse industries, making your role most stable as your work is not affected by negative economic forces that impact specific industries.  As an expert of our service, you are a good listener who understands the clients’ brief and can tailor solutions that would help the clients to achieve their targeted communication goals.  The opportunity to work with a vast industry means you will have an interesting career where you can have flexibility in pursuing your strategic goals.  In your role, you will be supported by a servicing team that is committed to delivering the highest standard of deliverables to our clients.   Job Skills: Ability to formulate a strategic plan that focuses on achieving sales goals Build a sales pipeline by cultivating prospects, managing, and expanding existing customer relationships to maximize growth opportunity Able to create and deliver a compelling sales presentation Develop new markets and identify business opportunities  Enjoys making cold calls Follow up on warm leads  Requirements: Must be a university graduate with over 5 years of experience Candidate from the Digital Media, Public Relations, Investor Relations, or Corporate Services industries is preferred Has effective consultative selling skills Able to develop a strategic sales plan to drive performance Strong verbal and written communication, including compelling presentation skills in English Has excellent networking and relationship building skills Self-motivator who can work independently with solid time management skills Self-discipline and focus on achieving goals  Please submit your application with CV to hr@media-outreach.com  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified, and we would only consider a candidate that meets our requirements.  Personal information provided will be handled in strict confidentiality and used for recruitment purposes only.  Thank you for applying!

description: Our job is to be bold at work.  It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role  The Account Executive is required to generate and close new business, as well as renew and upsell from existing clients within an assigned territory. The role also entails working to develop and execute a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, this person will continue to build strong relationships, enrich existing accounts, and drive retention of existing business by ensuring a high level of client satisfaction. This position is based in Singapore and will cover financial services (FS) as a territory. Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory on FS enterprises. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list on FS enterprises. Once closed, keep the relationship with these accounts and develop them further. Develop and close business by developing interest across Technology, Marketing, Customer Experience, Sales & Product roles. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Build a strong understanding of the financial services industry, as well as the changing business and technology issues and needs that our potential clients face. Navigate across teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes. Job Requirements Eight or more years quota-carrying experience in successful sales to C-level executives. Strong understanding and experience in a recurring revenue model business. A bachelor’s degree or higher equivalent experience. A proven track record of prospecting and selling strategic solutions to enterprises. Proven experience in working in complex global business environment, managing stakeholders internally and externally. Proven experience in working in lean organizations with complex internal ecosystems. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. A team player, with effective organization and time management skills. A high level of business acumen, particularly within FS. The ability to work and reside in Singapore without restriction. Explore #ForresterLife on:  YouTube  Twitter  Facebook  Instagram  LinkedIn  Glassdoor  Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment.  Data Protection  The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities.  By Submitting Your Resume/CV, You Consent To Forrester’s Retention Of The Information Provided On a Secure File For Personnel Administration And Management Purposes And/or In Order To Consider You For Future Employment Opportunities And To The Transfer Of The Information Provided To  Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Go1 is on a mission to unlock positive potential through a love of learning. The Go1 platform makes learning easy with thousands of courses in one simple solution. Since our founding in 2015, we have grown to an organization of 200+ in 9 global offices. At Go1, we go to infinity and beyond through excellent work, prioritising actions over words and encouraging creativity and candour. It is with this spirit that we are driving hypergrowth and international expansion.  The role:  We are in search of a motivated and determined sales Account Executive to join our Sales Team reporting to the Sales Team Manager. As an Account Executive you will encompass the sales lifecycle elements of discovery, solution design, negotiation, collaboration, and sale close. You will lead by example in performing and achieving your own personal sales targets. You have a complete understanding of the breadth and depth of opportunities held, be able to provide insight into how to best capitalize and convert opportunities at each sales stage, and to articulate process weekly via 1:1 pipeline review to optimize opportunities and troubleshoot where necessary.  Responsibilities: Full sales lifecycle: discovery, solution design, negotiation, collaboration, and sale close Generate new recurring revenue for Go1 Manage complex sales and present our value to C-level executives Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in CRM, while creating satisfied and referenceable customers Maintain accurate data around opportunities and communications Achieve, and exceed, a monthly (and ultimately annual) sales quota Assist in preparation of pertinent sales and marketing material Attend and participate in events on behalf of Go1 Nurture highly positive relationships inside and outside of Go1 Assist in constantly improving sales and marketing processes Occasional travel up to 30%  Requirements  About you:  You are persuasive and organized. Communication is a top priority to you in interpersonal, verbal, and written formats. You are resilient and consistently meet your goals.  You will have; High level of strategic sales capability and approach with a proven track record in customer acquisition, retention, and growth Consistent contribution to a high-performance sales team and culture Customer-centric with strong abilities in persuasion, organization, perseverance, negotiation, and appropriate communication Highly developed and effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, able to engage, influence, and negotiate at a senior and executive level if required Able to collaborate, problem solve and innovate internally with key stakeholders to develop compelling solutions for prospects and customers High alignment to Go1 Values; strong internal drive, bias for action, creativity and candor, collaboration and teamwork Strong understanding and capability for selling technical services to HR & other business stakeholders Excellent understanding of Go1 products and services (acquired during probation period  Benefits  Pay Benefits Competitive market-based salaries, bonus, and commission plans Salary paid monthly, within 7 days of the end of the salary period  Leave Benefits 20 Days Paid Annual Leave 11 Paid Public Holidays Sick Days Maternity Leave Childcare Leave Work-Related Injury Leave  Other Benefits Access to Go1’s exclusive learning platform Wellness benefits EAP

description: Co-Founded by one of the world’s most impactful and serial entrepreneurs, Ronnie Screwvala, upGrad is pioneering the online education revolution and aiming to change the lives of millions for the better by “Powering career success for every member of the global workforce as their trusted lifelong learning partner”.  upGrad is unique, in that it offers global learners a hyper-personalized yet comprehensive one stop solution and accompanies them through their professional journey, with an obsessive devotion to accelerate their careers. Owing to its significant global scale, upGrad brings together the world’s leading universities, faculty, industry experts on an integrated platform to deliver an experience that prepares learners for deep learning and long-term success.  Backed by Temasek and International Finance Corporation (Sister organisation of the World Bank) with a proven business model, upGrad has impacted over 2 million total registered learners over 50+ countries across the world, with its alumni base working in organisations like Gojek, PayTM, Gartner, Flipkart (Walmart-acquired), Accenture, and E&Y.   upGrad’s ever expanding roster of leading global universities include Duke Corporate Education (US), Michigan State University (US), Liverpool John Moores University (UK), Deakin Business School (Australia), Swiss School of Business Management, (Geneva), and others.   upGrad ranked amongst the Top 50 in the FT Asia-Pacific High-Growth Companies 2021 and the GSV Global EdTech 50. It has also ranked as No.1 in the LinkedIn Top Startups India 2020 list, three times in a row since 2018.   Role: Drive revenue and customer satisfaction through world class consultation and counselling  The ideal candidate for this role: You are a proven sales performer adept in direct to consumer consultative sales, in Southeast Asia. You are comfortable working with high ticket size products which require focussed nurturing over a period of time and yet can build urgency for the end consumer to decide fast. You have worked in an extremely competitive sales environment and have been at the top 10 percentile of your team. Key KRAs are:  Secure Revenue Targets ·       Being a mentor and guide to our potential learners for career advice. ·       Counselling potential learners, helping them to plan their career path, and making them understand how UpGrad can catalyze their career. ·       Achieve and consistently exceed your monthly enrolment targets, converting complete applications (strong leads) into enrolments, with marketing qualified leads becoming sales qualified closed leads and post sales relationship management. ·       Quickly learn about new courses and clearly communicate their value proposition to prospective students - Identify opportunities and test strategies to improve yield of high- quality candidates. ·       Dial new applicants fast and consistently build and deliver an accurate pipeline ·       Manning website live chat system during working hour  Strategy, Reporting and KPIs ·       Develop and implement sales activity plans. ·       Prepare and implement any requisite reporting and contribute to CRM reporting mandates in the timely fashion. ·       Create activities and maintain student community ·       Create activities and maintain student community  Knowledge, Skill & Attitude ·       Knowledge: Mentor and guide learners on career path advise ·       Skills: Strong selling and service mindset. ·       Attitude: Passionate and hungry to overachieve.

Description: At Anchanto, we know that the one of the keys to growth is a high-performing business development and sales team. That's why we're seeking a skilled Senior Sales and Business Developer to acquire and manage new client relationships. The ideal candidate will have experience in B2B SaaS ecommerce product sales, as well as skills related to strategic analysis and marketing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing relationships with our clients, negotiating contracts and closing deals. As a Senior Sales and Business Developer for Anchanto's products (OMS and WMS) focused on Enterprise segment, this is a new quota bearing sales role to manage the sales and business development for all Japanese corporate clients across Japan, Singapore and Southeast Asian countries. The role requires identifying best approach to reach out to Japanese corporates to identify the right contact(s) to introduce Anchanto company vision, qualify as prospects and engage them in a consultative sales process to win them as customers. This role will directly report to the Anchanto's Chief Revenue Officer (CRO)  Some things you should know about us:  We have incredible technology and we're adding new customers very often on our quest to solidify and expand our position as the premier B2B SaaS ecommerce product-based company. We have an amazing group of people working out of our headquarters in Singapore, and also across the 14 geographical locations we have a presence in.  Key Accountabilities/Responsibilities: Present, promote and sell Anchanto solutions using business value and benefit. Analyse the territory and market potential to build a business. Identify needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs. Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships Build pipeline by reaching out to customer leads through cold calling. Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments Share information on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.  Skills & Experience (Must have): More than 5 years of enterprise sales experience in eCommerce, SaaS solutions serving Japanese corporate clients. Bilingual and proficient communication skills in Japanese & English. Ability to work well in a past paced high growth company.  Soft Skills: Self-starter and should be able to proceed with minimal supervision Strong communication and documentation skills Understanding and respect multi-cultural work environment  About Anchanto  Anchanto provides global SaaS solution with a vision for e-commerce order management and logistics solutions to be frictionless while delivering business value by connecting key partners in Anchanto ecosystem globally. Our mission is to transform the way businesses conduct ecommerce, while becoming the most customer-centric company by enabling simpler, faster and scalable ecommerce. Look us on Anchanto

description: An attractive Sales Executive job has just become available at a reputable financial services firm based in Singapore. You will be reporting directly to the Head of Sales APAC and Canada and sales team leader in Singapore.  About The Sales Executive Role  In this business critical role, you will specifically focus on converting opportunities to new live trading accounts and proactively identifying high-value clients for the premium client-facing team.  Key Responsibilities Adhere to and achieve consistent monthly KPI targets (such as conversion rate, outbound call numbers, etc.) Identify sales opportunities where possible – contacting leads via outbound calling/email/seminars Provide excellent and high-calibre client service to ensure a positive client experience Proactively identify and cross sell additional products and services to existing clients Proactively identify opportunities to improve the client experience Proactively respond to and manage inbound client queries professionally and efficiently Act as a brand ambassador in all client interactions Take ownership for ensuring accurate client information is recorded in relevant internal systems (e.g. CRM) in a timely manner Escalate all relevant client issues to appropriate levels to ensure a consistently high level of client service Deal effectively with client queries - focusing on getting it right the first time Ensure adherence to compliance, including annual CPD points Always act with integrity in every aspect of the role (onboarding, branding, client communications, etc.) Provide proactive and timely support during the client onboarding process To succeed in this Sales Executive role, you will need to be willing to learn and grow with the team and company. You will also possess strong product knowledge in CFDs and driven personality to drive the company’s revenue  Key Requirements Diploma or bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline (business, finance, economics, etc.) Excellent written and verbal English and Chinese communication skills Proven sales ability and skills to work with KPIs and targets Previous sales-focused senior role is highly regarded Demonstrated passion and enthusiasm for products and services Operates with integrity and a highly client-centric mindset, with an ability to build, influence and enhance strong and meaningful client relationships Ability to work effectively as part of a team Intermediate knowledge/experience of financial markets Expert knowledge of platform and products is highly regarded This esteemed company is one of the world’s leading online CFD and financial spread betting providers, with nearly 60 million trades executed annually across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America. Their success is founded on their ability to deliver a wide range of trading products to customers, from single equities to indices, currencies and commodities. They have pioneered the development of online trading in markets around the world. The company is committed to provide consistent quality service to all their clients to transcend client retention and growth in the financial markets industry.  If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Sales Executive role.  Apply now or contact me to find out more.  Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted. Manage the operational activities of the regional sales team including visit planning and reporting. Prepare sales and service sales forecasts and budgets; monitor sales volume, revenues, and costs against forecasts to identify problem areas; and adapt procedures or re-allocate resources to improve the overall performance of the sales team. Actively encourage team to report back on customers product Installed Base (IB) What You’ll Need To Succeed  Education Bachelor’s degree in engineering, marine or business Experience 6+ years in Marine, shipping or offshore Competencies Fluent English – written and oral Ability to manage a team across different geographies Ability to manage and interpret sales and cost data and communicate results to the sales team Responsibility for conforming to the Cargotec Code of Conduct, QEHS Policies of MacGregor as well as requirements of ISO9001, ISO14001 and OHSAS18001 You Will Be Part Of  We offer you an opportunity to put your skills and experience to work and make an impact in our global organisation. You will work together with great colleagues from various backgrounds inspired by shared, ambitious goals. We value collaboration in our open and inclusive culture. With us, you will have the opportunity to develop yourself professionally. Join us to make a difference - and have fun while doing it.  Interested to join?  If you are excited about this opportunity, click on Apply Now and send us your updated CV and expected salaries.  MacGregor is part of Cargotec  MacGregor shapes the offshore and marine industries by offering world-leading engineering solutions and services with a strong portfolio of MacGregor, Hatlapa, Porsgrunn, Pusnes and Triplex brands. Shipbuilders, owners and operators are able to optimise the lifetime profitability, safety, reliability and environmental sustainability of their operations by working in close cooperation with MacGregor.  MacGregor solutions and services for handling marine cargoes, vessel operations, offshore loads,crude/LNG transfer and offshore mooring are all designed to perform with the sea. www.macgregor.com  MacGregor is part of Cargotec. Cargotec's (Nasdaq Helsinki: CGCBV) sales in 2020 totalled approximately EUR 3.3 billion and it employs around 11,500 people. www.cargotec.com
