description: About TIME:  TIME is a global media brand built on 98 years of unparalleled trust and authority, with an audience of more than 100 million people worldwide across our platforms. Our team is collaborative, innovative and committed to TIME’s mission of informing, guiding and engaging our audience with groundbreaking journalism, immersive experiences and live events.  TIME is an equal opportunity employer. Our people drive the culture. Our culture drives the mission. Our mission drives the business. Our business impacts the world. An inclusive and diverse team not only makes our content and our products better, but our workplace stronger. Equity, diversity, and inclusion are top priorities in our recruiting and hiring, and our culture.  The role: TIME is seeking an Account Manager to act as an internal sales representative responsible for the conceiving, managing and executing online marketing initiatives and management of all advertising programs and associated revenue pre- and post-sale. This includes media plan creation, campaign implementation, optimization, reporting, program retention and renewal, and ensuring prompt and proper resolution of advertiser business issues.  Responsibilities: Collaborate cross-functionally; ability to exercise judgment and flexibility in balancing program requirements, milestones, and keeping people and projects moving on schedule Maintain client relationships, partnering closely with Sales and other internal teams to understand client expectations and what needs to be communicated with the client Build out sales plans for clients Continuously monitor campaign delivery and performance and communicate recommendations for optimizations and up-sell opportunities. Will lead weekly pacing calls with assigned Sales teams Assist in analyzing and reconciling third party delivery for proper billing every month Utilize various analytic and ad server systems (GAM, Ad-juster, MOAT etc.) to analyze and troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance Build wrap-up analysis reporting, pulling in various sets of performance data and metrics, to help tell a story to the client about how the campaign performed and help recommend best practices for future campaigns.   Qualifications: 2-3 years proven digital advertising experience Excellent presentation, communication, and collaboration skills Strong organizational, interpersonal, and influential written and verbal communication skills. Ability to quickly form relationships usually by telephone or email High attention to detail. Strong analytical, quantitative and strategic problem solving. Excellent grammar, spelling and proofreading skills Attain a deep understanding of each media platform, ad products and capabilities High degree of proficiency in MS Office products. Ability to use databases. Excellent working knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook Positive and confident disposition when responding to frequent deadlines for multiple customers (internal and external) Demonstrated ability to quickly build positive team relationships Be able to think strategically and act tactically A desire to grow as a digital sales professional Analytical skills that can translate data performance into a narrative
industries: Publishing

description: Advanced Navigation is the global leader in navigation systems for air, land and sea. Our products are developed and manufactured in Australia with our main HQ is located in Sydney with offices around the world. With over 68 of the top 100 largest companies as customers, and a broad range of technologies, we are truly changing the way we navigate globally.  Our ever growing team has world class expertise in the fields of inertial navigation, global navigation satellite systems, sensors, acoustics, AI, and RF technologies.  Click below to find out a little more about us:  https://www.smartcompany.com.au/startupsmart/news/advanced-navigation-funding-unicorn/  Advanced Navigation is growing our presence in the APAC region. As our APAC Sales Executive you will be driving sales, developing customer relationships, building the company’s brand awareness and landing strategic accounts across the territory.  Main Duties/Responsibilities Drive the top-line revenue and orders for APAC by expanding growth with existing customers, acquiring new customers and driving upsells by fostering the adoption and use of our products, solutions and services Own the end to end sales process, from lead to prospect to close, bringing Advanced Navigation solutions to companies within your region Working closely with the Chief Revenue Officer to execute the company’s APAC Go-To-Market strategy Paint the Advanced Navigation vision and opportunity for prospects through a combination of ROI and qualitative value propositions Understand the technical requirements of each customer and work closely with Support and the Products Group to guide the direction of our product offerings and solutions Work openly with other Advanced Navigation teams (e.g. Marketing, Sales Operations, Products Group, Support and Operations) to improve our go-to-market plans, execution and acceleration of our growth Ensure operational excellence by keeping our CRM (Salesforce) always updated, guaranteeing business linearity and forecasting accuracy Skills & Experience: 5+ years experience of sales and account management, experience with high-tech solutions in at least one of the following verticals; aerospace & defence, surveying, autonomous vehicles/robotics, or maritime/subsea Executive presence with the ability to represent and present in front of an audience Be a strong team player that is passionate about being a part of a fast-moving and entrepreneurial company Flexibility to work within multiple time zones within the APAC region as well as connecting with Global Head Office, based in Australia. Working in a Global collaborative cross-functional environment. Have an understanding that you will be travelling roughly 50% of the time Relevant technical knowledge, such as inertial sensors, acoustics, GNSS, optical sensors, and robotics with an ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied and comparable navigation products/solutions in the market A sense of being coach-able and invested in your professional growth, development, and career path Strong skills with CRM solutions such as Salesforce Excellent communication and writing skills with the ability to be both technical and analytical The ability to adapt to a fast-changing environment, international cultures, and distributed teams Languages: Fluent English, Mandarin Chinese, other University Degree, is nice to have but not essential You'll have access to industry-leading products with diverse applications within some of the most interesting and exciting projects worldwide. We’re growing a team of inspired, smart, and driven individuals from all sorts of backgrounds. With great opportunities for growth and variety, we strive to help each employee carve out the path that’s right for them.

description: Vuealta is a young and entrepreneurial consulting firm  Vuealta is a leading global consulting firm and Anaplan Partner helping medium and large enterprises around the world solve complex planning challenges through the delivery of a suite of applications powered by the Anaplan Connected Planning Platform. We provide deep process expertise and advanced planning solutions in Finance, Supply Chain, and Human Resources. We serve clients across industries such as Resources, Transportation, Retail, FMCG, Insurance, and many more.  Vuealta is a young and dynamic consulting firm with its headquarters in London and offices in Sweden, Finland, The Netherlands, New York, and Singapore. Our fast-growing Singapore office is hiring for a variety of roles to expand our energetic team in various directions.  We are hiring Account Executive  More than ever does the dynamic, challenging, and ever-changing business environment require enterprises to break through internal functional silos and work in concerted way to change enterprise business models, manage the unexpected, and grasp new opportunities.  Anaplan Is a Very Versatile Connected Planning Platform And Recognized By Our Customers As An Ideal Instrument To Meet Their Challenges It connects people, plans, and data across the enterprise The implementation is fast and affordable Its flexibility offers an almost unlimited range of functional options Vuealta is seeking a seasoned Account Executive who can help us professionalize and scale up our in- and outbound sales strategy, drive content-based sales activities, and help expand our already impressive client portfolio.  You will prospect, engage and win  You Will Need To Connect With Various Stakeholders, Understand Their Needs For Improving Business Efficiency And Effectiveness, Articulate The Vuealta Value Proposition, And Collaborate With Vuealta Experts To Win The Deals  As an Account Executive, your main objective is to prospect, engage targeted enterprises with a structured go-to-market approach, identify and qualify new business opportunities, and drive revenue that includes software and professional services. Develop a deep understanding of our customers challenges across all functions and value chain Develop a good understanding of Vuealta ’s services and value proposition Develop and execute strategic plans to expand our customer base and achieve sales targets Effectively communicate unique value proposition through proposals and presentations Build and maintain strong, long lasting customer relationships Own and hit/exceed annual sales target within assigned territories and/or accounts You will complement a young, diverse, and ambitious team, and contribute with creativity, versatility, and persistence.  Elements in your profile A positive and never-give-up attitude The desire to keep pushing yourself to attain greater achievements Ability to sell both software and professional services based on functional knowledge Strong technical aptitude to learn about Vuealta solution offerings Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills ≥ 4 years of experience in software solutions sales in enterprise accounts A good understanding of the sales cycle, from sales prospecting to closing a deal Vuealta offers you a fantastic team in a fast-paced environment An exciting, dynamic, and energetic working environment An entrepreneurial practice in which your contributions really make a difference Open and honest culture Extensive professional and personal growth through training and experience A steep learning curve with exposure to senior customer stakeholders Fast career progression in a variety of directions in a rapidly expanding organization Competitive compensation and benefits Flexible work schedule and location Located in the vibrant heart of the city, amidst customers and abundance of leisure If you think you are result-oriented, passionate in sales, and would like to work in a diverse team, you might just be the one we are looking for! We would be delighted to receive your application and meeting you.  You May Apply Directly Here Too  https://vuealta.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=46&source=aWQ9MTI%3D

description: About Datadog:  Datadog is the world-class monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. We’re dedicated to creating, developing, and supporting our product and customers, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Built by engineers, for engineers, our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stack. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.  The Team:  Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.  The Opportunity:  We are searching for an experienced Enterprise Sales Executive that has a real passion for technology and can deliver on bold revenue targets. As we continue to break into bigger deals, and formalize our support for the larger enterprise segment, this division within Datadog will blaze the path for the organization's growth. This is a lucrative opportunity to penetrate new accounts within a rich territory, as well as nurture others underway with their move to the cloud.  You Will: Prospect into large fortune 1000 companies while running an efficient sales process Maintain, build and own specific relationship maps for your territory including existing relationships and aspirational contacts Develop a deep comprehension of customer's business Negotiate favorable pricing and business terms with large commercial enterprises by selling value and ROI Handle existing customer expectations while expanding reach and depth into assigned territory Demonstrate resourcefulness when faced with challenges that defy easy solution Have intuitive sense of necessary steps to close business and gain customer validation Identify robust set of business drivers behind all opportunities Ensure high forecasting accuracy and consistency  You Are: Someone with 5+ years closing experience (mix of field selling within mid-market and enterprise) Driven and have met/exceeded direct sales goals of 1M+ and operated with an average deal size of $100k+ Able to demonstrate methodology to prospect and build pipeline on your own Experienced in working for an innovative tech company (SaaS, IT infrastructure or similar preferred) Experienced in selling into large fortune 1000 companies with the ability to win new logos Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 70% of the time  Bonus Points: Familiarity with the challenger sale or MEDDIC approach President’s Club, top rep, top percentile performer, consistent YoY overachievement Consistent deal sizes of $500k+  Why You Should Apply: President’s Club for top performers Continuous Sales training and career growth New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Generous and competitive global benefits Friendly and inclusive workplace culture  Equal Opportunity at Datadog:  Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.  Your Privacy:  Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

description: Job Summary: As an Inside Service Sales Representative in the NetApp's Sales function, you are responsible for supporting sales success by ensuring customers have the products, services, education and support to meet their technology and business needs. You will utilize your customer service and selling skills by building strong relationships with customers over the phone, selling solutions, and keeping them apprised of new product and service introductions. You will be also responsible for the customer installed base qualification and assigning the customer assets to the appropriate opportunity buckets based on the identified customer needs and ongoing projects. This includes maintaining the customer records and database clean-up activities. Essential Functions: The essential responsibilities of the Inside Service Sales Representatives are: - To work with the channel partners and/or directly with the customers over the telephone to detect, develop, and manage sales opportunities - First point of contact within the sales organization for the existing customers when they call NetApp with queries related to their installed base. - Upselling and Cross-selling to expand within the existing accounts through proactive outbound calling - Customer installed base qualification through identifying the customer need, and creating opportunities for:       - Technology Refresh       - Product Upgrades       - Service Upgrades       - Renewal Options - Identify proper entitlements, uplifts and technical education needs. - Work with field sales on complex orders - Prepare weekly activity and forecast reports.  Job Requirement: - Strong verbal and written communications skills including presentation skills. - Organized and able to follow department processes and work flow. - Ability to deal effectively with people and communicate clearly in a technical and non-technical way. - Ability to work collaboratively with employees within department and across functions. - Aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems. - Ability to convey information clearly and analyse it to help customer make buying decisions.  Responsibility and Interaction: Responsibility: - This individual will apply attained experiences and knowledge in solving routine to moderately complex problems. - Is responsible for the customer installed base management and keeping the database up to date within the assigned geographical territory Interaction: - This individual effectively works with internal personnel. - General direction is provided to them by their manager on routine work, and detailed direction is provided on new projects and assignments; as well as on-going review of activities and priorities - The ideal candidate contributes proactively to sales team efforts and positively influences decisions of the team.  Education & Experience: - 4- 5 years of sales or sales support experience is preferred. - A University degree is required. - Experience which demonstrates a strong level of expertise in technical specifications required to sell NetApp products and services is required. - Fluent English is a must - Foreign language skills would be an advantage

Day to day activities: End to end management of deal closing - sourcing (cold calling, etc), developing, negotiating and signing partnerships and contracts with notable global and regional brands (omnichannel retail) for GrabPay products Working with cross-functional teams (Integration, Operations, Marketing, Business teams) across the region on strategic projects and deliverables Managing and maintaining reporting for the sales pipeline through Salesforce and trackers Developing financial models to size and analyze key merchant opportunities and recommend sales offers and commercials Developing and fine-tuning sales tools and pitch decks with reference to competitor insights and industry best practices The must-haves: 5+ years experience in sales or business development role, B2B sales experience and demonstrated track record of closing notable accounts and outperforming sales targets Highly developed interpersonal skills with energy and a passion to succeed and outservice partners Comfortable working in a start-up environment, with ambiguity and evolving timelines and processes Existing network in notable e-commerce and retail accounts is a plus Strong communication and time management skills

By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers. About Notabene  Notabene is a Y Combinator-backed B2B software company that helps cryptocurrency businesses comply with financial regulations.  We bring a trusted data layer to blockchain transactions. Businesses use our software to manage counterparty risk and deliver a best-in-class payment experience to their customers.  We are a key enabler of the crypto ecosystem. Notabene helps crypto businesses grow faster by removing regulatory complexity and adding transparency and ease to their transaction flows.  We’re at a very exciting moment in our Notabene journey. We are growing fast—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape the future rails of the crypto industry!  We’re a team of diverse talent who dream big and are passionate about bringing crypto to everyone. Ready to build with us? Since 2012, our team has led blockchain and identity projects and has a successful track record in building and scaling companies, including crypto exchanges. We are a fully distributed international team spanning 8 countries and 3 continents.  We're rapidly growing and looking for an experienced Business Development Lead to prospect, connect and close high-value clients. You will be responsible for sourcing new opportunities and driving the sales process from lead identification, outreach, and qualification to close. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to have a large impact on some of the most innovative fintechs and crypto companies today. You will operate in a fast-paced environment—regulations are evolving and market demand is sky-high for new financial products. You will be a trusted partner to crypto companies’ and fintechs’ compliance and business operations teams. You will work closely with the Notabene founders, solving challenging and urgent problems for our clients.  Responsibilities Manage the full sales life-cycle from beginning to end: generate leads and source contacts, qualify potential clients, demonstrate product and pitch various stakeholders, generate pricing proposals, negotiate terms and lead the contract process Define sales methodology for our target market segments Build & refine a repeatable sales process to help bring our product to market Collaborate with Marketing and Product teams to prepare sales enablement material Represent the customer’s voice by providing feedback to Notabene’s Product team and identifying common gaps that block opportunities or increase friction for our customers Skills and qualifications 5+ years experience in sales (quota track record) B2B tech sales experience selling to C/VP level buyers Great communication skills, fluency in both English and Mandarin Prior experience in fintech or crypto, a plus Strong customer-facing and relationship building skills Able to understand complex technical concepts and articulate them Excited about our mission Motivated and capable of building and managing a team (in due time) High energy, self-starter comfortable with ambiguity in entrepreneurial environments Comfortable working remote in a fully distributed team (our team is based in Chile, Spain, Brazil, New York and Switzerland) As we look to grow our team, what we really value is adding the right person and not just evaluating a group of skill sets. We are happy to hear your story and also to share ours. If you think that Notabene is the company for you and want to start the conversation, apply today. We can't wait to hear from you!  Notabene is proud to be an equal employment workplace and an affirmative action employer. By valuing inclusion and diversity of all forms, we strictly prohibit and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, citizenship, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.

description: Job Summary  SHI has a career advancing opportunity in our Singapore/Asia Pacific-Enterprise Sales Department as a Business Development Manager (BDM), supporting some of our largest existing US headquartered customers. The Business Development Manager will help manage existing clients and ensure they stay satisfied and positive. You will be expected to call on clients, often being required to make presentations on solutions and services that meet or predict their clients’ future needs.  The BDM will work to improve SHI’s market position and achieve financial growth. This person will help define long term strategic goals, build key customer relationships, identify new business opportunities, negotiate and close deals.  You will be expected to build a thorough knowledge of the market, the solutions we can provide and of the competition. This will be an office based sales position, based in the Singapore office, requiring occasional travel but could develop into a field based role.  About Us  Established for over 30 years, SHI has continued to grow from once a small software only reseller to a global industry leading IT solutions provider. With our organic growth and stability within the global market, we are able to provide a variety of technology products, solutions and services to businesses including Cloud Computing, Data Centre Infrastructure, Networking and Security solutions, Configuration and Integration services, Enterprise Mobility and IT Asset Management.  With the support from our International partners and colleagues, we offer the opportunity to progress and develop a career within the IT Industry while working in a diverse and fun environment. From sales, technical and support personnel, SHI offers positions ranging from entry-level to seasoned experts.  SHI provides innovative solutions and world-class support from over 30 offices throughout the U.S., the U.K., Republic of Ireland, Canada, France, Hong Kong and Singapore.  Including But Not Limited To  Responsibilities Identify key decision makers within the client organization. Research and build relationships with new Line of Business owners. Being knowledgeable in the IT practices of End User Computing, Data Center and Security Work with internal resources to develop proposals that meets the client’s needs, concerns, and objectives. Participate in pricing the solution/service. Effectively position and present SHI’s portfolio of value added offerings Must work in a team environment and facilitate direction to Solution Architects, Product Specialists and Inside Sales Responsible for driving the sales process including identifying new business opportunities, qualifying, forecasting and decision making criteria Increase overall customer profitability in line with annual GM goals. Presenting SHI’s local and international capabilities to key personnel. Prepare and deliver Quarterly Business Reviews with all customers. Demonstrates leadership to ensure that SHI’s recommended enterprise solutions are comprehensive, achieve customer expectations and meet customer business needs and planning. Other General Roles Assessment of marketing opportunities and target markets Account planning and performance monitoring Sales Pipeline creation and management through CRM. Complete and maintain customer IT Profiles in CRM. Manage all CRM opportunities to ensure deals are closed out as Won or Lost. Participate in internal/external training sessions when required. Account retention and penetrating multiple lines of business in existing accounts Develop and execute strategy set by SHI Global Account Manager. University Degree or equivalent. Required Skills Successful inside or outside sales experience or related experience, with a documented history of New Business Development Self-starter with excellent time management, planning, and organization skills Has a Motivation for Sales/New Business Prospecting skills Understands the Customer Needs Process Strong organizational and planning skills Strong written and presentation skills Preferred Skills Working knowledge of major OEM Hardware and Services Programs is desirable (HP, Dell, Lenovo, Apple, Cisco, etc.) Working knowledge of major Software License Programs is desirable (Microsoft, IBM, Adobe, Symantec, etc.) Good command of both spoken and written English (Knowledge of Japanese / Korean / Asian Languages will be an advantage) Knowledge of / familiarity with IBM as a customer is a plus Additional Information Business working hours are Monday to Friday, 09:00 to 18:00 with a 1 hour lunch break. description: Our job is to be bold at work.  It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role  The Account Executive has an assigned quota that requires generating and closing new business within the assigned territory. He/she works to develop and execute a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, this person will collaborate with an account manager to ensure the successful transition of all new business bookings  Job Description Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list Once closed, keep the relationship with these accounts and develop them further Develop and close business by developing interest from IT and marketing enterprises that currently are not Forrester clients. Sell to VP level and above within the prospect’s IT and marketing organizations. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Understand the changing business and technology issues and needs that our potential clients face. Work with research teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes. Job Requirements A proven track record of prospecting and selling to $1B+ companies. Proven experience in developing new business, achieving revenue goals, and managing personal sales strategies. Seven or more years of proven experience in successful sales to C-level executives. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. Effective organization and time management skills. A team player. A high level of business acumen. The ability to travel. A bachelor’s degree. Explore #ForresterLife on:  YouTube  Twitter  Facebook  Instagram  LinkedIn  Glassdoor  Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment.  Data Protection  The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities.  By Submitting Your Resume/CV, You Consent To Forrester’s Retention Of The Information Provided On a Secure File For Personnel Administration And Management Purposes And/or In Order To Consider You For Future Employment Opportunities And To The Transfer Of The Information Provided To  Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.

jobTitle: Sales Operations Lead, Sales Efficiency - Singapore
description: The role: Sales Operations Lead, Sales Efficiency - Singapore  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  Additional Role Description  The APAC Sales Efficiency team is focused on empowering the work of Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams through the improvement of capabilities, excellence and support teams utilization. In close partnership with other teams (Product, Global Business Operations, gCare, Subregion/Country) we aim to streamline the complexity of the sales landscape.  As an APAC Sales Operations Lead, you will be a member of a small team and be responsible for the deployment and activation of different projects related to Sales capabilities and Sales efficiency for APAC LCS teams.  With deep knowledge of business analysis, sales processes, customer planning and opportunity management, you will engage with key Country Go-to-Market (GTM), Global Strategy and Operations, Media Operations and Leadership to drive large scale sales efficiency initiatives across APAC. You have a passion for change management, optimizing processes, and helping shape an exceptional sales organization.  Responsibilities Set and drive the operating rhythm for LCS Sales excellence. Prepare timely reviews and in-depth information at APAC Executive reviews for Operational Metrics, and give actionable information. Partner with the Global Strategy team to cascade Business Operations initiatives, as well as represent APAC’s point of view in Global Executive reviews. Partner with Country teams to ensure alignment with Regional and Global initiatives, scale best practices, and activate desired seller behavior. Act as regional point of contact on day-to-day sales processes. Develop and scale tools, reports, and materials to empower LCS sellers (e.g. playbooks and dashboards). Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 4 years of experience in analysis and sales operations Preferred Qualifications Experience working in Sales Experience with learning systems and tools, and driving or designing improvements Ability to speak to both technical and business stakeholders at all levels of the organization Ability to articulate business needs and derive insights from large data sets Basic/intermediate SQL skills. Excellent presentation, communication, problem solving, analysis, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills Passion for continuous optimization or process re-engineering

description: IDC's Enterprise Financial Sales team is seeking a Business Development Manager who will focus on selling IDC’s research products and custom solutions to AP Financial Services companies in the asset management industry including hedge funds, mutual funds, and other investment firms.  Duties & Responsibilites  As a member of a global collaborative sales team, the Business Development Manager AP FSI will be responsible for developing an in-depth knowledge of IDC products and services, as well as building strong relationships with individuals across IDC. The Business Development Manager will work with global sales colleagues and will be responsible for learning and articulating the value proposition IDC brings to the global financial community. The individual will prospect for new business opportunities, follow up on proposal generation, respond to client requests for information and/or problems, and continue to enhance the IDC brand.  This position will be responsible for selling new business into the hedge fund, mutual fund, and buy side investment firms. Annual net new business sales target is $500K per year (approximately 7-10 new clients). The Business Development Manager will primarily sell Tech Investor products, but would be able to sell all IDC products and services if appropriate.  Essential Skills & Experience  Requirements for the position include 3-5 years of demonstrated sales success, along with strong written, analytical, and verbal communication skills. The ideal candidate will possess an outstanding interpersonal skill set and passion for developing new business revenue and developing high level relationships. Additionally, this person will be entrepreneurial, motivated, assertive, and collaborative, as well as be a self-starter and a quick-thinker. This position requires strong time management and organization skills. Prior market research industry sales experience and knowledge of the financial services investment ecosystem is highly desirable. MBA is helpful but not required.

Introduction PetroEdge and PowerEdge are leading energy industry training specialists in the Asia Pacific region. Since inception in 2007, we have provided targeted and in-depth training courses to develop the competency and capabilities of engineers, scientists, technicians and related professionals in leading energy companies across the region. In our commitment to create sustainable skills development, we facilitate cost-effective skills transfer opportunities through world-class training courses with leading experts.  To learn more about us, visit http://www.petroedgeasia.net or https://www.poweredgeasia.com/  We are currently recruiting Corporate Sales Executives - Training and Education for our Asia Pacific markets division. The role will involve acquiring company sponsored participants to attend or purchase a wide range of technical and management courses. The candidate for this role need not have prior experience in the energy industry, and will be provided with intensive hands-on training about the industry and how to secure client participation for our portfolio of training courses.  This position offers great learning opportunities for experienced sales and business development professionals from the training, skills development or conference industry. Successful candidates will have strong earning opportunities and career advancement. If you have experience in selling training from other industries, it will be an added advantage.  Work Location: Singapore  Total annual package circa S$40,000 to S$50,000 per annum   JOB SCOPE To identify opportunities and sell training courses & solutions to local and regional energy companies through telephone and video conference To ensure proper record of call logs, sales leads and invoices are maintained through-out each sales campaign in the CRM To promptly chase payment from clients and ensure courses are cleared of receivables within each quarter. To work closely with your team leader and team mates in ensuring the sales processes are executed and adhere to at all times.   REQUIREMENTS At least 1 year related working experience in phone-based sales or inside sales career will be an added advantage Confident and strong communication skills, both written and on the phone Ambitious, motivated, action-oriented and committed to achieving goals set Able to work independently as well as be a strong team player Position available for Singaporeans or PR only Able to start work immediately   BENEFITS Birthday paid leave, outpatient medical benefits, company hospitalization plan, sales training and mentoring   We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified

About The Role We are looking for a talented and competitive Inside Sales Representative (ISR) that excels in a fast-paced environment. If you are passionate about the products you are selling and you get a kick out of closing a sale, then this is the role for you.  The ISR will make outbound calls to potential clients who have expressed interest in learning more about Megaport or appear to be strong potential customers based upon our general market focus. The ISR qualifies prospective customers through targeted questions about their business strategy then leveraging this information to align and sell Megaport’s product offerings. This position spends roughly 80% of the time on the phone prospecting new clients. Inside Sales Representatives will receive hands-on training with an emphasis on strategic selling and a focus on researching targeted accounts. This position is a great way for individuals to gain in depth experience in a rapidly growing SaaS company. This position reports to the Head of Direct Sales, APAC.  About Megaport Megaport has transformed the way IT gets connected. We're global leaders in Network as a Service (NaaS), changing the way businesses reach the cloud. We're also a leading partner to Amazon, Microsoft, Google, IBM, Oracle, NYSE, and many other leading technology companies. Megaport is a publicly traded company on the Australian Stock Exchange with a market cap exceeding $2 Billion. We’re a lean, high-achieving team made up of over 230 members globally. While the company is headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, employees are spread out across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. Staff enjoy an environment that is collaborative, supportive, and fun.  Our Team Culture Join a team of globally-positioned industry experts that lead by example. We do not compromise our values for commercial gain; we are all custodians of our culture, and the customer is at the centre of everything we do. Our employees are motivated, adaptable, persistent, hard-working, and dynamic. Our culture permeates everything we do and this, in turn with a global vision, forms a commitment to each other, our customers, and shareholders alike.  What You'll Be Doing Contacting new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound calls or emails. Work to understand customer needs and requirements, and act on those with the Megaport services proposition. Route qualified opportunities to the appropriate Sales Directors or Solutions Architects for further development and closure. Develop new customer relationships from market demand and the Megaport services portfolio. Drive new sales and achieve weekly, monthly and quarterly quotas. Research accounts, identify key prospects and generate interest in Megaport. Maintain and expand your database of prospects within your assigned territory or vertical market. Team up with partners to build pipeline, work over use cases as they apply to their customers and drive sales into that partner base. Be aware of competitors, rivals and other options that customers may deploy instead of Megaport.  What We Are Looking For Proven sales experience (2+ years) Have an understanding of Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Cloud computing industries Innovative, commercially focused and collaborative approach Additional languages including Japanese, Mandarin and Cantonese a plus Understanding of enterprise IT systems and technology Track record of over-achieving quota with a winning mentality Professional phone presence and experience high volume customer calling per day Proficient with corporate productivity and web presentation tools Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Active listening and engaging presentation skills Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively  What We Offer Flexible working environments Birthday Leave Generous study and training allowance + development opportunities + 5 days paid study leave Creative, fun, and contemporary workspaces Motivated team of industry experts and new talent Celebrated success with ‘Legend’ and ‘Kudos’ Awards Health and wellness program Opportunities for career growth and potential for global intra-company transfers for interested candidates  All applications will be treated in confidence. Please see Part 2 of our Privacy Policy to see what information Megaport collects from job applicants, why, and how we store and use it. Note that you’re entitled to know what personal data of yours Megaport holds, to request updates, rectification, and in some circumstances restriction or deletion thereof if you object (you being entitled to withdraw your consent to our holding your information at any time). Please see Part 5 of our Privacy Policy for more details on this and how to contact Megaport's data protection officer if you have any further privacy-related questions. Candidates who meet the selection criteria will be invited to attend an interview Strictly no Recruitment Agencies please. #LI-REMOTE

jobTitle: IKEA Tampines - Customer Relations Team Leader (Easy Buying)
description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the Manager in Easy Buying Section of Customer Relations Department, you will work with your team of co-workers to value add and provide a positive customer relations experience for our IKEA customers.  Your assignment You will lead a team of co-workers for attending to customer’ enquiries over the counter and via email/phone on after sales matters. You will be responsible to plan the team work schedule and to support the team members in serving the customers with GST (Greet, Smile, Thank) in mind. You will work with your manager and your team to identify the root cause and to resolve customer complaint, orders fulfilments, delivery issues etc of recurring problems by providing solutions. To prioritise and organise work and the work of others in order to make the most efficient use of time availability. You will also need to provide training to co-workers on customer handling and the usage of the Navision system, and take on case/complaint escalation when arises. You will support the department to ensure a safe working environment and compliance to work place processes and policies for functional review and sec check compliance You will provide coaching and training to new co-workers and support them in their growth and development You will work closely with HR on co-workers performance issues. Qualifications  Your profile You possess at least 5 years of experience in a supervisory position in a fast paced and dynamic customer-service oriented environment. You are a fast learner and have strong proficient in the use of computer software and office applications. You are self-motivated and results driven and able to multi-tasked and work under pressure. You have a warm personality and excellent communication skills and able stay calm and provide solutions to customer’s problems. You have a genuine interest in people and passion for home furnishing. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to share your knowledge with other co-workers and create an environment where the IKEA values are a strong and living reality that embraces the diversity of co-workers and visitors Additional Information  Please apply by 31 October 2021
industries: Retail, Furniture, and Consumer Goods

description: Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources.  Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform.  Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. For generations to come.  Visit us at hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow  The Role  Who Are We Looking For  We are looking for a Business Development Lead with at least 8 years experience in enterprise B2B solutioning sales and has a proven track record with managing at least $2 million sales quota per year. You are equipped to answer client technical queries and can identify new business opportunities independently. The individual should be resourceful and self-reliant. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are required for the job. The ideal Business Development Lead is also a tech-savvy professional, able to explain technical details and requirements to a non-technical audience. You should feel comfortable and aspire to be a hunter NOT a farmer.  Your Current Mood  You have spent the past years in a slow and bureaucratic workplace. You find it stifling and you are starting to feel that you can contribute more. You want to make an impact at work and make a dent in the universe. You want to be in a dynamic, fun, and energetic environment. You feel that you have talents in abundance but they are not recognised. You want to step up to the plate now. You want to bat for home runs.  What You Will Be Doing  As part of the Business Development team, you will be a key driving force behind the fastest-growing tech startup in the construction industry. Work closely with the CEO and be put in charge of your own projects. At Hubble, we aim to revolutionise the entire construction industry and you will be at the very front lines of this expansion as you identify strategic areas for growth and create new opportunities.  Responsibilities Work closely with our clients, proposing innovative solutions to improve their operations and empower data-driven management decisions through strategic use of technology Take charge of client acquisition and create new business opportunities to maintain the company’s relevance and competitive edge Manage a team of BD Managers Further Hubble’s growth by exploring potential prospects, pursuing new leads, and taking charge of deal-making, repeat-sales and partnerships Conduct market share analysis to develop revenue growth strategies Develop a comprehensive understanding of client pain points and communicate user requirements to improve our product offerings Collaborate with the engineering team to define product scopes and deliver game-changing products Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction and gather user feedback to inform product development Conduct market research to better understand the industry and client operations Contribute to defining and establishing Hubble as a leading regional company Be a trusted and knowledgeable advisor for customers' C-Suite, IT and business leadership Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships with key partners and executive sponsors Manage and solve conflicts affecting the account by coordinating, facilitating and operating across internal/external cross-functional partners and relationships Ideal Profile  What We Need From You At least 8 years of experience in enterprise B2B sales and have demonstrated ability to navigate complex multiple stakeholder deal environment Bachelor's degree with good academic results preferred Ability to generate leads and identify strategic areas for growth Independent, focused and driven Excellent written and communication skills Excellent at developing proposal and presentation slide Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to take the initiative to forward team goals Enjoy solving complex problems with technology Strong business acumen, team player, results-oriented What's on Offer? A role that offers a breadth of learning opportunities Leadership Role Attractive Salary & Benefits

description: The Business Development function is responsible for generating new business and developing new client relationships and, along with the Marketing team, is driving our efforts to cement our position as a global brand and a leader in the legal technology space.  The Role  The focus of this commercial role is to help us drive the adoption of our technology across APAC, promoting and embedding its use within the field of Disputes.  You will be responsible for helping the business conceive and execute pro-active business development strategies, and regularly lead client meetings / presentations to lawyers, judges and arbitrators. The ideal candidate will be a high-performing, passionate individual invested in helping us achieve our ambitious growth plans. The role offers an exceptional long-term opportunity to join our expanding APAC team at an early stage of its growth cycle.  Duties And Responsibilities Build a deep understanding of Opus 2's offering in order to be able to lead commercial negotiations with clients. Lead client presentations and confidently articulate the value proposition to prospective and existing clients including law firms, barristers, and arbitrators. Understanding the LegalTech market and our competitors, as well as the drivers and challenges for our clients and the buying and decision-making process within law firms, so that you can optimise conversations from initial outreach. Using a consultative approach to help drive pre and post sales engagements. Demonstrating business acumen and strategic thinking to maximise commercial success of the APAC team and develop effective strategies to drive company growth. Assisting the Marketing team with the development of key messaging and relevant collateral, participating in events as required. Collaborating with the wider Business Development team to drive the achievement of our goals and reputation that differentiates Opus 2 from Its competitors.  Requirements Experience working in a law firm or knowledge of the arbitration and litigation process is preferable but not essential. You are versatile and can thrive in broad and varied commercial role. You have strong verbal and written communication skills and are confident presenting to clients, and delivering impactful, tailored demonstrations. You are outgoing and take advantage of opportunities to network with prospects and clients. You are a quick learner who can grasp the Opus 2 solutions and client use cases. You are a team player, not afraid to roll up your sleeves to drive the execution of tasks.  Hours Full time, 9.00am - 6.00pm Work outside of these hours may be required for attending networking events, delivering presentations / webinars and other duties.  Benefits  Working at Opus 2  We are creating game-changing technology to empower lawyers in the digital future, working closely with the top firms worldwide – 49 out of 50 of the world’s largest law firms are using Opus 2.  Our achievements are underpinned by our unique culture and our people are our biggest asset. Working at Opus 2, you’ll receive: Performance related bonus. 22 days annual holidays and flexible working. Healthcare Insurance. Dental Insurance. Additional Childcare Leave. Accessible and modern office spaces. Regular company social events.

description: Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.  People are our driving strength of the company’s success, which is rooted in the expertise, passion and dedication of our people. This is motivated by the desire to deliver excellence in customer service and product innovation.  The Opportunity  Negotiate and persuade with tact to secure sales of new passenger cars, in-house finance and insurance. Be a master in product & pricing knowledge and stay on top of the latest trends in the automotive scene. Displays a high degree of integrity when handling customer's queries. Maintains accurate documentation during contract signing and follows proper procedures when registering new vehicles. To be willing to "walk that extra mile" by making valuable contributions to improve the customers experience within possible and legal means.  Requirements  You should possess tertiary qualification with at least 2 years’ working experience and a valid Class 3 driving licence. Experience in the airline, retail sales or service industry will be an added advantage. Graduates who desire to build a professional sales career are welcomed to apply. About the Company A member of the Jardine Cycle & Carriage Group, C&C is one of the leading automotive groups in Singapore. We started out in 1899 as a trader in nutmegs and other sundries. In more than 100 years since, we have grown to become a major player in the automotive industry in Singapore, retailing Mercedes-Benz, Mitsubishi, Kia and Citroën passenger cars and commercial vehicles. At Cycle & Carriage, it is more than just the recognition we have earned as being the leader in its class. "Exceptional Journeys" encapsulates our passion for our existence. Bringing together high-performing team members and technical excellence to create people-focused experiences that consistently exceed expectations. Whether it is a customer we serve, an employee that we engage, a brand that we carry, we want to support them in creating exceptional journeys for themselves.   We have a constant mission to strive towards being an Employer of Choice in the countries we operate in. Some of our better performing countries have consistently being recognised for commendable people practices such as:  • HR Asia’s Best Companies to Work for 5 consecutive years in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019; • Finalist in HR Excellence Awards 2016 for Recruitment and Leadership Development; • Winner of Innovative Talent Acquisition Strategy Award in the Annual Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2016 • Winner of Excellence In Innovative Use of HR Technology in HR Excellence Awards 2017 • Merit for Singapore Health Award as awarded by Health Promotion Board • Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2017, where we clinched the Best Employer Brand, Best Work-Life Balance and Best HR Team Awards. • Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2018 for Excellence in Employee Transformation • Bronze Award in HR Excellence Award 2019 for Excellence in HR Innovation   The emphasis on employee experience has been on the forefront of the C&C’s people practices. Keen for a career conversation? Connect with us to find out more.   (You would be notified if you are shortlisted. By submitting your application, you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data contained in this document by Jardine Cycle & Carriage Limited and its subsidiaries and affiliates, for assessing your career application).

Osome is an international fintech startup with the mission to to help business owners spend less time on routine admin and more time on managing their businesses. We use machine learning (AI) and complex algorithms to automate accounting, tax, company formation, and other tasks.  With Singapore as the headquarter, Osome has expanded to Malaysia, Hong Kong, United Kingdom with a total staff strength of more than 200 employees servicing more than 6000 clients.  Here at Osome, we provide an inclusive and collaborative environment, offering a promising career plan for our employees. You can expect to be rewarded for your contribution. If you are a diligent team player, who is not afraid of challenges, willing to think out of the box and find creative ways to reach the shared goal, think no further!  Responsibilities  JOB DESCRIPTION Renewal and Cross Selling of Services Establish a trusted advisor relationship with new and existing clients to ensure adoption of Osome’s suite of services Address clients’ concerns in an appropriate and timely manner via our platform, over the phone, and face to face meetings Collaborate with cross functional teams to escalate any issues clients might be experiencing Updating of Clients details on the point of contact Identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities to ensure growth attainment Uphold excellent service standards, going above and beyond to ensure clients love us, stay with us and refer their friends to us. Help us to advance our technical lead by providing input into our software development process Any other ad-hoc responsibilities as required Requirements Recognized Diploma or Degree in relevant fields, but relevant work experiences would make up for the lack in qualifications Having basic corporate secretary and/or accounting background is a plus Self-motivated and proactive, and able to work meticulously under tight deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills; independent yet be able to contribute in a team; fun and comfortable over the phone and face to face Positive attitude and willing to continuously develop, learn and be result driven Experience in a client facing role and/or sales background are desired Benefits Join a hyper fast growing company Experience the most exciting growth phase of a start-up first-hand – we are on an exponential growth path and providing each individual opportunity to change the way we do things Be on the forefront of development when it comes to accounting best practices Work closely with out tech team to help shape the face of corporate services in the future. International environment Competitive salary & medical benefits To apply to OSOME, please send your CV, including potential start date and salary expectations
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Summary  ITIVITI provides business-critical software and services to financial institutions globally, including low-latency connectivity and routing infrastructures, direct market access to global and regional exchanges, multi-asset low-touch and high-touch order management and execution systems, risk management and middle office solutions, as well as proprietary trading and market-making solutions.  We serve around 2,000 clients worldwide, including top-tier trading firms, banks, brokers, exchanges and institutional investors alike, which all rely on our technology, solutions and expertise to streamline their daily operations, all while being able to comply with global regulations.  With 18 offices across all major financial centers, the merger of ITIVITI and ULLINK in March 2018 created a full-service technology and infrastructure provider, covering all asset classes, geographies, and regulatory landscapes. Our company was recently acquired by Broadridge Financial Solutions (NYSE: BR), a constituent of S&P 500, which will give our staff further opportunities for success and growth.  About The Role  Our APAC Sales Team is made of multicultural, highly experienced experts, working autonomously and spread across our Tokyo, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Sydney offices. We are looking for a Sales Executive to join our Singapore team, to manage and grow our ASEAN & South Asia business.  The successful Sales Executive is responsible for identifying, qualifying, and prospecting new business opportunities, as well as managing existing relationships with an eye for growing revenue by cross selling between our global regions or by up-selling in existing accounts. This role reports directly to the APAC Head of Sales.  Main Responsibilities Include Generating leads and building a healthy pipeline of potential clients through cold-calling & networking. Growing existing accounts of the firm by up-selling and cross-selling. Closing on key deals to ensure the firm reaches aggressive sales targets. Managing client enquiries and taking ownership of the sales process and administrative follow ups. Promoting the company’s brand through professional events and conferences. Reporting to regional and global management on sales, sales progress, local trends, requirements, and issues, in order to facilitate operations and strategic decisions. Our Ideal Candidate Will Have Past experience in selling financial software solutions. Specific experience in selling complex order management, risk, pricing, market making, connectivity or execution platforms to sell-side financial institutions would be a key strength. Good understanding of Equities, Derivatives, Warrants, ETFs, FX, and Fixed Income order execution workflows. Proven track record of closing high-value deals and multi-year, multi-entity contracts. Team player with proven sales, lead generation, and client management skills. Independent, assertive, and willing to go the extra mile. Proven skills to manage complex deals and report issues to other parties efficiently. Ability to engage C-level decision-makers, with outstanding presentation skills. Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written) - a must. Other/regional languages - a plus.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: We love finance!  As a leading provider of software and consulting services for financial performance management, we care about our customers and their financial results. With our solutions for digital accounting and controlling, we take the complexity out of finance and provide consulting based on our professional expertise. It’s a match! If you take team spirit, sustainable thinking and commitment to heart and are passionate about facing new challenges, we get along! Become a part of our team and help shape the future.   WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  You are driven, self-motivated, and like to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment. You are a critical thinker who is not afraid to execute your own ideas and provide valuable insights into business operations. You want to make a significant impact on the success of a fast-growing business through your direct participation and innovation.         You have several years of direct/channel sales experience in the field of financial software solutions, SaaS and/or EPM Solutions. You are comfortable working in a dynamic environment and interacting with senior level executives including CFOs and Financial Controllers. You are able to demonstrate relevant sales methodology to prospect and own a pipeline. You have a good knowledge in lead generation and sales development. You are experienced in working in a software solution tech company (ERP, B2B SaaS, Financial software solutions). You possess strong business and entrepreneurial skills. You have superior communication skills and presentation skills. You work independently and organized. You are fluent in English.   WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT  You will be working with a highly-motivated team of financial and technical professionals. Your knowledgeable colleagues will be guiding you on your way to become an expert in Financial Performance Management Solutions. We are growing fast and we want you to grow with us. You are responsible for running your pipeline. You maintain, build and own specific relationship maps for your territory including existing relationships and aspirational contacts. You develop a deep comprehension of customer's business needs. You demonstrate resourcefulness when faced with challenges. You have an intuitive sense to close deals and gain customer validation. You identify robust set of business drivers behind all opportunities. You will focus on the generation of new businesses for a growing regional team.   THESE BENEFITS ARE WAITING FOR YOU  Great staff events Flexible working hours Company Pension Sabbatical Health program Exclusive staff discounts   ARE YOU INTERESTED?  Then we look forward to receiving your application online stating your desired starting date and salary expectations. Please note that we cannot accept applications by mail. We will not discriminate against any job applicant on the bases of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. If you have any questions, please contact our Career team at jobs@lucanet.com or by phone: +49 30 469 910-0 Click here to learn more about LucaNet as a workplace.

description: BCH ART is a healthcare service provider providing swab consultancy, swabbing and testing services for private companies and government agencies. Our area of focus will be for companies on RRT, Swab testing for public (Pre-departure Testing, Pre-event testing etc). We are looking for a high-performing Sales Executive to help us meet our customer acquisition and revenue growth targets. Your objective is to promote healthcare services and drive financial growth by identifying consumers’ needs and wants, cultivating trust, and provide solutions. You will also play a vital role in customizing and building products/services that consumers love by making sure that all our products/services are based on the users’ needs and wants and at the same time generating sales.  You’ll have excellent analytical skills and communication skills by taking a data driven and efficient and effective sales approach to everything you do. You will be analysing the customers' insights and provide useful feedback to the operations team and help to refine the product. You’re obsessive about understanding customer behaviour and finding new ways in improving user conversion and experience.  Key Responsibilities Prospecting new accounts, identifying opportunities, developing as well as maintaining existing accounts Attend to all sales enquiries and build good customer experience by giving professional advice on products/services and benefits to meet customers' needs Actively respond to inbound emails and messaging Follow up on leads in timely manner Provide on-site client support as necessary Assist in refining the company’s sales strategy and processes including quotations Handle other sales-related administrative duties Assist in any other related duties assigned by immediate supervisor

We offer customers a lightning fast and convenient way to book delivery and moving services whether they are at their home, at work or on the go. People talk about O2O, we live it.  We are now operating in Asia and LATAM our aspirations don’t stop there as our model has the ability to transform how goods moved in any city worldwide. Backed by a team of experienced entrepreneurs, Lalamove offers a great place to add real value because you get real ownership of what you do. Come work with energetic, dynamic individuals, and play a critical role in disrupting the entire logistics market in a cutting-edge tech company. Are you highly motivated and strives to exceed your goals? Join the team at Lalamove Singapore and experience first-hand, the thrill of disrupting the logistics industry. Think you are up for it? Apply now!  Main Responsibilities Sales and lead sourcing: acquire aggressively and onboard corporate users by maintaining a healthy pipeline of leads, and to ensure weekly sales targets are achieved Negotiation and closing of deals: Lead contract negotiations to establish a strong working relationship with our local partners, and to ensure economic sustainability and mutual growth of the partnership Sales operations: ensure Standard Operating Procedures and Policies are implemented in a timely and accurate manner Brand ambassador: become the face of Lalamove when engaging local partners to promote our services and values What We Seek Curious and creative thinkers who are capable of thinking beyond the role and committed to self-improvement Charming personality to build and maintain professional relationships Strong sales skills to get our potential client to use our service. Remain knowledgeable on products offered and discuss available options Can-do attitude and grit to make things happen, to identify and leverage new opportunities What You'll Need Relevant sales working experience (Startup/logistics industry is a plus) Knowledge and understanding of mobile and web technologies Fearless attitude; curious mind and a hunter mentality Sound business acumen and analyzing data to make the best sales strategies

description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  Key Roles & Responsibilities Drives account sales Maintains a superior level of current clinical knowledge Demonstrates expertise in the BMS selling model to deliver persuasive messaging Probes customers to gain clinical insights Uncovers account and territory influence networks and decision drivers to efficiently and effectively deliver behavior change across the account and overcome access barriers with hard to reach customers Ensures account interactions are well coordinated across functions Maintains and expands patient access in key accounts Understands the patient types and affordability dynamics as well as hospital, government, competitor, and third party patient support schemes Develops account level strategic access and pricing proposals and supports them with sound insights and analysis Masters account and territory stakeholder and influence networks to be able to implement relevant pricing/access programs in partnership with customers at the account level Develops and executes business plans Utilizes market, customer, and competitor insights to formulate territory and account plans Delivers account strategy, tactics, and investment proposals that will drive patient access, access to customers, and delivery of the sales targets Ensures cross-functional input and alignment in the development of plans Applies customer mapping and process analysis to identify key decision-makers, influencers, stakeholders, and patient and funding flows within defined accounts Applies detailed mapping and analysis to understand customer networks, interactions and decision-making processes within and across accounts Develops account tactics to deliver on business plan objective Continually develops awareness of healthcare industry dynamics, trends, competitors and customers Ensures business objectives are met in full compliance with laws, regulations and BMS standards of Business Conduct and Ethics Position Requirements Undergraduate (studies in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, Medical or related discipline is a plus) or higher degrees Min. 3 years of Pharmaceutical Sales experience (or key account management experience) Experience and relationships with key accounts in the relevant therapeutic area are desirable Experience in marketing is a plus Strong track record in sales and key account management Proven high level of clinical disease and therapeutic area competence Demonstrates ability to clearly convey clinical knowledge and persuasive messages to customers Ability to create a business plan and a compelling case for investment Knowledge of the National Healthcare System and the pharmaceutical industry in Singapore Ability to implement innovative partnership with complex accounts. Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
