description: Are you a dynamic and results-driven key account manager, looking to be part of our mission to bring #PositiveFood to the world? We are looking for a Regional Key Account Manager (Food Services) to grow and develop our presence in the region through building strong customer relationships and bringing forth creative food innovation to the industry.  Savencia Fromage & Dairy is a France-based company that is primarily engaged in the production of cheese and other dairy products. The Company produces a range of dairy products, such as cheese, butter and cream, for the retail market and food service professionals.  Your Mission: Lead the Southern Asia regional food service business development strategy to grow Savencia’s footprint and sales in the region; Grow and manage key accounts in the QSR (Fast food), Bakery/Pastry (BAPA) and related food service channels.  Your Team: You will report to the Managing Director, Southeast Asia and Oceania and be part of a multi-functional regional office based in Singapore.  Your Responsibilities Responsible for product portfolio applicable to global/regional QSR and BAPA/Café account business in the Southern Asia region sales, working in conjunction with the local Food Service team(s). Locate and propose potential business deals by contacting potential partners as well as discovering and exploring opportunities. Maintain responsibility for full sales cycle, from opportunity identification through to negotiation and close of sale, with a heavy focus on prospecting and conducting ideation sessions. Sales nature will be consultative mainly, including solutioning employing Company’s know-how and resources in the sector. Apply Key Account management principles and methodology, including extensions of Global Key Accounts present in the region. Build network and relationship to establish Savencia as a key Supplier in regional/local Key Account offices. Ensure that sales, revenue and profitability objectives are met and/or exceeded through working with Customer’s regional offices and local offices. Negotiate and execute contracts to establish customers, new and existing. Assess value and contribution of existing partnerships and make changes when necessary. Partner with stakeholders to identify, establish and roll out revenue generating applications/solutions for clients. Share market feedback to product marketing management and sales leadership. Manage revenue results and progress to forecast for the Southern Asia region. Our Ideal Profile And Role Requirements Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communication, business, sciences or equivalent. 10+ years of sales or business management experience in the food industry. Consultative selling experience required. Experience in QSR/BAPA products/market. Strong interpersonal skills and sales skills including closing skills, motivation for sales, prospecting, planning, selling to customer needs Prior experience in developing new accounts with new products Prior experience and networks within Southern Asia / Southeast Asia would be an advantage Professional and positive approach, self-motivated, strong in building relationships, team player, dynamic, creative with the ability to work on own initiative. Excellent Interpersonal skills as well as strong oral and written communication skills. Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills What opportunities can we offer to you?  With close to 20 000 employees worldwide, Savencia Fromage & Dairy produces and distributes dairy ingredients & finished dairy products in 120 countries. A leader in cheese specialties, high value-added dairy ingredients, and Food service solutions, SAVENCIA Fromage & Dairy is among the world’s leading milk processors.  The culture of the company stands for an open, empowering and entrepreneurial culture. You will have the opportunity to be part of an innovative and creative environment, where you will be encouraged to develop your entrepreneurial and pioneering spirit.You will be exposed to career growth opportunities as well as mobility opportunities across countries and within the group brands.
industries: Food & Beverages, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Consumer Goods

description: The Company: Preqin is an award-winning, independent, research company providing data and intelligence to the financial industry. Investment professionals use Preqin’s online products to obtain key information for business-critical decision-making. Preqin’s clients include fund managers, legal firms, institutional investors, financial advisors and placement agents.  Primarily a data company; Preqin is also a fast-moving fintech with a strong growth record and a world-wide staff base. Owned by our founder, directors and employee shareholders, we care passionately about our customers, brand and the employees that make it all happen.  Role Overview: A fantastic opportunity has arisen at a global financial data provider for a Client Services Executive in our Singapore office. We are seeking an analytical and organised individual with knowledge of the financial markets, client-facing experience and proficiency in Microsoft Office. We would also consider a Graduate with the ability to learn and grow within the role.  We are continuing to invest in our customer-oriented strategy and this role will report to the Head of Client Services, and the position is an important part of implementing Preqin’s client-focused approach.  This is an excellent opportunity to develop your career in a client-facing role within a fast-growing sector.   Roles and Responsibilities: Pro-actively contacting clients via Phone/Email to ensure usage/understanding of platform Responding to incoming client requests, often involving liaising internally with research and sales teams Responding to client queries in real-time via LiveChat Advising clients on how to obtain the relevant data/information from the Preqin platform Training/developing client knowledge of the Preqin platform which includes attending client meetings where needed Working to support/promote sales and marketing initiatives Act as an internal and external consultant to provide solution on data related issues  Key Requirements for this Role: Excellent communication skills, with the confidence to make outbound calls and receive inbound calls, to build relationships with financial professionals and the ability to explain complex issues in a clear and simple way Excellent analytical/problem solving skills – ability to have a problem-solving approach to all incoming queries You can manage priorities and expectations for incoming requests and projects You will have ideally strong Microsoft Excel skills (proficiency in vlook ups, pivot tables, 'what if’ statements) but if not, must demonstrate aptitude and willingness to learn advanced Excel to help with client requests High level of attention to detail – accuracy and consistency is a key feature of client support You will be comfortable working to key performance indicator targets You should have some experience in customer or sales support/client relations or other client-facing role, as you will be liaising with key decision makers at financial institutions You will be confident communicating with sales and research teams, technical people, and managers You will need to be confident working with business applications. Ideally you will have Powerpoint experience and be able to quickly find your way around our bespoke CRM system You enjoy working with a friendly and intelligent group of peers as part of a team, balancing urgent tactical work, periodic operational needs, and our longer-term sales initiatives Knowledge of Salesforce, Power BI, Alteryx, VBA, & SQL is a plus  Company Benefits: A competitive starting salary A quarterly bonus scheme (performance-dependent) Conditional annual bonus Sponsorship to undertake professional training and/or industry qualifications such as CAIA and CFA Medical insurance Annual leave: 21 days  Covid-19 note During the COVID-19 pandemic, Preqin has closed its offices and moved staff to work from home. Our primary goals are to ensure the safety of our employees, and to keep providing our clients with the best-in-class support they have come to expect from us. However, we have not slowed our recruitment activity due to the outbreak, and have adopted a remote interviewing, onboarding and training process. Our growth plans have not stopped, and we anticipate onboarding a significant number of staff in the coming months.
industries: Venture Capital & Private Equity and Financial Services

description: Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.  foodpanda is the leading, on-demand food delivery company in Singapore, bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture.  We’re looking for a highly-driven and motivated Sales Operations Executive for our team in Singapore. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have a direct impact, then this may be the place for you! The ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor – comfortable working independently, whilst working closely with the management team.  About The Job  This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Sales Operation Manager. The successful candidate will excel managing salesforce governance role and projects related to salesforce. Focusing mainly on salesforce data governance, processes, mediator regarding salesforce and test launch new feature and provide training.  Responsibilities Customize Salesforce fields, page layouts, record types, searching, list views, queues, reports, and dashboards. Maintain overall system configuration, change control, and enhancements. Manage the instance with a view to ensure data integrity, security and perform basic audits. Assist in developing and maintaining documentation on processes, policies, application configuration, and help related materials. Manage day-to-day support request (adhoc by sales or am, finance check, report request) Manage operational requests and troubleshoot issues, working with diverse user groups and potentially with business leaders. Manage mass imports and exports of data. Assist in conducting training of business owners for new features and help with roll-out. Act as a point of contact for Salesforce users in the APAC region. Assist on day to day task : account cloning, quality check Able to learn and adapt fast on business tools : formstack, google form Mediator between various department : account manager, sales rep, finance, partner care (bpo) Understand the foundational of salesforce governance framework and propose new way to improve processes Requirements Min. 1-2 years of Salesforce experience in a mid/large company, ideally with a multi-national user / business base Understanding of Salesforce capabilities and limitations Salesforce ownership / rollout experience Analytical and process driven with a good eye for detail Proficiency in MS Office with strong Excel skills Analytical, number-oriented, attention to details and strong organisational skills Positive attitude with good communication skills Drive to constantly improve Salesforce knowledge. Independent and highly motivated fast learner What We Offer Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve Vibrant, dynamic & international workplace Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities Tasty Thursdays Birthday Leave Work Anniversar(ies) Leave Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company

description: Job Description  Easyship is revolutionizing logistics for eCommerce. With our all-in-one cloud based shipping software, businesses of all shapes and sizes have the tools needed to scale globally. At Easyship we believe in accelerating borderless commerce. We’re proud that a diversity of small business owners, crowdfunding campaigns, and global brands trust Easyship as their gateway to the world.  “We envision a frictionless economy where creators can use one platform to ship products to anyone, anywhere. When you grow, we grow.” Tommaso Tamburnotti, Co Founder.  Easyship is building tomorrow’s logistic infrastructure, today. Our team is continuously looking to reach new heights, whether it’s learning about new technologies or improving your own skillset, Easyship is prepared to empower you to grow. We believe that when we inspire each other, we grow together.  Easyship is recruiting brilliant, curious, and driven individuals to help us scale our innovative technology worldwide. Headquartered in New York with offices in London, Hong Kong, Singapore, Melbourne, Toronto, and Taipei – our team is global and growing. We encourage you to apply if a challenge excites you. If you enjoy the company of talented people. If you would dedicate yourself to a simple mission: to make shipping easy for everyone.  We operate with a global footprint, but we’re still tiny relative to the opportunity ahead, so there is still much to do. Join us and help put borderless commerce within reach of every entrepreneur.  Position Title: Sales Executive  Reports to: Head of Sales  Key Relationships: Sales Team, Customers, Marketing, Customer Service  Job Purpose: to discover and pursue new sales prospects and maintain customer satisfaction. The Sales Executive's goal is to meet and surpass the company’s expectations to drive rapid and sustainable growth.  Job Responsibilities Prospect and generate leads through our database of prospects and build a pipeline of new prospects utilizing sales tactics Close deals and convert visitors to users guiding negotiations until contracts are signed Be the industry expert in eCommerce for global and domestic logistics Analyze trends and results to continually improve your sales strategy Contribute to product development. Analyze customer feedback and collaborate with the tech and operation team to improve the product Collaborate with cross functional teams to identify new opportunities for company growth Meet (and exceed!) monthly KPIs that offer you generous, uncapped commissions Requirements  Skills & Personal Qualities: 3-5 years of sales experience selling SaaS products 2+ years of experience in eCommerce Enterprise sales experience is preferred Proven track record hitting and exceeding quotas (top 10% of company) Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets Highly organized with exceptional follow up skills Experience selling to C-suite and Founders Driven, self-motivated and organized HubSpot experience desired BA/BS degree Benefits Competitive compensation package Company Equity Gym & Wellness Reimbursement Generous Vacation Policy Duvet Day - Perfect for those cold winter days, when you don’t want to escape the warmth of your bed! Mental Health Day - You deserve a day off! A chance to recharge and enjoy ‘Me Time’. Flexible working approach Professional Development Unlimited Coffee, Drinks & Healthy Snacks Office PlayStation Games As we expand, the potential to work in one of our international offices Annual Summit in Hong Kong for you to collaborate with the team You will have the opportunity to work with a global team, filled with smart, ambitious and like minded colleagues. We have built an inclusive culture which supports and enables you to grow. Come and join the Easyship Family!

description: PSG is a global pump and dispensing solution expert and leading manufacturer of pumps, systems and related flow-control technology for the safe and efficient transfer of critical and valuable fluids and materials. Headquartered in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, USA, PSG is comprised of several world-class brands, including Abaque™, All-Flo, Almatec®, Blackmer®, Ebsray®, EnviroGear®, Griswold®, Hydro Systems, Mouvex®, Neptune™, Quattroflow™ and Wilden®. PSG products are manufactured on three continents, North America, Europe and Asia, in state-of-the-art facilities that practice lean manufacturing and are ISO-certified. PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of Dover Corporation. For additional information on PSG, please visit psgdover.com. PSG: Where Innovation Flows.  We are an organization on the move, always looking for talented and ambitious people with a desire to help us grow our business. We thrive on winning and being number one. PSG offers a unique combination of the both small company atmosphere: with an ownership mindset that allows you to make close-to-the-customer decisions; an innovative approach in seeing beyond what is possible today and entrepreneurial spirit in the pursuit of new opportunities; combined with benefits of a large company’s scale, tools, career planning and financial strength of Dover. Join PSG, a growing global company where your curiosity, hard work and ambition is rewarded with exceptional career opportunities in a friendly & fast paced environment. Welcome aboard!  PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer and solutions provider with annual revenue of approximately $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, consumable supplies, aftermarket parts, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of over 23,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible.  Our business is growing. Grow with us!  To develop and expand market coverage in the Asian semiconductor market with our Almatec brand we are looking for a  Business Development Manager (f/m/d) – Semicon, Asia  starting in September 2021, located in the Philippines or Singapore.  Your tasks: Develop and execute a strategy to leverage commercial, operational, and organizational opportunities to deliver revenue synergies. Drive revenue in the targeted market by identifying, acquiring, and managing new customers with focus on end-users, OEMs and other relevant semicon market participants. Collaborate with account managers on account specific challenges and sales strategies. Proactively understand the customer strategy and needs. Develop, establish, maintain, and manage relationships with key influential contacts of customers. Identify acquisition and product development opportunities within core and adjacent technologies. Interface with product managers, engineering, and sales to develop new products, create business cases, execute field trial plans, and product launches that are aligned with overall product life cycle strategies. Drive development of value-added customer materials and training. Train and accompany new partners in their way to market. Your profile: 4 year degree bachelors degree from accredited university. Prior customer interfacing responsibilities (ex. sales, business development, technical service etc.) with strong communication and presentation skills. Experience in selling the values of a premium product offering. History of achieving sales goals using a collaborative, cross-functional team. Deep knowledge of production technologies in general and of fluid handling systems in the Semicon market. Ideally personal professional experience in the regional Semicon market. Expert in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and experience with SharePoint. Willingness to travel 50%, mostly Asia, occasionally EMEA or USA. Fluent in English (written and oral). Sounds interesting? Please apply with complete documents (CV, references and cover letter) stating your availability and salary expectations via our Dover career portal: https://careers.dovercorporation.com/.  We are looking forward to getting to know you.  We will gladly answer questions in advance: kathrin.hensges@psgdover.com or 0049-(0)2065-89 205-33.  For data protection reasons, please do not send applications by e-mail.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.  This position may be located in: Cebu City || APAC : Philippines : Cebu City : Cebu City || APAC : Philippines : Makati City : Makati City || APAC : Singapore : Singapore : Singapore  Sub Division : Duisburg  Job Requisition ID : 38719

description: We are hiring  Sales Consultants (Leasing / Auto)  We are building our sales team and are looking for people who are interested in doing sales in the Business-to-Business landscape. There are few openings for this role. This Sales Professional would be involved in the sales of all Brand new and pre-owned vehicle sales for the company. He has to be a self-starter, independent and interested in relationship building. We are looking for a mix of Hunter and Farmer for this role. He must be a good team player, KPI driven and self-motivated to achieve our yearly target.  REQUIREMENT • Singaporean/ PR • Min. 2 years sales experience • Experience in the automotive/ business to business industry would be an advantage • Possess positive learning attitude & a good team player • Resilience, resourceful and goal-oriented • Good interpersonal and communication skills • Possess a strong interest in sales and highly motivated individual • Bilingual (Mandarin and English) • Min. Class 3 Driving license  Salary • $4,000 and more (Basic + Allowance + Commission)  Send us your resume at hr@skylink.com.sg

Lalamove is disrupting the logistics industry by connecting customers and drivers directly through our technology. We offer customers a lightning fast and convenient way to book delivery and moving services whether they are at their home, at work or on the go. People talk about O2O, we live it.  Onto our seventh year as a start-up, now operating in Asia, LATAM, and the United States, our aspirations don’t stop there as our model has the ability to transform how goods moved in any city worldwide. Backed by a team of experienced entrepreneurs, Lalamove offers a great place to add real value because you get real ownership of what you do. Come work with energetic, dynamic individuals, and play a critical role in disrupting the entire logistics market in a cutting-edge tech company. Are you highly motivated and strives to exceed your goals? Join the team at Lalamove Singapore and experience first-hand, the thrill of disrupting the logistics industry.  We are looking for a high-energy, charismatic Sales Associate who can work well under pressure and who exhibits a spirit of excellence to join one of the fastest growing intra-city delivery platforms in Asia.  Think you are up for it? Apply now!  Main Responsibilities Sales and lead sourcing: acquire aggressively and onboard corporate users by maintaining a healthy pipeline of leads, and to ensure weekly sales targets are achieved Negotiation and closing of deals: Lead contract negotiations to establish a strong working relationship with our local partners, and to ensure economic sustainability and mutual growth of the partnership Sales operations: ensure Standard Operating Procedures and Policies are implemented in a timely and accurate manner Brand ambassador: become the face of Lalamove when engaging local partners to promote our services and values  What We Seek Curious and creative thinkers who are capable of thinking beyond the role and committed to self-improvement Charming personality to build and maintain professional relationships Strong sales skills to get our potential client to use our service. Remain knowledgeable on products offered and discuss available options Can-do attitude and grit to make things happen, to identify and leverage new opportunities  What You'll Need Relevant sales working experience (Startup/logistics industry is a plus) Knowledge and understanding of mobile and web technologies Fearless attitude; curious mind and a hunter mentality Sound business acumen and analyzing data to make the best sales strategies

description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  Responsibilities Process Optimization: Evaluate current sales process and recommend improvements to the sales process to increase sales efficiency in shipper activation. Data Visualisation and Maintenance: Build customised dashboards and reports to relevant stakeholders for monitoring performance and monthly business reviews. Ensure dashboards are updated with the current operational processes. Analysis: Offer deep drive analysis to key stakeholders across all commercial teams for campaigns and promotions. Support: Work directly with Senior Management to formulate and drive key commercial strategic initiatives. Requirements Minimum degree in a relevant field preferred Excel proficient SQL proficient Capable in Stakeholders Management Displays capability for inductive reasoning Strong communication skills Knowledge in Salesforce will be a bonus Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

description: Working at Bitfury:  Bitfury is a leading emerging technologies company. At Bitfury, you can build the solutions of the future, with the most significant technologies of the millennium, in a modern and flexible workplace. We work a bit faster, and a bit smarter, so we can make the world a bit better.  Benefits of Working at Bitfury:  International Experiences & Global Impacts  Bitfury is an international company with 200+ team members in more than 16 countries. No matter your assignment, your work will support global technology initiatives and best-in-class security operations in North America, Asia and Europe, as well as help us fulfil our mission to make the world more trusted and secure.  Building the Future  We believe big data, artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, tokenized economies and cryptocurrencies are the future of our digital, global economy. Bitfury is building this future through our products that offer digitised security, asset management, government services and more. We consider ourselves first and foremost a technology company. We are a diversified organisation, with operations across multiple facets of the AI, blockchain, and digital currency sectors. If you are passionate about emerging technologies, you can build your future at Bitfury.  Accelerate Your Career  Bitfury is growing fast and looking for the next generation of leaders and entrepreneurs to help us. At Bitfury, you will be expected to create the future – not just execute it. If you are a self-starter, driven and collaborative team member, you can create a dynamic future for yourself and your career at Bitfury.  Modern Workplace with Intelligent Flexibility  Bitfury lets you work in the way you need to work to make your work faster, smarter and better. We will give you the resources you need to succeed – competitive pay and benefits, educational support, intellectual challenges, professional advancement, personal accommodations including remote work, and more. We pride ourselves on being less bureaucratic and a lot more impactful.  Start-up Culture with Established Results  Working with the world's leading experts and engineers, you will have the opportunity at Bitfury to pursue results that will power your success as well as lead to the adoption of game-changing technologies. Our teams work every day to make the impossible possible, to change the game, to be agile and effective, and most of all – to empower the rest of the world to do the same.  Personal and Professional Characteristics  We at Bitfury ensure our team members possess the ability to think out of the box and make the impossible possible. We are self-motivated and result-oriented, and we have an "owner of the company" mindset. We are constantly self-educating and developing. We are able to work in a team and collaborate. We have a "do good" mindset and are not afraid to dream big. And of course, we always deliver in time what we promised and with extreme attention to detail — because if we are not able to do the little things right, we will never be able to do big things right.  We are looking for an experienced Sales Executive to join our Crystal team.  https://crystalblockchain.com/  Duties and responsibilities Identify and develop new business opportunities in Korea Drive technical and commercial analysis and build business cases to support Crystal's initiatives Coordinate negotiations of technology & business agreements with ecosystem partners Identify and partner with national organisations to negotiate economic development agreements with various state and local governments and economic development agencies Evangelize Crystals solutions to key stakeholders at all levels and Identify and track relevant metrics of success for Crystal across Korea/APAC Build and execute the right strategic go-to-market programs, solutions development, field enablement and technical alignment Support in establishing product/project promotion strategies across Korea/APAC Explore, qualify structure, negotiate, and execute partnership programs and agreements Achieve KPIs set in line with revenue targets and opportunity progression Manage and support existing Crystal customers in region Opening, qualifying & closing sales opportunities mainly with large customers Looking for new customers as well as working with existing ones Developing a sales pipeline to support future sales & business planning Managing day to day personal sales process, coordinating account meetings & coordinating sales support resources with specific accounts Achieving quarterly & annual quota & pipeline development objectives Providing sales & executive management with account updates, sales forecasts, etc. Developing & maintaining contacts at assigned accounts  Requirements 5+ years of experience in business development management Knowledge and experience of Blockchain/Crypto Currencies Direct experience in SAAS/blockchain software solutions is a plus Strong ability to self-manage and be successful in an unstructured entrepreneurial environment Takes initiative and creative in approach to problem-solving, strong "can do" attitude Able to present and sell to C-level customers and partners Experienced in sales and business development of IT, software High degree of integrity, attention to detail, punctual; responsibility for all decisions Excellent oral communication, organizational and analytical skills Languages: English (upper intermediate), Korean(Oral and Written) Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, MBA or Master's Degree in IT or technical field a plus

description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  You are responsible to handle all inbound calls to our SME Sales Hotline.  Processes and Operation Provide proactive feedback and recommendations to supervisor and Marketing on any possible improvement areas in sales, internal processes and customer experience. Provide updates on sales performance to supervisor on daily and weekly basis. Submit sales orders via in-house systems, such as Spear. Involve in internal follow-through to ensure sales orders are completed till the services are delivered. Comply to our Singtel policies, processes and guidelines. Financial Achieve sales targets. Achieve product line and VASes drivers targets, including Singnet, Mobile, SaaS, etc. Achieve call targets. Ensure every call opportunity is maximized to cross-sell, upsell and winback. Generate/ qualify leads, and build a strong funnel of opportunities to meet sales objectives. Identify and drive qualified opportunities from pre-sales to closure. Customers Deliver a consistently high quality of customer experience by possessing customer focus attitude, ability to recommend appropriate solutions and creating value. Provide good customer service and experience over the telephone. Ensure no customer complaints pertaining to poor customer management. Job Requirement A diploma/degree with at least 2 years of sales experience in Telco/IT industries, with track record in sales. Excellent interpersonal and communications skills. Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed. High proficiency in MS Word, Excel & Powerpoint. Able to sell the full range of ICT/Telecommunications solutions. We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Telecommunications

description: Position Summary: As a member of our sales organization, you will be expected to expand and look for new customers in the Taiwan market, proactively offer products to Fortune 1000 companies, and close business while maintaining lasting relationships. This opportunity is for highly driven individuals who are entrepreneurial in nature, and it provides the opportunity for exceptional high earnings potential with uncapped commissions!  What we can do for you!   Offer unparalleled earning potential not seen in other industries Provide training to give you the knowledge to thrive in a fast-paced environment Offer support through a collaborative, and open environment with proven sales professionals with decades of sales expertise Enable growth through direct and focused mentorship  What can you do for us! Drive revenue through prospecting new customers, managing existing customer relationships, and growing business within accounts Interact with prospects via telephone, email, chat, and occasional on-site visits. Collaborate with Customers & Marketing team to identify and develop additional areas of opportunity Educate customers on the current state of the hardware market to maximize efficiency and support of the supply chain  Who we’re looking for! 2-5 years of experience in a B2B sales position, handling Taiwan Market  A high-energy, smart, and persistent salesperson driven to succeed and revolutionize an industry A professional and ethical approach to selling Proficient with standard business tools (email, voicemail, MS Office 365, etc.)  Benefits Medical and Dental benefits State of the Art Open Concept Working Environment Collaborative and Motivated Team Competitive Base Salary and Uncapped Commission Onsite Gym Great Location; Walking Distance from Train Station  Established in 2001, Fusion Worldwide is a premier, global open market distributor of electronic components with an established reputation of excellence in sourcing, quality, and outstanding customer support. Solving supply chain disruptions is where we are truly able to provide key service to all our customers, and we are looking for motivated individuals like you to join this rapidly growing industry! With our company headquarters located in the scenic Boston Seaport area, we also have key locations in Amsterdam, Singapore, Munich, Guadalajara, Seoul, and San Francisco. At our current rate of growth, we are continuously expanding our global footprint to reach all corners of the world, and we are dedicated to finding top talent to help us grow in all regions!    We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

description: About The Job  Check out our short presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_Sales  Is the topic of digitisation close to your heart? Is SaaS exactly your thing? Do you want to support people and companies in the phase of digital transformation? Then CoachHub is the right place for you! In just 3 years we have built a passionate team of 350+ people, all on the same mission to democratise coaching to employees at all levels. Come and join one of LinkedIn's top 10 Startups and make your mark!  We are looking for a new team member for our APAC Sales Team. As Enterprise Account Executive at CoachHub you will play a key role in our growth in the Asia Pacific market and as brand ambassador you will represent our mission of professional coaching for everyone.  For this position you can work either from our offices in Singapore or completely remote after you have completed your onboarding with us. You take over the customers acquired by the Sales Development Representative and accompany them through the closing process. Make phone calls, web demos, on-site appointments, negotiations, and presentations to turn prospects into customers. You will support our clients as a consultant and maintain a constant contact with them You develop long-term customer relationships and build up a trusting and efficient cooperation You take part with the team in fairs & events to strengthen your network and represent our company professionally. You work closely with our Customer Success Managers and Sales Development Representatives You support the optimization of processes, content and success reporting YOUR PROFILE You have successfully completed your studies or training and have gained at least 7+ years experience in enterprise sales. You have experience with closing deals in the 6-7 figure range You convince through your professional and self-confident appearance as well as through your engaging communication skills. You stand out due to your exceptionally high motivation and enthusiasm. You distinguish yourself through your solution orientation and your independent work style. You speak English at native-level. A second language is a plus You bring a willingness to travel (up to 20%) What We Offer The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing start-up company from the beginning and to participate significantly in a global success story together Top business customer contacts, including leading top tier and tech groups and communication at management level Direct cooperation with our founders/managing directors Diverse learning and training opportunities and personal coaching from experienced entrepreneurs Your own personal business coach Regular Team Events Fun in a highly motivated team & a High Growth Company A job with Purpose Conveniently from your location (Singapore) Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub!  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn’s Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‘help organisations to unleash their people’s full potential’ attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‘CoachHubbers’ hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.

description: At SimplifyNext, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Our employees go deeper to solve our clients’ biggest challenges and make a positive, lasting impact on their businesses.  We are looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, to learn and to contribute, thus, creating value for our clients, for our business and for the society at large.  SimplifyNext is a consulting-led technology company with a dedicated focus on automation. We provide holistic automation services both from an automation life-cycle as well as technology perspective. We bring strong process consulting experience, combined with deep technical expertise on RPA and other complementary technologies such as Artificial Intelligence and Operations Analytics.  Work you’ll do  As a member of our Sales and Business Development team, you will be responsible for generating and maximizing sales results and driving new leads through the sales pipeline. You are expected to acquire new client accounts, sell to existing accounts, and build long-term relationships with our clients. You will also collaborate with different teams to coordinate pre-sales, professional services, and support resources to drive successful solutions and services for our clients.  Your Responsibilities Would Include Work closely with Sales Director to develop go-to-market strategy on identifying and acquiring new strategic client accounts specifically for the Enterprise Sector. Actively network in the industry to identify prospects and establish contact with the objective of converting prospects into client accounts through business development methods such as networking events, client referrals, cold calling, and other innovative channels. Close sales and provide support in the coordination of tender/quotation submission which includes the formulation of price quotations and solution proposals. Grow recurring business within existing client accounts through a consultative sale approach. Work closely with delivery team to ensure successful delivery of projects and if required, to bring the required resources in the project. Maintain strong relationships with both new and existing clients and ensure positive client satisfaction in the services provided by SimplifyNext. Provide weekly report updates of sales, pipelines, leads, opportunities, and sales activities. Be accountable for achieving profitability and sales growth targets within assigned territories. Monitor accounts receivables from assigned client accounts and ensure timely collections. Qualifications Good Bachelor’s Degree with 3 to 5 years of experience in a sales hunting and account management role within a technology consulting environment. Must have track record of selling to large enterprise clients with focus in the Singapore market. Experience in selling to large enterprise clients with focus in the local market would be an added advantage. Ability to engage with all levels across the client organizations including C-level executives; understand and identify clients’ needs. Self-starter and highly motivated individual. Excellent communications and inter-personal skills, and passion to deliver quality work. Experience working in a fast-paced environment

description: Industry leader in Digital Adoption, WalkMe provides the world's first Digital Adoption Platform, designed to help enterprises guide and engage end-users through various websites and applications. Proof of our impact is seen in the growing number of Fortune 500 companies and global partners using WalkMe's DAP to drive higher engagement and adoption of their digital assets across an expanding list of regions, industries and verticals.  As the company continues to rapidly expand, we are seeking a senior and driven Sales Account Executive to manage all aspects of the sale's cycle, with a focus on WalkMe's Major Accounts in Singapore. Proven success in growing and working within the region, experience in the financial services industry in SE Asia preferred Ability to manage a long and strategic sales cycle from demo to negotiation and closing. Evidence of exceptional commitment to a process-driven sales approach, and accurately tracking and forecasting all customer engagement, account management and activity through the use of Salesforce.com. A track record of consistent earnings and over-achievement in past Sales Executive roles. Be able to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment. Excellent presentation skills. Fluent English required, additional proficiency in SE Asian language a bonus Singaporean and Permanent Resident applicants preferred Experience using WalkMe is a major plus!

description: Lalamove is disrupting the logistics industry by connecting customers and drivers directly through our technology. We offer customers a lightning fast and convenient way to book delivery and moving services whether they are at their home, at work or on the go. People talk about O2O, we live it.  Onto our seventh year as a start-up, now operating in Asia, LATAM, and the United States, our aspirations don’t stop there as our model has the ability to transform how goods moved in any city worldwide. Backed by a team of experienced entrepreneurs, Lalamove offers a great place to add real value because you get real ownership of what you do. Come work with energetic, dynamic individuals, and play a critical role in disrupting the entire logistics market in a cutting-edge tech company. Are you highly motivated and strives to exceed your goals? Join the team at Lalamove Singapore and experience first-hand, the thrill of disrupting the logistics industry.  We are looking for a high-energy, charismatic Sales Associate who can work well under pressure and who exhibits a spirit of excellence to join one of the fastest growing intra-city delivery platforms in Asia.  Think you are up for it? Apply now!  Main Responsibilities Sales and lead sourcing: acquire aggressively and onboard corporate users by maintaining a healthy pipeline of leads, and to ensure weekly sales targets are achieved Negotiation and closing of deals: Lead contract negotiations to establish a strong working relationship with our local partners, and to ensure economic sustainability and mutual growth of the partnership Sales operations: ensure Standard Operating Procedures and Policies are implemented in a timely and accurate manner Brand ambassador: become the face of Lalamove when engaging local partners to promote our services and values  What We Seek Curious and creative thinkers who are capable of thinking beyond the role and committed to self-improvement Charming personality to build and maintain professional relationships Strong sales skills to get our potential client to use our service. Remain knowledgeable on products offered and discuss available options Can-do attitude and grit to make things happen, to identify and leverage new opportunities  What You'll Need Relevant sales working experience (Startup/logistics industry is a plus) Knowledge and understanding of mobile and web technologies Fearless attitude; curious mind and a hunter mentality Sound business acumen and analyzing data to make the best sales strategies

description: Fast Track Your Career with finexis Management Associate Programme (finMAP)!  The Programme A 24-month programme, finMAPTM is designed to groom budding talents to be future key pillars of finexis. The aim is to give the Management Associates (MAs) an accelerated path to Senior Management as early as within 5 years of their career with finexis. The four business rotations will give the MAs an all-rounded exposure to the industry, from back office to the front.  finMAP at a glance: Remuneration: Competitive, Salary increment with each successful rotation Four Key Rotations: Rotation through different business functions (i.e. Compliance, Human Resource, Processing, Digital, Sales) Progression: Fast-Tracked & Accelerated Growth Exposure: Mentored by Senior Management & Key Leadership Staff, Solve real business problems Experience: All-rounded business experience, Comprehensive learning, Fulfilling & Purposeful Training: On-the-job training, Strengths-based Approach, Honest & direct conversations  What To Expect: Intensive on-the-job training through our trademarked training system that has groomed 80% of the core management team, including the current CEO Go through four business rotations that form the foundation of the industry, present and future Shadow the Senior Management to gain first-hand knowledge and witness the heart and soul behind the running of the firm One-on-one mentoring sessions with Senior Management staff to discuss work progress, career mobility options to open up new areas of growth Be involved and lead strategic projects at the company level Potential salary increments and promotions after every successful business function rotation  We Want Determined Self-Starters Like YOU Who: Possess strong leadership qualities and reliance, as shown in your participation in extracurricular activities or entrepreneurial activities Are adaptable and able to work well in a team and diverse group of people Are hungry for growth, willing to learn and unlearn  Are you passionate about impacting people and do you strive to build a positive work culture?  If you aspire to take the lead and BE THE CHANGE, we are looking for you!  How To Apply: Send your resume to desiree.su@finexis.com.sg with the subject title: Job Application - Management Associate University Fresh Graduates and Diploma Holders are welcome to apply! Only Singaporeans  Disclaimer The above job description does not cover the comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of a Management Associate. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time according to the needs of the firm or the supervisor.
industries: Financial Services

description: Due to COVID-19 and the tightened travel/work visa restrictions, Hodlnaut is currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. We will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected.  Company Profile  Hodlnaut is the leading Crypto Borrowing and Lending Platform based in Singapore whose mission is to provide financial services to cryptocurrency users. The platform currently has over $500 Million USD of Digital Assets under Management (Bitcoin, Ethereum, DAI etc) and is growing at an average of 20% month on month.  Hodlnaut is a certified Fintech by the Singapore Fintech Association, an accreditation recognized by the MAS (Monetary Authority of Singapore). Hodlnaut is also currently undergoing license application under the PS Act 2019 (by the MAS) and is looking to become the first regulated entity in Singapore within the Crypto Borrowing and Lending Space.  As Hodlnaut scales, it is looking for a Junior Relationship Manager to join the team.  Key responsibilities  Managing and servicing a list of designated high net worth clients (corporate and individual), or your ‘Book of Business’, as their primary point of contact Building long-term relationships with your clients and provide ongoing relationship servicing with current clients to gain additional business and ensure they are satisfied Manage a variety of clients; understand client needs and strategize with team members to meet those needs Help up-sell and/or cross-sell products and services across clients Assess client satisfaction and extract key business needs/issues Achieve quarterly target metrics and KPIs established by management, this includes but does not limit to retaining and growing Digital Assets Under Management Align with leadership regularly to discuss and optimize strategy and share customer feedback across functions Demonstrate a proactive mindset, constantly thinking ahead and anticipating client needs and/or concerns, while keeping their business goals top-of-mind  Required Skills and Competencies  Bachelor’s degree in any discipline Industry experience in a client-facing capacity, preferably in financial services or wealth management High impact communication and relationship development skills Superior service skills/"client first" approach resulting in strong customer loyalty Preferably an understanding of blockchain technology and crypto assets Demonstrated adaptability, flexibility, and willingness to work in a collaborative, team environment Experience with sales and/or conversion and client relationship management Excellent interpersonal communication skills and high attention to detail Excited to work in an early-stage company and have a high impact on the future of the company’s growth and help Hodlnaut scale  This position provides a large opportunity for professional growth as we scale our organization. The individual who joins our team should expect to scale with our company and be ready to take on larger responsibilities over time.

jobTitle: Senior Associate, Sales Operations and CRM, GrabAds
description: Job Description:  About the team:  GrabAds allows Advertisers, Agencies, and Merchants to engage the Grab Audience via innovative online and offline advertising experiences. Through our unique ecosystem and transacting user base, our clients are able to reach their desired audiences at scale, while driving measurable business outcomes.  GrabAds helps brands and businesses deliver results that matter by: Helping you reach high value users with proven purchase power Offering action based ad formats that drive measurable results Leveraging Grab’s ecosystem to deliver Online-2-Offline purchase results We would like You to join our journey to create value for our users, drivers, merchants and advertising partners, while continuing to drive Southeast Asia forward by creating economic empowerment for everyone.  About the role:  GrabAds is looking for an experienced Sales Operations and CRM Associate to join us as a SFDC expert to support our rapidly evolving and growing business. Responsibilities include translating cross-vertical and cross-functional business requirements into working Salesforce tools, strategising and defining solutions that meet both near and long-term business needs and objectives, and guiding business stakeholders and client-facing sales teams through workshops to ensure adoption and usage. As a Sales Operations and CRM Associate, you’ll help our business stakeholders achieve success through defining the SFDC strategy for their business needs and end users throughout each stage of the implementation process.  A successful candidate in this role must have the ability to think strategically and effectively to develop thought leadership around SFDC, CRM implementation and the general sales process, as well as the grit and problem-solving abilities to deep dive in certain topics as required. This individual must be passionate about digital advertising strategy.  As the Sales Operations and CRM Associate, You will be an integral member of the regional Strategy, Partnerships & Finance team in Singapore. You will drive Salesforce roadmap planning, operations and execution processes with cross-functional and cross-vertical teams including Sales, Marketing, Operations, Analytics, Product, and Finance. You will be the central point of contact for GrabAds on all Salesforce related projects, and you will lead the execution of key deliverables including the status and outlook on each active project You will design and implement account hierarchies on SFDC to enable macro and micro level reporting You will define the end-to-end sales process from lead and opportunity creation to billing and collections for various business units and revenue streams You will work closely with internal Marketing stakeholders to design and implement the Pardot platform to create an automated lead generation and qualifying process You will work closely with Grab’s Salesforce Developer Teams to create enhancements and controls according to business requirements, escalate and resolve roadblocks when needed You will play a key role in defining and enforcing the governance and SOPs around Salesforce and connected systems within GrabAds in line with Grab’s overall governance processes You will implement new enhancements to Salesforce, to improve user experience and workflow efficiency (e.g. ticketing system), and improve reporting capabilities (e.g. PowerBI integration) You will be the central point of contact who supports GrabAds sales teams and leadership You will create and maintain Salesforce dashboards for business and sales leaders You will conduct regular training sessions for new Salesforce users You will source external partners and integrations to manage the end-to-end order to cash process In order to succeed in the role, you should ideally have: 5 to 8 years of work experiences in Sales Operations functions Previous experience with Salesforce, Marketing Automation, ticketing systems and CRM systems Relevant Salesforce Certifications e.g. Certified SalesforceSalesForce Administrator, Certified Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist, Certified Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant and etc The ability to use internal tools and industry tools to manage projects and communication effectively. Experience in strategic planning and strong business acumen, project management skills and the ability to lead multiple high profile projects of varying timelines simultaneously. Exceptional written, presentation, and verbal communications skills that can be applied across organisational levels, countries and cultures. Experience working in Southeast Asia is a big plus. Proactive, resourceful and open-minded, with superior analytical thinking and problem solving skills, enjoy taking up challenges and developing creative solutions working comfortably in the face of ambiguity and a fast paced environment. An analytical mindset with strong organisational skills, and the ability to multitask across several projects The ability to work collaboratively with senior, cross-functional and cross-vertical stakeholders throughout the company through exceptional relationship and consensus building skills. Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem and strongly recommended by peers. The ability to quickly adapt to a constantly changing environment and help others progress through best practices in change management. Experience working with Microsoft Excel and Google Suite. Previous experience in a technology driven environment is a plus.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Founded in 2014, Laundryheap is one of the young, leading and fastest growing UK based tech startup. Our dedicated teams pick up, clean and deliver within 24 hours. We are currently operating in the UK, US, Ireland, Netherlands, Singapore and UAE. Our aim is to grow, and we want you to be part of it! We believe in change and building strong relationships. In Laundryheap, we are committed to ensuring that our employees work in an environment that is inclusive to everyone and treated with dignity. The world and the industry around us are changing constantly. To keep up with innovation, fast grow and increase in emerging customer needs, you have to be confident and fearless. We are looking for confident, brave and creative minds to challenge our needs to drive Laundryheap forward. Your opportunities and development are limitless! Having launched our Singapore service in early 2020, we are currently looking for a City Associate to join our fast-growing global team. Energetic and talented individuals ready to take on challenges and have a go-getter attitude are welcome to apply to us. Your Responsibilities and Experience Include: Quickly develop expertise in Laundryheap’s range of B2C and B2B solutions and help adapt these based on your local expertise. Grow commercial relationships with existing suppliers and lead on acquiring new ones. Finetune and enhance our ground operation capabilities and processes, working closely with our Global Operations team to ensure our seamless 24h turnaround and excellent customer experience. Help the Global Business Development team find, negotiate and close innovative partnerships to help drive the business in Singapore. Generate new ideas and identify additional opportunities for new business development and B2C/B2B sales in the laundry/hospitality industries. Be the face of Laundryheap in Singapore to suppliers and partners. Required Skill Set: At least 1-2 years commercial experience, ideally in a sales/business development/startup/tech/finance/consulting background. Excellent interpersonal as well as written and verbal communication skills. Hands-on, action-driven, with a preference for the fast-paced work environment. Self-starter with a high level of resilience, calm under pressure. Ability to perform independently, while contributing to the team efforts. Based, and eligible to work in Singapore. Desired Skills: Bachelor's degree in related field or certifications Able to give and receive constructive criticism Negotiation skills Organisational skills Ability to work under pressure COVID-19 Precautions: Remote working until further notice Salary Negotiable, experience dependant We have ambitious global expansion plans in 2021, and we love working with ambitious, proactive people with a get-things-done attitude. Take this opportunity and apply today via using this link below.

description: Job Descriptions  At NP Foods Singapore, we’re well aware of the impact our customisable solutions of our seasoning powders have on the world’s taste. But we won’t rest until everybody knows. We’re seeking a qualified business development executive to extend our global reach through expert discovery and exploration of new and untapped business opportunities and relationships. Our ideal candidate will be trusted to dive right in, take the lead, use initiative, and help build our brand that help make everyday activities easier for people around the world. Highly skilled at improving business operations, and with some crucial knowledge of sales, this person will join and inspire a team of like-minded go-getters to achieve our company vision.  Job Tasks Prepare business action plans and strategies for any products developed Develop strategies and positions by analyzing new venture integration Handle any project enquiries between internal and external stakeholders Collaborate with key account managers to identify new business and grow relationships that assist in revenue generation within assigned verticals Develop intervention strategies to mitigate gaps in any business processes Conduct research to identify new markets and customer need Assist in the coordination and implementation of marketing strategies, and delegate tasks that achieve strategic goals Identify trends and customer needs, building a short/medium/long-term business pipeline in accordance with achieving financial gain Motivate the team, track performance, and report metrics Job Responsibilities Monitor and evaluate industry trends and customer drivers and meet regularly with management and stakeholders to discuss strategy Manage proposal response process, including detailed RFP requirements, content creation, and inputs from various sources Develop and implement overarching outbound sales and business development strategy, sales structure, and best practices across the company Support deal structure and pricing with business value analysis. Maintain and share professional knowledge through education, networking, events, and presentations Key Competencies Diploma or bachelor’s degree in business or management Successful track record in Project management Some understanding of B2B sales Excellent verbal and written communication skills Working experience with sales techniques Proficiency with data analysis, forecasting, and budgeting Proven ability to plan and manage resources Adaptability and Flexible Goal driven Other Requirements Valid class 3 driving license Willing to travel Love to eat chips and food

description: Position Overview: Arton Capital is looking for a dynamic and commercially astute candidate to work in the business development department of a world class, global leader in second residence and citizenship planning as the Relationship Manager for its global operations. The successful candidate should have excellent communication skills with a proven record in generating significant revenues. Arton Capital is a dynamic and fast-moving company; the ideal fit would be a candidate who is ambitious and keen to have genuine influence – helping to shape the growth of the business’s future.  Duties and Responsibilities: Identify business opportunities and set business development strategies to develop a pipeline of business coming into ARTON, incl. by proposing new services and pricing of new/existing products, set targets for annual sales and present semi-annual reports to the President Improve the market position of ARTON and achieve financial growth while maximizing the revenues for ARTON Build, maintain, and retain key relationships with Clients and Consultants, identify new Clients and Consultants, negotiate and close business deals Understand in depth and stay informed about the market, the business trends, the particularities of each IIP, including changes, amendments and enhancements of each IIP, as well as to monitor the performance of key competitors in the area Liaise with all departments at ARTON and, in particular, with the Marketing department and the senior management to identify opportunities for events and campaigns Attend industry events and provide feedback on the market development and shifts Act as a Relationship Manager for key Clients and for all Consultants and meet their needs Work in close relation with the Program Managers to secure the flawless and efficient service and channel the communication flows with. Please note this job description contains only a partial listing of duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Qualifications:  A bachelor’s degree Excellent command of spoken and written English Experience with professional services firms in the financial or legal industry Superior communications skills and ability to work with external parties Creative, proactive and confident approach to the position Team player, collaborative, reliable, flexible, and cooperative, who works well with firm leadership, marketing team and staff at all level Strong organization skills and attention to detail: ability to prioritize, work efficiently under pressure and manage tight deadlines. This job operates in a professional office environment and all equipment and tools necessary for the execution of the work will be provided by the firm.

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.   At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.  The primary function of the Asia Sales Performance Lead  is to execute successful key sales projects, deliver information, training and strategies to the Asia Sales team to ensure they are successful. This highly influential role is pivotal to ensure the adoption of Xero in Partner firms and SME’s. This individual will work closely with the Head of Sales and Territory Managers to drive the Asia sales team performance via upskilling, coaching and ensuring the sales team have the systems, tools and processes to be successful.   What you'll do - Product and Platform Continuous fundamental product training  Being the person responsible for new product training and the coordination of this with the product team, when it is coming (new releases) Be the Asia lead for Product launches, responsible Project Managing the local launch, for example Singapore Seamless Filing. Responsible for the success of product launches Liaising with commercial operations, understanding the road map, clarifying  what is relevant to the Asia region and communicating the  projects coming due for release and execution of these projects   What you'll do - New starter onboarding Fundamental Xero product training Ownership of sales onboarding process Showpad - up to date and localised to Asia, sales training platform, own the content Intro to Xero Demos (First 30 days)   What you'll do - Be a specialist in the coordination, creation, and execution of world class content Work with the Education team to develop strategies, create and execute content for presentations at key events. Build and present specialist content for other ad hoc partner or industry events where required   What you'll do - Increase the confidence of the Asia sales team through value-adding competitor positioning Translate global competitor analysis and effectively deliver value added insights to the Asia sales team Work with varied stakeholders to develop competitor strategies and resources Provide sales team with training and materials on how to position Xero Develop onboarding courses and resources to ensure new partner sales members can confidently position Xero against competitors Consistently stay up to date  on all competitor changes. This includes pricing, promotions, partner programs and events. Effectively communicate changes and announcements to all relevant stakeholders   What you'll do - Sales Training Align Asia & Global FY22 sales enablement strategies and tools  Align Sales onboarding strategies with APAC Sales Enablement Onboarding strategies for consistency  Collaborate with APAC Sales Enablement to imbed sales skill (fuleX) coaching/training Demonstrate Sales/product excellence in coaching & training Manage the localisation and updating of relevant education with every new product release Produce and write materials for core training on new products and sales skills etc. Be the local point of contact for global Sales improvement programs and deliver these in region (Scalex/Fuel Ex), work with Sales Operations to assess systems needed Being the regional point of contact FuelX embedding and coordination of dates/training schedules with global enablement Responsible for the sales teams understanding of the value proposition for target customer/ target market You will be the "do-er" while also maintaining a strategic focus within the sales leadership team,  i.e., build training material, regionalise global material, put together sales briefing docs, coordinate dates, etc   What you'll do - Other important areas of focus Assist in the coordination and delivery of internal change management programs  Represent the Asia Sales team on various projects as a subject matter expert Work with Global Enablement team to drive key enablement projects Be a regional contact for the Global Product Marketing, Events, Product  and Global sales enablement teams to assess and tailor to regional  market requirements Take feedback from surveys and follow up programmes to refine content after initial release Assess where the gaps are in the sales business unit and understand where levers can be pulled to optimise across all sales education, globally Any other sales enablement projects as determined by the Asia Head of Sales   Success looks like Stakeholders relationship across the board Marketing, Commercial Operations Territory Sales Managers and  Partner Consulting Manager etc Organisation - project management skills, proactively building training, ahead of the game with what is coming out Interconnection with product team regarding releases to understand what is beneficial and why Work with HOS - new targets align with new releases supporting HOS to understand the benefits of releases  Successful delivery of  sales programs and material to enable the Sales team to successfully position Xero against key competitors Delivery of outstanding presentations at key events, including equipping the sales team to deliver   What you’ll bring with you - Critical competencies Demonstrated successes and competencies at improving processes  Exceptional presentation, communication and people skills Working in a leadership group to meeting our objectives Experience in training, including creation and delivery of training materials An understanding of the Xero platform and an ability to understand market shifts and the opportunities contained therein Ability to work autonomously and demonstrate initiative and planning skills Loads of initiative and ability to collaborate   What you’ll bring with you - Experience Considerable experience of working within a Sales environment (5+ years) Experience building and delivering presentations Experience and understanding of the Xero platform and other accounting software products   Why Xero?  At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package which includes shares and life insurance plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology too.    Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About ISUZU MOTORS ASIA LIMITED (IMA)  A Global Japanese Automotive Manufacturer with an office in Singapore is embarking on an evolving path and expanding role. The Singapore office assists the Japan Head Office in managing the Group’s interests and exposures in the ASEAN region, India and Middle East.  There are many opportunities for staff to be involved in cross department and regional projects. And as part of the Group’s initiative towards greater adoption of technology and boosting work efficiency, the Singapore Office offers a chance to take part in exciting tech projects and development of newly standardized operations that can have impact across the Group.  The Parts Department (PD) has recently re-established its standard operational procedures to simplify processes with sound workflows to ensure efficiency in communication, lead-time and cost. With this completion of first step towards improvements, PD is currently looking for a matured and capable Order Management & Sales Coordinator to execute the second step in advancing towards proactive sales management that capitalizes the growing demands of Isuzu Parts regionally. Pending tasks are challenging and time sensitive but will be very rewarding for high performers.  Roles & Responsibilities Promote Isuzu Parts and attend to enquiries on order status. Process orders and claims. Gather market information from customers. Review monthly sales data and propose improvements. Expedite back orders by communicating with 3PLs and warehouse group. Communicate with procurement group to improve order fulfilment rate. Prepare and present sales report(s) to customers. Assist management in extracting valuable data from SAP. Assist in the making of agreement(s) between IMA and customers. Be a secondary person-in-charge to ensure business continuity. Be proactive in proposing operational improvements. Job Requirements Minimally 2 years of experience in sales (automotive industry is a plus) Proficiency in SAP (SD/MM modules), Excel and Power Point Familiar with logistics terminologies and Incoterms Good sales negotiation skills Good time management skills Good communication and coordination skills Good presentation skills Proactivity in finding ways to improve work processes Able to travel 2-3 days in a month regionally Expected Start Date of Work: ASAP/ Nov 2021
industries: Information Technology and Services, Automotive, and Consumer Goods

As your role develops at Pace, there’ll also be opportunities to expand your scope into a regional one, as the business expands into key markets outside Singapore. description: Job Description & Requirements  We're currently looking for a Brand Manager for our eCommerce team!  This role is very much responsible to manage our brands and partners end to end e-Commerce performance including, sales, marketing, inventory, pricing, on-site visibility & traffic, collaboration, evaluation, and execution.  The ideal candidate is required to have some background in the e-Commerce industry, also an analytical team player who owns the entire product lifecycle from strategy to evaluation.
