Job Description Develop marketing strategies plan including GTM strategy, pricing, and promotions Manage products forecast, sales & marketing planning and budgeting (e.g. bundles creation, discounts activation, vouchers, etc), and ensure compliance in execution Manage inventory & ensure high stock availability and low aging inventory Manage marketing claims recovery from vendors within contractual terms Liaise with both brand owners and platform partners to build strong rapport and engagement, establish a good understanding of brand performance across all channels and advise on strategies to drive and achieve business objectives Conduct regular business reviews and recommend actionable insight from post-campaign evaluation analyses and incorporate them into immediate and future business strategies. Involvement in annual renewal negotiations, including trading terms and conditions, to facilitate sales agreements and achieve targeted margins Accountable for achieving set Sales Target and KPIs given Gathering market intelligence on competitive and new products, industry trends, and development and constantly lookout for new opportunities to grow the brand business Lay down standard operating procedure (SOP) and guidelines within the team Requirements Diploma/Degree in any field At least 2-3 years of strong experience in the e-commerce industry, experience working in vendor, enabler, or platform is a big plus Demonstrates excellent communication (written & spoken) and follow-up skills Possess past experience in managerial/leadership role Highly organized and efficient Proficient in MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel) Ability to multi-task and work under pressure and independently Have strong networking and negotiation skills, team player, adaptive, ability to multi-task, and able to work under pressure Compensation Will Be Commensurate With Experience. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified, thank you.

description: About Switch Switch is the world’s first workspace on-demand platform. Switch unlocks productivity by unlocking workspace all over the city. With two taps in the Switch app, Switch Members can check in and out of workspaces on a pay-per-minute basis. On the demand side, large corporations and individual consumers use Switch to ‘Work From Anywhere’ and ‘Work Near Home’. On the supply side, space partners such as coworking-spaces, serviced offices, traditional offices, shopping malls, hotels and co-living operators offer four types of workspaces: hot desks, meeting rooms, private offices, and smart work booths. Switch enables both individual and enterprise users to work from anywhere with improved productivity, privacy, and flexibility. Users can pay only for what they use (by minutes) and skip any monthly memberships or day-passes.  The Switch team has a proven track record in inventing and commercializing technologies and business models in the real estate industry and marketplace businesses. Led by the former leadership and team members of WeWork China Technology team, the Switch team is based in offices across Singapore, Shanghai, Taipei and Melbourne. The team is comprised of experienced veterans from both tech and real estate industries including WeWork, CapitaLand, KE Holdings, Google, Uber, Airbnb, Bytedance, Microsoft, Autodesk, and other leading firms.  Switch is backed by four of the largest property companies in Asia. For more information, please visit www.switch.site  What This Position Does to Help Switch Succeed? This is a unique opportunity for a highly motivated business development/account management professional with successful track record of making deals with commercial real estate landlords or operators. It would be a major plus if you have retail real estate experience.  The ideal candidate has strong business development experience as well as deep understanding of retail real estate business operations. Responsible for the entire sales process, you skillfully prospect, align business outcomes, build consensus, handle objections, negotiate deals and successfully close on time.  What Makes This Job Awesome? Join one of the most innovative companies at the intersection of the technology and real estate worlds! Identify new business opportunities (business districts /malls /transportation hubs etc.), work out the feasibility study and develop the strategic business plan to expand Switch’s booths coverage. Build a pipeline by prospecting new business with landlord or developer decision makers within retail and commercial real estate industry. Confidently negotiate pricing and sales contracts running point on legal and contract reviews Translate discovery insights and desired business outcomes into compelling sales strategies that win new booth placement and partnership deals, upsell and extend the existing deals. Work closely with booth deployment, professional services and customer support teams to address client requirements and ensure successful implementation and continued use Represent Switch at in-market events, industry groups, and CRE specific initiatives networking and building relationships with target prospects.  What Makes You A Great Fit? 3 - 5+ years working experience in sales roles related with retail real estate industry or retail brand business development with proven track record. Experiences in the technology or marketplace businesses is a plus. Demonstrated history of handling business deals between retail landlords and merchants. A deal winner with deep understanding of the retail real estate BD & operations and strong insight on consumer retail trends in your market Skilled at building new pipeline and strong in building process-oriented action plans to win accounts. Negotiate independently with Landlord for all the contracts, including new opening /renewal /termination as well as Popups, and ensure on-time signing Identify new business opportunities (new cities /malls / retail channels, etc.), work out and execute Work as key bridge between Landlord and Switch, support internal departments (Marketing, PR, Finance, etc.) for communication/negotiation with Landlord and help to solve the issues Go-getter attitude Liaise closely with Go-to-market (GTM) team in order to maximize team results and brand synergy Creative thinker, highly organized and efficient in managing multiple projects at once Fluency in Mandarin is a plus so as to communicate effectively with our team in China
industries: Internet and Real Estate

description: About Us: Smart Walkie Pte Ltd (https://www.smartwalkie.com) We are building the next generation hardware and software that makes mobile workers more efficient, return home in one piece and lower the blood pressure of their managers back in the office.  Job Title: Mobility Consultant (B2B Sales, Telecommunications) “Help other companies choose our product as their choice for communication with their Field Workers.”  The ideal Sales person should be able to get requirement clearly from customers and match to features and solution Suggest IT solutions to their problems Can create a product preference in the customer’s mind so that we can win the competition Demonstrate to customer that you and the company is reliable and able to support them can feel the customer’s preference towards us or competition and feedback to marketing so we can figure out how to fight the competition.  Do you fit us? You want to sell a solution that benefits companies You want to sell and understand the meaning of grit. You can problem solve and ensure your work helps our customers become more successful. People trust you when you talk to them You are motivated by financial incentives on Revenue and Customer Satisfaction  Why you should join Smart Walkie Talkie  Improve yourself as a Consultant: Our customers come to us to improve their businesses. Although we sell Smart Walkie Talkies, we also regularly recommend Enterprise Apps that can help them. This will expose you to a wide range of business problems and you can explore solutions that can aid your customers on Enterprise Mobility. This will be great if you are looking to gain business experience.  Attractive commission scheme with proven product: We are no longer a startup trying to fit a market need. We just need people to close customers. Come win your commission. Work Location: Jurong/West Coast. However you can choose to work remotely/home. We expect you to have maximum time at the customer's location rather than in our office.  B2B Consultative Sales: Learn and experience B2B sales which is very different and a much more rewarding career track than B2C sales. B2B sales are conducted in professional, consultative manner. The deal size is larger but the problems are also more complex and require problem solving. FYI: https://www.pipedrive.com/en/blog/b2b-sales-b2c-sales  Application: Together with your Resume, write about how you would sell this phone (http://nomu.smartwalkie.com) to an Inuit. Job Type: Full-time  Benefits: Cell phone reimbursement Flexible schedule Professional development Work from home  Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Commission pay Experience: Sales: 1 year (Minimum Required) Work Remotely: Yes

description: At Blackpanda, our sales team is the engine that drives our success. We are seeking a motivated Sales Analyst with a love for tech to help us drive growth across Asia. This is a role which will balance both strategic and operational responsibilities – you will think big picture and also roll-up your sleeves to drive execution of strategic initiatives.  The Sales Analyst will enable the driving of growth of a wide variety of cybersecurity proactive defense services and products as well as cyber resiliency solutions, while helping to position Blackpanda as the premier cybersecurity Digital Forensics and Incident Response team in Asia. Applicants must be based in Hong Kong or Singapore with long-term plans to reside and stay in the city.  Roles and Responsibilities Play a pivotal role in strategic initiatives to accelerate sales and growth, ensuring progress against business objectives Support new growth opportunities for Blackpanda and contribute to the development of associated business cases Set individual and company sales targets with the executive leadership team Track sales goals and report results to executive leadership Coordinate with Marketing on lead generation and service support Coordinate with the Revenue team on channel sales development Understand our ideal customers and how they relate to our product / services Represent the organization and its products / services Support other company personnel and projects, as necessary Qualifications and Experience This is an entry level position, 2-3 years in tech preferred but not required Ability to learn CRM & connected planning systems, developing systems and process across the organization Knowledge of consulting business models and associated KPIs Ability to work within a multi-national sales team Extroverted, positive attitude with a drive to build relationships Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Based in Hong Kong or Singapore with long-term plans to remain in the region Bachelor’s degree in a related field Cantonese or Mandarin language skills a plus Benefits Possible equity awards based on performance Annual bonus based on performance Sales commission program participation Future relocation opportunities to your office of choice Enrollment in the company health plan Future travel and training opportunities Due to the volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your understanding.  BLACKPANDA is Asia’s premier cyber security incident response group, hyper-focused on digital forensics and cyber crisis response. Our team consists of an elite cadre of risk and security experts from International military special forces, intelligence, forensics and law enforcement backgrounds. We are highly trained, ready to respond to and help manage crises on short notice, when and wherever needed. www.blackpanda.com | hello@blackpanda.com

Good understanding of telecommunication services is a plus. Proficient in MS Office, specifically MS Excel. We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. Find more information at https://www.converge.com  About Arrow  Arrow Electronics, Inc. (NYSE: ARW), an award-winning Fortune 102 and one of Fortune Magazine’s Most Admired Companies. Learn more at www.arrow.com.  Our strategic direction of guiding innovation forward is expressed as Five Years Out, a way of thinking about the tangible future to bridge the gap between what's possible and the practical technologies to make it happen. description: About The Team  Shape the future of advertising in Southeast Asia and Taiwan. Our mission is to empower our sellers to connect with the right customers and grow their businesses through our advertising solutions. As an Advertising Business PM, you play a key part in developing and implementing Shopee’s advertising product and business strategy. In so doing, we enable the success of our sellers and help to further drive Shopee’s growth.  Job Description Advocate for customers and discover customer needs. Drive and own high-level strategic initiatives, and at the same time, hands-on with the ability to roll up your sleeves and get things done. Identify business opportunities and requirements through analysis of market trends, data, seller feedback and competitor platforms. Analyse, align and evaluate business requirements, feasibility and value of the feature requests with both business and Product teams to deliver a comprehensive and accurate Business Requirement Document (BRD). Collaborate with the wider Product team as well as Engineering and Design teams to develop, prioritise and implement our product roadmap in order to drive growth. Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the  Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at  www.coupa.com . Read more on the  Coupa Blog  or follow  @Coupa on Twitter .  Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:  1. Ensure Customer Success  – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful. 2. Focus On Results  – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action. 3. Strive For Excellence  – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.  We are looking for highly energetic and driven sales professionals to work as part of a strategic sales team to sell enterprise software solutions to APAC's leading companies. Ideal candidates will have a minimum of two years sales experience and the ability to qualify sales opportunities and deliver the Coupa value proposition to a variety of lines of business and decision makers. You will possess sound business acumen, the ability to influence, and a can-do attitude. Coupa is growing at a phenomenal rate and with that comes significant career opportunities for consistent performers.   Responsibilities: New business development / account development Accessing C-Level, Director level contacts within customer accounts and target prospects Lead generation via targeted outbound account prospection and calling on marketing-generated/inbound leads Partner with marketing on a programmatic campaign-based approach to demand generation Partner with field sales force to implement sales & pipeline build strategies Provide accurate forecasts to the sales organization and executive management Meet monthly and quarterly new meeting, lead qualification, opportunity conversion and closed won objectives Demonstrate thorough knowledge of Coupa’s product line and value proposition Host product demonstrations and guided tours for customers and prospects Demonstrate clear understanding of Coupa’s sales processes and product and service value propositions Customer event attendance    Requirements: Fluent in English; high preference for candidates speaking Thai and Mandarin Consistent track record for meeting and exceeding lead generation and sales objectives 2+ years inside sales software experience Experience calling into Fortune 1000 accounts at CXO level Proven track record with new account development Highly motivated professional with excellent interpersonal skills High level of energy, drive, enthusiasm, initiative, commitment and professionalism Self-starter with solid organisational and planning skills Working knowledge of Salesforce.com or a similar CRM system required Discipline to maintain high call volumes Bachelor’s Degree required <10% travel expected    At Coupa, we have a strong and innovative team dedicated to improving the spend management processes of today’s dynamic businesses. It’s our people who make it happen, and we strive to attract and retain the best in every discipline.  We take care of our employees every way we can, with competitive compensation packages, as well as restricted stock units, an Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), comprehensive health benefits for employees and their families, retirement and savings plans with employer match, a flexible work environment, no limit vacations for exempt employees, non-exempt employees are on an accrual basis for PTO, catered lunches…And much more!  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Coupa is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.  Please be advised, inquiries or resumes from recruiters will not be accepted.

description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce with the world’s best education. This team is made up of three sub-teams: Sales, Customer Success, and Revenue Strategy & Operations. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi.  We are looking for an Business Development Manager who can help us empower Universities & Higher-ed Institutions in Asia to offer the world’s best education to their employees and students respectively. Our ideal candidate is a passionate, entrepreneurial sales manager who can prospect, develop, and close large enterprise deals in Asia. You should have extensive experience of sales to large enterprises /universities / higher education institutions. Your knowledge of edtech, enterprise learning / training combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities will shape Coursera’s enterprise business.  Responsibilities Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas Create a strategic territory plan and generate new-business revenue from the territory Navigate Universities & Higher-Ed Institutions to identify, effectively prospect, develop, and close sales opportunities Develop and manage pipeline activity and monitor sales activity against quota Use in-depth knowledge of industry trends to consult, support and manage prospective customers relationships. Accurately forecast quarterly and monthly sales Basic Qualifications 11+ years of enterprise sales experience, including experience in the Asian markets. Demonstrated history in enterprise sales experience at a SaaS company (experience selling to higher education segment, large universities is preferred) Experience of consistently exceeding quota of $1 Million and more, with proven success in accurately forecasting targets, and achieving sales commits Experience of managing meetings with C-suite representatives and key decision-makers - President, Chancellor, Vice-Chancellor, Dean Experience working in the higher Ed space - with demonstrated history showing skills in the Higher education landscape, key influencers, decision-making process, budgeting etc. Preferred Qualifications Extensive enterprise sales experience at a SaaS company (experience selling to higher education segment, large universities is essential) Track record of establishing senior level, long term client relationships to generate cross-sell and upsell opportunities with strategic accounts. Proven track record of selling enterprise solutions into large/complex accounts and over-achieving quarterly and annual sales targets Business written and verbal communication skills, strong analytical and creative problem solving abilities, excellent interpersonal skills, organizational, and operational skills Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working autonomously and as part of a team in ambiguous, quickly changing environments Outstanding ability to collaborate, understand and empathize with others Passion for education If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Foundations of Business Strategy  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

description: Eatigo – Winner of several start up awards and recognized as the Number 1 discounted restaurant reservations platform in South East Asia, Eatigo is the number 1 restaurant reservations platform in South East Asia. We currently have operations in Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong, India, Philippines, Indonesia and South Korea.  Founded in 2013, Eatigo’s mission is to connect empty tables with empty stomachs by offering time-based discounts of up to 50% every day at all of its participating restaurants through its online website and mobile applications. Users can choose to dine anywhere, from upscale hotels to popular food chains, and enjoy the same discounts with no strings attached, while restaurants get to fill their empty seats during off-peak hours.  The Role  Seeking a highly motivated and energetic candidate for the position of Business Development Manager to join the Eatigo Team. The ability to work in a fast paced environment, under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism is crucial to this role. Reporting directly to the Country Lead, you will be a key strategic member of the Singapore Sales Team. This role would extend our reach through exploration of new and untapped business opportunities and relationships.  What You’ll Do Has the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality is crucial to this role. Good communication skills and attention to detail are equally important. Ability to identify & contact potential restaurant partners that can benefit from incremental diners during their off-peak hours Present convincing business cases to demonstrate clear value to these potential restaurant partners Continuously analyse, identify & execute value creation opportunities for existing restaurant partners Work closely with the senior business development manager & country lead to brainstorm and execute new strategies Continuously analyse individual and team performance and take necessary steps to ensure growth. Senior members responsible for training and mentoring team to excel in performance Meet rigorous daily reporting requirements Ideal Profile  What You’ll Need Experience in sales / account management, and passion for e-commerce and F&B industry. Ability to use data and analytics while building on client conversations. Self-motivated with a strong affinity for problem solving. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Ability to lead and motivate junior members to achieve exceeding results What's on Offer? Fantastic work culture Work alongside & learn from the best Strong opportunities to progress your career
industries: Internet

description: We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, fearless team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!  Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 350,000 customers and almost 2 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  As a Territory Account Manager, you’ll help customers understand the value of our cloud-managed hardware solution and develop new and lasting relationships in a variety of accounts. You’ll join a passionate, high-energy, fast-moving sales team and will advance deals through the sales cycle in collaboration with account teams, sales engineers and partners. In this high-velocity role, you’ll focus on small and mid-sized enterprise businesses. Strong organisational skills are key, and you are able to handle a pipeline of up to 150 opportunities at once with deals that range in size from $5k to $100k+. You will also be able to demo Cisco Meraki technology via Webex to end users and our partner organisation.  You will: Own the entire sales process from prospecting to close Meet and exceed quarterly sales targets Maintain accurate pipeline management with expert-level forecasting Cultivate, grow and enable partners to optimally close Cisco Meraki business Understand customer needs and requirements Demonstrate Meraki technology using Webex Travel to assigned territory at least once per quarter to support partners and customers  You have: B2B full cycle sales experience in a revenue closing role with a proven record of overachievement As a Territory Account Manager, you will be working across the region including key partners in India and thus, proficiency in both English and Hindi is crucial 4 years of technology sales experience Highly effective communication skills, with ability to balance multiple emails, phone calls, social media and more BA/BS degree preferred  You are: Enterprising – you are creative and hardworking Organised – you are on top of everything A phenomenal teammate – we have a collaborative environment Positive – we bring solutions, not problems Hardworking – we all love what we do  At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Due to the rapid growth in our APJ region we are recruiting for experienced Enterprise Sales Executives to be responsible for new business sales across the board.  The expansion of Rackspace’s business in Singapore is a major strategic priority for Rackspace and as a result, this role is a key hire and will be high profile across our sales organization.  Focus will be on business acceleration and driving new logo opportunities in our Enterprise space in Singapore.  What You'll Be Doing Evolve and create an acquisition strategy to increase market share within the SG market Define target segments and customers based on the defined Rackspace market entry strategy Develop initiatives to increase new deal flow, senior client meetings and ways to position the comprehensive Rackspace portfolio within the defined target segments and customers in SG Build multi-level relationships including senior customer contacts and key decision makers and stakeholders Execute sales processes to ensure market leading win ratios and strategies Develop and optimize a structured sales process to grow the business within the selected target segments and customers Establish, meet and exceed sales revenue quota Drive revenue growth via interaction and engagement with other critical parts of the Rackspace organization Engage with channel partners to find and develop new opportunities Is This Job For You Bachelor's degree in Sales, Marketing, Business, or related field is required. Equivalent work experience may be considered. 10+ years successful B2B sales experience, including a minimum of 5 years of experience in technology You'll have experience of selling strategic Technology Services, either from systems integration or other SaaS / Cloud related services Experience understanding a client's business strategy and how services can create change and transformation. You have a structured approach to solution selling that you can articulate and demonstrate. Previous Enterprise service or software sales experience is also essential. About Rackspace Technology  We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.  More on Rackspace Technology  Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

description: Who are Unruly?  Unruly is one of the leading video ad platforms in the world. Publishers use Unruly’s self-service tools, global relationships with premium demand partners, user-friendly ad formats and dedicated support team to maximise their revenue across a range of different screens, including CTV, mobile and desktop.  A pioneer in bringing emotional intelligence to the ad ecosystem, Unruly's innovative, multi-format tech, unique audience insights and creative solutions also enable brands and agencies to seamlessly engage global consumers in premium, brand-safe environments.  Our culture, built from the combined experience and personality of every single member of the team, is defined by three key values: Deliver Wow, Inspire Change, and Share the Love.  Where in the Unrulyverse will I be working?  The Sales Team for Unruly are responsible for cultivating and nurturing relationships across media and advertisers direct to offer innovative solutions with Unruly's product set.  Currently our teams are working remotely, however once it is safe to do so this role will be based in the Singapore office for some of the week.  What will I be doing?  Your mission will be to significantly increase cross screen, multi format video advertising spend with Unruly from the large agencies and clients in your designated portfolio which includes the world’s biggest brand names. Some of your role will involve; Driving maximum revenue for Unruly in Singapore Pitching the Unruly product to our core customers Maintaining and building relationships with Singapore agencies/clients and a group of Independent agencies & direct client brands Achieving (and pushing to exceed) significant targets in both IO and Programmatic spend Communicating complex, creative solutions to agencies and clients who may be unfamiliar or uncomfortable with the space effectively in an accessible way Understanding of client challenges and able to explain how Unruly’s solutions can resolve them Inspiring and educate Singapore’s Independent agencies and brands on the benefits of embracing video What will I bring? An established network of Singapore based media agency decision-makers - you are on first name terms with the key people. Experience and/or passion in digital media sales (video experience is a plus). A track record of prospecting for new business and converting this into revenue Demonstrated digital or video sales experience Strong passion of digital culture, and knowledge of trends and innovation in the digital space Understanding of and enthusiasm for the video space and the ability to inspire confidence and collaboration with your clients Here at Unruly, we like to think outside the box, so if you don’t tick every one of these- don’t worry! We would rather see your application than risk missing out on your potential. We also know our strength comes from our differences and varied life experiences, so we are committed to the value of diversity and inclusion in all its forms.  What benefits are there for me?  We want all Unrulies to have a brilliant work life balance, so we offer a range of benefits such as; Flexible working as standard including core hours and remote/home working Summer/Fireside Fridays- leave at 3pm to start your weekend early at certain times of the year Your health is important to us- that’s why we provide private healthcare as well as a confidential employee assistance programme No need to worry about holidays- we give you 25 days paid leave and the option to buy/sell 5 more And if you wanted to extend your holiday a bit more - we offer you the chance to work remotely from one of Unruly’s global offices
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

and auction markets, keep abreast of market happenings and collector activities, and help develop insights that are relevant to Christie's client engagement efforts •               Help identify high description: Founded in 2015 to address the unmet financing needs of SMEs, Validus is today the largest online lending marketplace in Singapore with a growing presence in Indonesia, Vietnam and Thailand.  An award-winning Fintech, Validus uses data analytics and AI to provide growth financing to SMEs via funds from HNWIs and institutional investors. Backed by global VCs, our mission is to drive financial inclusion for SMEs through technology, data and industry collaboration.  As with the SMEs we serve, we may be small but together we are a mighty force! Our success is dependent on what each of us does, how we do it, and our belief that we can always do better. We’re building a strong team of passionate, capable individuals who are committed to making Validus the best online lending marketplace in the region.  As Client Acquisition Manager, you will be responsible for the sales of Validus’ unsecured financing solutions to SMEs. Validus’ products include invoice financing, purchase order financing and working capital loans. This role will focus on client acquisition activities only with minimal account management.  Key Responsibilities Acquire new SME clients through cold calling, networking, and referrals Provide needs-based financing solutions to new and existing SME clients through cross-selling and upselling Administer the onboarding of and loan disbursement from five new SME clients every month Ensure all sales processes are properly documented and close any gaps in the client acquisition cycle – from onboarding of new SME borrower to first loan disbursement  Requirements Degree in Accountancy / Finance / Business Administration is preferred 1 - 2 years of experience in Retail Banking with some SME Lending background 3 - 5 years of experience in SME lending / Business Banking is preferred Acquire new SME clients through cold calling, networking, and referrals Provide needs-based financing solutions to new and existing SME clients through cross-selling and upselling Ensure completion of daily targets of thirty to fifty cold calls and two meetings Administer the onboarding of and loan disbursement from five new SME clients every month Ensure all sales processes are properly documented and close any gaps in the client acquisition cycle – from onboarding of new SME borrower to first loan disbursement

description: A quick snapshot...  You stare at your laptop, poring over the same sales data you’ve been looking at quarter after quarter. You’re focused on putting statuses together to report progress on your deals. Your KPIs are quarterly at best, but more likely monthly or weekly. Your thoughts wander, yearning for more purpose. You’re an accomplished salesperson, having closed deals large complex deals, networking with the key retail leaders in your territory. You have your own personal brand equity. You’re looking for a role that truly takes advantage of all that experience. Not just to close more deals, but to grow a business. You’re your stamp and build a market.  If this is you, then welcome to Aptos.  Here’s what we expect...  Know your market. Know what it takes to make it successful, the things that work well, the things that need improving, and the things that need a total overhaul.  A voice. You know what it takes to get it done. You don’t need a playbook. Then use your voice to articulate your passion, your plans and your promise. You do that and rest assured the Aptos team will be 100% behind you.  Responsibilities Include Review the allocated territory and develop a well thought-out, robust sales strategy that maximizes the business opportunities identified and ensures sales goals are met Expertly lead and manage the sales cycle for all customers and prospects within the territory; follow up leads, call on clients and prospects per business plans, respond to RFPs, create and deliver proposal presentations, and work closely with clients until close Confidently orchestrate the necessary resources to provide high quality and accurate answers to tender offers (RFP and/or RFI) and any other request coming from clients Have an exemplary knowledge of the allocated territory, enabling all opportunities for sales to be quickly and efficiently identified and acted upon Develop close strategic relationships with customers, prospects, suspects and other third parties and execute a large and deep account management of their clients to make sure the company is well perceived at every level of their organization, maintaining contact with all clients in the market area to ensure high levels of client satisfaction Maintain accurate records within the CRM and provide timely feedback to management regarding performance, opportunities and risks, including maintaining an accurate forecast Here’s what skills you’ll need... 5-10 Years’ experience selling retail software Strong retail network that can be leveraged to build pipeline Proven track record of exceeding quota consistently Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills Have an entrepreneurial mindset and be a self-starter, having the ability to keep things organized and prioritize tasks effectively Be a team player and understand the need to operate as one, working close with both sales and delivery teams Proficient understanding of retail software ideally core products such as POS, Planning, Omni-Channel Proficiency in MS Office and Salesforce Process orientated – strong hunter mentality. Need to be customer facing and have a strong focus on business development Experience in selling SaaS Passion. We know it when we see it. Passion is not saying how much you love what you do in your most excited voice. Passion is revealed in your truest self. It’s about what you’ve accomplished; how you want to grow; the ideas you have; your philosophies. It’s demonstrating through your words and your actions that you truly believe in what you do -- and where you work. That it matters to you. And that’s pretty cool.  Resourcefulness and application. At Aptos, we have a pioneering spirit -- when we have questions, we find answers; when we’re faced with challenges, we find solutions. We turn to a variety of resources, including our own colleagues, our professional network, the Internet, articles and books -- whatever helps us get the job done. But’s it’s not just about using a variety of resources to gain knowledge -- it’s also about applying that knowledge to other areas of the job or business where it might make sense.  Initiative. You don’t wait around for things to happen or for your manager to tell you what to do. You’re not only proactive about completing your own work, but when you sense the need to introduce a project that will benefit the team or the organization -- even if it’s outside your scope of work -- you put a proposal together, talk to the team about it, and own it. And that also goes back to having a pioneering spirit.  Quality orientation. You rarely make mistakes because you have good processes in place to ensure that every last detail is correct. There’s hardly an error that gets past you -- even when you’re under pressure to complete something in a very short timeframe.  Did we pique your interest?  If this sounds like the kind of job you would love in the kind of environment you would thrive in, please drop us a line -- we’d love to hear from you!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Are you a motivated and adaptable Business Development Manager who wants to make a difference and grow in a role that can provide you with an opportunity to lead a team of your own? Come and join our sales team in a diverse role offering you a chance to be a leader in your region and tap into your strength of relationship management and business development!     The Royal Caribbean International brand, with its HQ in Miami, operates 26 ships around the world and carries over 1 million guests per year. Known for its innovation and industry-leading operational and environmental standards, the brand holds The Best Cruise Line Overall award for 16 years running. In Australia alone, Royal Caribbean International has won several significant titles including Best Cruise Operator (8 consecutive years running) at the National Travel Industry Awards and recently voted Australia’s leading cruise line at the CLIA industry awards   JOB DESCRIPTION: Reporting to the Director of Sales for Asia Pacific, this position will lead an assigned team to spearhead business development and to serve as primary sales & operational growth engine for the International Representatives (IR) and Preferred Sales Representatives in South APAC.  Your duties will be (but not limited to): Responsible for profitable revenue generation from assigned trade partners in the assigned territories for Royal Caribbean International Cruise brand.  Manage and assess total investment spend including overrides, tactical programs and marketing co-op to maximize ROI Responsible for physical in-market engagement with the trade partners and provide training to ensure complete transfer of knowledge of the company, brand and update our clients with the latest information on itineraries, pricing and product enhancements. Conduct business reviews with trade partners to assess business performance and identify opportunities to exceed targets Coordinate all sales meeting and conference, trade shows and other sales activities within the South APAC region. This will involve managing and conducting cruise shows, seminars onboard, ship tours product training with our International Representatives and Preferred Sales Representatives and doing sales presentations for clients.  SKILLS/QUALIFICAITON REQUIRED: Min 3 years’ experience in a Business Development (or equivalent to) position Travel industry experience is desirable but not mandatory Multi-national (via either work or education) will be highly regarded Bachelor’s degree Trade partner, Distributor management or managing external parties/agency experience essential Resourceful and adaptable. Thinking outside of the box approach along with a go -getter attitude Team player mentality but also able to function as a sole contributor Strong negotiation skills that can manage expectations of all external and internal key stakeholders Solid communicator and the ability to build good relationships Fluent English language skills (both written and verbal)   WHY WORK FOR US: Royal Caribbean was named again for the 5th time, one of the world's most ethical companies along with our CEO Richard Fain being named Glassdoor's Top 100 CEO's in 2021.  We continue to provide our employees with training and development both in-house & externally to ensure a continuous development. In our Sydney office, we value a flexible work approach, ensuring our employees wellbeing comes first.   ﻿Application Process: Once you click through to Apply, you will be required to create a profile in order to continue with the submission of your CV. This should take no longer than 5 mins to complete. All shortlisted candidates will be required to partake in a 30 mins video screening via MS Teams.

Job Advert  JOB PURPOSE  The Strategic Account Manager role is responsible for organic growth of existing account with an average order value between £10,000 and £100,000. The role is responsible for between 80-100 accounts each so a balanced approach to increasing spend and reducing churn in needed to be successful. The role doesn’t contain any new business but is expected to deliver growth on the existing book through effective data licensing, cross-selling and up-selling.  Fastmarkets is equally about sales performance and sales behaviors, it is crucial that anyone stepping into this role understand and respects that how Fastmarkets grows is as important as how much we grow. Within those behaviors we expect full collaboration, a customer centric approach and a first class communication style both internally and externally.  Principal Accountabilities  As a Strategic Account Manager, you will be accountable for delivery in the following areas;  Sales Performance Meets and exceeds revenue quota through the management and execution of the sales process Employs consultative sales techniques to manage renewals, generate new opportunities and drive growth Increases sales of new and non-benchmark services to new and existing users, divisions and locations Grows revenue but with a focus on retention of existing business Planning Create a sales plan for pool for the short-term and long-term Must have a strong skillset in pipeline management and forecasting Map territory completely including product and data white space opportunities for cross-sell and upsell Fully utilize Salesforce (no exceptions) for Lead to order process, pipeline management, forecasting Develop and regularly updates comprehensive customer-centric account sales strategy/ plan that is established in collaboration with customer and key stakeholders to ensure alignment with client needs Personal Development Takes ownership of their own personal development to constantly learn, develop and contribute to the wider team’s development Continually seek to improve your knowledge of Fastmarkets products Understand how the economy and major ‘market moves’ can impact clients and the metal markets as a whole Master your understanding of the market sector(s) allocated Customer Relationships Establishes and maintains a good rapport with senior contacts (C-Level) across key divisions and regions and works as a trusted advisor to clients Conducts high-level customer-facing presentations and new product development discussions Understands the dynamics and nuances of a regulated markets Leads and drives benchmark penetration and price adoption Attends conferences within territory and represents the company, brand and product offering Leverages the knowledge built on clients and input provided from key stakeholders from other functions Can work across functions and collaborate internally so as to provide utmost value to customer and draw best results Ensures full awareness of the company’s short, medium and long term goals and that territory plan aligns with these Communication and collaboration Close communication with Fastmarkets sales team and other Fastmarkets departments Understand the impact of your performance to the business as a whole Work effectively with the Editorial, Price Development, MBR & Marketing teams to drive value and performance results Can work in a team environment and closely with Account Manager of the region to build a sound and consistent strategy for the region Develops and evolves best practice to ensure the sales operations are as effective as possible Reporting Take full ownership and accountability for reporting your performance and working with Salesforce to best uncover opportunity Monthly activity reporting with feedback on client and market developments that are business impacting Provides accurate forecasting and manages pipeline effectively KEY INTERFACES Sales Enablement Marketing Team Pricing & Research Teams Sales Operations Customers Success Product Team Operations Team Commercial Finance Team Compliance & Legal Teams KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS  Experience  The Strategic Account Manager will have 5-6 years of experience in managing and growing a 80+ Accounts book through strategic account plans, building deep client relationships and a thorough understanding of clients workflow. Excellent communications skills are required, as this job entails face-to-face meetings, high level presentations and demonstrations of our services to key stakeholders across multiple regions.  Skills  Essential First-class and experienced Account Manager Experienced managing complex customers Experience growing a £1m book of business Experience with growing £10,000+ accounts Proven ability to deliver accurate forecasting and pipeline management Strong track-record of using CRM and data to improve sales performance Good to have Commodity market experience Data licencing experience Salesforce experience Korean and Japanese Language skills strongly preferred due to the territory coverage

description: General Description  The Strategic Account Manager (SAM) is the assigned manager for one or more designated Regional Accounts (APAC based), acting as the main point of contact between the client & ICD BU level Account Manager/Sales. The ultimate objective of this role is to lead on higher level of BD, hence to maximize revenue and profits of one account.  This is achieved by building long term relationships with clients, providing value-added services, and exploiting advance BD opportunities to expand and grow the business. It is the Strategic Account Manager’s responsibility to manage all aspects related to assigned account with BU Account Manager/Sales including all communications with the client, learning & manage their requirements, leading regional bidding strategies, master pricing & service agreement establishment, coordinating internally across functional departments, and finally ensuring the timely delivery of services to the client.  Major Responsibilities Identify and pursue new business opportunities/ BD from the accounts regionally. Work with management team and BU Sales team on strategic issues to strengthen ICD’s position. To seek every opportunity to promote ICD Premium Service as added value selling. Negotiate and lead business discussion at regional level on behalf of ICD. Overseeing BU Sales & Service team to ensure service and project timely delivery, high quality installation, and professional level. Identifies potential project risks and develops/implements strategies to minimize impact and control deviations from estimated costs and project deadlines. Document all important account-related information in the “Account Handbook” and store all documentation in an online “Account Folder” for company records Act as account owner in managing one account’s documentation (including pricing consistency, system & requirements standard, client relationship) Keep all incoming opportunities updated on the company’s database. Conduct regular meeting with related Account Manager/Sales assigned for one account (including general updates, coordination, and feedback sharing). Direct responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with the clients. Overall responsibility for customer satisfaction on all installed accounts. Regularly meets with clients to ensure quality installations and meeting their individual needs. Conducts follow-up reviews of solutions to verify that desired objectives were accomplished effectively and efficiently. Manage client expectations to increase value recognition and client satisfaction, with ultimate objective to expand the business regionally. Proactively communicates with and seek feedback from clients. Drives outstanding client’s value and loyalty. Track all documentation related to the client including weekly project updates, service case reports, etc with each BU Account Manager/ Sales. Prepare and send out quarterly reports to clients summarizing recent developments, project information, and security system updates. Assists in the analysis and documentation of the feasibility of technology solutions for a specific account. Performs other duties and responsibilities as requested or required. Skills And Knowledge Leadership Orientation - Actively seeks ways in which to act as a role model, guide, develop and mentor others within the organization. Analytical Thinking - Logically breaks down problems and looks for solutions. Strong communication, both written and oral as well as presentation skills, negotiation skills, work ethic, and personal motivation. Brainstorming, problem solving, and analytical skills. Knowledge of client team, corporate strategy, and security standards. Knowledge of security products, systems, design concepts, and market situation. Knowledge of account management concepts, procedures and tools. Ensure appropriate protection of customer personnel, information, and property, both real and intellectual. Interested candidate please send resume to jobs.singapore@icdsecurity.com  Tags: singaporeposition

description: Want to be on the forefront for Parcel Perform's product for B2B software solutions in e-commerce logistics?  Parcel Perform is looking for an amazing team member to support us on the sales front!  We are a dynamic, fast-growing team that’s excited about e-commerce and logistics, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology. Join us in our journey to drive Parcel Perform’s growth in the e-commerce market.  WE NEED YOU ON OUR TEAM!  All our outstanding solutions and happy customers are looking for a Parcel Perform counterpart that can assist in their onboarding, keeps a close eye on their account and advises them on further potential use cases to expand their feature use on the platform. If have knowledge in the arena of tech SaaS products, B2B sales, and account management experience and are ready to go above and beyond for our clients, this role might be for you.  In short, you will be the key driver for Parcel Perform success in the following ways: Managing relationships and processes in the onboarding of clients: Onboarding of new customers can involve multiple parties on their and our side. We are looking for a well organised Account Manager that can be a knowledgeable counterpart to guide them through the onboarding process and service them throughout their Parcel Perform journey. Manage portfolio of existing enterprise customers to make them successful: You build strong long-term relationship with all key stakeholders, being the first point of contact for any of their inquiries. You will establish a trusted/strategic adviser relationship with each key customer and drive continued value of Parcel Performs products and services. As part of your role, you will work with customers to establish critical goals, or other key performance indicators and aid the customer in achieving their business goals. Ensuring you are aware of all competitive activities within accounts and work with the customer success team to prevent attrition. Leverage upsell opportunities: You love advising customers on new features and use cases within our platform to drive our upsell opportunity into new features or higher subscriptions and convert existing customers to annual subscriptions. In summary, you will be a business-critical part of our team, focusing on the customers and making them successful in order to cater to the long-term growth of Parcel Perform. key initial prospecting as much as the first key outreach to ensure a constant lead flow for our business managers to follow up. Your strong organization and writing-skills as well as your high interpersonal competence will ensure our constant customer growth.  WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING ALONG!  About  You need to feel the same way about our offering and bring along the following things  We at Parcel Perform believe in innovation, energy and resourcefulness for everything we do. We will not stop to deliver an outstanding product that we can be proud of and need you to help us to inform the world. Minimum 3 years of experience in SaaS / IT sales or account management; eCommerce experience a plus Previous experience with SaaS contracts / subscription models a plus Readiness to go the extra mile for our customers around the world. Experience navigating through multiple decision makers and influencers within a large Enterprise environment World-class interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effortlessly make complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple Exceptional fluency and articulation in English (both spoken and written) Highly self motivated and ambitious in achieving goals. Strong team player but still a self-starter Well structured with the ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple projects/deals at the same time High interpersonal skills, ability to identify the needs of our prospects A willingness to keep learning and pushing yourself to higher and higher levels WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE IN RETURN! The opportunity to work in a fast-growing, super exciting and innovative business that will revolutionize the e-commerce logistics industry. You will be the needle of success on the growth of a global product that will become a key platform behind successful e-commerce logistics worldwide. The ability to continuously learn and develop in an international setting with you being a critical driver behind the success of us achieving our mission. An environment where everybody never stops growing, and focuses on succeeding - we continuously work with you on your strengths and weaknesses across many important dimensions, and look at ways for you to address them and further your development. Your entry ticket into being part of the Parcel Perform journey, where you will work with and alongside people from around the world that share the same passion and dedication. About Us  Parcel Perform is the leading delivery experience platform. It enables modern e-commerce enterprises to create unique end-to-end customer journeys and optimize logistics operations with powerful data integrations, parcel tracking, delivery notifications and logistics performance reports in real-time. Parcel Perform believes in growing our dynamic and diverse team with the best talent to assist our global expansion. For more information, please visit www.parcelperform.com

description: Summary Role: Inside Sales Consultant (i.e. Sales Development Representative) / Team: Real Estate Status: Full-Time / Start Date: ASAP Location: 380 Jalan Besar, Singapore 209000, SG (Lavender Area)  About Propseller Propseller is the "Modern Real Estate Agency that Stands by You". Our mission is to help our clients achieve the most when making one of the biggest financial decisions of their life: selling, buying, or renting real estate. We do that by offering them the state of the art real estate agent service of the 21st century: highly valuable, completely transparent, and fairly priced. A service that will, hopefully, make them love real estate agents (again).  At Propseller, we are building the first technology-powered real estate brokerage in South-East Asia. We elevate the most human part of the service with top agents you can trust. Then, we industrialise all the rest with technology and centralised operations. By rethinking the way properties are transacted, keeping what works, and changing what doesn't, we are able to deliver more while charging less. In Singapore, where we currently operate, that means we sell homes 2 times faster for only 1% commission (vs. 2% standard), saving people S$10,000 per transaction on average.  Are you looking for the “next big thing”? Real Estate is the largest asset class on Earth and we are on a mission to make it better. Do you enjoy learning and growing every day in a dynamic start-up environment? We have assembled a highly driven "AAA" team of real estate, growth, and technology professionals. Our current team members studied at top universities (NUS, NTU, SMU, INSEAD, ESSEC, St Gallen, etc.), and founded/were early employees in top startups (Shopback, Zalora, Groupon, etc.)  In June 2020, Propseller was one of the 8 SEA startups selected to be part of the first cohort of the accelerator Iterative. In July 2020, Propseller was ranked #15 in TechInAsia's ranking of Top 50 rising startups in Southeast Asia. In October 2020, Propseller announced a S$1.7m Seed Round from top VCs such as Target Global, Sequoia Capital, Hustle Fund and high-profile angel investors from Lazada, Google, Expedia, Sotheby's, PropNex, PropertyGuru, and DotProperty. The fundraising was covered by The Business Times. As of September 2021, we are a team of 30+ people. To support our growth, we are hiring another 20 people as-soon-as-possible. We are multi-cultural and we collectively speak a total of 9 different languages. We enjoy having fun while working hard in a diverse environment. We are assembling an A-team and are hiring the best for every role.  Interested in knowing more? Check our Careers Page (https://propseller.com/careers/)  Role Description We are looking for a self-starter, and highly ambitious hustler to accelerate our growth and bring in more property owners and seekers to the top of the funnel. As an Inside Sales Consultant, you are responsible for managing the pre-sales consultative selling process from initial contact with clients to introduction to one of Propseller's in-house Real Estate Consultants (i.e. property agents). You are responsible to handle inbound leads coming directly to our website (80%) while also generating some outbound leads by yourself (20%). You will consult and advise clients about their sale/lease (one of the most important financial decisions of a lifetime), assist them in matching them with their perfect Real Estate Consultant and follow up with both the clients and consultants until the transaction is closed.  Duties & Responsibilities Manage the pre-sales process via various channels: calls, emails, chat, etc Introduce Propseller's services and value proposition in a pitch to potential clients Provide thorough advice about the property market, regulations, and transaction's steps (you'll get intensive training) Convert Marketing Qualified Leads who have contacted us after visiting our website, or other channels into Sales Qualified Leads who will meet one of our Real Estate Consultants Make 40+ calls daily, both warm and cold Lead demand generation initiatives from ideation to execution Build strong relationships with clients and colleagues Represent Propseller with top-level professionalism Drive Propseller revenue growth by over-achieving KPIs and milestones Propose, launch and deliver commercial and operational projects  Requirements Bachelor degree + at least 1-year experience in sales, support, customer service, hospitality, or real estate OR Polytechnic diploma + at least 3 years experience in sales, support, customer service, hospitality, or real estate Fluent English Residency status: Singaporean or Singapore PR (is required to pass RES license) Exceptional poise and presence on the phone The drive to maintain 40+ calls per day Multitasking, structured, autonomous, self-starter, tech-savvy Flexibility to contribute to our effort to be open 7/7, 9 to 9 Nice to Have (not required): Real Estate experience/license & car/motorbike license.  You Get Central, iconic office near Lavender, Bendemeer, and Farrer Park MRTs All training provided (Sales, Real Estate, CRMs). Be ready to learn a lot State-of-the-art-tools: MacBook Pro, Jabra Headset, fully-integrated CRM, etc At least two days home-office per week after training, more possible Opportunity to make history and help thousands of people with the biggest financial decision of a lifetime Inside Sales Consultants are Propseller's next generation of Inside Sales Team Leaders and Real Estate Consultants.  Recruiting Process Ideal length: 2 weeks If your application is selected: Three questions to be answered via email Interview 1 – Video Call: Introductory call Case to be prepared at home Interview 2 – Physical: Case presentation Interview 3 – Physical: Meet with our CEO Welcome aboard!  Salary: SGD 3,500 to SGD 4,500 On-Target-Earnings (i.e. base + unlimited bonus) + stock options.
industries: Real Estate, Internet, and Commercial Real Estate

description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Regional Business Development Senior Specialist within the team will focus on both B2B & B2C client acquisitions within SEA, ranging from medium/ large e-commerce brands to consolidators & social commerce sellers. This will help to achieve our goal of revenue diversification through increased acquisitions. This individual will be expected to achieve revenue targets by upselling Ninja Van's sea freight and air freight solutions & manage account servicing duties.  Responsibilities Prospect and identify target client segments Manage the entire sales pipeline from lead generation, pitching , prospecting, closing to onboarding Assist on designing acquisition strategies and implement best in-class acquisition processes Provide inputs to marketing/ commercial teams to develop marketing campaigns to ensure generation of a healthy lead pipeline Identify new business opportunities and upsell new services, to grow and extract revenue opportunities from existing clients Meet and exceed monthly sales targets Take ownership of and manage relationships with high volume (existing) key accounts and acquired small / medium clients, to ensure commercial and operational success Preparation of required materials for Client Presentations (e.g. Monthly Business Reviews), see through the required actionable (often revolving operational and commercial issues) with the relevant internal stakeholders in the organization Maintain well organized, up-to-date and accurate sales information and activity reports in Salesforce CRM system Provide excellent client service, and deliver operational insights using qualitative and quantitative data to troubleshoot and address issues affecting account performance Independently manage commercial negotiations with incoming leads/ existing clients by coordinating with internal commercial teams Requirements Minimally a Bachelors' Degree with at least 2 years of relevant experience in a Logistics / e-commerce company handling cross border logistics products Well versed in both sides of the hunter and farmer landscape of client acquisition/servicing Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to influence senior stakeholders in client organizations Well-versed in English & Mandarin to liaise with Mandarin speaking clients Applicants of all nationalities welcomed but should already be residing in Singapore physically Demonstrated experience in executing complex multi-stakeholder commercial and operational projects Good understanding of cross border related operations and solutions Advantageous to have exposure to working across geographies, teams and individuals Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

jobTitle: Sales & Operations Program Manager, Channel Partner - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Sales & Operations Program Manager, Channel Partner - Singapore  Additional Role Description  The Partnerships Strategy & Operations (PSO) team provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  Channel Partner works with companies who bundle and integrate Google Ads products with their own to deliver value to their customer base. We partner with technology platform companies including eCommerce, Ad Tech, Marketing Automation segments, among others, who serve millions of customers primarily through their online offerings.  As part of Partnership Strategy & Operations (PSO), you'll help to set the strategy and ensure implementation of the go-to-market for Google’s Channel Partner business. You will work as part of the Revenue Programs team, a central team responsible for strategy and operations across Google Customer Solutions programs. The team leads the design and planning for programs that generate incremental business growth for Google. We work in partnership with cross-­functional teams across Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Engineering.  Responsibilities Build annual APAC-regional business plan around strategic big bets with business growth forecast. Develop innovative strategies and solutions to accelerate business growth, and design sales initiatives to capture growth opportunities locally and globally. Identify opportunities for program and process improvement, with a focus on driving business growth. Lead and manage the successful execution of global programs within the APAC region. Work with cross-functional teams to design and execute projects, driving recommendations through to implementation. Partner with the Senior Channel Partner leadership to identify strategic opportunities for business growth and drive business execution efficiency. Communicate findings to leadership and to a broader set of stakeholders by preparing polished presentations. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in management consulting, corporate strategy, finance, investment banking, business operations or equivalent sales operations or project management experience. Preferred Qualifications Experience with SQL. Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate with diverse stakeholders and present to executives. Self-directed individual, with the ability to thrive in an unstructured environment; comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are looking for a high-performing Sales Account Manager who fits our culture. We are from a fast-growing IT Solution Company with a vision to be the leading IT service provider for the business community in Southeast Asia. We are focusing on our growth at the moment and are expecting exponential growth in the coming years.  If you are the candidate we’re looking for, you are a strong relationship builder, entrepreneurial-minded, fast learner, sociable, and influential. You truly care about customers and want the best for them. You are excited about helping companies and entrepreneurs grow their businesses through proven IT solutions.  You are driven, focused, and have high standards. You are systematic and goal-oriented and enjoy building relationships with both customers and colleagues. You seek to understand them more so that you can recommend the best solutions to them. You have a proven track record of success in sales or business development and/or a strong desire to learn and succeed.  You Would Describe Yourself As Tenacious about results-driven to achieve goals and constantly improving yourself; Outgoing and persuasive - you are great at connecting with people online or in-person; Organized and systematic - follow-up, scheduling, keeping the ball moving, tracking results; Persistent and proactive - making the calls, following-up, staying positive; A relationship builder - customers trust you and know you have their best interests in mind; Some Key Responsibilities Of This Role Generate and nurture leads for effective conversion to new customers Collaborate with strategic partners who refer us partners Outbound cold calls or visits to companies from our target industries Conduct effective sales presentations, negotiations, and prepare sales proposals with a strong value proposition Achieve sales revenue targets through servicing of new customers and existing clients Establish rapport and develop strong relationships with clients and identify opportunities to grow their accounts. Prepare quotations based on clients’ requirements Build strong relationships with our existing team, learn their stories and their clients’ stories to show how we consistently deliver results to our clients Prepare weekly pipeline progress reports Ensuring excellent delivery standards to customers, accurate billing, and following up on account receivables Maintain awareness of potential issues faced by the customers and team and be quick to take action to resolve these issues Be willing to learn and be coachable to constantly improve yourself Perks Supportive and tight-knit working relationships Quality training both on technical aspects and sales/soft skills Growth, advancement, recognition, and awards Attractive commission for performers Make a huge difference by helping your clients’ companies grow and impacting their lives More personal and professional growth than you can imagine Qualifications O’ Level and above 3+ years experience in the full sales cycle in the IT industry including deal closing Demonstrated sales success Strong ability to manage time and prioritise tasks Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills CRM experience is preferred Competent in Microsoft word, excel & PowerPoint
