jobTitle: Account Strategist, Managed Agency, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Account Strategist, Managed Agency, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  The Managed Agency Sales team is a high performing Sales team that drives customer success by partnering with a wide range of independent agencies in Singapore, Malaysia, and Philippines.  Our Agency Account Strategists are ambitious and customer focused front-line sellers who serve as the face of Google, promoting and cross-selling the best solutions Google has to offer. As an Account Strategist, you will activate initiatives across both agency and end customers via improving account and campaign performance, driving thoughtful Google product adoption, and designing short, medium, and long-term strategies to meet customer business objectives. You will collaborate with our teams of technicians, analysts, and solution specialists to analyze and solve customer challenges, capitalizing on industry opportunities, and delivering great sales experience.  Responsibilities Deliver against quarterly business and product growth goals for the Singapore market Own a portfolio of independent media agencies and customers, and maintain a healthy and predictable pipeline by thoroughly understanding growth drivers, identifying opportunities for growth, managing risks, and building multi-quarter plans for achievement Drive customer growth by delivering outstanding customer experience, achieving customer business and marketing objectives, and co-create strategies with customers and agencies for opportunities that contribute to exceeding goals Pitch and provide strategic recommendations to help customers and agencies to get the best Return on Investment on their advertising, and solve partner business challenges using critical thinking and teamwork to produce industry leading media plans Implement creative ways to improve our agency relationships, tailor and pitch performance-enhancing suggestions, and promote other Google products Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 3 years of experience in Digital Media and/or Advertising Sales Preferred Qualifications Experience strategically assessing and achieving customer success via sales techniques, (including effective questioning, objection managing, competitive selling) in order to influence executive business leaders, manage pipeline, and establish agreements Experience in technology or advertising sales, with knowledge/experience of agency ecosystem, while partnering with cross-functional partners, advertisers, agencies, and influencing executive-level stakeholders Expertise in managing digital advertising campaigns with a focus on performance marketing Knowledge of online marketing strategy and tactics Ability to own a portfolio in advertising or media sales, and consistently exceed business goals to drive growth Excellent communication, collaboration, and relationship management skills
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Responsibilities:  Reporting to the Head of Trade Marketing / Trade Marketing Manager, you are responsible for planning and executing the trade marketing strategies and plans for the assigned category and brand portfolio. Other responsibilities are:  Assist to manage a customer management business process which ensures effective communication and liaison between Sales, Marketing and other departments in order to optimize key business opportunities. Analyse both internal and external sales (Sell-in, Sell Through and AC Nielsen retail data) to identify distribution gaps, threats and opportunities for the channels / retailers in your assigned portfolio. Develop, plan and execute channel strategies and trade promotions for the key accounts and trade channel to achieve sales objectives. Ensure these strategies are in tandem with the positioning and potential of the accounts / channels. Monitor competitive activities and submit monthly report to track frequency and types of promotions taking place in the various trade sectors, documenting such activities for analysis, reporting and future referencing purposes Work with Demand Planner to monitor and improve accuracy of category sales forecast by channel & chain, in accordance to the monthly forecast schedule.  Identify sales gaps and work with the respective Key Account Executive / Manager to propose close gap measures. Take initiative to discuss and develop plans to assist Brand Manager and Key Account Manager to maximize the category potential in each of the retail account.   Identify customers who do not meet the Company’s guidelines and recommend action to improve level of requirements. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of trade promotions and in-store promotions to determine whether these meet the Company’ objectives, and make recommendations for future promotions. Interact with Sales & Marketing regarding deadlines / lead time required for promotions, pack / price changes, new products, POSM and others in order to ensure on-time and effective implementation. Monitor and implement price surveys on selected competitive brands to track and graph trends over periods of time, for purposes of recommending for pricing strategies based on information received. Consolidate internal price control program for your assigned product categories, and administering pricing alignment between Key accounts. To support new product launches via new distribution tracking, planograms, in-store visibility drive and timely roll-out in the trade. Any other duties assigned by the Management.   Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Sales or Management Relevant experience: minimum 2 years of Trade Marketing or Category experience in FMCG environment. Relevant exposure 1 to 2 years’ experience in Marketing and Sales functions will can be considered for the role. Strong Interpersonal & Analytical skills. Good presentation and communication skills Proficient in Excel & PowerPoint tools. Able to multi tasks in fast pace environment.

In 2021, we are pursuing our ambitions to continue to enable organizations' digital transformation. We are looking for our new Regional Pre-Sales Consultant in Singapore to join Axway's family. Are you ready? Join us now!!!  Together we can. Together we will. Axway is an enterprise integration company that's been around for over 20 years to digitally transform enterprises of all sizes - more than 11,000 in 100 countries at last count. Axway revitalizes heritage IT infrastructures to enable brilliant digital customer experiences, unlock new business innovation and capabilities, and put companies on a secure, future-proof path for growth.  You'll exchange ideas with a culturally rich global community of over 1,800 members who connect remotely or show up onsite in virtually every time zone on the planet. And you'll have the support and camaraderie of your Axway leadership and colleagues to serve as a reminder that you're not alone on your journey, and that every day, you've taken one more step forward. With Axway, you'll go far because we're better together. Learn more: www.axway.com.   Your role : Provides technical expertise to support sales of Axway Digital MFT solution Collaborates between Sales, Services Engineering, Support, and Channel partners to address customer needs in a complex solution Reports directly to Presales Director in the APAC region   Responsibilities : Focus on targeting the Managed File Transfer buyer role at the customers from business line buyers to technical buyers. Provide technical expertise to support sales activities and consultancy Support Channel partners sales capabilities and enable newly on-board partners Demonstrate awareness of competitive products and their strategies Develop and Maintain detailed knowledge of Axway suite of products Proactively scopes the technical solution required to address customer requirements, assesses customers’ needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Axway. Coordinates with internal sales, sales support, service resources, and Channel partners to align solution design with customers’ business requirements Opportunistically pursues additional business development opportunities within existing customers.  Conduct business and product presentations or demonstrations to customers Help Product Management to understand the business and technical functionality required for Axway Digital MFT in APAC Contribute to marketing campaigns and events   Accountabilities & Performance measures Support sales targets for the assigned geography, channel, sales team, or account base Maintains high satisfaction ratings from customer and Channel partners Completes required training and development objectives within the assigned time frame  Organizational Alignment Reports to the Presales Director, APAC Works closely and collaboratively with the sales team in South Asia, Australia, and New Zealand (ANZ) region This position may be assigned to support another geography in the APAC region  Qualifications : Obtained Tertiary degree from an accredited institution Minimum 8 years experience in either pre-sales or sales support role for integration/middleware solutions such as MFT or similar technologies. Additional understanding of API Management solutions is preferable. Good knowledge of network and IT security is mandatory Understands the limitations of traditional MFT offerings Familiar with DevOps integration and processes Understands hybrid integration platform and cloud storage Experience in operational analytics would be a plus  Ability to travel internationally at short notice on a regular basis Ability to motivate self and work independently with little supervision to provide sales support and develop sales opportunities Possess excellent presentation, writing skills, communication skills, written and verbal Ability to present confidentially and pitch ideas at a different levels of the audience Willingness to continuously learn and develop new skills and a professional image Ability to listen, analyze, discuss and apply a consultative selling approach to promote the best solution for the customer's requirements. Ability to lead and contribute effectively in a team environment  Axway is an EEO and AA Employer.

description: Who We Are  Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Burger King, Delivery Hero, HBO Max, Mercari, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, hundreds of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 3 billion active users through Braze.  Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Forrester Wave™: Cross-Channel Campaign Management (Independent Platforms), Q3 2021, and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for the fourth consecutive year. The company has also been selected as one of Fortune’s Best Workplace for Millennials in 2021, and was ranked #20 on Fortune’s Best Medium Sized Workplaces in 2021. Braze is certified as a Great Place to Work in the UK and the U.S. and is recognized as one of the UK's Best Workplaces for Women.  What You’ll Do  We are looking for an experienced Manager to sit within our Alliances organisation and report into the VP of Global Solutions Alliances. This experienced partnerships leader will scale and expand on the success of an established agency partner program across the APAC region.  The Partner Account Manager will help to evolve the agency alliance strategy and action partner GTM plans. You will acquire and onboard new agency partners, whilst also managing and growing relationships with an existing patch of agency/consulting partners. You will be responsible for driving the development and management of our key strategic alliances, as well as our regional boutique agency and consultancy relationships.  This role works very closely with our Sales organization; both our APAC leadership on our program strategy, as well as our APAC Account Executives on sourcing new business pipeline and influencing pipeline via our agency partners. This role is largely measured on quality pipeline generation, which is created through deploying strategic GTM programs with our partners and field sales teams.  Key Responsibilities Include Developing and managing comprehensive GTM plans with our agency partners, which manifest in quality net-new business pipeline Supporting the sales cycle alongside our sales teams, from prospecting to deal close, in collaboration with our agency partners Advancing differentiated value propositions and specialism with key strategic agency partners, and articulating that story internally at Braze and with our agency partner organisations, and ultimately evangelizing the story in the market Ensuring partnership accountability and reciprocity, with measured flow of outsourced Braze services in exchange for net-new client opportunities from our agency partners Reviewing sales play metrics and effectiveness on a recurring basis with agency partners and Braze leadership. Maintain CRM reporting and dashboards that communicate to leadership the effectiveness of GTM sales plays with our agency partners. Collaborating cross-functionally with other Braze departments and divisions, including Tech and Cloud Partnerships, Partner Marketing, Partner Education & Enablement, etc. What You Bring 3+ years of partnerships experience in a modern cloud technology company. Agency/Consultancy experience is a plus. Demonstrable proof of producing measurable sourced pipeline and influenced revenue results via a mature SaaS partner program/playbook. A strong bias for execution and are motivated by exceeding targets and results. Deep knowledge of the agency and marketing services ecosystem. Understanding of service offering creation, marketing, lead generation, and professional services organization key performance indicators. Experience working with agencies and consultancies, and intimate knowledge of agency org structure, business dynamics, and effective business case development. Executive presence and an ability to present and vision-sell to Executive audiences Ability to lead through ambiguity, take on complex strategic and operational initiatives and scale effectively across a large organization and distributed team Strong drive and character qualities that match with Braze Core Values What We Offer Competitive compensation that includes equity Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.  If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Company Our client is an innovative adtech firm that connects brands to consumers by bridging the gap between digital advertising and the real-world. Their aim is to help brand partners achieve their goals by delivering advertising that drives more customers to stores, dealerships and restaurants. They provide advertising that’s tailored to every step of the customer journey and reaches customers at a global scale. Most recently they were named on the 2021 Programmatic Power Players List AdExchanger. Founded in 2011 by experts in advertising and marketing technologies,, they now service more than 1000 brands around the world. They are headquartered in Paris with over 200 employees and offices worldwide in the US, Europe, Asia Pacific, and Latin America.  The Role We are looking for an Account Manager based in Singapore. The successful candidate will take full responsibility for campaign sales push and delivery: strategic watch, RFP coordination, client management, briefing stakeholders, ad operations & performance optimization & reporting in relationship with the traffic and trading team. This role reports into the Country Manager.  The Candidate This role will suit an Account Manager with at least 1 year of client facing experience in an AdTech company. You will need to have experience with ad-serving, DSP, video, and rich media vendor tools. Ultimately, you must be self-motivated, curious, hard working and a great team player.  Responsibilities Day-to-day client management with their mobile campaigns, working hand in hand with the Sales Managers; Full responsibility for campaign sales push and delivery: strategic watch, RFP coordination, client management, briefing stakeholders, ad operations & performance optimization & reporting in relationship with the traffic and trading team; Creation and delivery of weekly campaign reports; Support of the sales team with pre-sales and campaign approval; Monitoring campaign delivery with trader team; Project management with the design team to deliver best in class creative executions; Working with trading team and vendor partners to set up necessary integrations and partnerships; Keep abreast of market knowledge and insights; Post campaign analysis and reporting; Working with the corporate marketing team to develop at least two case studies per quarter to be shared with current and prospective clients.  Requirements An English speaker (oral and written) Familiar with the media agencies landscape; Familiar with digital tracking solutions (Double Click, Sizmek, Nielsen, …); Comfortable with a start-up mindset, facing interesting challenges globally; A problem solver and detail oriented; Highly organised and able to prioritise; Excellent in building relationships with agency teams; Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with high expectations.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: About Workato  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why: Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 large company for remote workers  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups Flexible and personalised medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalisation and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave  Responsibilities  We are looking for a Partner Manager, Business Development. In this role, you will be responsible to: Drive partner revenue through field engagement, pipeline development, deal registration, and business reviews Understand integration and automation requirements of vertical ecosystem and work closely with partners to develop responsive solutions Establish Workato as the partner's preferred integration and automation platform Develop Workato champions in the partners' sales and customer success organizations and recruit consulting partners with the intent to receive referrals. Maximize the number of touch points with partner sales and customer success resources and consulting partners. Manage contract negotiations Work cross-functionally to create and execute strategic business plans  Requirements  Qualifications and Experience 2-5 years experience in sales and/or partner management role with a revenue objective. Experience in SG market preferred Proven track record of building partner senior level relationships and supporting stakeholders Lots of passion and love for the work you do Entrepreneurial experience highly beneficial MBA will be a plus  Skills Understanding of business and curiosity to learn about business processes Sales with motivation to build a business together with our partner(s) Ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Ability to build appropriate rapport with diplomacy and tact Solid verbal and written presentation, communication, and influencing skills Possesses strategic thinking, able to plan ahead and respond proactively

Basic understanding of entire sales approach, methodology, tools, processes, general research & consulting approaches Develop and grow a strong comprehension of the sales process, including an understanding of the value proposition and value based selling Make solid business lead connections on a daily basis to identify business development opportunities in new and within our existing client base Make outbound prospecting calls and communicate via email and social media Participate, as needed, in all aspects of the sale including; conducting qualifying activities and client meetings, needs assessments, delivering formal presentations and proposals, and closing new business Renew and solidify relationships to grow business and overall marketing spend Degree holder with at least 1-3 years of experience in B2B sales experience within a consultative sales environment Fresh graduates are also encouraged to apply Passion for sales and highly motivated individuals to augment our aggressive growth plans Articulate with excellent written and oral communication skills in English An excellent communicator; articulate and persuasive, and possesses exceptional interpersonal skills

description: Job Description:  Get to know our Team:  We believe in developing mutually beneficial regional collaborations with corporate partners to enhance both our service offerings and positively impact the lives of Grab’s consumers, merchants, and driver/delivery partners. We have individuals on the team working on different projects, but we all have a common mission to develop strategic partnerships that are critical to the success of our everyday everything app.  Get to know about GrabDefence:  GrabDefence is Grab’s first B2B enterprise technology business. Through GrabDefence, Grab is opening up our fraud detection and prevention technology to companies that want to protect themselves from fraudsters and fraudulent transactions. Drawing from Grab’s own experience operating in various verticals across the region and battling various fraud attempts, GrabDefence seeks to help companies battle fraud and fortify trust in their digital ecosystem.  This is your opportunity to be part of an exciting new team venturing into a new domain and be involved from strategy to execution. We are looking for driven, like-minded individuals who want to join a start-up within a start-up and thrive in an environment of rapid experimentation!  Get to know the Role:  Our Regional BD & Strategic Partnerships team is looking for an experienced Sales Assistant Manager to be part of a dynamic growing team -- one who thrives on challenges and is looking for an opportunity to take their sales experience to the next level. We’re looking for an entrepreneurial individual who will play a central role in building GrabDefence’s client pipeline as well as developing and executing GrabDefence’s Go-To-Market strategy and initiatives. The candidate is expected to take the lead in defining key target segments, drive deals end-to-end from commercial negotiation to closure, overall project management and execution, as well as maintain key relationships at senior levels of large corporate institutions.  To perform this role well, the candidate needs to have extensive experience in building a SaaS sales pipeline and developing the GTM strategy.  As part of the larger Regional BD & Strategic Partnerships team, the candidate will also support various regional business development initiatives to ensure they meet Grab-wide objectives. The candidate is also expected to co-create partnerships-based business development plans and roadmaps in line with Grab's overall strategic direction.  The day-to-day activities:  As a GrabDefence Enterprise Sales Assistant Manager, you’ll be responsible for Identifying and prioritising key target accounts for B2B sales, closing deals and continual building and maintenance of the sales pipeline to drive towards revenue targets for GrabDefence. Designing and proposing needs and value based solutions for prospective clients using GrabDefence technology suite, and managing the overall delivery of the solution along with the GrabDefence Product and Engineering teams to ensure on time, on target execution. Co-developing and executing on a Go-To-Market strategy for GrabDefence, as well as providing key inputs for long-term strategic roadmaps. Creating and owning a methodical, data-driven sales process and managing all internal coordination to ensure smooth delivery of proposed solution suite. Exploring and developing strategic partnerships/alliances to accelerate GrabDefence’s growth regionally and globally. Collaborating with internal product, engineering and strategy teams and providing relevant customer-centric feedback from the field to help shape GrabDefence’s future developments. Prepare and deliver regular business reviews covering progress, roadblocks and solutions to increase customer adoption of GrabDefence. The must haves: Bachelor degree as minimum. 2-4 years of experience in B2B/Enterprise software sales. Experience with both inside and outside sales, including leads generation and outbound prospecting. Knowledge in the SaaS and/or anti-fraud domain in SE Asia would be a plus. Experience in strategic B2B business development and partnerships would be a plus. Passion, drive and the desire to be a part of a growing team that makes a difference for both the company and our clients. Be extremely organised, and bring a high level of attention to detail and efficiency while working under tight deadlines and on multiple projects simultaneously. Demonstrate strong track record in project management, and managing internal/external stakeholders locally and regionally. Proven ability to blend business, strategy, tech, legal and finance concepts to lead multi-faceted, win-win deals. Strong written and verbal communications skills a must. Candidate must be comfortable presenting alone in front of large groups of senior representatives. Proven ability to work independently and effectively, especially in an entrepreneurial work environment where self-motivated individuals succeed. Strong code of ethics and sound business judgment required. Strong in Google Suite, PowerPoint, Excel and Word. Regional language proficiency is a plus (e.g. Mandarin, Bahasa Melayu, Vietnamese, Tagalog). Seasoned professional with experience establishing, maintaining and leveraging C-level relationships is a plus.
jobFunction: Business Development, General Business, and Information Technology

description: Who We Are  Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Burger King, Delivery Hero, HBO Max, Mercari, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, hundreds of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 3 billion active users through Braze.  Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Forrester Wave™: Cross-Channel Campaign Management (Independent Platforms), Q3 2021, and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for the fourth consecutive year. The company has also been selected as one of Fortune’s Best Workplace for Millennials in 2021, and was ranked #20 on Fortune’s Best Medium Sized Workplaces in 2021. Braze is certified as a Great Place to Work in the UK and the U.S. and is recognized as one of the UK's Best Workplaces for Women.  What We're Looking For  The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years experience selling, renewing and expanding SaaS solutions to clients in a variety of different verticals. In addition, candidates should have at least 8+ years overall industry experience. Ideally, this experience will include collaboration with Customer Success and Marketing/Sales Enablement teams and input into the lead generation process.  You will work with Braze’s high growth potential clients to ensure they are maximising value from technology and services in order to develop and grow the relationship. This is an opportunity to bring your skills as a consultant, business analyst, project manager and sales professional to work with leading global brands and expand your knowledge of cross-channel consumer engagement, mobile marketing automation, APIs and analytics.  This is a field sales role that routinely requires travel for onsite customer engagement, resulting in a majority of time spent out of the office meeting with and selling to existing customers.  What You Have 5+ years of experience in a relevant closing role Drive, determination and accountability Background in SaaS sales for Mobile and/or Marketing Technology Outstanding verbal, written and stand-up presentation skills, with experience of presenting value propositions to executive teams Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Keynote Prior experience with salesforce.com CRM, or other CRM used to manage sales pipeline Excellent organisational skills and time management abilities The ability to handle multiple competing priorities Proven ability to quickly get up to speed on new cloud apps and tools A proven networker in your daily life Up-to-date on digital trends, especially in the mobile, web and email space Proven success navigating large organizations and the ability to quickly identify decision makers and the decision-making process for large, global brands Prior experience in a startup technology company a plus Fluency in Mandarin and/or Cantonese is a plus CORE OBJECTIVES Achieve quarterly net new and retention revenue targets Consistently generate robust pipeline in support of these targets Develop commercial relationships in order to increase Braze utilization and value Effectively communicate customer feedback to the Braze product team. Cross-department collaboration, including but not limited to Success, Sales, RevOps, Product, Legal and Marketing Coordinate resources to drive feature adoption Excellent Product knowledge Pro-actively analyze customer product usage and identify growth opportunities Work with Success & Onboarding managers and other technical partners to seamlessly transition clients from pre-sales, through onboarding and into ongoing Service usage What We Offer Competitive compensation that includes equity Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.  If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

description: Job Description -  Manager, Business Development (International Business)  Job Overview We are looking to expand our team by hiring a new Business Development Manager, Singapore a team player who is ready to make the role their own and bring their own ideas and innovations to the table. The Manager, Sales & Business Development, is to establish, maintain and expand relationships with strategically important overseas Customers, Manufacturers/Suppliers. He/she is responsible to solicit sales orders and markets from overseas Customers to meet annual KPI and sales target. The Manager is to promote and market our products and services to provide a One-Stop Center for overseas Customers. Key Responsibilities Focused on the international growth of our business. Develop and formulate business development strategies that focus on business expansion. Network with customers and strategic partners to foster relationships that will assure the delivery of the sales order target and future growth as declared in the business plan. Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including support service, and management resources, in order to meet account performance objectives and customers’ expectations. Seek out new potential overseas partners and customers. Secure sales order targets as assigned. Plan, organize and coordinates engagement programs and visits with strategic and key customers for Senior Management. Drive related marketing activities, including organize and coordinate with internal staff and external personnel in showcasing our services and capabilities in participating trade exhibitions. Gather intelligence and requirements to initiate project proposals and formulate potential businesses. Develop and communicate business strategies to higher management; Fulfil planned international engagement events; Maintain high customer satisfaction ratings that meet company standards. What We Value Experience in scaling business in a rapid growth organization You have excellent business acumen, communication, organizational and interpersonal skills in a fast-paced environment; a consultative approach to winning new business. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. You have confident communication (written and verbal) skills and a demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with all levels of internal and external organizations. You have demonstrated the ability to work independently and remain self-motivated. Ability to travel internationally. What We Offer Opportunity to work in a fast-growing organization with the ability to make a quick impact. Allow your inspirational ideas to come to life in a highly creative and executional environment. The opportunity to challenge in a high performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact.

description: At ServiceSource, we strive to find and grow exceptional people like you.  Working at ServiceSource, you will be a part of an engaging, energetic, and entrepreneurial work environment while having the stability and influence of a nearly 20-year industry leader behind you.  ServiceSource is a place where you can GROW, both personally and professionally, while expanding your skills in sales, customer success and people management.  Imagine being able to partner with global technology leaders in a company that cares about YOU – your professional growth, your success, and your community.  We are looking for an Associate Sales Manager to join our team. Today.  We are ServiceSource. We are dedicated to creating success for our clients, the communities around us and each other. We provide outsourced inside sales, customer success, renewals management, and channel management solutions for the world's greatest brands. At ServiceSource, you will be part of our diversified team that makes an impact for our clients. All of this is possible because of the talent you have to offer.  The future team member that will love this job will manage a team driving revenue generation and business growth on behalf of our clients. If you have passion for sales leadership, a customer focus, the capacity for quick thinking and immediate action, and the ability to forecast sales outcomes, this could be the right fit for you! You will promote the professional development of the sales team, including coaching and performance evaluation. Reporting to a sales manager, you will also build the strategic relationship with our external facing clients. Along the way you will have access to world-class training opportunities to grow and enhance your skills and career. At ServiceSource, you can truly Own Your Future!  You Have 5+ years proven work experience in a sales role A passion for customer experience and driving team results Experience in operations and strategy building Excellent Coaching history A record of developing and retaining great employees Experience maximizing revenue through best practices Experience in Microsoft programs like Word, Outlook and PowerPoint Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Experience finding solutions as a manager Change Management skills You Will Lead the team to achieve specific business targets and meet assigned performance targets weekly/monthly/quarterly, ensuring high customer satisfaction Provide accurate ongoing sales forecasting and ensure data recorded in the CRM is accurate and up-to-date Be an enabler to remove roadblocks and help team to resolve challenges to support sales opportunities Monitor and drive team call time and productivity and conduct weekly performance reviews and weekly coaching sessions with all team members Analyze data, performance and customer experience trends to develop strategic sales plays and best practice for client/specific territories Stay current on developments in client services and within the market and ensure the team is informed on the latest trends and market direction Be a point of escalation for our clients and respond promptly to any issues Maintain a balanced level of communication with Sales Director and external facing client to ensure strategic client relationship is fostered and developed Work with client contact on reporting and forecasting Ensure team understanding to achieve operating plan targets, sales targets and client performance targets (CPTs) Work with internal functional resources and external partners to develop a coaching platform Coordinate team incentives and Sales Performance Incentive Funds Partner and build business relationships with all partners to ensure customer expectations are met Work with teams and management to improve sales processes and achieve a positive customer experience Lead team to buying/renewal process to achieve greater client satisfaction Our Benefits And Perks Group Term Life Insurance Group Personal Accident Insurance Group Health Insurance with coverage for dependents on co-payment scheme Flexi-Benefit Employee Assistance Program In addition to regulated PTOs, Marriage, Paternity, Compassionate, Exam) Rewards and Recognition Program Learning and Development Program Fun & Diversity Engagement Program Accommodation and Diversity  We have always been and will always be committed to the principle that everyone at ServiceSource, regardless of who they are, where they hail from, the color of their skin, who they worship, or who they love, has equal opportunity, with policies and values which codify this, across all the countries where we are based. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin or disability.  Virtual First and Remote Work  ServiceSource is a Virtual First company, which means work outside of an office will be the primary experience for most employees for the foreseeable future. Equipment will be provided, but a space at home to work is required.  While you have the ability to work from your home, we do require that you are in a commutable distance of the local office to ensure you can attend when/if required by the company.  (Uninterrupted home-based internet is required in your home to attend and host video calls, a minimum bandwidth speed of 20mbps is important.)  Other Information 5 days work week (Regular working hours) Singapore office is at walking distance from nearest MRT (Labrador Park) Permanent position If this sounds like an interesting opportunity, hit apply!  All shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  Uninterrupted home-based internet is required for this role. Applicants should have sufficient internet access in their homes to attend and host video calls, as well as perform essential functions of the role which include downloading and uploading of large files to shared network drives. In general, we have found that a minimum bandwidth speed of 20mbps is essential.
