description: Account Executive  Singapore  Our job is to be bold at work.  It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role  The Account Executive is a hybrid sales role that generates and closes new businesses, as well as renews and upsells from existing clients within an assigned territory. This role will work on developing and executing a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, the Account Executive will continue to build strong relationships, enrich existing accounts, and drive retention of existing businesses by ensuring high-level client satisfaction. This position is based in Singapore and will cover global corporate enterprise accounts, government-link companies, and government agencies as a territory.  Job Description Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory on corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list on corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Keep the relationship on closed accounts and develop them further. Develop and close business by promoting interest from IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing organizations across clients and other prospects. Sell to VP level and above within the prospect’s IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing organizations. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (Salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Build a strong understanding on assigned industries, as well as the changing business and technology issues and needs that Forrester’s potential clients face. Navigate across teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes. Job Requirements A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. A proven track record of prospecting and selling strategic solutions to $1 billion-plus corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Five or more years of proven experience in successful sales to C-level executives. Proven experience in working in a complex global business environment and managing stakeholders internally and externally. Proven experience in working in lean organizations with complex internal ecosystems. Possesses a strong domain knowledge in the following areas: IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing, as well as experience in selling to corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. A high level of business acumen of corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. A team player with effective organization and time management skills. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. Must be willing to travel. Explore #ForresterLife on:  YouTube  Twitter  Facebook  Instagram  LinkedIn  Glassdoor  Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment.  Data Protection  The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities.  By Submitting Your Resume/CV, You Consent To Forrester’s Retention Of The Information Provided On a Secure File For Personnel Administration And Management Purposes And/or In Order To Consider You For Future Employment Opportunities And To The Transfer Of The Information Provided To  Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Who is Unruly?  Unruly is one of the leading programmatic video ad platforms (SSP) in the world. Publishers use Unruly’s self-service tools, global relationships with premium demand partners, user-friendly ad formats and dedicated support team to maximize their revenue across a range of different screens, including CTV, mobile and desktop.    A pioneer in bringing emotional intelligence to the ad ecosystem, Unruly's innovative, multi-format tech, unique audience insights and creative solutions also enable brands and agencies to seamlessly engage global consumers in premium, brand-safe environments.    Where in the Unrulyverse will I be working?    Currently our teams are working remotely, however once it is safe to do so this role will be based in the Singapore office for some of the week.    What will I be doing?   Develop a solid revenue stream from leading media agencies and direct clients and exceed quarterly revenue targets.      Ensuring Unruly continues to be perceived as a true thought leader in the premium video marketplace.   Presenting the Unruly value proposition, and getting under the skin of your clients and their opportunities and challenges.  Deliver ongoing management and development of client relationships to ensure ongoing business including Managed Service and Programmatic bookings running in Singapore  You will use Unruly’s full product suite to ensure that Unruly continues to be a key partner for all the clients in your allocated agency patch   You’ll be a source of knowledge and inspiration to agency partners – pushing the boundaries of cross screen programmatic and managed service video, ensuring Unruly continues to be perceived as a true thought leader in this space  Thinking strategically about opportunities for revenue growth, and will work with internal teams at Unruly to achieve these  Work towards (and pushing to exceed) significant targets in both IO and Programmatic spend  Communicate complex, creative solutions to agencies and clients who may be unfamiliar or uncomfortable with the space effectively in an accessible way  Understanding of client challenges and able to explain how Unruly’s solutions can be advantageous and successful   What will I bring?  An established network of Singapore based media agency and client decision-makers  A track record of prospecting for new business and converting this into revenue  Demonstrated digital or video sales experience (minimum 3-5 years' experience)  Understanding of and enthusiasm for the video space and the ability to inspire confidence and collaboration with your clients.  Demonstrated ability to use and work within sales platforms, e.g., Salesforce, Tableau, etc   High degree of technical understanding of the online video and programmatic video marketplace   An understanding of the Programmatic landscape - including contacts at the major DSP’s and experience of selling an SSP.    Ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment within tight deadlines    Demonstrated experience generating leads and closing new business    Presentation Skills; creating and presenting own sales pitches and presentations   Experience generating revenue against personal and group targets (and love smashing them!)    Solid knowledge of the “cookieless” future and it’s impact to the digital landscape   Here at Unruly, we like to think outside the box, so if you don’t tick every one of these- don’t worry! We would rather see your application than risk missing out on your potential. We also know our strength comes from our differences and varied life experiences, so we are committed to the value of diversity and inclusion in all its forms.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

jobTitle: IKEA Tampines - Customer Relations Team Leader (Easy Buying)
description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the Manager in Easy Buying Section of Customer Relations Department, you will work with your team of co-workers to value add and provide a positive customer relations experience for our IKEA customers.  Your assignment You will lead a team of co-workers for attending to customer’ enquiries over the counter and via email/phone on after sales matters. You will be responsible to plan the team work schedule and to support the team members in serving the customers with GST (Greet, Smile, Thank) in mind. You will work with your manager and your team to identify the root cause and to resolve customer complaint, orders fulfilments, delivery issues etc of recurring problems by providing solutions. To prioritise and organise work and the work of others in order to make the most efficient use of time availability. You will also need to provide training to co-workers on customer handling and the usage of the Navision system, and take on case/complaint escalation when arises. You will support the department to ensure a safe working environment and compliance to work place processes and policies for functional review and sec check compliance You will provide coaching and training to new co-workers and support them in their growth and development You will work closely with HR on co-workers performance issues. Qualifications  Your profile You possess at least 5 years of experience in a supervisory position in a fast paced and dynamic customer-service oriented environment. You are a fast learner and have strong proficient in the use of computer software and office applications. You are self-motivated and results driven and able to multi-tasked and work under pressure. You have a warm personality and excellent communication skills and able stay calm and provide solutions to customer’s problems. You have a genuine interest in people and passion for home furnishing. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to share your knowledge with other co-workers and create an environment where the IKEA values are a strong and living reality that embraces the diversity of co-workers and visitors Additional Information  Please apply by 31 October 2021
industries: Consumer Goods, Retail, and Financial Services

description: With over 50 years’ experience and a reputation for accurate and robust data and insightful analysis, IWSR is the recognized industry benchmark for organizations operating within or investing in the Beverage Alcohol industry  We are looking for a highly capable and proactive Market Analyst to join our Singapore research team, focusing on markets in South East Asia. The role is based out of IWSR's Singapore office, with remote working in place until restrictions ease  The role: Market Analyst Reporting to: Sarah Campbell, Head of Research – APAC  Overall purpose of the role: As Market Analyst you will be responsible for interviewing (and visiting in person when possible) our contacts in several markets in South East Asia to compile accurate data and insights for our annual report series. In addition, you will be responsible for researching data and providing insights on key growth areas of the market such as E-Commerce and no and low alcohol for our annually updated strategic studies  Primary duties and responsibilities: To build and maintain working relationships with distributors, producers and other local contacts in key markets Collect data and supporting market insight, add this to our database and use that knowledge to analyse and explain current trends and make assumptions about future market development in terms of beverage alcohol consumption. This forms the heart of the role – the successful candidate should have a desire to forge new relationships, uncover local dynamics and become a true expert in their markets When feasible this will involve travel to selected markets in South East Asia to meet key contacts - where travel is not possible, meetings are to be conducted via conference call Contribute to the relevant components of IWSR’s Strategic Study Series, including strategic studies on E-Commerce, no/low alcohol and the RTD market To improve the coverage and depth of understanding of local categories To ensure that pricing data in the markets is collected in-store and online each year and to work with the central research and operations team to improve quality. To conduct research and analysis for the Custom Analytics team as requested To support commercial operations in building client relationships, according to agreed protocols between sales and research  Education, experience and competencies: Native / business fluent English 1+ years’ research and analysis experience within a relevant industry (e.g. business information, consulting or beverage alcohol) Strong data analysis and insight skills – this should include the ability to write concise, insightful reports on key market trends Comfortable and confident in client facing scenarios Team player: able to work effectively within a small high growth company A motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced, informal and friendly environment Qualifications to degree level Internationally mobile Preference to Singapore based applicants  Desirable: Native / business fluent Mandarin Business fluent / intermediate level Cantonese / Thai / Filipino / Korean  Benefits:   Remuneration: $40,000 - $55,000 SGD plus bonus (dependent upon experience)  In addition to a highly competitive basic salary and company pension, there are 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays and Christmas/New Year shutdown), a generous annual bonus scheme, lots of learning opportunities within a friendly and supportive working environment and the potential for flexible working hours

Attachment Description This position reports to the Owner of SUNTEXNOLOGY INC. PTE. LTD.. The sales executive will support the owner in all sales-related matters which include finding new clients, building key customer relationships and increase sales opportunities, formulating new sales strategies, creating quotations, invoices, and weekly reports and identify trends in the marketplace. Specific Responsibilities Individual To Be Involved In Finding new clients. Building key customer relationships and increase sales opportunities. Formulating new sales strategies to hit sales targets. Creating quotations, invoices, and weekly sales reports to the owner. Update sales materials and research the latest trends in the marketplace. Technical Skills and Competencies Ability to think like a business owner and formulate strategies for sales growth. Deal with customers in a professional manner. How to build key relationships with important clients and stakeholders. Ability to do market research to identify trends in the marketplace to leverage on for a company's growth.

jobTitle: Head of Sales - Rest of Asia
description: Von Roll is the world market leader in the field of electrical insulation and is also active in the development and synthesis of resins. We are the only company to offer the entire portfolio of solid and liquid insulation materials, including engineering consulting, testing and services, from a single source. Our products are essential for the global electrification. Do you want to be a part of the upcoming new energy and E-mobility revolution? You've come to the right place.  Responsibilities and tasks Visit existing & new customers to secure and develop existing business Liaise closely with customer engineering, design and R&D departments to clearly identify needs Identify new business opportunities and develop new customers and markets for all business lines high voltage, low voltage and composites Development and implementation of respective market segment strategies for all business lines Manage, develop and optimize a strong network of distributors in the most important Asian countries (South Korea, Japan, Malaysia, Taiwan and RoA Cooperation with our headquarters in Switzerland to provide product and application support at customers for all concerned Von Roll Product Groups. This will require both office and field-based support Recommend Electrical Insulating Systems (EIS)& Electrical Insulation Materials (EIM) including application process to customers and assist in expanding existing business and taking new market shares in-line with the overall business strategy Control and implement consistent pricing strategy within the customer base for all business lines Achieve margin improvement through strong negotiation skills. Complete market analysis reports to achieve market transparency to assist with overall strategy and sales development for all business lines Interact with multi-disciplinary team within Asia, Europe and USA to achieve overall business targets and meet market requirements  Qualifications Recognized international qualification to Degree level, preferably in the field of Electrical Engineering, Physics or Chemistry Five plus years ‘experience in global and strategic sales position, preferably in the electrical insulation industry Proven ability to initiate, establish and nurture global business relationships in a growing business environment Strong background in successfully networking at customers covering both technical and commercial departments Experience with new product introductions and successful market development Good experience in commercial negotiations and contract preparation as well as solid understanding of ‘Needs Based’ selling principles Capable able of multi-tasking and working as part of a multi-disciplinary team Team player with ability to interact at all levels, successfully lead a team and set objectives to achieve higher level goals Fluent in English and Chinese both written and spoken
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: · 5+ years experience in cybersecurity/IT industry · Successful track record in SaaS, PaaS sales and negotiation · Public speaking skills · Ability to work within a multi-national sales team · Extroverted, positive attitude with a drive to build relationships · Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Mandarin · Bachelor’s degree in a related field · Familiar with Singapore government policies and subsidy policies in CyberSecurity field.

jobTitle: Business Development Manager, Agency Business Development
description: Job Purpose  You will be responsible to achieve cluster business Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) by driving the sales force through effective management and prompt service support of cluster assigned.  The Job Achieve the cluster yearly KPIs and growth in new business premiums and manpower through the development and implementation of Company & Department business plans and initiatives Conduct regular meetings and communication sessions with cluster agency leaders and/ or potential producers with the intention to enhance their performance management, sales & recruitment results and business plans and ensure compliance of regulatory guidelines Raise productivity, motivate and influence top producers and planners in taking positive actions to achieve personal and agency objectives and goals Identify & develop future potential agency leaders and producers within the respective cluster Manage the operational requirements of the field force and ensure that they are given full and appropriate logistic support & problem solving assistance in running their agency business Ensure the agencies within the cluster comply with prevailing regulatory regulations and conduct their business in a professional and competent manner Maintain a conducive and productive cluster working environment Take accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and take appropriate steps to mitigate the risks Maintain awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company Highlight any potential concerns/ risks and proactively share best risk management practices Our Requirements Minimum Degree qualification from a recognized institution Project Management experience Proficiency in MS Office Applications (Excel, Word & PowerPoint) Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills Able to perform quantitative and qualitative evaluations Performance management driven Ability to carry oneself confidently Willing to learn and adaptable A team player High level of integrity, take accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork Take initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes About Great Eastern  Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner.  We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us.  We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions.  Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people’s lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management.  To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Banking

jobTitle: Regional Cross Border Sales Channel Associate / Senior Associate
description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  We are seeking Regional Cross Border Sales Channels Associate / Senior Associate who can help us win and retain business by providing proactive and effective cross border solutions support to internal commercial stakeholders (“Sales Channels”) across all customer segments. You will be the “one face” of Cross Border to our channel partners; focusing on securing relationships with the Sales teams to uncover opportunities, develop territory sales strategies, and act as an advisor to sales teams throughout the sales process while collecting feedback from the sales teams for continuous optimization of the Cross Border suite of solutions.  As part of a small and dynamic team that is responsible for the success of Cross Border, the Sales Channels Associate will have a very direct impact on the success of the company. The incumbents will work closely with members of our Cross Border Solutions, Cross Border Control Tower, Business Intelligence, Finance, Operations, and various customer facing Sales teams across Ninja Van’s six countries in Southeast Asia.  Responsibilities Accountable for P&L, volumes, and sales targets of assigned Sales Channel Manage & monitor all sales administrative tools to channel partners for visibility and accuracy of Sales numbers & forecast Generate periodic sales reports, sales materials, and process documentation for Sales Channels Provide latest pricing guidance and solutions changelogs to Sales Channels Rollout sales administrative tools to channel partners for visibility and accuracy of sales numbers and forecast Continuously simplify sales process and operations to drive product penetration Subject Matter expert for B2C Product Development. Championing any initiatives determined by the management team Responsible for top line B2C revenue growth Responsible for ensuring efficient and effective follow up on strategic deals and operational blockers Responsible for knowledge transfer to Sales Channel on new & existing cross border products Ensuring that the needs of the Sales Channel is well summarized and thought out in order to drive initiatives with Product Specialists to meet requirements of Key Clients Serve as single point of contact for all Cross Border communications to assigned Sales Channels on operational and commercial aspects of all services/products offered Align and maintain all capability requests for internal visibility on timeliness End to end implementation coordination for complex shippers across commercials, tech integration and operations SOPs Responsible for providing commercial visibility to assigned Sales Channel Design, maintain & optimize Sales Trackers used by Sales Channels Chair Weekly Ops performance, Monthly reviews, and Run rate performance for assigned Sales Channel Requirements Bachelor degree in any related business discipline Min. 1 - 3 years working experience in strategy / project management (Applicants with minimal work experiences but possess strong extra-curricular and relevant internship records are welcomed to apply) Proficiency in SQL / Python is a plus Ability to drive clarity in unclear scenarios Stakeholder management - possessing the ability to collaborate across functions and cultures Strong ability to multitask to manage existing responsibilities and address ad hoc requests or issues Must be able to work independently and as a team to deliver outcome of consistent good quality within stipulated timeline in a dynamic environment Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About Aurous Capital  We are a registered Fund Management Company based in Singapore. We offer investment management and advisory services to our clients, and our fund products span global markets and different asset classes. We aim to provide investment solutions capable of achieving superior long-term returns for our investors.  Who We're Looking For  We're looking for a Business Development/Sales Trainer to join our Business Development team at Aurous. You will manage all aspects of the relationship between Aurous and prospective clients & partners; to achieve sales targets and position Aurous as a preferred business partner in Singapore & countries we are expanding into.  What You'll Do  You will drive the marketing effort of Aurous products and services to prospective clients and partners by: developing and implementing sales & product strategies initiating & developing joint marketing activities or programs with partners conducting partner visits & presentation providing fund and market information developing sales and distribution channels with partners handling clients' enquiries and partners hotline keeping abreast of competitors' products and development in the market The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications You Need Degree graduate with preferably at least 5 years of track record of institutional sales in a fund house or bank in Singapore Strong communication and interpersonal skills Highly self-motivated and enjoys achieving sales targets Proactive and able to adapt in a fast-changing environment Positive attitude and ability to develop collaborative working relationships with colleagues across the company
industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

description: About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain—in real-time, across devices—to improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The RM Team  The Enterprise Relationship Management team covers roughly 25% of Mixpanel's global ARR, across some of our largest and most strategic customers. The team is focused on retaining and growing this book of business, through ensuring a smooth onboarding process, understanding how our customers get the most value out of Mixpanel's capabilities, driving adoption, and uncovering growth opportunities.  The RM team has developed a strong community of practice in collaboration with the Services team (CSM’s) in APAC and globally. The team works on individual targets but also values and cultivates a team culture where sharing knowledge and supporting others is a critical part of individual success.  About The Role  We're looking for a Relationship Manager for the APAC region who can partner closely with their customers, ultimately leading to long term customer success and increased revenue under their management. Mixpanel Relationship Managers have a strong understanding of our product's capabilities and are able to continuously uncover areas of value for our customers.  Responsibilities Owns and maintains the relationship with director and executive-level economic buyers at their accounts by being able to connect their objectives with the value that Mixpanel provides to their teams Builds and maintains a long-term account plan and strategy focused on product adoption, driving business value, and discovering growth opportunities, across a book of approximately 30-40 managed accounts in the territory. Acts as a data and analytics thought leader and partner to their accounts, as demonstrated through QBR's focused on use cases and business impact, and coordination and delivery of product demos and trainings Will work with our Reseller in Germany to support overall growth in the region and ensure adequate handovers with new customers are done in collaboration with the Reseller Will be responsible for accurately forecasting churn and growth in their accounts Will be part of the overall RM community of practice and as such be an active contributor to team meetings, best practice sharing and collaborative working. Requirements Experience working within the SaaS/Software Market. Is able to travel (COVID permitting) to visit his customers frequently. 5+ years in quota carrying role, managing existing customer relationships Has owned customer relationships at Fortune 1000 businesses Has strong organizational skills and sales acumen, demonstrated by following a consistent sales methodology, maintaining accurate CRM data and revenue/churn forecasts, and consistently hitting retention and growth targets Is able to build and maintain credibility with a technical end-user in Engineering, Product, and Design functions, by showcasing Product and Industry knowledge and expertise Is able to build out Success Plans for their customers and use Services, CSMs, Partners to deliver Believes in extreme ownership of their successes and failures, and continues to build on their skillsets and learns from their mistakes. Is a team player and has experience of strong collaborative relationships with Partners and Services to achieve common goals Bonus Points For Previous experience in a technical customer-facing role (support / CSM / SE / SA) Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers’ success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can’t win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Computer Software

description: Here at Anaplan, we have reinvented how companies see, plan, and run their businesses. Our platform allows our customers to uncover new insights, connect their strategy to their plans, and work in ways they had not previously thought possible. We’re growing fast, constantly innovating, and couldn’t be prouder to help our customers move forward with confidence in a sophisticated and changing world.  We are looking for forward-thinking people who bend over backward to put customers first. Individuals who thrive on challenge and are ready to grasp the opportunity of a lifetime. Because we fundamentally believe every colleague brings unique value to our whole. We are a workplace where each person feels seen, heard, and valued, and can contribute their unique talent to our collective effort. We believe that for ourselves and for our customers.  At Anaplan, we are looking for an ENTERPRISE ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE to join one of the fastest growing cloud vendors and make your mark on the industry. Based in Singapore you will take your proven track record of new business sales and Account Management of Global 2000 enterprises and sell an incredibly versatile solution that is helping people and companies around the world every day to make better-informed plans and decisions.  Our sales team is sharing our bold vision with companies around the world and helping them understand the power of Anaplan products. We partner with some of the world’s biggest brands, such as P&G, GE, PwC, and VMware, to unlock their full potential for success and to grow our business.  You will join a team of individuals who embrace and respect diverse perspectives, aren’t afraid to push boundaries and try new ideas, and are passionate about helping our customers and each other succeed. We work hard, but we also don’t wait for an excuse to have fun. In fact, we’re so serious about it that it’s one of our core values.  Would you consider yourself as someone always on the hunt for a win? Do you take the time to seize each opportunity for all that you can all while consistently putting in the time and energy to succeed? Then this job is for you!  In this role, you will be a key contributor to Anaplan’s revenue growth while driving change as a market disruptor. Reporting directly to the RVP (Regional Vice President), you will work with our Sales Development Reps, Pre-sales Consultants and Customer Success Team to build customer value and drive new business onto the Anaplan platform. You may have up to 30 accounts in a defined geographic territory, mostly ‘greenfield’ accounts with several existing Anaplan customers. This type of territory requires someone to further build our footprint by hunting and winning new logo accounts as well as expanding opportunities within the current Anaplan customer base.  What You’ll Be Doing Engaging with targeted enterprise prospects to identify broken business processes and position Anaplan’s unique ability to solve the problem Building and defending Anaplan’s business value throughout the selling engagement. Navigating complex prospect environments to align the prospect around the Anaplan solution Building and maintaining a pipeline of high-quality opportunities Utilizing Anaplan’s value-based selling methodology and Salesforce.com to manage sales processes and accurately forecast business Recruiting and leveraging partners and existing customers in your territory to build Anaplan More About You 7 years + successful experience in software pre-sales and/or software sales into Enterprise Accounts into regional based accounts. Fluent English speaker for business negotiations. Excellent Presentation skills. Excellent Software Product Demonstration Skills Experience selling (includes pre-sales) SaaS within Enterprise. Experience selling (includes pre-sales) Large and Complex Deals Values Strong technical aptitude to learn the Anaplan solution quickly Consultative selling skills Ability to understand and navigate through complex political environments Proven ability to meet and exceed a sales quota BS/BA degree educated (preferred) English speaking required, mandarin is a plus Travel: up to 20% Bonus Points Experience selling EPM, ERP or BI software solutions is a "nice to have", but we will certainly consider enterprise software sales experience. Fluent Communication in other Asian Languages What We Offer A rewarding, progressive career with a company that values diversity, flexibility and understands the need for a good work/life balance. Market-leading salaries combined with generous bonuses, equity and a range of comprehensive benefits. Regular agile meetups, events and hackathons (both attending and hosting!) Flexible working, catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen and plenty of parties and events A range of sports, health and wellbeing initiatives 3 days of paid leave every year to help support the charity or cause of your choice. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We believe in maintaining a hiring and working experience in which all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your true self to work every day!  COVID-19  Protecting the health and safety of our communities, including our employees and of those considering a career at Anaplan, is our highest priority. We continue to closely monitor the evolving situation and we appreciate your understanding and flexibility with any related changes to our interviewing process.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Part i – Requirements  Qualification: Degree holder in any related business studies  Experience: At least 2 ~ 3 years related working experience in handing Trading businesses (experience in handling petrochemical related products will be an added advantage) Knowledge in Trading terms is a MUST.  Candidate requires to visit production site frequently.  During non-pandamic period, candidate needs to travel to Malaysia (day trip) and other countries for business meetings. Frequency of traveling depends on business requirement.  Reporting to: Department Manager  Date require: Able to start work immediately or within short notice  Owning vehicle: not require but possessed class 3 license is preferred  Part Ii – Job Descriptions To make annual marketing plan and budget. To ensure budgets are under control to meet its target. To work closely with suppliers on meeting products specifications and delivery schedule base on Customers’ requirements To handle and follow up with feedback or claims from Customers To work closely with Sales Admin team to co-ordinate on shipment arrangement To prepare sales/marketing reports for the management review. To monitor and ensure timely payment from Customers To visit customers in overseas to build stronger business relations and enhance customers service level To monitor and ensure Suppliers’ service and quality level are always at optimum To introduce and present new products to new Customers. To negotiate with Suppliers and Principals on pricing and better trading terms. To source for new products, suppliers and contractors for business expansion and cost effectiveness.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Wholesale, and Consumer Goods

description: Job Advert  Job Purpose  The Global Account Manager will be responsible for the organic growth of a portfolio of leading global accounts. The portfolio is made up of between 15-20APAC headquartered global accounts across multiple market segments and commodities with a minimum individual spend of $100K+.  Reporting to the Director of Global Accounts, the successful candidate will work with multiple internal departments to drive sustainable double-digit growth through the execution of a multi-year account strategy for each account. This will involve determining core content requirements, identifying the internal use case of each content set and providing bespoke delivery options that will ensure wide adoption of services and key prices across each account.  The role will require mapping out each complex structures to understand the internal dynamics within each account. This will be accomplished through virtual as well as physical client visits in all relevant regions.  The Global Account Manager role will not be just measured around pure sales performance but also around other key performance indicators such as added-value engagements, product demos and client visits who are all equally important in strengthening the relationship with our largest and most prestigious clients.  Principle Accountabilities Meeting monthly and annual sales targets Weekly forecasting of the annual value of the BoB and its expected growth Weekly sales reporting covering sales, cancellations as well as update on competitors and market trends Effective use of CRM (salesforce) in line with internal process Ensuring all opportunities are updated in a timely manner within CRM Ensuring all account plans within allocated portfolio are created and subsequently updated every six months Regular client meetings (virtual and physical) with multiple external stakeholders to ensure services are being adopted across each account Supporting the adoption of key prices across relevant markets by working with the relevant editorial teams to deliver added-value engagements to key price takers and givers Detailed understanding of the key commodity prices and data sets used by each client Anticipating and reporting on key competitive threats Proficient in demonstrating current suite of services Regular client feedback with product team to support future product development Commercial collaboration within as well as outside of the Global Account team Key Interfaces Editorial and Research Customer Success Client Services Product Compliance and Legal Marketing Knowledge, Skills And Experience  The Global Account manager will come with a strong track-record of successfully growing a multi-million portfolio of either strategic or enterprise accounts over a period of time. A strong understanding of data workflow and how to optimise content delivery through APIs and other centralised data delivery channels is required as this role involves complex solution sales. Excellent communications skills are required, as this job entails face-to-face meetings, high level presentations and demonstrations of our services to key stakeholders across multiple regions. Regular travel will be required to nurture existing relationships but also to identify and drive usage of services and prices across new business units within the portfolio. description: Put the World on Vacation  At Panorama our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. As the world’s foremost membership travel business and part of Travel + Leisure Co., we bring a broader perspective through our brands, including RCI, the largest vacation exchange company, 7Across, Love Home Swap, the Registry Collection, @Work International, and the Alliance Reservations Network. Together we’re shaping the future of the travel industry as we deliver new vacation possibilities.  Main Responsibilities  Serve as the first point of contact for Clubs / RCI members. Receive inbound telephone calls or conduct outgoing calls to confirm exchanges and solicit spacebank deposits, subscriptions and renewals, meeting service expectations.  Sell / promote Clubs / RCI and additional travel-related products/services {e.g. current promotions and renewals} to generate corporate revenue.  To provide service that will “WOW” our club members, maintaining a positive brand image and company reputation.  Utilize effective listening and customer service skills to identify member needs and/or problems and travel expectations and provide problem solving for members when required.  Educate members on the value of their membership and the most effective use of the exchange process.  Conduct Welcome / save Calls to Clubs / RCI members and any other call activities to support the efficient and effective growth of Clubs / RCI member base  Handle complaints by providing appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits and follow up on a timely manner to ensure resolution. Process member account transactions by entering accurate data into the exchange system to record current member contacts and accounts activity.  To ensure that all SLA and KPIs are met and delivered in a timely manner  To assist in conducting User Acceptance Test for all systems whenever required.  To assist in translation of documents/materials whenever required  To provide and tabulate calls stats and sales reports whenever necessary.  Participate in team meetings and ongoing specialized training to ensure the accuracy of information communicated to clients.  Skills Requirements  Any other duties as required and/or directed.  Ability to speak and write fluent foreign language (dependent on team requirements)  Strong customer service focus and excellent sales skills with demonstrated track record in meeting targets.  Able to meet performance objectives, exhibit self-discipline, display Contact Centre and company values as well as core competencies.  Demonstrate highest level of ethics and integrity and actively participate in driving the company’s culture  Tertiary Qualifications.  QUALIFICATIONS & WORKING EXPERIENCE  At least 1 years of sales / service experience preferably from the travel-related industry or a Contact Centre environment  This Position Description is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. The incumbent acknowledges receipt of a copy of this Position Description.  A Place for Everyone  Hospitality is at the heart of all we do at Travel + Leisure Co., including how we treat each member of our growing community. Here, you’ll find a team that’s inclusive, values diversity, and is built on a foundational respect for people from all over the world.  We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to mycareer@wyn.com, including the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

description: At SimplifyNext, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Our employees go deeper to solve our clients’ biggest challenges and make a positive, lasting impact on their businesses.  We are looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, to learn and to contribute, thus, creating value for our clients, for our business and for the society at large.  SimplifyNext is a consulting-led technology company with a dedicated focus on automation. We provide holistic automation services both from an automation life-cycle as well as technology perspective. We bring strong process consulting experience, combined with deep technical expertise on RPA and other complementary technologies such as Artificial Intelligence and Operations Analytics.  Work you’ll do  As a member of our Sales and Business Development team, you will be responsible for generating and maximizing sales results and driving new leads through the sales pipeline. You are expected to acquire new client accounts and close deals, sell to existing accounts, and build long-term relationships with our clients. You will also collaborate with different teams to coordinate pre-sales, professional services, and support resources to drive successful solutions and services for our clients.  Your Responsibilities Would Include Work closely with Sales Director to develop go-to-market strategy on identifying and acquiring new strategic client accounts specifically for the Enterprise Sector. Actively network in the industry to identify prospects and establish contact with the objective of converting prospects into client accounts through business development methods such as networking events, client referrals, cold calling, and other innovative channels. Initiate and drive sales process by building relationships with key decision makers in the target client organization; qualifying potential; scheduling appointments etc. Develop sales by making initial presentation to new prospective clients; articulating SimplifyNext’s value proposition and value-added services. Close sales and provide support in the coordination of tender/quotation submission which includes the formulation of price quotations and solution proposals. Grow recurring business within existing client accounts through a consultative sale approach. Work closely with delivery team to ensure successful delivery of projects and if required, to bring the required resources in the project. Maintain strong relationships with both new and existing clients and ensure positive client satisfaction in the services provided by SimplifyNext. Provide weekly report updates of sales, pipelines, leads, opportunities, and sales activities. Be accountable for achieving profitability and sales growth targets within assigned territories. Monitor accounts receivables from assigned client accounts and ensure timely collections. Qualifications Good Bachelor’s Degree with 5 to 8 years of experience in a sales hunting and account management role within a technology consulting environment. Must have track record of selling to large enterprise clients with focus in the Singapore market. Ability to engage with all levels across the client organizations including C-level executives; understand and identify clients’ needs. Self-starter and highly motivated individual. Excellent communications and inter-personal skills, and passion to deliver quality work. Experience working in a fast-paced environment.

description: Taytonn is a leading flavours and fragrances ingredients distributor with operations based out of Singapore. Our business reach extends across Asia Pacific and we work side by side with our manufacturing principles to support growth of our customers through the region.  Due to regional growth, we are recruiting a Business Analyst based in Singapore. This role is central in the next phase of our expansion plans and will work closely with the General Manager & Regional Sales Manager in Business Analysis, Pricing and Demand Management tasks.    We are seeking a person strong with numbers & analysis, identifying trends, gaining insight and summarising the implications of data. This is an entry level role and would suit a new graduate or a person with 1-2 years’ experience in a similar role. description: NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation.  We advance our communities by partnering with governments and enterprises to harness technology. We do this by bringing people together to make the extraordinary happen.  We are looking for a highly motivated individual that has proven track record to take on sales leadership position to build and lead the team. Join us as Sales Lead, Public Service - Education and create your own success story by making a difference at many levels.  Position Summary  As a Sales Lead for Public Service - Education , you are responsible for leading the team to drive NCS sales, including account penetration, prospect qualification, supervision of sales activity, sales process planning, and closing all sales opportunities in the industry and/or sector that you will be assigned to. You are expected to build deep and trusted business relationships with the client to seed and grow future opportunities.  Beyond managing your own Business Centre’s sales, sold margin and revenue achievements, you also act as trusted client advisors to customise and sell NCS solutions and services according to the business needs of clients.  Reporting to the Client Service Lead (CSL) of Public Service (PS) you will work within the PS Client Service Unit, and across Service Organisation (SOs), NEXT Services. Additionally, it is important that you work with the teams to define the solution offerings and value propositions to maximise NCS’ win probability in every opportunity. The key to success is your deep understanding of the business needs of the clients, provides consulting services and developing sales pipelines.  Responsibilities Lead and grow your portfolio of accounts space through strong engagement with key decision makers by selling NCS solutions to the target customer base; Meet sales quota through identifying and gaining business from new and existing clients and ensuring customer’s satisfaction through the products and services provided by NCS; Manage and coordinate contract terms and conditions internally and externally; Manage and build relationships at all levels with the designated clients that you oversee; Develop value prepositions and negotiate successfully to close deals; Drive profitable wins focused on NCS’ core capabilities and growth strategy; Coordinate and partner across functional teams and Service Organisation (SOs) within NCS to strike innovative deals, get orders provisioned and meet the customers' service expectations. Provide one-stop experience to customers regarding all NCS services.  The Ideal Profile Should Have / Be Degree in related discipline. Preferably with Technical or Engineering Minimum 10 years of selling/business development experience in IT or ICT services industry with 5 years or more sales experience focusing on key account industry in Education. Consulting Practitioner background preferred Process broad business acumen and deep industry knowledge, and to use this knowledge to develop/enhance client relationships. Experience in Consulting preferred. Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets and consistent success closing individual deals Ability to strategize sales strategy; articulate and present a compelling value proposition Good sales acumen with proven track record of prospecting, qualifying leads and assessing client’s needs Technical acumen blended with ability to communicate business value Excellent communication skills including presentation abilities Understand social style techniques and apply these to manage stakeholders  #ncslife #makeextraordinaryhappen

description: Writing the future. Together.  Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow. description: About Aspire: Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.   In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn’s Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don’t take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  About the Role: As the Sales Manager, you will be reporting to the Head of Sales. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team in 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure clients fully utilize their account.    What will you be doing?  Negotiate and close all VIP clients looking to open a business account with Aspire Handle VIP clients relationship from the day of the first demo call until the day the client made their first deposit.  Use consultative sales strategies to effectively overcome client objections and maximize sales activity within assigned territory Follow up with clients regularly to ensure needs are being met and identify new opportunities Drive referrals by your exceptional work  Work closely with BD team to ensure high quality leads generation  Keep all records in our CRM  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  5 to 8 years of experience in banking/fintech/SaaS sales  You are a top dog and never take no to an answer  Strong negotiation & sales skills Top producer in your previous companies  Sale is in your blood   Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. Ideally have been managing a small team  Experience in a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard) is a plus

description: What's the role?  As the Regional Sales Strategy Lead (SSL) you will be an innovative out-of-the-box thinker responsible for helping the sales team drive revenue growth by executing HERE’s sales strategy and sales process. You are a conceptually analytical “big-picture” person who sees the connection between global sales strategy and regional execution.  Your Main Responsibilities Include Being the subject matter expert (SME) in executing the HERE Sales Process (HSP) Establishing HERE’s global sales strategy and work with regional sales teams on execution Providing input to Product, Brand, and Professional Services teams on making market solutions more scalable Working with regional sales teams to create launch plans for market solutions Training, mentoring, and coaching the sales team on sales strategy, new product launches, the HSP, sales tools and technologies Field testing new product offerings, launch plans, sales tools and technologies being rolled out to the sales team. Who are you?  You are a strong match for this role if you possess the following skills, competencies and work experience: A MBA or bachelor's degree or a combination of education and relevant experience 12+ years of in depth B2B complex sales/ sales strategy experience or equivalent consulting experience Extensive experience in business case creation and financial analysis of technology investments Demonstrated ability to generate, advance, and close large ($2M+ transaction value) complex software transactions Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to collaborate and operate in a “team-based” sales environment Ability to engage C-level executives in business conversations Ability to deliver executive presentations and discuss business and financial impacts Ability to work independently and manage time productively and effectively APAC regional experience HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  Who are we?  HERE Technologies is a location data and technology platform company. We empower our customers to achieve better outcomes – from helping a city manage its infrastructure or a business optimize its assets to guiding drivers to their destination safely.  At HERE we take it upon ourselves to be the change we wish to see. We create solutions that fuel innovation, provide opportunity and foster inclusion to improve people’s lives. If you are inspired by an open world and driven to create positive change, join us. Learn more about us. Watch Video

About The Company  The company is one of the biggest sporting goods designers, manufacturers, and retailers based in France, with an international network of 90,000 employees working in over 1400 stores in 42 countries. They are opening their sixth outlet in Punggol by October 2021 and need new hires to join them before that in order to undergo a great training program.  About The Job  Your responsibility will be to make your designated sport accessible within your community by sharing the benefits of your sport with your customers and users. Once you have mastered the in-store basics, you will have the freedom to think outside the box, make commercial decisions on how and what to sell, building your business from the ground up. You are responsible for the design, layout and feel of the sport section under you and are similar to an entrepreneur and a sport lover on the job. Here are parts of the role where you can make the biggest difference in: Economic analysis and projection Customer Satisfaction Commercial merchandising Project management About The Manager/team  You will report to the Store Manager and may have 2 oe 3 part-timers under your supervision.  Skills & Requirements  You must be extremely passionate about sports, and previous retail experience is a plus. This role is well-suited for somebody who is excited by their potential to drive impactful change in people, positive, hands-on attitude with a desire to learn, embrace responsibility and vitality, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment. In addition, you should be a great listener, communicator, and team player. In return the company offers a good bonus and employee benefits. You will work 44 hours over 5 days, with 1 week day and 1 weekend off every week.  To apply online please use the 'apply' function. Consultant-in-charge: Tammie Phus  (EA: 94C3609/ R1109745)

description: Client Partner / Business Development Managers  Singapore  Permanent  Do you come from a Recruitment, Exec Search, RPO environment or similar and are looking for something different, less transactional? Something where you can use your solid relationship building skills to add real value to the talent strategy of global businesses?  Then we would love to hear from you!  Armstrong Craven are growing significantly on an international basis, and as a result we are looking for outstanding Business Development professionals to join us help take us to the next level.  Our Client Partner roles are a mix of new business and existing client development, and will see you truly partner with HR and Talent Acquisition professionals on a global level to help them identify the need and scope the solutions to their talent challenges. Aligned to one of our key practice areas, you will build and maintain relationships with your clients, presenting innovative, creative, and sector leading solutions, becoming their go to person for global talent mapping, pipelining and insight.  We are looking for people who are truly consultative, skilled at solutions sales and able building lasting client relationships. You will ideally be proven in selling HR / Recruitment solutions, and be ready to challenge yourself in a unique and rapidly growing business.  What's on offer?  This is a fantastic opportunity to partner with some of the world’s largest and most high-profile businesses, with direct influence on their people and talent strategy. As well and an excellent basic salary, the benefits also include:  · 36 days holiday (including Public Holidays) · A collaborative and fast paced working environment · Contribution to the provident fund · Healthcare  Our continued growth will be based around our values of Accountability, Courage, Positivity and Integrity, and continuing to provide the expert service to our clients, we need people who will live this with us.  Interested? To find out more, apply with your CV or contact Katrina Campbell for a confidential chat.  We are committed to equal opportunities for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. description: NCS is a member of the Singtel Group and the leading information, communications and technology (ICT) service provider with presence in the Asia Pacific region. We deliver end-to-end ICT solutions to help governments and enterprises realise business value through digital transformation and the innovative use of technology. Over the years, NCS has played a critical role in the Singapore government’s efforts to computerise the civil service sector and integrate IT into its public services.  Join us and create your own success story by making a difference at many levels. Our close-knit teams are accelerating businesses, helping communities and growing smart cities across the region.  We are looking for a highly motivated individual that has proven track record to take on sales leadership position to build and lead the team. Join us as Sales Lead, Public Service - Education and create your own success story by making a difference at many levels.  Position Summary  As a Sales Lead for Public Service - Education , you are responsible for leading the team to drive NCS sales, including account penetration, prospect qualification, supervision of sales activity, sales process planning, and closing all sales opportunities in the industry and/or sector that you will be assigned to. You are expected to build deep and trusted business relationships with the client to seed and grow future opportunities.  Beyond managing your own Business Centre’s sales, sold margin and revenue achievements, you also act as trusted client advisors to customise and sell NCS solutions and services according to the business needs of clients.  Reporting to the Client Service Lead (CSL) of Public Service (PS) you will work within the PS Client Service Unit, and across Service Organisation (SOs), NEXT Services. Additionally, it is important that you work with the teams to define the solution offerings and value propositions to maximise NCS’ win probability in every opportunity. The key to success is your deep understanding of the business needs of the clients, provides consulting services and developing sales pipelines.  Responsibilities Lead and grow your portfolio of accounts space through strong engagement with key decision makers by selling NCS solutions to the target customer base; Meet sales quota through identifying and gaining business from new and existing clients and ensuring customer’s satisfaction through the products and services provided by NCS; Manage and coordinate contract terms and conditions internally and externally; Manage and build relationships at all levels with the designated clients that you oversee; Develop value prepositions and negotiate successfully to close deals; Drive profitable wins focused on NCS’ core capabilities and growth strategy; Coordinate and partner across functional teams and Service Organisation (SOs) within NCS to strike innovative deals, get orders provisioned and meet the customers' service expectations. Provide one-stop experience to customers regarding all NCS services.  The Ideal Profile Should Have / Be Degree in related discipline. Preferably with Technical or Engineering Minimum 10 years of selling/business development experience in IT or ICT services industry with 5 years or more sales experience focusing on key account industry in Education. Consulting Practitioner background preferred Process broad business acumen and deep industry knowledge, and to use this knowledge to develop/enhance client relationships. Experience in Consulting preferred. Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets and consistent success closing individual deals Ability to strategize sales strategy; articulate and present a compelling value proposition Good sales acumen with proven track record of prospecting, qualifying leads and assessing client’s needs Technical acumen blended with ability to communicate business value Excellent communication skills including presentation abilities Understand social style techniques and apply these to manage stakeholders  #ncslife #makeextraordinaryhappen

description: The Business Development Executive is responsible for driving growth in sales and product engagement through new customer acquisition as well as upsell and cross sell of existing corporate customer accounts. You will also be responsible to assist the Business Development Manager in developing and implementing appropriate initiatives, plans, solutions and proposals working alongside a highly skilled and experience account management, marketing and support team.  Detailed Responsibilities Plan and execute targeted initiatives in collaboration with other departments to drive customer acquisition through a variety of channels. Generate leads and cold calling prospective customers. Drive towards meeting challenging, but rewarding targets (uncapped commission), goals and objectives. Develop, grow and nurture relationships based on consistent proactive and reactive communication with key corporate customers with a focus on customer needs and requirements. Attend face-to-face meetings with prospective and existing customers. Prepare, deliver and present high quality, professional proposals, quotes and business plans crafted towards the customers’ needs and expectations applying negotiation skills as and when required. Plan, manage and execute the on boarding of new customers with applied strategy, process and organisation. Nurture a strong and structured strategy focused towards new and existing customers to tailor appropriate solutions and drive increased engagement in partnership between the organisation and customer. Maintain and grow an in-depth understanding of corporate customers and the general market. Work within a highly metricised environment across the Corporate Accounts team and Marketing Team to ensure adequate forecasting, planning and projections along with tracking and periodic reporting as required. Assist the Business Development Manager/Head of Business Development to implement and manage any applicable corporate customer strategies and initiatives. Process incoming, missed and any other required customer communication with respect to corporate sales. Receive, communicate and escalate any customer concerns and issues within the Corporate Accounts and Technical team. Keep the Business Development Manager/Head of Business Development updated on targets’ progress and timeline, providing them with accurate forecasting of anticipated sales. Reporting on successes and areas needing improvements. Desired Skillsets/Experience 3 – 5 years of business development/sales experience, preferably in the Information Technology or Web Development space and proven sales track record in the job advertisement. Is commercially astute with extensive experience in business development roles preferably in the Information Technology or Web Developments space. Possess a command for information technology, particularly within the area of Servers, Infrastructure as a service and associated enterprise products and solutions. Excellent selling skills with a “hunter” mentality. Have an entrepreneurial approach with a strong focus on innovation and is passionate towards customer advocacy. Possesses strong account management and relationship building skills. Excellent problem-solving and negotiation skills. Superb analytical skills with efficient ability to evaluate data and implement applicable action items and initiatives. Ability to flourish with minimal guidance and can handle uncertainty. Able to think strategically - seeing the bigger picture and setting aims and objectives in order to develop and improve the business. Has a proactive approach, take initiative and the confidence to start things from scratch. Is a team player and have outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Employment with Dreamscape Networks is at-will and nothing in this Job Description should be interpreted or construed to alter the at-will employment relationship.  This Job Description includes the essential job functions required to perform the job described above, as well as additional duties and responsibilities. This Job Description is not an exhaustive list of all functions that the employee performing this job may be required to perform. The Company reserves the right to revise the Job Description at any time, and to require the employee to perform functions in addition to those listed above.

Skills And Experience Required Bachelor's degree in a related field At least 2 years expereince in a full B2B sales role with experience in HR SaaS software sales Experience and Networks within the retail and F&B industry Strong experience and keen interest in lead generation, outbound sales, prospecting and cold calling Proven sales track record from prospecting to close Strong stakeholder management skills, and the ability to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization, particularly at the C-level Strong presentations skills, both formal and informal Strong time management skills with great organisation skills and the ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based business goals.
