description: About Aspire: Aspire is the #1 All-in-one financial operating platform for businesses in SouthEast Asia. With a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, Aspire is building a platform that offers what financial products our customers need, how they need it.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has successfully raised USD 40M from world-class investors and financial partners such as Y-combinator and others. It has partnered with leading financial firms like Visa and Wise to power its solutions. In 2020, we were awarded as the #1 Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Startup Award by TechNode Global ORIGIN Awards. Currently, we have ~150 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand.  You will be amazed and energized by the diverse backgrounds of our people. We are a team made up of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders and high-achievers who want to make an impact yet always collaborate and don’t take NO for an answer. We have high bars during our recruitment process because we want to inspire and to be inspired by our teammates.    We are still expanding and hiring more top talents who are passionate about startups to join the journey of building a neobank to support the under-serviced SMEs and entrepreneurs.  About the role: At Aspire, we pride ourselves on building an amazing team that is customer centric. We are looking for an outgoing candidate to foster strong relationships with our clients. To be successful as an Account Manager - you should be able to build positive, long-term relationships and support clients in the decision-making process by identifying solutions that most closely meet their needs. If you are passionate about people and always want the best for your clients, then this role is for you.  What will you be doing?   Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with customers Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders and partners Grow transaction volume and revenue of existing accounts by identifying new sales opportunities and obtaining referrals Responsible for working with the Sales team to onboard and start developing new clients   What will you need?  Self-motivated and able to thrive in a results-driven environment Strong consultative selling mindset and skills Problem solving skills and ability to upsell and cross sell among different product lines Ability to prioritize among competing tasks Keen attention to detail and adherence to deadlines  What's on offer?  Fast career trajectory in one of the hottest and award-winning fintech startups in SEA Work in a fast-growing environment Exposure to a team of international and talented colleagues in the region

Job Overview  Are you looking for a role where you can truly influence and manage your own book of business? We believe in entrepreneurialism and empower you to make decisions that will promote the development of our business. Definitely we will provide you with all the resources you need to become a successful high-income sales executive.  What You Will Do  As an Enterprise Account Executive, your job is to proactively identify and qualify sales leads, pitch our award-winning software solutions to enterprises, and manage the full sales. The ideal candidate has a history of bringing on new business and hitting sales quotas, and loves the challenges that come with outbound prospecting in a competitive market!  Key Responsibilities Will Be Developing new prospects and expanding existing accounts Managing complex sales cycles with a consultative sales approach Planning and conducting presentations so that prospective and existing customers can gain insights into how our solutions solve their challenges Working with dedicated pre-sales engineers and other cross-functional team members to help close the business Communicating new product developments with prospective and existing customers Participating remote and on-site meetings with customers Collaborating with teams in different regions and offices Making contributions and leading others towards a productive, dynamic, and achievement-oriented team environment Constantly demonstrating our core values and being a role model for team members Providing accurate and timely feedback and verification on a regular basis for key performance indicators as well as the progress/attainments of achieving the established results Driving the commitment to continuous improvements of the team, department, and company Overseeing the actions and performance plans of individuals in your team Holding people accountable and becoming their biggest supporter What We Look For  We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can come up with new ideas to the table and eagerly hope to have the opportunity to learn, develop, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build the best areas for your customers, partners, teams and yourself.  Your main task is to bring in new business while balancing the individual and team quotas. This means that you are a creative thinker who is confident and self-motivated in an entrepreneurial way of thinking. You will take pride in seeing your hard work pay off when you see the final results and are determined to help others succeed.  Other qualities we look for in candidates: : At least 1 years of previous sales experience in Singapore Government (candidates without sales experience but having good potential are also welcome) Past experience in the software/technology industry is a plus Excellent communication and listening skills Determination to surpass performance goals Willingness to learn and teach Ability to work individually and within a highly collaborative team environment Plenty of initiative A persuasive manner Ability to think on your feet Ability to identify, coach, and measure critical core competencies and essential performance indicators Balance of emotional intelligence and competitive spirit Determination to help others succeed Courage to do the right thing and hold others accountable to our shared values Ability to execute in an environment with rapidly changing priorities, showing agility, flexibility and adaptability Strong communication skills to articulate the company’s vision, product changes and adapting to new strategies About AvePoint  Check out our careers blog for content on our people, culture, and workplace!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobTitle: Sales Operations Analyst, Sales Efficiency - Singapore
description: The area: Sales Operations  The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.  The role: Sales Operations Analyst, Sales Efficiency - Singapore  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  Additional Role Description  The APAC Sales Efficiency team is focused on empowering the work of Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams through the improvement of capabilities, excellence, and support teams utilization. In close partnership with other teams (Product, Global Business Operations, gCare, Subregion/Country) we aim to streamline the complexity of the sales landscape.  As an APAC Sales Operations Analyst, you will be a member of a small team and be responsible for the deployment and activation of different projects related to Customer Satisfaction and Sales efficiency for APAC LCS teams. With deep knowledge of Google’s analysis tools, products, back-end infrastructure and LCS sales processes, you will also represent APAC LCS back to Global Business Operations Leads. You have a passion for innovation and simplification of the sales experience.  Responsibilities Derive actionable business insights from in-depth analyses of datasets; (e.g. prioritization of initiatives, impact estimates, and correlation between operational behaviors and business outcomes. Manage cross-functional regional projects or workstreams involving collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders. Partner with the Global Strategy team to cascade Business Operations initiatives and represent APAC’s point of view in Executive reviews. Ensure a consistent approach where applicable. Partner closely with market teams to improve sales efficiency and customer service. Liaise with global and regional counterparts to share best-practices. Present progress and impact of solutions to leadership. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience 3 years of experience in analytics in marketing, sales, or business operations Experience with databases, SQL, data visualization, and advertising products Preferred Qualifications Experience with other scripting/programming languages (e.g. Python, R) Experience with learning systems and tools, and driving or designing improvements Ability to speak to both technical and business stakeholders at all levels of the organization Excellent presentation, communication, problem solving, analysis, and collaboration skills, and strong business judgment Passion for continuous optimization or process re-engineering
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Reporting to Andrew Shuttleworth, the Head of Business Developement, JAPAC, you will be joining a team of located in Singapore, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Paris and Montreal and whose mission is to bring on new logos & develop our outstanding customers‘ base. The Account Executive will prospect, identify, sell and maintain sales relationships within his/her assigned territory.  This position requires interaction with other internal departments such as inside sales, marketing, sales operations and our project delivery teams.  This Role Is Perfect For Those Who Have good experience as a Sales Development Representative or are early in their careers as an Account Executive. Wish to develop their experience in sales and business development and gain experience and responsibility in a growing international startup as an Account Executive Like building business relationships and understanding customer requirements Wish to play a role in the development of an innovative company and are okay with ambiguity and change. Love reaching out and building business relationships in an authentic way Are excited by unearthing relevant customer needs & requirements and working with customers to adopt solutions to solve/meet them (= closing the deal) Are innovative, creative and action-oriented Work efficiently and effectively, are self-driven, street smart and take initiative to work independently and with team members to make things happen Want to work with the latest business development tools and techniques Want to work in a youthful, collaborative, positive, hard working, fun loving team Prefer to work from home but love getting out to meet customers (Preferred, not required) Have a background selling recruiting services or technologies to hiring managers, want to hit the ground running by selling innovative solutions in this space, and are interested to expand their experience to new products & target markets within the first year of joining Agorize Do not rely on marketing to generate leads but go out and find & connect with prospects themselves  Your day to day life at Agorize will look like this Prospecting or properly qualifying new sales opportunities (search, email sequences, events, LinkedIn reach outs, calls) Arranging and participating in 5~10 new warm calls each week to learn about customer requirements, and professionally introduce our services up to the executive level Following up with customers who are interested in our services through to signing of the contract & handover to the project management team Leading negotiations and overcome objections for deal closure Keeping a watchful eye on the progress of won projects to help ensure its success and understand further customer needs  Managing complex sales cycles and multiple engagements simultaneously Following-up with the inbound leads generated by our marketing team (but note this role is certainly expected to generate leads as well). Reporting your activities in the CRM (Hubspot). Effectively and accurately manage forecasting and pipeline reporting Sharing feedback from customers on our product offering to help influence future feature development Work with marketing, product management, and professional services teams to maximise opportunities and foster cohesive sales strategies.  Approximate breakdown of your time Researching 20% Connecting with and closing contracts with prospects 50% Reporting 20% Admin & Other Meetings 10%  Required Skills 2+ years experience in a Sales Development Representative, Account Executive or similar role You have a strong love for sales Knowledge of market research, sales and negotiating principles You are not afraid of challenges and like to take them up You have exceptional presentation and relationship skills enabling you to listen and understand the needs of your clients You are an expert LinkedIn user, have a attractive & active profile and network and want to grow it further You are familiar with business development tools of the trade and interest to test and learn more and stay on the leading edge You are open-minded, you have a strong creative sense and you like to take the less-traveled path You see the glass half full rather than half empty You are known for liking a job well done and for your curiosity You speak English fluently and have professional written communication skills You are interested in hiring and human resources and how companies can use technology to hire more effectively You are also interested new technologies, innovation, and entrepreneurship and have a desire to learn more about these fields You are proficient using leading edge productivity and collaboration tools such as Google Workplace, Slack and Hubspot.

Who we are  Johnson Controls is the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings. At Johnson Controls, we’ve been making buildings smarter since 1885, and our capabilities, depth of innovation experience, and global reach have been growing ever since. Today, we offer the world’s largest portfolio of building products, technologies, software, and services; we put that portfolio to work to transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play.  This is where Johnson Controls comes in, helping drive the outcomes that matter most. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make your buildings smarter. A smarter building is safer, more comfortable, more efficient, and, ultimately, more sustainable. Most important, smarter buildings let you focus more intensely on your unique mission. Better for your people. Better for your bottom line. Better for the planet. We’re helping to create a healthy planet with solutions that decrease energy use, reduce waste and make carbon neutrality a reality.  Sustainability is a top priority for our company. We committed to invest 75 percent of new product development R&D in climate-related innovation to develop sustainable products and services. We take sustainability seriously. Achieving net zero carbon emissions before 2040 is just one of our commitments to making the world a better place.  Please visit and follow Johnson Controls Pacific linkedin for recent exciting activities.  JCI Pacific Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/johnson-controls-australia-pty-ltd/  Career The Power Behind Your Mission  OpenBlue OpenBlue: This is How a Space Comes Alive  What To Do  To execute sales strategies to achieve profitability and growth objectives and sets priorities to ensure customer satisfaction in business delivery objectives. Through effective management, leads the efforts to sell core Air-Conditioning business across multiple channels. Develops and maintains relationships with customers and suppliers and interacts with them frequently. Responsible for sales planning, sales management development and sales activity consistent with Sales Management Disciplines. To ensure a commitment to customer satisfaction and quality and an understanding of the business environment and local community including legislative, purchasing, and market trends.  How You Will Do It Responsible for B2B sales of DX Air Conditioning systems across the region through to distributors, channel partners, wholesalers & contractors Handle small scale projects sales for DX AC systems Secure continuous growth within this the region Visit customers – alone and with sales support at times – and gain an understanding of customer project specifications and inquiries You will also make quotations, specifications and budgets for B2B, B2C & projects sales, and follow up on these leads through proper communication You will have responsibility for keeping your sales pipeline updated in SALES FORCE (CRM System), and you will participate in weekly team meetings and monthly one-to-one meetings to review your complete sales pipeline Responsible for growth of sales through new acquisitions and business partners What We Look For Ability to work autonomously, yet also be a team player that understands and values effective cooperation with colleagues, as you will collaborate with a technically skilled sales support team with regards to your tasks Possess great skills within stakeholder analysis, enabling you to identify and build relationships with key decision makers and customers on all levels Degree/Diploma in Electrical, Mechanical or HVAC engineering or relevant experience in HVAC industry for at least 3 years Possess knowledge of HVAC-Single/multi Split DX AC system and VRF is an added advantage Polished communicator and effective in translating technical knowledge into tangible sales specifications and quotations Responsible for growth through new acquisitions and business partners. Directly responsible for the sales and sales support resources to support these initiatives Ability to multi-task and to convert leads to actual sales Diversity & Inclusion  Our dedication to diversity and inclusion starts with our values. We lead with integrity and purpose, focusing on the future and aligning with our customers’ vision for success. Our High-Performance Culture ensures that we have the best talent that is highly engaged and eager to innovate.  Our D&I mission elevates each employee’s responsibility to contribute to our culture. It’s through these contributions that we’ll drive the mindsets and behaviors we need to power our customers’ missions. You have the power. You have the voice. You have the culture in your hands. description: About us:  Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.  In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn's Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don't take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.  About the Role:  You will be reporting to the Sales Manager. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team into 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure they fully utilize their account.  What will you be doing? Focus on clients within the digital economy (startup / ecom / marketing agencies / fintech / etc.) Hunt new commercial clients that are spending on cards (Commercial Card) OR Hunt new leads for client that are sending funds in different currencies across the globe (FX) Perform prospecting activities such as cold calling and networking Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps Drive referrals by your exceptional work Identify best practices to refine the company's lead generation playbook Keep all records in our CRM Report to Sales Manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  We would love to get to know you if you have the following: Bachelor's degree OR at least 2-3 years of relevant work experience Hunting new opportunities is in your blood Possess a track record of being a top producer in your previous companies Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills via phone (cold calling) and email Experience with a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard/CardUp) is a big plus (Commercial Card) & knowledge of the commercial card market in Singapore (and SEA ideally) OR Experience with a remittance company (WorldFirst/Wise/Instarem/Wallex/SingX) is a big plus (FX) Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization
industries: Financial Services

description: Application Instructions: Interested applicants please apply here: https://grnh.se/170d77282us  Workato is the operating system for today’s fast-moving business. As a high growth company with over 6000 customers, Workato is revolutionizing the integration and automation market with investments from the top 3 SaaS companies - Salesforce, Workday, ServiceNow. Recognized as a leader by both Gartner and Forrester, it is the only AI-based platform that enables both business and IT to integrate their apps and automate workflows across their enterprise with robust security and governance. Some of the world’s top brands including Slack, Grab, Box, Visa, Broadcom run on Workato.  We are looking for an exceptional Senior Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for responding to inbound inquiries and increasing our outreach via outbound activity. You will strategically approach target companies and sell automation solutions that will help them achieve their business objectives. Although you strive to meet and exceed quota, you act in the best interests of the client. You are confident, tenacious and highly organized.  Workato has a positive, diverse, and collaborative culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, smart, hardworking and work to be a little better every day. Workato has also been recognized amongst the “Top 47 Enterprise Startups to Bet Your Career On in 2020” and the “Hottest 13 Productivity Software Startups to Watch in 2020!” by Business Insider.  Responsibilities Own and develop accounts to expand business with enterprise companies in the Asia (Excluding Japan) market Develop and execute outbound strategies to create opportunities Manage the full sales pipeline by assessing sales potential and create prospecting lists via various methods to attract enterprise customers. Develop relationships with existing/potential customers to meet their needs and proactively help customers to assess Workato Working with teams from multiple functions (e.g: Marketing, Customer Success, Product, etc.) to formulate plans to grow new and existing businesses. Ability to expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Build a compelling partner strategy for your key accounts, engage with the channel team and lead the joint sales approach Requirements  Qualifications and Experience 5+ years of Enterprise Software Sales experience in a technology space. Needs to be based in Singapore Has prior experience in closing deals in software or technology sales in Asia (Excluding Japan) Keen interest in technology and industry trends Skills Demonstrates understanding of the Workato iPaaS & Automation Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time in high-pressure situations, and work in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Possess strong critical thinking and analytical skills with an entrepreneurial mindset Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Capability to build great relationships with highly technical customers Why Workato? Supportive, collaborative, international team environment that supports remote employees (currently all of us!) Long-term prospects for a professional career in a high growth company Flexible Work culture Be part of a community-oriented organization with a history of giving back Best in class technology tools to empower you to do your best work Support for professional development and continuous learning Wellness programs, including fitness challenges and an occasional company day off to recover from Zoom fatigue Company-sponsored team-bonding activities and team celebrations Employee and Customer referral bonuses All full-time permanent employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley’s fastest growing startups Flexible and personalised medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalisation and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...)

description: Our Mission  Are you looking to work in a fast growing team that is disrupting the supply chain industry globally with freight tech?  At Flexport, it’s our mission to make global trade easy for everyone. We are transforming the industry with technology associated with our talents and state of the art infrastructure.  Why you?  You want to be more than just a number in a large company. You want to learn skills and build things that are going to disrupt industries and deliver amazing client value. You’re tired of the status quo in an industry that needs transformation. You know you can dream big and be part of the global trade shake up.  Your Background Bachelor / Masters degree 1-3 years working experience as a shipment coordinator, in operations / supply chain, or freight customer service Client-centric mindset, experience or a desire to work with large B2B clients and help them solve complex problems relating to their supply chain Entrepreneurial. We are just building out our client solutions team. We’re looking for entrepreneurial people who aren’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and do whatever it takes to help our customers succeed. A background in logistics, freight forwarding, or supply chain is a plus Ability to demonstrate hands-on, process-oriented, structured thinking with strong problem-solving skills Excellent communicators. Ability to write and speak fluently in English. Mandarin highly preferred What You’ll Do Delight our clients with best-in-class services, solutions and technology: obsessed with client outcomes, doing what it takes to deliver the client’s expectations Connect with global teams to work on end-to-end solutions Fix problems in clients’ supply chain Working Environment Mutli-cultural - We are a diverse team of problem solvers, passionate about making an impact in this crazy World, and advancing Global Trade. Part of our DNA is that people can come as they are, and contribute to our unique culture. We all come with different backgrounds and experiences, and we can’t wait for you to add your story to Flexport. Agile - We empower the team to make the right decisions for our clients & the company. We trust our people to do the best they can in any situation. Supportive - You’ll never feel alone. We have great experts in the company to provide necessary support to you in terms of training, solutions and mentorship. As long as you stay curious, you will always find something to learn at Flexport. Fun - Look, we’re fun, don’t make this awkward. At times we work a lot, and stakes are high but we always make sure to not take ourselves too seriously. Benefits & Perks 13 months salary Semi-annual performance bonus Restricted stock units (your own slice of Flexport) Free lunch, snacks (unlimited sugar rush yay!) and drinks Flexible annual leave - take what you need Flexible Work from Home policy Top-notch medical and dental care plan Life insurance Amazing Learning & development opportunities Hi-tech environment (we’re cloud based and most of us have no idea what a Fax does) Work in downtown Singapore (our office location is Grade A prime real estate in Raffles Place)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Internet

description: Sales and Business Development Manager  X0PA AI is an Artificial Intelligence Software as a Service (SaaS) start-up that aims to digitally transform the hiring process. We aim to save companies significant time and cost in hiring while achieving the highest level of objectivity, ultimately enhancing retention, loyalty and person to job and organization fit. Through our AI and Machine Learning capabilities, we are able to source, score and rank talent to identify the best talent for each organisation.  Brief Overview Of The Role  You will be reporting directly to the Global Head of Strategic Sales and will be working very closely together.  As a Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for targeting new organisations across the globe. You will also be responsible for handling renewals of existing clients as well as up-selling new opportunities.  This is a fantastic opportunity to work hands on with a high performing team in an AI based, innovative, fastmoving, funded start-up.  We are looking for candidates with the right attitude, drive & curiosity and we value that over any educational qualifications. If you are highly driven, looking to accelerate your career and grow in a high performing start-up environment, WE WANT YOU!  Key Responsibilities Identify key influencers and decision makers at target companies and convince them on the benefits of our solutions Comfortable with selling B2B solutions and SaaS solutions Conduct product demonstrations Manage end to end sales processes, including negotiating and closing clients Take ownership of creating your sales plan and achieving your sales targets Create presentation and marketing materials independently as required Perform cost-benefit analysis Perform other related duties and manage ad-hoc projects as needed 3-5 years of sales experience, with a proven sales track record in current role Experience in selling B2B/ SaaS or Technology solutions Knowledge of Applicant Tracking System (ATS) platforms & HR Tech Solutions will be an added advantage Comfortable with interacting with VP and C-level executives Excellent negotiation and communication skills Oral and written fluency in English Experience and/ or comfortable with cold calling Highly result oriented, go-getter and a team player Highly self-motivated with a strong ambition to excel and achieve results Adaptable working style – comfortable with ambiguity Comfortable with technology systems and internet applications What we offer?  We are a bunch of fun loving, self-motivated professionals. We offer an inclusive, diverse and motivated work environment with huge learning opportunities.  In Singapore, we are located at JTC LaunchPad at One North which is a leading start-up hub in Asia and the world, a vibrant start-up ecosystem with opportunities to meet lot of like- minded individuals.

description: about the company  Randstad is the world’s leading HR solutions agency that is passionate about making work meaningful. We thrive on delivering award-winning and digital-led talent matching solutions to organisations ranging from start-ups to global multinationals.  In Singapore, we are made up of more than 100 individuals from a diverse range of backgrounds and work experience to offer different perspectives about the local employment landscape. We believe in developing our people - professionally and personally. At Randstad Singapore, we offer our consultants a diverse environment focussed on skills development, innovation and performance recognition.   When you work with us, you’ll be empowered to explore your entrepreneurial spirit, carve your career progression, access great training opportunities and earn a highly competitive income with uncapped commissions.   As part of our growing technology team we are looking for an industry expert to do business development across our technology clients.  Leveraging off our existing client relationships this role will see you opening doors in a new market and working alongside the team to build a strong reputation in this sector.  about the job  As a business development consultant, you will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities though sales activity and develop a portfolio of clients to contribute positively to revenue and business growth and team expansion.  You will also market map and identify key clients to ensure growth and development in your allocated industry or vertical to hunt for new clients and account managed existing ones. You will target specific positions in the technology stack to partner effectively with the delivery consultants to identify the talent sought after and place them effectively.   main accountabilities  formulate a business development plan, together with the manager, to support the achievement of personal sales targets. initiate a range of sales and marketing activities, in accordance with the business development plan, to attract business. develop and maintain relationships with clients to ensure a good understanding of their current and future priorities and to identify new leads within the Randstad Group. independently identify new clients & new contacts for the randstad technologies team  manage business development by sales pitches in client meetings  about the manager  Dlo is looking for a high-EQ tech sales King or Queen to join his sales team! That's right, a rare chance to have the billing superstar of Randstad tech as your boss, mentor and (maybe) friend! If you or someone you know is great at building lasting and meaningful relationships with Singapore's Tech Leaders and Talent Leaders - let's talk more. Dlo promises he’s so much cooler than this job ad makes him seem.  skills and experience  University degree or higher education discipline A minimum of 2 years IT sales experience or strong IT background Must consistently meet individual targets Exceptional at creating opportunities and influencing outcomes Commercially- and digitally-savvy Motivated and driven to produce consistent performance   To apply, email your resume to francine.wong@randstad.com.sg. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. (EA: 94C3609)  culture and benefits Randstad Singapore is a people-first organisation. We go above and beyond to ensure that every employee feels empowered to make and drive change, while looking after their physical and mental health.   Aside from a highly competitive salary and commission structure, you will have access to medical insurance benefits, performance bonus, extensive learning & development programme and a customised individual development plan to fast-track your career with us. As a global HR company, you’ll also have the unique opportunity to collaborate with other teams and markets as you grow with us.

description: Do you aspire a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company.  Work with the world’s most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore!  Top reasons to work here: Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentives Comprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverage Premium workspaces Engaging activities and recognition programs Strong learning and development plans for your career growth Positive culture for you to #BeMore at work Easy to locate area with direct access to public transport Flexible working arrangements Be coached and mentored by experts in your field Join a global company with 25 years of experience and more than 270 industry awards  What is your mission?  What gets measured, gets managed.” The Business Analyst is responsible for gathering and understanding business requirements, collating and preparing data, performing analyses, extracting insights, and making recommendations to assist the company in developing meaningful business solutions and operational improvements. The position is also expected to monitor progress to agreed measurables and within set organizational procedures. The ideal candidate can work on multiple initiatives simultaneously and translate data into digestible and actionable insights that improve our businesses.  You are also required to perform these job functions: Responsible for studying analytics requirements and delivering solutions Study business requirements, collate data, analyse/research, and translate results into effective presentations and recommendations to aid decision making in timely manner Conduct root cause analysis or correlation studies as and when required Support projects/departments by developing regular (e.g. daily, weekly, monthly) and effective reports, dashboards and presentations on KPIs and other metrics related to contact center operations (inbound/outbound) Educate internal/external users appropriate use of analytics and business intelligence Any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management from time to time, within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the Quality Management System of TDCX.   Who are we looking for? Possesses an analytics-related diploma or at least a Bachelor’s Degree Experience in extracting, transforming and porting data from source systems to data analytics platform(s) and reports Experience in conceptualising, designing, developing, testing, implementing and supporting agile data analytics platforms to support analytical initiatives of internal or external stakeholders Experience in analysing different types of data to support business needs and present the results in concise visualisation formats Has an inquisitive mind and proactivity to challenge the norms constructively Team player with good communication and presentation skills Detail oriented, independent and able to work under pressure to meet deadlines Experience in Salesforce, advanced Excel and PowerPoint would be preferred Ability to use analytical tools such as Tableau, Klipfolio, Qlik, R, SPSS would be added advantage Adaptable to various stakeholders, business models and projects  Who is TDCX? We serve some of the world’s best brands from our centers of excellence in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, the Philippines, Hong Kong, China, Japan, Spain, Colombia, Romania, and India. We specialize in perfecting our clients’ customer experience and elevating their sales. We are guided by a talent philosophy - selecting and employing the best professionals to make the outsource industry better for our people and our clients. Our company has won over 270 industry awards for delivering value driven by technology and continuously innovating our customer-facing brand solutions. Thanks to our premium workspaces, above industry average compensation packages, career opportunities, and long list of perks, we were recently awarded as one of the best companies to work for in Asia.

description: Job Summary  Primary responsibilities involve developing, implementing and executing TWG Tea sales action plans and strategies, to maintain positive current client relationships that are sustainable and beneficial to our Organization as well as developing new clients to contribute to the growth of our business. Ability to facilitate communication, contribute ideas about product differentiation, and operate as a liaison between clients and Management.  Primary Relationships  The position reports directly to the Sales Directors or Senior Sales Managers and indirectly to the Chief Corporate Officer.  Within the organization, this position has primary working relationships with the other Corporate Sales team members, the Sales Logistics, Marketing, Human Resources and Training teams as well as TWG Tea overseas partners and franchisees.  Outside the organization, the position coordinates primarily with our HORECA clients that carries TWG Tea products, both locally and overseas.  Job Descriptions Manage major key corporate account / develop new business with corporate clients Target market by developing, implementing and executing sales action plans and strategies Source for new and appropriate clients Prepare quotation and proposals to clients Monitor sales and follow up with clients Meeting of sales target and boosting sales Project accurate representation of Company to clients Liaise with warehouse and logistic colleagues to ensure timely delivery of goods Liaise with Finance to ensure timely invoicing and payments are received from clients Process purchase and sales orders Prepare periodic reporting Be cheerful at all times Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related major Minimum 3-years’ experience in corporate sales with demonstrated success, preferably in the luxury industry Key account servicing experience in a luxury brand is preferred Fluent in written and spoken Chinese/Korean/Japanese would be a plus (in order to liaise with Chinese/Korean/Japanese speaking clients, depending on the market assigned) Computer literacy in Microsoft Office and Outlook Demonstrated successful experience in making presentations and negotiating contracts with clients Excellent written and oral communication skills Good analytical, organizational and personal skills Meticulous and excellent eye for details Customer service oriented Adaptable and flexible Pleasant personality and ability to work in teams Affinity with the products Only Singaporeans may apply. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.  Please upload a detailed resume, indicating reasons for leaving, last drawn salary, expected salary and date of availability.
industries: Food & Beverages, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Retail

description: Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.  foodpanda is the leading, on-demand food delivery company in Singapore, bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture.  We are looking for a highly driven and motivated Corporate Account Manager for our team in Singapore. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have direct impact, then this may be the place for you! The ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor – comfortable working independently, whilst working closely with the management team. This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Head of Corporate.  About The Job  As a Corporate Account Manager, you will work as a member of our B2B sales team and will be responsible for the execution of our sales plan which include:  Responsibilities Grow the current revenue streams of B2B orders and servicing key existing accounts on the B2B platform Use data to find gaps and opportunities for growth and increased productivity of our most important companies Strategize, implement, and measure the results of new processes to improve companies' performance Optimize and automate processes to allow for scalability of the business Report KPIs to the Head of Corporate and provide insights to other departments Requirements Excellent communication skills, confident personality and ability to understand clients’ needs You have successfully completed a Bachelor’s degree At least 1-2 years of proven success in a sales/business development environment, with experience generating new business in a B2B Experienced in cold calling Quick learner, excited about the opportunity to develop consultative sales skills Comfortable in competitive environment working with monthly targets Able to start immediately will be an added advantage What We Offer Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve Vibrant, dynamic & international workplace Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities Tasty Thursdays Birthday Leave Work Anniversar(ies) Leave Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Roger Dubuis 's World. Brave, bold and technically sophisticated Swiss watch Manufacture. Audacious mindset that drives innovation while cultivating profound respect for traditions  HOW WILL YOU WILL CREATE IMPACT?  You will be the Ambassador of the brand Be excellent in customer service and being able to build meaningful and sustainable relationships with VIP/HNWI clients are expected. To grow your performance and Boutique business through recruitment of new clients, while actively capitalizing on different tools to develop existing or prospective client’s loyalty to the brand.  HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?  You have at least 2 years of experience ideally within the luxury watch industry, we also consider candidate with hospitality background or having the audacious mindset Together with your exceptional communication and presentation skills, you also thrive under pressure and able to demonstrate strong selling skill You have a strong team spirit because of your positive mindset and inspiring attitude Your proactiveness to communicate with management about opportunities to propose action plan for further relationships development and to explore potential events to increase brand awareness and customer loyalty among new and existing clients  HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?  A great opportunity to demonstrate your interpersonal skills and comfortable in building relations with internal and external client’s and interact with people with different cultures and habits. This role will also help deepen your knowledge of luxury watchmaking whilst enhancing your expertise in retail operations and client management Finally, a plethora of opportunities within the Richemont Group to help you develop and take your career to the next level  Your Journey With Us  Firstly, you will meet the HR Manager to get to know YOU and give you a preview as well of the team dynamics and company culture Subsequently, you will be meeting with the Boutique Manager to dive deeper and assess your fit to this role. She will also share potential growth opportunities should you be successful in this position Finally, you could have chance to meet some of the Maison’s Key Leaders
industries: Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: About The Company  The company is one of the biggest sporting goods designers, manufacturers, and retailers based in France, with an international network of 90,000 employees working in over 1400 stores in 42 countries. They are opening their sixth outlet in Punggol by October 2021 and need new hires to join them before that in order to undergo a great training program.  About The Job  Your responsibility will be to make your designated sport accessible within your community by sharing the benefits of your sport with your customers and users. Once you have mastered the in-store basics, you will have the freedom to think outside the box, make commercial decisions on how and what to sell, building your business from the ground up. You are responsible for the design, layout and feel of the sport section under you and are similar to an entrepreneur and a sport lover on the job. Here are parts of the role where you can make the biggest difference in: Economic analysis and projection Customer Satisfaction Commercial merchandising Project management About The Manager/team  You will report to the Store Manager and may have 2 oe 3 part-timers under your supervision.  Skills & Requirements  You must be extremely passionate about sports, and previous retail experience is a plus. This role is well-suited for somebody who is excited by their potential to drive impactful change in people, positive, hands-on attitude with a desire to learn, embrace responsibility and vitality, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment. In addition, you should be a great listener, communicator, and team player. In return the company offers a good bonus and employee benefits. You will work 44 hours over 5 days, with 1 week day and 1 weekend off every week.  To apply online please use the 'apply' function. Consultant-in-charge: Tammie Phus  (EA: 94C3609/ R1109745)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: We are looking for multiple Majors Account Executive - Malaysia (to be based in Singapore) with the right energy, competitive spirit, personal drive and track record of success in Sales. This position involves working with small to medium business clients (employee count of 1,001 to 5,000 non-named) to provide them the right Zoom services that meet their video and online meeting needs. Working in a defined geographic territory, you will proactively engage with targeted companies, as well as follow up and close on various sources of inbound leads. All are new additional headcounts.  Responsibilities Meet or exceed sales and product objectives Effectively qualify leads and identify prospect needs, engaging technical resources as required Create client demos/ presentations, quotes/ proposals, and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) Conduct high-level conversations with C-Level and VP -Level Executives to address business needs Utilize solution-selling techniques to effectively guide sales process to close Develop and maintain business within existing accounts, manage complex sales situations and sales campaigns Upsell and leverage business from new and established customer relationships Utilize Salesforce CRM to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates Work strategically with management to deliver forecasts, identify trending opportunities/challenges, and provide recommended solutions Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement while creating satisfied customers Resolve client issues in a timely and thorough manner; escalates issues to manager as appropriate Keep informed of product line, competition and industry trends that may impact client business activities Requirements Minimum 8 years of Account Executive experience in a Technology company Direct sales experience in SaaS / Cloud / Subscription-based solutions Language Proficiency: Bahasa Malaysia plus English SaaS video or web conferencing solutions selling experience preferred Inbound sales experience This position requires the ability to hunt into new accounts, develop and maintain business within existing accounts and manage complex sales situations and large projects (in the Malaysia market) Demonstrated excellence in presentation skills with the ability to build relevant, strategic messaging Presence and proficiency in social media such as LinkedIn preferred Strong collaboration and relational skills Business forecasting, pipeline development and management skills are required A proven track record of closed sales, client satisfaction, & teamwork Must have strong verbal skills with consultative professional business acumen Must be detail-oriented, organized, ethical, responsible, & self-motivated Salesforce CRM experience preferred Strong Internet research skills with excellent PC literacy [Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint] BA/ BS or equivalent experience
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Overall Purpose Of The Job To organize, prepare and report on Major Projects Steering Committees and assist the Major Projects team in the bid management and related tools of medical services mid-size and major projects.  Scope Medical services mid-size and major projects.  Overview The main roles of the Major Projects Team are: To participate in successful and profitable development of Medical Services projects, through assessment of business opportunities, response to tenders, preparation of proposals and other Sales & Marketing initiatives. To drive a multi-country effort to develop International SOS Medical Services business with Private Entities, Governmental Institutions and International Organizations.  Key Responsibilities Provides commercial supports (as a lead or support depending on project size/complexity) on replies to large tenders or proposals: review of tender documentation, design of solution, preparation and/or review of costings and P&L schedules, pricing calculations. Reviews calculations provided by project teams and challenges assumptions and methodology, where necessary. Provides guidance to teams on compliance with Scope of Work Reviews proposals and checks for coherence with Scope of Work and pricing Leads or support review calls with the project owners Constantly reviews and suggests enhancements to costing/P&L template and assists in programming, validating & testing of formulas Develops and maintains the project tracking sheet allowing accurate and up-to-date reporting. Responsible for the reporting and analysis of mid-size and major projects, including tracking of opportunities and communicating on overall trends and results. (MBR reporting, SFDC updates, follow-up with project owners) Responsible for the organization of the project review meetings, monitoring and support of prior required functional reviews, follow up of actions items, tracking of statistics and safe-keeping of related documents Independently maintains the Sharepoint site, ensuring the templates always reflects the latest versions Independently develop, maintain and enhance the project and tender libraries  Other Duties To carry out any other reasonable duties as requested by the line manager. To work flexible hours as appropriate to the needs of the post.  OH&S Responsibilities Participate in the development and maintenance of a safe and healthy workplace. Undertake all mandatory OH&S training as required. Comply with any reasonable instructions, policies, procedures or safe work practices given by Intl.SOS in adhering to safe work procedures. Co-operate with management in its fulfilment of its legislative obligations. Take reasonable care to ensure their own health and safety and the safety of others. To report any injury, hazard or illness as soon as possible to their supervisor. Job Profile Required Work Experience At least 2 years in service industries Organizational roles (full-time or project based) Analytical and reporting responsibilities Tertiary educational qualifications Finance background Good command of Excel is a must. “Sharepoint” is a plus
industries: Hospital & Health Care

#TeamSHIELD SHIELD is a mobile-first risk intelligence company that helps world-leading enterprises build trust and safety by stopping fraud and abuse. Trusted across all continents by superapps, top e-commerce platforms and e-wallets, we protect over 7 billion devices and 700 million user accounts every year. Headquartered in Singapore, we have offices in the United States, the United Kingdom, Germany, Indonesia, and China.  Responsibilities As a Technical Account Manager, you will be the expert in our solutions and a trusted advisor to our clients. You will be responsible for maintaining and strengthening client relationships, as well as supporting clients through the implementation of SHIELD’s solutions. You will work closely with the team to provide high quality service and support, such as technical consultation and quick troubleshooting. Advise on technical support and product adoption for clients in line with pre-sales, post-sales and the renewal processes Work closely across the different teams in SHIELD to provide prompt and professional troubleshooting for any technical challenges faced by clients Ability to stand in the client's shoes and dedication to drive high level of client satisfaction Perform regular technical account reviews, product trainings and on-site visits to provide insights and analytics for clients Assist clients in their upgrades and migration by providing technical support to ensure long-term success Be the trusted technical advisor our clients seek and work with the SHIELD product and engineering teams to manage clients’ feature request prioritization Pro-actively advocate for SHIELD’s product adoption by identifying opportunities in which our product can better fit with clients’ needs and technology  Qualifications Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field Minimum 3 years of Technical Account Management, Sales engineering or Support engineering experience in the B2B enterprise Software / SaaS / payments industry Good knowledge  in HTTP, JavaScript, RESTful APIs, JSON, OAuth and SQL Strong customer focus with an ability to manage multiple priorities and perform in a fast-paced work environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate and present technical concepts to both technical and business audience
industries: Information Technology and Services

Perform any other tasks as requested and directed by the Management. Requirements  The candidate should possess the following: Degree or Diploma in Sales, Marketing, Business Administration or other related fields, with at least 5 years of relevant and managerial experience Confident and meticulous Good spoken and written English Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills Ability to work independently and in teams Well versed in use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Knowledge in Adobe Photoshop/Illustrators will be an added advantage

description: The people at Wilhelmsen Marine Products do not just hold jobs here. They make the most innovative ideas a reality – and in the process, they shape the maritime industry. With the largest maritime network in the world, we do work that makes an impact - if it floats, our products are probably on it. Supplying marine solutions including the Unitor brand of products, Timm ropes, Unicool refrigerants, and Unitor and Nalfleet marine chemicals, last year we made product deliveries to 27,500 vessels. Having the largest maritime network, we supply marine consumables, products, and solutions to every conceivable vessel type, at over 2,000 ports. At Wilhelmsen, we keep global trade running. Anchor your career in the maritime industry and dive into a sea of opportunities with us now. We are looking for a Sales Support Team Lead SEA to manage and lead a team of Sales Support Coordinators. If you have a Diploma or Bachelor degree in Sales & Marketing with a minimum 3 years of relevant working experience, then this is the role for you. The Sales Support Team Lead SEA will report to Area Sales Director - South East Asia. Required experience and skills: Administrative skills and managerial experience in revious roles. Proven communication skills. Able to meet deadlines through good time management and allocation of priorities. Computer literate and good command of MS Office, CRM systems, Excel etc. Proactive, takes responsibility and delivers results. Team player with good interpersonal skills. What you will be doing: Manage the team, coordinate workload and monitor results and performance. Capture “as-is” processes and collaborate to cocurate the new standardized processes. Align and collaborate with other Sales Support Team Leads on global best practices. Prepare deal proposals, tender doc. and legal agreements in accordance with WSS governance. Register and maintain relevant customer data, such as payer, vessel and contract data. Monitor and drive improvement of customer data accuracy and completeness. Provide sales and customer analysis, prepare business reviews and customer presentations. Assist on enforcing high levels of quality, accuracy and consistency in the sales planning. Facilitate successful implementation of sales processes and CRM usage. Manage customer complaints/non-compliance through the CRM/IP system as per valid process. Coordinate the implementation of sales initiatives & campaigns. Prepare and organize sales meetings and customer events. We offer a culture and work environment of strong leadership, career development and a job that is both challenging and stimulating. Sounds interesting? If you can see yourself in this role, please let us know why you are our new Sales Support Team Lead SEA. Please apply via link : https://wilhelmsen.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Wilhelmsen/job/Singapore/Sales-Support-Team-Lead-SEA_JOBREQ_1604-1
industries: Maritime

description: Vistex is an SAP software solutions extensions partner serving businesses of all sizes worldwide across a spectrum of industries by managing their master data, contracts, pricing, rebates and incentive programs. Our solutions provide unprecedented visibility into the breadth and depth of go-to-market programs and enable businesses with insightful information that drive revenue, control costs and increase margins. Our deep industry expertise coupled with in-house implementation, delivery and training services makes Vistex a full solutions resource and consultancy.  The Customer Engagement Manager will manage and develop new and existing clients. They will work towards strengthening our relationships and increasing Vistex footprint. Expected to resolve clients’ issues, communicate information accurately to the teams, engage with clients, position and aggressively pursue Vistex services. Will be assigned to multiple clients/implementations simultaneously which could be in various regions of the country.  Responsibilities: Assist in expanding Vistex consulting service offering Build client relationships with C Level executives and stakeholders. Understand client’s business and business processes and act as Vistex advocate to address the existing gaps by selling Vistex implementation services Position and assist in up selling additional Vistex software Develop sales and solution strategies Understand and work with different teams to provide solution roadmap to clients Assist in finalizing proposals, project planning and estimating Assist in pre-sales activities for implementation services  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree Required 5 + Years of Sap Consulting (hands-on) experience and or Presales SAP experience and or SAP Project Management (Implementation only) experience Excellent client-facing and interpersonal skills Understanding of RFPs, Contracts and SOWs Exposure to multiple full lifecycle software implementations Experience working with Big 4 or other large consulting firms is preferred Collaborative and consultative work style Ability to link business processes with products/solutions Independent thinking with keen problem-solving skills Ability to adapt to changing schedules and multiple work plans. Excellent hands on experience and knowledge on MS Office tools like MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint and MS Projects. Willingness to travel  About us:  Vistex solutions help businesses take control of their mission-critical processes. With a multitude of programs covering pricing, trade, royalties and incentives, it can be complicated to see where all the money is flowing, let alone how much difference it makes to the topline and the bottomline. With Vistex, business stakeholders can see the numbers, see what really works, and see what to do next – so they can make sure every dollar spent or earned is really driving growth, and not just additional costs. The world’s leading enterprises across a spectrum of industries rely on Vistex every day to propel their businesses.
industries: Computer Software

To establish long term partnerships and relationships with channel partners and personnel within the organization. We are currently seeking an Account Manager to join the Commercial team based in Singapore.  Reporting to the Account Team Manager, the Account Manager will be playing a critical role in the team to achieve the margin and market share growth of the M&O business, in line with the area Long Range Plan (LRP). This role will personally act as the main point of contact for the assigned group of accounts, focussing on the customer experience to enhance loyalty and build long-term relationships.  Key Responsibilities Support the account team manager to routinely review and identify the clients within the territory that represent the greatest opportunities. Develop a thorough understanding of the assigned accounts clients’ business to articulate a clear ‘why LR’ value proposition that will resonate with the client and the challenges of their key stakeholders. Maintain a thorough understanding of LR’s main competitors in the area and share this understanding as necessary with the area, global and central commercial teams. Develop and maintain account plans for the assigned accounts, that optimise the margin performance for the segment, area, and the global LR business. Provide input and insight into the Sales and Marketing plan (SMP) with the actions necessary to deliver the area Long Range Plan (LRP). Regularly analyse and expected sales performance based on sales pipeline, individual win rates, market trends, forecasts and competitor activity. Act as the main point of contact for the assigned accounts and work closely with the area client care team and key stakeholders to ensure the client relationship is always managed effectively. Deliver financial and operational performance against agreed budget targets, in line with the expected area contribution to the Marine & Offshore financial plans. Ensure that for all large bids involving multiple internal stakeholders, a bid leader is agreed from the outset, with defined roles and responsibilities understood by the opportunity capture team. Collaborate extensively and actively engage with the growth product specialists and account managers in different teams or areas to support opportunities and projects as required. Organise frequent executive level engagement with specified clients and ensure strategic relationships are maintained between LR’s senior management and the clients’ senior management. Take accountability for the accuracy and quality of the opportunity and account data input into Salesforce to ensure confidence in the performance reporting and sales forecasts. Report on client meetings and all aspects of competitor activity for each client. Disseminate this information to relevant internal stakeholders and share updates during relevant meetings. Seek and review client feedback, facilitate resolution of complaints promptly, and disseminate lessons learned to service delivery and client care teams as appropriate, in line with GMS and SLAs. Ensure high quality proposals and competitive quotes are produced for the assigned accounts, to expand LR’s existing revenue, market share and relationship with the clients. Apply commercial acumen in the review of commercial contracts, safeguarding and maximising LR’s position. Liaise with relevant colleagues as required in the preparation/review stage. Support the Account Team Manager as required and actively participate in events, conferences, and workshops to network and promote LR. Key Requirements A degree from a recognized institution within a relevant field of study. Experience in Account Management in a Marine & Offshore environment with an in depth understanding of sales and client care principles. Strong commercial awareness including the ability to develop strategic action plans based on input from key persons. Strong team spirit. Excellent professional people skills to improve performance across the area of business. Thorough understanding of the shipping market and marine environment to manage commercial focus and find new business opportunities. Ability to communicate effectively at different levels within organisations and to influence successfully and openly at all levels - both inside our organisation and outside in the business. Ability and understanding to participate, communicate, positively contribute and add value in marine & offshore supply chain and technical discussions with clients and LR colleagues alike. Enjoyment of building relationships, with the ability to pro-actively drive development of a network of key relationships internally and externally. Flexible approach to adjust role as the position develops. Diversity and Inclusion at Lloyd's Register:  Together we are one Lloyd’s Register, committed to developing an inclusive and safe workplace that embraces and celebrates diversity. We strive to ensure that all applicants to LR experience equality of opportunity and fair treatment, because we believe it is the right thing to do. We hope you do too.  Copyright © Lloyd's Register 2021. All rights reserved. Terms of use. Privacy policy.  The Lloyd's Register Group comprises charities and non-charitable companies, with the latter supporting the charities in their main goal of enhancing the safety of life and property, at sea, on land and in the air - for the benefit of the public and the environment. (Group entities)

You will be responsible for developing and maintaining partnerships with business partners aligned to the company’s overall objectives and get exposure to shape the overall business strategy. Here at PolicyPal, we strive to provide opportunities for our team to learn, grow and thrive. Building up & managing client accounts through a customer contact strategy that includes regular virtual interaction (face to face depending on Covid regulations), creating multiple contact points in each corporate account, and personal relationship building with these contacts Continuously researching and prospecting new business opportunities through effective methods Pitching and presenting the company’s product offerings to new business opportunities and existing clients Completing regular needs analyses, formulating proposals, detailing costing, and negotiating payment terms with organisations. Requirements 1-2 years of business development or sales experience in the insurance or banking industry will be advantageous Ability to perform in a fast-paced and growth-charged environment Track record of consistently meeting and exceeding KPIs Excellent interpersonal, strong presentation and communication skills Comfortable with numbers and ability to use MS Excel Passionate about FinTech and InsurTech Certification in M5,M9,M8,HI,BCP, PGI, CGI would be a plus

description: Summary   ITIVITI provides business-critical software and services to financial institutions globally, including low-latency connectivity and routing infrastructures, direct market access to global and regional exchanges, multi-asset low-touch and high-touch order management and execution systems, risk management and middle office solutions, as well as proprietary trading and market-making solutions.   We serve around 2,000 clients worldwide, including top-tier trading firms, banks, brokers, exchanges and institutional investors alike, which all rely on our technology, solutions and expertise to streamline their daily operations, all while being able to comply with global regulations.  With 18 offices across all major financial centers, the merger of ITIVITI and ULLINK in March 2018 created a full-service technology and infrastructure provider, covering all asset classes, geographies, and regulatory landscapes. Our company was recently acquired by Broadridge Financial Solutions (NYSE: BR), a constituent of S&P 500, which will give our staff further opportunities for success and growth.  About the role:  Our APAC Sales Team is made of multicultural, highly experienced experts, working autonomously and spread across our Tokyo, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Sydney offices. We are looking for a Sales Executive to join our Singapore team, to manage and grow our ASEAN & South Asia business.  The successful Sales Executive is responsible for identifying, qualifying, and prospecting new business opportunities, as well as managing existing relationships with an eye for growing revenue by cross selling between our global regions or by up-selling in existing accounts. This role reports directly to the APAC Head of Sales.  Main responsibilities include:  Generating leads and building a healthy pipeline of potential clients through cold-calling & networking. Growing existing accounts of the firm by up-selling and cross-selling. Closing on key deals to ensure the firm reaches aggressive sales targets. Managing client enquiries and taking ownership of the sales process and administrative follow ups. Promoting the company’s brand through professional events and conferences. Reporting to regional and global management on sales, sales progress, local trends, requirements, and issues, in order to facilitate operations and strategic decisions. Our ideal candidate will have:  Past experience in selling financial software solutions. Specific experience in selling complex order management, risk, pricing, market making, connectivity or execution platforms to sell-side financial institutions would be a key strength. Good understanding of Equities, Derivatives, Warrants, ETFs, FX, and Fixed Income order execution workflows. Proven track record of closing high-value deals and multi-year, multi-entity contracts. Team player with proven sales, lead generation, and client management skills. Independent, assertive, and willing to go the extra mile. Proven skills to manage complex deals and report issues to other parties efficiently. Ability to engage C-level decision-makers, with outstanding presentation skills. Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written) - a must. Other/regional languages - a plus.  We offer:
