description: KaVo Dental is one of the world’s leading creators of equipment for dentists and dental professionals, including premium solutions for imaging, treatment units, and instruments. Since its establishment in 1909, KaVo has been a leader in the dental market, making its mark on dentistry with numerous significant dental innovations and technology. KaVo built its world-renowned reputation on products and services that follow its mission for "Quality and Precision" to achieve “Dental Excellence.” The 2,200+ patents and utility models granted to KaVo are an impressive proof of this claim. Learn more about KaVo Dental at www.kavo.com.  Job Description  Purpose of Position:  Responsible for achieving agreed sales volume and revenue within the expected margin to grow the consumables product market share in Singapore.  Key Responsibilities  Responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Sales Volume/Pricing - Ensure the achievement of target sales volumes, pricing and revenue and to gain market share by planning and maintaining systematic call/visit patterns (include cold calls) on an array of dental consumables; developing and maintaining close/excellent business relationships with customers and their staff and key clients, dealer sales personnel and by identifying opportunities to increase sales and aiming at converting the prospective customers from competition to a new customer within the country. Negotiate terms of sales agreement and close sales with customers. Sales Management - Ensure effective management of the respective sales by the timely and accurate maintenance, preparation and submission of relevant quotation, sales order, sales reports and after sales follow-up/support. Co-ordinate with other sales and technical support team members. Marketing and Sales Co-ordination - Contribute to the orderly and systematic marketing and sales of consumable products in the Singapore market by the timely and accurate adherence to all agreed sales and pricing policies, gather market and customer information and provide feedback on buying trends and practice sharing. Keep Country Manager aware of significant developments within the country. Team Participation - Contribute to the teamwork and work climate by assisting other team members where appropriate, seeking area’s where further work contributions may be made and by maintaining effective work relations with all other staff members. Contribute to the effective representation of our consumables product interests by promoting and representing the company with involvement in exhibits, trade shows and conventions, product demonstration and in industry association activities. Develop and maintain relationships with key influential thought leaders. Utilize these relationships to expand market share. Study and stay informed on products, technologies, clinical studies, competitive activity, and other general information of interest to company or to customers. Job Requirements Education: Degree/Diploma in Marketing / Business or related discipline. Experience: Min 3 years of relevant direct and channel selling experience, preferably in dental industry. Proven track record of sales success. Good knowledge and experience with segmentation, positioning, product marketing, branding, marketing communications, digital marketing will be added advantage. Excellent communication skills Good commercial acumen - Able to study and understand customers' buying pattern and create customer segmentation; strong ability to build sales pipeline and funnel; always aspire ways to gain market share for the consumable products Highly motivated and professional individual Sales process-driven with strong closing skills Drive and resilience - ability to maintain focus on key objectives Operating Company  KaVo  Envista and its family of companies (Envista) will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Envista will consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes submitted by vendors such as search firms, staffing agencies, professional recruiters, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies (Agency) to have been referred by the Agency free of charge and Envista will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt such unsolicited resumes. An Agency must obtain advance written approval from Envista's internal Talent Acquisition or Human Resources team to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract approved by the Global Talent Acquisition leader and in response to a specific job opening. Envista will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement and written approval in place.

jobTitle: Enterprise Account Executive, Cryptocurrency Businesses, APAC
description: Our Account Executives are expert storytellers and problem-solvers and we’re obsessed with expanding cryptocurrency markets and helping customers track and prevent fraud and abuse. Our goal is to make sure every cryptocurrency business sees the value of implementing our solutions.  Account Executives are experts at moving prospects through the sales funnel, tailoring their sales approach to the potential buyers’ needs, and evangelizing Chainalysis solutions in a compelling yet approachable way. We measure success by the attainment of assigned quota, accuracy of forecasting, and the growth of accounts in your region.  In one year you’ll know you were successful if… You exceeded your quota and substantially increased our foothold in the Cryptocurrency Markets in APAC through building large enterprise accounts in the vertical You’ve helped us develop compelling product positioning and messaging specific to market trends, competitive drivers, region-specific sales channels, and more Your relationships with customers are built on trust and transparency resulting in network referrals that ultimately build Chainalysis’ brand awareness You’ve built a diverse pipeline of opportunities resulting in consistent and accurate forecasting You’ve consistently used data from sales figures, marketing campaigns, and promotional activities to enable you to meet and exceed sales goals Product and Engineering teams rely on your advice and input to inform new product features and solutions You have relationships across departments at Chainalysis allowing you to provide expert advice to prospects related to technical concepts, product roadmaps, solutions implementations, training, and craft appropriate customer proposals A Background Like This Helps Demonstrated history in a previous full-cycle B2B SaaS Sales position, selling to cryptocurrency businesses You have built a strong Crypto portfolio for a B2B Saas company across APAC You’re an articulate, enthusiastic, and effective communicator who can convey complex concepts in an approachable and concise way You’re willing to travel as needed (when it’s safe again!) At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant’s Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.  Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA Employees are not required to attend in-person meetings at this time. All in-person, Chainalysis attendees must be vaccinated* prior to the in-person event/meeting You must follow cleaning protocols. This includes washing your hands before and after meetings or using a disinfectant or alcohol solution with at least 70% alcohol If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, they must immediately notify the People team *A USA employee is considered fully vaccinated if they meet any of the following criteria: It has been 2 weeks since their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or It has been 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen vaccine, or A person has recovered from a COVID-19 infection and was treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma and are within 90 days of the treatment. Please note that once 90 days has passed after the monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma treatment, an employee will not be permitted to meet in-person or go to a customer meeting until they meet the above criteria of being fully vaccinated Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA  As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. Employees in the EU and the UK are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed “green or amber” by the EU and the UK authorities. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines: International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC  With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.

description: The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you’ll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that.  We’ve been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There’s plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure.  Commercial Account Executive : Singapore  Based: Singapore  EDB seeks an Commercial Account Executive (CAE) who will develop pipeline and close new business in the sales territory of ASEAN, Singapore for EDB’s commercial segment. The commercial segment is defined as accounts that have less than $1 billion in annual revenue - but this adjusts for different regions and territories. The CAE will be accountable for closing business that originates from the inbound marketing funnel, outbound prospecting, and assigned accounts. This is a high-energy role that requires exceptional organization, determination, and focus. It is not easy to identify new opportunities across multiple channels, progress qualified pipeline, close new business, and develop strong customer relationships simultaneously. If you’re up to the challenge in the hot PostgreSQL market - we want to talk to you!  This resource will report to the Director of Inside Sales.  Responsibilities  An Inside or commercial Account Executive at EDB gains a trusted rapport with our prospects and target accounts, helps them identify their challenges, and demonstrates how PostgreSQL and EDB can be a solution for their needs. Meet and exceed quotas for new annual recurring revenue (assuming you’d like to tap into excellent accelerators!) Dig deep to understand customer needs, pain points, and requirements Qualify and execute against an inbound lead funnel Prospect and build demand at target accounts Collaborate with SDRs to build pipeline Collaborate with channel partners to build pipeline and close deals Target carrying 3x pipeline coverage of your target Exhibit pipeline management and forecasting accuracy Learn and grow your knowledge and expertise of PostgreSQL There are three primary routes to market for the CAE. These include: [1] Inbound demand (i.e. marketing and partner generated) from a defined geographic territory [2] Proactive engagement at assigned [non-customer] target accounts [3] Expansion business from an assigned set of EDB customers from the commercial segment. Requirements Sales and lead development experience Successful B2B sales experience (anything over 2-3 years is a plus) Experience with or selling in the open source database space a definite plus Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience Exceptional interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills (verbal and written) Excellent time management and organizational skills Experience with Salesforce.com, SalesLoft / Outreach, ZoomInfo, and other marketing tools preferred Highly motivated and goal oriented Exhibit maturity and a healthy emotional intelligence Exhibit pride in your work We know it takes a unique mix of people and skills to help us in our mission to supercharge Postgres, and we understand that not everyone will check every box. We’d love to hear from you and we want you to apply!  EDB is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. EDB was built on a commitment to trust and respect each other and to embrace an array of people and ideas. These values remain at the center of our culture and are key to our company’s integrity.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Customer Success Team will take all new customer and additional orders from existing customers and ensure that the customer is handed over internally with a completely functional system / service. In order to do this the team will liaise with key customer contacts, the vessel and sales to ensure that the user experience is of the highest order.  Following confirmation from the Customer that all is in order, the customer may be invoiced, and support provided in the normal way. All Customer Success Team responsibilities cease at this point.  It is very important that during the Onboarding process the customer is kept up to date with progress.  From time to time, OneOcean will need to upgrade all customers following a software change. The Customer Success Team will play a key role in this activity, managing beta test vessels and assisting in the roll out and uptake of the new release.  Requirements Assist in the onboarding process ensuring customer satisfaction Ensure that all details required from Sales are present and correct before the onboarding process starts Be the point of contact between sales and the customer Ensure orders are added into the internal business system To gather all information necessary to allow successful communication with the vessel / office/ customer Help to make the onboarding process as efficient as possible, provide suggested improvement To monitor all new orders at the point of entry, whether that be for new vessels/fleets, additional subscriptions or trial vessels, and to provide weekly metrics around the progress of these orders To fully understand the requirements of the customer in terms of timescales, prerequisites and assistance To ensure that all physical goods required for onboarding are despatched in order to be with the vessel / site in a timely manner To track the progress of all physical goods in order that installation can commence as soon as the vessel has all the necessary deliverables To assist the vessel where necessary in the installation of any hardware / software To visit vessel or office as directed Confirm with customer that all services are working and that the end user understands the essential basics of managing the subscribed services Work with the Support Team in managing any technical issues that may arise during installation and commissioning Assist in managing the Trial process and outcomes Two weeks prior to completion of the trial period the Customer Success Team will liaise with the relevant Sales Manager and agree a plan for termination, conversion or extension Provide testing on Installation & Upgrade process for any new software release as directed Be part of the Beta Rollout process and ensure that feedback is captured Customer training in required OneOcean products and Services to ensure that this is efficient through use of technology  What we need from you ? Strong collaboration, time-management, influencing and prioritization skills are critical to the success of this role. The ability to build and maintain relationships internally and with customers. Excellent listening, presentation, and communication skills at all business levels The ability to partner with customers in developing their strategic direction. 3-5 years of experience in customer service or customer success position strongly preferred Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Conversant with standard MS Office software packages (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) with the Skills required to be able to use sales and CRM software packages. Knowledge of the shipping / marine industry an asset.

description: Yumi Active is an activewear brand inspired by haute couture and brings a little of the runway to the gym, yoga studio, and running track.  They are looking for a Retail Sales & Operations Executive.  Website: https://yumiactive.com/  Job Description  The job holder plays a critical role in ensuring efficiency in operations and driving sales growth of the brand. You will manage Yumi Active’s daily online and offline retail operations which include customer service, inventory management, stocking, merchandising, housekeeping, and retail administration.  You will be responsible for supervising, coaching, and training the frontline retail team at the mall outlets and managing the team’s roster. You will also be rostered to frontline operations in the malls.  Roles And Responsibilities Customer service – Provide accurate information/advice on products to customers, assist in day to day operations at Yumi studio and at the malls, manage and follow up with all multi-channel customer enquiries and feedback. Obtain regular customer feedback from different distribution points on our products and services and prepare summarised reports to the design team and management for review. Frontline team management – Manage roster and placement of frontline retail staff at shopping malls, prepare training materials and administrative guidance to new and existing promoters. Conduct regular reviews of frontline staff performance, store set-up and merchandise display. Be involved in frontline duties at the shopping mall. Inventory management and fulfilment – Conduct regular stock-taking, ensure timely order fulfilments, planning and distribution required stocks to stockists and online marketplaces. Distribution channel management – Coordinate collaborations and setup of new and existing stockists and online marketplaces, plan for product briefings, sales performance review and identify opportunities to grow brand awareness, engagement, and sales. Explore and propose new channel partnerships to grow the brand. Store upkeep and maintenance - Ensure office and all retail store interior and its environment are always properly maintained and up-kept. This includes online storefronts’ presentation and information. Process Documentation – Assist in drafting and keeping up to date standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure operational efficiency and effectiveness. Job Requirements Minimum a Diploma in Business Studies/ Retail Operations/Administration/ Management or equivalent. Proficiency in MS Office is a must. Be customer and sales oriented - Pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard Enthusiastic, pleasant, and vibrant personality. Highly motivated team player with good supervisory, communication, customer service and management, planning skills. Must be adaptable and thrive in changing environments. Experience in fashion retail and/or fitness enthusiasts will be an added advantage Suitable candidates may be placed under the Professional Conversion Programme Place and Train  About TaF.tc  With the mission to inculcate the attitude, skills and knowledge for the development and integration of the textile and fashion industry, TaF.tc aims to be the global fashion school without boundaries. Being the training arm of the Textile and Fashion Federation (Taff) and the first Continuing Education and Training Centre (CET) in Singapore, we offer specially designed courses and programmes to prepare our students for a creative career as well as to help industry professionals develop and specialise. As a big family, we are building a culture that inspires you to cultivate an agile thinking, build your growth mindset, enhance your customer obsession and most importantly, learn to care for one another. We are also constantly seeking and leveraging on technology to solve problems and transform the way we work in order to achieve the most efficient outcomes. If these are some of the qualities that interests you to be part of our big family, we would like to hear from you!
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Retail, and Financial Services

description: Career Growth, Flexibility and Collaboration!  Entrust is dedicated to securing a world in motion by enabling trusted identities, payments, and data protection around the globe. Headquartered in Minnesota, we offer our colleagues the ability to work globally, in a flexible and collaborative environment. Our team makes an impact!!  The Company: Entrust relies on curious, dedicated and innovative individuals whom anticipate the future and provide solutions for a more connected, mobile and secure world. Entrust’s technologies and expertise help government agencies, enterprises and financial institutions in more than 150 countries serve and safeguard citizens, employees and consumers.  We Believe: Securing identities is most effective when we value all identities. We are committed to ensuring that, through diversity and inclusion, the many voices that make up our communities are heard. From unconscious bias training for managers to global affinity groups that create connections both within and across our enterprise, Entrust expects and encourages all individuals to accept and respect one another. And, of course, to be themselves.  Will attached JD  The successful candidate will achieve assigned sales objectives in the ASEAN markets for Entrust Certificate Solutions by working with end user customers predominantly in the enterprise and government space, and also with a focus on developing new partners, especially Value Added Resellers and Value Added Distributors to generate sales revenue.  To manage the client relationship for the key accounts, functioning as a single point of contract, and design strategies for new business development and meet targets for growth. The position will be based in our Singapore office.  Responsibilities Calls on existing and potential clients to identify their current or perspective needs and provide information about Entrust products/services including demonstrations and quotations. Develops, together with the Channel Management Team, new Channel Partners for Entrust products. Assumes accountability for achieving defined revenue targets. Enables partners to resell Entrust products and successfully implement them. Develops leads to potential new customers through various sources. Consults with partners to analyse and understand their customer’s business needs and determine which of Entrust products and services best fit their requirements. Researches and develops sales presentations to effectively relate Entrust products/services to potential customers' needs. Helps partners to develop business proposals for presentation to clients, assembles expertise from other departments to ensure that all technical areas are covered. Maintains thorough knowledge of Entrust products/services, sales objectives and strategies, pricing and delivery/installation policies and practices to be able to respond to customer requests for information. Manages overall client relationships, has overall responsibility for the maintenance and development of business from existing clients. Responsible for forecast – maintains required sales and call records and prepares reports as required. Leverages marketing events/activities as well as attending relevant industry events and trade shows to ensure Entrust brand recognition within the marketplace. Ensures the pre-sales technical endorsement/presentation of Entrust products. Provides design advice and technical guidance to partners in the application of Entrust. Assists partners in understanding the integration of Entrust products into their existing technical infrastructure. Provides feedback to Entrust design and production personnel. Reviews impact of new Entrust product releases, new product features, delivery schedules, and competitor offerings with sales personnel. Represents Entrust at technical exhibitions, conferences, and speaking engagements to assist in explaining technical and performance information. Qualifications And Experience Relevant Degree or equivalent qualification. Significant experience in a similar role, preferably within the IT or Telecoms industry selling complex solutions A proven and successful track record of closing deals. New account development experience Account relationship management experience as evidenced by opening, growing and maintaining fortune level accounts. Recruiter  James BeckJames.Beck@entrust.com

description: Who We Are  Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Burger King, Delivery Hero, HBO Max, Mercari, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, hundreds of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 3 billion active users through Braze.  Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Forrester Wave™: Cross-Channel Campaign Management (Independent Platforms), Q3 2021, and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for the fourth consecutive year. The company has also been selected as one of Fortune’s Best Workplace for Millennials in 2021, and was ranked #20 on Fortune’s Best Medium Sized Workplaces in 2021. Braze is certified as a Great Place to Work in the UK and the U.S. and is recognized as one of the UK's Best Workplaces for Women.  What We're Looking For  Simply put, this role is a SaaS Sales "Hunter" with a track record of closing new business. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years selling SaaS Solutions to enterprise clients where typical deal size ranges from $50K - $500K/year. In addition, candidates should have at least 8+ years overall industry experience.  Stronger fit exists with those who have experience working with enterprise companies. Ideally, your product sales experience focuses on non-ERP solutions. Experience selling analytics, CRM, marketing automation, digital media publishing or content marketing solutions would be the best fit. Prior experience should include collaboration with Marketing/Sales Enablement team including input into the lead generation process.  What You Have Background in Enterprise Sales for Mobile or Marketing Technology required Outstanding verbal, written and stand up presentation skills Prior experience with Salesforce.com CRM, or other CRM used to manage sales pipeline, required. Demonstrated ability to quickly come up to speed on new cloud apps and tools. A proven connector in your daily life through social media and other mediums Up-to-date on digital and application trends, especially in the mobile space Proven success navigating large organizations and ability to quickly identify the decision makers and the decision making process for large SaaS investments Prior experience in a startup technology company a plus What We Offer Competitive compensation that includes equity Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.  If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

About Us Far East Organization's Sales and Leasing Group manages a large and diverse portfolio of quality real estate for sale and lease to suit different business and individual needs. The group's portfolio comprises residential, office, industrial and medical units across the island with over 1,000 units for sale and 6.5 million square feet of lettable space. As Singapore's largest private property developer and residential landlord, the group's wide array of housing options seek to serve the extensive needs of buyers and investors as well as the expatriate and local communities looking for long-term stays. The Sales Consultant is responsible for the sales and marketing of Far East properties, contributing to the individual, department, and organization sales targets. This is delivered with a strong network of customer and agent relationship, including discovering and pursuing new sales prospect, negotiating deals and maintaining customer satisfaction.    About the Role  Generate client leads to market and sell properties through networking, site visits and project viewings Build positive, long lasting value-based relationships with property agents and customers Stay abreast of real estate markets and best practices through trade journals, relevant literature and attend events, seminars and association Keep management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call calling, prospecting reports and weekly work plans Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing and new project launches Conduct all sales administration in compliance with statutory and company regulations Any other ad-hoc duties assigned  About You Diploma / Degree in Marketing, Real Estate or equivalent discipline with at least 2 years of sales experience Strong agent and clients' network preferred Good interpersonal and communication skills with strong passion in sales Resourceful, self-motivated and articulate Possess good negotiation skill Good understanding of, and interest in the local property market, and the process of buying and selling property Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Good knowledge of statutory and/or real estate regulatory compliance Due to the nature of the industry and job requirements, you may be rostered to work on weekends and statutory holidays

description: Leading Global Executive Search & Leadership Advisory firm Performance driven, team-based, learning centric work culture. Attractive compensation scheme to reward high performance  Company Profile Founded in 1992, LINCOLN is an international Talent Advisory firm with expertise to offer Talents and Clients in the areas of Executive Search, Leadership Advisory and Executive Interim Management solutions, globally through 8 offices across Europe and Asia. Our mission as Talent Partner is to support Clients and Talents throughout their professional life cycles. Who are we looking for? We are looking for smart, energetic, passionate and driven individuals with at least 4 to 5 years of experience with a proven track record of success. Here are some attributes and behaviors we are looking for: Committed and focused professional with significant experience Excellent communication and interpersonal skills High level of integrity Strong leadership and motivation to handle daily challenges Energetic, positive and fun personality Sales-driven and ambitious with an interest in people and advisory services Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and performance-driven environment Fluent in English (written and spoken) Previous advisory experience in talent management / executive search is a plus  For a confidential discussion with our Country Director, please send your email to steven.pang@lincoln-group.com

description: Why CrescoData  Headquartered in Singapore and with a presence in Australia and Europe, CrescoData is a Platform-as-a-Service business in the commerce space. The CrescoData Commerce Connect Platform is a Leading Enterprise Integration, Automation and Mapping Middleware Platform. CrescoData provides commerce-in-the-cloud services to leading enterprise customers across the globe. CrescoData is a Fast 500 Deloitte Winner This is an exciting opportunity to join a close-knit, knowledgeable team, a chance to be mentored and learn from highly experienced professionals within the Tech /SaaS industry Culture is something that is really important to us at CrescoData. We value people, growth, development and fun! We regularly run company initiatives such as fitness bootcamps, team building days, awards and recognition for going above and beyond and team events to connect and reward our hard work Expect to join a unique market leading company with a global culture and entrepreneurial mindset Gain invaluable experience of working with a wide range of large Enterprise customers We encourage people to think outside of the box and enjoy supporting the growth of people who want to shape their role and future career development Why You Matter  The role involves working with a wide range of businesses across the APAC and EMEA region to promote and sell CrescoData services. Reporting directly to the CEO, this role suits a Junior level professional looking to develop into an elite sales and business professional through training and mentorship delivered by your direct manager.  Who You Are This role is suitable for a recent graduate who is looking for the first step of their career within the tech industry.  You are hungry, driven and enjoy working in a results style environment. We are looking for dynamic, enthusiastic people who want to learn and make a difference, leaders in the making, people who can think on their feet, who are not scared to use their initiative and suggest or try new things. We want people who thrive in a fast paced environment. You are passionate about technology and have the desire to train and exceed within all aspects of the role.  What You'll Do Sales ○ Supports CEO to drive new business for CrescoData  ○ Own KPIs’s and individual revenue targets  ○ Represent CrescoData in relevant industry digital networking events for lead gen purposes  ○ Leverage and grow partner relationships  ○ Conduct Lead Generation campaigns to generate leads from: Marketplaces + Commerce Platforms  ○ Autonomously prepare sales decks via Google Slides  ○ Owns Hubspot  ■ Keeps data clean and accurate  ■ Subject matter expert : ensures we are fully utilising the tool to optimise efficiency  ■ Weekly reporting on lead gen, SQL’s, pipeline generation, conversion rates and closed revenue Marketing ○ Manage social media platforms, LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook  ○ Prepare and issue quarterly Newsletter and Blog across social media platforms  ○ Create sales decks via Google Slides  ○ Manages and updates marketing collateral  ○ Manage and own marketing metrics - social media, website traffic, number of leads/sales  ○ Website updates via Wordpress  Skills + Qualifications Bachelor degree qualified in Information Technology or Marketing related fields Entrepreneurial - ability to work in a small team and ‘hustle’ to get things done Outstanding communication skills Demonstrated passion for technology Confident with good presentation skills Fluency in English; written and verbal Interest in eCommerce / value chain and ecosystem / tech Data driven & experience with graphics tools Tools Hubspot G Suite Wordpress Graphics Tools

description: Osome is an international fintech startup with the mission to to help business owners spend less time on routine admin and more time on managing their businesses. We use machine learning (AI) and complex algorithms to automate accounting, tax, company formation, and other tasks.   With Singapore as the headquarter, Osome has expanded to Malaysia, Hong Kong, United Kingdom with a total staff strength of more than 200 employees servicing more than 6000 clients.   Here at Osome, we provide an inclusive and collaborative environment, offering a promising career plan for our employees. You can expect to be rewarded for your contribution. If you are a diligent team player, who is not afraid of challenges, willing to think out of the box and find creative ways to reach the shared goal, think no further! description: General:  To assist the Securitas / account team in the delivery of exceptional security and customer service outcomes to client by; ·      Supporting strategic and operational planning, and service delivery imperatives. ·      Leading in the measurement and achievement of contractual & operational SLA’s / KPI’s and other service delivery obligations as specified in the Master Service Agreement & Work Orders. ·      Directly assisting with the identification and development of improvement opportunities and best-practice initiatives. ·      Taking ownership of all operational and administrative matters related to the Guarding service. ·      Prioritising and promoting the safety & welfare of client assigned guard-force staff. ·      Demonstrate the core brand values and culture of client, promoting a positive image of our organisation at all times.  Specific:  The Regional Account Manager (RAM) will oversee and take operational ownership of the contracted guard-force(s) operating on designated client Corporate offices within the assigned operational region. This will include the following key actions;  ·      Act as a single point of contact between the contracted guard-force, the supporting vendor branch office, the client country management team and the Securitas Project Management Team, in areas of operational service management, communications, coordination, administration, and escalations. Build and maintain proactive, collaborative relationships with all key stakeholder groups (internal & external).  ·      Taking ownership of contracted guard-force tasks & responsibilities relevant to the agreed Scope of Works, ensuring full compliance with client’s security & safety policies, guidelines, requirements, quality standards and in particular SLAs/ KPIs.  ·      Partnering with the client's team & other key stakeholders to ensure, where necessary, that service delivery is adapted to meet new standards, changing requirements or situational demands. In particular to ensure the delivery / establishment / client's initiatives in the AoR.  ·      Assist the mobilisation of any new services or locations and ensure an efficient, issue-free commencement of service  ·      Providing strong leadership, supervision and direction to client assigned guard-forces, ensuring; o  Recruitment, installation, development & retention of staff is appropriately managed (identifying local recruitment needs, effecting formal communication of recruitment needs to the supporting HR office(s) and collating statistics related to recruitment efforts and retention).  o  All staff receive the appropriate levels of training, guidance & supervision needed to complete their individual roles with competency. Oversight of training programs (regional, local, or site-level), identification of training gaps, and resolution of same. Personal formulation and/ or delivery of training packages addressing specific training needs. That all staffs have the necessary tools, equipment, and information to effectively perform their duties. And that all staffs are aware of, and compliant with, the relevant client & Securitas Security SOPs/ Safety policies and procedures.  ·      All site-level service delivery issues/ failures are identified, reported & resolved. All relevant security or safety-related incidents receive an immediate operational response and are reported/escalated as appropriate to their nature.  The ‘Vision’ system and its reporting are managed effectively. And the maintenance of country incident registers and supporting incident files.  ·      The production of detailed, formal reports in response to line management information requests, or supporting personal recommendations / concerns. Oversight, timely maintenance, accuracy & contribution to - those project documents / records designated as ‘Living, shared reference articles’ (e.g. Site Status Reg’) as relevant to the AoR.  Requirements:  The RAM will be embedded into the client's business, operating primarily from a nominated client's corporate office. The RAM will be required to maintain an agreed travel schedule domestically & regionally supporting key operational relationships and standards. Short-notice response travel and periods of an extended stay in support of specific projects or business activities will / may also be required.  The RAM will be engaged / contracted by a selected vendor company and will report directly to the Securitas Regional Contract Manager and higher Securitas / client's Project Management team. For all matters relating to service delivery and work assignments the RAM will be supported by, the client's team in achieving operational aims, as defined by client's leadership.  Personal Attributes Managing and Leading others Leads, develops and fosters a culture of high performance and encourages client's core values. Sets clear goals, objectives and leads by example.  Manage Self Be interesting and self-disciplined, open to learn, then teach and share everything you know Demonstrating an awareness of own values, motivations & emotions Taking an active interest in what is happening more widely in the organisation Manages time effectively and prioritises against urgency and importance.  Operational Excellence Monitors and maintains quality and productivity with a focus on high standards. Demonstrates attention to detail with a high level of accuracy. Understands and maximises strengths within teams. Focuses on delivering value in a timely manner Collaborates across the business and shares best practice.  Decision Making Prepared to make tough decisions, considering risks to meet operational needs and demands of the business. Takes responsibility and accountability for actions and works under own direction Delegates decision making, empowering team members where appropriate.  Communication skills High level of verbal and written accuracy and effective communication in particular with complex information Ability to adapt communication style when interacting with different stakeholders Encourages a culture of honesty and accountability within the team Maintains an approachable demeanour and is visibly engaged with the team  Business Acumen and Commercial Awareness ·      Controls costs and thinks in terms of profit, loss and added value  Strategic Thinking (Planning and forecasting) Supports planning process, thinking ahead to future demand and requirements of their specific area and feeding into management Contributes to contingency planning for area  Customer Management & Sales Development ·        Focuses on Customers’ needs and satisfaction for their area of the business  ·        Looks for and flags potential risks to or issues with, Customer satisfaction and raises with line manager  Relationship building & Networking Establishes a strong, reliable internal and external network within area of responsibility, through being visible, increasing customer engagement and sharing best practice where appropriate/mutually beneficial Works across areas to maximise productivity and secure buy-in from internal and external stakeholders

jobTitle: Regional Marketing Manager, CRM, Asia Pacific
description: Job Summary  The CRM Marketing Manager APAC is responsible for identifying, developing and implementing strategic marketing programs in the Asia Pacific Region that drive business objectives. Key markets will include Japan, China, Taiwan, Korea, India, Hong Kong and SEA and ANZ. The Regional CRM Marketing Manager will work in close collaboration with the other Regional CRM Marketing Managers as well as a diverse group of in-country sales and marketing stakeholders, in analyzing market opportunities, tailoring programs from inception to execution, and monitoring the effectiveness of programs. The CRM Marketing Manager APAC is a vital contributor to the future growth of the CRM franchise in Asia Pacific.  Responsibilities  The CRM Marketing Manager APAC will work closely with Country leadership as a key contributor to building of the strategic vision of CRM in APAC region with a focus on core markets of Japan, China, ANZ, Korea and developing markets in South East Asia and India. The primary objective for this role is to bring additional strategic leadership to the CRM franchise in Asia Pacific; ensuring tailored programs are in place for key markets that leverage the full breadth and depth of the Abbott CRM portfolio. Other key responsibilities include: Develops marketing and customer programs to support implementation of key APAC CRM strategies across the region to achieve operating plan objective and long-term vision objectives. Manages CRM product launches to reflect marketing plan, strategies and tactics (price, positioning, promotion, education etc.). Works with the Abbott Global Marketing counterparts to implement marketing strategies and tactics and specific materials to support local Asia Pacific markets. Uphold highest margin and profitability standards, providing strategic decision support in designing, supporting and assessing go-to-market strategies. Works in partnership with the other CRM Marketing Managers and with country sales and marketing leadership. Works in partnership to capitalize on synergies across the wider Abbott CRM Portfolio. Conduit to actively observe, research, and review market segments, customer requirements and competitor dynamics. Aggregates and synthesizes field input to support marketing and sales strategy development. Identifies business growth opportunities and unmet customer requirements and provides vision and focus to move ideas to market place. Works with regional operations teams to provide input on forecast to enable future strategic product launches, phase in/out plans. Participates in physician review panels to provide effective customer feedback on product plans and marketing strategies. Measurement  This position will be measured on their ability to drive the CRM business growth in the region through identifying, designing, developing and tailoring strategic marketing programs that impact the business in a meaningful way and drive the region towards both its operating plan objectives and long-term objectives. Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Plan achievements in revenue and operating profit for CRM franchise Quality & success of product launch – execution effectiveness as well as meeting the set objectives Market share leadership for all key products Professional Knowledge, Skills & Qualifications 5-10 years of experience in multi-national pharmaceutical, healthcare or medical devices companies, in the field of product management. Result-oriented, creative and resourceful. Highly strategic and analytical, and strong problem solver Good organizational skills and able to perform multi tasks. Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to inspire people. Experience in working in cross functional teams Fluent in written and spoken English; Chinese (Mandarin) will be an advantage. No less than 50% traveling time Able to adapt travelling and accommodation conditions in developing countries Other Functions And Responsibilities Handle and process customer complaints in timely manner and according to Abbott Asia Pacific’s policy and requirement Execute the job responsibilities according to applicable standard operating procedures of Abbott Asia Pacific and Abbott Singapore Ensure applicable standard operating procedures of Abbott Asia Pacific, Abbott Singapore, and Abbott Hong Kong are executed Preformance Factors Focuses on the Customer: Is dedicated to meeting the needs of internal and external customers Delivers Results with Integrity: Meets commitments and produces the right results at the right time. Adheres to moral and ethical principles. Believable and trustworthy. Does what he/she says they are going to do Teamwork/Supporting our Colleagues: Collaborates with co-workers to achieve work group and company goals Initiative: Takes action without prompting or direction from others. Constantly strives to improve own and company performance Personal Involvement: Personally engages his/her interests, emotions or commitments in their work

description: This is an exciting opportunity for you to inspire and enable the next generation of fintech unicorns, digital banks and innovative payment programs across Asia Pacific.  GPS has cemented its position as the leading Paytech Pioneer, with innovative and flexible issuer processing payment technology and solutions. In 2020 the GPS Apex platform, our teams and partnering client programs won 11 industry awards, and the awards have already started rolling in during 2021.  The payment volumes processed on the GPS Apex platform have grown 10X in recent years, with the business now spanning ~160 clients in ~60 countries, using over 150 currencies. With many incumbent processors being hampered by legacy technology and banks needing to transform their customer experience, GPS will continue to maintain a strong growth trajectory in the exciting years ahead.  Job Summary  As a business development executive, you need to have the passion and drive to independently source, nurture and close opportunities, backed by strong in region pre-sales support. In return for closing exciting new issuance programs, you will benefit from uncapped commission and strong professional experience and advancement within a growth segment of the payments space.  This is your opportunity to work for a multi-award winning PayTech Pioneer, that powers many cutting-edge payment programs, including digital banks, ewallets, and global Fintechs. With great tech, solid APIs, and a proven track record of supporting many Fintech Unicorns, GPS offers highly competitive and compelling products and services. The flexibility of the platform solutions means you can sell to almost all manner of fintech issuance use cases including card/credential processing for digital banks on Visa and or MasterCard with innovative digital solutions.  As an award-winning provider of processing services behind many leading fintech unicorns, the GPS brand strength is growing so you will increasingly benefit from solid inbound leads. However, you will need to aggressively tap and grow your own leads network to hit your KPIs and maximise your uncapped income potential. Hence your responsibilities will include lead sourcing (industry networking, trade shows, associations, partner engagements), to increase lead generation, drive high customer conversion rates, and close prospects. You will also closely engage the country teams with our channel partners such as Visa and Mastercard, to stay abreast of new developments and opportunities.  What You’ll Do Sell the GPS Apex platform and solution to Fintechs, Banks, and Program Managers in target verticals, such as: Digital Banking, Multi-currency, Crypto, B2B, eWallets, Retail, Wearables Achieve and exceed quarterly and annual business sales targets as set by the company Ability to work independently and as part of a global matrix organisation Develop, track and progress in detail your sales prospects and all engagements in Salesforce Accurately complete sales documentation which supports the sale of services, including quotations, proposals and tenders (with pre-sales consultant support) Identify and maximize revenue opportunities with each prospect and prioritise profitable clients Develop and maintain strong client relationships with key prospects and clients Build and maintain awareness of the competitive landscape and update internal teams of key developments or requirements (Leadership, Marketing and Sales Teams) To work and contribute within the broader sales team, creating and promoting ideas to assist colleagues in the achievement of set objectives Excellent verbal and written communication skills complemented by confident presentation style An ability to grasp new technologies, in addition to demonstrated interest in our business An excellent working knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Microsoft Outlook and Excel Travel to your assigned territory to engage prospects or to regional/global company events (as post Covid travel resumes) What You’ll Need A track record of scaling business and selling B2B solutions in a dynamic entrepreneurial environment Sales experience with demonstrated success at networking, setting appointments, pipeline building, negotiation, closing solution sales and hitting targets Ideally, proven experience in payments or issuer processing Successful track record of achieving sales quotas with tenacity and persistence Excellent English communication skills; written, verbal and IT literate Motivated self-starter able to work independently Proven ability to multitask and prioritise under pressure Very good listening and communication skills Strong affinity to both sales and financial technology Willingness to travel domestically and internationally We are the ‘Paytech Pioneers’ and we want you to help us lead the way. So apply now.  GPS operates in a secure environment. All candidates will be Credit and Background checked to the extent permitted by law.

description: S4M’s aim is to help brands succeed, we want to see busy stores, popular restaurants and thriving car dealerships. We help our brand partners achieve their goals by delivering advertising that drives more customers to stores, dealerships and restaurants. 🏬  Our drive-to-store platform Fusio reaches local customers at a global scale, with advertising that’s tailored to every step of the customer journey.  We were founded in 2011, by experts in advertising and marketing technologies, who wanted to help brands achieve their goals. 🎯 S4M now has offices around the world, over 200 people make up our fantastic team, and more than 1,000 brands use our platform to drive customers to physical locations! 💪  S4M are looking for an Account Manager based in Singapore.  Your role You will report to the Country manager and your role will involve: Day-to-day client management with their mobile campaigns, working hand in hand with the Sales Managers; Full responsibility for campaign sales push and delivery: strategic watch, RFP coordination, client management, briefing stakeholders, ad operations & performance optimization & reporting in relationship with the traffic and trading team; Creation and delivery of weekly campaign reports; Support of the sales team with pre-sales and campaign approval; Monitoring campaign delivery with trader team; Project management with the design team to deliver best in class creative executions; Working with trading team and vendor partners to set up necessary integrations and partnerships; Keep abreast of market knowledge and insights; Post campaign analysis and reporting; Working with the corporate marketing team to develop at least two case studies per quarter to be shared with current and prospective clients.  Your profile You have: Over 1 year of experience in an Account Management position in an online ad Company (RTB, Programmatic media buying); Experience with ad-serving, DSP, video, and rich media vendor tools; Client-facing experience; Ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team; Strong analytical skills; Excellent written skills; Plus: A Bachelor degree in a related field and an experience in the mobile media expertise.  You are: An English speaker (oral and written) Familiar with the media agencies landscape; Familiar with digital tracking solutions (Double Click, Sizmek, Nielsen, …); Comfortable with a start-up mindset, facing interesting challenges globally; A problem solver and detail oriented; Highly organised and able to prioritise; Excellent in building relationships with agency teams; Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with high expectations; Self-motivated, curious and hard working.  We aim to get back to you as soon as possible. Nevertheless, due to the large volume of applicants, we can only reply to successful candidates.

escalates issues to manager as appropriate Keep informed of product line, competition and industry trends that may impact client business activities Requirements Minimum 8 years of Account Executive experience in a Technology company Direct sales experience in SaaS / Cloud / Subscription-based solutions Language Proficiency: Tagalog/Filipino plus English SaaS video or web conferencing solutions selling experience preferred Inbound sales experience This position requires the ability to hunt into new accounts, develop and maintain business within existing accounts and manage complex sales situations and large projects (in the Philippines & ROA market) Demonstrated excellence in presentation skills with the ability to build relevant, strategic messaging Presence and proficiency in social media such as LinkedIn preferred Strong collaboration and relational skills Business forecasting, pipeline development and management skills are required A proven track record of closed sales, client satisfaction, & teamwork Must have strong verbal skills with consultative professional business acumen Must be detail-oriented, organized, ethical, responsible, & self-motivated Salesforce CRM experience preferred Strong Internet research skills with excellent PC literacy [Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint] BA/ BS or equivalent experience

description: About The Team  Shopee’s Seller Center serves over 10 million active Sellers across Southeast Asia and Taiwan. Sellers are a critical part of Shopee’s ecosystem to deliver our vision to make online shopping accessible, easy and enjoyable. As a Seller Service BPM, you work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, where you play a critical role to enable Sellers to list, market and manage their products to make their selection available to the right customers. In doing so, we enable the success of our sellers and help to further drive Shopee’s growth.  Job Description Advocate for our sellers and discover sellers’ needs Drive and own high-level strategic initiatives, and at the same time, hands-on with the ability to roll up your sleeves and get things done. Identify business opportunities and requirements through analysis of market trends, data, seller feedback and competitor platforms. Enable sellers to have end-to-end e-commerce operational capabilities from listing management, fulfilment management to finance management, maximising seller’s efficiency at selling on Shopee. Boost sellers’ business with comprehensive promotion and campaign management, and manage shop traffic efficiently. Drive seller progression from acquisition, through onboarding, incubation and till growth. Actively engage with local/regional business leaders to strategise and prioritise feature requests. Analyse, align and evaluate business requirements, feasibility and value of the feature requests with both business and Product teams to deliver a comprehensive and accurate Business Requirement Document (BRD). Collaborate with the wider Product team as well as Engineering and Design teams to deep dive into metrics, identify growth drivers or problems, in order to drive growth. Formulate our business strategy by identifying key seller segments to support and grow. Identify and solve obstacles that are preventing our key seller segments from growing faster. Partner with teams in our local markets to implement our business strategy and initiatives. Manage product specs creation process and obtain sign-off from key stakeholders. Manage complex, cross-functional products and lead the delivery process of these products (BRD, UAT, Live Release).  Requirements Bachelor Degree and above in any discipline. Ability to collaborate well in a team environment, and work effectively with people at all levels in an organisation. Strong stakeholder management skills with customer-oriented and execution-focused mindset. Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing. Flexible and adaptive, with a willingness and attitude to learn new tasks. Distinctive problem-solving, logical thinking and analytical skills. Ability to innovate product strategy based on research, data and industry trends. Track record of driving adoption of products through feature improvements, marketing and sales. Demonstrate willingness and positive attitude to learn new tasks. Ability to adapt in a fast-paced and agile environment. Excellent organisational and planning skills. Speaking one of the languages (optional) besides English: Bahasa Indonesia, Mandarin, Thai, Vietnamese, Bahasa Melayu, Filipino, to communicate more efficiently with internal stakeholders across the region
industries: Internet

Language: fluent in both Chinese and English, other language is a plus. Personality: Outgoing and presentable Reporting line: Regional Sales Director - Asia Working base: Singapore

description: About JLL –  We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.  Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.  Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.  If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!  Job Description  Regional Commercial Executive, Asia Pacific  Role Summary  The Commercial function has been created to support ork Dynamics growth with stronger profit margins. The key levers to achieve this are securing more income for the valuable scope we deliver, cross-selling higher margin products, driving productivity, finding ways to benefit from our scale and changing our commercial contract models and pricing.  The Regional Commercial Executives will play the frontline role for the Commercial team engaging with account managers, sales leaders, supply chain leaders and other functional groups in WD to drive commercial projects generating margin growth regionally and globally. Working closely with the Commercial Program Leads and regional leadership, this role will be responsible for taking opportunities identified by the Commercial Optimisation Teams and in CRB reviews through to execution. It will require strong commercial knowledge, operational experience and credibility, and a bias to collaboration and teamwork.  The Commercial team will bring together people with diverse business skills and backgrounds and is intended to be a development pathway for talent, enabling people to expand their account management, product, operations, sales, finance, legal or supply chain experience into a broader commercial scope.  Responsibilities  The Commercial Executives will take the lead responsibility in region for a diverse range of projects including- Working with Account leaders to execute contract design changes and scope management identified in Commercial reviews Commercial support required for Transition and start-up of deals approved in CRB to strengthen governance and consistency of handover from Sales to Transition to Account Management. Supporting client facing negotiations alongside Sales leaders where specific Commercial input required Providing required Commercial support to business transformation changes with a focus on value-creating outcomes for JLL and our clients (e.g. JBS transitions, Operations automation initiatives) Identifying market trends and changes in pricing models and developing recommendations for changes to JLL standard pricing Partnering with regional Account Management leadership to implement identified Commercial opportunities on Enterprise and Scaling accounts arising from annual account planning. Supporting new Account Managers transitioning into role Core Competencies  The successful candidates will demonstrate the following competencies-  Commercial Experience Has in-depth operational experience of the CS business model, client requirements, industry delivery and contracting models. Understands the impact of risk-reward frameworks, pricing and resource structures. Sales and growth-oriented – looks for ways to help JLL win well and manage risk to secure reward. Aware of competitor strategies and strengths. Deep understanding of account P&Ls; the drivers of value and risk, impact of changes in contract scope, portfolio profile and resource levels. Client focussed – recognises that driving client satisfaction is our best path to growth and profit. Influence & Negotiating Strong communicator, able to advise and influence senior stakeholders and SMEs across a diverse range of topics. Sophisticated negotiating skills; able to partner with account and sales leaders to engage with clients on contract changes, management of scope increases, variations to resource models, glidepaths etc. Critical Analysis Can critically review financial, contract and sales information for new business, account reviews and other commercial topics. Provides constructive and relevant feedback and advice, shares learnings from comparable situations. Client Focus Anticipates and understands the emerging needs of clients and trends in the market. Credible with colleagues and clients when talking about business trends. Leads by example and instils strong client focus into ways of working and process design. Teamwork An enthusiastic and positive collaborator, able to work effectively as part of a distributed team globally and partner with colleagues across diverse functions. Experience First-hand experience of contract management and negotiation essential. Current knowledge of Corporate Solutions business models, clients and geos will be highly valuable. Successful candidates are likely to have 10+ years of relevant business experience and a track record of working successfully at account or service/product level with multi-disciplinary teams in cross-border businesses. A broad spectrum of experience will be relevant for the Commercial Executive roles; candidates with backgrounds in sales, account management, operations, finance, legal, project management, supply chain would all bring relevant skills. Success Measures Timely delivery of specific Commercial projects on individual accounts and products to achieve targeted margin goals. Effective participation in Commercial reviews and Commercial team meetings to provide feedback from project learnings and relevant expertise to shape scope of future projects. Team delivery of Commercial margin targets and contribution goals. Improvement in pro-forma margin expectations from business wins, benefitting from CRB review process, stronger due diligence, leverage of Commercial learnings and initiatives. Effective partnering across Commercial team and other CS and Enterprise functions to share best practices, eliminate silos and support Sales and Account teams to be successful. What You Can Expect From Us  We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.  Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.  We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!  JLL Privacy Notice  Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.  For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .  For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.  For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .  Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at AccomodationRequest@am.jll.com . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.
industries: Commercial Real Estate

description: About Yojee  Yojee Limited (ASX: YOJ) is a cloud based (SaaS) logistics platform that seamlessly and uniquely manages, tracks and optimises freight movements along the entire logistics chain, from sender to end customer, across borders and between logistics providers (land, sea, air), with subcontractors and for multi-leg journeys. Rarely is a single carrier servicing an entire goods journey from sender to end customer, or exclusively using one type of transportation method. Yojee ensures connectivity and more efficient planning along the entire journey.  About The Job  As a Yojee Sales Executive, you will play a key role in acquiring and engaging the right set of companies to use Yojee’s products and help users and merchants derive maximum value from it. This is a high-volume, quick sales cycle role to grow numbers in our SME customer space.  What You Will Be Doing Responsible for achieving sales targets. Regularly communicating progress and strategies/tactics that will be deployed to reach revenue targets. Manage the sales process from end-to-end – prospecting, pitching, negotiating, contracting, result tracking and troubleshooting. Picking up the phone. It is your responsibility to grow a healthy pipeline to meet your targets. Calling new prospects on a daily basis is a minimum requirement for all sales reps. Setting the right expectations. Yojee is a SaaS solution that provides great value to customers right from the day they adopt. Customer feedback is encouraged but your mission is to sell a ready-made solution. Finding the right customer. Identifying and prospecting the right opportunities to grow revenue in targeted vertical markets such as e-commerce, retail, manufacturers, distributors and last mile providers. Meeting with the customer online or in-person. Today’s world is constantly changing and it is your responsibility to find out the best form of engagement with customers across all types of offline and online mediums. Keep a current working knowledge of trends and cycles within the Logistics industry. Desired Skills & Experience - About You Proficient in English. 5+ years of working experience in direct sales. (SaaS sales preferred) History of meeting and exceeding sales targets Domain knowledge in Logistics. Experience using a CRM Courageous - willing to jump on the phone and engage with new people every single day to explain Yojee’s value proposition. Articulate, organized, detail-oriented, tech-savvy and able to multitask. Able to self-motivate and keep pace with a fast-paced startup with an appetite for success. Nice to have Familiar with HubSpot, Slack or Confluence Experience selling in Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines or Thailand Who Will Help You Win  The role is based in Singapore and reports to the Head of Growth.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain new accounts through various sales prospecting approaches Manage and sustain business relationship with existing accounts Prepare sales proposals and quotations tocustomer needs and demands Provide timely market updates in management and department meetings Perform other ad-hoc duties as required Requirements Minimum Diploma & GCE `O’ level education At least three years of relevant work experience in food service, FMCG and related industries; Familiarity with protein & non-protein will be an asset Sales- and target-driven; Highly motivated and initiative Strong interpersonal skills Good problem-solving skills, computer literate Preferably already have experience with institutional FMCG sales account, such as supermarket or hyper mart
