description: Position Overview  Job Purpose  The Inside Sales Executive is the primary internal sales contact for their assigned accounts and is responsible to handle customer inquiries timely and drive sales through service activities.  Principal Accountabilities Performance to KPIs Drive sales through prompt, accurate and timely RFQ responses and quotation follow up (BG quotes) Proactive Backlog and BIM Management together with CS/OSR partners Act as the operational interface between Outside Sales and all back end support departments to service the Customer inquiries Participate in driving the assigned sales branch/regional management goals, objectives and initiatives. JOB CONTENT: (PRIMARY & SECONDARY FUNCTIONS) Work with Outside Sales to develop account plans and strategy to meet or exceed sales target, KPIs and company objectives. Attend Account Reviews as applicable. Proactively call assigned accounts to solicit new business and build strong relationships with all personnel with buying influence in the customers' organization. Ensure knowledge and compliance with all sales SOPS as listed in the Intranet. Manage the customer's daily RFQs by processing BG quotes promptly and accurately using Sales Associates quoting tool, respond to Customer and follow up on TURNS and BUY quotes to convert to Orders timely. Qualify and process BID quotes through SBDU (as assigned) or BG process with timely response to Customer. Work with Order Entry team on any specific customer requirements for their order entry and PO acknowledgement. Manage the data entry for Shortage buys when urgency requires it. Manage the commercial business interface with customer and internal departments related Trade Compliance requirements (ECS, CIV, renewals, etc), product documentation such as NCNR and product waivers, Programming First Article Approval. Act as customer interface to address outstanding issues on orders that are not aligned to the Backlog Management policy (For non-strategy accounts), address Order Rejects and PINs. Elevate to Outside Sales if unresolved timely. Act as first customer interface on all operational issues e.g. RMA, QA, Credit discrepancy (For all accounts), Expedite and Delivery issues (For non-strategy accounts). Working with appropriate internal departments, coordinate resolving operational service issues for assigned customers. Process BIM line add on/delete after BIM set up (with OSR inputs after reviewing with customer). 3Tab report-IS review any forecast gap and communicate with Customers/OS. For liability parts, secure NCNR paper work with customer OR product waivers with info-BAC. Support assigned back-up Customers when other team members are out of office. Additional responsibilities vary depending on the customer specific service requirements and should be defined and agreed upon with the outside sales and sales management. Qualifications  RECOMMENDED CREDENTIALS: Preferably Diploma or ¿A" Level Experience At least 1 year of experience in sales COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Attitudes) Attention to detail; Great follow-up skills; Computer skills; Communication skills; Interpersonal skills and be a Team player. Complete understanding functionality of Sales Associates tools to execute on customer RFQ process. Functional knowledge of MS Excel, including Sorting, Filtering, VLook-up, Basic formula utilization in order to do basic analysis of customers BOM's in order to prioritize quote activity and maximize quote/close ratio. Basic semiconductor, passive, interconnect and electromechanical product knowledge-part recognition, basic part crossing,

description: As a Senior Sales Specialist, you will propose and sell services-based technology solutions for Telstra Enterprise customers in Singapore. You will be a Security Sales professional with strong specialisation and experience in Cyber Security and Security Advisory.  Based on understanding the customer’s business and ICT environment through a consultative sales process, you will utilise your subject matter expertise and substantial experience to develop a solution that meets the client’s needs in line with financial and business needs.  You will work closely with our Account and Solution Sales teams as well as our key vendor partners and directly with customers to generate demand for Security Technology Solutions and Services. Upon securing customer interest, you will also work with our pool of Senior Consultants & Architects to develop proposals and statement of work for submission to the customer. description: The Professional Services team at HubSpot works with our customers to help them see extraordinary growth through ongoing engagement, business consulting and delight.  As an Inbound Consultant, you will develop deep relationships with customers earning a position as a trusted advisor as you guide them in executing their growth strategy on the HubSpot platform. In this role, you will deliver HubSpot software training and implementation support, guide their ongoing campaign-based Marketing Hub, Sales Hub and Service Hub strategy, and be responsible for delivering quarterly strategic reports. In addition to training, you will also provide best practices, project management, and overall strategic direction that will help customers optimize their use of HubSpot.  Check out the Inbound Consulting Program at HubSpot here  In This Role, You’ll Get To Work with customers on recurring services and/or one-time outcome based service packages to provide strategic advice as well as help to plan and build growth strategies which includes marketing campaigns and sales strategies. Build deep relationships and turn your customers into power users of HubSpot. Use your marketing knowledge, creativity, communication skills, and organizational skills to help deliver tangible, positive results to our customers’ growth efforts Become the trusted advisor for your customers Drive product adoption across your customer base Guide customers in the inbound methodology as well as sales & service methodologies to get the most out of the HubSpot product Write and deliver Quarterly Strategy Reports We Are Looking For People Who Have An extraordinary understanding of customer service, and inbound marketing standard methodologies At least 4 years of consultative client facing experience in a relevant industry/ field An ability to lead and develop a growth campaign An ability to drive customer success with the HubSpot software Analytical thinking and creative problem solving while being a customer advocate We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  About HubSpot  HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.  Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.  By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Scalable Acquisitions Specialist, Online Partnership Group (English, Mandarin) - Singapore
description: The area: Online Partnerships Group - Global Partnerships  Google helps our partners find better ways to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. In return, our partners provide great content for our products, and they syndicate Google products to enhance their sites and apps. Global Partnerships team members expand and support these relationships by continually finding new opportunities and solving technical problems for our partners. The wider Global Partnerships team includes a variety of different organizations, including CorpDev, Emerging Business Development, Strategy and Operations, Google for Startups, Area 120 and our Display Advertising Business.  The role: Scalable Acquisitions Specialist, Online Partnership Group (English, Mandarin) - Singapore  Additional Role Description  The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdMob, and AdSense tools, to help online publishers and developers grow their businesses. In this role, you'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers through analytically driven problem-solving recommendations. We manage a fast-growing business and have a forward looking, entrepreneurial spirit. We value strategic discussions and are constantly experimenting with new ideas to serve our scalable part of the business.  In this global role, you will focus on onboarding and growing app developers at scale. As a Scalable Acquisitions Specialist, you will be responsible for the growth and performance of some of our scaled pre- and post-sign up programs that support the early journey of Admob partners. You will be leading a small vendor-based lead prospecting team focused on growing our Admob business. You will also help grow Google's business with app developers and provide early-stage education for newly-acquired Admob users. In this role, you will learn in-depth insights on the mobile apps industry, how to drive cross-functional and cross-regional collaboration, and most importantly how to grow together with our partners.  In this role, you will move between strategic thinking and excellent execution and project management. You will be a key contributor in a high energy growth environment.  Responsibilities Expand Google’s app business by managing the strategy, growth, and performance of pre- and post-signup programs for Google AdMob, focusing on sustainable and high quality acquisitions. Develop strategies to enhance the performance of newly signed up partners, a significant portion of which are based in Greater China, by accelerating their activation and business growth through data-driven decisions and engaging cross-channel communication in English and/or Mandarin. Lead & improve performance of a small lead prospecting team (vendors) focused on identifying potential partners. Improve demand generation and opportunity identification. Manage and optimize the delivery of the core strategic and operational processes, including annual planning, monitoring/reporting business performance, global business updates, and quarterly reviews. Partner with product marketing to ensure consistent messaging and narrative throughout the customer journey to websites, with sales team and into the product. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of relevant work experience in growth marketing, as well as process development, optimization, and change management. Experience using digital marketing tools (e.g. Google Ads, Google Analytics). Ability to speak & write in business Mandarin, to liaise with Mandarin-speaking partners and stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications Experience with mobile app go-to-market and/or product strategy. Proven ability to multitask, analyze opportunities, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems. Outstanding written, presentation, and verbal communication skills in business-level English and Mandarin. Ability to make the complex simple without losing key ideas and messages.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description & Requirements  lululemon athletica is seeking a highly capable leader who is passionate about developing others and connecting with the community as a Key Leader on our team. The key objective of this position is to lead our retail floor and maintain amazing guest experience in stores.  What You Will Do  The role will combine the life-altering potential of wearing stretchy pants to work every day while talking health, fitness and yoga to your guests and community. The key leader plays a key role in ensuring an exceptional level of education on the retail floor by training, coaching, and developing a team of Educators that delivers the lululemon guest experience. Key leaders build capabilities within the store team to drive strategy and achieve results for the business, today and tomorrow. Under the supervision of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager, the position supports in day-to-day leadership and key areas of store operations. Our Key Leader emanates the lululemon culture, is a lover of fitness and sweaty endeavors, and is committed to creating amazing experiences for those around them.  The life of our Key Leader Passionately leads and educates on our product, community and culture on the retail floor and in the community Takes a stand as an advocate for lululemon athletica’s values and guest experience Oversees the execution of certain deliverables on the Manager ‘80/20 Checklist’, as delegated by the Store Manager or Assistant Manager. For example, Inventory, Product or Community Events Present on the retail floor encouraging and energizing staff Represents her/his store at all required meetings, events and conferences, under the direction of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager Acts as a coach to Educators and plays a hands-on roll in their development What are the technical skills necessary to perform this role? Minimum one year’s work experience in retail / sales leadership, or an equivalent role Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, retail or related field (preferred) Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) Detail oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills Ability to multi-task and coordinate ongoing projects, plans and people development Love of brainstorming, problem-solving, being creative and resourceful Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon, community, and people Passion, knowledge and involvement in yoga, and/or athletics Strong sense of personal style and athletically minded Excellent decision making and problem resolution skills Entrepreneurial, proactive and solution-oriented To Apply for this position  If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness, personal development, growth, change, responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Executive / Senior Executive – Digital Lifestyle & Payments  Who are we?  At EZ-Link, we are more than just the people behind a card.  We are the enablers of connecting people, creating smoother journeys for the young and old.  For nineteen years, we’ve been a trusted part of Singapore’s fabric and we continue to punch above our weight. Having issued 40 million cards, charms and wearables, our products are widely used for shopping, dining, private transport, government services and community services at more than 30,000 acceptance points across the island. We are also not just in the business of micro-payments, but also creating smart motoring solutions for road tolls and carpark payments.  The department  As a team member of Digital Lifestyle & Payments, your key job responsibilities are to accomplish assigned revenue targets, proliferate acceptance points and usages through strategic partnerships, programs and campaigns.  You must remain knowledgeable, be updated on changes and developments in the payment industry, as well as the overall business landscape. Come and help us make a positive impact and have a say in the daily journeys of Singaporeans. description: Make A Real Difference At PropertyGuru.  Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.  At PropertyGuru Group, we believe that every person – no matter what their circumstance – should have a place to call home. PropertyGuru Finance makes sure that nothing comes between finding a dream home and owning it. description: Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.  Primary Duties & Responsibilities To develop new business sales across marketing, corporate communications, public relations and/or investor relations segments over the telephone, via emails, and through face to face meetings To reach or exceed specific quarterly and annual targets by achieving pre-set criteria on revenue generated, with primary focus on outbound wire distribution, multimedia services and corporate workflow solutions To ensure that all clients are handled to the highest standards and everything is known about their corporate IR, PR and marketing communications requirements throughout the year To stay ahead of competition by following up on all leads and opportunities to ensure that PR Newswire maximizes the chance of winning business and by keeping regular contact with clients and prospects To provide regular (weekly, monthly and ad hoc) feedback of sales activities to the Supervisor, including clients wins/losses, competition activity, product feedback, etc. Desired Skills And Experience 3 years of sales and/or new business development experience, preferably in the relevant industries such as corporate communications, marketing, public relations, investor relations, advertising and/or media sales A solid track record of consistently delivering or exceeding sales targets and other relevant KPIs High level of self-motivation, energy and accountability; ability to work both independently and as a team in a fast-paced working environment Competent in territory management Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; mature and engaging personalities Fluent speaking and writing in English and local language Proficiency in Internet and PC software, esp. MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint User knowledge and experience in CRM system is preferred. Salesforce is an advantage As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.  Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .  Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.  Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

description: We're looking for a Business Development Associate (Singapore)  The Business Development Associate (BDA) is responsible for growing Cornerstone’s prospect pipeline, generating leads, and identifying sales opportunities for an industry-leading on-demand web-based talent management software solution. This person will be focused on outbound telephone prospecting, identifying new potential opportunities for our sales team.  This position will be based in the Cornerstone Singapore office. Success in this role may provide future additional opportunities for growth and career progression.Cornerstone is committed not only to recruiting top talent, but also to retaining great people. The compensation package includes a base salary, bonus based on achieving monthly objectives, and industry-leading benefits.  In this role you will... Undertake outbound prospecting, primarily via phone Qualify and align to client's needs, goals, and objectives Build and manage a prospect database Use Salesforce.com to accurately track relevant prospect and opportunity information Build strong internal and external relationships Consistently meet or exceed established quotas and targets Consideration of security and privacy obligations You’ve Got What It Takes If You Have... Minimum of 2 years of lead generation, account management, or sales experience in an HR software company, or equivalent Solution Selling Skills Experience using a CRM or contact management system, SFDC an advantage Proven experience of translating product functionality into client value Strong drive to achieve results with minimal supervision Aptitude for Technology, including using web-based software and internet tools Excellent communication (telephone and email), time management, presentation and organisational skills Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or equivalent is advantageous but not mandatory Fluency in English and Chinese/Bahasa Our Culture  Our mission is to empower people, businesses and communities. A culture created less by what we do and more by who we are. When people ask what our team is about, we point to our core values: champion customer success, bring our best, achieve together, get stuff done, and innovate every day. We're always on the lookout for new, curious and capable people who can help us achieve our goal and we are seeking diversity in the people who join our team. We want to make sure that our company reflects the demographic of our customers, clients, and the communities in which we operate. So if you want to work for a friendly, global, inclusive and innovative company, we'd love to meet you!  What We Do  Cornerstone is a premier people development company. We believe people can achieve anything when they have the right development and growth opportunities. We offer organizations the technology, content, expertise and specialized focus to help them realize the potential of their people. Featuring comprehensive recruiting, personalized learning, modern training content, development-driven performance management and holistic employee data management and insights, Cornerstone’s people development solutions are successfully used by more than 75 million people in 180+ countries and in nearly 50 languages.  Cornerstone takes special care to ensure the security and privacy of the data of its users.  Check us out on Linkedin , Comparably , Glassdoor , and Facebook !

description: Group-IB is one of the global leaders in threat intelligence, anti-fraud, network security, and incident response. Our team includes over 500 people. Our HQ is in Singapore and we recently opened a European office in Amsterdam. At 18 years young, we still operate like a start-up, developing new and exciting products, always hunting for more business, and reinvesting profits back into the company. We are hunters with limitless energy, and we know our products and the industry inside out.  Thanks to a combination of cutting-edge technologies, extensive experience, and in-depth expertise, Group-IB experts successfully fight international cybercrime by offering products and services that protect people, businesses, and governments worldwide.  Each of us can help to make the world a safer place.  Join us!  THE ROLE: You will be required to play an important part in assisting the sales team expand the business in the APAC market. As a Sales Support Assistant you will be responsible to be the contact point for any administrative enquiries and referrals from the sales team, internal stakeholders, clients and external vendors in the APAC market.  TASKS TO SOLVE: Assist the Sales Team in APAC with administrative matters (eg. preparation of NDA/MOU, filling up information of vendor information etc). Build strong relationships internally and collaborate effectively on cross-functional teams. Liaise with the legal and finance team advisors on all contract matters. Housekeeping of Salesforce system including to ensure all new and existing contracts are up to date. Monitor and follow up on payment terms and contract validity with clients. Assist with scheduling meetings. Conduct business correspondences. Draft basic accounting documentation. Build reports for management. Manage list of partners and provide support for partners’ enablement. Work closely with the Marketing team to assist on company’s events when needed. Generate Commercial proposals. Assist on any ad-hoc tasks as required by the team. Report to the Head of Sales.  APPLY FOR THIS VACANCY IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING QUALIFICATIONS: Diploma holder or equivalent work experience (recent graduates are welcome). Proven and significant experience in administrative support in a professional, fast paced, high profile environment. Fluent English. Solid communication skills. Excellent knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Prior experience working on Salesforce or other related CRM systems would be an advantage. Flexibility and strong sense of responsibility.   WHY CHOOSE GROUP-IB: Your happiness is important to us. We want every single team member to be happy. Continuing professional development. At Group-IB, you can choose from various paths to growth: progress as an expert, advance to a management position, try your hand in another department, relocate abroad, or launch a new business area at Group-IB. A team with extensive international expertise. Do you have experience but are looking for exciting challenges? By choosing us, you will be choosing complex tasks and continuously improving your skills in a fast-growing international company. Globally recognized technologies. Group-IB's offices are located in seven countries and our products and services are sold in 60 countries. What’s more, Gartner, IDC, and Forrester have ranked our technologies among the best in their class. We work with over 450 international partners and about 500 clients. A culture created by each of us. Group-IB’s employees speak many different languages and understand one another. We respect each other's beliefs, share common values, and strive toward the happiness of every employee. Economic stability. Group-IB's sustainable growth helps rapidly develop careers that would take years to progress as far in most other companies.   WHAT ELSE YOU SHOULD KNOW: Flexible schedule. Group-IB does not have fixed working hours. You choose your own schedule. We adhere to the principle advocated by Steve Jobs: “We have to work not 12 hours, and head.” Health. If anything goes wrong, don’t worry — we offer health insurance. Comfortable offices in all countries of operation. We bring our creative ideas to life and design our offices so that they are a convenient space. In summer, we sometimes work outside on verandas and invite clients and partners to celebrate special occasions there. Certificates and training courses. Group-IB specialists hold over 1,000 professional certificates, including CEH, CISSP, OSCP, GIAC, MCFE, BSI, as well as some rare ones that would be a source of pride for experts in forensics, penetration testing, and reverse engineering worldwide. We have an incentive program that helps employees achieve certifications at the company's expense. Challenges. A wide selection of GIB programs help you improve soft skills, gain new competencies, and receive monetary rewards. Initiative is rewarded. At Group-IB, you can bring your most daring ideas to life. The company encourages technical blogging, writing articles, building sports teams, and other creative activities.

description: Techsun is a fast growing cloud-native SaaS company. Our flagship product - Social Hub - combines functionalities of traditional CRM and CDP product, helping retailer/brand manage multi-channel data, enable strategy on customer understanding, loyalty program, customer engagement and marketing automation. Techsun proudly counts world-class brands, such as McDonald’s, Adidas, Haagen-Dazs, Microsoft Store, Swatch, Vans, The North Face, Olay etc. as customers. We have closed series A funding in 2021 and opened Asia Pacific Headquarter in Singapore for global expansion. If you like working in a start-up environment, this is a perfect opportunity!  The Role  You Will Be Responsible For Identifying opportunities for new business development through following up on leads and conducting research on target clients. New business generation by meeting potential clients to understand needs and providing relevant solutions. Managing the sales process to close new business opportunities. Building strong relationships with the existing portfolio of clients. Meeting and exceeding weekly and monthly activity and revenue targets. Sourcing new partners and executing exciting partnership solutions. Negotiating attractive partnership deals and ensuring mutually beneficial partnership terms that are in line with business objectives and strategy. Maintaining and deepening relationships with existing partners. Developing metrics to measure ROI from partnerships. Ideal Profile You have at least 1 year experience within a B2B sales/ account management or Partnerships & Alliances role, ideally within the IT industry. Experience within Startup Experience would be a strong advantage. You possess excellent interpersonal as well as written and verbal communication skills. You have a proven track record of meeting/exceeding your targets. You have a strong experience within consultative sales and possess the ability to prospect and manage senior level relationships. You are a strong networker & relationship builder You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments You are a strong mentor and coach who can build high performing teams What's on Offer? description: OBJECTIVE & PURPOSE  The broad objectives of the Marketing Department is to ensure that the APAC region achieves both its annual financial objectives and its strategic intent, to grow revenue and profit. Acquisition of New customers Retention and Development of Existing Customers  Within the marketing department, this is achieved through; A strategic Business to Business marketing plan that prioritizes activities required from marketing, by sales or other functions, with a view that the best of the GEODIS brand is available to customer to drive customer engagement and intimacy, that each step of the customer’s journey through the sales funnel is enhanced by marketing A integrated marketing and sales approach that supports the objectives of the regional sales organization, dedicating resources to all of the 3 sales channels, within one of six vertical markets (Hi-Tech, E-commerce, FMCG, Industrial, Retail, Automotive) in the APAC region Underpinning the activities of the successful formulation and execution of our marketing plan is Data Data-driven marketing will ensure that the customer data that the organization currently have is effectively used to maximum the returns on marketing spend on driving customers through the sales funnel  ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES  The Marketing Specialist supports the marketing and sales campaigns throughout the year through using the data from our GEODIS CRM system and GEODIS sales and operations performance reporting systems currently available and systems to come  Build personalized buyers’ journeys for our customers to promote customer intimacy- execute through new Salesforce Pardot marketing technology platform Identify customer groups as target audience for the marketing campaigns through identification of target customer segments Ensure effective Demand and Lead generation activities through the measurement of the success of previous and ongoing campaigns, understanding the drivers of success through the data and analysis of the behavior of customers and potential customers Identification of the customers’ growth potential in new business services with GEODIS through analysis of their existing spend with us on separate products/ service bought, trade lanes used against what is available through “lookalike” customers Using data to understand and strategize different marketing messages to the multiple touchpoints that each Business-to-Business customer present Drive ROI when digital marketing spend is activated Optimize sales campaigns through better identification of ROI for marketing spend  As GEODIS migrates from one CRM system to another (SalesForce), it is expected that the use of Pardot (SalesForce’s marketing technology platform) will enhance our ability to mine our own data. This position is expected to  Work with sales colleagues and regional sales analyst to ensure that the data linkages between the different reporting systems are well understood, extracted, reported and analyzed Ensure timely and accurate reporting of data. Provide not just data but analysis to assist in decision making, identification of trends and seasonality For Internal data, where data structures may not clearly understood by the different users currently and rules of reporting documented, to work with the different departments of finance, sales and global colleagues to build understanding  For external data, to drive the reporting and analysis for currently available independent sources of external data against GEODIS internal revenue and volume performance data  Build comparison of data between GEODIS and external data to understand total market share, total market growth benchmarks to identify Sources of Growth Build understanding of our performance against competitors, against available market to us, for current timeframe and forecasted future for growth mapping Build understanding of industry type (verticals), where opportunities lie against our strength and where there are growth areas to capitalize in each sector Build understanding of product type (Airfreight, Ocean freight, Contract Logistics etc) against our growth ambitions Mapping trade lane performance from external sources against internal data Understanding APAC countries’ growth against macro-economic drivers of growth  REQUIREMENTS  University graduate or equivalent, preferable in Business or Statistics Some practical experience in digital marketing for B2B industries. Experience in logistics and supply chain would be advantageous Knowledge or experience in business analysis would be advantageous Knowledge of the use of PARDOT and SALESFORCE Marketing or sales support experience will be useful High Proficiency in English language Proficiency in any other APAC language (Chinese, etc) is a plus  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure?  Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.

jobTitle: Regional Business Partnership Manager (Gaming, Media, eSports)
description: Job Responsibilities: Lead the development and growth of the company's strategic partner ecosystem Build and seed new sales channel partnerships for long-term strategic business strategy Active in making sales calls and consulting engagements for best practices on partnership Structure and negotiate partnership deal terms with external C level counterparts in collaboration with internal sales, product, and marketing teams Possesses strong understanding and experience in affiliate sales and marketing Develop presentations and materials Passion to develop innovative solutions  Job Requirements: Minimum 4 years’ direct marketing and partnership of proven track record results in Esports, gaming or media industry Strong ability to create sales and sponsorship decks in PowerPoint for presentation Have regional working experience across a minimum 2 to 3 continents Be proactive in researching and updating connections contacts in the esports, gaming networks Degree in Communications, marketing, media with strong written and spoken skills in English  Interested candidates, do submit your resume in MSWord to cv.mktg@recruithaus.com.sg or 62251232

We’re looking for a Marketing Strategist / Account Manager to join our award-winning integrated digital consultancy., You will be in charge of leading projects, developing strong relationships with clients, driving strategy development and marketing implementation to meet clients' business objectives.  You will oversee campaign strategy development, planning, implementation, execution and tracking across Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads, SEO & SEM, CRM workflows and email marketing, and ensure the maximising of marketing and advertising ROI for clients. You will oversee and manage ad budgets for campaigns, plan and conduct optimisation and A/B testing, while leading cross-functional teams of researchers, copywriters and designers. The ideal candidate is independent, proactive, highly collaborative, with strong problem solving and analytical skills, and a self-starter. You are a strategic thinker, and are comfortable understanding and leveraging audience insights and data to help drive toward marketing and sales goals, creating business impact for clients.  RESPONSIBILITIES Marketing Strategy and Execution Design and set comprehensive goals for performance and meeting of client's business objectives Set up marketing campaigns across channels including media planning, buying and channel optimisation Oversee strategic implementations and interpret campaign metrics and develop data-driven approaches toward achieving client's objectives Develop, implement, and manage all aspects of paid social media and PPC ad planning and buying, including strategy, target analysis, ad setup, content calendar, monitoring, and reporting Plan, develop, and defend budget recommendations, work goals, campaign strategies Proactively monitor, track and report on campaign metrics and performance Anticipating trends that may influence our work in relation to client's businesses Conduct competitive analyses or other business research to develop relevant insights to inform marketing strategy Fluent in the workings, language and lexicon of various disciplines helming our business i.e. creative, content, digital strategy, martech and branding  Identify and consult growth resulting in additional business opportunities for clients and assist in executing strategies against those opportunities when necessary  Account and Project Management Day-to-day management of accounts to deliver a proactive and reliable account management service, including addressing client queries effectively and in a timely manner Build and maintain trusted relationships with clients, with the view of maintaining client satisfaction and mining for new business opportunities within accounts Lead and manage projects including taking detailed briefs, distilling briefs into actionable and strategies, scoping and maintaining budgets, developing and maintaining timelines, creating and presenting proposals, and collaborating with internal teams across functions (marketing, creative, insights, tech) and external suppliers Ensure projects are executed in accordance with client expectations and quality standards, on time and within budget, including performing quality control across all deliverables Understand and distill the essential dynamics and drivers of the client's business and objectives, to interpret them into solutions and ensure relevance and efficacy of strategies Maintain financial management across accounts, provide accurate forecasts, ensure margins on projects are maintained, and identify ways to boost profit within accounts Lead client calls including brief-taking, ongoing WIPs, and project reviews  Team and Account Leadership Develop an efficient and collaborative working with a cross-disciplinary team of designers, content strategists, researchers, marketeers, and account managers Drive strategic direction and implementation for the team across projects and accounts Contribute effective and innovative ideas for running accounts Contribute to the design and implementation of business strategies, plans and procedures for AKIN and the business Work with key heads of business and disciplines in day-to-day operations to optimise workflow efficiencies Takes charge of given tasks to completion, self-educating if necessary Lead by example and encourage maximum performance and dedication Chart out solutions and structure even amidst ambiguity, stepping up when needed Proactive in driving initiatives and positive change within the company  Preferably effective in managing and mentoring junior team members Preferably able to coach and train new skill-sets for the team members when tasked, and is proactive in training team members to elevate quality of work and skillsets beyond day-to-day project work by understanding broader workings  REQUIREMENTS Possess at least Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in any field At least 3 years of working experience in marketing, with prior agency or consultancy experience preferred, hands-on in digital media and account management capacities Fluency across marketing strategies, understanding of the customer funnel and ability to optimise conversions at various stages Fluency with SaaS tools for web / SEO / paid analytics such as GA, SEMRush and Socialbakers Fluency with performance KPIs: CPA, CPC, CPI, CPM, Attribution and LTV Knowledge of online advertising platforms and analytics tools for online channels Knowledge across mar-tech infrastructure architecture  Knowledge with creation and running of email workflows and campaigns across Hubspot, Mailchimp, Drip, etc Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present well externally on behalf of the team  in a consultative, client-facing environment Strong listening, questioning, and critical-thinking skills Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team Confident, independent, and proactive with a can-do attitude Self-motivated and driven with a hunger to learn and stay abreast of marketing and digital industry trends Strong strategic, implementation and organisation skills, attention to detail Ability to effectively manage multiple projects smoothly and thoroughly, while adopting a self-directed attitude to achieve results  About AKIN / Why Join Us: AKÏN designs marketing strategies for a restless digital generation. Positioned at the intersection of data, creative design and contemporary culture, our unique approach to marketing delivers real business impact. We help brands articulate their purpose through a deep understanding of consumer and cultural truths. We design impactful marketing campaigns based on data and analysis. We build smart solutions and websites that bring you closer to your audiences. Above all, we’re interested in helping your brand nurture consumer relationships that will stand the test of time.  We have also clinched 10 awards at Marketing Interactive's Agency of the Year Awards in 2021 and 2020. Join us for impactful work!

Company Information:  SoMin is a SaaS platform that helps brands and agencies prevent unnecessary spending on their digital campaigns. In the digital auctions of today, brands are forced into bidding wars due to the saturation in the digital space. Through SoMin’s intuitive AI-driven targeting and automation (bidding circumvention technology), brands are able to diversify the approach to their audiences so that they can circumvent bidding wars. We do this by combining advanced data analytics and behavioral science to generate data-driven insights.  We’re looking for a dynamic Marketing Executive to join our growing marketing team to help drive brand awareness, lead generation, and pipeline acceleration campaigns. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing, ambitious, and friendly team and make a real business impact! Reporting to our Head of Marketing, you will help plan and execute marketing efforts to increase pipeline, utilizing the full marketing mix within multiple global regions.  You will work in a dynamic team that comprises both business and technology driven people. As you will be communicating with multiple stakeholders, high emotional intelligence and project management skills are key. Also, you are required to think on your feet with creative content ideas, direction, and distribution strategies.  Responsibilities Work closely with our Head of Marketing, Sales Teams, and CEO to identify opportunities for marketing campaigns and support, across APAC, North America, and Russia/CIS regions, prioritizing where appropriate Develop, implement, and evaluate the success of online and offline lead gen marketing campaigns across a range of product lines, including AI-driven Ad Targeting & Optimization, AI-driven Influencer Search, and Ad Campaign Management platforms Assist with planning and organizing our presence at industry events (virtual and in-person conferences, and webinars), taking the lead on logistics, collation of relevant marketing collaterals, liaising with internal stakeholders, and providing on-the-day support Liaise with our Google Ads Specialist to build and run impactful PPC campaigns via Search, Display, and YouTube Liaise with our Facebook Ads Specialist to build and run retargeting campaigns to drive existing website visitors back to segmented product web pages Help coordinate regional press releases with our Head of Marketing and CEO for maximum exposure Work with our in-house Design and Product Teams to oversee the marketing content creation process and ensure we’re delivering high-quality, innovative content and assets Build campaign landing pages and contact forms on SoMin’s website domain and subdomains Continually review the success of marketing campaigns, making segmentation, design, or positioning tweaks where needed to improve success Work closely with our Sales Teams to ensure lead monitoring and accuracy of CRM lead or deal data Develop and build emails for our investor monthly updates, and customer/prospect monthly newsletters Work with the Head of Marketing and CEO to manage monthly marketing budget and utilization Monitor, evaluate, and report on pipeline generation and ROI of marketing activities Support our Sales Teams with marketing assistance where relevant to nurture prospects through to deal closure  Requirements Proven experience within B2B marketing and digital marketing Fresh graduates are welcomed to apply Agency or Marketing internship experience is a plus Facebook and Google Ads experience a plus Experience with CRM, Email Marketing and Marketing Automation tools a plus Previous exposure to event marketing & graphic designing or similar roles is highly desirable Basic budget management skills A deep interest in learning about the wider business and marketing’s impact You have an entrepreneurial and innovative attitude You have great interpersonal skills, and able to connect with people with strong English communication You have a data-driven and analytical mindset; numbers don't scare you You can work diligently and independently in a remote environment You have high focusing abilities to manage impactful campaigns, projects, and tasks in a fast-paced startup environment You are based in Singapore

ADVANCE.AI is a leading AI and big data company in Asia, helping to solve digital transformation, fraud prevention and process automation for enterprise clients. Launched in 2016 and headquartered in Singapore, We combine deep local market knowledge with superior Al technology. We are experts in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision and help our clients with chatbots, anti-fraud, facial recognition, e-KYC, and optical character recognition (OCR).  Currently, we partner over 1,000 enterprise clients across Southeast Asia, South Asia and Mexico in sectors such as banking, financial services, fintech, payment, retail and e-commerce. ADVANCE.AI was ranked No. 5 on LinkedIn’s 2020 Top Startups List in Singapore.  As part of the Advance Intelligence Group, an Al-driven technology company with over 1500+ employees in 12 markets worldwide, we are united by a shared vision and purpose: to Advance with Intelligence for a Better Life--for our customers, colleagues and communities.  Our culture is built on values that are core to who we are and what we stand for: We foster an INNOVATION mindset We achieve results with EFFICIENCY and excellence We take pride in the QUALITY of our work We uphold INTEGRITY in all we do We embrace COLLABORATION to work across business lines and borders We’re looking for a Business Development Manager to join our high performing team. If you’re looking to be a part of a team who tackle real-world problems that can be addressed by AI technology, Advance.AI might just be the place for you! Work alongside world-class talent and join us as we use sophisticated data and analytics to make a change in the financial world.  Job Responsibilities Drive the software and service revenue by achieving the individual sales quota. Develop and enhance sales and business development plans through market intelligence, understanding of client markets (quantitative and qualitative) and competitor analysis Focus on solution selling for prospecting and engaging key stakeholders / C-levels and closing opportunities Identify and define needs, articulating value proposition, differentiating competition and positioning for new market entry Report on sales activity, pipeline development and revenue forecast. Develop the Go To Market strategy for the respective territory Job Requirements Minimum 6 years of work experience in enterprise software sales, account management, business development with regional exposure in SEA counties. Industries include financial services (Bank, Insurance), financial technology eCommerce, and Payment with a strong sales track records in the last 3-4 years. Solid understanding of enterprise credit risk decision solution, eKYC, digital lending, digital fraud prevention, AML, AI/big data and analytics modelling Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal Fluency in English due to regional team Proactive with successful track record of working in a team based environment Independent and highly-motivated, results-driven with significant ongoing curiosity for growth
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Strategic Sales Account Manager - Data Centre
description: Great People make Schneider Electric a great company.  Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose and that continuously creates an inclusive environment where you are empowered to do your best and be innovative?  The Role: Strategic Sales Account Manager @ NaviX Solutions by Schneider Electric  We are looking for a Senior Strategic Account Manager to be accountable for selling NaviX Solutions secure power and cooling products ‘as-a-service’ to customers seeking an alternative to a traditional capital expenditure model and looking to transition to OPEX model. The scope of the role is to begin in Singapore then expand into Asia Pacific and globally. The focus will on both conversion of existing installed based customers as well as new green-field opportunity customers.  The candidate will be responsible for achieving revenue objectives including identifying sales opportunities, qualifying opportunities, and efficiently leveraging resources in order to bring opportunities to a successful conclusion. In addition, responsible for maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction and personal involvement in customer relationships.  The candidate should be a self-starter with excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively present to both technical and executive audiences.  What will you do? Develop long-term strategic account relationships, initially in Singapore then expanding across Asia Pacific Solution selling to existing customer base and new prospects, both direct and through partners Drive the entire sales process; responsible for opportunity qualification and development, RFP/RFI proposal development and customer reviews, negotiations and deal closure Nurture opportunities and fill pipeline by active engagement with prospects, key customers and partners Prepare and provide business reviews to the management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing existing and new customers Responsible to articulate compelling value propositions and developing executive relationship with C-suite and key stakeholders within accounts Maintain knowledge of competitors in accounts  Qualifications  Who would be successful? At least 10+ years’ experience in solution selling and new business development within enterprise customers, demonstrating customer orientation Bachelor’s degree or MBA preferred; or equivalent experience Exposure to selling ‘as a Service’ (aaS) and/or Usage-based consumption models within the IT Infrastructure and/or software sector Sales orientation demonstrating strong track record of achievement in managing sales and exceeding all targets Strong relationship management skills, clear verbal and written communication skills and experience in influence-without-authority High-energy, motivated self-starter, ability to work independently and successfully within small, unstructured teams, often in an ambiguous environment Experience in power and/or cooling solutions preferred, but not required Strong Negotiating skills Innovative and able to foresee market conditions Extrovert with a sales mindset with winning, collaborative attitude Ability to work independently and with internal teams and partners  About NaviX Solutions  NaviX Solutions by Schneider Electric is a new first-to-market service, that delivers a full end-to-end ‘as-a-service’ model, providing full lifecycle management for critical power and cooling assets. These critical assets include Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS), switchgears, transformers and IT cooling. This is supported by NaviX Solutions Unified Digital Platform which will introduce intelligence through an application layer that tracks, monitors and drives the efficiency of your power and cooling assets.  The idea behind NaviX Solutions is to change the way company’s think about how to manage assets that are critical to business continuity and growth in an increasingly digital economy.  NaviX Solutions is the product of a partnership between Schneider Electric and Singapore’s Economic Development Board (EDB) to incubate and launch new business ventures and help companies with strong global potential and ability to scale. NaviX Solutions is the first global business to be launched in Singapore as a result of this joint partnership.  Why us?  Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.  €25.7bn global revenue  137 000+ employees in 100+ countries  45% of revenue from IoT  5% of revenue devoted for R&D  Video Link: https://youtu.be/J0cFSdFpI24  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.  It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.  Schedule: Full-time  Req: 006H71
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Location. Singapore - Home Based Summary. Formpipe Software is a leading Independent Enterprise Software Vendor (ISV) (SaaS) solution provider. We are a European-based public company that operates with a global customer base and offices . Our current success is evidenced by the sale of our software to an increased number of banking clients both direct with organisations like TEMENOS and also other banking vertical partners. We are ready to increase our market share, improve our brand awareness and drive new business opportunities. To do this effectively, we need a commercial salesperson dedicated to the banking vertical to join our organization. The primary focus of this role is to deliver the strategic drive to increase our presence in banking across the APAC market. You will be joining the existing commercial team and have the support of the existing banking team. You will have the opportunity to be a key influencer in shaping the banking vertical in Formpipe and the team will look to you as the expert in your field to take responsibility for delivering a comprehensive strategic and tactical plan with the objectives of further business development. It is for this reason we are looking for someone to immerse themselves in our specific Industry and to take a lead role in driving and executing our strategy in support of our growth aspirations. Duties and Responsibilities. Ensure the development of the growth sales strategy for APAC. Understand our product and solutions and how they fit the banking marketplace Applying sales methodology and operate at Director / C-level Deal management – owning the deal strategy to create a win embracing both customer and partner engagement. Achieve assigned targets and KPIs Understand the TEMENOS environment in APAC and drive new contacts and relationships with the partner Drive and deliver new leads in the banking environment. Understand the partner program and align the APAC banking sector to this Source and define new partners and drive these partners according to the partner program Embracing and enhancing the team ethos and values of Formpipe  Knowledge and Experience. Essential: • Experience working within the banking sector. • Experience selling complex products / solutions • Proven sales experience at Director / C-Level • Excellent Customer service skills through all channels (telephone, email, face to face) • Comfortable and confident in customer service with internal customers, external customers and partners • Creation and delivery of presentations to any stakeholder within the sales process from end user to C-level. Desirable: • Previous knowledge of TEMENOS or the TEMENOS application either by working for TEMENOS or working for a bank using TEMENOS solutions • Experience working with partners in software solution selling

Responsibilities In-charge of company P&L and marketing strategies of all the company brands Develop and execute sales & marketing strategies and commercial plans Plan and execute marketing promotional campaigns Lead and supervise cross functional team to ensure align with company direction Lead marketing and social media team To increase market presence and boost sales for the company Manage project deadlines and cost control within project budget Responsible for data analytics on websites Ad hoc duties as assigned Requirements Bachelor in Business Administration, Marketing, Digital Marketing or equivalent At least 4 - 5 years of B2B Sales and E-commerce Sales experience Prior experience in Lifestyle Products Industry / FMCG Industry / Trading Companies would be ideal Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please send in your resumes to https://www.careers-page.com/talent-trader-group/job/XW36RR to apply  EA License No.: 13C6305  Registration No.: R1654399  For candidate who applied for the advertised position is deemed to have consented to us that we may collect, use or disclose your personal information for purpose in connection with the services provided by us.

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  APAC Marketing Analyst, B2B  AP Product Marketing is part of AP B2B Marketing. It aims to: Be the resident marketing expert for all our suite of products & solution. Leverage market intelligence & insights about payment usage trends and competing products to identify new opportunities. Collaborate with product team to design and develop sales enablement materials & compelling sales tools for sales team to leverage & sell. Explore creative and relevant way to communicate Mastercard’s product story. Support all go-to-market product launch to create awareness & drive adoption & usage. Partner with Research team to provide insights into design of product & features to that will create differentiation for end users. Distribution of all marketing content (product and merchant content) via marketing owned platforms for easy access.  AP Product marketing works closely with all stakeholders in the Product & Marketing organization at Global/Division/Country level. We also partner and leverage appointed agencies to deliver successful outcomes aligned to our objectives.  Information on Roles and Responsibilities Drive a confident and conversant sales force Develop a broad understanding of Mastercard’s business through close partnership with Product & Services leads & translating this into compelling product story in the form of sales enablement materials. Such materials can take a variety of creative format including interactive tool, powerpoint deck, videos & demo. Day-to-day lead overseeing the maintenance and re-certification of 400+ sales materials on our internal Product & Sales Center to ensure that all materials are up to date (content and branding) and relevant for the sales team to leverage Build awareness of Mastercard as a forward-thinking paytech company beyond cards Input to B2B narrative that position Mastercard as a credible organization beyond card solution. Pilot lead generation campaigns for Mastercard’s new and existing B2B solutions, including all core, digital & fintech product & solution. Support externally sponsored & internally curated customers events and exhibitions to showcase products/solutions & customers engagement Drive usage of Mastercard products with partners Develop B2B2C toolkits for key Mastercard Products & Services, that will enable partners with the assets they need, to drive usage of our solutions Identify and support regional opportunities for Mastercard sonic branding at check out. Be the subject matter expert for AP region to provide support for local implementation as well as the key focal contact with global team. Enhancement and management of marketing owned platforms supporting external partners. Own the platforms end to end Review of platform from a customer user journey perspective to ensure optimal customer experience – recommend and execute enhancements as needed Drive usage to platforms Successful delivery of compelling sales enablement materials. Manage agencies to efficiently deliver sales enablement materials that are on strategy & in a timely manner and to budget. Execute and deliver lead generation programs. Manage operation of Marketing owned platform to increase usage by 10% YoY Achieve region’s target for sonic at check out  Requirements University degree 5 years experience in working for or dealing with advertising / media / digital marketing agency Good project management skills. Ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects concurrently Good team player and relationship management skills. Strong influencing & negotiation skills as this role requires working through others to deliver. Ability to work independently Resourceful with good analytical skills Proficient in creating reports and presentations Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel & PowerPoint), internet and other computer software/applications Experience with B2B marketing and/or payments industry will be an advantage  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: The people at Wilhelmsen Marine Products do not just hold jobs here. They make the most innovative ideas a reality – and in the process, they shape the maritime industry. With the largest maritime network in the world, we do work that makes an impact - if it floats, our products are probably on it.  Supplying marine solutions including the Unitor brand of products, Timm ropes, Unicool refrigerants, and Unitor and Nalfleet marine chemicals, last year we made product deliveries to 27,500 vessels. Having the largest maritime network, we supply marine consumables, products, and solutions to every conceivable vessel type, at over 2,000 ports. At Wilhelmsen, we keep global trade running.  Anchor your career in the maritime industry and dive into a sea of opportunities with us now.  We are looking for a Sales Support Team Lead SEA to manage and lead a team of Sales Support Coordinators. If you have a Diploma or Bachelor degree in Sales & Marketing with a minimum 3 years of relevant working experience, then this is the role for you.  The Sales Support Team Lead SEA will report to Area Sales Director - South East Asia.  Required Experience And Skills Administrative skills and managerial experience in previous roles. Proven communication skills. Able to meet deadlines through good time management and allocation of priorities. Computer literate and good command of MS Office, CRM systems, Excel etc. Proactive, takes responsibility and delivers results. Team player with good interpersonal skills. What You Will Be Doing Manage the team, coordinate workload and monitor results and performance. Capture “as-is” processes and collaborate to cocurate the new standardized processes. Align and collaborate with other Sales Support Team Leads on global best practices. Prepare deal proposals, tender doc. and legal agreements in accordance with WSS governance. Register and maintain relevant customer data, such as payer, vessel and contract data. Monitor and drive improvement of customer data accuracy and completeness. Provide sales and customer analysis, prepare business reviews and customer presentations. Assist on enforcing high levels of quality, accuracy and consistency in the sales planning. Facilitate successful implementation of sales processes and CRM usage. Manage customer complaints/non-compliance through the CRM/IP system as per valid process. Coordinate the implementation of sales initiatives & campaigns. Prepare and organize sales meetings and customer events. We offer a culture and work environment of strong leadership, career development and a job that is both challenging and stimulating.  Sounds interesting? If you can see yourself in this role, please let us know why you are our new Sales Support Team Lead SEA.  Please Apply Via Link  https://wilhelmsen.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Wilhelmsen/job/Singapore/Sales-Support-Team-Lead-SEA_JOBREQ_1604-1

description: Business Executive Trainee (CBD Area)  Coinhako is a market leading platform for access to digital assets like Bitcoin from Singapore  Founded in 2014, Coinhako has established a reputation as being one of the most secure and trusted digital asset wallet service provider and trading platform in the APAC market. Our team is deeply passionate about building the crypto economy in the APAC region. Through the launch of our innovative suite of products and services, Coinhako aims to empower individuals and businesses by allowing them to take ownership and control of the way they build and manage their assets in the new digital finance world.  Your Role  Selected Business Executives will undergo 4 months of comprehensive structured training covering the 3 tracks of Marketing, Customer Experience & Corporate Development for 2 weeks each before specializing in 1 of them at the 3rdmonth onwards.  A glimpse of what will be cover under the 3 tracks: Corporate Development Work closely with investment firms & family offices to develop & structure crypto linked investment. Engage existing corporate clients & develop new ones to grow the business. Marketing Plan & ideate digital marketing campaigns. Optimize customer user experience journey by assisting with UX/UI efforts. Develop & execute Content Marketing strategy. Customer Experience Delivering a best-in-class customer service in person and via our omni-channel support. On-boarding customers by processing their applications and performing KYC checks. Collaborating with internal stakeholders to develop service procedures, policies and standards that maintain a world class customer experience. To ensure our new hired Business Executive succeed, they will be mentored by our functional department heads in their work.  Expectations Has prior experience & thrive in front facing roles including sales, client servicing, marketing & customer service etc, Has work in different functional experience & willing to stretch yourself in learning new functional areas. Able to develop and implement new ideas with haste & empathy with your stakeholders. Ability to deal with ambiguity & work in a fast-paced environment as change is the only constant in our industry. A strong interest in cryptocurrencies!
