Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  Coinbase is seeking a Technical Account Manager (TAM) to maintain and grow Coinbase implementations with enterprise accounts. Technical Account Managers work in close alignment with Coinbase Sales, Account Management, Product, Support and Engineering teams to ensure Coinbase’s product and service meet clients’ expectations.  As the trusted technical Advisor to Coinbase customers, the (TAM) is responsible for the health & growth of Coinbase technology and integrations within their book of business serving as well as point of contact for technical service escalations.  The TAM is accountable for developing and reinforcing strong and effective client relationships, particularly with key stakeholders and decision makers.  What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Take ownership of all technical and product initiatives for designated accounts. Work together with Sales to ensure retention and increase penetration of enterprise accounts. Work in tandem with Account Managers to map out account structure, identify decision makers and establish touch points for technical operations. Gather product requirements and advocate for customer requirements within Coinbase. Work closely with product teams to provide product roadmap updates to customers. Develop a comprehensive understanding of customer environment and operational constraints. Ensure that any customer configurations are documented and part of the product development lifecycle. Work with assigned accounts to establish a well-defined IT and business process for cloud and on-prem deployments. Coordinate go-to-market for new product features to ensure the best customer experience. Provide detailed review of operational performance of account, metrics and service disruptions to management team and customer. Assist Support Engineers in troubleshooting technical issues and service outages for assigned accounts. Responsible for escalation to Coinbase senior management to ensure timely resolution of service outages. What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, or related field required or equivalent work experience Proven experience managing applications/technical deployments in a client facing role Exceptional interpersonal skills. Ability to engage C level decision makers on product and technology You are self-motivated and develop a deep understanding of Coinbase product and technical stack Organised and analytical. Able to distill sophisticated and ambiguous requirements into clear results Experience with integrating REST/FIX APIs Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here: Ireland/EU, United Kingdom, and California. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

description: Purpose Of Position  Responsible for achieving agreed sales volume and revenue within the expected margin to grow the consumables product market share in Singapore. Negotiate terms of sales agreement and close sales with customers. Sales Management - Ensure effective management of the respective sales by the timely and accurate maintenance, preparation and submission of relevant quotation, sales order, sales reports and after sales follow-up/support. Co-ordinate with other sales and technical support team members. Marketing and Sales Co-ordination - Contribute to the orderly and systematic marketing and sales of consumable products in the Singapore market by the timely and accurate adherence to all agreed sales and pricing policies, gather market and customer information and provide feedback on buying trends and practice sharing. Keep Country Manager aware of significant developments within the country. Team Participation - Contribute to the teamwork and work climate by assisting other team members where appropriate, seeking area’s where further work contributions may be made and by maintaining effective work relations with all other staff members. Contribute to the effective representation of our consumables product interests by promoting and representing the company with involvement in exhibits, trade shows and conventions, product demonstration and in industry association activities. Develop and maintain relationships with key influential thought leaders. Utilize these relationships to expand market share. Study and stay informed on products, technologies, clinical studies, competitive activity, and other general information of interest to company or to customers. Requirement for the Position Education: Degree/Diploma in Marketing / Business or related discipline. Experience: Min 3 years of relevant direct and channel selling experience, preferably in dental / medical devices industry. Proven track record of sales success. Good knowledge and experience with segmentation, positioning, product marketing, branding, marketing communications, digital marketing will be added advantage. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Highly motivated and professional individual Sales process-driven with strong closing skills Self-starter who is able to work independently Drive and resilience - ability to maintain focus on key objectives.

description: Job Description  We are looking for a Growth Manager based in Singapore. This is a strategic business development role and you will primarily be responsible to develop new business opportunities and increase new sales revenue for the company.  Be prepared to get scrappy and get your hands dirty! This role will put your hunting, strategic thinking, sales skills, and communication skills to the test. You will need to constantly iterate on your approach to test out what works and what does not.  We are in a key stage of growth and this role will be suitable for someone who is excited to build and take a startup to the next level.  This role is not for the faint-hearted. Interactions with people should energize you! description: Description & Requirements  lululemon athletica is seeking a highly capable leader who is passionate about developing others and connecting with the community as a Key Leader on our team. The key objective of this position is to lead our retail floor and maintain amazing guest experience in stores.  What You Will Do  The role will combine the life-altering potential of wearing stretchy pants to work every day while talking health, fitness and yoga to your guests and community. The key leader plays a key role in ensuring an exceptional level of education on the retail floor by training, coaching, and developing a team of Educators that delivers the lululemon guest experience. Key leaders build capabilities within the store team to drive strategy and achieve results for the business, today and tomorrow. Under the supervision of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager, the position supports in day-to-day leadership and key areas of store operations. Our Key Leader emanates the lululemon culture, is a lover of fitness and sweaty endeavors, and is committed to creating amazing experiences for those around them.  The life of our Key Leader Passionately leads and educates on our product, community and culture on the retail floor and in the community Takes a stand as an advocate for lululemon athletica’s values and guest experience Oversees the execution of certain deliverables on the Manager ‘80/20 Checklist’, as delegated by the Store Manager or Assistant Manager. For example, Inventory, Product or Community Events Present on the retail floor encouraging and energizing staff Represents her/his store at all required meetings, events and conferences, under the direction of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager Acts as a coach to Educators and plays a hands-on roll in their development What are the technical skills necessary to perform this role? Minimum one year’s work experience in retail / sales leadership, or an equivalent role Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, retail or related field (preferred) Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) Detail oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills Ability to multi-task and coordinate ongoing projects, plans and people development Love of brainstorming, problem-solving, being creative and resourceful Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon, community, and people Passion, knowledge and involvement in yoga, and/or athletics Strong sense of personal style and athletically minded Excellent decision making and problem resolution skills Entrepreneurial, proactive and solution-oriented To Apply For This Position  If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness, personal development, growth, change, responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.  NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

jobTitle: New Business Strategist, Kickstart, Google Customer Solutions (Thai) - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: New Business Strategist, Kickstart, Google Customer Solutions (Thai) - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  We believe that an effective onboarding to increase the customer’s sustainability can be achieved through attentive support and regular communications. Our commitments are demonstrated by the fact that our team’s objectives and key results (OKRs) are formed to increase customer graduations into same store account teams.  As a New Business Strategist, you will manage relationships with our acquisitions and store team for the customer and set the vision and the strategy for how their marketing plans can reach users.  Responsibilities Work towards assigned goals, while prioritizing and delivering outstanding customer experience to Google's advertisers. Work closely with colleagues in New Business Sales and small- and medium-sized business (SMB) sales teams to deliver a seamless customer transition and experience. Implement creative ways to improve our customer’s advertising performance by tailoring and sharing performance-enhancing suggestions and by promoting other Google products. Provide strategic advice and help our customers get the best return on their advertising investment by working closely in a consultative role with customers. Communicate effectively with English and Thai speaking clients. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience in sales or account management. Ability to speak and write in Thai fluently. Preferred Qualifications Experience in digital marketing, with understanding of Google's advertising solutions. Experience in managing and customizing to a customer base. Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities at a time while paying attention to detail. Ability to proactively reach out to customers and help customers to add value to their business. Proactive and independent, with the ability to lead, motivate, and work well with others.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Role/Responsibilities As part of the Global Sales Operations team within Moody’s ESG Solutions, you will be responsible for providing sales support and contract administration to a dedicated team of sales professionals in the maintenance of existing accounts and new clients, in addition to ensuring compliance with organizational standards and protocol. The ideal candidate has some prior experience in operations or paralegal. Successful OAs are detail-oriented and outgoing, have excellent communication skills, and demonstrate exceptional organizational, prioritational and multitasking abilities. Attention to detail and the ability to prioritize is essential. Key Responsibilities Provide sales support and administration to assigned Sales team in maintaining existing accounts and closing new business; in addition to support sales activities such as contract generation, pricing, renewals management with compliance with Moody’s terms and conditions. New and Renewal Contract management and administration (preparation, execution and record retention) Manage contract fulfillment with attention to timeliness and quality control. Set up current and prospective client permissions to access electronically delivered services in accordance with contract specifications, terms, and effective dates. Supply clients with access details and manage de-activations in the event of cancellations. Work with Sales, Legal & Finance teams to meet strict deadlines and comply with Moody’s standards and protocol. Ensure all contracts are fully executed and archived. Coordinate with Finance, Collections, Sales Administration and Client Service Desk to ensure client queries are completed to high level of satisfaction. Maintain a high level of customer care through successful follow up with invoice changes/problems, permissioning problems, product queries, and maintenance of contact details. Maintain accurate data in database throughout the sales cycle, ensuring consistency and accuracy in managing trials, clients and prospects. Assist with maintenance of the forecasted sales data. Responsible for ad hoc reporting of usage data, sales pipeline, account information, trials, pricing, renewal status and booked sales. Qualifications Experience Required: Bachelor’s degree 2-3 years of experience of sales operations or legal (paralegal) preferred Relevant experience preparing contracts helpful Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel is required, and familiarity with Salesforce, Microsoft Access or databases is preferred. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines Excellent English and Chinese verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. LOB/Cost Center With global demand for ESG and climate insights growing at pace, Moody’s ESG Solutions Group (MESGS) is continuing to build a first-class Sales and Customer Service team that drives success across every business line and customer segment. Our Sales organization is responsible for sales and customer support globally for the Moody's suite of ESG, Climate and Sustainable Finance products and services. This global function consists of four core teams: Sales, Client Product Specialists, Sales Effectiveness and Strategic Relationships. Job Req ID 22373BR Entity Moody's Shared Services (MSS) Line of Business Moody's Risk Assessment (MRA) Regular/Temporary Regular City Hong Kong SAR, Singapore Job Category Sales & Marketing Job Sub Category Customer Services Experience Level Experienced Hire Working at Moody's Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com . Entity Moody’s ESG Solutions Group (MESGS) is a business unit of Moody’s Corporation. Its mission is to serve the growing global demand for ESG and climate insights. Complementing Moody’s long-established track record in risk management expertise, the group’s comprehensive offering includes – but is not limited to – ESG scores and assessments, climate data, ESG-themed indices, Sustainability Ratings and sustainable finance certifier services that help fulfil the broad spectrum of ESG- and climate-related goals in risk management, equity and credit markets. The group is rapidly expanding in headcount to meet ambitious growth targets on the path to becoming the most preeminent data and solutions provider within the ESG domain. By crafting a comprehensive suite of solutions, powered by superior data and overlaid with analytical expertise, Moody’s ESG Solutions seeks to be a pioneer of positive transformation – by playing a pivotal role in the greening of economy and advancing resilience across customer segments, including companies, sovereigns, banks, insurers, asset managers and asset owners globally. EEO Policy Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Securities Trading Policy (STP) Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

description: Purpose Contributes to the overall success of the Global Banking and Markets Onboarding (GBMO) department ensuring GBM clients in Singapore are fully on boarded in line with Bank, local regulatory policies, and procedures. Ensures all regulatory onboarding activities conducted follow governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures. Supports the Senior Manager/Director, GBMO & Regulatory Onboarding through the following primary functions: Assisting GBM clients in satisfying OTC Derivative Trading Regulatory Requirements (CanDer, Dodd-Frank, EMIR, HKMA, MAS) Ensuring client files are properly documented while containing appropriate regulatory/data attributes to facilitate accurate downstream reporting Liaising with relevant stakeholders (Front Office, Credit, Margin, Documentation, Operations, Technology, Compliance, Legal) to enable clients to transact in a timely manner, while ensuring all regulatory requirements have been completed Conduct ongoing client quality control reviews to ensure files are refreshed with accurate and complete data attributes Performing exception management, reconciliations, and data analysis across-systems to ensure counterparties are correctly mapped for downstream reporting Support the requests pertaining to Onboarding and periodic review of GBM clients in an efficient, compliant, and client-centric manner. Rapidly triage and escalate complex issues to management for resolution. Accountable to perform KYC Quality checks as needed to ensure that defined guidelines are being adhered to and liaise with teams locally and across the region to facilitate knowledge sharing. Provide guidance and oversight to makers in on boarding Team with respect to Policies, Procedures and Priorities. Work directly with clients to complete requisite Know Your Client ("KYC") and Anti-money Laundering ("AML") documentation. Ensure that documentation meets the guidance put in place by GBM and escalate any variances from guidance to management for resolution Ensure documentation is archived according to Bank and regulatory requirements Prepare onboarding status reports for executive management. Prepare tracking systems to accurately capture and pass down onboarding data to back-office teams.  Work closely with AML and business teams to help in resolution of issues and ensure stakeholders are well informed of the progress and escalated issues and coordinate with relevant stakeholders to get the task done. Stay informed of changes in requisite regulatory onboarding matters related including but not limited to: Know Your Client ("KYC") and Anti-money Laundering ("AML”) regulations. Tax Regulations such as Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act ("FATCA") and Common Reporting Standards ("CRS) Provide support to internal and external clients on significant changes and client impact related to the various  regulatory onboarding matters Participate in multi-disciplinary teams to address new business initiatives, technology system enhancement projects, and one-off projects as required.  Accountabilities Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge. Understand how the Bank's risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk. Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment. The incumbent will operate independently, and in partnership with other internal/external stakeholders to deliver on the Bank’s OTC Derivative regulatory onboarding mandate and AML KYC Onboarding. Demonstrates knowledge of trading products and capital markets documentation requirements necessary in support of strategic plans implemented to address reporting requirements from an execution and controls perspective. The incumbent communicates and liaises with various internal stakeholders (Front Office, Compliance, Operations, Internal Controls, Senior Management etc.) as required. Assists with the identification and resolution of process, control and data issues based on inquiries from internal stakeholders, and problem solves solutions to assess the risk faced by the bank, as well as implement solutions that control for risks for counterparty onboarding function. The incumbent will be responsible for developing and enhancing 1A regulatory onboarding procedures, as well as making risk-based decisions under extremely strict timelines.   Supports on all regulatory and ad-hoc requests involving compliance status’ and questions surrounding client- data. Represents GBMO on various working group, steering committees, and compliance forums to address issues involving exceptions, breaches, projects, or escalations. Answers regulatory-compliance and data queries for internal stakeholders in a timely manner, while considering the Bank’s rules-based escalation policies and procedures. Ensures all outgoing communications to clients are properly scripted, formatted, or customized as appropriate.  Education / Experience / Other Information 5-7 years of industry experience within capital markets, Corporate banking, investment banking and compliance, or operations dealing with AML & regulatory onboarding or other regulatory-related business processes. knowledge of multiple capital market, Corporate banking product areas and jurisdictions, supporting the operations of a financial institution is desirable. A background in global OTC derivatives regulations (including business conduct, margin, and other related requirements) and related regulatory controls experience is preferred Client-service experience is desirable, as the role requires interaction with various client-types (Corporate, Commercial, Agency, Individuals). The international scope of the business, together with the multiplicity of stakeholders, will require work outside of traditional business hours from time to time. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Interaction with internal and external contacts includes clients, GBM senior management, trading and marketing desks, corporate bankers, legal counsel, and Compliance. Must be able to operate effectively within an exceptionally time sensitive environment with changing priorities and tight time frames which are closely scrutinized by Senior/Executive Management. The position requires strong business acumen, sound judgment and critical thinking skills. The incumbent must be an action-oriented and self-motivated multi-tasker who possesses strong relationship management skills as the role requires. Knowledge of Scotiabank internal processes and reporting systems is preferred. Proficiency with all Microsoft Office suite of products, including Work, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint; some experience using Visual Basic or other programming languages to automate manual/tactical tasks is preferred
industries: Banking

description: About The Company  My client is a health consultancy firm, providing medically tailored programmes designed to mitigate any health and ageing concerns aimed to keep individuals' physical and mental performances at its optimum. If you seek to be a part of an organisation that represents change, to innovate and reform the way age-related diseases are viewed and treated in the world, apply now.  About The Job  They are in search of a result-oriented sales professional who is driven and motivated to be a part of the organisation. Your job responsibilities include generating sales lead by actively servicing existing accounts and promoting new account acquisition, attending to customer’s enquiries and providing excellent customer service, consolidating feedback to management team to enhance sales performance, and producing reports and presentation materials as required. You will also be expected to provide immaculate sales follow-up and after-sales service, handle customer disputes and ensure an organised record of sales activities in the CRM system .  About The Manager/team  This position works cloesly with the Senior Sales Consultant and reports directly to the Centre Manager.  Skills And Experience Required  The incumbent should be tertiary educated and come with at least 2 years of relevant experience in a sales-focused environment. To succeed in this role, you must be adaptable and possess high levels of problem solving ability to identify and resolve arising issues in a timely and efficient manner. It is essential that you have great interpersonal and communication skills with a strong command of written and spoken English to communicate with stakeholders in a diverse environment. The ideal candidate should also be independent, resourceful, and possessing a willingness to learn and explore new skills.  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Carmen Tan at 6510 1333.  (EA: 94C3609/ R2196577 )
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

description: CREA’s mission is to power brand through digital commerce to reach the booming, digital savvy, Millennial and Gen Z consumers in Southeast Asia. The e-commerce business model is evolving fast. Today simply knowing how to list, ship and manage digital payments is not enough to differentiate brand online. At CREA, our objective is to build the most relevant Millennial and Gen Z beauty, fashion, and lifestyle brand portfolio in South East Asia leveraging on a growing multi-billion dollar market demand.  CREA has quickly become the number one player in the beauty and fashion digital sales space, empowering our teams through tech. CREA helps big brands e.g. L’Oréal, Clarins, The Body Shop, Lee, Wrangler and etc. to use their marketing spend efficiency and market to people online.   Responsibilities: Working closely with Key Account manager in preparing joint business plan and driving weekly/monthly/quarterly reviews of performance against targets Advising your brands on go to market strategy for new product ranges Planning promotional campaigns and coordinating execution with Onsite Manager Planning brand marketing engagement including onsite brand visibility, online marketing strategy and co-marketing efforts on social media and offline Support Key Account Manager in managing daily engagement with assigned brands e.g. price competitiveness, assortment, and stock availability Working with cross-functional teams to resolve any issues impacting brand performance on all platforms (operations, fulfilment services, marketing, finance etc.)  Qualification: The ideal candidate has superb business judgment with a desire to manage their own business. He/she must be able to work well in cross-functional teams to drive business goals. Bachelor’s Degree from undergraduate institution At least 1-2 years of experience, preferably in either e-commerce/ merchandising or to FMCG/Beauty/ Fashion. Superb business judgment with a track record of successful negotiations and overall relationship management (both internal and external) Ability to work autonomously in a highly demanding and often ambiguous environment, with strong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills Strong analytical skills Great communication skills (both oral and written) are a must Mastery of MS Office (particularly Excel and PowerPoint) is a must, as well as an agility with web-based software applications, SQL, and internally developed systems Experience with e-commerce or to FMCG/Fashion background will be considered a plus.
jobFunction: Marketing, Business Development, and Project Management
industries: Internet

description: About Us  Fairmart is an early-stage community commerce company with a mission to help local stores thrive in the digital age. It is our belief that local stores should have access to the same capabilities that larger businesses have, but built for their scale. To achieve this, we take a multidisciplinary approach to building solutions that are simple to use, yet powerful in their impact.  We're based in the JTC Launchpad - a heart of Singapore's startup community.  We are a diverse team of technologists and builders who love to see the direct impact of our work on the lives of our customers. Those who are successful at Fairmart are intensely curious and bring a fierce passion to their work. You should be results-oriented, but also be people-oriented and understand the broader context of each problem you solve. Our culture is our competitive advantage, and you will have a unique opportunity to nurture its evolution and growth.  Our founders bring a combined 25 years of experience from industry giants such as Shopback, Redmart, and DJI. The company is supported by prominent VCs such as Entrepreneur First, HAX, and SOSV.  What You'll Be Doing Representing Fairmart as the first point of contact for potential customers and partners. Daily levels of proactive outreach activity presenting opportunities to partner with Fairmart. Owning and maintaining a consistent pipeline, to exceed monthly sales targets. Drafting outreach templates and proposals to convert pipeline to sales. Maintaining records to provide transparency on all sales activities via the CRM. Passionately representing Fairmart and resolving customer objections. Negotiating partnership pricing to ensure business objectives are achieved. Skills You’ll Need You’ll be comfortable on the phone and walking into stores, talking to people and building rapport with them quickly. Comfort with high levels of activity and a fast-paced environment. Closing sales: getting buy in and agreement from potential customers. Experience and confidence pitching things you’re passionate about. Experience with technology and capturing your activity in a CRM You’ll have an interest in all things retail and digital shopping. Fairmart is changing the game for a specialist by helping them compete with the larger marketplaces. Perseverance and grit – you’re a hustler, and you’re not afraid of rejection. Top-notch people skills – you have bags of emotional intelligence and can persuade even the toughest of prospects. Perks And Benefits Performance based incentive scheme. Open, respectful and fun company culture. Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution. Work with people who love what they do every day. Qualifications Diploma in Business, communication, or related field. At least 1 - 3 years of relevant work experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Mandarin. All additional languages are a plus. Ability to work independently, multi-task, organize and prioritize work. Check out our website: https://fairmart.app/

jobTitle: Senior Executive / Manager, Business Development & Sales, Digital Platforms
description: About Us  CapitaLand Limited (CapitaLand) is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, it owns and manages a global portfolio worth S$131.9 billion as at 31 December 2019. CapitaLand’s portfolio spans across diversified real estate classes which includes commercial, retail; business park, industrial and logistics; integrated development, urban development; as well as lodging and residential. With a presence across more than 200 cities in over 30 countries, the Group focuses on Singapore and China as its core markets, while it continues to expand in markets such as India, Vietnam, Australia, Europe and the USA.  The Job  Be at the forefront driving the evolution, digitalization and transformation of retail and workspace landscape with us. The Digital Platforms team manages key platform programs, mainly: CapitaStar, CapitaVoucher, eCapitaMall, Capita3Eats, CapitaCard and CapitaStar@Work. The team focuses on driving business sustainability through profitability and value whilst injecting innovation & creation of seamless customers’ experiences for CapitaLand’s commercial, retail businesses, shopping malls, merchant and partner networks.  This a great opportunity for a high caliber Business Development professional experienced in propagating interesting solutions and consumer products to corporates and enterprises; this individual will assist in solutions consulting & business advisory with a large untapped market to go after. This role will report to the Team Lead of Business Development.  Office Location: 615 Toa Payoh Lorong 4, #07-00 StorHub, Singapore 319457  Responsibilities Achieve and exceed monthly / quarterly sales targets by selling Digital Platforms key products to Corporates for their B2B solutions Manage the entire sales process for Corporates and enterprises to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while maintaining good relationships with existing accounts Territory / Vertical identification and research, to formalize a go-to-market strategy and create qualified target accounts Pipeline development through a combination of cold-calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence Create and maintain a sales pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated market sectors Engage with prospects to position CapitaLand Digital Platforms products and solutions through strategic value-based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data Manage the end-to-end process through engagement of other stakeholders and teams Perform regular day-to-day administrative and ad-hoc duties as assigned Requirements Degree in Business, Sales or a related field Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Sales and Business Development in Digital Advertising, or IT industry. Experience selling at a strategic level to either head of region office, corporate strategy, business development or consumer growth market teams would be ideal. A proven track record against high sales targets, must be comfortable managing consultative sales processes end-to-end for multiple deals A personable, articulate, consultative and confident sales approach conducive for selling to Corporates Strong quantitative analytical ability and strategic thinking is crucial with capacity to communicate complex, large-scale concepts clearly Have the personal motivation and ability to contribute to an entrepreneurial and dynamic team culture Benefits Flexible benefits with comprehensive medical coverage for self and family Training and development opportunities Subsidised rates at Ascott services residences Strong advocate of staff volunteerism Wellness programs Closing Statement  At CapitaLand, we advocate fair employment practices, and recruit talents based on merit and fit with our Corporate values. We provide equal opportunity for all qualified persons and build an inclusive workplace regardless of race, gender, age, religious belief or nationality.  Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Real Estate

The goal is to maximize our revenue stream and business performance. We harness sales and business opportunities with customer experience strategy by refreshing ways of approaching our clients and providing effective platforms for future potential advertisers. We optimize sales procedures by using tools and aim to develop customer's success stories with our Sales team for SPH Media.  The responsibility of the role will be a combination of project management and Go-to-market development.  The Job  Liaise with Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Product to ensure successful integration of media packages and plans Develop go-to-market strategies, campaign ideas, and sales & marketing material to entice more advertisers with a positive ROI Analyzing and interpreting data and reports to evaluate campaign effectiveness Monitor Media/Digital package sell-through and further optimized by using client data, such as past trends and client segmentation Monitor & coordinate project progress, perform gap analysis, and problem-solving Leads generation, nurturing, and tracking Ensure proper alignment of strategy with relevant stakeholders Keeping up to date with cultural/social trends and planning suitable initiatives based on customers’ views and attitudes Review and improve SOPs to ensure consistent business and workflow efficiency  Job Requirements  Bachelor degree 5 to 8 years of campaign planning and management Experienced working in a cross-functional capacity within a dynamic, rapidly changing environment Demonstrated capacity to communicate complex large-scale concepts clearly and simply Project management skills are preferred Good team player with a positive attitude, eager to learn with a can-do spirit Preferred tool skills: MS Excel & Powerpoint (must), Google Analytics, Salesforce sales Cloud & CRM, Emarsys and Tableau

Ability to facilitate communication, contribute ideas about product differentiation, and operate as a liaison between clients and Management.  Primary Relationships  The position reports directly to the Sales Directors or Senior Sales Managers and indirectly to the Chief Corporate Officer.  Within the organization, this position has primary working relationships with the other Corporate Sales team members, the Sales Logistics, Marketing, Human Resources and Training teams as well as TWG Tea overseas partners and franchisees.  Outside the organization, the position coordinates primarily with our HORECA clients that carries TWG Tea products, both locally and overseas.  Job Descriptions Responsible for maintaining and developing good relationships with existing customers through regular contact Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information Responding to incoming email and phone enquiries Assist in preparing Sales Order and other internal documents as required To match customer PO with sales information provided by the Sales department Handle order administration Handling day to day paperwork and Liaising with Finance, Warehousing, 3rd party couriers Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related major Minimum 1-year experience in corporate sales with demonstrated success, preferably in the luxury industry Past experience working in a luxury brand is preferred Preferably fluent in written and spoken Chinese/Korean/Japanese (to liaise with TWG Tea overseas partners and franchises from Asia Markets such as: China, Taiwan, Japan and Korea) Computer literacy in Microsoft Office and Outlook Demonstrated successful experience in making presentations and negotiating contracts with clients Excellent oral and written communication skills Good analytical, organizational and personal skills Meticulous and excellent eye for details Customer service oriented Adaptable and flexible Pleasant personality and ability to work in teams Affinity with the products Only Singaporeans may apply. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.  Please upload a detailed resume, indicating reasons for leaving, last drawn salary, expected salary and date of availability.

description: Lucence is a precision oncology company that invents ultrasensitive blood-testing technology for early cancer detection and treatment selection. Our vision is a world where cancer is overcome with treatments guided by quick, accurate, and accessible testing of the hallmarks of cancer.  Join us in bringing innovative diagnostics to more people by being part of our sales operations as a Sales Support Executive.  Key Responsibilities Supporting the sales team in their daily sales operations in order to meet company business goals and sales targets. Managing all sales-related administrative tasks and duties such as handling of customer queries, preparation of sample kits and order forms for customers. Delivering excellent customer support and developing trusted relationships with various key stakeholders. Supporting the sales team in developing new businesses with existing customers and lead generation for new business opportunities. Identifying inefficiencies and roadblocks in sales processes and executing improvements for more efficient delivery of sales support. Tracking the progress of monthly/quarterly sales initiatives for internal reporting. Any other ad hoc duties as necessary (e.g. organization of seminars). To be a good fit for this role, you would have: Minimally a Nitec in business administration, science, or a related field. Prior working experience in sales support and coordination would be advantageous. Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Flexibility to attend to customer support and operational matters beyond usual working hours. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to multitask, while maintaining sharp attention to detail.

Ensure all sales activity supports key business strategies and current initiatives in order to drive the success of the business. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, customer service skills and the ability to prioritize while handling multiple tasks is required. Ability to work with a diverse client base. Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment. Proficiency in Point of Sales (POS) systems and Microsoft Outlook/e-mail. Minimally a Diploma holder. Graduate gemologist degree or previous Gemological Institute of America (GIA) course work is a bonus

description: About Formula Bright Formula Bright is a growing local start up that helps our customers achieve their ideal state of skin care by providing the right products based on individual skin types and skin conditions. We work closely with our producers to bring in skin care products which are minimally invasive to the skin and have a higher concentration of natural extracts made from natural ingredients before matching them to our customers based on their profile. We aim to help all our customers achieve their skin care goals by using a formula that is natural, sustainable and effective for a bright and healthy skin. Job at A Glance We are looking for capable, resilient and independent sales executives who are interested in and have personal experience with skincare and are keen to be involved with skincare products we carry in terms of online sales and business development with guidance from one of our founders. Rise to the challenge to conceptualize, shape and be part of the team to bring our start-up to the next stage! *Responsibilities -Increase company sales through face-to-face, influencer and digital marketing campaigns; -Learn, research and gain basic understanding on skincare regimes and some of our products; -Identify and penetrate new markets and demographics for our skincare products; -Involve in the formulation of strategies to market and sell our products; -Execute our social media sales & marketing plan through development of online sales; -Sales and Business development results and metrics analysis and optimization; * Job Tasks for the program may vary depending on progress of business and continuity needs. Requirements Possess interest in and personal experience with various skincare products Comfortable with pitching and achieving sales through online and digital platforms Strong problem solving and creative thinking skills Result and customer oriented with entrepreneurial and positive mindset Able to commit for minimum 3 months Please apply by submitting your CV with a short summary and your date of availability. Given the current Covid situation, we are happy to discuss or make flexible arrangements on a case to case basis. Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Consumer Goods

description: Client Partner - SEA & Global Growth  Job Purpose  To lead and drive new business across SEA and globally by sourcing and securing new to Cowan clients across the core capabilities of strategy, branding design, packaging design, brand naming, brand experience and communications. Growth and client development efforts will focus 70% on the SEA geographies of Singapore, Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and Philippines; and 30% on the other Cowan offices in China, Australia and London. Reporting to the Global CEO.  Roles & Responsibilities With a full understanding of Cowan’s multi-disciplinary offer, the primary role is to identify, develop and convert opportunities outside of Cowan’s current existing portfolio of clients locally, regionally and globally. The focus of outreach will fall on new/cold opportunities (email/call cold calling or self-generated contacts), with a smaller focus on dormant clients (no activity over the last year) Develop a Strategic Business Development plan with monthly, quarterly and annual goals and deliverables to complement and supplement the existing Client Development Plan, targeting companies / brands that have potential to become a new core client. Draft proposals, negotiate fees and close deals, collaborating with SEA and global management to ensure approach, process and rates result in profitable projects for Cowan and successful outcomes for clients. In partnership with the heads of business, lead creative pitches – being the core client liaison until the opportunity is converted. Provide learnings & insights from win/losses and helping to improve success rate. i.e information on pricing versus competitors; gaining meaningful and actionable feedback on creative and chemistry meetings. Build deep relationships with senior management both internally at Cowan and externally with clients. Lead the Global Growth team and agenda. Maintain the New Business database, keeping it up-to-date on a weekly to reflect and share new intelligence; draft fortnightly activity reports to SG and VN head of business; provide a monthly report, that will feed into the Management Executive Summary, detailing progress an status of leads for sharing with Global CEO and CFO. Role KPIs  Sales and pitch targets to be defined annually, with quarterly deliverables, in support of the annual business ambition.  Clients and deals closed to be supervised through the beginning contract signing phase through to invoice, to ensure successful embedding into the agency.  Strong partnership with local leadership and client service team, as captured in 360 feedback reviews and performance reviews.  Contracts and rates to be in keeping with Cowan legal standards as well as within Cowan rate card rates, any exceptions must be aligned and agreed with the SG and VN business leads, and passed up to the Global CEO and CFO for discussion and review in cases of significant deviation from the standard terms and rates.  Qualification And Experience Requirements Bachelor Degree in Business, Science or any other related field. Comprehensive (at least 10+ years) sales experience in Branding and Design industry with a regional and global remit Proven record for developing and implementing successful strategies that led to increased sales Capable of bring in immediate clients and sales Aware of the latest market trends and shifts, as well as market trends studies for mid-long term planning Evidence of ability to innovate and implement change successfully Ability to prioritize high-value tasks and focus under pressure Exceptional communication and presentation skills Able to be persuasive and procure buy-in from upper management Solid computer skills Outstanding organizational skills Driven and committed to success while maintaining integrity. Willing to travel
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Design, and Consumer Goods

description: We are hiring! Looking for self-motivated and driven individuals to join us! Attractive compensation and an opportunity for career progression at the fastest-growing Independent Distributor of Electronic Components !  Job Highlights Earning Potential (Basic + Attractive Commissions!) Outstanding career growth and development opportunities Passionate, energetic and innovative work culture  About UsFounded in 2014 with 7 offices around the world, NewPower Worldwide is the fastest growing global independent distributor of electronic components and finished goods. Providing a wide range of services to a diversified client base which includes the world’s largest companies and logos, NewPower Worldwide is growing at a hyper pace. We are looking for the next person who wants to join an exciting, fast paced, team-oriented company to jump start their career immediately. Visit www.newpowerww.com for more information. Job DescriptionThe Sales Account Executive is a critical member of the NewPower Worldwide sales team and is responsible for driving revenue growth through new and existing customer relationships. As a NewPower Worldwide AE, your focus is to increase sales and contribute to our long-term business growth. Responsibilities include researching targeted / strategic accounts, developing relationships with potential new customers, managing, and growing existing customer revenue opportunities.ResponsibilitiesResearch and sell to targeted OEMs, ODMs, EMS Providers, Military/Aerospace, Authorized Distributors and Global Service Facilities to understanding and build a knowledge base of: Organizational structures Company buying profiles Company decision makers and influencers Develop and maintain trusted business relationships with targeted industry buyers and decision influencers at new and existing customers / prospects.Generate new sales opportunities and drive revenue through various new and existing customers using market research, professional introductions, partner relationships, cold calling, etc.Develop and implement effective sales plans to meet and exceed assigned sales objectives.Differentiate NewPower Worldwide by communicating our value proposition to customer executives through conversation, communications, and presentation materials as appropriate.Employ a disciplined approach to building a robust sales pipeline for the NewPower Worldwide sales team.Accurately document and update prospecting activity and new sales opportunities in our proprietary CRMRequirements Experience selling to OEMs, ODMs, EMS Providers, Military/Aerospace, Authorized Distributors and Global Service Facilities Understanding of electronic components and finish goods industry. Bachelor’s degree or university preferred. Huge drive, ambition, and motivation to win. Outstanding work ethic willing to work hard and do what is needed. Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written. Customer focused with outstanding customer relationship skills. Team player with unquestioned integrity and character. Self-starter who leads by example and personal involvement. Multi-tasks and works effectively under pressure. Eager to compete and overachieve. Must be able to communicate fluently in both Mandarin and English (to handle queries and communicate effectively with our Mandarin speaking associates)

Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Customer Experience Resolve escalated complaints from customers, customer service, sales support team and other sales streams. Be SingTel Ambassador. Able to relate well to people at all levels Good communication and listening skills and able to build rapport and trust with customers Lively, energetic, dynamic individual with friendly disposition Able to perform in a fast-paced environment and work under pressure Able to work rotating shift and/or weekends. We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

The ideal candidate should also be independent, resourceful, and possessing a willingness to learn and explore new skills.  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Carmen Tan at 6510 1333.  (EA: 94C3609/ R2196577 )

description: We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, fearless team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!  Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 350,000 customers and almost 2 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  As a Territory Account Manager, you’ll help customers understand the value of our cloud-managed hardware solution and develop new and lasting relationships in a variety of accounts. You’ll join a passionate, high-energy, fast-moving sales team and will advance deals through the sales cycle in collaboration with account teams, sales engineers and partners. In this high-velocity role, you’ll focus on small and mid-sized enterprise businesses. Strong organisational skills are key, and you are able to handle a pipeline of up to 150 opportunities at once with deals that range in size from $5k to $100k+. You will also be able to demo Cisco Meraki technology via WebEx to end users and our partner organisation. This position is full-time, covering the market in India  You Will Own the entire sales process from prospecting to close Meet and exceed quarterly sales targets Maintain accurate pipeline management with expert-level forecasting Cultivate, grow and enable partners to optimally close Cisco Meraki business Understand customer needs and requirements Demonstrate Meraki technology using WebEx Travel to assigned territory at least once per quarter to support partners and customers You Have B2B full cycle sales experience in a revenue closing role with a proven record of overachievement As a Territory Account Manager, you will be working across the region including key stakeholders in India and thus, proficiency in both English and Hindi is essential Technology sales experience is a plus Highly effective communication skills, with ability to balance multiple emails, phone calls, social media and more BA/BS degree preferred You Are Enterprising – you are creative and hardworking Organised – you are on top of everything A phenomenal teammate – we have a collaborative environment Positive – we bring solutions, not problems Hardworking – we all love what we do Have the current and continued right to work in Singapore. The position doesn't support visa sponsorship. Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Overview  DD2 Media (https://dd2media.com) is an integrated and full serviced digital marketing agency which started since September 2019. The Account Executive will be responsible for all aspects of the pre & post digital sales process including media plan creation and execution, campaign delivery, client support and satisfaction.  Reporting to the Managing Director, the AE will develop digital media plans and presentations across multiple digital advertising categories, working with sales and ad ops to help grow the business.  Job Duties & Responsibilities Responsible for client retention and account management of key major accounts Provide account leadership during all stages of client engagement and effectively manage ongoing client needs and expectations Understand the client’s business objectives and goals and to provide strategic consultation to ensure success for the client Oversee all briefs on account, collaborate with the internal team and facilitate ideation, always looking for ideas that are big and offer the greatest impact on the clients business. Scope and develop creative campaign proposals that achieve client marketing objectives Keep abreast of latest digital marketing news and trends Any other duties that may be assigned that are compatible with skills and experience Job Requirements (knowledge, Skills & Competencies) Have a passion for digital marketing and web technology. Is focused, organised and highly detail-oriented. Have 1 - 2 years of previous online advertising or marketing experience at a publisher, agency or ad tech firm. Prior online account management/planning experience and familiarity with online advertising is a plus. Must be proficient in Powerpoint and Excel. Strategic: You are an organized multi-tasker with an eye for detail in a fast-paced, changing environment. In any context, you manage to take both time and priority into account. Organized: You live by prioritization and organization. You’re a born multitasker who loves to take on a good challenge; especially on a tight deadline. Communicative: Whether written or orally, your communication skills are outstanding in any context. Your interactions with clients and co-workers move business forward in a dynamic and surprisingly entrepreneurial environment. You are a good communicator and collaborate well with others. A Self-starter & learner: You are a self-starter, but you work well in teams. You like working in a start-up environment, with the opportunity and ability to learn, adapt and move quickly. You take pride in getting the best work possible out for internal stakeholders or external clients. Qualifications  Minimum: Diploma & above  Experience  Minimum: 1 - 2 years

description: ABOUT JANIO Janio is a cross-border smart logistics solutions provider in Southeast Asia (SEA), connecting merchants, logistics partners, and major industry players across the globe. As we advance towards building this integrated end-to-end logistics network of key players, our evolving data-intelligent platform will empower SEA’s ecommerce businesses to scale quickly and reliably.  Our platform will look to use AI and machine learning to enable real-time tracking, route optimization, warehouse management, and dynamic forecasting — in order to build Southeast Asia’s leading logistics network.  THE CHALLENGE Janio is looking for a Business Development Manager to join our rapidly expanding Singapore team. This position is exposed to multiple aspects of setting up a business in a fast-paced startup environment. We invite candidates with an entrepreneurial and motivated mindset, as well as a keen interest in combining logistics with new technologies, to apply.  THE RESPONSIBILITIES The successful candidate will: Be the primary point of contact for the customer, representing all our services and solutions, with focus in cross border eCommerce logistics Analyze market trends to explore potential markets and clients Conduct proactive sales calls, visits and presentations to new clients Design, plan and present logistics solutions to meet clients’ requirements Coordinate and facilitate effective internal and external communications to drive business growth Partner with cross-functional teams on RFQ, pricing and handover preparations Participate in sales & marketing activities to promote awareness in the market and develop new business opportunities Update CRM tools to keep track of sales activities, customer data and market intelligence Perform any other ad-hoc tasks assigned by manager  THE REQUIREMENTS You are best equipped for this role if you possess/are: Degree holder with minimum 3 years’ experience in the logistics industry. Related experience in the e-Commerce/technology industry is a plus Proven sales track record Developing growth strategies and plans Ability to influence key decision makers (CEO, COO, Head of Departments).  Fluency in both oral and written English and a 2nd language (Fluency in dialects is an added advantage) Computer literacy and good digital skills (i.e. Microsoft Office, in particular PowerPoint, Excel) Ability to convince and negotiate stakeholders Strong interpersonal skills and networking capabilities Strong organisation skills and high attention to details  Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, startup environment Self-Motivated Individual who is able to work independently  Interested candidates may apply here.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Role Purpose This is a newly created role. As the Customer Success Manager, you will report to the Digital Insights Business Lead. You will pro-actively work with affiliates to pursue & secure opportunities across the full digital solutions product portfolio. This includes building a deep understanding of the customers’ needs, buying cycle and key stakeholders & their wins, and design customised solutions, both Roche and non-Roche products, and innovative value-based pricing models to achieve desired outcomes at the opportunity level. Where necessary, you will need to partner team members, VS, and Global teams to bring in vendors/3rd party products to deliver the holistic solutions. You will work together with our Roche colleagues in each country to provide a seamless customer experience – This involves building relationships with a wide range of stakeholders within the laboratory or hospital, both technical and commercial. As a trusted adviser and coach to the customer, you continuously articulate value and support your customers with achieving their desired outcomes.  In this role, you will Be the champion to accelerate the sales of  digital solutions portfolio across multiple customer areas across the affiliates in Asia Pacific; Create a regional overview of the sales opportunity funnel across the full digital solutions portfolio in APAC. This includes designing & monitoring success metrics and conducting regular business reviews with Roche affiliates and customers to discuss strategic initiatives and align with each customer’s success criteria; Build relationships and partner with our Roche counterparts in each country and region to align with their customer account management approach; Partner affiliates to advance the digital solutions opportunities, from providing expertise in digital sales process, designing & architecting customised solutions, defining the pricing models, to finally submitting & negotiating for the tenders; Serve as an advocate for your customers in driving the improvement and evolution of our products and services by bringing thoughtful feedback back to the RIS team and identifying new areas of growth to harvest more value from the customers; Identify risks within customer accounts and drive internal action plans to eliminate those risks - Be a trusted advisor for your customers, based on strong product and industry knowledge; Establish and build strong customer relationships over time that allow for continuity and ongoing partnership to drive growth and retention of accounts through deep understanding of your customers’ use cases; Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional internal teams including sales, service delivery, marketing, support and product management; International travel of up to 50% is expected for this role  Who you are Minimum qualifications You should possess a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Biomedical Sciences, Business, Finance, or Healthcare, advanced degree (Masters, Medical Degree or Ph.D) is preferred 5-8 years of experiences in either the IVD, pharmaceutical industry, preferably in sales and/or marketing; Experience with driving successful sales, adoption & cross-selling of Software as a Service (SaaS) products in APAC from early customer engagement/ pilots to meaningful revenues is a plus Demonstrate the ability to prioritize in an ambiguous environment in accordance to a clear understanding of the business, target markets and trends Ability to work in a highly matrixed environment, with excellent oral and verbal communication skills Demonstrated ability to be pro-active in supporting local sales & marketing teams to drive opportunities forward e.g. participating in tender submissions, building deal level P&L  Qualification and Experience Preferred qualifications Outstanding communication (written and oral), listening and negotiation skills and proven commercial acumen demonstrated by previous successes Able to foster positive partnerships through effective influencing, negotiation and conflict management skills  Location Preferred location will be Singapore, however other locations within Asia Pacific may also be considered.  APAC This is a diverse region culturally and with respect to business maturity. APAC Spirit is an embodiment of the organisation we in the APAC region aspire to be. As a member in this region, you will strive to deeply understand, live and encourage those around you to embrace the APAC Spirit principles. As this position is a regional role, international business travel will be required depending upon the business location of the successful candidate and ongoing business project activities. Roche is strongly committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to build teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Embracing diversity enables us to create a great place to work and to innovate for patients

description: Snore Solutions International is seeking a multi-skilled individual who has been in the role of medical and pharmaceutical sales and has commercial/business acumen to generate and create new business opportunities.  The role will involve working towards an RPSGT qualification (Registered Sleep Technologist) (if not already attained) and on the job training towards being a skilled all-rounder in providing care and comprehensive solution to our patients, medical partners, and external / internal stakeholders. Specialization in both B2B and B2C and to provide needed clinical information and  benefits to medical professionals.  Implement and execute sales and marketing activities on social media and staying ahead of market trends to achieve targets.  Support and collaborate in enhancing and improving E-commerce platforms to boost product and brand awareness.  Manage customer/patient servicing efforts across all online platforms on chat, email, and phone channels, ensuring an exceptional customer experience at all times.  Highly motivated with the ability to work independently to deliver results.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, positive attitude, and a team player.

As a Commercial Account Executive you will successfully source new customers with up to 350 employees. This role will drive strategic engagement with C-level executives, helping them reach their business goals.  The Mission Understand the Talkdesk platform to create a solution tailored to the customers needs. Meet and exceed quarterly and annual revenue/quota’s. Create and execute a sales strategy to produce consistent achievements against Talkdesk’s short and Long term goals Generate revenue through new customer acquisition Build strong internal and external relationships to support in delivering Talkdesk’s key values and closing deals. Become a Talkdesk Evangelist. You should have/be; Consistent track record of selling software or technology at C-level. 1 year of quota carrying software or technology sales experience, with a focus on new customer acquisition.. Excellent communication and presentation skills Extensive negotiation and contract development experience Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment Willingness to travel It would be great if you have; Experience selling Contact Centre solutions Understanding of MEDDIC About Talkdesk  Talkdesk is a global customer experience leader for customer-obsessed companies. Our contact centre solution provides a better way for businesses and customers to engage with one another. Our speed of innovation and global footprint reflect our commitment to ensure businesses everywhere can deliver better customer experiences through any channel, resulting in higher customer satisfaction, cost savings and profitability. Named a Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant #17 on Forbes Cloud 100 G2 Leader in Contact Centre Operations The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender,

If you seek to be a part of an organisation that represents change, to innovate and reform the way age-related diseases are viewed and treated in the world, apply now.  About The Job  They are in search of a result-oriented sales professional who is driven and motivated to be a part of the organisation. Your job responsibilities include generating sales lead by actively servicing existing accounts and promoting new account acquisition, attending to customer’s enquiries and providing excellent customer service, consolidating feedback to management team to enhance sales performance, and producing reports and presentation materials as required. You will also be expected to provide immaculate sales follow-up and after-sales service, handle customer disputes and ensure an organised record of sales activities in the CRM system .  About The Manager/team  This position works cloesly with the Senior Sales Consultant and reports directly to the Centre Manager.  Skills And Experience Required  The incumbent should be tertiary educated and come with at least 2 years of relevant experience in a sales-focused environment. To succeed in this role, you must be adaptable and possess high levels of problem solving ability to identify and resolve arising issues in a timely and efficient manner. It is essential that you have great interpersonal and communication skills with a strong command of written and spoken English to communicate with stakeholders in a diverse environment. The ideal candidate should also be independent, resourceful, and possessing a willingness to learn and explore new skills.  To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Carmen Tan at 6510 1333.  (EA: 94C3609/ R2196577 )
