description: Singtel, Asia’s leading communications technology group, provides an extensive range of telecommunications and digital services to millions of consumers and businesses across Asia, Australia, Africa and the USA. With over 140 years of innovation behind us, we continue to push boundaries in our networks and services, to enrich lives and transform businesses.  Our core values – Customer Focus, Challenger Spirit, Teamwork, Integrity, and Personal Excellence – shape the way we work. We are passionate about making a difference and have an open and inclusive culture where everyone is empowered to do their best. Our diverse business means you will enjoy unique opportunities and rewarding experiences to learn and grow your career in a dynamic industry.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  Responsibilities Ensuring sales processes and policies are compliant to audit requirement by getting respective authorities clearance before roll-out. Designing and executing efficient processes for Business Segment that touches other CFU such as SME Hotline 1606, Customer Service & Support, Networks and Technical helpdesk teams. Instituting Process Knowledge database for Business Segment and ensuring maintenance of real time information for sales and support team reference. Managing day-to-day operational concerns from different stakeholders (Credit Management, 1606, Product, Network, Global Delivery, Customer Service & Support). Deriving efficient processes for Business Segment on GTM or Customer Experience initiatives. Following up on Audit / Operational Compliance issues and ensuring the actions are been implemented and updated for the report. Enhancing Customer Experience through working with relevant stakeholders on the improvement actions for the customer OE / NPS survey. Following up on customer escalations and ensuring they are been resolved by the relevant stakeholders within stipulated lead time. Supporting business transformation projects regarding sales process and system upgrades Managing the filing of both internal / external documentations including sales Contracts / Master Sales Agreement. Requirements Minimum Diploma holder. At least 3 years of relevant experience, ideally from Telco or ICT industries. Knowledge on Sales, Marketing or Operations. Always have the mindset to challenge the status quo. Must have ability to conduct data analytics and make recommendations Effective and efficient problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment. Strong multitasking skills with ability to prioritize and respond to ad-hoc requests as needed. Excellent communication (in both written and verbal) and collaboration skills. Experience with Salesforce CRM system is preferred. Highly proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio) We believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

description: Have you ever stared out at sea and wondered which exotic destinations all these ships you see are coming from and going to? We know, as we are agents in more than 2000 ports around the world. In Wilhelmsen Ships Agency, we provide our customers with piece of mind while we handle their cargo, their vessels, and their crew. We handle 75,000 port calls per year, which means that every 7 minutes, anywhere around the world, we send a ship safely out to sea again to fulfil its purpose. We match local expertise with strict global standards, making sure we consistently make our customers’ port calls as efficient and safe as possible. Now more than ever we see that the maritime industry keeps the world going round, and as agents we are the linking pin in the process of transporting goods around the world. Our vision is to shape the maritime industry, and we constantly develop new and improved solutions for our customers, like last mile drone delivery and our online interactive maps showing Covid port restrictions which has reached more than 500,000 users globally. We now have the opportunity for you to join our global network. We are looking for a Sales Executive to assist in the Maritime Logistics Department and is the single point of contact for inquiries. If you can handle enquiries proactively and professionally, then this is the role for you. The Sales Executive will report to Maritime Logistics Manager. Required experience and skills: Diploma in Sales & Marketing or similar discipline. Preferably 1-2 years of relevant working experience. What you will be doing: Strive to increase the enquiry hit rate and keep a record of all inquiries received and reason of lost enquiries. Ensure that all bookings are handled without delay and assigned to operations. Pro-active cooperation with Operations at all levels to build a strong team spirit pulling in the same direction. Engage actively in finding solutions to customer’s challenges and act as partner in all dealings with customers. Support maintenance of relationships with operations personnel both internally and externally Assist in arranging business reviews and prepare all analyses in advance, inclusive KPI reporting. Conduct follow-up visits and evaluating the vital needs of the clients. Meet goals and target to fulfill an overall revenue objective. We offer a culture and work environment of strong leadership, career development, work-life balance and a job that is both challenging and stimulating. Sounds interesting? If you can see yourself in this role, please let us know why you are our new Sales Executive. Please apply via link : https://wilhelmsen.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Wilhelmsen/job/Singapore/Sales-Executive_JOBREQ_1441
industries: Maritime

description: Video is how publishers interact with the world and JW Player offers a world class experience. We do stuff that no one else can do. We have an established product that has a great reputation and massive potential.  We are looking to add a Senior Account Executive to our expanding Singapore-based sales team. We are looking for a strong communicator that is talented, aggressive, and high energy and can apply their skills and experience to drive regional APAC growth. We value creative, dedicated and intelligent employees. JW Player demands a lot and requires top-notch performers that can deliver quality results.  As a Senior Account Executive, you will: Meet and exceed opportunity quota through phone and email prospecting Confidently convey JW Player's value proposition and be able to react to competitive questions and FAQ's Lead qualification from both outbound campaigns and inbound leads Collaborate with sales and marketing leadership to develop and execute on a prospecting plan of attack, including call scripts, audience segmentation and approach Maintain and improve CRM data within Salesforce.com Actively manage leads pipeline and campaigns in order to meet goals and quarterly objectives Collaborate with all areas of the organization to optimize team productivity  Who You Are: 2-4 years experience generating new SaaS sales or other customer-facing roles within the B2B, Technology and/or SaaS selling experience Experience selling to media and entertainment publishers and broadcasters across APAC Outstanding communication, time management, and organizational skills Results-oriented with a sense of urgency and passion for success Ability to deliver expected results in driving pipeline growth for SaaS-based deals Comfortable analyzing sales data and utilizing sales tools, including Salesforce.com Proven experience partnering with marketing team to convert inbound leads to paying customers Possess a solid sales foundation Analytical and a problem solver  About JW Player  JW Player pioneered video on the web over a decade ago and continues to innovate as the world's largest network-independent platform for video delivery and intelligence. Media companies including Fox, VICE, Business Insider, and Univision, in addition to hundreds of thousands of creators of all types and sizes, rely on JW Player to deliver and monetize their content across all devices. JW Player's massive global footprint of over 2 billion unique devices creates a powerful data graph of unique consumer insights and generates billions of incremental video views. The company is headquartered in New York, with offices in London and Eindhoven, and was named to Deloitte's Technology Fast 500™ in 2018. For more information, visit http://www.jwplayer.com.  Our Perks  When you join JW Player, you are not just joining a company or a team but a family. Our goal is to take care of you and ensure you will be successful in your new role. Your success is our success. Development Program An opportunity to make an impact in a fast paced environment Bi - Annual Hack Weeks AMA (Ask Me Anything) and Fireside chats with Executives & JW Player family  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  #jwplayer #salescareer #sales #hiring #singaporejobs
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  A Day in the Life Experience in multi-threaded engagement, selling to EVPs, CXOs and end-users (in the same sales cycle) in both individual and team sales environments Build your market - Acquiring clients, negotiating, and selling the Qualtrics Experience Management platform to marketing, customer experience, research and/or HR executives of Fortune 500 companies, governments NPOs and/or academic institutions Define and execute territory sales plans within the assigned territory Storytelling - Leading potential clients to an understanding of the options or solutions that are applicable to their situation, demonstrating how features and benefits match their needs Daily Prospecting/assess new sales potential Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or higher 7+ years of direct sales experience, with proven track records in achieving quotas in ASEAN region Demonstrated success in driving new business sales, and ability to develop and manage a sales execution plan at an account and/or territory level. Goal-Getter. Strive to achieve sales KPIs daily, weekly, monthly, etc. You are willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful Effective Communicator. You have the ability to ‘story-tell’ and illustrate strong communication skills cross functionally. Highly Competitive Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology Preferred Qualifications Experience using Salesforce.com About The Team  Part of the growing Qualtrics South-east Asia team, the team is a group of highly driven individuals that are intelligent, organized, and dedicated. We work together as a team to accomplish and surpass quarterly and annual objectives. We are a visionary team that works hard and enjoys the incredible trajectory that Qualtrics provides. Our overarching objective is to drive company revenue growth through client success.  What Differentiates Us From Other Companies Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings (COVID rules apply), and happy hours. Based in Downtown Singapore, we take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space. On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office. We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees. Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer  Qualtrics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.

description: Position Summary  Headquartered in Singapore, Korindo Energy is a trusted total energy solutions provider for the Marine and Power industry.  Driven by our commitment to be a global leader, we continue to work with the biggest engine makers to offer only the best for the customers. We now represent an impressive and authorised products line that can reach out to a wider user audience, both locally and overseas.  With continuous growth and investment into post sales activities, e.g. replacement of engines or equipment parts, we are looking for a high energy, committed and detail-oriented Sales Support Executive to provide effective assistance to the aftersales/parts department, helping to convert enquiries to real sales as well as maintaining customer satisfaction.  Key Responsibilities Respond to enquiries from customers on aftersales parts and service. Generate purchase and delivery orders (PO & DO) as well as oversee to all logistical arrangements, thereby ensuring goods arrive on time as specified. Monitor and update status of sales quotes and proposals to all key stakeholders. Perform other assigned tasks or duties as needed. description: TraceLink has built the world's largest cloud-based network dedicated to protecting patients, ensuring compliance and growing profits across global life sciences. The TraceLink Life Sciences Cloud is our network, our platform, and the community that we’ve built, that links life science people, processes and information everywhere, from ingredient to patient. Over 1,000 businesses across the globe, from the largest drug manufacturers to small street corner pharmacies, trust us to help them manufacture and deliver safe, secure medicines to the patients who need them, anywhere in the world.  The Opportunity  We need high energy, team oriented, proven sales talent with exceptional Korean communication skills and a successful track record of enterprise-level technology solution selling.  This role is an integral part of our sales organization. You will manage the entire sales process from initial outreach through contract negotiations. This includes creating sales opportunities by diligently prospecting into target accounts and teaming with our sales development staff to effectively follow up on marketing generated sales leads. You will lead the execution of our defined sales process to discover and define target account needs and map those to the TraceLink offerings. You will work collaboratively with a solutions architect to present and demonstrate TraceLink’s solutions and to propose the differentiated value of partnering with TraceLink.  This position will require in person sales meetings and presentations which represent travel to accounts in Korea.  Responsibilities Aggressively engage with multiple contacts at prospects via telephone, email, web and in person meetings to educate and drive them through the sales process Define sales strategies working collaboratively with sales team and management Execute customer centric meetings, presentations and product demonstrations both virtually and in person with key decision-makers and influencers Develop high impact proposals which articulate TraceLink’s differentiated solution, market leadership, and unique value as a partner Manage all aspects of the close process Build and execute a sales plan to achieve revenue targets on a quarterly basis Manage and document sales pipeline including forecasts, prospect details, current opportunities and future planned activities Work collaboratively with other team members to share information, expertise and market feedback Requirements Fluent Korean is a must; Outstanding verbal, written, organizational, and interpersonal skills Experience selling into one of the following areas highly beneficial Pharma/Life Sciences, Contract Manufacturing, Supply Chain 5+ years ERP/Complex sales experience Previous sales experience in a SaaS and/or Cloud software environment Sales experience in or in-depth knowledge of enterprise software and services Ability to work both independently and as a part of the TraceLink team Demonstrated understanding of and success in the sales life-cycle prospecting, qualifying, overcoming objections and closing sales

jobTitle: Sales Account Manager, EB Sales & Marketing
description: Corporate Overview Globally, we are a leading provider of market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It’s supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality.  We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world’s financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy & Commodities.   Job duties  Relationships Responsible for driving adoption and revenue on pure electronic and hybrid solutions Create, develop and grow contacts at new and existing clients Deeply understand your clients and their challenges and identify solutions and sales opportunities that will support them Establish broad relationships at your clients wider than the traders - e.g. IT, Business Managers - make yourself and ICAP critical for their business Create, develop and grow key partnerships and networks internally that are vital to global account management - (e.g. global broking, IT, product, operations) Take responsibility for ensuring these partnerships deliver excellence for your client: Be known as the face of ICAP for your key accounts - become their trusted adviser and take ownership in ensuring all their challenges are met Leverage your internal networks to ensure this delivery- drive the 360-feedback process internally and externally Complete at least 2 clients per week or 6 per month and enter the meeting notes into the CRM system.  Product Have a strong overall product knowledge. Understand how your clients use them - support them and offer ideas for improvement Drive the sales and marketing of our product offerings to potential new clients and leads Be on top of new products - be at the forefront of understanding new eSolutions and capabilities. Innovate and contribute to their design and work alongside UX to find best way to market Pro-actively drive client development through ongoing training and support Drive product development to meet our client's needs. SAMs are responsible for working with clients to identify what they want and then contributing to the design and development of new product innovation Design optimal UAT strategies for new systems/upgrades - who, where, when, what are they focused on and what will they feedback on. Take ownership for delivery and feedback  Analysis and account management Maximise the benefit of data. Analyse and understand the usage and trade behaviour of your clients - Design responses and solutions and take them to your clients e.g. Market share and market volume info to ensure login rates continue to grow and traders interaction with screen increases Follow eCommerce best practice CRM  Risk Related Responsibilities Ensure that you understand the risks and controls on your desk; what could go wrong, what controls you have to prevent/detect or contain these.  Requirements  Knowledge A good grounding in the fundamental principles of the product and associated hedges should also be exhibited An understanding of our traditional and evolving competitors across all markets Understands the power of technology, has a flair for UX with a creative/ innovative spark  Experience  Relevant Market experience, as you will cover sales across Fixed Income, Energy and Rates  Skills Motivated and pro-active - confident in making new and developing existing relationships Has a genuine interest in the industry- understands their clients' challenges and how TP ICAP can support them Has an ability to read and understand people and the trading environment - flexing their style depending on sales need (cold calling / presenting / advising). Able to develop a wide range of relevant internal and external relationships - a trusted partner and a brand ambassador for TP ICAP/ eCommerce Tenacious - sees problems as opportunities - evolves sales approach to incorporate new angles and uses relationships to increase adoption and evolve customer strategy - never giving up on the 'unsold' Prepares - researches every customer so fully understands the landscape of the individual or the institution before opening a discussion. Detailed in preparation for sales meeting, profiling for all new accounts / users and existing Outgoing and engaging personality, willing to invest time in networking. An excellent communicator who understands the value of regular, clear and honest communication Self-motivates and prioritises effectively - enjoys being accountable for quality delivery regarding their clients Committed to team and individual goals - ambitious and target oriented whilst understanding the wider eCommerce strategy and the role that sales plays within this Hungry for new business - uses every opportunity to start new conversations and leverage existing relationships to uncover contacts, leads and opportunities Keen commercial outlook - understands the impact they can have on revenue Enthusiastic to learn about a product and grow their sales tools - invests time to research and discuss market evolution, liaises with subject matter experts Strong written presentation skills and public speaking Excellent negotiator - confidence to appropriately challenge feedback or indifference Comfortable chasing down leads and establishing initial contact Has a natural ability to read and understand people, flexing their style to develop a wide range of meaningful relationships Skilled networker

Responsibilities Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with customers Liaise between customers and cross-functional internal teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs Generate sales among client accounts, including reporting, up selling and cross selling Develops long-term relationships with a portfolio of clients, connecting with key business executives and stakeholders. Makes sure clients receive requested products and services within timelines promised. description: CREA’s mission is to power brand through digital commerce to reach the booming, digital savvy, Millennial and Gen Z consumers in Southeast Asia. The e-commerce business model is evolving fast. Today simply knowing how to list, ship and manage digital payments is not enough to differentiate brand online. At CREA, our objective is to build the most relevant Millennial and Gen Z beauty, fashion, and lifestyle brand portfolio in South East Asia leveraging on a growing multi-billion dollar market demand.  Responsibilities: Growing your brand portfolio through joint business planning by: Preparing joint business plan and driving weekly/monthly/quarterly reviews of performance against targets Advising your brands on go to market strategy for new product ranges Planning promotional campaigns and coordinating execution with Onsite Manager Planning brand marketing engagement including onsite brand visibility, online marketing strategy and co-marketing efforts on social media and offline  Managing daily engagement with your large brand accounts by: Managing price competitiveness, assortment, and stock availability Working with cross-functional teams to resolve any issues impacting brand performance on all platforms (operations, fulfilment services, marketing, finance etc.) Conducting regular analysis on sales, traffic, conversion, and customer funnel. Deriving and sharing insight to guide promotional and marketing input Day to day operations on executing graphic briefs, store set ups, cutting & uploading banners, and campaign submissions to platform  Discussions and execution with platform on campaigns and well as visibility management and submissions   Qualification: At least 3-4 years of experience, preferably in either e-commerce/ merchandising Strong passion to initiate new ideas, implement new processes with strong passion to Start Up environment Willing to get hands dirty as individual contributor & team player Ability to meet deadlines and good brand negotiation and management skills to seek for most right solutions to clients The ideal candidate has superb business judgment with a desire to build and manage their own business. He/she must be able to work well in cross-functional teams to drive business goals. Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Engineering and Business Administration is preferred Experience with e-commerce or to FMCG/Fashion/Beauty/Skincare background will be considered a plus. Ability to work autonomously in a highly demanding and often ambiguous environment, with strong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills Strong analytical skills Great communication skills (both oral and written) are a must Mastery of MS Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint) is a must

description: Role Mission  The Client Advisor will be responsible for providing day-to-day Omnichannel operational and customer-based services across the Gucci South Asia & Pacific Region. You will work both independently and cross-functionally to guarantee a successfully management of the order fulfilment process, ensuring the highest service level targets are met consistently and back-office procedures are optimized.  Key Accountabilities Resolve order-related issues by liaising between client and internal/external groups (warehouse/UPS/repairs) Manage fraud detection and prevention processes to mitigate fraud losses to ensure chargeback levels are maintained in accordance with the agreed targets Deal with payment issues and chargeback queries, ensuring that losses are recovered, responding timely respecting the requested deadline Partner cross functionally with Gucci Administration Department and Fiscal Department to resolve performance issues linked to payments Participate in functional tests for the system/applications enhancements and liaise with the technology and support groups to resolve outstanding issues ensuring smooth transition of the fast-paced enhancements/changes into the production application Initiate and follow-up with charge sends Keep current with product information and attend pre-season product training meetings Assist with various operational and administrative tasks Contact clients to manage credit card declines and ensure daily sales goals are met Identify opportunities seek new initiatives and participate in the development of functional and service enhancements to maximize sales Provide exceptional online customer service support with excellent phone/written/chat communication skills, resulting in maximizing online sales conversion and clientele Manage customer cases providing support and information regarding various scenario. This will include but not limited to: ECommerce products, stock availability, order inquiries, returns, exchanges, repair, and shipping information Act as a generalist to clients and prospects regarding fashion trends, providing styling recommendations based on clients’ individual needs Knowledgeable in company policies and procedures for different area Demonstrate passion for the brand and keeps relevant with luxury brands information including but not limited to Gucci products, brand storytelling, social responsibility, services, promotions and marketing trends Cultivate relationships and offers special, dedicated, and curated service to Very Important Gucci clients (VIG) actively contributing to increased sales revenue Cross collaboration with other department, including DOS stores in order to manage customer request Organize regular meetings to go over fraud rules and statistics with payment gateway Monitor fraud trends and keep team updated Open Kering Service ticket for client repair related cases Assist client for placing phone order, send payment link to client and follow up till complete Assist client on order information changing (item/customer information/ shipping address) or cancellation Request and process stock transfer for order fulfillment Arrange with shipping carrier for client return/refund request, to pick up the item for process Ensure relevant administration is completed and distributed appropriately Ad-hoc activities related to online client advisor function

description: Position Responsibilities Achievement of sales revenue of a given territory. Planning and organizing weekly / daily schedule to call on existing accounts, obtains orders and establishes new or potential accounts. Performs product presentations / in services, product evaluations to existing and new or potential accounts. Submits orders promptly with accurate billing information and in accordance to price guide. Prepares quotation / tender documents. Maintains a healthy inventory by establishing correct consignment stock level, perform stock rotation to minimize stock write off and removal of expired stock promptly from the shelf. Ensures all sales activities comply with legal and ethical standards, and that documented processes, procedures and internal quality management system are followed and adhered to. Keeps management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analyses. Presents sales reviews including market share analysis, sales forecast and territory management. Develops strong KOL relationship and identification of upcoming doctors for business continuity. Monitors competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, promotion, etc. Provide such market information promptly to the marketing team. Recommends changes in products, service, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments. Resolves customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; making recommendations to management. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks. Provides historical records by maintaining records on area and customer sales. Assist the marketing team in the organization of sales and marketing activities (e.g. workshop, exhibition booth) Assist the R&D team and clinical team in the development of new products with KOL, product/clinical trials and registries. Assists in the development of less experienced sales reps to extend skills and expertise of individual. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Experiences, Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Degree in Biological Sciences, Business Administration, Nursing or related discipline. 3 -5 years of successful direct sales experience in medical device or pharmaceutical company. Demonstrates ability to absorb technical knowledge quickly and disseminate appropriately to healthcare professionals Good communication and presentation skills Independent, high energy level, ambitious, with a strong desire to succeed Possess own car and have valid license
industries: Medical Devices, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Circles.Life will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require sponsorship of a visa.  About This Role We are looking for a passionate, driven and results-oriented individual to join the International Expansion team and help drive a number of strategic projects and initiatives critical to Circles expansion efforts into new regions and territories. Working directly with the Executive Director - International Business, the successful candidate will take ownership of a number of strategic projects across (but not limited to) new market evaluation, competition scan, financial modeling, brand building and contribute towards building a progressive culture at a rapidly-growing organization. This candidate will play a critical role in influencing and executing our B2B SaaS strategies in the next 3-5 years, and will directly involved in implementing key initiatives, accounts and projects to grow SaaS revenues across target regions globally. By coming up with innovative ideas/ blue sky thinking, creating building blocks through experimentation, and working closely with cross functional stakeholders, this environment will push you to challenge the status-quo - all at a pace that is exacting, but nonetheless, exciting! This is a group-level role which is based in Singapore. About Circles.life  Circles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016, and have since expanded to Australia, Taiwan, Indonesia and Japan. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth.  More recently, Circles has set its sights on the B2B vertical SaaS market, offering our proprietary cloud-native solutions to telcos worldwide. Amidst the software exodus to the cloud, our innovative tech stack has enabled major operators to modernise their mission-critical systems and B2C portals, transforming themselves into digital leaders in an ever-evolving consumer market.  Circles.Life was founded by Rameez Ansar (ex-Temasek, BCG), Abhishek Gupta (ex-McKinsey, Bain Capital, StanChart PE) and Adeel Najam (ex- Nokia, Huawei, Starhub). It now employees 300+ people over 5 APAC offices. It is the portfolio company of Warburg Pincus and Sequoia Capital. YouGov Customer's Choice - Top 5 most loved Singapore brands (2nd year running) Seedly - Top Telco for Customer Service IMDA Consumer Awareness and Satisfaction Survey 2018 - Top Telco for Customer Satisfaction Influential brands - Top Employer 2019 WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE  Unparalleled access - Not only will the successful candidate have exposure to broad content knowledge across functions, but they also understand how the senior leaders think and know what’s top of mind. They should use this to connect dots across projects to improve decision-making and team effectiveness.  Career accelerant - Opportunity to be part of a team that build and scale the new SaaS business vertical and influence overall strategies and product vision with huge potential for growth.  10X - Be part of a fast-growing organisation with ambitious plans to expand into multiple more markets and verticals, and help be the one to make it happen  What You'll Do Conduct market landscape and competition scanning to continue finetuning Circles USP in the market and improve the way Circles approach our potential partners Conduct market research for existing market (including both B2B and B2C markets) Circles are operating in as well as target market Circles intend to enter Build robust financial models to support Circles evaluation of business cases for B2B and B2C deals, as well as pricing structure for various projects Facilitate monthly and weekly business update sessions with Founder and HoDs by preparing materials and attending the sessions Develop pitching materials for the sales development and lead conversion process Who You Will Work With Co-Founder (Abhishek Gupta) International Expansion Team Members across departments What We Are Looking For 2-3+ years of experience in market research and financial modeling in a rapidly growing, fast pace environment Solid functional knowledge, including but not limited to: strategy, business development, marketing, project management etc Strong quantitative, analytical and conceptual problem-solving skills combined with outstanding business acumen Proven ability to collaborate across functional teams and communicate complex ideas clearly Strong digital mindset and passionate about disrupting the future With an entrepreneurial spirit, and the grit, resilience and resourcefulness to overcome obstacles Able to work and communicate effectively across geographies BENEFITS: One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. In order to do that, we offer: Exponential career growth & ownership - Completely own your own career and determine how fast and in which direction you grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond. Talent Mobility - Circles.Lifers are given the opportunity to change roles internally, across functions and/or offices, through multiple structured programs (i.e. internal transfers, job shadowing or job rotation). We've witnessed many successful examples -e.g., from HR lead to Business Development Senior Manager. Talent Development - We stand for a culture of continuous learning and growing. Besides structured career development paths and quarterly performance reviews, we offer monthly learning brown bag sessions, manager training and L&D budget to support development of professional interests and efforts. Attractive Total Rewards (Salary + Equity) - We offer highly competitive salary and bonus inline with top tier technology companies, and equity for ALL employees (up to 6 months of annual salary worth for top performers). That means, unlimited upside based on company's performance. Benefits - Mobile bill reimbursement for all Circles.Lifers and their dependents and medical insurance. Bonus: Well-stocked pantry and monthly fun activities. Circles.Life is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, disability or age.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: #BeMore Do you aspire a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company.  Work with the world’s most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore!  Top reasons to work here: Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentives Comprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverage Premium workspaces Engaging activities and recognition programs Strong learning and development plans for your career growth Positive culture for you to #BeMore at work Easy to locate area with direct access to public transport Flexible working arrangements Be coached and mentored by experts in your field Join a global company with 25 years of experience and more than 270 industry awards  What is your mission? You’ll help us deliver excellent service to our partner brands by performing these tasks:  To provide post-sales customer service support / troubleshooting support through email/phone/chat to the client's B2B customers To support advertising customers and deliver consultative support Perform data analysis to improve advertising customer experience and ensure higher return in investment Gather client and partner feedback to enhance ad products and the customer experience Perform other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance, and continual improvement of the Quality Management System of TDCX. Minimum Diploma, Bachelor’s Degree, Professional Degree in Media related or Marketing will be an added advantage Preferably with 1 year of working experience in the related field is ideal for this position. Strong communication skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and the language of the supporting markets such as Oceania, Greater China, Indonesia, Thai or Korea. Strong time management skills and motivation to exceed expectations. Comfortable working with computers and multiple systems.  Who is TDCX? We specialize in perfecting our clients’ customer experience and elevating their sales. We are guided by a talent philosophy - selecting and employing the best professionals to make the outsource industry better for our people and our clients. Our company has won over 270 industry awards for delivering value driven by technology and continuously innovating our customer-facing brand solutions. Thanks to our premium workspaces, above industry average compensation packages, career opportunities, and long list of perks, we were recently awarded as one of the best companies to work for in Asia.

Our business focuses on asset and investment advisory, fintech, new energy, health, and wellness business. Asset and investment advisory includes fund management, family offices, company listings, corporate mergers, and acquisitions. The health and wellness business includes health care products, bioengineering, and medical equipment.  Our vision is to discover values for investment and to empower dreams for people and support communities.  What you'll do Developing and implementing sales & product strategies. Initiating & developing joint marketing activities or programs with partners. Conducting partner visits & presentations. Providing fund and market information. Motivating partners' channels to sell Aurous funds. Handling investor inquiries and partners hotline. Keeping abreast of competitors' products and development in the market. The Knowledge, Experience, And Qualifications You Need Degree graduate with preferably at least 5 years of track record of sales in a fund house or bank in Singapore. Positive attitude and ability to develop collaborative working relationships with colleagues across the business.
